Volume 1

Central Continent
=================

The
Central Continent
 (中央大陸
Chūō Tairiku
) is one of the five continents in the
world
. It is the largest continent by size and is neighbored by the
Begaritt Continent
 to the south-west,
Divine Continent
 to the north-east, and the
Millis Continent
 to the south-east with the
Ringus Sea
 along its eastern coast.






Map of Central Continent



History

Second Great Human-Demon War

The Central Continent was previously part of a larger landmass known as the
Great Continent
 which the
Demon Continent
 was also part of. This giant continent, however, was split into the present-day Central and Demon Continents by the end of the
Second Great Human-Demon War
 due to a
Mana
 Calamity triggered by the dying Demon Dragon-King
Laplace
. After the war ended, the Central Continent and the Demon Continent was newly formed leaving the
Ringus Sea
 in between. The western half of the Great Continent was predominantly populated by humans and naturally, after the splitting, the Central Continent had a human-majority populace.

Laplace War

When Demon God
Laplace
 began his famous campaign from the Demon Continent, now referred to as the
Laplace War
, he put the whole Central Continent in great distress. In a short time, he had gained total control of the north and the south. Then from both directions, he pressed his assault on the western region. The whole continent was close to being dominated by the demons' force.

Laplace was eventually defeated and sealed away with the help of many heroes and the humans entered a treaty with a neutral Demon King and lifted the barricades between the ports ushering the path towards the present age.

Present Age

By the conclusion of the
Lapace War
 only the
Kingdom of Asura
 remained on on central continent
. It wasn't until about a century afterwards that the
King Dragon Realm
 established sovereignty in the south, and another century before the
Shirone Kingdom
 would join the hegemony

Geography

Red Wyrm Mountains

The Red Wyrm Mountains is an enormous chain of mountain and hills that runs across and down the continent separating the land into three parts - the North, the West and the South - with their own distinct geography. The name originates from during the Laplace War when Laplace released his dreaded wyrm dragons in the mountains to block the passage of humans.

The mountain range starts from the northwest where it is known as the
Red Wyrm's Upper Jaw
 and runs across the lands until it forks into two more ranges. One range runs across the landmass without much deviation all the way to the east, and this part has been known as the
Crying Wyrm
 mountain ranges. The other range runs down the continent almost up to the mid-point southern coastline where it abruptly ends to open a route that is mostly used by the people for traversing between the west and the south.

North

The northern continent, referred to as the the "Northern Territories", is a cold region which lies east to the
Red Wyrm's Upper Jaw
 and
Crying Wyrm
 mountain ranges which run horizontally across the continent. The region receives heavy snowfall and the soil is infertile for crops but large expanse of forests are also present. The majority of the nations in this region are poor and weak and often have skirmishes over resources. Many strong monsters appear in this region which attracts warriors-in-training and veteran adventurers.

Notable locations in the north
:

Wyrm's Whiskers
: A monster-infested forest separating the Northern Territories from the northern part of the Kingdom of Asura. It is home to many bandits and criminals who have fled from the Kingdom.

Kingdom of Ranoa
: It is one of the three Magic Nations alliance known for its
institutions
 of magical learning.

Sharia
: One of the largest cities in the Kingdom of Ranoa. Houses the
Ranoa Magic Academy
 and is the headquarters of the Magicians' Guild and Neris Magical Implements Workshop.

Caerleon: boarder town.

Forest of Hail: Forest located three days' travel north of Sharia on the boarder with the Duchy of Basherant.

Duchy of Neris
: It is one of the three Magic Nations alliance known for its manufacturing of
magical implements
.

Gyuranza: capital of Neris and headquarters of the Thunderbolt clan.

Duchy of Basherant
: It is one of the three Magic Nations alliance known for its expertise in arcane
magic
 research.

Pipin: Third largest city in the Duchy of Basherant.

Rosenburg: Nicknamed the "Gateway to the Northern Territories" is one of largest cities in Duchy of Basherant located two months journey north of the Asuran border. Exports of magical implements to the Asura Kingdom account for half of the cities revenue.

Lake Cucuru: located three days journey north from Rosenburg.

Galgua Ruins: Remains of a underground Demon Fortress from First Human-Demon War. Constructed by Demon King Largon-Hargon the Subterranean. Located two days due South from Rosenburg. Became Snow Drake nest since it fell into disuse.

Ilbron Cave: Located one days travels from Rosenburg and Galgua Ruins.

Trier Forest: Forest located half a day's journey due West from Rosenburg, Infested by Snow Treants and Icefall Treants.

Kingdom of Biheiril
: A fairly strong kingdom in the north-eastern edge of the continent surrounded by mountains and forests where the survivors of the
Superd Race
 are currently hiding.

Sword Sanctum
: A territory in the north-western edge of the continent that is covered in snow all year round. It is the headquarters of the
Sword God Style
 school of swordsmanship which attracts a number of young fighters with the hopes of learning under the Sword God himself.

Ogre Island
: An island in the archipelago that lies south of Biheilil where the Ogre God resides along with his Ogre Tribe.

Kingdom of Toile
: a small kingdom in the Northern Territories.

West

The western continent is a prosperous region that lies between the Red Wyrm's
Upper Jaw
 and the
Lower Jaw
 mountain range. It is abundant with rivers and fertile plains but not many large forests are found. Monsters that appear in this region are fairly weak and knights of the Kingdom carry out exterminations to keep the commonfolks safe, which is one of the reasons as to why it is not a popular place for adventurers despite the riches of the lands.

Notable locations in the west
:

Asura Kingdom
: A kingdom which holds autonomy over the west. Not only is it the richest kingdom in the world but its royal capital - Ars, is also the largest city in the world.

South

The southern continent is a fertile region that lies south of the Red Wyrm's
Crying Wyrm
 mountain range and east to the
Lower Jaw
. It has numerous rivers and lakes along with large expanse of plains and dense forest regions. The plains and the forests are divided by the
Dragon King
 mountain range which runs vertically down the region. Though there are numerous nations in the southern continent, a majority of them in the north of the Dragon King mountain range are small and weak regularly warring over territories and as such the region has been referred to as the
Conflict Zone
. Countries in this zone are built only to meet their demise shortly thereafter and be rebuilt once more. However, moving down the Conflict Zone the nations are more stable and have autonomous power over an area.

Notable locations in the south
:

Markien Mercenary Country
: A warmongering country in the Conflict Zone that bases its economy on dispatching mercenaries to neighbouring countries. The mercenaries dispatched are incredibly feared.

HammerPolka
: A town known for producing weapons and armor.

Dikuto Kingdom:
 A country in the Conflict Zone.

Broze Empire:
 A country in the Conflict Zone.

Gardenia Kingdom:
 A country in the Conflict Zone known for its fertile soil.

Nekrina Kingdom:
 A country in the Conflict Zone.

Bista Kingdom
: a kingdom that borders north of Shirone Kingdom.

King Dragon Realm
: a powerful kingdom that holds dominion of the southernmost regions of the continent with affluent resources. It is the third biggest country in the world with four vassal states under it.

Shirone Kingdom
: A vassal state of King Dragon Realm anointed with its own king.

Latakia: Capital city of the Shrinone Kingdom

Kikka Kingdom
: A vassal state of King Dragon Realm.

Sanakia Kingdom
: A Vassal state of the King Dragon Realm.

See
Interactive Map of Central Continent

Monsters

The monsters on the Central Continent are generally less populous and weaker than other continents, except for a selected few areas. In the Asura Kingdom, one has to go deep into the jungle to find C-ranked monsters
, and there are no subjugation requests higher than C-rank in the capital city Ars
. Monsters are stronger and more numerous in the Northern Territories, whereas the strongest monsters are the Red Dragons residing in the Red Dragon Mountain Range, and the King Dragons in the King Dragon Mountain Range.

See
list of monsters on the Central Continent

Gallery

Holy Land of Swords in the Manga
Shirone Royal Palace in the Shirone Kingdom
Ratakia, Shirone Kingdom Capital
1/3

References

Chaos
=====

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Mad Dragon King
Chaos
 is one of the
First Dragon God
's Five Dragon Generals who is from the Mad Dragon Tribe and the crafter of weapons and armors used by Dragon Tribe to protect their capital Kayos and the Dragon World.

Appearance

Chaos has black-silver scales and profound eyes.

Personality

Chaos has a reputation of being stubborn and has ill feelings towards the Demon Race and as such, he has no qualms on going to war against them. He also is close to his fellow Dragon Generals who know him very well and consider his shouting when emotional to be a normal occurrence.

Background

The First Dragon God teaches the Dragon Tribe how to use
Dragon Battle Aura
 that allowed them to battle against the dragons that rule over Dragon World and eventually conquer it. Although the First Dragon God is powerful, he is not omnipotent and there are places out of reach as well. Thus, from the Dragon Tribe, he chose the 5 most powerful individuals to be the Dragon Generals whom he entrusts them to protecting the Dragon World and Chaos is one of them who are loyal to the First Dragon God.

Apart from his duty as one of the Five Dragon Generals, Chaos is also the leader of the Anti-demon faction of the Dragon World and to distinguish themselves, Chaos also has a unique emblem that resembles the Dragon God's emblem with some alterations.(see photo above)

Plot

"Blasphemy! Maybe if it was
Dora
, but you will have the mixed blooded demon be in charge of the investigation!?"

-Chaos to Szilard

Chaos attends the meeting at the Dragon God's mansion and does not hide his anger on the death of
Crystal
 and at the thought of a demon killing Crystal that is raised by
Szilard
. When
Laplace
 volunteers to investigate further, Chaos strongly opposes this but to his surprise,
Maxwell
 did not object either and calms him down by pointing out what the culprit's possible aim is and in the end, the Dragon God allows Laplace to conduct the investigation.
 Laplace later visits Chaos to question him on his whereabouts when Crystal was killed and afterwards, Chaos assures him that he will help Laplace avenge Crystal even if its in secret.

Chaos attends another meeting with the rest the Dragon Generals where Laplace reports his capture of
Necrolia Nacrolia
 then Szilard reports his interrogation that Necrolia has indeed killed Crystal. Chaos is outraged by this like the rest of the Dragon Generals and urges the Dragon God to invade the Demon World but the latter chose to negotiate with them instead. Although Chaos is willing to assist Laplace in his investigation, he still objects when the First Dragon God names Laplace to be Crystal's successor as Dragon General.

After the meeting of the Gods has concluded and an agreement for the Six Worlds for peace and cooperation, Chaos restrains his hostility towards demons.
 When the Dragon God's child is born, Chaos makes fireworks, an invention of the Human World to excite the parade and like the rest of the Dragon Generals, Chaos is also impressed by the child and left with a solemn expression.

Chaos and the rest of the Dragon Generals accompanies the First Dragon God as he battles and defeats the Gods of the Beast World, Ocean World and Sky World one after another and resulting to the destruction of each world just by the power of the First Dragon God and the Five Dragon Generals.
 But for the Demon World, which is comparable in fighting strength with the Dragon Tribe and in addition, the Eight Great Demon Kings matched strengths with the Five Dragon Generals so the full force of the Dragon World's Dragon Warriors is brought to wage war on the Demon World. The war between the Dragon World and Demon World lasted for decades. During this time every innovation and technology is focused on winning the war where Chaos forge Magic Swords from demon bones.

While the magic and technology development was at its peak during the war, it also caused the massive rise in casualties in both sides which eventually caused a problem in population decline. The
Human God
 suggests that the Five Dragon Generals lure, isolate and gang up on the Eight Demon King one by one causing the
Demon God
 to finally appear in the frontline. The First Dragon God battles and defeat the Demon God but nearly exhausts all his Dragon Battle Aura afterwards that the Dragon Generals brings him back to the Dragon World.

Power and Abilities

Crafter





An automated doll made from Chaos' writings in the Anime



Aside from being a Dragon General, The First Dragon God also assigns Chaos to craft weapons and armor that is used by the Dragon Warriors.
 Chaos had a workshop at the western border where he uses dragon bones and ores for his crafts.
 In addition to weapons and armors, Chaos also crafted automated dolls that
Zanoba Shirone
 admires for its intricate craftsmanship.

Designs of a automaton dolls are also written in a book with Chaos' emblem are also found on what will become the
Greyrat House
 and a moving doll is built that is discovered by
Rudeus
,
Zanoba
 and
Cliff

Equipment

References

Chaos Breaker
=============

This article
lacks information
 and requires expansion. Please
expand this page
 to include missing information to help improve the article.





Chaos Breaker flying above the Red Orb in the Anime



Chaos Breaker
 is a sky castle that previously belongs to
Armored Dragon King Dora
 and later the residence of her son
Perugius Dola
.

Design

When flying above the sky, Chaos Breaker looks like a giant mass of rock covered in dragon scales originating in the
Dragon World
.
 Sitting on the rock is a gigantic castle taller than the Silver Palace home of the royal family of
Asura Kingdom
 that has a garden of similar size and a river.

Background

"It didn't have a name. Ah... if I should give it a name. "Chaos Breaker" I would call it that. Because that scene and that moment of
Kayos
' destruction was forever seared into my eyelids"

-
Laplace

Chaos Breaker is first used by
Armored Dragon King Dora
 during the battle of the Dragon Generals against the
First Dragon God
 at the final years of the
Six-Faced World
 Era. As Chaos Breaker approaches, the First Dragon God fired torrents of power to the fortress but it was protected by spirits summoned by the Dragon Generals. After withstanding a few more shots of the barrage fired by the First Dragon God, the spirits disappear after exhausting their power. The First Dragon God then draws his
GodSword
 and with a single strike everything was carved in half including Chaos Breaker which the upper part fell toward the sky while its lower half remained floating since the function of its core remained intact.

During the
Laplace Wars
, Chaos Breaker is summoned by
Perugius Dola
 and together with his 12 familiars and other heroes, they managed to seal
Laplace
, and Perugius is known as a hero of the war with the new era named
"Armored Dragon Era"
 in his honor.
After growing tired of the palace life in
Asura Kingdom
, Perugius left and to this day travels the world with Chaos Breaker, vigilantly watching over any signs of Laplace's revival to defeat him and get revenge for the death of his friends.

Entry

Elinalise Dragonroad
: "While we're still here, I have to say this. Where we're going isn't a place to joke around at. Remember to watch your mouth."
Cliff Grimoire
: "...I get it. I am not a kid anymore."

To gain entry to Chaos Breaker, you must be at a
Monument of Seven Great Powers
 then blow a golden flute with out any finger holes which is provided by Perugius so in a sense only those who Perugius knows are able to enter or if accompanied by them. The music of the flute that is not heard by
Human
 ears will be heard by
Clearnight of Thunder
, one of Perugius' familiars who will inform
Almanfi
. Almanfi will then teleport to the corresponding monument where the flute is used and he will decide if entry to Chaos Breaker will be granted which so far, demons are forbidden entry. Then Perugius will teleport those approved by Almanfi to the castle which is done by a golden baton that is provided by Almanfi where it is held by all those who wishes to enter Chaos Breaker

Notable Areas

Throne Room





Chaos Breaker's Throne Room in the Anime



"Long ago, Almanfi and
Ghislaine Dedoldia
 fought in a stalemate. In other words, the 12 of them including
Sylvaril
 have strength equal to that of a
Sword King
. I really dont' want to make enemies out of these people. I really need to be very careful with what I say from now on."

-
Rudeus Greyrat

The entrance to the Throne Room (Also known as Audience Room) is a pair of heavy doors dotted with silver and has a dragon painted on each side which took almost an hour to walk from arriving from the outside to get here. Beyond the door is an enormous hall where the tall ceilings are supported by tree-like pillars and ligh radiates from above that is of luxurious and brilliance. The walls have curtains of complex patterns that are products of
Asura Kingdom
 and the Holy Country of Millis. The floor has a red carpet and leading to the stairs of 10 steps where the famed 12 Familiars of Perugius stands at attention and above the stairs is Perugius sitting on his throne overlooking the entire hall.

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Plot

"The "Armored Dragon King" isn't working for any kingdom or governing any territory, and flies around the world with the Sky Fortress "Chaos Breaker.""

-Excerpt from the Legend of Perugius Book

Chaos Breaker is seen flying above the
Citadel of Roa
 where Eris proudly narrates what she knows about the Perugius and his 12 familiars to
Ghislaine Dedoldia
. Rudeus begins to research about this and finds the Legen of Perugius Book which he also have at his home in
Buena Village
 that Rudeus also uses as teaching materials to Eris and Ghislaine.

Chapter 100

Differences from Light Novel

Children and Warriors
=====================

Children and Warriors
 (子供と戦士
Kodomo to Senshi
) is the eleventh episode of the
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on March 21, 2021.

Synopsis

With their new money-making scheme in place, Dead End heads out to track down a mysterious monster. Unfortunately, the job doesn't go as smoothly as they hope, and Rudy's plans may turn out to be a lot less safe than he thought.

Plot

After the
Mana Surge
 in Fitoa,
Roxy
 begins looking for news about Rudeus and his family. Aside from
Paul
 and
Norn
, all members of the Greyrat family are missing. She is is introduced to
Elinalise Dragonroad
 and
Talhand
. Paul left a message for Rudeus to be contactable at <<Buena Villager Search Team>>, <<Fittoa Region Search Group>>.

Meanwhile, to accomplish a quest, Rudeus' party look for a mysterious monster in the middle of
a forest
. They encounter two other parties also searching for the monster.
The boar-like leader of one party
 insists on "first come, first served" and do not welcome competition. <<
Tokurabu Village Toughs
>> follows after. Ruijerd expresses concern for the young demon team.

One of the parties is ambushed by monsters: a big spider and an
Almond Anaconda
, but Rudeus decides to wait before attacking to maximize soft reputation, which ends with
one of the adventurers
 being killed. Ruijerd and Rudeus have a falling out, which is diffused by Kurt.

The monster
 they are looking has killed most of other party, with
the leader
 in its maw. This time, Rudeus decides to intervene early and slays it with his team.

Back at
Rikarisu
, Rudeus is approached by
another adventurer
, who discovers his scheme and attempts to blackmail him. Rudeus believes the only solution is to blow up the town. Moved by Rudeus' resolve to protect Eris, Ruijerd drops his disguise, revealing himself as a
Superd
 and threatens to kill the adventurer should he reveals their secret. Rudeus is disappointed with
Kurt
 and
Bachirou
 being scared of the Superd.

After leaving the city, Rudeus reconciles with Ruijerd.

The next morning, they find Ruijerd with a shaved head. Rudeus gives him a headband while the rest gets matching accessories. He starts his first strategy meeting which involves
Asura Kingdom
. Rudeus keeps traveling with Eris and Ruijerd all the way to a coastal city on the edge of the Demon Continent, unaware that Roxy is also arriving at the continent to look for him, accompanied by two of Paul's former companions.

Characters

Roxy Migurdia

Elinalise Dragonroad
 (unnamed)

Talhand
 (unnamed)

Paul Greyrat
 (only voice)

Rudeus Greyrat

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Ruijerd Superdia

Kurt

Bachirou

Gablin
 (unnamed, killed)

Blaze
 (unnamed, killed)

Nokopara

Jalil

Vizquel

Locations

Central Continent

Asura Kingdom

Fittoa Region

Demon Continent

Biegoya Region

Petrified Forest

Rikarisu City

Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 2

Epilogue

Light Novel Volume 3

Chapter 11: A Smooth Start.

Chapter 12: Children and Warriors.

Chapter 13: Failure, Chaos, and Resolve.

Chapter 14: The Beginning of Our Journey.

Differences with the light novel:

Some short PoV of some people about the teleport incident was cut.

In the LN, Roxy meets Talhand and Elinalise offscreen before the events of
Light Novel Volume 4
.

All the development with Jalil and Vizquel was cut.

In the LN they buy his new equipment (the most notable, Rudeus Coat made of Mackey Rat) before the battle against the Cobra, meanwhile in the anime was after they leave Rikarisu.

In the LN, Kurt's party was attacked by a group of Executioners (a humanoid monster that can use swords) and a group of Almond Anacondas, while in the anime it's against a single spider and a single anaconda.

A short scene where Rudeus licks Eris hand was cut.

The definition of Ruijerd of what is a warrior in LN happens after Kurt's party left the forest, meanwhile in the anime happens after Ruijerd left Rikarisu.

The backup plan if they find that the party Dead End interchange jobs with the party P-Hunter was cut.

A short scene after Ruijerd left Rikarisu of how Rudeus prepare something for the travel was cut

The explanation for "What are the demon kings of the Demon Continent?" was cut.

A reunion of Dead End that explain all the future plans about the travel was cut

How all those months traveling was changed in the anime.

Children and Warriors/Gallery
=============================

This page is an image gallery for
Children and Warriors
. Please add to the contents of this page, but only images that
pertain
 to the article.

Christina Greyrat
=================

Christina Greyrat
 is the sixth child and fourth daughter of
Rudeus Greyrat
 and the youngest child he had with
Eris Greyrat
. She is the younger sister of
Ars Greyrat
 and the youngest half-sister of
Lucy Greyrat
,
Lara Greyrat
,
Sieghart Saladin Greyrat
 and
Lily Greyrat
.

Appearance

Christina Greyrat is identical to her mother. She has long, straight, red hair and green eyes like her father. She wears a teal, floral dress with a white, ruffled trim and long sleeves. She is wearing teal slip-ons and white  socks which reach just above her ankles. She appears to be around 10 years old during this time.

Personality

"I will protect you from now onwards!"

-Christina Greyrat

During Christina's childhood, she is considered to be an indoor type and is timid and withdrawn even when Eris would occasionally bring her out, Christina would always be stuck to her and would often start crying and return home because she was scared. Thus she refuses to go out on walks and spends most of her time at home.

Unlike Ars, she is extremely attached to Rudeus who dotes her without restraint and making his lap to be her reserved seat. The only one who can stop her from crying is Rudeus. She is resourceful as implied in planning together with Aisha the downfall of Viola Yellowsnake during graduation. She also showed pity for the girl as the latter chose to cheat to earn titles despite having the capacity to earn them with hardwork.

Chris is raised by her parents to "never bully the weak" and when she tries to stop the bullying of the higher aristocracy, she tries to convince them to stop but when they refuse or when she loses an argument, Chris would resort to using her fists, like her mother Eris would when she was younger without a regard of the nobility status. By helping those who were bullied Chris gained allies as she goes on her turbulent school life at
Asura Royal Academy
.

Background

Christina is the second child of Rudeus and Eris Greyrat who they affectionately refer to as Chris.

Plot

Redundancy: The Last One to Leave the Nest

Christina is graduating from Asura Royal Academy, after solving a problem with a noble, she starts a relationship with
Edward Anemoi Asura
 and begins to work in
Asura
.

Power and Abilities

Physical Abilities

Despite Christina being mediocre when it comes to
Swordsmanship
, she is able to fight one against many due to the special education she received from her parents.

Equipment

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Quotes

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Trivia

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

References

Citadel of Roa
==============

Citadel of Roa



The
Citadel of Roa
 (城塞都市ロア
Jōsai Toshi Roa
) is a fortress city in the Fittoa Region of the
Asura Kingdom
 lying on the
Central Continent
. Being the center of trade and commerce and the administrative headquarters of the
Fittoa Region
, Roa is the largest settlement in the Region.

History

Roa is an ancient city with noble history. Four hundred years ago, it stood as the last bastion of defense during the war against the
Demon race
. Owing to that, there stands a picturesque castle in the middle of the city.

Though, despite its mighty origin story, the nobles of the imperial capital currently saw Roa as nothing more than a crude backwater full of
adventurers
.

Description

Roa is a fortified city built inside walls. Sturdy ramparts, 7 to 8 meters in height are wrapped around the city. The walkways of the ramparts are roofed and along it, towers with conical spires are built with airy overviewing windows and balconies.

The city itself is not a perfect circle; it bent with the terrain making the dimensions hard to estimate.
 The city has a gigantic gate for the influx of merchants and townspeople. At the entrance one would be greeted with stables and inns and the waiting area for the stagecoaches. Along the main road, lines of merchant stalls are erected. Shops for different kind of customers are grouped by street junctions while residence buildings are situated in the alleyways much deeper into the city. The streets are paved and buildings are established in a grid structure with vendor shops lined tidily on the roadsides.

The city was built in such a way that the deeper you went into the city the bigger the houses became and the more luxurious the goods shops offered. The closer you lived to the center, the richer you were. All the shops near the noble district are elegant and peddled expensive wares. A castle is nestled right in the middle of the city which is used as the residence of the
 Region
's lord.

Plot

Story events regarding the Citadel of Roa

Home Tutor arc

Rudeus Greyrat
 is brought to the Citadel of Roa by
Ghislaine Dedoldia
 to be the tutor of
Eris Boreas Greyrat

Rudeus convinces
Philip Boreas Greyrat
 to stage a kidnapping in order to be motivated in learning but Thomas plots to make it a real kidnapping

Upon returning to Roa, Rudeus battles 2 of the kidnappers but is saved by Ghislaine and Eris accepts Rudeus to be her tutor

Rudeus begins tutoring Eris but is still violent so Rudeus proposes the idea of having a 1 free day after 6 days which is later adapted by the
Princess Ariel Faction
 during their stay in Sharia

Rudeus helps Eris into being able to dance during her 10th birthday party earning her respect and praise

During their trip at Roa, Rudeus sees
Chaos Breaker
 passing above them

Eris requests
Sauros Boreas Greyrat
 to throw a party for Rudeus' 10th birthday and gives him the
Aqua Heartia
 as a present

In
K412
 a red orb appears above Roa and people believes its not something bad and even used for prayer to grant wishes

Rudeus tries to cast
Cumulonimbus
 while Ghislaine and Eris are watching but they are attacked by
Almanfi

After the battle between Ghislaine and Almanfi, the
Teleport Incident
 occurs that transports Rudeus and Eris to the
Demon Continent

Homecoming arc

Rudeus and Eris returns to the ruins of Roa after 3 years of travelling from the Demon Continent and they learn that Sauros who is succeeded by James Boreas Greyrat while Philip and Hilda are dead confirmed by Ghislaine

Alfonse is in charge of the efforts of rebuilding Roa and the Fittoa Region, funded by Minister
Darius Silva Ganius

Since James refuses to take Eris in, Alfonse proposes that Eris become the concubine of
Pilemon Notos Greyrat
 that is objected by Ghislaine and wants Eris to run away with Rudeus

Eris spends a night with Rudeus but in the end decides to go to the
Holy Land of Swords
 with Ghislaine

Rudeus falls into depression upon learning this and heads to the northern Central Continent to look for his mother

Alphonse officially announces that Eris dies and Darius eventually pulls the funding for the Fitto Region rebuilding

Trivia

The city's mayor is
Philip Boreas Greyrat
.

Even though the wall fortifying the city is specified to be 7-8 metres tall in the light novel, the manga portrays it to be over 50 meters tall towering above most buildings.

References

Claire Latreia
==============

This article
lacks information
 and requires expansion. Please
expand this page
 to include missing information to help improve the article.

Information

Relationships

Appearance

Claire Latreia
 (
クレア
・
ラトレイア
)
 is the mother of
Zenith
 and
Therese
, as well as the grandmother of
Rudeus
 and
Norn
.

Appearance

Claire is an older woman with white hair in a bun and piercing eyes. She wears a purple dress with a darker purple crevat.

Personality

She's strict and hard headed. She was stubborn from the moment she was born, the house's education raised her to be a person strict with both herself and others; once she decides something, she will never yield and will keep the same opinion until the day she dies. However, when something happens which proves her wrong without a doubt she will revise her opinion, she will not admit to being wrong nor will she offer apologies, but she will at least not make the same mistakes in future.

She likes people that are fair and righteous and hates crimes. In conclusion, she's a genuinely good human being who is just too stubborn to hear out other people and faults frequently because of it.

Background/Story

She was just a regular noblewoman you can find anywhere and has high expectations for her children as a result, she was delighted when her oldest son and daughter turned out to be a knight and a noble young lady who married into a good house. However, when her daughter Therese became a knight, she criticized that this was not a good job for a lady. When Zenith, her most promising child, became an adventurer she felt betrayed and scornful. In both cases, she was adamant her daughters would one day realize their mistakes and come home, but Therese became a high ranking knight and guard of the Miko herself, while Zenith became a successful adventurer and did not show any intent to return. Finally, after the Metastasis event occurred and Paul came asking her for help tracking Zenith down, she aided them partially to tell her daughter "see, this happened because you disobeyed me," but these feelings died down when they failed to find her.

She loves her family quite strongly, but her expectations and stubbornness have a habit of driving them away. When Paul entered a depression, she wanted to take Norn from him by force for her own sake but was prevented from doing so by her husband. She also gained a lot of respect for Rudeus after hearing that he had beaten his father back to his senses, though she was rather disappointed that Rudeus didn't even drop in to introduce himself to her. She gains an even higher opinion of him after meeting him, due to his awareness as the head of a family and also due to the fact that he's serving someone of note, though she has no knowledge of military affairs and does not know who Dragon God Orsted actually is, she just knows the term Dragon God.

Finally, when Rudeus reported that Zenith had been saved but was in a mentally invalid state, she sent him a letter to bring Zenith over and began exploring ways to help cure her. She discovered the story of Elinalise, who went through what Zenith did and reportedly recovered from her state after lots of carnal relations (in reality, however, Elinalise recovered over time, and the rest was a result of her curse making her physically need such things). She was disgusted by her find but desperate enough to cure Zenith that it seemed worth trying.

She hates Paul such that when she met Rudeus, she recognized Paul's face in him and her worst side was on full display. This, coupled with her hinting at the plan to cure Zenith was enough to outright disgust Rudeus and cause him to leave her mansion while violently beating aside any guards unlucky enough to try and stop him. This is extremely notable as Rudeus is usually a pacifist and dislikes fighting.

After this, she tried taking matters into her own hands to cure Zenith, intentionally alienating her family to avoiding having blame placed upon them. This caused a series of massive issues which eventually leads to Rudeus kidnapping the Miko and very well could've resulted in him killing someone or destroying the entire Latreia Estate to find his mother. The issue became such that the officials of the entire Milis religion had to gather to resolve it and likely could've damaged relations between Dragon God Orsted's organization and them.

Her stubbornness finally cracks when Zenith, even in her current state, stopped Rudeus from allowing his grandmother to be imprisoned for ten years for the crime and she confesses her true intentions. After hearing Claire's motivations, Rudeus reveals to her that he knows Elinalise personally and knows that the method she hoped to use would not have worked (and would've essentially just resulted in her mentally handicapped daughter being used repeatedly for sex). Knowing full well that what she sought to do was not a forgivable act, Claire is shocked when Rudeus lets her off for her actions and asks to reconcile with her, and she willingly turns over to the Demon Race Acceptance Faction when asked by him to do so.

Claire Latreia/Appearance

 and requires expansion. Please
expand this page

Claire Latreia/Relationships
============================

Zenith Greyrat

She is the daughter of Claire.

Rudeus Greyrat

He is the grandson of Claire.

Norn Greyrat

She is the granddaughter of Claire.

Aisha Greyrat

Claire hates Aisha because the latter is the child of Lilia, who is a maid and Paul's second wife.

Classes
=======

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Classes
 refer to titles or professions bestowed upon a person or a group that gives them their role or function in a party or even a country.

Although some Classes are granted by teachers or masters of a certain school, people has their personal freedom to call themselves whatever they wish and can also hold more than one title or class.

Swordsman

Swordsmen
 (
剣士
,

Kenshi
)
 are sword users who are affiliated with one of the three major schools of swordsmanship:
Sword God Style
,
Water God Style
 and
North God Style
.

Warrior

Warriors
 (
戦士
,

Senshi
)
  can refers to practitioners who use swords but their sword styles are outside of the three major schools such as
Randolph Marianne
 who uses the Sword of Bewitching swordsmanship. Even within the three major schools, if they don't use swords, they are still called Warriors
 such as
Elinalise Dragonroad
 who uses an estoc and buckler,
Ruijerd Superdia
 who uses a spear and even
Kalman II
 who uses a staff despite being the second North God.

Knight





Therese Latreia
, an Order of the Temple Knight and Protector of the
Miko of Memory



Knights
 (
騎士
,

Kishi
)
 are people that serve under a kingdom, a lord's employment or part of a knight order. Most knights come from nobility and has high pride. Some knights are also educated that knows language and math and some also know simple magic.

Notable Knight Orders:
Millishion Holy Knights
,
Seven Knights of Asura

Lower Class Knight

Lower Class Knights are knights that are recognized "bodyguards" of the kingdom who are assigned by a lord of the kingdom to defend villages far from the capital from Monsters and serve as a mediator between villagers or farmers like
Paul Greyrat
 who is assigned in
Buena Village
.

Guardian Knight

Guardian Knights are knights from spare children of powerful nobilities who protects the Royal family. When an assassin is sent they die bravely to protect their the royal family, in a sense a sacrificial pawn while the child's parents grieve exaggeratedly on how brave their child was. The royal family acknowledges their grief by sending a medal of honor as recompense and to deepen their bonds between the nobility and the royal family.

Magician

Magicians
 (
魔術師
,

Majutsu-shi
)
 are individuals who possess the ability to use
Magic
 and cast
Magic Spells
. It has been stated that only 1 in 20 people are born with the  capacity to using
Mana
. Moreover, out of those individuals, only 1 in 20 can learn to master it and become a Magician. However, only 1 in 100 of those is actually capable of becoming advanced Magicians in only one element. The magician's ranking title is determined by the most advanced spell that a magician could cast.

Guardian Magician

Guardian Magicians are magicians who are also spare children of powerful nobilities to protect the Royal Family. Guardian Magician are generally paired with Guardian Knights. Although the Guardian Magician are given to those of the upper nobilities, Ariel insists that Sylphiette who saved her life replace his Derrick who gave his life to protect her.

Adventurer

Adventurers
 (
冒険者
,

Bōken-sha
)
 are individuals who accept quests categorized by the level of threat within the
Adventure Guild
. They receive rewards for completing these quests and can also sell materials obtained from
Monsters
 or treasures found in dungeons. By registering with the Adventure Guild, which is always present in large towns, individuals can become adventurers, accept quests, and form parties with other adventurers.

Roles

Geese explaining the party roles and positions in the Manga
A party with their position depending on their roles
A party back line formation in the Anime
Rudeus' party attacking while in a formation against the Manatite Hydra
1/4

When forming a party, roles are assigned for each member which determines their position on the formation and tasks they are responsible for in the party.

Scout

Geese testing the effectiveness of Talfro Root against Devouring Devils
Geese leaving markers on his footprint for his party to follow
A map charted by Geese and notating it
Sara performing the Scout role and detecting Luster Grizzlies
Geese throwing Smoke Grenades to obscure the Manatite Hydra as they retreat
1/5

Scout
 (
スカウト
,

Sukauto
)
 is a role generally fulfilled by an Archer
 or Thief and when it comes to exploring an uncharted labyrinths, they position ahead of the party to look out traps or provide intel of incoming enemies like their numbers and also uses various tools to ensure their party does not fall to any traps or be overwhelmed by enemies like having a marker on their boots to confirm its a safe place to step in for the party.
 They are also generally in charge of navigation and map charting.
 When a retreat is called by the party, Scouts would also assist in the retreat such as using Smoke Grenades to obscure their retreat and also ensure everyone is falling back.

Tank

Elinalise, a Warrior tanking Deathlord Tarantulas
Talhand Tanking a Manatite Hydra attack to protect Roxy
1/2

Tanks
 (
タンク
,

Tanku
)
 are roles fulfilled by Swordsmen or Warriors where they take the frontline to engage the enemy first while the rest move to position or draw their fire to prevent them from attacking their healers and attackers in the back line as they have the means to handle a head on attack to provide an opening for the Attackers to finish off their enemy.

Subtank

Paul, a Swordsman working with as a Subtank to assist Elinalise
Elinalise, Subtanking to protect Rudeus while Paul assists her
Elinalise Bashing the Hydra to assist Paul
1/3

Subtanks
 (
サブタンク
,

Sabutanku
)
 are roles also fulfilled by Swordsmen or Warriors where they either position behind the Tank to assist them as a secondary attacker to disengage an enemy, an additional tank or at the rear to guard from ambushes from the back line.

Attackers

Rudeus using Blizzard Storm to finish off the Deathlord Tarantulas
Timothy finishing off the Luster Grizzlies while his party protects him
Sara finishing off a Luster Grizzly tanked by Patris
Rudeus using Deep Mist as an additional obstruction as they retreat
1/4

Atackers
 (
アタッカー
,

Atakkā
)
, also known as Offense are generally positioned where the Tank or Subtank can protect them and the role is taken by classes who can generally perform medium to long range attacks like a Magician or an Archer who deal the finishing attack on enemies engaged by the Tank or Subtank. When a retreat is called, Attackers also provide support like the Scout as the tanks disengage their enemy or provide distractions or other hindrance to prevent their enemy from pursuing them to ensure a successful retreat.

Healer





Mimir
 wearing white robes typical for Healers



Healers
 (
ヒーラー
,

Hīrā
)
 is a role generally performed by
Priests
 (
僧侶
,

Sōryo
)
, clerics or anyone one who can use
Healing Magic
 to support their party. In
Millishion
, most people stops learning Healing Magic upon reaching Elementary Rank and those that reach Intermediate Rank Healing Magic usually are eligible to work at hospitals.

Thief

Geese, a thief looking for a hidden room in the Anime
Tristina Purplehorse, a thief and member of the Bandit Group in the Light Novel
1/2

Thieves
 (
泥棒
,

Dorobō
)
 are generally members of a bandit group that conducts their business with information gathering, smuggling, search requests, slave trades, assassination requests and other underground business.
 When in a party, they take the roles of scouting, sabotaging their enemies before engaging the party, looking out for traps or hidden rooms.

Archer

--To be added

Mercenary

Mercenary
 (
傭兵
,

Yōhei
)
 are groups or people that completes a request of a "client" regardless of factions such as acting as their bodyguards for a certain period of time or a condition of the contract is met which is in a sense similar to Adventurers but more focused on combat. Mercenaries generally supports all their clients equally and without discrimination in order to avoid themselves from becoming a faction.
 During wars, a kingdom's branch of the Adventure Guild can also conscript adventurers to act as mercenaries where the pay is higher but the fatality rate is ridiculous.

Notable Mercenary Groups:
Rude Mercenary Company
,
Malkien Mercenary Kingdom

Miko






Zanoba Shirone, a Miko posessing inhuman strength



Mikos
 (
神子
,

Miko
, lit. "Blessed Child")
 are individuals born with "beneficial"
Curses
. On the other hand,
Cursed Ones
 (
呪子
,

Noroi-ko
, lit."Cursed Child")
 are born with disadvantageous or harmful curses. It's important to note that even Miko powers can have drawbacks or disadvantages for the user. If they are not royalty, Mikos have their birth name stripped and are forced to work for the kingdom they were born into.

God Rank

For the Gods that are divine beings who ruled during the
Six-Faced World
 era, see
Gods

"
God
" is a title that indicates the pinnacle of a
Sword School
,
Magic
, or
Race
. Non-magicians are called
｢ ｣ Gods
, and in the case of Magicians, they are called
God-ranked ｢ ｣
 Magicians
. The same goes for those of the Saint, King or Emperor-ranked
.

Known God Rank Title Holders

Magicians

:
Perugius Dola

:
Largon Hargon
, Unnamed previous Ore God before Godbard

Swordmanship Schools

: Strongest user of the
Sword God Style
; Current:

: Strongest user of the
Water God Style
; Current:

: Strongest user of the
North God Style
; Current:

,
Kalman III
 (the North God title can be assumed by more than one person)

Race






Dragon God Orsted in the Anime



Demon God
: Strongest member of the Demon Race.
Its also possibly the title given to the world's greatest magician

Laplace

Dragon Tribe

Golden Armor

Randolph Marianne

Slave






Julie
 during the time she was a slave in the Anime



Slaves are people who are generally sold to slave market form various reasons such as: those orphaned during a war, sold by their parents when crop harvests failed to save the family or voluntarily done to save the family or those who are unable to pay their debts. Unlike
Millis Continent
 and Southern
Central Continent
, most countries in the north has legalized slave trade and is a key part of their economy while there also rumors that slave trade is also done by the Thieves' Guild that smuggle these slaves to various government to serve as cannon fodder during war.

Slaves are also marked with a brand or magic seal to ensure they won't escape nor attack their master but this is at the choice of their owners.

Bard






Big Boys Orchestra - a party of Bards in the Anime



Bards, also known as Troubadours is a profession where they perform on a pub's stage to sing, play music for tips. In bigger cities, bards sign exclusive contracts with theaters. Adventurers can also become bards by turning their experiences into music or from fellow adventurers. Bards who share similar interests also tends to form parties and perform around the world especially if they specialize in different instruments.

Demon Lord






Demon Lord Badigadi in the Anime



Demon Lord
 (
魔王
,

Maō
, lit. "Demon King")
 are some exceptionally powerful individuals among the
Demon Race
 that become rulers of a certain region on the
Demon Continent
.

Cliff
=====

Redirect to:
Cliff Grimoire

Cliff Grimoire
==============

Information

Story

Relationships

Appearance

Cliff Grimoire
 (
クリフ
・
グリモル
)
 is the grandson of the Milis Pope. First introduced in a
side-story
 starring
Eris
, he later becomes one of the main supporting characters of the main story after he becomes
Rudeus'
 classmate at the
Ranoa Magic Academy
, where he also met and fell in love with
Elinalise
.

Appearance

He is short and has dark brown hair. He also has an eye patch to cover his
Demon Eye of Identification
 that he received.

Personality

Cliff is very prideful, so much so that he would proudly brag and proclaim himself as a genius in other people's face. During his debut, he was extremely obnoxious, looking down upon most people as beneath him and would insult them openly. However, he upholds rules and his own codes of honor very firmly, and would not break them except for the most extreme situations.

He is shown to be very diligent that he would constantly seek to improve himself. He is also very loyal to his friends and loved ones, willing to give everything he has or even risking his life for their sake.

While the grandson of the current head of the Millis Church and a devout follower of the Millis religion himself, he does not try to impose his beliefs on others and does not seem to mind if others engage in acts that would normally be seen as blasphemous unless the act involves him directly. He is also compassionate and flexible in his beliefs, understanding
Elinalise's
 curse forces her to be promiscuous or else she would die, and does not mind her engaging in sexual activity with other men as long as he is the only one she is emotionally loyal to.

Background

When Cliff was 5, Harry Grimoire, a person who held a high position in the Millis religious organization adopted him. Cliff is a gifted child that became Advanced Rank in Summoning,
Detoxification
,
Healing
, and Fire at a young age. He is also the biological grandson of the current Pope of Millis. He had a dream of becoming an adventurer which leads to him meeting with
Eris
.

Power and Abilities

Magic:

Attack Magic:

«Water Magic - Advanced Rank»

«Earth Magic - Advanced Rank»

«Wind Magic - Advanced Rank»

«Fire Magic - Advanced Rank»

Support Magic:

«Healing Magic - Advanced Rank»

«Detoxification Magic - Advanced Rank»

«Barrier Magic - Intermediate Rank»

«Divine Strike Magic - Advanced Rank»

Summoning Magic

«Summoning Magic - Advanced Rank»

Research

He is one of the major contributors in developing the
Zariff prosthetic limbs
 and the magic armor series.

Having studied curses for Elinalise's and Orsted's sakes, he created the first ever series of
Magic Tools
 that are able to suppress or negate the effects of curses.

Demon Eye of Identification

When looking at something with the
Identification Eyes
, they will show the user details of that object. However, only within things that
Kishirika
 knows of will be shown. Anything that she doesn't know will be shown as something unknown.

Achievements

With
Rudeus
 and
Zanoba
, they were the creators of some
magic tools
 like the Zariff Prosthetic Hand and the Magic Armor.

He was able to partially neutralize the effects of the curses of
Elinalise
 and
Orsted
.

Graduated with honors in Ranoa magic Academy.

He was able to save the Superd Race.

Quotes

To an adventurer:
 “What does that matter?! I’m as powerful as any A-ranked magician! You should be grateful that I’m even willing to work with the likes of You!.

Cliff:
 "There is nothing this genius can't do. Leave it to me."

Trivia

In Future Rudeus's original timeline, he goes to Millis with
Rudeus
 and
Zanoba
 to get God rank Detoxification magic to cure
Roxy
, but dies on the way back to
Sharia
 after getting poisoned.

Cliff's grandmother is a
hobbit
, thus the reason of him being somewhat short in height
.

Like Rudeus
, Cliff's first meeting with
Eris
 resulted on him getting punched in the face and beaten up after angering her.
.

Cliff Grimoire/Relationships
============================

Information

Story

Relationships

Appearance

Family

Elinalise

His wife, he fell in love at first sight after he meets her in Ranoa, although Elinalise told him about her curse he accepted her and promised to find a way to break the curse, and so they started dating.

After Elinalise return from Begaritt Continent, they marry, and some months later, she became pregnant with Clive.

Clive Grimoire

His son between him and Elinalise.

Friends

Rudeus Greyrat

He first heard of Rudeus from Eris. After he was shot down by Eris he held a sort of jealousy/hatred for Rudeus. This changed after Rudeus helped him get with Elinalise. Later on they become great friends and are curious as to why their children are in a relationship.

Zanoba

His friend

Other

Eris Greyrat

He meets briefly her when he was young in the Millis Continent, after  a quest, he confess his love to her, but he was quickly rejected by Eris because she like Rudeus, years later he meets Eris again after she become Rudeus wife, but is unknown if she still remember him.

Cliff Grimoire/Story
====================

Volume 5 - Juvenile Period - Reunion Chapter

He was extremely arrogant and cocky. Met
Eris
 in adventurers hall and he fell in love with her. Wishing to show off his genius abilities, he was compared to
Rudeus
 and told he was not even close to his level.

Volume 7 - Youth Period - School Entry Chapter

He met
Rudeus
 and he was not impressed with him.

Volume 8 - Youth Period - Special Student Chapter

After hearing stories about
Rudeus's
 exploits and having fell in love with
Elinalise
, he asks
Rudeus
 for help and manages to become her boyfriend. He then embarks on researching on curses, specifically to cure Elinalise's curse of having to have sexual contact in order to live.

Volume 14 - Young Man Period - Everyday Chapter

He is married to Elinalise and successfully makes a magic tool that can suppress her needs for several months.

Clive
=====

Redirect to:
Clive Grimoire

Clive Grimoire
==============

Clive Grimoire
 is the son of
Cliff Grimoire
 and
Elinalise Dragonroad
.

Appearance

Clive is a pretty boy with looks so similar to his father Cliff in terms of his hair and lips while his eyes and features were quite like Elinalise and there was no doubt that he'd be popular with both
Human
 and
Elf
 girls in the future.

Personality

Even at a young age, Clive is protective towards her mother. Clive also have a complex for being short due to his
Halfling Heritage
 and would always talk about how he wants to be taller all the time and believes that being taller would make
Lucy Greyrat
 think he is cool.

Background

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Plot

Spoilers ahead

Redundancy
Nanahoshi Gourmet

At Lucy and Clive's ages of 12 and 9 respectively, they start a relationship and are planning to marry in the future unless Rudeus needs a heartfelt conversation with them for permission.

Redundancy
The Last One to Leave the Nest

At Lucy and Clive's ages of 18 and 15 respectively, they are happily married and live together in the Holy Country of Milis, having a child named Roland.

Complacency
===========

Complacency
 (
油断
,

Yudan
)
 is the eighth chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Summary

Rudeus searches and finds a gagged Eris with her two abductors running down an alleyway, so Rudeus uses Earth magic to create a wall and block their escape. As they see Rudeus using magic, they mistakenly think him as her bodyguard, and the kidnappers propose to pay Rudeus from profits by a
fat noble
 who wishes to buy Eris. But while Rudeus sees it is tempting, he refuses outright as he can't buy personal connections with money. Shooting a fireball into the air, the kidnappers are distracted by the firework, allowing Rudeus to free Eris from the custody of the one holding her.

However, the other thief slices an Earth Cannon attack in half, forcing Rudeus into a hasty retreat. Using a fireball as a feint, the remaining thief is caught in a mud trap, as Rudeus is racing to the street with Eris in his arms. Unable to move, the second kidnapper is forced to throw his blade in an attempt to stop Rudeus. As Rudeus sees the blade flying toward him, he flashes back to Paul's teaching him about North God Style incorporating sword throwing techniques. With no way to dodge or escape anymore, Rudeus believes himself about to die until Ghislaine arrives. Ghislaine destroys the thrown sword and kills the swordsman kidnapper. When asked, Rudy tells her that there were no other kidnappers and that it was his first time seeing someone be killed in front of him.

After Ghislaine advises Rudeus to be more careful, she escorts the children to the Boreas Manor, where the staff tend to them. Once home, Eris is finally allowed to talk having fulfilled her promise to Rudeus, and
grants
 him the
privilege
 to simply address her as Eris. Realizing he never asked her name, Rudeus believes he's finally been hired as her tutor whils Eris falls back and sleeps on the floor. Still thinking back, as that thrown sword was aimed to kill him, and regardless of his being in a fantasy world, Rudeus is afraid as he has no idea what would happen if he were to die again.

Could It Be? An Alternate Universe!
===================================

Could It Be? An Alternate Universe!
 (
もしかして異世界
,

Moshikashite Isekai
)
 is the first chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Roxy Migurdia

Summary

After a 34 year old NEET was kick out of his house by his surviving siblings, he finds himself hopeless and unfit for the world. He soon dies trying to save a group of students from a runaway truck in the rain. But to his surprise, he finds himself no longer on Earth, but reincarnated as a baby named
Rudeus Greyrat
, the first son of
Zenith
 and
Paul
. With a new life, Rudy decides to not make the same mistakes he did in his previous life, and secretly trains in magic in order to learn what he can. When he was 3 years old and was secretly training, he misused a spell and his parents discover his potential as a mage. While Zenith is overjoyed and Paul wanted to commit to instructing Rudy, they ultimately decide to have him study both magic and swordsmanship in the morning and afternoon respectively on
Lillia
's suggestion. Proceeding to hire a magic tutor, they are met by
Roxy Migurdia
.

Appearances

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Zenith Greyrat

Paul Greyrat

Lilia

Roxy Migurdia

Nanahoshi Shizuka
 (Cameo)

Shinohara Akihito
 (Cameo)

Skills

Water Ball

Water Cannon

Regions

Buena Village

Fittoa Region

Others

Differences from Light Novel

Part of the background of Rudeus in his previous life was cut.

The scene where he watches
Paul
 training with the sword and Zenith heal him after he fell happened when he was less than a year old (manga with 3 years).

The types of magic and how they work was cut.

Rudeus firsts training and test about how work the magic was cut.

Trivia

It's the first time that Rudeus' previous life family,
Nanahoshi Shizuka
 and
Shinohara Akihito
 obtain a illustration.

Navigation

Template:JuvenileP

Counter Arrow
=============

Counter Arrow
 is a party of the
Adventure Guild
 that Rudeus meets in the
Northern lands
 after
Eris
 left him, and he continues to search for his mother
Zenith
.

History

Counter Arrow was a party that was active in the
Asura Kingdom
, when the party obtained the Rank B as adventurers, they decide to move north to the Duchy of Basherant to search for better quests. In the travel to the Northern Lands, they meet a depressed
Rudeus Greyrat
, after completing a quest with him, he occasionally joined to the party to complete harder quests.

During one of their missions without Rudeus, the party is ambushed by
Snow Buffaloes
 but due to the low visibility caused by the blizzard, they got separated that resulted in the death of Mimir, and Sara gets trapped by a
Icefall Treant
 slowly draining her life force, until Rudeus rescues her upon learning from the remaining party that Sara is still missing.

After Rudeus left Basherant, the party goes on a mission to subjugate a giant wolf but they were ambushed by the monster and injures Suzanne. Sara defeats the giant wolf and the party rushes Suzanne back to the city to be treated. As Suzanne is recovering she announces her intent to disband the Counter Arrow party while Timothy announces that he will marry Suzanne and settle down in
Sharia
, Ranoa Kingdom and Timothy's hometown. Patris decides to go back to Asura Kingdom after hearing a rumor that her sister who is though to be dead is still alive and plans become a soldier if she is alright.

Years later, Rudeus eventually hires Suzanne to be the wet nurse of his first child
Lucy Greyrat
.
 Sara continues working as an Adventurer and joins
The Amazons
, an all female Rank S party who is given a mission in Ranoa where she works with Rudeus once again.

Members

Timothy
 (Leader, Rear Guard Mage)

Suzanne
 (Vice Leader, Vanguard)

Sara
 (Ranged Fighter)

Mimir
 (Rear Guard Healer)

Patris
 (Vanguard)

Temporary members

Rudeus Greyrat
 (Rear Guard Mage)

Abilities

The party was conformed by two in the vanguard, one ranged fighter, and two rear guard.

Trivia

Even though Timothy is the official leader, Suzanne is the person in charge of almost everything.

In the Web Novel, even though only Suzanne appears, Rudeus says that the party was conformed by 4 persons, 2 vanguard (Suzanne, Patris) a Healer (Mimir) and a Mage (Timothy); Sara was added for the LN.

References

Crystal
=======

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Crystal
 is from the Sturdy Dragon Tribe and a member of the Five Dragon Generals. He is also the mate of Dora and the father of
Perugius Dola
.

Background

Crystal has served the
First Dragon God
 as one of his Five Dragon Generals who protect the Dragon World for years. Since the concept of familial relationship is thin among the
Dragon Tribe
, the mating seasons of Crystal and fellow Dragon General
Dora
 aligning is met with high expectation due to it being the first time a child between two Dragon Generals will be born. But before their child is born, Crystal is found dead at a Gold Dragon's nest with his escorts and it looked like he fought the Gold Dragon and lost.

Legacy

The news of the death of Crystal is met with shock by the Dragon Tribe considering he is a Dragon General, recognized by the First Dragon God as the most powerful Dragon Warriors.

A meeting is held on the First Dragon God's mansion with the remaining Dragon Generals who are also in disbelief Crystal's death.

Maxwell
 reports his investigation that a Gold Dragon cannot kill Crystal and there's a possibility that a monster would but feels there is more to this.

Szilard
 considers the possibility that this could be the work of demons

The First Dragon God assigns
Laplace
 to search for the culprit despite Szilard and
Chaos
 volunteering and Chaos also opposing the idea.

Maxwell introduces
Gora and Scrubava
 to Laplace to assist in the investigation, both from the Steel Dragon Tribe like Crystal and are burning for revenge to search for the culprit.

Laplace defeats
Necrolia Nacrolia
 and hands him over to Szilard and reports on the meeting with the First Dragon God and the remaining Dragon Generals that he indeed killed Crystal and is executed.

Laplace informs Dora of his capture of Necrolia and apologizes that he did not bring his head to her but she does not mind and asks that Laplace name Crystal and her child who is still in an egg to which Laplace names him
Perugius
.

Despite the Dragon Generals urging the First Dragon God to go to war against the demons, he chose to negotiate with them reasoning that they are even for losing their own Dragon General and them losing one of their Eight Demon Kings.

The First Dragon God also instructs the Dragon Generals to keep the death of Necrolia a secret to avoid a war with the Demon World before the negotiation.

At Szilard's recommendation to reward Laplace, the First Dragon God grants Laplace the title Demon Dragon King and a place among the Dragon Generals to the surprise of everyone.

During Crystal's funeral rite, the name of the dead are placed on the wall of the burial building but Crystal's name is carved on a stone tablet which is for special people in the Dragon Tribe.

Dora inherits Crystal's research on Teleport Magic takes charge of the Teleportation Research Laboratory in a nameless mountain in the Dragon World.

Power and Abilities

Teleport Magic

The First Dragon God assigns Crystal to the research of Teleportation Magic which has been an unexplained incidents happening through out the Six Worlds and because of this, Necrolia assassinates Crystal ordered by the
Demon God
.

Achievements

Became a Dragon General, who's power is recognized by the First Dragon God.

References
