Cursed Swords
=============

Yulian Jalisco the Demon World's craftsman created a total of 49 swords from the bones of king of
King Dragons
, Kajakut.

Inscription-less Sword





Inscription-less Sword in the Light Novel



An unnamed sword that doesn’t lose its edge, Eris obtained this sword from
Roxy
's Father
Rowin Migurdia
. The sword is a single edge falchion with a curved blade where the edge side is vastly wider than the back side and has two red ornaments on its blade ridge. The blade is also attached to both ends of the cross guard and has a knuckle bow.

Owner:
Eris Greyrat

Prominent





Prominent in the Light Novel



Prominent
 (
指折
,

Yubi Ori
)
 is an ornamented sword that
Orsted
 gave to Rudeus who became his subordinate to sell for funds for his missions but due to the difficulty of finding someone to immediately buy it, he gives the sword to Eris that is seen sheathed by the right side of her waist.

Owner:
Eris Greyrat


King Dragon Sword Kajakut

King Dragon Sword Kajakut
 (
王竜剣カジャクト
,

Ōryū-ken Kajakuto
)
 is a greatsword forged from the crème de la crème of King Dragon King’s corpse. It can manipulate gravity just like the Dragon King, and can release its energy in a burst that can leave a 20 meter crater on the ground.

Owner:
Kalman II
 (former),
Kalman III
 (current)

Sword God
's seven swords

Sword God Gal Farion likes collecting swords especially those made by Yulian that he keeps in his room which is commonly given to his students after reaching the Sword king rank as proof of mastery.

Windpipe





Windpipe in the Light Novel



Windpipe
 (
喉笛
,

Nodobue
)
 is a single edge curve sword with a sparkling golden blade that Gal sheathes at his left hip. The sword guard is composed of 2 bow shaped ornaments where the belly of the bow attaches to the body of the guard and a decorated mushroom shaped pommel at the end of the sword's grip. After their battle, Gal gives Eris the Windpipe.

Owner:
Gal Farion
, Eris Greyrat

Flat Core






Ghislaine's Flat Core in the Anime



Flat Core
 (
平宗
,

Hiramune
)
 which can also be read as Pillar of Peace is a katana with a dark colored back side and patterns by its reddish edge side. The golden cross guard also serves as a blade collar but it is longer on backside and as it crosses to the edge side. The dark hilt is slightly curved and has a golden pommel. Ghislaine is given the Flat Core when she became a Sword King by Gal Farion.

Owner:
Ghislaine

Phoenix Elegant Dragon Sword






Phoenix Elegant Dragon Sword in the Light Novel



Phoenix Elegant Dragon Sword
 (
鳳雅龍剣
,

Hōgaryū-ken
)
 is a single edge silver sword that has a curved blade where the edge side is at the inside of the blade (unlike her first sword and Ghislaine's Hiramune where the edge is outside of the blade). There is a detachable ornament is placed by the back side near the blade collar with various engravings. The cross guard is shaped like a bow where the belly of the bow is facing the hilt and a pommel pointing towards the edge side. A sword that didn't release any sinister feeling and just felt refreshing.

Defense Nullification:
Can nullify the
Battle Aura
 of the enemy

Owner:
Eris Greyrat

Trivia

Is explained in Volume 15 that, two of the seven
Sword God's seven swords
 are in possession of the Sword emperors (one of them being
Timothy Britts
) And the other two are reserved for students that still need to grow a little more (probably
Jino Britts
 and
Nina Farion
).

The sword
Prominent
 worth around 100,000 Asura gold coins.

Flat Core can also be read as Flat Chest to which Rudeus thought that the name doesn't suit Ghislaine considering the size of her chest.

Reference

Curses
======

Curses
 (
呪い
,

Noroi
)
 are special abilities born from abnormalities in
Mana
. They can manifest in two forms: people whose abilities are beneficial to others are known as
Miko
 (
神子
,

Miko
, lit. "Blessed Child")
, while those whose abilities bring disadvantage or harm are known as
Cursed One
 (
呪子
,

Noroi-ko
, lit."Cursed Child")
. This distinction is made by humans and fundamentally, both are the same kind of anomalous ability. Because whether an ability is beneficial or harmful is judged by others, even a Miko’s ability can sometimes be detrimental to themselves.

Cliff Grimoire
 proposes a hypothesis that suggests a connection between curses and
magic items
. According to his theory, the effects of curses and magic items are essentially the same. After hearing that
Laplace
 transferred his curse to the
Superd Tribe
 through a
spear
, Cliff Grimoire is researching a technique to send mana from a
magic tool
 to offset the negative effects of curses and alleviate their symptoms.

Cursed Ones

Elinalise Dragonroad

Elinalise Dragonroad is afflicted with a curse inherited from being trapped in a labyrinth magic crystal. This curse causes mana to accumulate within her body, which must be crystallized through receiving a male’s sperm. If she fails to receive it, the mana bulges too dangerously within her, ultimately leading to her death. As a result, she produces a mana crystal once per month.

During pregnancy, her condition can be temporarily subsided as the mana flowed into the unborn child instead, eliminating the need for sexual intercourse to avoid death. As result, her children born inherit exceptionally high mana capacity without exception. Thanks to Cliff’s research, a magical device was devised that suppressed the curse—allowing her to go over a year without intercourse by the time Cliff graduated.

Ruijerd Superdia

Cursed after Laplace transferred his own curse to him. Makes others feel intense fear toward him. The effect has weakened over time as his physical resemblance to Laplace (green hair) faded.

Demon God
Laplace

Laplace has a curse on him that makes all living creatures of the Human World fear him extremely, which according to
Perugius
 is a curse that shakes the innermost heart of people. Laplace transferred the <Curse of Fear> to the
spears
 and passed it onto the
Superd race

Dragon God
Orsted

Orsted's curse affecting all creatures of the world
Curse on Orsted causing even dragons to fear him
1/2

Orsted is born with an innate curse that causes every living being in this world to instinctively despise and fear him—those who sense his
mana
 harbor hostility toward him. A powerful curse so intense that children cry, dogs flee, and carriages overturn merely from his presence. There are some exceptions:

Those with ancient dragon blood, like
Perugius
, are immune.

Rudeus
 and his descendants, as well as
Nanahoshi
, are not influenced by this curse.
Hitogami
 speculates that “it doesn’t affect people from other worlds,” while Orsted believes his status as a reincarnated being may also play a role.

Some individuals possess the mental fortitude to overcome the curse, such as
Eris
,
Ruijerd
 and
Ariel
.

Wearing the magical tool, Curse Suppressing Helmet, crafted by
Cliff
 can mitigate the curse’s effects.

It seems the root of the curse is linked to fear stemming from the
First Dragon God
—who annihilated all worlds except the
Dragon
 and
Human World
. From this, it's inferred that the curse doesn’t affect the Dragon Tribe who were not adversaries of the First Dragon God, nor does it affect people from other worlds who never interacted with him.

Henry Macedonia

Becomes difficult to be recognized by others. The curse can be mitigated with a curse-repelling mask. However, most humans, except for his biological mother, cannot recognize Henry, and his face cannot be remembered. Notably, the Superd Tribe with a third eye can recognize him.

Mikos

Only about ten Mikos exist whole world . Outside of royalty, most are stripped of their birth names and renamed
“Miko of [Ability]”
, with the title reflecting their innate abilities. They are typically bound to serve the kingdom of their birth.

Miko of Superhuman Strength
Zanoba Shirone





Zanoba's Miko Power in the Anime



Even at a young age, Zanoba is abnormally strong, capable of standing off against a demon king as far as raw strength goes. Any hit from Zanoba is potentially fatal even with
Battle Aura
. This power does not include stamina, however, as Zanoba is described to be unfit for long travels.

Miko of Memory

When looking into someone's eyes, the Miko of Memory is able to see one's "surface memories", memories that a person has in mind. This also extends to being able to see related memories to that subject, and the longer she stares into someone's eyes, the more of that person's memories she sees.

Miko of Rewind
 Lilia

She has the ability to alter the past, but since she cannot fully control it, her power is believed to be only the ability to rewind an object’s time by a single day.

Hitogami

He is automatically trusted by all Humans in the world and has the ability to talk to people in their dreams. When he speaks with people in their dreams, he's able to read their minds.

Zenith Greyrat

Zenith has gained the ability to read minds after being trapped in a Magic Crystal during the Teleport Incident. A side effect of her power is that she is in a dream like state where she is not fully awake and not able to actually speak, but thinks she is speaking due to her telepathy.

Nether King
Vita

He can read the memories of his enemies, predict the future that might have occurred and blend it with the desires of his opponent, putting them into an endless illusion. By splitting off part of his own body and inserting them into people, he can control many people at the same time and even halt a disease outbreak.

Kishirika Kishirisu

She's most known for her ability to produce, control and give demon eyes. She carries 12 types within her body, each with their own unique ability. She regenerates these demon eyes as she grows older after reincarnation, it may be possible that she generates new ones if she gets old enough without dying.

Items

See in
Magic Items

See in
Cursed Swords

See in
Demon Spear

Trivia

There are only about 10 Mikos in the whole world.

As long as you are not royalty, your birth name will be taken away and replaced with just "Miko" (Such as in the case of
Millishion Miko
) and you will be forced to work for the kingdom.

References

Dale
====

Dale was the leader of
Rikarisu gang
, he died in a quest crushed by a landslide.

Appearance

Dale has a youthful aperance and looked very similar to a human despite being from the demon continent. He has spicky medium length blond hair that's swept back and green eyes.

Personality

Dale had dreams of one day becoming a legendary adventurer. He typically names himself as 'Hawkendale" because he thinks that longer names are cooler.

Background

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Plot

Three years after
Roxy
 joined
his party
, Dale and the rest of the
Rikarisu gang
 had all reached B rank as adventurers.

After they embarked on a Rank A quest, Dale perished in a landslide.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Power and Abilities

Dale is a proficent enough swordsman to slice large boulders in half

Equipment

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Quotes

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Trivia

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Trivia

For
Roxy
, he was like a older brother.

Roxy
 remembers him when she was almost killed in the Teleport Labyrinth and when she try to comfort
Rudeus
 after
Paul
 death.

His name appeared for the first time in
Roxy spin off manga
.

Darius
======

Redirect to:
Darius Silva Ganius

Darius Silva Ganius
===================

Darius Silva Ganius
 (
ダリウス
・
シルバ
・
ガニウス
)
 was the Prime Minister of the
Asura Kingdom
.

Appearance

Darius is a fat and bald old man that wears wealthy clothes.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Personality

A vile human who does everything he can to gain power and please his desires. He would regularly kidnap young noble women such as
Eris Boreas Greyrat
, which failed, and
Tristina Purplehorse
, which succeeded, and would use them as his sex slaves and play toys, selling them off once he was done with them. He also had no problem ordering people to kill others when he thinks it will benefit himself, such as when he ordered
Reida Reia
 to kill
Ariel Anemoi Asura
. His appearance and character may be a reference to Minister
Foss
 from Berserk.

Background

He was a big supporter of the first prince of the Asura Kingdom,
Grabel Zafin Asura
, and would do everything in his power to coerce others to his side to give Grabel the best chances of becoming King, even if he did not deserve the throne.

Plot

Vol 2

Darius is suspected to be behind the true kidnapping of Eris.

Vol 4

Darius informed Grabel about Ariel's suspicious movements and sent
Nights Eye Crow
 to kill her. Even though she fails, he continues to send assassins after her until she leaves the country.

Vol 6

He financially supported the Boreas family after the
Teleport Incident
, and helped protect them and allow them to rebuilt House Boreas when the other nobles would have crushed it, taking as much of the land they owned for themselves. However he thought
Sauros Boreas Greyrat
 was a fool for wanting to use the entire Boreas fortune on rebuilding
Fittoa
, so he persuaded
Pilemon Notos Greyrat
 into action,  and caused Sauros to be blamed for the teleport incident which led to his execution.

Vol 17

Darius would repeatedly send assassination attempts to any noble that would side themselves with Ariel, which caused some of them to switch sides to the first prince Grabel out of fear for their lives.

Darius is one of the
Hitogami
 apostles, and he was behind every attack against Ariel. After he was exposed by Tristina and Ariel his political position was greatly reduced as he was going to be punished for his crimes of kidnapping and abusing Tristina, but Reida came to his rescue and ordered
Auber Corvette
 to carry him to safety, but he was killed by ultimately chased down by
Rudeus Greyrat
,
Ghislaine Dedoldia
, and Eris. After the three defeated his guard, Auber, Ghislaine was allowed to deliver the final blow to Darius as he was the one who ordered Sauros to be executed, which was the person Ghislaine wanted to avenge.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Power and Abilities

He can use fire magic, including the fire spell
fireball
.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Equipment

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Quotes

To Grabel:
 “I’ve watched them quietly this past year. If they’re going to be Your Majesty’s enemies, Prince Grabel, then naturally we must dispose of them.”

Dark King Vita
==============

Vita

Dead End
========

Dead End
 (デッドエンド,
Deddo Endo
) was a party formed by
Rudeus Greyrat
 after the Teleportation incident.

History

The party was created in order for them to do adventurer jobs so that they can get some money in order for them to travel back to
Asura Kingdom
.
 It was disbanded after they reached the Fittoa Region, when Ruijerd achieved his goal of escorting the two back to their home. After the party was disbanded, Ruijerd went off to search for other surviving members of the Superd Race, Eris left to train in the Holy Land of the Sword, whereas Rudeus continued to work as an adventurer to spread his fame in hope of finding the still missing
Zenith
.

Members

Rudeus Greyrat

Eris Greyrat

Ruijerd Superdia

Temporary Members

Geese

Jalil

Vizquel

Abilities

Trivia

They had the skill to obtain the S rank of the adventurer guild, but because this may limit the quest that may take, they stayed in A Rank.

Each members have their own epithet:

"Mad Dog"  Eris

"Guard Dog" Ruijerd

"Kennel Master" Rujerd (Rudeus)

In order to improve Ruijerd's and subsequently Superd's reputation, Rudeus would introduce himself as "Ruijerd of Dead End" whenever he did something amicable, and as "Rudeus" when he did something bad or got into trouble.

As a result, his name was mixed up and mistakenly spread as "Rujerd".

Dealing With Sisters
====================

Dealing With Sisters
 is the 89th chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Badigadi

Summary

Rudeus finishes his morning jogging and upon returning home, he sees Badigadi standing at the front door of their but he is actually staring at Ruijerd guarding the door. Badigadi realizes that Rudeus is there and departs after realizing the situation. After breakfast, Ruijerd is heading out since he has completed the request to bring Norn and Aisha to Rudeus but Norn wants to got with him. Back at home, Aisha has decided to become Rudeus' maid while Norn still is still struggling with his new life with her brother.

Volume 1

Demon Continent
===============

Map of Demon Continent



Demon Continent
 (魔大陸
Mā Tairiku
) lying east to the
Ringus Sea
 is the continent where the
Demon Race
 live. There are no roads but a single path is present. D-rank or above monsters roam around the continent and they have high adaptability to the techniques even if they see it only once. It is said that warriors go there to train but mostly never come back. It is an exceedingly harsh land over which is ruled by Demon lords. The monsters are said to taste bad.

Population

The Demon Race makes up the large majority of the population. The Human Race, Beast Race, and the Seafolk can be seen near port towns.

Demon God Tongue is the language spoken.

Governance

There are about 30 demon lords and each one of them has their own territory. They're demon lords in name only though, who just act bossy. There are also demon lords who have a special unit, but actually, they’re just warriors with special powers and cool names. The Special Guard in the town of Rikaris is also one of them. The people in special units are actually pretty similar to adventurers. They exterminate monsters like them, they catch criminals in town, and they also guard the town they live in. If a demon lord is determined to start a war, they would become the demon lord’s army. Most of the magic continent is a lawless area that does not have a Demon Lord ruling over the territory.

Geography

Biegoya Region

The region reigned over by the Demon King
Badigadi
.

Rikarisu

The city of
Rikarisu
, also referred to as
Old Kishirisu Castle
, is one of the three largest settlements on the Demon Continent. It served as the home base for the forces of the Demon Empress Kishirika Kishirisu during the Great Human-Demon War.

It sits in the middle of a gigantic crater.

Petrified Forest

A forest a days journey away from Rikarisu. It was a place where bone-like trees with jagged branches grew in enormous numbers. Cutting through the forest offered a shortcut to reach another nearby city, but due to the presence of multiple rank B monsters such as the Almond Anaconda and the Executioner, this shortcut is only taken by merchants in a big hurry who hire multiple skilled bodyguards beforehand. The rank A Red-Hood Cobra can also rarely be present as well.

Migurd Village

The Migurd Village is a small settlement where the Demon tribe of
Migurd
 lives.

Gaslow Region

The region reigned over by the Demon King
Atoferatofe Raibaku
.

Sokasu grass is also grown in this region in depths of caves where the sun never shines and its inhabitants have knowledge of its cultivating techniques. In addition to being used as tea due to its delicious taste by demons, Sokasu grass is also used for treatment in
Nanahoshi Shizuka
's Drain Syndrome.

Fort Necross

An impregnable fortress built by the immortal Demon King Necross Lacross. The place where Atoferatofe resides.

Babynos Region

Where the
Superd
 tribe originally lived before driven out of their homes during the Laplace war.

Southern Region

Wind Port

The only port city in the Demon Continent and is the connecting travel hub via sea to and from Zanto Port,
Millis Continent
. It's a town with a lot of hills and slopes. You can see the entire city from the entrance.

See
Interactive Map of the Demon Continent

Monsters

Due to the high mana density, the monsters occupying the Demon Continent are far greater in strength and numbers when compared to other continents. All monsters are ranked D and above, while also having high adaptability to the techniques even if they see it only once. Combined with the harsh terrain, the Demon Continent is widely regarded as the most dangerous continent in the world.

See
list of monsters in the Demon Continent

Currency





Demon Continent Currency in the Anime



Green Ore Coins (1,000 yen = 10 USD)

Iron Coin (100 Yen = 1 USD)

Scrap Iron Coin (10 Yen = 10 cents)

Stone Coin (1 Yen = 1 cent)

References

Demon Eye
=========

Redirect to:
Demon Eyes

Demon Eyes
==========

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!





Kishirika's various Demon Eyes in the Manga



Demon Eyes
 (
魔眼
,

Magan
, alt. "Magic/Mystic Eyes")
 refer to special eyes that have abilities associated with them. How one obtains these eyes may vary, but it's possible for some to be born with them, such as someone born with the
Laplace Factor
, but it's more commonly known that one can be bestowed a demon eye by
Kishirika Kishirisu
.

Mastering demon eyes require precise control of the flow of mana, and most users are unable to fully control them throughout their lives. As a result, most users would wear an eyepatch to cover their demon eyes when they're not using them
.

Known Demon Eyes

There are a number of Demon Eyes. Kishirika possesses 12 of them, but only 7 of them are described.
 It's unknown what the other eyes are possessed by Kishirika. Demon Eyes have long existed even in the era of the
Six-Faced World
 and some of its users are not even aware that they have such eye until they are told to focus their
Mana
 to their eyes.

Magic Power Eyes

Ghislaine's Magic Power Eyes in the Manga
Ghislaine's Magic Power Eyes in the Anime
Kishirika's Magic Power Eyes in the Anime
1/3

The most common of Demon Eyes,
Magic Power Eyes
 (
魔力眼
,

Maryoku me
)
 allow the user to view the flow of mana directly. The eye appears to be a deep green color, and has a cross-like pattern, with something like 4 extra pupils appearing around the main center pupil.

Known Users:

Kishirika Kishirisu

Ghyslaine Dedoldia

Balibadom

Identification Eyes

When looking at something with the
Identification Eyes
 (
識別眼
,

Shikibetsu me
)
, the details of that object will be shown in texts. However, only information within Kishirika's knowledge would be provided, whereas anything that she doesn't know would be shown as "unknown".

Known Users:

Kishirika Kishirisu

Cliff Grimoire

X-ray Eyes

As the name suggests,
X-ray Eyes
 (
透視眼
,

Tōshi me
)
 allow one to see through opaque objects, including walls or clothes. However, it doesn't allow one to see through living creatures or dense magical power.

Known Users:

Kishirika Kishirisu

Clairvoyant Eyes

Clairvoyant Eye in the Anime
Kishirika seeing the massive mana gathering in Asura Kingdom
Kishirika's Clairvoyant Eye in the Light Novel
1/3

The
Clairvoyant Eyes
 (
千里眼
,

Senri me
, lit. "Thousand Miles Eyes")
 allow the user to see far away. However, the "Focus point" is difficult to control. Rather than acting as a scope, the Clairvoyant Eyes seem to change the perspective of one's vision, with the amount of mana determining the distance from the user.

Known Users:

Kishirika Kishirisu

Rudeus Greyrat

Foresight Eyes

Rudeus' Foresight Eye
Rudeus' Foresight Eye in the Anime PV
Rudeus foreseeing Eris' attack with his Foresight Eye
1/3

The
Foresight Eyes
 (
予見眼
,

Yoken me
)
 allows one to see into the future, seeing possible outcomes. However, like the Clairvoyance Eyes, it's difficult to control "focal point", which in this case means how far into the future one wants to see, and the opacity of the future imagery. The further one tries to see, the more outcomes are shown to them, but these outcomes become blurred together
. The appearance of this eye has a color similar to Rudeus' natural eyes, however the pupil takes on a swirl shape, similar to a whirlpool.

Known Users:

Kishirika Kishirisu

Rudeus Greyrat

Absorption Eyes

These Eyes absorb magic power. However, they also absorb one's own magic, so it's disadvantageous for a magician to have the
Absorption Eyes
 (
吸魔眼
,

Kyūma me
)
.

Known Users:

Kishirika Kishirisu

All-Seeing Eyes

The
All-Seeing Eyes
 (
万里眼
,

Banri me
, lit. "Ten-Thousand Miles Eyes")
 allow the user to see all things in the world, even being able to find specific people, and peer into labyrinths. However, a dense enough magical power can hinder the sight of the All-Seeing Eyes.

Known Users:

Kishirika Kishirisu

Absolute Void Eyes

The
Absolute Void Eyes
 (
空絶眼
,

Sora zemme
)
 create a barrier around a large area. It's unclear exactly how the barrier operates, but it's able to prevent a large mass of people from entering a castle.

Known Users:

Randolph Marianne

Affection Eyes

The
Affection Eyes
 (
魅了眼
,

Miryō me
)
 causes people to become infatuated with the user. Because some users can't control them, they'll usually cover the eye with bandages or an eyepatch.

Known Users:

Gadalf Rangid

Other

Laplace had a unnamed demon eye that allows its him to see traces of living beings in an area that can be differentiated by person and can be tracked to its owner despite the long distance from where it was initially found even if the traces were left decades ago.

Known Users:

Laplace

Trivia

The
All-Seeing Eyes
 original kanji (万里眼) literally means "Ten-Thousand Miles Eyes", likely to indicate that these eyes are on a higher level than the
Clairvoyant Eyes
 (
千里眼
, lit. "Thousand Miles Eyes")
.

References

Demon Lord
==========

Redirect to:
Category:Demon Lord

Demon Spear
===========

Demon Spears in the Manga



The Demon Spears are spears made by
Laplace
 as a gift for the
Superd Tribe
, that hold immense power with the side effect of causing its users in this case the Superd race to become insane not being able to tell friend from foe and is what caused them to gain such horrible reputations. It have a high resemblance with the Superd spear excluding his jet black color, this magic tool amplified their bearers’ physical capabilities several times over, nullified the effects of the humans’ magic, and heightened the Superds’ already sharp senses even further, but slowly erodes the mind of his user.

Trivia

Reference

Moved by their courage at the face of imminent death, Rudeus decides to take matters in his own hands...

Depressed Magician Chapter 009
==============================

Depressed Magician Chapter 009
 is the 9th chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei
 Depressed Magician Arc
manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Summary

Several months have passed, Rudeus steadily grows his reputation as an adventurer and the citizens of Rosenburg calls him "Quagmire". Due to the winter season, most adventurer are barely doing any missions so Rudeus takes a rankless mission to gather snow. After completing the mission, Rudeus spots Counter Arrow party Timothy, Suzanne and Patris but they look in despair.

Depressed on what happened, Rudeus drinks heavily alone where Soldat arrives to further provoke him and causing Rudeus to punch him.

 is the 17th chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei
 Depressed Magician Arc
manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Soldat Heckler

Unnamed
Stepped Leader
 members

Summary

After parting ways with Sara, Rudeus agrees to accompany Soldat who introduces him to the Stepped Leader members who are waiting for Soldat before they depart. The members were surprised that Rudeus is with Soldat who they are aware that he dislikes but welcomes him nonetheless. During the trip, Rudeus shows his ability to
Silent Spell Cast
 and when Rudeus tries to explain his other abilities, Soldat stops him and challenges him to a fight.

Earth Magic
 to remove the Crab's stone armor and defeats it then the female magician hugs him in gratitude. They later celebrate and one of the members mentions that Soldat would take care of people that eventually become members of the party as he recalls his past from 22 years ago.

Swordsmanship

Depressed Magician Volume 01
============================

This article contains information for the First Volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
: Depressed Magician Arc
Manga
 adaptation and its chapters.

Synopsis

After his separation with
Eris
,
Rudeus
 falls into the depths of depression. He travels to Rosenberg, the second city of the Duchy of Basherant, to search for his missing mother,
Zenith
. Desperate, Rudeus tries to accept a high-ranking request alone in order to make a name for himself. However, by chance, he ends up working with a party of B-rank adventurers called the
Counter Arrow
. One of the party members is a girl named
Sara
, who reminds him of Eris...!

Eris Seriously Sharpen her Fangs

Volume 1

Derrick Redbat
==============

"He was a shrewd man, possessing a strong ambition. If the mana calamity had not happened, Ariel was fated to encounter Perugius. And the one who at that time would have persuaded Perugius was Derrick."

Orsted

Derrick Redbat
 was an advanced ranked magician and the previous guardian mage of Ariel before Fitts.

Appearance

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Personality

While Orsted describes Derrick to be shrewd and ambitious, he is also a man of common sense and due to hailing from a middle class noble family does not share the behavior of upper class nobles where the ability to toy with others was a status symbol especially those in the Silver Palace. Derrick also has understanding of the dangers within Asura Kingdom that has been on a standstill due to the ugly political bickering between the nobilities and would remain a drag on the kingdom's progress despite the overwhelming advantages Asura Kingdom has, it might not last even fifty years should the surrounding kingdoms invade.

Out of all the heirs, Derrick believes that Ariel is the most suitable to become queen because of her unsurpassed charisma and that she certainly would be a monarch beloved by the people, just as her ancestor
Kaunis Freean Asura
 that led humanity after the Laplace Wars was.

Background

Derrick is the third son of the famed Redbat house, an advanced ranked magician hailed from the historic Asura Magic Academy and became a guardian purely due to his exemplary grades in the Magic Academy. A noble with advance magic was of great value. The Redbat family was mere middle class noble of Asura Kingdom, thus largely disconnected from the decadence within the Silver Palace.

Derrick first meets Ariel after his graduation at a coming of age banquet hosted by the king himself where Ariel participated in the banquet as an honored guest. Although young, her congratulatory speech was brilliantly made, even outshining the valedictorian with her intellect. His father later suggested "the position of Second Princess Guardian Magician is vacant, don't put your hopes up, but want me to recommend you?" Without a moment of doubt he took the offer and gets the position and works with
Luke Notos Greyrat
.

Plot





Derrick and Ariel saved by Syphiette



Derrick would frequently lecture on kingship and persuade Ariel to become queen but Ariel would refuse because of numerous assassination attempts on her life. He sacrifices his life protecting Ariel from a terminate boar that appeared in the Silver Palace due to the
Teleport Incident
. Derrick aware his wounds are fatal sees Ariel in tears next to him and felt an unexpected happiness since he assumed that Ariel and Luke despised him for his lectures and tells Ariel his final request for her to become queen. Seeing Luke get knocked off by the boar, Derrick could only pray despite knowing that it meant little on this desperate situation but his prayer is answered when he sees an angel falling from heaven and kills the boar. Seeing this happen, Derrick shed a final tear in thanks and entrusts the angel to continue protecting Ariel.

Legacy

He is succeeded by
Fitts
 and all his equipment was given to her.

Ariel resolves to become queen because of Derrick's final request.

Rudeus Greyrat
 helps Ariel recall Derrick's lectures on kingship and successfully gains Perugius' backing to become queen.

Power and Abilities

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Equipment

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Quotes

"Please, God, I pray to you to aid us in our current predicament. Take my life as exchange; please help Ariel, whose existence this world cannot be without."

"As long as Ariel-sama has the will to fight, I'll be more than happy to sacrifice my life against assassins, if need be."

Trivia

In
Orsted
's previous loops, Derrick is the first person needed for Ariel to become
Asura Kingdom
's queen by successfully convincing
Perugius Dola
 to support Ariel's ascent to the throne and he would become her Prime Minister but has died during the Teleport Incident despite having a strong fate.

Reference

Desert Journey
==============

Desert Journey
 (砂漠の旅
Sabaku no Tabi
) is the nineteenth episode of the
second season
 (43nd overall)
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on May 26, 2024 and also the first episode of the
Labyrinth Arc
 for the Anime.

The episode is supposed to air on May 19, 2024 but it is postponed to May 26, 2024 and a special episode was aired featuring the seiyuu's of the series instead.

Synopsis

Upon receiving a letter from Geese saying, "Difficulty in rescuing Zenith, seeking help," Rudeus faces the tough choice of leaving behind his pregnant wife, Sylphy, along with his sisters, Norn and Aisha. Despite his inner struggle, Rudeus decides to head to the
labyrinth city of Rapan
 on the Begaritt continent with Elinalise. However, the journey turns out to be even more perilous than he imagined, putting lives at risk.

Plot

At Ranoa Magic Academy, Rudeus informs Elinalise that he is going to Begaritt who agrees to travel together after Rudeus insists on going. They then plan their trip and they first address dealing with the
Curse of Promiscuity
 of Elinalise and Rudeus suggests to use the
Curse Supressing Tool
 created by Cliff. Elinalise seems reluctant to tell Cliff that she is leaving but Rudeus tells her to talk to Cliff about it.

Rudeus then visits Nanahoshi and tells her that he will be going to Begaritt and will be gone for 2 years that surprises Nanahoshi, but quickly calms down to think. Before Rudeus leave, Nanahoshi gives him a map of Teleportation Circles of the
Human World
 and the location of the Teleportation Circle Ruins near Sharia to Begaritt. Although Nanahoshi is reluctant since Teleportation Magic is taboo in the Human World and is also sworn to secrecy, she shows Rudeus the map that upon teleporting to Begaritt he will need to travel north for a month and he should reach Rapan. Rudeus is shocked by how fast he can reach Rapan but is glad to be able to make it in time when Sylphy gives birth. Nanahoshi then reminds him to keep it a secret and she is just returning the favor and wants him to return quickly to continue her research after Rudeus thanks her.

At the Greyrat House, Rudeus announces his plans to go to Begaritt Continent that surprises Aisha while Norn remains silent. Sylphiette accepts Rudeus' decision despite promising he will not disappear on her. Sylphiette initially thought that Rudeus will be gone for 2 years but he tells her about the Teleportation Circles through Nanahoshi's help, she is worried due to her own experience with the
Teleport Incident
 but Rudeus assures her that he will come back. After talking to Aisha and Norn, Rudeus wants to name their
child
 but the girls are visibly shocked upon hearing this and Sylphy tells her that naming their child before going on journey means he will never make it back due to the legend of
Feroze Star
. Seeing Sylphy is still worried, Rudeus kisses Sylphy while Norn and Aisha looks on blushing.

At Ranoa Magic Academy, Rudeus talks to Linia and Pursena, then visits Jinas to arrange for a leave of absence for him and Elinalise then asks permission to borrow the books: "An Exploratory Account of the
Teleportation Labyrinth
" and "The Begaritt Continent and the
Fighting God Tongue
" from the Library.

At the Commerce District, Rudeus is joined by Zanoba, Juliette, and Ginger, who recommend purchasing a rather large dark horse that Rudeus names Matsukaze.

At the Greyrat House, Rudeus and Elinalise are packing up Matsukaze. Cliff then gives the Curse Supressing Tool that is smaller than the prototype and entrusts Elinalise to him. Cliff then approaches and embraces Elinalise and tells her that they will be married in a
Milis style
 ceremony when she returns. Sylphy also approaches Rudeus who once again assures her he will return soon and after giving his farewell to Norn and Aisha, Rudeus and Elinalise depart with an
adventurer
 accompanying them.

Arriving at their destination at Lumen Forest, the site of the Teleportation Circle Ruins, the adventurer leaves with Matsukaze to be returned to the Greyrat House.

Rudeus and Elinalise travels to the forest until they see a stone tablet bearing the emblem of Saint Dragon General
Szilard
. Rudeus presses his hand on the emblem and chants the incantation provided by Nanahoshi and the landscape changes to the entrance of the Teleportation Ruins, which they enter.

The two explore the ruins and descend the stairs. They see the Teleportation Circle which Rudeus confirms that it is a two-way Teleportation circle from the book he borrowed. The two then hold hands and upon stepping on the circle, they are now in Begaritt Continent. Before the leave the ruins, Elinalise volunteers to test the circle if they can return. While waiting for Elinalise to return, Rudeus explores the ruins and finds
Orsted
's extra
Coat
. Elinalise returns and Redeus deduces that the teleportation incurs a time lag.

Rudeus and Elinalise exits the Teleportation Ruins and seeing the vast desert before them, they confirm they are indeed in the Begaritt Continent. Since the night is approaching, Elinalise suggests to rest in the ruins until morning and they continue their travel.

At night, Rudeus conjures an
Earth Fortress
 for them to sleep but is exposed to a scent and begins to make a move on Elinalise who is asleep but upon hearing her utter Cliff's name, Rudeus steps outside and encounters a
Succubus
.

Rudeus approaches the Succubus but Elinalise attacks her that the monster narrowly dodges. The Succubus reveals her true form to take flight but Elinalise pummels the monster midair with her
Buckler
, causing the Succubus crash to the ground then Elinalise finishes her off by thrusting her
Estoc
 to the Succubus' heart. Rudeus, still affected by the Succubus' scent, makes a preposition to Elinalise, but she taps him on the head with her buckler and tells him to use
Detoxification Magic
.

Continuing their travel, they encounter a
Twin Death Scorpions
 where Elinalise attacks head on while Rudeus finishes it off with his
Stone Cannon
. They are then caught by a sandstorm that Rudeus nullifies with his own
Sandstorm
 spell.

A
behemoth
 accompanies them for a while. After days of travelling, Rudeus and Elinalise arrives at Bazaar, an encampment surrounding an
oasis
, where Rudeus asks for directions and have their meals.

That night, Elinalise steps out of the Earth Fortress for to pick up men while Rudeus thought that the Curse Supressing Tool still needs improvement, and they need to rescue
Zenith
 and return home as soon as possible.

Next day, Rudeus and Elinalise are in front of a cliff, causing Elinalise to suggest taking a detour but Rudeus uses
Earth Lance
 to lifts them atop the cliff but they are attacked by a
Griffon
 that Rudeus narrowly dodges. Another Griffon arrives and confronts Elinalise and the battle begins.

Seeing the Griffon attack with his
Foresight Eyes
, Rudeus responds with
Earth Hedgehog
, causing the Griffon to fly back but Rudeus follows up with
Wind Blast
, stunning the Griffon to the ground. As the Griffon lands, Rudeus follows up with a Stone Cannon and finishes it off by burning it with
Fireball
 that engulfs the Griffon in flame. Rudeus then turns his attention to Elinalise who is still fighting the second Griffon then prepares another Stone Cannon. Elinalise lands a hit on the Griffon who tried to take off. But Elinalise stabs the Griffon's front paw with her Estoc, pinning it in place as the Stone Cannon lands at the Griffon's neck and kills it.

That night, Rudeus and Elinalise are eating the drumstick of the Griffon they fought and where Elinalise talks about her adventures with Zenith who was 16, the same age of Rudeus when they first met but they decide to drop the subject when it changed to
Paul
's past.

After further travelling, Rudeus and Elinalise finally arrives at Rapan.

Destiny
=======

Redirect to:
Fate

Detoxification Magic
====================

Detoxification Magic
 is one of the four systems of
Healing Magic
 (magic category), focused on curing poison or sickness. At higher stages, Detoxification Magic even be used to create poison or medicine to cure poisons. Status-affliction related Detoxification Magic is said to be
Saint-ranked
 and above, and very difficult to learn.

With Detoxification Magic, the large majority of conditions can be cured using just Elementary-level. However, particular illnesses, poisons produced by powerful monsters, or diseases that have reached an advanced stage will need a pinpoint incantation and a massive amount of magic power which required higher level Detoxification Magic.

The God-class Detoxification Magic is a single magic that cures『Magic Stone Disease』. However, its incantation is carefully guarded in the storage of the
Great Church of Milishion
.

Trivia

Detoxification magic has also been shown to enable sobriety caused from drinking alcohol, but it can't remove the intoxication or fix hangovers from overdrinking.

Volume 1

Disturb Magic
=============

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Disturb Magic
 (
乱魔

,

Ran Ma

)
 is a
Unique/Unclassified

Magic
 that disrupts and cancels an opponent's spell during the activation phase, before it fully manifests.

Background

Disturb Magic is devised by the Dragon God
Urupen
[
Citation needed
]
 and is also first seen to be used by
Orsted
 during his
first battle against Rudeus
.





Rudeus practicing Disturb Magic in the Anime



Rudeus: "Since there is a number of cases where my magic has been sealed and I've been unable to do anything recently, I'm researching it after all."
Eris: "Hey, why is Rudeus that strong?"

Rudeus learned the technique through analysis and combat experience during his first near-fatal battle with Orsted, in which Orsted used it against him. Later, while training with Sylphiette, Rudeus developed a method to counter Disturb Magic itself, enabling him to cast spells despite its interference.

Details

Orsted using Disturb Magic in the Anime
Orsted using Disturb Magic against Rudeus in the Manga.
Rudeus' right hand sealed by Disturb Magic.
1/3

Disturb Magic works by sending magic designed to counteract the target spell. This interference causes the opponent's magic to scatter harmlessly before it can form.

It's an extremely rare and difficult technique to learn and master. Even highly talented mages like
Sylphiette
 struggle with it significantly.

Secrecy





Rudeus and Sylphy practicing Disturb Magic in the Anime



Fitz: "H-How did you do that?"
Rudeus: "Its a spell called Disturb Magic. Haven't you heard of it?"

Aside from Orsted and Rudeus, Disturb Magic's existence is not known even in prominent schools like
Ranoa Magic Academy
 that upon seeing it for the first time, that it is speculated that it is a Unique Magic of a certain
race
.
 At Sylphy's request to learn Disturb Magic, they develop a method to practice Disturb Magic where Rudeus would try to keep a
Waterball
 active while Sylphy tries to use Disturb Magic to neutralize it.

Counter

Rudeus using wind magic with his left hand while his other hand is sealed by Disturb Magic.
1/1

"Hmm... you managed to cancel Disturb Magic? No, its different... its a form of multiple incantations. Being able to do it with voiceless incantations, what a skillful guy you are."

-Orsted to Rudeus

Disturb Magic is only effective against magic cast from within a certain distance. Spells cast from beyond the range of the interfering magic are unaffected. It typically targets the magic activation at one specific part of the opponent's body (e.g., a hand). However, magic can still be cast using other body parts that are not currently targeted. During
Rudeus
's first battle with
Orsted
, Orsted used Disturb Magic to seal the magic in Rudeus's right hand. However, since it only targeted one body part, Rudeus could still cast magic with his left hand.

References

Divine Attack Magic
===================

Redirect to:
Divine Strike Magic

Divine Continent
================

Map of Divine Continent



Divine Continent
 (
天大陸
,

Ten Tairiku
,  lit. Heaven Continent)
 is a small continent located in the north connected to the
Central Continent
. You could even walk from it to the
Demon Continent
 during the low tide.
 It is where the
Heaven Race
 lives. The continent sits on a 3000-meter cliff with no proper connecting roads.

The Continent lies far north of the
Ringus Sea
.

Population

The
Heaven Race
 is the only major race that is known to live on this continent.

The language spoken is Sky God Tongue.

Localization

Western Cliff Face

Located at the furthest north-eastern edge of the Central Continent. The cliff face is more than simple bare rock. A number of the local inhabitants believed that gods resided within this cliff, so its surface was dotted with ladders and footholds. According to
Orsted
, a shrine dedicated to the worship of these gods could be found around two hundred meters up. Further above that, there were stakes driven into the cliff face to assist with climbing. There is a road made of a series of barely walkable footholds that leads to the Demon Continent, it was a much safer bet to travel than trying to climb upwards.

Hell

One of the three greatest labyrinths in the world. This was where
Nether King Vita
 stayed to avoid
Laxus
.

Artier

A town of the Heaven Race protected by a barrier.
Perugius Dola
 has some ties with the citizens in the town, and they would guide the people who come for their child's baptism to the shrine.

Currency

Trivia

It is the only continent on which Rudeus doesn't travel in the WN.

Even though is connected by a cliff with the Central Continent and Demon Continent, is considered a separate Continent because is really hard to climb.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

References

Divine Revelation
=================

Divine Revelation
 (
神のお告げ
,

Kami no Otsuge
)
 is the seventeenth chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Hitogami

Summary

Sulking in the unknown space, Rudeus in his old form is encouraged by Eris, Rosy and Sylphie to get up as he can overcome what has happened. Only for their voices to change into a singular individual, dubbed the Man-God, granting Rudeus one word of advise before Rudeus wakes up to find he is himself. Happy he was still in his new life, he suddenly finds himself being saved from a demonic wolf pack. Hoping to find Ghislaine, he is instead met by a Superd spearman, and panics trying to find a solution to surviving. Recalling being in the unknown space, depressed at believing his life as Rudeus was a dream, the Man-God arrived to tell him that it was real and that Rudeus was caught in a mana calamity that teleported him and Eris to the demon continent. When he wakes up, Man-God advices Rudeus do one task: rely on and save the man they meet. Rudeus finds his injuries bandaged and Eris safe, believing the Superd he meets is whom Man-God meant.

Appearances

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Roxy Migurdia

Sylphiette

Hitogami

Ruijerd Superdia

Others

.

Divine Attack Magic is magic that's effective against spirits or evil races. It is kept secret by the Divine Priest Fighters. The
magic university
 doesn't teach it, therefore
Roxy
 also didn't know anything about it and couldn't teach it to
Rudeus
.

Dochil
======

The son of a village chief in the western edge of the
King Dragon Realm
 bordering a dense forest, who eventually succeeds his father and becomes chief.

Appearance

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Personality

Hardworking but rather boring.

Background

Growing up, he used to be teased by
Pham Haindora
, enough to bring him to tears. He was part of a group of children in that village all around the same age, which also included
Angelique Curenttale
.

He has a wife and son.

Plot

After contracting Ibri Syndrome, which would likely kill him within 10 days, Angie and Pham set out to obtain the Eant Flower which can be used to create a curing tonic for the disease. Thanks to
Rudeus Greyrat
 they were able to succeed and create the tonic which saved his life. Eventually he also proposed to Angie and she became his second wife who bore him a child.

Power and Abilities

Equipment

Achievements

Quotes

Trivia

Doga
====

Doga
 is a North Emperor, one of
Ariel
's Seven Knights and husband of
Isolte Cruel
.

Appearance

Doga's face is simple, not crude. He has the appearance of someone naïve, who cannot deceive others.

He has a very tall yet broad figure, to the point that he was mistaken for an ogre.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Personality

Doga is a very calm person. According to Rudeus, he appears to be unable to read the atmosphere. He is a man of few words -- when he does talk, he speaks in a stuttered manner.

He isn't very bright, but is honest to a fault and very persistent when it comes to his goals. As such, he is deeply loyal to his position and loved ones.

Background

Doga was born in the Donati Province of the
Asura Kingdom
. He was a little slow and treated like a henchman by the other kids.  His father was a soldier, who spent most of his days outside, and his mother died after giving birth to their younger sister.

After his mother's death, Doga cried for several days. When he stopped crying, he began training with the goal of protecting his sister. His weapon is an ax that was near his house. One day, a magical beast attacked the village. Doga defended his house and although his arm ended up broken, he managed to kill the beast. From then on, Doga took it upon himself to work and protect the village.

With ten years, Doga began to work worked for a time as a soldier, looking for money to take care of his sister since his father had died during the metastasis incident. He was promoted after killing some thieves and was charged with defending the city gate. During Ariel's coronation, a mysterious man tried to enter the city. The mysterious man,
Kalman II
, defeated all the soldiers and decided to take Doga as a disciple.

Soon after, he was personally recruited by Ariel as one of the Seven Knights of Asura at the recommendation of Kalman II. Doga's post is guarding the King's Chamber where he is known as the King's Gatekeeper.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Plot

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Volume 23: Young Man Period - Decisive Battle Chapter

Sent by
Ariel
, he joined
Rudeus
 alongside Sandor (
Kalman II
) on his journey to the Beheiril Kingdom. They traveled without being stopped by monsters. When they reached the second city, they settled for a few days before continuing their journey. After leaving the city and entering the forest, they were attacked by invisible monsters. They defeat them without problems and meet a member of the
Superd Tribe
. Although Doga was afraid of the Superd, she worked to care for the sick. Days later, they all set out in search of help to heal the tribe.

Two people (
Gal Farion
 and
Kalman III
) were sent by the king to approve the existence of the Superd tribe. Doga was put to sleep with pills so that he cannot get up and arrives just as Rudeus, with his arms cut off, falls from the bridge. Doga jumped up and saved Rudeus. On his way back, Doga slays dragons with one blow. In the end, they found an ancient cave and were able to escape to return to the Superd tribe.

Later, Doga and
Zanoba
 face the
Ogre God
. Despite being a 2v1, they were unable to defeat him. They were brutally beaten and in the end, saved by
Atofe
. In the fight against Kalman III, Doga couldn't hold out even after being healed by Rudeus and withdrew.

After the fight, his relationship with the Superds improved. Doga stayed in the city while Rudeus and his group went to the city to speak with the king. When he heard of Sándor's defeat by Badigadi, he wept. He participated in the second match against
Badigadi
, but was defeated after
Cliff
. He is cured by
Sylphi
 and later, along with Zanoba, they led an unconscious
Cliff
 to the Superd tribe.

Redundancy: Story of The Seven Knights of Asura

Kalman II names Doga North King and also decides that Doga and Isolte were to have a match. Doga tirelessly swings his axe against Isolte but she effortlessly countered and Doga is eventually defeated. During their battle Doga admits the Isolte is worthy of protect the King's Door in his stead and at the same time, he realizes that Isolte is graceful and a lovely flower that Doga has fallen in love with.

Doga works as Ariel's bodyguard as one of the
Seven Knights of Asura
. When Doga inspects Isolte, he leaves her sword and doesn't touch her. At that moment, he caught the attention of Isolte, who is looking for someone to marry. After the hearing, Doga offers her cold water in a very attentive way. Doga has been in love with Isolte ever since he met her in a sparring match, when Doga was not yet even a North King.

At a dinner with her brother-in-law, Hans, Doga indirectly told him about his feelings for Isolte. Hans insisted that he should go and ask Isolte to marry her right now, but Doga disagreed as he thinks he's not up to the task. After a little discussion, Doga was convinced to confess his love.

Doga went personally to the Isolte dojo dressed in formal clothes and a bouquet of flowers. He pleaded but was rejected, even after telling his whole story, as Isolte had promised Ariel to marry someone royalty. Doga decides to retire as a knight and declares himself to Isolte again. This time, Isolte realizes how much Doga loves her and decides to accept his feelings.

Power and Abilities

North God Style

As a North Emperor, Doga is a very powerful person. He uses a large ax as a weapon instead of a sword, and is capable of defeating dragons and monsters in one hit. According to his teacher, his specialty is hunting monsters.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Equipment

He uses a giant Axe.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Dora
====

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

"Dragon God-sama had his own considerations. He always thinks about us, the Dragon Race. Even when he does something we don't understand, it's done for the future of our race, so I don't need an explanation."

Armored Dragon King Dora

Dora
 is from the Armored Dragon Tribe and a member of the Five Dragon Generals who oversees the training of dragons and Dragon Warriors. She is also the mate of
Crystal
 and the mother of
Perugius Dola
.

Appearance

Dora has exceptionally large wings and beautiful white scales.

Personality

Among the Five Dragon Generals, Dora is particularly loyal to the
First Dragon God
, that she takes as a great point of pride. During
Laplace
's training, Dora  would resort to provocations and physical harm which is long been an effective method for teaching hierarchy.

Despite possessing personal pride for the training methods she has refined for millenia, she is willing to put those aside as long as it benefits the First Dragon God.

Background

Show respect and submit to me. I don't tell lies. Be true and trust me with all your heart. No whimpering or saying I can't. It's a waste of time. If you don't give up, I will surely raise you into a fine dragon warrior

-Dora to Laplace

Dora immediately provokes Laplace to a fight upon meeting and after she tells
Lunaria
 that the First Dragon God's order to educate Laplace, Lunaria bids Laplace to learn well and leaves with the servants. For the next five years, Dora teaches Laplace how to speak, history, geography, status relationship, etiquette, industry and various other common knowledge of the Dragon Tribe. Dora then trains Laplace on classroom training and combat during the morning and leaves Laplace alone to learn to fly from afternoon to night.

After Laplace completes his Dragon Warrior training, he becomes Dora's subordinate and she assigns him to train a red dragon. One year later, Dora is surprised to find that Laplace is able to tame the dragon that he names
Saleyakt
 and upon hearing the method Laplace has used which is different Dora's method of beating them to submission, she assigns him to tame dragons that are deemed untrainable through out the Dragon World which eventually decreased the number individuals killed and the number of high quality dragons increased.

Dora and Crystal's spawning season happened to overlap and like the rest of the Dragon Race of breeding age, they were obligated to prioritize making the next generation where Dora already had some children that are all fully grown Dragon Warriors or Dragon Trainers but a child of 2 Dragon Generals are met with high expectations. So before that time, Dora names Laplace to be her substitute to supervise all dragon training grounds in the Dragon World during the spawning season which Laplace feels honored to be selected to carry out Dora's duty for around 30 years.

"For a long time, I had watched him develop... While he still lacks the strength to be worthy of the title Dragon General... we were once inadequate as well. Dragon God-sama's battle banner needs new blood if we're to grow our battle strength. Laplace. It's an honor. Work harder now, more than ever."

-Dora

When Crystal died, Dora was unable to attend the meeting with the First Dragon God and the rest of the Dragon Generals due to her pregnancy but Laplace, who was her substitute on the meeting informs her that he is assigned to look for Crystal's killer to which Dora asks her to bring the head of the criminal.

Laplace visits Dora after capturing Crystal's killer and apologizes for the delay of the report and that he did not bring his head but Dora doesn't mind then asks him to name hers and Crystal's child to which Laplace names him
Perugius
.

Dora attends the meeting at the Dragon God's mansion where Laplace and
Szilard
 give their reports, and confirm that the criminal Laplace has captured is
Necrolia Nacrolia
, and his reasons for killing Crystal. Although Dora looks calm, the rest of the Dragon Generals knows that Dora is enraged and they all urge the Dragon God to declare war on the Demon World but the Dragon God choose to negotiate with them. When the Dragon God bestows Laplace with the title Demon Dragon King and Crystal's successor as Dragon General, Dora is shocked but welcomes Laplace like the most of the Dragon Generals.

When the Dragon God's child is born, even the dragons that are ongoing training with Dora is treated well that lasted for decades and like the rest of the Dragon Generals, Dora is also impressed by the child and left with a solemn expression.

After Lunaria's death and funeral, Dora gives her list of suspects which is the same as the rest of the Dragon General and is also present when the
Human God
 reveals the plot of the other worlds against the Dragon God. Dora and the rest of the Dragon Generals accompanies the First Dragon God who goes to war against the Beast God, Sea God and  Sky God resulting to their deaths then the destruction of their respective worlds.

--To be added--

Dragon Kings Knight Order
=========================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

The
Dragon King's Knight Order
 is an order of
Knights
 under the command of
Pax Jr.

--To be added

Background

Plot

Members

Pax Jr.

Black Dragon Knight Commander Pax Shirone Jr. is the leader of the Dragon King's Knight Order

Sieghart Saladin Greyrat

Death God Knight Sieghart Saladin is the Deputy Commander of the Dragon King's Knight Order

Lauri Shirone

"Screaming Princess" Lauri Shirone is one of Pax Jr.'s granddaughter who has dark skin and blue hair around the age of 20. Despite her age she is also an arcknight and is educated by Pax Jr. and raised her as one of his commanders.

Jeda

"Loyal Hound Knight" Jeda is a male
North Saint
 half
Demon
 with dull blonde hair, thin eyes, sharp ears, with scales and a large x-shaped scar on his face. He was a
Slave
 who has talent for the sword and is purchased by Pax Jr.

Herpel

"Tribal Knight" Herpel is a man with dark skin, has black hair braided into several braids that is bundled behind his head and has a body better honed than anyone.

Atmos Roland

"Iron Knight" Atmos Roland is huge man with a gentle smile even broader than Herpel. But most of his width is due to his arms and two great mounds of black metal.

Pyi Ku

"Dwarf Knight" Pyi Ku is a female
Dwarf
 with a childlike body and wears a toylike armor. But his face is not that of a child and is considered to be the most intelligent of the knight order.

Others

Due to Pax Jr.'s tendency to favor those who are more capable than those of high status and willing to give people a chance to prove themselves, rumors circulate and people flocked from everywhere. The Dragon King's Knight Order assigned these people work according to their abilities that even the handling of
Slaves
 are more organized than anywhere else that they rarely died from sickness or injury and were given the ability to showcase their abilities. For those capable, the Dragon King's Knight Order for a hefty sum and be treated generously.

References

Dragon Tribe
============

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

The
Dragon Tribe
 is a race of humanoids with scales, known for their use of Dragon
Battle Aura
 (also known as
Touki
 or Fighting Spirit) that lives in the Dragon World and is ruled by the First Dragon God until the destruction of their world at the hands of Hitogami. They are known to be very strong and can fly by infusing their wings with Touki.

Appearance

The Dragon Tribe (or Dragon Race) has wings, golden eyes and scales covering their bodies. In addition, they had sharp claws and fangs which they used for combat.

Domain

Dragon World

The Dragon World is the home world of the Dragon Tribes which is an inverted world where the Mountains are located above while the sky is below. It is also the home of several species of dragon such as the Red Dragons, Blue Dragons and Gold Dragons which the Dragon Tribe hunt for food or train as mounts.

Kayos

Kayos is the capital city of the Dragon Tribe located at the hollowed center of Dragon Roar Mountain in the Dragon World. The Dragon Roar Mountain is the largest mountain and located at the center of the Dragon World that was once a nest of Red Dragons that the Dragon Tribe conquered and they built their city with the First Dragon God's mansion at its center. Aside from Kayos where most of the Dragon Tribes lives, there are 122 villages inhabited by various tribes where the tribe must have sufficient battle strength to exterminate dragons or any other threats.

Five Dragon Generals

The
First Dragon God
 was powerful, but he's not omnipotent. There are places out of his reach as well. That's why from the Dragon Race, he made the five most powerful individuals the Dragon Generals, and entrusted them with protecting the world.

Laplace

The Five Dragon Generals (also known as Five Dragon Kings) are the Dragon God's personal confidants and assists him in overseeing the protection of the Dragon World capital Kayos and its 122 towns each inhabited by various tribes of the Dragon Race.

Szilard

[Holy Dragon General]
Szilard
, also known as Shilard is one of the 5 Dragon Generals who fought against the first generation Dragon God.
  Szilard is the leader of the Five Dragon Generals and considered to be the second in command on the First Dragon God's behalf when he is away.
.  Szilard's crest is engraved on
Magic Tools
 seen in a hidden teleport ruins which
Rudeus
 believes to belong to him after reciting the incantation.

Dora

[Armored Dragon General]
Dora
 is the most loyal among the Dragon Generals to the First Dragon God and is in charge of training of Dragon Warriors and Dragons to defend the Dragon World which includes training
Laplace
. She is also the mate of
Crystal
 and the mother of
Perugius Dola
.

Chaos

[Mad Dragon General]
Chaos
 is one of the 5 Dragon Generals who fought against the first generation Dragon God.
 According to
Zanoba Shirone
, Chaos loves dolls and created an autonomous doll that has his crest drawn in a house which later becomes
Rudeus
' home in Sharia, Ranoa Kingdom. Peruguis mentions that Chaos has died and it is unknown if he left a successor.

Maxwell

[Dark Dragon General]
Maxwell
 is one of the 5 Dragon Generals who fought against the first generation Dragon God.
 Maxwell specializes in magical craftmanship and construction. An arc handmade by Maxwell is seen in Perugius' Sky Castle [Chaos Breaker] and some of his work is also seen in the White Palace,
Millishion
. According to
Sylvaril
, Maxwell wanders the world somewhere if he is still alive.

Crystal

[Steel Dragon General]
Crystal
 is the mate of Dora and the father of Perugius who specializes in Teleportation Magic. After his death, he is succeeded by Laplace
 and his teleportation research is continued by Dora
.

Abilities and Powers

Dragon Battle Aura

Developed by the First Dragon God which allows its user to multiply their physical abilities many-folds and harden their skin. Due to their Battle Aura, the Dragon Tribe was considered the most powerful sentient race of all six worlds because they where extremely strong and fast.

Teaching of Nail, Fangs and Wings





Orsted using Claw Technique and Fang Technique against Ruijerd



"Train your claws, fangs and wings to make your body strong."

Laplace

Fundamental fighting style of the Dragon Tribe that involves the usage of Dragon Battle Aura.

Wing Technique

Cover one's wings with Dragon Battle Aura for rapidly accelerating or deaccelerating to change one's position behind the enemy.

Fang Technique

Cover one's fists with Dragon Battle Aura to break through the enemy's defense and weaken them.

Claw Technique

Cover one's claws with Dragon Battle Aura to cut the enemy and cause a fatal injury.

Flight

Almost all dragon members of the Dragon Tribe could fly by infusing their wings with Touki to levitate off the ground and glide using their wings.

Long Lifespan

A regular Dragon Tribe member could live for tens of thousands of years on average and so time flowed differently for them.

Culture

Members of the Dragon Tribe hatched from eggs and they had a spawning season in which they could mate and lay those eggs. Due to their long lifespan, the people of the Dragon Tribe could have children only once every one thousand years. Dragon Tribe pregnancy took 50 year and it took another 50 years for the eggs to hatch.

The Dragon Tribe did not have the concept of "Family" young members of the Dragon Tribe were raised in specialized nurseries. However, the parents and children did share a special bond between each other.

Members of the Dragon Tribe who could not fly where branded as "Fallen" and would be looked down on and had to do the jobs no one else wanted to do.

Trivia

The number 6 is considered an unlucky number based from the number of Five Dragon Generals and the First Dragon God waging war on the five other worlds leading to its destruction.

It is said a monstrous black serpent lives beneath the sky and feeds on the carrion that falls from above.

References

Dragonfolk

Dragon Tribe

Drain Syndrome
==============

Drain Syndrome
is an ancient disease that affects those with too little mana capacity, which
Nanahoshi
 had due to the nature of her body.

Background

"Drain Syndrome eh? That name sure is nostalgic. People still getting sick from that, now that's shocking!"

-Kishirika Kishirisu

Drain Syndrome had existed in the
Human World
 ever since its early ages especially on children. Drain Syndrome was eventually eradicated around 7,000 years ago during the first
Human-Demon Wars
 at the reign of Demon Empress
Kishirika Kishirisu
. The war caused all kinds of advancements for
Humans
 such as increase in their mana capacity, which in turn made them immune to Drain Syndrome. As such, information and written records about the illness is very scarce during the present day, and some consider finding the disease's name to be a miracle in ancient libraries such as in
Perugius Dola
's Flying Fortress
.

Cause

Drain Syndrome is a disease that occurs when a human with little or no
Mana
 capacity externally accumulates mana over time, until their body begins to react negatively to it. It usually takes around 10 years to happen for children. In other words, it's a disease that results from having mana within body that is incapable of holding mana. Despite the Humans that are born in the Human World are already immune to it for the past 7000 years, Drain Syndrome still affects those that have drifted to the Human World like Nanahoshi.

When the patient's body is no longer able to handle the mana absorbed, they exhibit symptoms of frequent coughing that gets more severe over time, to the point of coughing blood, collapsing and losing consciousness. The affected patient would have a pale complexion and dark circles under their eyes while bedridden, and would eventually die unless treated
.

Treatment

"Don't be mistaken. As guests of my castle, I'll offer some minimum assistance. But don't expect everything. My ultimate purpose is to find and destroy Laplace."

-Perugius





Recovering Nanahoshi with Sokasu Tea



Drain Syndrome has no permanent cure and it does not work even with the use of Healing Magic or Detoxification Magic. Otherwise, Drain Syndrome's sickness can temporarily be cured by drinking tea made from Sokasu Grass, which removes the Mana that accumulated in their body through their waste.

The unique power of Perugius' familiars can also be used as a temporary treatment such as Yuruzu of Atonement's power of transfer the health and vitality from one person to the patient. Sukeakoto of Time's power to stop time can also be used but because the patient's time is stopped no further research on the cure can be done and ultimately Sokasu Tea is the best treatment.

References

Drama CD
========

Drama CD Booklet 『Mushoku Tensei ~Isekai Ittara Honki Dasu~ Metastatic Labyrinth』

This Drama CD is divided in 2 parts and take place in the events of
Volume 12
, and includes a booklet with a short novel.

Synopsis

Rudeus joins to his father Paul to explore a dangerous labyrinth to rescue his mother. Along the way, she helps Roxy, a woman who used to be his tutor. The exploration of the labyrinth progressed better than expected because she joined the party, but for Rudeus it was too big to overcome the thing that was waiting at the deepest part !? A battle against the Hydra that shocked many readers into a drama CD. At that time it becomes clear what my father was thinking!

Tracks

Part 1: Roxy Rescue

Min 00:00- Min 26:58

The story is told from the point of view of Rudeus. The party arrives to the third floor of the labyrinth searching for Roxy.

This part is a continuation of the
Chapter 3: Enter the Labyrinth
 and has the PoV of Rudeus of
Chapter 4: Her Feelings at that Time

Episode 1 "The Labyrinth of Transposition" (6:42 Minutes)

Episode 2 "Discomfort" (7:54 Minutes)

Episode 3 "Wall"  (12:21 Minutes)

Part 2: The decisive battle in the bottom layer

Min 26:58 - Min 56:26

The party enter to the red magic circle and find a Hydra and Zenith.

Episode 4 "Guardian of the Labyrinth" (7:19 Minutes)

Episode 5 "Hydra Countermeasures" (10:38 Minutes)

Episode 6 "Death Fight against the Hydra" (11:29 Minutes)

Dwarf
=====

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Talhand, a male Dwarf in the Anime
Julie a female Dwarf in the Anime
1/2

Dwarves
 (
炭鉱族
,
Dowaafu
, lit. "Coal Mine Tribe") are a race of people who currently live at the foot of the Blue Dragon Mountain Range in the
Millis Continent
.

Background

Due to the Dwarves being created during the
Age of Chaos
, they are sometimes classified as a
Demon Race
.
 When the
Human World
 change from a world of endless grass lands to a world that has the terrain features of the rest of the
Six-Faced World
 due to the war of the
First Dragon God
 with the rest of the world, the Dwarves chose to settle at the foot of the Blue Dragon Mountain Range in the Millis Continent like other
Races
 who settled in the terrain that is close to their previous world while the Humans and Demons are at a ceaseless conflict for dominance of the Human World.

Trait

Julie using Earth Magic in the Anime
Talhand using Earth Pillar in the Anime
1/2

Dwarves are shorter in height compared to Humans

Male Dwarves have a stout body constitution while female dwarves are similar to young female humans

Dwarves have a longer lifespan compared to humans where some of them have lived since the
Laplace War
 from 400 to 500 years ago

As a race of craftsmen and blacksmiths by birth, dwarves have naturally dexterous hands and high affinity towards earth and fire magic

Known Dwarves

Talhand

Juliette

Godbard

Balda

Pyi Ku

--To be added

Culture

Depending on the settlement, dwarves vary culture wise. Like in the Dwarf Village in the Millis Continent, dwarves would raise all children of the same generation together like a school, and they would treat each other as siblings.

Dwarves especially the adults, consider Water and Wind Magic worthless and refuses to acknowledge it due to tradition and formality which Talhand begins to practice and eventually becoming an outcast and leaving the Dwarf Village.

Dwarf Children don't get an official name until they are seven years old, and when they do, they receive a name that's fashioned after something they're good at, something they're attracted to, or something they like(eg. Balda the Hammer for his tendency to use his hammer to fix things or use it on his underling for making a mistake). Until then they are referred to as "child of (Father's name) and (Mother's Name).
.

Domain

References

Edward Anemoi Asura
===================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Edward Anemoi Asura
 is the son of
Ariel Anemoi Asura
 and a Prince of the Asura Kingdom.

Appearance

Edward is an unquestionably handsome guy from every angle. He has a well defined nose, with slightly drooping eyes and unique platinum blonde hair that one can never get tired of looking.

Personality

Edward is callous and has a cold personality in general. He is playfully teasing of people he's genuinely interested in, such as
Christina Greyrat
, and will go out of his way to help them despite some sarcasm. He cannot be bothered to care about people he is not interested in.
 He is a straightforward and honest person when it comes to his beloved, as he was upfront with Rudeus Greyrat when confronted about Edward's relationship with his daughter.

Plot

Redundancy

Edward is a friend of
Christina Greyrat
. After berating his ex-fiancee Viola Yellowsnake and disowning her, Edward takes on the position as the next valedictorian of the Asura Royal Academy graduation ceremony. However, he relegates the position to Christina who is more deserving of it. Edward plans to become a diplomat for the Royal Family in the Northern Lands, the direction of the Three Great Magical Nations.

Later, Edward tries to pester Christina to introduce him to her father,
Rudeus Greyrat
. After telling Rudeus what Christina told him about Rudeus' habits at home, Rudeus questions what is his relationship with Christina, to which he asks for his permission to date Christina with intent of marriage. Rudeus, finding no excuse to refuse, invites him to talk alone for a while, albeit somewhat reluctant. In the end, Edward receives Rudeus' permission to date Christina.
[1]

Achievements

De-factor valedictorian behind his Asura Royal Academy graduation ceremony

Diplomat for Asura Royal Family in the Northern Lands, in the direction of the Three Great Magical Nations

Quotes

"In the future, I will be involved in diplomacy. I cannot marry someone who calls a foreign dignitary a country bumpkin in public! I am breaking off our engagement!"

"Yes! However, Mother, there is someone more suitable to be our representative than I am. That person is someone who has saved many students and even turned former enemies into allies... a person who embodies the ideals of the Asura Royal Academy."

Rudeus:
"Okay, so what's your relationship with Chris like?"

Edward:
"I would like to have a relationship with Chris with the intention of getting married."

Trivia

It is implied that
Luke Greyrat
 may be Edward's biological father, as his physical description is similar to that of Luke's when he was introduced to Rudeus.

Edward dating and possibly marrying Christina Greyrat fulfills Rudeus' and Ariel's former agreement of a consensual arranged marriage between their families. Previously, Ariel tried to do this with Sariel and
Sieg Greyrat
, to no avail.
