Redirect to:
Human-Demon Wars

Greyrat Family
==============

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

The
Greyrat
 bloodline is a prominent old noble family of the
Asura Kingdom
 divided into 4 Noble Houses, Notos, Boreas, Euros, Zephyrus. who protect all the sides of the kingdom and has many branch families.

Background

The Greyrat Family can be traced back to the Asura Kingdom's royal family and it is known that the men of the Greyrat bloodline are particularly infamous for their sex drive and perversion;
Luke Notos Greyrat
,
Paul Greyrat
 and
Rudeus Greyrat
 all being notable examples of this. Various branches of the Greyrat line are known for having specific preferences in women. For example, the Notos branch has a fetish for large boobs, while the Boreas branch has a fetish for beast people.

The name Greyrat is not unusual to any degree in Asura Kingdom due to the family's fondness for women and  hearing a lower noble's daughter or maid conceiving a child in order to become a mistress is a common thing to hear. Thus, it is allowed for those mistresses to also call themselves Greyrat. To distinguish the upper nobilities, they decided that the names of the protectors of Asura will be called: Notos, Boreas, Euros and Zephyrus as the four main branches of Greyrat family.

For nobles who wish to establish themselves, they need to have blood relations with one of these four main branches of the Greyrat Family which is a common practice to be working towards that end. But despite the Greyrat being an ordinary name, the talk becomes different when its a talk about a genius.

"I'm not a Boreas anymore. Its just Eris Greyrat."

-
Eris
 to
Orsted

There are also instances where family members of the upper nobility would sever their ties to their family and would willing be called Greyrat like Paul who severed his ties to the Notos Family and became an
Adventurer
 and Eris who severed ties with the Boreas Family after learning the death of
Sauros Boreas Greyrat
 and decides to go to the
Holy Land of Swords
 since none of the remaining Boreas would adopt her.

Branches

Notos Family

Pilemon Notos Greyrat
Paul Greyrat
 (formerly Notos Greyrat)
Luke Notos Greyrat
Notos Family Emblem in the Manga
1/4

The Notos Family are the branch in charge of the Milbots Region under the lordship of
Pilemon Notos Greyrat
 and where Paul and Rudeus descended from. Famous as the land of alcohol and has a gigantic brewing site. Although beer is a regular commodity in the Asura Kingdom, most of the wine consumed in celebrations are produced in Milbots.

The Notos Family are aligned with
Ariel's faction
.

Members

Amarant Notos Greyrat

Valentina Boreas Greyrat

Paul Greyrat
 (estranged)

Pilemon Notos Greyrat

Luke Notos Greyrat

Boreas Family

The Boreas Greyrat Family in the Anime
The Boreas Greyrat Family in the Light Novel
Boreas Family Emblem in the Manga
1/3

The Boreas Family are the branch in charge of the
Fittoa Region
 that is ruled by
Sauros Boreas Greyrat
 and grandfather of Eris, later succeeded by James Boreas Greyrat. The Boreas are in charge of the
Fittoa Region
 that is famous as the land of perfume but after the Teleport Incident, almost the entire area vanished.

The Boreas Family are aligned with the
First Prince
 Faction where Sauros always criticizes Pilemon Notos Greyrat as he believes that Paul is a more suitable head of the Notos Family.

Members

Sauros Boreas Greyrat

Valentina Notos Greyrat
 (married out)

James Boreas Greyrat

Gordon Boreas Greyrat

Philip Boreas Greyrat

Hilda Boreas Greyrat

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Rudeus Greyrat
 (Taken in because he became Eris' teacher)

Euros Family

The Euros Family are in charge of the Donati Region.

They are aligned with the
Halfaus
 Fraction.

Zephyrus Family

The Zephyrus Family are in charge of the Wishiru Region.

Like the Euros, they are also aligned with the
Halfaus
 faction.

Neutral Greyrat Families

Paul Greyrat's Family

Background

After Paul left the Notos household he married Zenith Latreia and they moved together with their maid Lilia to
Buena Village
. There they had a son named Rudeus and he was so talented in
magic
 that they got him a teacher named
Roxy Migurdia
. Paul and Zenith had a daughter named
Norn
 and due to an affair Paul and Lilia had a daughter named
Aisha
 whereupon Paul took Lilia as his second wife.

Background

After he reunited with her at the
Ranoa Magic Academy
 Rudeus married his childhood friend
Sylphiette
. They bought a
House
 and Rudeus' father Paul sent his sisters Norn and Aisha to live with him and Sylphy. Rudeus went to the
Begarrit Continent
 to help his father save Zenith in a
Labyrinth
 where he also reunited with Roxy. Paul died but they were able to save Zenith and Rudeus took Lilia and Zenith to his home and took Roxy as his second wife. Shortly after Rudeus and the others returned, Sylphiette gave birth to a girl named
Lucy
.

Greyrat House
=============

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!





The Greyrat House at Sharia in the Anime



The
Greyrat House
 is the residence and dwelling of
Rudeus Greyrat
 and his family initially located at
Buena Village
,
Asura Kingdom
, and later at
Sharia
, Ranoa Kingdom.

Background

Buena Village


https://mushokutensei.fandom.com/wiki/File:MT-AN-S1-E01-WEBM-01.webm



Rudeus casting a spell that blows a hole at the Greyrat House, Buena Village in the Anime



After
Paul Greyrat
 and
Zenith Greyrat
 retires from being
Adventurers
, Paul asks
Philip Boreas Greyrat
 to give him a job so the Boreas Family arranges that he become a lower class
Knight
 who is assigned to defend Buena Village while Zenith becomes the healer of the village. They both lived in a two story wooden house where they hired
Lilia Greyrat
 to be their maid and eventually where
Rudeus Greyrat
,
Norn Greyrat
 and
Aisha Greyrat
 were born
.





Rudeus seeing the ruins of their house while recalling memories of his time there



In
K417
, the
Teleport Incident
 occurs causing the citizens of Buena Village to be teleported randomly through out the
Human World
. Three years later, Rudeus manages to return to Buena Village but all that is left are the ruins of their house and the village is abandoned. Rudeus then decides to head to the northern regions of the
Central Continent
 to search for his missing families.

Sharia






Rudeus, Cliff and Zanoba preparing to exorcise the "Haunted" House



Rudeus eventually receives news that
Zenith
 has been located and ceases his search and at the suggestion of
Elinalise Dragonroad
, he goes to
Ranoa Magic Academy
 to continue his studies where he eventually reunites with
Sylphiette
.
 With plans of marrying her, Rudeus decides to look for a house to settle down and finds a listing for one that is rumored to be haunted. Due to his reputation as "Rudeus the
Quagmire
" and also listing his guarantors to be
Ariel Anemoi Asura
 and
Badigadi
, he managed to lower the price of the house. Still interested in buying the house despite being haunted, Rudeus is assisted by
Zanoba Shirone
 and
Cliff Grimoire
 to exorcise the house which turns out that the ghost is an automated doll.

Layout






Sharia Greyrat House Layout



With the house "exorcised", Rudeus begins renovations and hires
Balda
 of the Great Cave for the repairs and to avoid further expenses, Rudeus also provided the materials for the repairs with his Earth Magic. From Balda's inspection he describes the floor to be oddly well made but the walls and ceiling are shoddy as if the basement is the most important part of the house and everything else is just extra.

Exterior

Exteriors before Renovations
Exteriors after Renovations
1/2

"I picked a color close to your original hair for the roof. You might not have liked your hair, but I really did."

-Rudeus to Sylphiette

The Greyrat House in Sharia is located at the Student District of the city, built over a century ago that has an untended garden; walls, ceiling had water damage; roof leaking during rains and walls shrouded in moss and shriveled vines making it look more like an abandoned ruin than a house. After the renovation, the walls and stones are polished and cleaned with the roof painted bright green.

Door

Zanoba knocking down the Front Door before renovation
Greyrat House new front door in the Anime
1/2

The Front Doors were knocked down by Zanoba when they exorcised the house so Rudeus replaced it with double doors made of expensive wood shaved down to fit the frame and the outside slab has a knocker in the form of a lion head. A
Magic Circle
 is also drawn at the edge of the door as a security measure that causes a loud noise if the door is forced open which echoes throughout the house.

Main Hall

Main Hall in the Anime
Main Hall viewed behind the front door
1/2

"I decided to buy only the bare essentials of furniture for now. Perhaps it was just the Japanese part of me talking, but I felt like I should save the rest for myself and Sylphie to decide on together."

-Rudeus

Beyond the front door is the main hall that has a stairs leading to the second floor and behind it is another stairs to the basement while the doors on each side leads to the living rooms. Despite the hall being in ruins, it has excellent natural lightings.
 After the renovation, the ceilings has been restored with bright wooden panels that eliminates the concern of water leaking when it rains.

Bathroom






Rudeus and Sylphy inspecting the Bathroom tub



Before the renovation, the bathroom is a second kitchen later converted to a bathroom since it was initially used for washing so most of the bathroom's plumbing are kept in tact since most of its interior structure does not appear to be used much but the floorings are replaced from stones to tiles and has a large tub is placed at the end of the room.  The bathroom in the house was made at the request of Rudeus that is normally seen in the house of nobilities
which also caused rumors about him that despite his carelessness for his clothing, he loved cleanliness and bathed almost everyday.

Living Room

Rudeus and Sylphiette at the Living Room
Rudeus and Sylphiette talking about the Fireplace
Rudeus and Ruijerd at the Greyrat House living room
1/3

The Greyrat House has 2 living rooms which is a large, warm family-oriented room. The room has a 3 seater sofa, 2 single seater sofa around the fireplace and a nearby jug and water that gives the feeling of a relaxing home.

Kitchen






Rudeus and Sylphy in the Kitchen



Before the renovation, the Greyrat House has 2 kitchens but only the first 1 has a kiln giving the impression that it was 2 houses merged into one. After the renovation, the kiln is refurbished and the kitchen also hosted an assortment of the newest cooking equipment, a counter large enough to butcher an entire boar and a cooking stove with a gigantic pot. There are also casks, jars and other sorts of containers for storage purposes.

Basement






Rudeus praying at the shrine at the basement



The Basement is initially where the automated doll stays when inactive at a hidden room. After Rudeus moves into the house, he turns the basement to be his private study while the hidden room becomes the shrine for her Goddesses and their relics.
Aisha
 eventually discovers the shrine and uses it to as a means to get what she wants such as getting Rudeus to agree in keeping
Beat
 as their pet.

Hitogami
 attempted to manipulate Rudeus in to releasing the mouse infected with
Magic Stone Disease
 but he was stopped by an
old man
 before he could enter the basement.

Bedrooms






Aisha's bedroom in the Manga



The second floor has 7 bedrooms that Aisha, Norn, Zenith, Lilith, Roxy and Eris occupies when they move to Sharia.

Master Bedroom

Sylphy seeing the Master Bedroom for the first time
Master Bedroom at night
1/2

The Master Bedroom, also known as the "Love Nest" the room of Rudeus which has a large bed that is big enough for 3 people, chair and desk.

--To be added

Aisha's Room

Study

Grimoire House
==============

The
Grimoire House
 is the most influential family of the
Milis Religion
 and part of the
Demon Race Acceptance Faction
. The head of the house is Pope
Harry Grimoire
 and the leader of the Milis Religion.

Members

Harry Grimoire

He is the Pope of the Milis Religion and
Cliff Grimoire
's grandfather.





Harry Grimoire



Cliff's parents (Harry's Son and his wife) were murdered in a power struggle, so Harry Grimoire took Cliff to an orphanage where he could stay hidden and safe. Later, when the situation improved, he brought took Cliff back in.

After the attempted assassination on the
Miko of Memory
 had failed, the conflict between the relgion's faction intensifies. So Harry sends Cliff to
Ranoa Magic Academy
 for refuge from the conflict.

Cliff Grimoire

He is the grandson of the Milis Pope,
Elinalise
's husband and
Clive Grimoire
's father.





Cliff Grimoire



He becomes
Rudeus
' classmate at the Ranoa Magic Academy, where he also met and fell in love with Elinalise.

he becomes Rudeus' classmate at the Ranoa Magic Academy, where he also met and fell in love with Elinalise, who he later married and had a son with.

Elinalise Dragonroad

She is the wife of Cliff Grimoire and mother of Clive Grimoire.






Elinalise Dragonroad
 (Wife of
Cliff
)



Elinalise is cursed with an affliction that forces her to regularly have sexual intercourse.

she and Rudeus Greyrat later joined the Ranoa Magic Academy, where she fell in love with Cliff after he found a remedy for her curse. They get married and have a son named Clive Grimoire.

Clive Grimoire

Son of Cliff Grimoire and Elinalise, husband of
Lucy Greyrat
 and father of
Roland Grimoire
.

He grew up next to Lucy Greyrat and as they grew up they fell in love, married, moved to the
Holy Country of Millis
 and had a son named Roland Grimoire.

Lucy Greyrat

She is the daughter of Rudeus and
Sylphiette Greyrat
, descendant of Elinalise Dragonroad, wife of Clive Grimoire and mother of Roland Grimoire.






Lucy Greyrat
 (Wife of
Clive
)



She and Clive live happily with Roland in the Holy Country of Millis.

Roland Grimoire

He is the son Lucy Greyrat and Clive Grimoire.

After his parents married and moved to the Holy Country of Millis they had him and are living happily together.

Related Families

Greyrat Family

Closely related

After Lucy Greyrat and Clive Grimoire married, the two had a son named Roland.

Latreia House

Close ancestors

The Latreia House is the family from which
Zenith Greyrat
, ancestor of Roland Grimoire, comes.

Asura Royal Family

Distant ancestors

The
Greyrat Family
 descends from the
Asura Royal family
, which means that the newest generation of Grimoires does the same.

Guardian Fitz
=============

Guardian Fitz
 (守護術師フィッツ、
Shugo-jutsu-shi fittsu
) is the debut episode of the
second season

Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on July 02, 2023. Although it is technically the first episode, it is referred to as "Episode 0" on the official Twitter announcement.

Synopsis

Ariel, the second princess, was attacked by a
Terminate Boar
 that suddenly appeared in the royal garden of
Asura Kingdom
. While her bodyguards fall at the hands of the monster, the one who appears is...?

Many months later, in the Silver Palace, where the power struggle for the succession to the throne was in full swing, there was a figure known as "Silent Fitz".

Plot

In the wake of the
Teleport Incident
, Sylphie finds herself transported to the skies above the Asura Kingdom, where she inadvertently kills a Terminate Boar threatening the life of Asura's second princess, Ariel and has already mortally wounded her Magic Guardian Derrick. In the process, Sylphie's hair turns from green to white due to expending her
Mana
. Witnessing Sylphie's abilities, Ariel coerces her to become one of her bodyguards under the alias of "Fitz" under the threat of charging her with trespassing. Meanwhile, Ariel is in a secret dispute with her brother Grabel over succession to Asura's throne, her most loyal supporters being her other bodyguard Luke and his father Lord Pilemon Notos Greyrat. Later, Ariel learns that Sylphie suffers from nightmares about the Teleport Incident, and Ariel confides that she has nightmares about her own near death experience as well. The two decide to sleep together for the night, then later that night Sylphie fights off and manages to defeat Nights Eye Crow sent by Grabel and Darius to assassinate Ariel. Lord Pilemon suggests that Ariel study abroad for the time being for her own safety. Accepting the idea, Ariel releases Sylphie from her service, but Sylphie decides to continue following Ariel since she considers her a friend and they depart together.

Characters

Fitz

Ariel Anemoi Asura

Luke Notos Greyrat

Derrick Redbat

Pilemon Notos Greyrat

Darius Silva Ganius

Grabell Zafin Asura

Nights Eye Crow

Locations

Central Continent

Asura Kingdom

Ars

Silver Palace

Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 3

Extra Chapter: The Princess of Asura and the Angel

Light Novel Volume 4

Extra Chapter: Guardian Fitz

Differences with the Light Novel:

The anime is more inspired in the manga version of the events (excluding the temporal amnesia that happens only in the manga).

In the LN, the identity of Fitz is left ambiguous.

Trailer

『無職転生Ⅱ ～異世界行ったら本気だす～』次回予告① 7-2(日)放送第0話予告／ナレーション：フィッツ(CV.茅野愛衣)
Episode 0 Trailer

Gallery

View Gallery

Click here to view the Gallery

Trivia

The international version distributed by Crunchyroll and Muse Asia censored some scenes that happened in the conversation between Grabell and Darius (Min 14:40 to Min 16:00 approx).

Even though Fitz is only a nickname for Sylphie, Ai Kayano is credited in the ending 2 times for both names.

Gustav
======

Redirect to:
Gustav Dedoldia

Gustav Dedoldia
===============

Gustav Dedoldia
 is an old warrior and the Doldia Village leader. When he meets
Rudeus
, because he was seriously injured in a battle,
Gyes
 became the next Chief.

Appearance

Gustav is an old man with dark skin and white fur. He has white hair and brown eyes, and his tan is similar to that of his son and daughter. He also has beast ears and a tiger tail. His fur is very thick. His tail is the same color as his hair, and he usually wears common tribal clothing.

Personality

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Background

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Plot

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Power and Abilities

Superior agility, physical strength, and the characteristics special to his race.

Voice Magic

A unique
magic
 of the Doldia race that can manipulate the sound of his voice.

It can be used to find enemies with a far-reaching howl or to stun them.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Equipment

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Quotes

Gyes Dedoldia
=============

Gyes Dedoldia
 is
Linia Dedoldia
 and
Minitona Dedoldia
's father and
Ghislaine Dedoldia
's brother. He is the warrior chief of the Dedoldia tribe.

Appearance

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Personality

During his debut, Gyes was uptight and impulsive, having the tendency to jump into conclusion in the heat of moments. However, he was willing to admit his faults and make up for it.

Years later, he becomes more lenient and flexible, similar to his father.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Plot

.

Power and Abilities

Gyes using Voice Magic to paralyze Rudeus

Can be used to fight enemies with a far-reaching howl or to stun them.

.

Harry Grimoire
==============

Harry Grimoire is the Pope and adoptive grandfather of
Cliff Grimoire
.

This article
lacks information
 and requires expansion. Please
expand this page
 to include missing information to help improve the article.

Healing Magic
=============

Healing Magic is one of the four systems of
Healing Magic
.

 It is magic used to heal. It is divided into seven ranks: Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced, Saintly, Kingly, Imperial, and Divine.

Rudeus healing Eris with X-Healing
Beginner Healing Magic
1/2

Beginner

Healing (chant): "Let this divine power be as satisfying nourishment, giving one who has lost their strength the strength to rise again!"

Capable of healing external wounds that can be healed naturally
, while also able to reattach broken plants
.

Intermediate

X-Healing (chant): "Oh merciful mother of gods, please heal this one’s wounds, and let him recover with a healthy body!"

Capable of healing potentially fatal wounds like severe burns and major injuries, but unable to reattach severed limbs
.

Advanced

Shine-Healing (chant): "Angel of miracles, bestow thy holy breath unto the pulsing heart before thee. O heavens blessed with sunlight, servants who despise crimson, swoop down into the ocean of light, the pure white of thy wings spread wide. Drive away the blood thou seest before thee!"

Can heal major open wounds and reattach freshly severed limbs, but cannot restore lost body parts
.

Saintly

Capable of healing most bodily injuries and restoring lost limbs as long as bones of said limbs are available
.

Kingly

Capable of regenerating lost limbs regardless of the duration of loss
.

Imperial

Divine

Capable of resurrecting freshly deceased individuals
.

Heaven Continent
================

Redirect to:
Divine Continent

Heaven Race
===========

Winged Angel like Humanoids, they live in the Heaven Continent.

Abilities

They can fly and control the weather.

Known Heaven race

Sylvaril

Henry
=====

Redirect to:
Henry Macedonia

Henry Macedonia
===============

Name: Henry Macedonia

Grandmother: Lucy Greyrat

Cursed child

Henry Macedonius
================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Henry Macedonius
 is the grandson of
Lucy Greyrat
 and the partner of
Luicelia Superdia
 who currently works under as an agent of the Ogre God Empire.

Personality

Henry is described as a man whose presence was so faint it was almost imperceptible, this is thanks to his curse making him impersetible to others that makes him a perfect spy. Despite this, Henry is still a kind and sociable person, and a capable warrior making him a good partner to Lucelia.

Background

Henry is born with a curse that makes him invisible to other people, causing no one to recognize him and no one to remember him, including his own father who struggled to recognize him, and his own grandmother
Lucy Greyrat
, who couldn't even remember that Henry was her grandson. The only exception was the Superd tribe who, thanks to their third eye, can recognize Henry. Henry becomes an ally of the ogre kingdom with Lucelia Superdia, becoming Lucelia's partner.

Plot

Lucelia is tasked with hunting down a spy from the kingdom of Asura, after killing the spy in one of Rudeus' laboratories, Henry finds a copy of volume 29 of Rudeus' diary and takes it to
Ars Greyrat
, who now, an old man, begins to tell them the story of his youth and his life with
Aisha Greyrat
.

Powers and Abilities

Curses

Henry has a curse that makes him unnoticeable similar to the effects of
Prosopagnosia
 or "face blindness" which makes Henrys face unrecognizable nor remembered by anyone with the exception of his own mother and the
Superd Tribe
.

References

Hero
====

Redirect to:
Category:Hero

Hilda Boreas Greyrat
====================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Hilda Boreas Greyrat
 (
ヒルダ
・
ボレアス
・
グレイラット
)
 is the mother of
Eris Boreas Greyrat
 and the wife of
Philip Boreas Greyrat
. She is a member of the Boreas household.

Appearance

Hilda Boreas Greyrat is a tall, elegant woman with a regal and imposing presence. She has long, dark red hair that falls straight down her back, like her daughter, often emphasizing her stern and serious demeanor. Her sharp, almond-shaped eyes, paired with her high cheekbones and furrowed brows, give her an intense, unyielding look.

She wears a formal, aristocratic gown in deep red, with off-the-shoulder sleeves and a fitted bodice that highlights her slender yet very curvy figure, with a low-hanging collar, which expose a generous part of her cleavage. The dress has black accents running down its length, adding to her noble and dignified appearance. Around her neck, she dons a large green gemstone pendant that adds a touch of refinement and wealth to her look, with short white earrings.

Personality

At first, Hilda is very cold towards
Rudeus Greyrat
, due to the fact her two sons were taken away from her and would always stare at him angrily. But as years pass, she eventually warms up to him, acting very motherly and proud of him and even calling him her son and offering him her daughter to marry.

Background

Hilda is a daughter of an ordinary noble who has ties with Philip and they eventually married. When Philip lost to his brother
James Boreas Greyrat
 on the battle becoming head of the Boreas family, and as per Boreas tradition, their first born son is taken away by James which greatly affects Hilda until Eris was born. But Hilda became unstable again after their second son who is 2 years younger than Eris is also taken away.

Plot

Hilda is introduced to Rudeus where she scoffs at his greeting and they barely interact with each and when they do, she would angrily stare at him making Rudeus wonder if he has done something to offend her.






Hilda hugging Rudeus in the Anime



During the party for Rudeus' 10th birthday, Hilda's attitude towards Rudeus has greatly changed and seeing the budding relationship between Rudeus and Eris, she proposes that Rudeus marry Eris, much to Eris' surprise. At the middle of the party, Hilda drank quite a lot and become drunk but her face is full of smiles and laughing boisterously. Before retired for the night, she gave Rudeus and a goodnight kiss and walked back to her room. Later at the night, Rudeus believes that Hilda sent Eris to his room in a nightgown.

In the
Teleport Incident
, she and her husband were teleported into a dangerous location where they were found dead once
Ghislaine Dedoldia
 reached and found them.

--To be added--

Legacy

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Trivia

The name
Hilda
 means "fortress" (ヒルダ) (hiruda).

Hilda's surname
Boreas
 could mean the Greek god of north wind.

Gallery

Hilda accepts Rudeus in the manga.

References

Hilda Greyrat
=============

Redirect to:
Hilda Boreas Greyrat

Hitogami
========

Information

Chronology

Hitogami
 (
ヒトガミ
,

Hitogami
)
 is the self-proclaimed
Human God
 (
人神

,

Hito-shin

, lit. "Man-God")
 and the sworn enemy of Dragon God
Orsted
.

Spoilers ahead!

Initially a supporting character, aiding
Rudeus
 by offering helpful advice, he later becomes the overarching antagonist of the series following the revelation that he actually sought to prevent the birth of
Rudeus' children
, who are prophesied to kill him one day.
He is the physically oldest being in Mushoku Tensei Verse.

Appearance

He has a blank white face coupled with a grin that eludes memory, which gives off the feeling that his face is covered in a mosaic.

Personality

Hitogami appears friendly and casual when communicating with his apostles, but he is actually a manipulative trickster who pulls strings behind the scenes. He seems to derive a sick sense of enjoyment from tricking people into destroying what they value the most, and laughing at their despaired faces afterwards. He is also a sore loser that throws tantrums when things aren't going his way.

Background

Hitogami's exact origins is unknown. It is known that after the
Creator God
's death, unbeknownst to anyone, he was born within the
Void World
. At some point in the distant past, the being who would come to be known as Hitogami killed or otherwise usurped the
original Human God
 and took his form. He then began manipulating the
First Dragon God
 and his five Dragon Generals into destroying the other four worlds and then proceeded to help the survivors of those ruined worlds to flee into the
Human World
. When the five Dragon Generals turned on the Dragon God and weakened him, Hitogami took that opportunity to strike a fatal blow to the Dragon God and then destroy the Dragon World. However before Hitogami's victory was complete, the dying Dragon God used the last of his power to trap Hitogami within the Void World.

He is the sworn enemy of
Orsted
 as he was the one that caused the fall of the First Dragon God, Orsted's father. Despite not being able to physically manifest in the Human World, he was still pulling the strings from behind the scene by appearing in people's dreams, manipulating them as his "apostles". During the
Second Great Human-Demon War
, he convinced
Badigadi
 to steal the Golden Armor from Demon Dragon God
Laplace
 and fight him head on, resulting in the huge explosion that formed the
Ringus Sea
 and Laplace being split into two beings. He is currently still sealed in the
Void between the worlds
, presenting himself as the god associated with humans.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Power and Abilities

Not much is currently known about Hitogami's Powers.

He is automatically trusted by all inhabitants of the
Six-Faced World
, except members of the
Dragon Tribe
 as well as otherworlders and their descendants.

He has the ability to talk to people in their dreams.

When he speaks with people in their dreams, he's able to read their minds.

His powers won't work on non-human opponents, like spirits.

Being the physically oldest in the world coupled with the power of all seeing eyes, he has very high knowledge of magic and history surpassing that of even Orsted.

According to the First Dragon God, he has Divine powers being able to destroy the Dragon World with a single strike. He is without a doubt one of the strongest characters in the series with his powers possibly being second only to Orsted.

『Divine Powers』

While Hitogami Full Powers are still unknown, he is powerful enough to destroy the Dragon World with a single attack. The first Dragon God implied that he is so powerful that only another god can kill him.

『Future Sight』

He has the ability to see the future, probably the strongest one there is as he can see nearly 100 years into the future (when looking at his own future only), but according to
Orsted
 the more apostles he controls the more his future sight becomes vague, and because of this ability he can also adjust the future to a certain extent. He can likely control only three apostles at the same time because he is always using much of his own future sight to look at his own future constantly and trying to control it in a way that would benefit him.

『All-Seeing Eyes』

Like Kishirika's All-Seeing Eyes, he can see anywhere in the world except places with high mana concentration.

Achievements

Successfully tricked the previous dragon god into destroying the other races' worlds, forcing them to migrate to the human world and effectively creating the setting of Mushoku Tensei.

Drove
Pax Shirone
 into suicide via his apostles and prevented the formation of the Republic of Shirone, thus foiling Orsted's plan to pinpoint and kill Laplace when he is newly born
.

Alternate Timeline

Indirectly killing
Roxy
 during pregnancy and effectively preventing the birth of
Lara
, whom is prophesied to play a key role in his death.

Taking over
Asura Kingdom
 through his apostles.

Quotes

To Rudeus:
 “Ah, you see, last time my advice didn’t turn out so well for you, did it? So it was a bit hard for me to show myself again.”

Trivia

In the Seven seas version of the light novel, Hitogami is called Man-God, meanwhile in the seven seas version of the manga he is called Hitogami.

He is the only character of the anime adaptation that is animated with CGI.

It was speculated by Laplace that the source of Hitogami Divine Powers is the Corpse of the Creator God.

By his own admission, the world will end if he dies.

References

Hitogami/Chronology
===================

Information

Chronology

Mushoku Tensei

He first appears after the Mana Calamity which teleported Rudeus and Eris to the Demon Continent. He advises Rudeus to trust and help Ruijerd. Rudeus immediately finds him suspicious. However over time he starts to trust him after all of the beneficial advice Hitogami has given him. However it seems that the Human God is constantly working against Rudeus, and Rudeus just has strange luck that everything works out for him. However when the future Rudeus comes back to the current time it is revealed that the Human God will cause the death of everyone Rudeus cares about. This is because the Human God sees a future where Orsted teams up with Rudeus's descendants to kill the Human God. To counter this future he tells Rudeus that he will not be left alone unless he kills Orsted. However after Rudeus and Orsted fight Rudeus joins the fight against the Human God as long as Orsted promises to defend his family. Although Hitogami cannot speak to Rudeus anymore, he still has many apostles. During the events of the Asura Kingdom Chapter, Hitogami manipulated Darius, Reida, and Luke. Hitogami manipulated Geese the entire time and had him take Zenith out of Cliff's house and deliver her to the Latreia House.

Mushoku Tensei Sequel

Hitogami's fate is one of the major story threads that remained unresolved by the end of Mushoku Tensei. However, Rudeus did see a vision where his and
Roxy's
 daughter,
Lara
, helped
Orsted
 and an unknown individual, presumably
Shinohara Akito
, reach his realm to finally kill him. This implies that Hitogami will once again be a major antagonist in the planned sequel series.

Holy Beast

Leo

Holy Land of Swords
===================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!





Holy Land of Swords in the Manga



The
Holy Land of Swords
 also known as the
Sword Sanctum
 or
Sword Sanctuary
 is the town where the headquarters of the
Sword God Style
 is located.

Geography

The Holy Land of Swords is a harsh land covered in snow all year round located at the northwest region of the
Central Continent
. Travelling from the Holy Land of Swords to
Sharia
 takes around 1 to 2 months on a horse.

Background





The first Sword God teaching in the Holy Land of Swords



The first Sword God in his final years built a school here to teach his disciples the sword, and it became the destination for all aspiring swordsmen to be trained by the Sword God himself
. In K323, a
Water God
 of a certain generation had dueled the Sword God and took the land from him, but that same Water God was defeated by another Sword God and the Holy Land was returned to the Sword God Style. Since then, the Holy Land of Swords became the place where the strongest swordsman among the 3 Great Sword Styles of the generation stays to teach the sword.

The Water God
Reida Reia
, who has maintained her strength in her old age also crossed swords with the Sword God
Gal Farion
, but Gal's sword is unblockable for her. Afterwards they were still more or less on good terms that Reia accepts Gal's invitation to teach one of his students who piqued Reia's interest years after.

Plot






Eris in the Holy Land of Swords in the Anime



On Ghislaine's monologue, she considers bringing Rudeus and Eris to the Holy Land of Swords should they decide to improve their swordsmanship.

At Eris' request, Ghislaine brings her to the Holy Land of Swords where Gal Farion promotes her to
Sword Saint
 after defeating Jino and Nina.

Notable Areas

Like any other towns, the Holy Land of Swords has an inn, a weapon shop, and even an
Adventure Guild
. There are also adventurers and merchants seen throughout the streets. The most outlying feature of the town is that all townsfolk are swordsmen of the Sword God Style, that even the town girls having slim arms are more skilled than most adventurers.

Sword God Style Dojo






Sword God Style Dojo in the Manga



The Sword God Style's headquarters is a large dojo encircled by a wall sitting at the top of the hill, making it the centerpiece of the Holy Land of Swords seen even from afar. Despite the numerous dojos located all over the Holy Land of Swords, The Sword God Style Dojo is the most prominent among them as this is the headquarters of the Sword God Style and Gal Farion's residence.

Space of the Present






Space of the Present in the Manga



The Space of the Present is the Main Hall Room of the dojo where the Sword God is usually found along with the 2 Sword Emperors. The students of the Sword God Style would also practice under their watch
.

In the Holy Land of Swords, anyone below Sword Saint are not allowed to enter the Sword God Style Main Dojo. While anyone below Advanced rank including children are placed in dojos near their homes for training. This method of placing has no exceptions even for
Nina Farion
 and
Jino Britts
 who are relatives of the Sword God.
 Otherwise it is the duty of the Sword Saints to kick out anyone who intrudes in the dojo.

Trivia

Most of the people in the Holy Land of Swords are so illiterate that they dismissed
Ghislaine Dedoldia
's writing are just scribbles

References

Human
=====

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!





A Human Race family from the Human World in the Anime



Humans
 (人族,
Jinzoku
) are the main race that lives in the Human World, ruled by the Human God.

Appearance

The Humans of the Human World have similar appearances to the humans on earth with the exception that Humans on the Human World having black hair is quite uncommon.

Background

Six-Faced World
 Era

Humans are the main race that dwells in the
Human World
 during the
Six-Faced World
 Era 10, 000 to 20, 000 years ago and is ruled by the
Human God
. Under the Human God's guidance, the humans were able to thrive faster and advance their civilization greatly ahead of the other five worlds from words and letters to communal living and forming a social order.
The Human God wishes to share this to all the other gods to help advance their respective civilization and the summit of the
Gods
 is formed with aims for the prosperity of all civilizations of the Six Worlds.

In exchange for the Human's knowledge, the other races also passed on their own knowledge and strength to the human race such as: The
Dragon Tribe
 teaches how to use the inner power of the body known as
Battle Aura
; The Demon Race teaches how to empower and transform their body so as to withstand the Battle Aura; The
Beast Race
 teaches how to tame ferocious beasts; The Ocean Race teaches how to purify water and keep it clean; And the Heaven Race teaches how to read the wind and control the weather.

Age of Chaos

The Age of Chaos Era is the period from
8,000 - 10, 000 years ago
 in the aftermath of the other five worlds being destroyed at the hands of the
First Dragon God
 and the surviving denizens fled to the Human World. The Human World was once an endless grasslands and hills now it has terrain features of the other worlds before they were destroyed. Most of the surviving race settled in continents that matches their previous world but the Humans and Demons are at ceaseless conflict on where to settle since at this time, the
Central Continent
 and
Demon Continent
 is a single massive continent called the Grand Continent.

First Human-Demon War

Around
7,000 years ago
,
Magic
 and martial skills has greatly advanced, as well as the population of the humans increased.
 However the
Mana
 also caused the younger humans to be afflicted with a disease called
Drain Syndrome
 but the disease was eventually eradicated as the human body adapt and increased their magic power.

It is also during this time that the conflict between the humans and demons escalated into a Great War called the First Human-Demon War led by Demon Empress
Kishirika Kishirisu
 and her 5 Great Demon Kings which lasted a thousand years with an interval of fierce battle and lulls between. Around 6,000 years ago, the Humans is lead by the Hero
Ars
 and together with his 6 comrades, they lead the fight until Kishirika and her Demon Kings are defeated. For his victory, the capital city of
Asura Kingdom
 is named after Ars which becomes the largest city in the Human World.

Second Human-Demon War

Around
5,500 years ago
, the Humans being victorious on the previous war that resulted to the demons being enslaved, they grew drunk with power and begin warring other races and among themselves that lasted for next 500 years. 5,000 years ago, Kishirika revives and once again rallies the demons to another war for vengeance for a thousand year grudge. The demon army established an alliance with the
Beast Race
 and
Ocean Race
 against the humans who were backed into a corner but they refused to surrender and continue to fight for the next 800 years.

Around
4200 years ago
, the Golden Knight
Aldebaran
 routes over 10,000 enemies by himself and the humans were able to push the demons back. Aldebaran also defeats all the powerful demons which also makes him a legend and an entry in history believes that he is the
Human God
 himself. But in the battle of Aldebaran against the
Fighting God
, Aldebaran's final attack causes the Grand Continent to implode, splitting it to several continents. With the continents now split and separated by
Ringus Sea
, the Second Human-Demon War ends where most of the humans settled in the
Central Continent
 or the southern region of the
Millis Continent
.

Traits

During the Six-Faced World era, the Human race is a weak race with the shortest lifespan which also forced them to learn quickly. However due to the Human World being rich in nature and abundant food, the Human race thrived faster than any other race, that causes their civilization to advance.

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Culture

In the
Asura Kingdom
, the Humans there only celebrate their birthday every 5 years where they are given gifts or celebrate parties especially by the nobility and by reaching 15 years old you are considered an adult.

Marriage is used as a recognition of a strong connection between families with the general notion that the head of the family decides on the marriage of their family members

In the Shirone Kingdom, the husband sends a gift to the bride's family over time while in the Milis Kingdom, where the family of the bride gives the husband a present while husband helps out when something is going on in the bride's home.

Humans with last names is usually seen among the nobilities as proof they are part of this family but those left their families also relinquish a portion of their last name as proof like
Eris Boreas Greyrat
 and
Paul Greyrat
 relinquishing their Boreas and Notos names respectively.

References

Human-Demon Wars
================

The
Human-Demon Wars
 (人魔大戦
Jinma Taisen
) were three wars fought between the
Demon Race
 and the
Human Race
. The first two wars were waged by Great Demon Empress
Kishirika Kishirisu
, known as the
Great Human-Demon War
, to reign superiority over the Human Race. But the third war was waged by Demon God
Laplace
 in his own name, referred to as the
Laplace War
, as an outcome of his hatred of the Human Race.

First Great Human-Demon War

The
First Great Human-Demon War
 (第一次人魔大戦
Daiichiji Hito-Ma Taisen
) is the first great war between the Human Race and the Demon Race which was fought between
6000 - 7000 years
 prior to the main story. Kishirika Kishirisu, the Great Demon Empress, and the Five Great Demon Kings led the Demons against the Humans. This war was fought before the splitting of the
Central Continent
 and the
Demon Continent
, when the Humans and the Demons still lived in one landmass known as the
Great Continent
. The war lasted for approximately a millennium, repeating constantly between a state of fierce battle and relaxation. Finally the hero of humanity Ars and his six comrades ended the long war following the defeat the Five Great Demon Kings and the Demon Empress Kishirika.

Second Great Human-Demon War

The
Second Great Human-Demon War
 (第二次人魔大戦
Daiiniji Hito-Ma Taisen
) is the second great war between the Human Race and the Demon Race which was fought between
5000 - 4200 years
 prior to the main story. The Great Demon Empress Kishirika Kishirisu, seeking vengeance for a thousand-year old grudge, brought the
Beast Race
 and
Ocean Race
 to the Demon side and waged war for the second time against the Human Race. This time the Human Race was pushed back and cornered but the war still went on for several centuries without surrendering.

At the time of distress of the Humans, the Demon Dragon King
Laplace
 joined the war to annihilate the Demon Army singlehandedly which allowed the Human Army to retake their frontlines. Laplace was eventually defeated by the
Fighting God
 who was an Apostle of
Hitogami
. On the verge of death, Laplace performed the reincarnation
Magic
 of the
Dragon Race
 but the spell went out of control and the released force of
Mana
 was so strong that it split the Great Continent into two - now known as the Central Continent and the Demon Continent - forming a new sea in the middle now referred to as the
Ringus Sea
. This event marked the end of the Second Great Human-Demon War which lasted for 800 years.

Laplace War

The
Laplace War
 (ラプラス戦役
Rapurasu Sen'eki
) was a war that lasted between
500 - 400 years
 prior to the main story. Though it lasted much shorter than the previous wars, the humans were forced into a war far more brutal than any they had fought before. The one who united all the Demons of the Demon Continent and launched this assault against the Humans was the
Demon God Laplace
 - a human-hating Demon who was split from the failed reincarnation attempt of Demon Dragon King Laplace in the previous war.

Demon God Laplace spawned approximately a thousand years ago. In a extremely short period of time, he rallied the Demons and conquered the Demon Continent. For many years he cultivated his empire, building his race to be tough and fierce. After long years, he pulled the Beast Race and the Ocean Race over to his side.

Laplace began his military campaign approximately 500 years ago. The invasion began from the south, drawing all the humans' military power there. Then he set his wyrms upon the land, making passage through the mountains impossible. After that he took the humans by storm, attacking with a separate unit from the north, scattering his enemies. In a short time, he had gained total control of the north and the south. Then from both directions, he pressed his assault on the western region.

Forced into a corner, the humans took their last gamble. The
Seven Heroes
 convinced the Ocean Race to lift their blockade, then set out on the seas for the Millis Continent. Now allied with the demons, the Beast Race had taken control of the Holy City of Millis. So the Seven Heroes took the clan leaders' children hostage and threatened them into cooperation. The Seven Heroes, leading the
Holy Knights of Millis
 and the Beast Race, launched a decisive battle and assaulted Laplace's main stronghold.

After a violent confrontation, four of the Seven Heroes were dead, but they successfully sealed Laplace away and destroyed his closest companions. Though Laplace was defeated, the humans were greatly exhausted from the long battle and couldn't keep up to fight anymore. Instead, they signed a treaty with one of the Demon Kings who wasn't allied with Laplace and the blockade on the Demon Continent was lifted. According to the terms of the treaty, racial discrimination was prohibited and demons could now freely travel to other continents.

Trivia

Demon Dragon King Laplace joined the human side of the Second Great Human-Demon War under the false name of
Aldebaran
 who was nicknamed the Golden Knight.

Demon Dragon King Laplace, who was a Demon-Dragon hybrid, split into two beings after his failed reincarnation attempt - Technique God and Demon God. Technique God retained his Dragon Race side and all his knowledge; Demon God retained his Demon Race side and his hatred for the
Human God
, eventually forgetting the "God" part his hatred mistakenly turned towards the Human Race itself.

During the First Human-Demon War, the great elven swordsman Idaztleid fought and was killed by the great demon king
Necross Lacross
 but almost no one today remembers this event.

References

Hitogami

Human World

World Map

I Don't Want to Die
===================

I Don't Want to Die
 (死にたくない
Shinitakunai
) is the sixth episode of the
second season
 (30th overall)
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on August 13, 2023.

Synopsis

Rudeus continues his studies at Ranoa Magic Academy as he deepens his relationship with Fitts who joins him on investigating the
Teleport Incident
. At the Academy, there is also Zanoba who considers Rudeus as a doll figurine master asks to learn how to create them so at the advise of Fitts, they go to the slave market looking for someone they can teach Earth Magic for Zanoba, who is struggling to make dolls because of his
Miko
 strength.

Plot

Rudeus
 begins to get used to school life in the university, where he studies magic he lacks experience in as well as researches the cause of the
teleportation disaster
 alongside
Fitz
. However, Rudeus begins to realize he may have a crush on Fitz, much to his confusion since he still believes Fitz is male.

Meanwhile, he also attempts to teach
Zanoba
 how to create his own sculptures, but his own lack of magic capacity and his super strength prevent him being able to sculpt. Fitz suggests that Zanoba purchase a slave who can create sculptures for him.

Rudeus, Fitz, and Zanoba then travel to the local slave market. Through Febritto, they purchase a young dwarf girl they name
Julie
. Afterwards, Rudeus begins tutoring Julie to teach her magic and general skills while she acts as Zanoba's servant.

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Sylphiette

Zanoba Shirone

Febritto

Julie

Locations

Central Continent

Ranoa Kingdom

Sharia

Ranoa Magic Academy

Slave Market

Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 8

Chapter 4: The Beginning of My School Life

Chapter 5: An Unreachable Power (Part 1)

Chapter 6: An Unreachable Power (Part 2)

Differences with the Light Novel:

Rudeus uses
Healing
 and
Detoxification Magic
 after purchasing Julie but in the Anime Fitts uses Detoxification Magic upon seeing Julie.

Trailer

I Want to Tell You
==================

I Want to Tell You
 (伝えたい
Tsutaetai
) is the twelfth episode of the
second season
 (36th overall) and the final episode of Part 1
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on September 25, 2023.

Synopsis

Rudeus finally learns that Fitz is Sylphiette. Sylphy also tells Rudeus about her feelings, and the two are united. Fitts smiles kindly at Rudeus who apologizes for not realizing that she is Sylphy for a long time. Rudeus makes up his mind and visits Ariel with Fitts.

Plot

Rudeus admits he loves Slyphie as well, but to his dismay he cannot make love to her since his impotence still isn't fully cured. Sylphie reports back to Ariel and Luke, with Luke agreeing to help Sylphie find a cure for Rudeus' impotence out of sympathy for him. Luke gifts Sylphie a rare and powerful aphrodisiac that should counter Rudeus' impotence while Ariel provides some advice on how to seduce him. Sylphie meets Rudues later that night and they both imbibe the aphrodisiac, which helps push them to make love. The next morning, after realizing that Sylphie hasn't abandoned him, Rudeus experiences an emotional catharsis and overcomes the trauma caused by Eris leaving him, and is cured of his impotence. Rudeus then thanks Ariel for her help by pledging his loyalty to her, and then asks for Sylphie's hand in marriage which she accepts. Ariel releases Sylphie from her obligation to disguise herself as Fitz and accepts Rudeus as part of her inner circle. Sylphie then thanks Ariel and Luke for everything they've done for her.

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Sylphiette

Ariel Anemoi Asura

Luke Notos Greyrat

Zanoba Shirone

Julie

Linia Dedoldia

Pursena Adoldia

Locations

Central Continent

Ranoa Kingdom

Sharia

Ranoa Magic Academy

Adaptation Notes

Light Novel Volume 9

Chapter 11: The Final Push

Side Story: Sylphiette (Part 0)

Light Novel Volume 10

Into the Labyrinth
==================

Into the Labyrinth
 (迷宮入り)
Meikyūiri
) is the twentieth episode of the
second season
 (44th overall)
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on June 2, 2024 and also the second episode of the
Labyrinth Arc
 for the Anime.

Synopsis

Upon arriving at the labyrinth city of Rapan, Rudeus and Elinalise quickly find Geese who brings them to Paul and Lilia. Rudeus gently speaks to the exhausted and haggard Paul, who is lamenting he is unable to rescue Zenith. They discuss the conquest of the Teleport Labyrinth where Zenith is supposed to be, but Roxy, who should be there, is nowhere to be found...

Plot

Rudeus and Elinalise finally arrives at Rapan where Rudeus intends to meet with Paul's group first so Elinalise suggests to head to the Adventurer Guild Headquarters and look for Paul or Geese where the latter would establish his information network being the party's
Thief
. Upon looking around, they immediately find Geese who is trying to enlist a male
Beast Race
 but is refused then Elinalise calls out Geese who approaches them. Geese is surprised on how quickly they arrived since it was only 6 months since he sent the letter and were expecting them in another 6 months. After agreeing to delay the details of their situations, Rudeus asks Geese to takes them to his father which suprises Geese on how his "Boss" has grown up and asks to be called as he did before. The two explain their
history
 to Elinalise, Geese brings them to the Inn where Paul is staying.

Before entering the Inn, Geese tells them Paul is in a bad shape then asks Elinalise and Rudeus to avoid picking a fight with him for now to which Elinalise refuses to make any promises and Rudeus agrees. Upon entering the Inn, Paul, Vierra and Lilia are there where Lilia wakes up Paul. After confirming he is not dreaming, Paul also remarks how fast Rudeus arrives to which Rudeus mentions a "
unique method
" they used to travel. Paul hugs him and laments he is unable to rescue
Zenith
 to which Rudeus affirms it is enough reason to take the journey. Paul also remarks how Rudeus has grown but is surprised that Rudeus is about to have a
child
. Paul then approaches Elinalise and bends his knee to apologize to which Elinalise also admits she is partially at fault too and extends her hand to help Paul stand up.

Paul the mentions how Elinalise was able to last the journey due to her
Curse of Promiscuity
 that Elinalise mentions it was thanks to the
Curse Supressing Tool
 created by
Cliff
, her husband which even surprises Paul.

Paul then explains the situation that Zenith is captured in the Teleporation Labyrinth which is a day's travel north from Rapan and it is still unknown if she is still alive after 6 years according to the intel gathered by Geese. Talhand and Shierra arrives at the inn from shopping where the Talhand confirms Rudeus is Paul's son. But as Paul continues the discussion, Rudeus inquires where is Roxy that causes everyone to be tense and Paul tells him that she is missing for a month already. Rudeus is horrified and asks is she is dead but deep inside he'd rather not hear it. Paul elaborates she stepped into a Teleportation Circle and has disappeared while Geese and Talhand argues that she could still be alive despite their five attempts to look for her for the past month. After recovering from the shock with Elinalise's help, he is told that the labyrinth in question is the Teleportation Labyrinth and is considered S-rank in difficulty. Upon hearing this, brings out the "An Exploratory Account of the Teleportation Labyrinth" book he borrowed from the library of
Ranoa Magic Academy
 and after reading it, Geese is delighted that all the details they need to clear even the sixth floor are detailed in the book so Paul then proceeds to discuss their formation.

That night, Rudeus, Paul and Lilia shares the same room where Lilia mentions it is their first time sharing a room then they talk about
Aisha
 who Rudeus mentions that she is a big help and wishes that she was a little more selfish. This made Paul laugh who was also listening. Then they talk about Rudeus'
wedding
 with
Sylphiette
 which relieves Lilia upon hearing Sylphy is alive but Paul is surprised that Rudeus is not married to
Eris
. After exchanging apologies once again, Rudeus and Paul have a light talk about their past exploits to the chagrin of Lilia.

Next day, at the cave entrance of the Teleportation Labyrinth, Rudeus takes over Vierra's role of Magician and Healer, Elinalise is the Tank that was the previous role of Shierra, Paul is the secondary attacker, Talhand can be a Magician or secondary attacker and Geese is the scout. While Lilia, Shierra and Vierra are the support team will return to Rapan for supplies acquisition and other house sitting maintenance.

As they progress through the Labyrinth, Geese and Rudeus each uses
Summon Lamlight Spirit
 scrolls to light the way that Talhands praises the convenience it brings and Paul acknowledges as Rudeus is his pride and joy. As they walk, Rudeus explains how some Teleportation Circles does not glow but will transport them anyway so the party is following the footprints that has a cross-shaped mark that Geese creates with his special pair of boots for scouting until they encounter a
Tarantula Deathlord
 where Elinalise moves to position to tank it but Paul runs ahead and kills it with his
dual

swords
.

Although everyone in the party is aware that Paul showing off to Rudeus and moves on, Elinalise tells him off for being in beaking formation. Paul tries explains he is trying to loosen their nerves but Elinalise rebukes him as he is showing the same excitement when Zenith joined their
party
 in the past. When Paul mentions that Elinalise is nagging him more than usual, she responds that he is like a son to her as Paul dismisses the notion to be a joke while Rudeus watches amusingly but didn't tell Paul he is now Elinalise's son due to Rudeus' marrieage to Sylphy, her granddaughter.

They finally reach the Teleportation Circle to the second floor but are guarded by a lot of Tarantula Deathlords and before engaging to battle, Talhand reminds Rudeus not to use
Fire Magic
 due to Carbon Monoxide poisoning; not to attack the ceiling to avoid cave ins; and to also avoid water magic but instead use Ice Magic to avoid softening the ground that might cause it to collapse.

As Paul and Elinalise kills their share of Tarantula Deathlords, Rudeus uses
Blizzard Storm
 that kills a large number of Tarantula Deathlords, that Talhand praises that he is indeed Roxy's apprentice.

Looking at the Teleportation Labyrinth Book, Geese confirms the Teleportation Circle leads to the second floor and they all step in together.

After battling a few more Tarantula Deathlords at the Second Floor, Paul calls for a quick break where Paul, Geese and Rudeus checks and clean up their gear while Elinalise and Talhand are on the lookout. As they are resting, Geese mentions that the third floor's Teleportation Circles will only send people on the same floor and hopefully find Roxy there.

Upon reaching the third floor, Geese consults with Rudeus on where might Roxy be with his intuition and after a few moments, Rudeus suddenly stops causing the party to question him as he approaches a wall then shows a worried expression.

Somewhere in the third floor, armies of Tarantula Deathlords,
Iron Crawlers
 and
Mad Skulls
 are battling Roxy who casts
Earth Fortress
 that stops the advance of the Iron Crawlers but they crawl its wall. Roxy then casts
Water Splash
 to soak the monsters then follows up with
Icicle Field
 to freeze the wet monsters in place then finishes them off with Blizzard Storm. After defeating the wave of monsters, Roxy is breathing heavily but more monsters appear from the Teleportation Circle, and narrowly dodges a mud ball thrown by a Mad Skull that destroys a portion of the Earth Fortress where an Iron Crawler enter. Roxy strikes one of the Iron Crawlers with
Flame Slice
 then tries to cast another Earth Fortress but cannot do so due to exhaustion as more Iron Crawlers break the Earth Fortress. This causes Roxy to panic and tries to strike them with his staff but a Tarantula Deathlord shoots a web to knock the staff off her hand. Unable to fight back anymore, Roxy calls for help and shuts her eyes tight as the Iron Crawlers approach her.

Moments later, Roxy opens her eyes thinking she died but is surprised that she sees a world of ice where all monsters are frozen in place like white statues and the Mad Skulls at the back are frozen to their core as one of the frozen skull falls off. Roxy then sees Rudeus walking pass the frozen monsters to approach her and is relieved to see Roxy and smiles as Roxy looks on blushing.

Differences with the Light Novel:

The event where Paul is half awake when seeing Rudeus has been cut

The event where Paul briefs Rudeus of the various monsters they fought so far in the Teleport Labyrinth has been cut

The event where Paul is told that Elinalise is Sylphiette's grandmother has been cut

The event where Roxy's perspective is being narrated has been cut

Trivia

迷宮入り (
Meikyūiri
) is a Japanese metaphor for getting into a situation that is difficult to escape from, Also commonly used in criminal contexts when a case has gone cold.
