Isolte Cruel
============

Information

Story

Relationships

Isolde Cluel
 (
イゾルテ
・
クルーエル
)
 is the granddaughter of the late Water God,
Reida Lia
, trained in the Water God Style. Introduced initially as a Water King, she later on becomes a Water Emperor. By the events of
Redundant Reincarnation
, she becomes the next Water God, taking on the name of
Reida Lia
 in accordance to the title's tradition.

Appearance

Isolde is a very beautiful woman with a round face and long, black (ultramarine) silky hair who appears to be in her twenties. She is noted to resemble her grandmother and is likened to a beautiful blue flower by her future husband,
Doga
. When
Rudeus Greyrat
 saw her for the first time, he remarked that she is stunning in looks.
 Later on, he says her smile is a beautiful thing to witness; she looks like the prim and proper type but there is a hint of allurement about her too. He surmised he could see her as "the sexy wife next door."
 A few years later, Rudeus still considered her beautiful from her face to the way she holds herself after expressing gratitude for her assistance in battle.

She is usually seen wearing the Asuran royal knight armor complete with helmet and carries a sword by her hip.

Personality

Isolde is highly loyal to her family and friends, defending them and easily becoming hostile to people who mistreat them. Isolde is also very proud of her sword style, looking with contempt at the Sword God Style users when she first entered their territory, but later coming to respect it. She is studious and open to improving her own battle skills, such as in Sword Sanctum and in the battle against the
Fighting God
, but also able to impart tactful advice to other swordsmen such as
Nina Fallion
 and Eris Greyrat. Isolde is good at reading people, such as when she realized that Rudeus took good care of
Eris Greyrat
 without him saying anything. She can also be a little bit manipulative, being able to pacify Eris' provocations in a way that makes Rudeus describe as "throwing a bone to a dog."

She is a Millis follower, having the conviction of one man and one woman when it comes to marriage and love, and thus was outraged when she found out Rudeus already had two wives in addition to considering taking her dear friend Eris as his third.

Isolde is morally good and righteous but can be shallow and is particularly picky about a man's looks when it comes to preferences. However, a person's personality and integrity is far more important and even makes a man look more attractive to her if they possess good qualities. Eventually, she chose Doga for his inherently good nature and love for her. As a married couple, Isolde calls Doga 'darling' when in private.

Background

Isolde is the granddaughter of the famous Water God Reida Lia. Her father had no surname due to Reida abandoning hers, and instead Isolde took up her mother's surname. Her parents had died at an early age, leaving her older brother Tantris to take care of her.

Possessing raw natural talent for swordsmanship, she eventually surpasses her older brother under the age of ten to become the next prized pupil of Reida Lia. This leads her on a journey towards becoming even stronger, eventually crossing paths with Eris Greyrat and
Nina Farion
, her two rivals and also closest friends.

Power and Abilities

Isolde is a powerful swordsman trained in the Water God Style and serves as one of
Asura's Seven Knights
 under the rulership of
Ariel Anemoi Asura
, the
King's Greatshield
. A prodigy from birth, she had more raw talent than her older brother Tantris Cluel, an upper-level swordsman in the Water God Style, and surpassed him under the age of 10.
 As a Water King, she was able to easily defeat
Eris Greyrat
 while training in the Sword Sanctum. As a Water Emperor, she was able to stall the
Fighting God
 for an extended period of time. She was entrusted the future of Water God Style by her late grandmother and would later on become the next Water God as
Reida Lia.

She also becomes a palace sword instructor and operates several dojos across Asura Kingdom as the next carrier of the Water God Style.

『Water God Style』

As an expert practitioner of the Water God Style, Isolde excels in reading the emotions of her opponents and using her surroundings for defensive and counter maneuvers, able to use elementary techniques such as
Flow
. She is able to do this with such elegance and finesse that would gain her the admiration of many nobles and swordsmen. Having surpassed the level of Advanced, she is also able to self-consciously use
Battle Aura
 to enhance her physical attributes.

Upon introduction as a Water King, she is able to easily defeat Sword Saint Eris Greyrat in sparring, warding off everything Eris threw at her and answering with a bunch of sharp counters. Over the course of that bout, which had lasted less than 30 minutes, Eris would have "died" nearly a hundred times.

Later on as Water Emperor, she is able to deflect all of the Fighting God's attacks against her and striking back with her own, moving with grace and precision. Her technique made the Fighting God's violent blows - any one of which could have been lethal - and turn them into something inconsequential like a child's tantrum. Rudeus notes that in a one-on-one battle, she may have been able to give the Fighting God a good fight (but still not win).

As Water God Reida Lia, she is sad to have mastered at least three of the five Water God Style's secret arts. She is still able to defeat a more seasoned Eris Greyrat in all of their multiple mock battles, although the matches were never decided by a single blow because of Eris' tenacity and ability to counter sometimes.

Equipment

Asuran royal knight armor

Sword

Quotes

Isolde:
“Thank you as well, Eris."

Eris:
“…I’ll land one on you tomorrow.”

Isolde:
“I look forward to it.”

Isolde:
“What’s so weird? This is the official armor of the Asuran Royal knights… I thought it was rather impressive.”

Eris:
“Looks hard to move around in, though.”

Isolde:
“With the Water God Style, you don’t have to move very much. This suits me perfectly.”

Isolde:
“Please, Eris, don’t even joke about that. I have an obligation to protect the training halls of my style. The last thing I need is to suffer some lifelong injury fighting a crazed hellcat like you."

Eris:
“Who cares about a bunch of musty training halls, anyway?"

Isolde:
“I suppose it would seem odd to a girl who fled her house and her responsibilities. But for some of us, our obligations are very real.”

Rudeus:
"And thank you, Isolde. If you hadn't stood between me and the Fighting God, I'd be dead."

Isolde:
"Not at all! It was a highly educational battle. I should be thanking you."

(To Doga's proposal): "
I'm yours, if you'll have me.
"

Trivia

Though it's stated in the novels that Isolde has black hair, Rifujin notes it's better off as
ultramarine
 in color when done by an artist since black hair is rare in the setting.

Isolde became one of the
Seven Knights of Asura
 known as the
King's Greatshield
.

After her husband Doga "quitted" his position as Ariel's nightly bodyguard, Isolde became Ariel's own personal bodyguard with Doga protecting Isolde (all to the benefit of Ariel).

Isolde's beauty is often commented by Rudeus, surmising that he could see her as "the sexy wife next door."

When Isolde and Doga married, Rudeus thought that Isolde might have manipulated or tricked Doga into marrying her. Once he saw that the two were truly in love, he gave his blessings to the couple's marriage.

By the events of Web Novel 17 (Light Novel 14), Reida had already mastered 2 out of the 5 secret arts of Water God Style.

Though there were others who had mastered 3 out of 5 secret arts of Water God Style by the time Isolde did, they either: 1) couldn't surpass her, 2) had various other reasons, 3) had a wife and kids, 4) acknowledged Isolde as the true Water God.

In
Redundant Reincarnation Volume 3
, Isolte's real name is never mentioned; she only goes by her title Water God
Reida Lia
.

Reference

Navigation

Isolte Cruel/Relationships
==========================

Information

Story

Relationships

Doga





Doga confessing to Isolde a second time after he quits his position as one of Asura's Seven Royal Knights.



Doga is her husband whom she affectionately calls 'darling' in private. Initially acquaintances by virtue of their positions, Doga first took notice of Isolde in a match against her where she won by a landslide, remarking she moved like a "graceful and beautiful flower." It was then when he fell in love with Isolde.

When Doga confessed to her with the help of Ariel, Isolde was so smitten with Doga giving up his job and wanting to protect her, that she was reminded of the first Water God's story about how he gave everything up for a princess. Isolde considers Doga to be far above the countless Asuran nobles in terms of character and personality with whom she's interviewed, regardless of looks. She accepted his proposal and they got to know each other for one year, after which they married. They have one daughter.

When Rudeus spied on them, he noted that Doga looked extremely happy, and that the couple were lovey-dovey with each other.

Doga is considered to be better than Isolde at being the 'househusband' from cooking to cleaning, which makes her monotone as she admits this.

Reida Lia

Reida Lia is Isolde's grandmother as well as her master. As her prized pupil, Isolde held a high opinion of her and would listen to her requests such as extended training in the Sword Sanctum. They were close enough that Reida considered her as her successor to the Water God Style. When Reida died at the hands of Dragon God Orsted, Isolde was visibly distraught and overcome with fury against him. It took her a few days after the incident to get over the grief of losing her master, but noted with respect that she at least died a swordsman's death - rare for this day and age.

Eris Greyrat





Isolde approaches Eris at Ars Capital in Asura Kingdom.



Eris is one of the few friends she made at the Sword Sanctum and still keeps in touch with. When Isolde first met Eris, she held a patronizing view of her along with the rest of Sword God Style. This was reinforced by the fact that she easily beat Eris, a Sword Saint with speed and power approaching Ghislaine's at the time. However, thanks to Nina and the three-way deadlock among the three girls, Isolde was able to properly teach and learn from Eris thereby initiating a real friendship.

During Eris' departure, Isolde gets upset on her behalf for Rudeus' brazen letter suggesting Eris be taken in as his third wife, showing concern for her friend. When Eris later visits Ars Capital in Asura Kingdom, Isolde calls out to Eris and briefly catches up with her.

After the conflict where Ariel secures her position to the throne, Isolde visits Eris again and makes peace with her, not blaming her, Rudeus, or Ghislaine for Reida Lia's death. She takes Eris around for a tour of the city and genuinely enjoyed her time with each other.

Isolde is experienced at handling Eris and her explosive personality. After backing down from a provoked challenge and defusing the situation, she was regarding Eris with the patronizing smile of someone who’d just tossed a dog a bone.

As
Ars Greyrat
 noted in his encounters with various swordsmen, Isolde was among those who said that Eris isn't an opponent who could be defeated so easily.

Isolte Cruel/Story
==================

Information

Story

Relationships

Volume 13

Isolde, a
Water King
, accompanies her master
Reida Lia
 to the Sword Sanctum at the request of
Gall Falion
. In the
Asura Kingdom
, Isolde has no equal among her fellow disciples of the
Water God Style
 and has become arrogant, which saddens Reida as she senses that in the past year, Isolde hasn't grown at all despite taking her training seriously but in conceit. After Gall and Reida propose a bout between their students, Isolde exchange introductions with
Nina Fallion
 and
Eris Greyrat
, then first fights against Eris. Despite Eris' speed being in the top 10 among the students of the
Sword God Style
 and strength close to Sword King
Ghislaine Dedoldia
, Isolde defeats Eris to the point where she is unable to land a hit on Isolde (Eris would have "died" almost a hundred times). However, Nina defeats Isolde with 1 hit as she could not sense any bloodlust from Nina's attack and thus could not counterattack accordingly. Gall and Reida then have an agreement that from dawn to noon, Isolde, Eris, and Nina will train with their respective teachers, and from noon to dusk, the three will practice and train together.

Volume 14

One month later, a strange triple deadlock has formed where Eris beats Nina, Nina beats Isolde, and Isolde beats Eris. On one of the three's discussions, Isolde points out that Eris' constant release of bloodlust is something the Water God Style can easily counter while Nina points out that the release of bloodlust is unnecessary as long you are the faster one. During this time, Isolde admits that she feels getting stronger with Eris and Nina's help and is having fun as it is her first time having discussions with people of her level and age.

Volume 15

After a few years of training in the Sword Sanctum, Isolde is invited to Asura Kingdom to become a sword instructor in the Silver Palace and tells her friends that they should visit Asura Kingdom in the future, where she will give her a tour. During this time, Eris has reached Sword King rank and is also leaving for Sharia in Ranoa Kingdom. Before they depart, a letter from
Rudeus Greyrat
 arrives and Isolde reads it for Eris. Isolde becomes outraged at the contents of the letter, praying to Saint Millis and telling Eris to join her to Asura Kingdom instead of going to Ranoa while berating Rudeus for even asking Eris to become his third wife. Isolde then reads the second paper which is a postscript of Rudeus challenging the Dragon God
Orsted
. This causes Isolde and Nina to stiffen up in fear of those words. However, Eris smiles upon hearing this, gets on her horse, and tells Ghislaine that she will be late if they don't hurry while Isolde and Nina see them off with a dumbfounded expression.

Volume 17

Isolde reunites with Eris upon the latter's arrival to Ars, the Royal Capital in the Asura Kingdom. Isolde is currently a novice knight and well on her way to become a full-fledged knight of the Kingdom, with additional potential as either a palace sword instructor or a captain of the Royal Knights. She initially mistakes
Luke Greyrat
 as Rudeus and thus treats him coldly (due to having three wives), while taking an interest in Rudeus himself, unaware that this is actually Eris' husband.

She arrives to the sight of her master Water God Reida Lia using her technique on the entire party venue. Horrified, Isolde questions her master why is she doing this. In turn, Reida gives a cover-up story about how Isolde is to take her down and become the next carrier of the Water God Style. After
Orsted
 brutally kills Reida, Isolde cries in rage at him but he runs off, leaving Isolde cradling her dead grandmother in her arms.

Isolde visits Eris and Rudeus in the ten days after the events of Ariel's gathering, and after having gotten over her grief at her master's death. She properly introduces herself to the real Rudeus and notes that he actually takes good care of her dear friend despite having three wives. After teasing Eris for a bit and explaining the defused situation involving the former Water God's assassination attempt on Ariel, she takes Eris and Rudeus for a tour around the city.

Volume 26

Isolde, now a
Water Emperor
 and one of the
Seven Knights of Asura
, joins in the battle against the Fighting God, stepping in to save Rudeus. She plays a major role by acting as a frontliner, skillfully parrying and countering the Fighting God's violent blows - any of which could have been lethal - and making them look like a child's tantrum. After the Fighting God is defeated, she accompanies Rudeus as a guard to see Geese in his final moments. She then gets knocked out with the rest of the guard by a resurrected
North God Kalman III
 wearing Fighting God armor and wielding the King Dragon Sword Kajakut.

After Kalman III is defeated, Isolde finally departs with the rest of her crew and thanks Rudeus for the educational experience of fighting such a powerful opponent.

Redundant Reincarnation





Doga proposing to Isolde in the dojo.



Isolde is currently the new
Water God
 after mastering three out of the five secret arts of Water God Style. She seeks a suitor for marriage but to no avail as none fit her personal preferences. In a sudden turn, North Emperor
Doga
 confesses his feelings to Isolde and asks her to marry him while carrying a bouquet of blue flowers, but Isolde initially rejects him due to their responsibilities as Ariel's personal knights and arrangements by Ariel (at her own request) to marry royalty. However, Isolde is moved after Doga quits his position for the opportunity to be with her and with encouragement from Ariel, who tells Isolde that there is no greater honor for a woman than Doga's personal sacrifice. Isolde then realizes that there is no one else who loves her more than Doga, probably. She is deeply touched, having been reminded of the first Water God's tale with the runaway princess, and accepts Doga's proposal.

They get to know each other and marry after one year, eventually having one daughter who looks like Isolde herself. During the couple's private moments, she is affectionate with her husband and calls Doga 'darling.'

Jalil
=====

Jalil was a member of Lugonia Race, an adventurer and temporary member of
Dead End
.

Appearance

Jalil looked like an anthropomorphic lizard with green skin.

Personality

Jalil was somewhat cowardly and very easily intimidated. He was prone to committing petty crime for easy money, but he was actually a decent person as he upheld his end of the bargain pretty well when they had an agreement with Dead End.

Background

He was the owner of a Pet shop and member of P-hunter, a party that kidnap pets and when the owners publish a petition in the adventure guild, they returned the pets for the reward.

After he was caught by
Roman
, he and
Vizquel
 were blackmailed and started to work for him.

Plot

Volume 3 - Juvenile Period - Adventurer Chapter

Jalil is a petty criminal that specialize in lost pets with Roman and Vizquel. They were originally running a scam where they were stealing pets and claiming the lost reward later on. After that
Dead End
 catch them and kill Roman. They are forced to collaborate with
Dead End
.

Volume 14 - Young Man Period - Summoning Chapter

It was mentioned that he got killed 2 years ago while taming a magic beast.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Power and Abilities

Taming

Since the Lugonias are experts in taming wild animals and monsters. Their training methods have been handed down from ancient times and they are able to make everything from wild dogs to the most prideful beasts submit. Jalil uses his talent to tame monsters and sell them.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Equipment

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Quotes

Rudeus:
 “So, uh. Why did you even start abducting pets if you already had a legitimate line of work?”

Jalil:
 “At first, we were just taking in ones that got lost, but…I guess something got into us.”

Trivia

He claimed  could “domesticate" anything from a stray mutt to a proud woman of the Beastfolk. But he died while trying to tame a magic beast

Jenius
======

Redirect to:
Jinas Halfas

Jinas Halfas
============

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Jinas Halfas
 (
ジーナス・ハルファス
,

Jīnasu Harufasu
)
 is the current vice principal of the
Ranoa Magic Academy
. He was promoted from the teacher position.

Appearance

Jinas has short gray hair that frames his face. He is also always seen wearing a dark coat with a white collar that is covered by a blue robe with the Ranoa Magic Academy emblem at the left chest.

Personality

It was stated by
Roxy
 that he was very haughty and overbearing in the past when he was Roxy’s teacher. Now, he’s said to give off a strong image of being a diligent corporate worker that gives off a venerable and gentle demeanor. When he meets Roxy again, he apologizes for his past mistakes.

Cliff considers him to be a "decent, understanding man" while Norn describes him as honest. He has a strong sense of justice and treats people equally.

Background

Jinas was
Roxy
's teacher in Ranoa. In the past, he got jealous with Roxy's talent and told her something bad. Some years later he become the Vice-Principal of Ranoa Magic University.

Plot

After he heard the achievements of
Rudeus
, Jinas sent a letter to him, inviting him to study as a special student in Ranoa.

After receiving a letter that
Zenith
 has been found, Rudeus meets with Jinas to arrange a leave of absence for him and
Elinalise
 from Ranoa Magic Academy as they need to travel to Rapan,
Begaritt Continent
.

Rudeus and Roxy returns to the university to report their return where Roxy went to talk with Jinas to ask for a job as a teacher. They had a talk about their past dispute, after that Jinas hired Roxy as a teacher of the university.

At some point, he replaces Georg as the Head Teacher of the Academy. After gaining his new position, there was a huge reduction in racism against the staff. He also pushed for announcing the truth about the students who died in the storage room even though it could potentially harm the Academy's reputation.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Power and Abilities

He is a Saint-ranked water magician and a Saint-ranked fire magician.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

He was the former instructor in Saint level water class magic.

Quotes

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Trivia

He wrote a book about the Saint water class magic.

In the Anime, Jinas is introduced as a teacher of the university instead of Vice Principal

Jino Britts
===========

Information

Relationships

Jino Britts
 (
ジノ
・
ブリッツ
)
 (
Gino Britz
 in the official light novel) is a swordsman of the
Sword God Style
 hailing from the
Sword Sanctum
. He is the son of Sword Emperor Timothy Britz. Later on, he becomes the next Sword God succeeding
Gal Farion
, as well as the husband of
Nina Britts
 (née Farion).

Appearance

In his youth, Jino had short, spiky hair that is light brown in color and waved to one side. He wears an obi with a long-sleeve shirt underneath typical for swordsmen and carries his sword by his hip, latched onto his sash. He had a plain face that showed signs of immaturity when confronted with an issue he cannot deal with.

As an adult, Jino wears a coat similar to that of
Gal Farion
 and is often seen with a carefree, unconcerned expression on his face (alongside his wife Nina).
 Nevertheless, he can also express a stern, imposing gaze towards anybody who would put himself or his family in danger, as he did towards
Rudeus Greyrat
. According to Rudeus, Jino looks young and surmises he is around Rudeus' own age.

Personality

In his youth, Jino had an immature and naive way of thinking, seeing swordsmanship as a dull routine he simply did because it was natural to him, despite being praised as a prodigy. In fact, he actually didn't like sword fighting very much; he kept up his practice, but only because his parents made him do it without any desire himself. Neither did he feel happy when people praised him for being the youngest to achieve Sword Saint rank. He lived a life of complacency, doing things that would anger no one and bother no one.

Being brought up in a sheltered environment, he had many preconceived ideas and expectations about life, initially fearing the outside world (in part due to Ghyslaine's stories) and feeling no desire to ever leave the Sword Sanctum.
 The latter would continue on throughout his adult years. He had a vague idea of differences in philosophy but wasn't sure of specifics nor which was right until after his awakening.

His love for
Nina Farion
 and desire to want "more" of his first time with her awakened him to the idea of a "goal" that both
Eris Greyrat
 and arguably Nina failed to articulate to him correctly. With such a goal in mind, he could easily make the most out of his outstanding talent, with an unprecedented interest and effort in his swordsmanship. It was also around this when he finally understood his master Gal Farion's teachings, and thus became single-mindedly obstinate in his determination to live only for himself.

After becoming the Sword God, Jino still behaves calmly and in ways that exasperate the former disciples of
Gal Farion
, ignoring rudeness and only paying attention to Nina, even groping her and smelling her hair in plain daylight. He has no attachment to his authority as Sword God or status as master, and has offered to leave the Sword Sanctum, not doing so immediately due to his children being too young. He would look unconcerned at his disciple's frustrations about upholding the honor of the Sword God Style, having a look that wondered what the disciple was going on about.

While still respecting his former master and following his teachings, Jino bears no animosity toward Rudeus and Eris for his death, stating that if the former Sword God died by himself and for himself, then there is nothing to be resentful about.

Background

Jino Britts was born in the Sword Sanctum and into the Sword God Style. His family is a branch family of the Sword God Gal Farion: his mother is Gal's younger sister and his father is a Sword Emperor under him.
 He is considered a prodigy by his fellow practitioners, being able to come up with outlandish battle theories as a child, and attained the title of Sword Saint at the tender age of 12 as the youngest Sword Saint ever. Of those around his age, only Gal's daughter
Nina Farion
 was able to match his own sword skill and keep up with him.

Like almost every other Sword God Style practitioner in the Sword Sanctum, Jino has a great deal of respect for the Sword God. Eventually, Jino develops feelings for his daughter Nina and asks for her hand in marriage. When Gal refuses to give his approval unless Jino were to defeat him, it is with this motivation to marry Nina that beckons Jino's tumultuous awakening and dramatic rise in power as the next Sword God.

Power and Abilities

Jino is a Sword God Style swordsman of prodigious skill and talent, being both the youngest Sword Saint and Sword God in history. Despite his ambivalence about sword work, he was revered a genius by his peers; even as a child, he came up with somewhat outlandish battle theories, which would eventually enable him to see a path towards victory against the contemporary Sword God.
 He was able to catch up to Nina Farion in no time after being motivated by both a desire to get stronger and his feelings for her. When he had a "goal" in mind, he is able to put in the "work" to hone his body and skills to perfection to best Gal Farion in mock combat. Jino displayed speed equal to Gal but able to react and retract his sword faster than Gal, enabling him to obtain victory like needling a thread into a needle.

As the Sword God, he is able to completely overwhelm Eris Greyrat in mock battle, breaking her arm and toe so fast nobody except God-tier fighters were able to notice what had happened. He is also able to defeat
North God Kalman III
 (one arm sealed) in mock battle without so much as a single scratch. In the original timeline, it was Jino who defeated Kalman III, not Rudeus, which led the latter to become mature enough and eventually become a true hero.

Due to never leaving the Sword Sanctum and making a name for himself, he is said to be the weakest Sword God in history and believed to have inherited the title only due to passing of generations. Yet out of all the Sword Gods, he lived the longest.
 It is said that had he left Sword Sanctum, he might have defeated mighty foes such as Water God
Reida Lia
 and Death God
Randolph
.

『Sword God Style』

As a practitioner of the
Sword God Style
, Jino is able to use basic techniques such as
Sword Cleaving
 and advanced techniques such as
Longsword of Light
. In his youth, he was able to regularly keep up with Nina Farion in skill, albeit he lost more times to her in training than not. However, with proper motivation he was always able to close the gap due to his prodigious talent.

After his "goal" awakening, he became fast enough to parry Gal's sword in a direct exchange of blows, something Water God
Reida Lia
 could not do in her advanced age. As Sword God, while fighting mock battles simply for
Nina's
 amusement, he proved his superiority over Eris Greyrat in a fast double strike to her dominant arm and leg, so much that it even made the proud Eris concede in frustration. He is able to intercept and pressure a one-armed
Kalman III
 by landing countless hits on him without being struck back once, albeit it left him in a sweat. In fact, Kalman III was only able to keep up due to his demon regeneration. Rudeus notes that had it been real combat and with a scabbard for balancing his sword stance, Jino could have moved even faster.

Quotes

Gal: "
What do you think makes the difference, Jino? Answer me.
"

Jino: "
Th-the ability to think logically, to move skillfully... uh, body strength... or m-maybe weapon quality...?
"

Gal: "
Weapon quality?! How many years have you been training for, boy? You sure you don't need to go back and start from the basics?!
"

Eris: "
You lost?
"

Nina: "
Yes, before he challenged the Sword God, he told me,
'If I win, be mine.'
 I fought him without holding back and I lost
."

Eris: "
That's a beautiful way to propose.
"

Nina: "
Isn't it?
"

Jino: "
I will not work with you. I wield my sword for myself alone. Everything I do, I do for myself.
"

Rudeus: "
Even if your family were in danger, you wouldn't pick up your sword?
"

Jino: "
I would. If I loved them, I would. Or are you saying you'll kill my family if I refuse to work with you?
"

"
It is because you are such a man that I feel safe in saying that I will not work with you. My sword fights for me and those I love, and no one else.
"

Trivia

Jino is the son of
Gal Farion
's younger sister, which makes his wife
Nina
 his first cousin.

In the original timeline, without
Rudeus
, Jino was the one who defeated
Kalman III
 and set him on the path of becoming a true hero.

According to Orsted, in his youth Jino may have been susceptible to the
Mangod's
 teachings.

Jino's sword theory, while fundamentally still Sword God Style, actually differs slightly in that it is not based on one-shot one-kill, but rather the quickness and precision to disable one's opponent before attacking them again in rapid succession. Much like
Eris Greyrat
 and
Ars Greyrat
, he has created a variation of Sword God Style that overcomes some of the style's weaknesses.

Navigation

Jino Britts/Relationships
=========================

Information

Relationships

Nina Britts (née Farion)

When he returned with the title of Sword God, he swept Nina up and kissed her forcefully... that day, Nina had become Gino's in both mind and body.

—
Nina Farion

Nina is Jino's first cousin, childhood friend, and eventually wife. They grew up training together and Jino has always followed Nina in whatever she did, whether it be forming secret organizations for Sword God Style children or sparring together. Even though Nina would treat him like an underling, the two often understood each other best - when Nina frustratingly lost to Eris Greyrat in the selection to becoming a Sword King, they simply stayed silent and kept on training.

Jino eventually developed feelings for Nina during their training sessions and they consummated their relationship. It was his love and desire for Nina that finally motivated Jino enough to put in "work" towards achieving a "goal": to be with Nina in marriage after he was rejected by her father, Gal Farion. He became strong enough to defeat the current Sword God, and this earned him Nina's deep admiration too. Nina also takes Jino's family name upon marriage.

After becoming Sword God, he wields his sword only for the sake of himself and his family, proving his deep love for them. He also made Nina a Sword Emperor as a gift. During training halls in the Sword Sanctum, he is often seen cuddling with Nina at his side, oblivious to others' disapproving looks. He only cares for Nina and will do anything she commands him to, such as mock battles with Eris Greyrat and Kalman III.

Gal Farion

Gal Farion is Jino's uncle, former teacher, and his predecessor to the title of
Sword God
. Gal always tried pushing a young Jino to work harder and take swordsmanship more seriously, who simply practiced it out of habit and due to family pressure. He even tried to encourage him to adventure out into the world, to no avail. When Jino came to ask for Nina's hand in marriage, Gal saw it as an opportunity to motivate Jino into getting stronger - which he did, to the point of beating Gal in a 1-on-1. After that, Gal was crushed and held Jino in contempt yet begrudging respect. On the other hand, Jino bears no animosity towards Gal and wishes to uphold his former master's teachings: to wield the sword for one's self.

Eris Greyrat

Gal Farion: "See? Naive, right?"
Eris: "He really was , huh."

Eris is an acquaintance that Jino made at the
Holy Land of Swords
. Eris' first impression of Jino is that she thought he was a weak runt, and she never paid any attention to him.
 Despite being completely defeated by Eris during their first meeting, Jino did not see this defeat as a huge change since losing was an everyday occurrence to him due to frequent sparring and losing against Gal or even Nina in the past. Eris is responsible for Nina's growth after training together with Eris, who secretly trained with Jino during their free time; this made Jino begin to fall in love with Nina.

Eventually, when she fought Sword God Jino directly in a mock battle, she was frustrated but acknowledged his overwhelming superiority against her. Nevertheless, they remain on friendly, humble terms with each other, with Jino saying that Eris wouldn't back down in the old days and complementing her on her matured self-control. As
Ars Greyrat
 noted in his encounters with various swordsmen, Jino was among those who said that Eris isn't an opponent who could be defeated so easily.

Ghislaine Dedoldia

"The world is a place where even the most talented swordsman die. If you don't know how to use
Magic
 or math, or how to read, death will come swiftly."

-Ghislaine

Sword King Ghislaine Dedoldia is the 4th in rank at the Sword God Style and is Jino's senior who travelled around the
world
 as a famous
Adventurer
. When Ghislaine returns to the Holy Land of Swords, Ghislaine tells Jino stories of her journey. Unlike the adults, Ghislaine's serious face causes Jino to believe her warning since like the rest of the children in the region, he does not know how to read, write, use Magic nor know math. Despite this, Jino is still not interested in leaving his homeland to go for an adventure like Nina did as he fears of not being able to solve anything with swordsmanship alone.

Rudeus Greyrat

Rudeus is someone that Jino respects, primarily because of their similar love for their respective families. Jino has heard stories of Rudeus, such as how he would attack the Dragon God and even destroy a whole country to protect his family, which piqued his interest in Rudeus. As a result, Jino trusts that he will uphold their neutrality pact. Rudeus, on the other hand, finds Jino somewhat terrifying due to the cold bloodlust as a result of a misunderstanding, and somewhat eccentric due to his constant public display of affection with Nina during training.

References

Jirou
=====

Jirou
 (ジロー,
Jirō
) or
Dillo
 is an armadillo-like monster trained in eastern
Begaritt
 and bought by
Geese
.
Rudeus Greyrat
 took it home with him as he felt sorry to leave it behind in the desert to be eaten by monsters. It later becomes of the family pets of the Greyrat household.

Appearance

Jirou is a monster that looks like a large armadillo.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Personality

Jirou is properly trained and docile. It is afraid of griffons, but killing them and eating their meat in its view is enough to give it confidence with its group and march on.
.

Background

Jirou was trained by a Lizard-like demon race in the eastern Begaritt.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Plot





Jirou travelling with Rudeus' group in the Anime



Rudeus
 purchases Jirou and a carriage to be pulled for preparations to travel from the
Begaritt Continent
 to
Sharia
 to be used as a ride for
Zenith
 and
Lilia
 (in the Anime) as they travel through the desert. Rudeus initially plans to leave Jirou in the desert but decides to bring him since he can fit in the Teleportion Circle instead of letting him die. Upon arriving at the Northern Central Continent, Jirou seems to be struggling with the cold and could anytime that Rudeus decides to at least give him a name and decides that it will be Jirou.
 But Jirou manages to survive and gets used to the colder weather and eventually becomes Roxy's ride to
Ranoa Magic Academy
.

Power and Abilities

Jirou is large and strong enough to carry people on its back or pull a carriage.

Trivia

The name Jirou  (ジロー,
Jirō
) is derived from the Japanese pronunciation of armadillo (アルマジロ,
arumajiro
), which is also the same pronunciation as a common Japanese name “次郎”.

The English LN translation named it "Dillo" in the same manner, despite its unfortunate resemblance with the word "dildo".

Roxy rides it to work when she is not accompanying anyone else.

Jobless Reincarnation
=====================

Jobless Reincarnation
 (無職転生
Mushoku Tensei
) is the first episode of the
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on January 10, 2021.

Synopsis

When a 34-year-old underachiever gets run over by a bus, his story doesn’t end there. Reincarnated in a new world as an infant, Rudy will seize every opportunity to live the life he’s always wanted. Armed with new friends, some freshly acquired magical abilities, and the courage to do the things he’s always dreamed of, he’s embarking on an epic adventure—with all of his past experience intact!

Plot

After being hit by a truck and dying, a hopeless and jobless Japanese man reincarnates into a fantasy-like world as
Rudeus
, son of the swordsman
Paul Greyrat
 and his wife, the healer
Zenith
. Keeping his memories of his previous life, Rudeus quickly learns to read and eventually starts practicing magic. Noticing his aptitude, Rudeus' parents hire the adventurer
Roxy Migurdia
 as his magic teacher. Roxy has some doubts at first about tutoring him due to his tender age until she witnesses his unique ability to cast magic instantly and realizes his potential. As the Greyrat family gives a welcome party to Roxy, Rudeus vows to work hard to improve himself and make proper use of the second chance he was given to have a happy and fulfilling life.

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Paul Greyrat

Zenith Greyrat

Lilia

Roxy Migurdia

Locations

Buena Village

Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 1

Chapter 1: Is This Another World?

Chapter 2: The Creeped-Out Maid

Chapter 3: A Textbook of Magic

Chapter 4: Master

Differences with the light novel:

The episode extended the Prologue Chapter by adding an original scenario where pre-reincarnation Rudeus was brought up to a hospital after the accident.

In the light novel, pre-reincarnation Rudeus dies instantly in the accident spot by receiving a second collision from the truck.

The full-length Prologue Chapter adaptation was instead included in
 Episode 2
.

While in the anime the first Intermediate spell casted by Rudeus is called
Water Splash
, in the novel it is called
Water Cannon.

Lilia can be seen eating dinner with the Greyrat family. In the light novel, she didn't join for meals and upheld her maid status until the pregnancy crisis.

Trailer

1-10(日)放送第1話予告-『無職転生 ～異世界行ったら本気だす～』次回予告①／ナレーション：前世の男(CV.杉田智和)
Episode 1 Trailer, January 8

Gallery

View Gallery

Click here to view the Gallery

Trivia

When Rudeus was reborn as a baby, he only heard Paul and Zenith talking an unknown language.

In the Blu-ray addition, they add an uncensored scene where Paul and Zenith have sex.

Joseph

Joseph is a member of the mercenary band managed by
Aisha
 and

Zanoba's

Julie
=====

Redirect to:
Juliette

Juliette
========

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Juliette (
ジュリエット
)
, nickname
Julie
 is a young female
Dwarf

Slave
 that Rudeus and Zanoba purchased from a slave market to help them in the making of dolls.

Appearance

Due to her Dwarf Heritage, Julie is a small girl with a very thin frame, pale skin, and unkempt, feathery light red-orange hair. When she was a slave, Julie is deathly thin and undernourished. After she became Zanoba's servant, Julie is seen with a once piece sleeved white clothes with skirt and dark sandals.

Personality

At first she was apathetic and in despair for being a slave, but after
Rudeus
 and
Zanoba
 bought her she gradually started showing feelings, started toddling around Zanoba, asking about things that interested her, and, befitting her age, she likes to have someone read her books and tell her stories.

Background






Julie during the time she is a slave in the Anime



Julie is the only child of Bazelle, a blacksmith and Lilitella, a jewelcrafter. At some point because of debt, she and her parents were sold into slavery where Julie's parents were already sold while Julie remains in a Slave Market in
Sharia
 due to being undernourished and sick where she first meets Rudeus, Zanoba and Fitts.

Plot

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Powers and Abilities






Julie successfully casting Chantless Earth Magic in the Anime



『Magic』

Julie is trained by Rudeus in Earth Magic to create dolls for Zanoba and since Julie is a dwarf, she has a strong affinity to Earth Magic and Fire Magic but is more focused on the former.

『Chantless Spellcasting』

Julie is one of the few people who can cast Chantless spells that she learns under the guidance of
Rudeus
. During this time, there is no formal method of teaching Chantless Spellcasting so Rudeus calls this peculiar method of training an experiment. At the beginning of each day, Rudeus trains Julie to cast magic with
Incantations
 and after that Rudeus would not teach her anymore incantations and make her silently conjure clumps of earth instead. After one month of training, she successfully learns Chantless Spellcasting for Earth Magic.

Mana

Since being trained in Magic by Rudeus since she was six years old, Juliette also possess a high amount of mana which is increased during childhood. Although this is an accepted fact in Rudeus' family and part of their training, teachers of the Ranoa Magic Academy is only a theory and for the case of Rudeus, Sylphiette and Juliette is a special case.

Intellectual Abilities

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Physical Abilities

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Equipment

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Achievements

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Quotes

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Trivia

Juliette (Julie) is the name Rudeus gave her after he and Zanoba bought her.

Incidentally she is named after
Zanoba's
 younger brother Julius whom he accidentally killed.

References

Junior Disciple
===============

Junior Disciple
 is the 59th chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

Kalman I
========

Kalman I
 was the first North God of North God Style and also
Atofe
's husband.

He is one of the three heroes that defeated Demon God
Laplace
 along side with Armored Dragon King
Perugius Dola
 and Dragon God
Urupen
.

Appearance

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Personality

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Background

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Plot

Kalman married Atofe and before his death, he made
Perugius
 and
Atofe
 swear that they would never kill each other.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Power and Abilities

One of the strongest swordsman in his generation, North God Kalman is the first human to defeat the Immortal Demon King
Atoferatofe
. He was placed 7th in the
Seven Great Powers
.

Equipment

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

He is one of three legendary heroes that defeated
Laplace
.

Quotes

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Trivia

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Kalman II
=========

Kalman II
, real name
Alex C. Rybak
 (
アレックス
・
C
・
ライバック
)
, is
Kalman I
 and
Atofe
's son and also the second generation North God. Since the first generation North God himself never retired, he is called the
North God II
.

Appearance

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Personality

Alex is an easygoing man that gets along with most people. Despite his carefree and slightly eccentric outlook, he is actually very intelligent and perceptive, capable of quickly discerning opportunities and threats.

During his younger age, he was a person that chased after fame. Even so, he is good-natured and willing to lend a hand to those in need.

Background

Being the first North God and Demon Lord Atofe’s son, Alex was told repeatedly about his father’s heroic tales. However, people did not give the North God's reputation the respect he deserved, describing him as a coward because he did not defeat any major threat directly and died to the Emperor Dragon King. Wanting to improve the reputation of the North God and to be like his father, Alex became a heroic wannabe and went on a journey to slay the Emperor Dragon King Kajakut. On the way, he saved three girls from death: young assassin “Chiki” Chiquita, the “Death God Knight” Shaina Marianne and magician Frau “Flowing Clouds” Claudia. After Shaina saved him from a fatal attack, Alex killed Kajakut. Kajakut’s remains were forged into 49 powerful swords by master blacksmith Julien Halisco. The strongest one, King Dragon Sword Kajakut, was given to Alex. Both Chiki and Shaina had feelings for Alex, and Shaina would later become
Randolph Marianne
’s grandmother.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Plot

Volume 22 - Young Man Period - Organization Chapter

It is revealed by
Kishirika
 that he is somewhere near Asura in a place with dense mana.

Volume 23 - Young Man Period - Decisive Battle Chapter

He joined
Rudeus
 under the guise of Sándor, a knight from the Asura Kingdom sent by
Ariel
 together with
Doga
 to guard him during his journey to the Kingdom of Biheiril.
Orsted
 recognizes him but is asked to keep his identity a secret. After they made it to the Superd he assisted Rudeus and
Doga
 in helping the Superd people during the relapse of the plague. It was only after Rudeus came back from his near death experience at the bottom of the Earth Dragon Valley that his identity as Alex, North God Kalman II was revealed. However, he insisted of being called Sándor.

He later fought together with Rudeus,
Eris
 and
Ruijerd
 against his son
Alek
 in order to protect the Superd Village which Alek wanted to destroy. After Alek's defeat and apparent death, he accompanied Rudeus to Onigashima, where they were surprised by the sudden arrival of
Gisu
 and
Badigadi
 in the Fighting God armor. Just as Badigadi was about to start a fight with Rudeus, he formally requested a duel in order to give Rudeus some time to escape and get reinforcements. He was knocked off into the sea by the Fighting God and drifted ashore to Onigashima where he stayed to recuperate. It took him 10 days after the fight to come back.

Power and Abilities

Originally, his weapon was sword, but he tried a new fighting style using a metal rod as a method of self-discipline. He believes that staying inside the comfort zone will dull a person's skill.

He is strong enough to buy time (and survive) for Rudeus to call reinforcement by fighting Badigadi when he emerged as the Fighting god.

Immortality because of the immortal demon bloodline.

He defeats
Eris
 without much difficulty when she asks him for a duel.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Equipment

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

Second North God, former 7th rank of
Seven Great Powers
.

Hero to slay Emperor Dragon King Kajakut.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Quotes

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Trivia

In the web novel, Kalman became one of the
Seven Knights of Asura
.

Alex has black hair, which is rare for humans in the six-faced world
.

He is the one of the protagonists of the book
The Three Swordsmen and the Labyrinth
.

Rudeus meets Kalman II differently in the light novel as compared to the web novel.

Kalman III
==========

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Aleksander Ryback
 (
アレクサンダー
・
ライバック
)
, better known as
Kalman III
, is the third generation and current North God of
North God Style
. Initially part of
Hitogami's
 faction, he later joins
Orsted's

faction
 after being defeated by him during the
final battle
 of the series.

Appearance

Aleksander is described by
Rudeus
 as a young boy with black hair, around the age of
Paul
 as of
Rudeus
' birth.

Personality

Aleksander is a determined person. Due to the way he was raised, he is obsessed with becoming a hero and surpassing his
father
. To achieve such a goal, he did everything in his power to gain fame among the public.

After his crushing defeat against
Orsted
, his personality changed greatly. He becomes much humbler and obedient to his superiors in order to learn to "be a hero".

By his own admission, he isn't very good with words and is a bit of a simple minded person, which is a trait he Inherited from his
grandmother
 in a lesser degree.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Background

Aleksander became the North God early in his age and he had 20 students who after a few years, they parted ways with Alek to walk their own paths which resulted to Alek never taking another disciple.

Plot

Volume 25 - Young Man Period - Decisive Battle Chapter

He worked as one of
Gisu
's associates in order to destroy the
Superd Tribe
 and kill
Orsted
, with the objective of achieving the title of "Hero". He however, cared very little about the circumstances of the Superd or
Hitogami
 scheme and was only interested in the fame that came with the Hero title.
Rudeus
 and company were able to defeat him after an intense battle and was considered dead for a while. However, as he is a descendant of
Atofe
 it was only a matter of time until his body regenerated. He was eventually defeated by
Orsted
 after a very one sided battle that lasted only 10 minutes and in which he ended up losing both arms. He subsequently ended up becoming another subordinate of
Orsted
 and member of the
ORSTED Corporation
.

When Rudeus is on missions for Orsted, he usually leaves Alek to protect and watch over his children especially
Sieghart Saladin Greyrat
 who really likes the stories about his father.

In Orsted's knowledge of the original history, Alek fell into despair after losing to
Jino Britts
 and took a single child as his disciple who was no way talented but by watching him grow and correcting himself, he matured to be a true North God. In the second
Laplace
 Wars, Alek proved himself to be history's strongest North God. Orsted suggests that Alek train Sieghart in the North God Style with the intention of the same outcome in the current timeline with Alek teaching Sieghart.

Powers and Abilities

North God Swordsmanship

As the current and third generation leader of the North God Sword Style, he is a very powerful combatant.

Equipped with the King Dragon Sword Kajakuto he could fight against
Eris
,
Ruijerd
 and
Kalman II
 while having the upper hand until he was forced to flee after
Rudeus
 and
Atofe
 joined the fight. After acquiring the Fighting God Armor, he defeated
Ruijerd
,
Ghyslaine
 and
Isolte
 with a single move and forced Orsted to fight seriously, using the Godsword against him.

Immortality

As a descendant of
Atofe
, a Demon Lord of the
Immortal Demon Race
, he is also immortal and will recover from wounds that would kill a normal being as well as being long lived.

Equipment

King Dragon Sword Kajakut

The strongest sword with the ability to manipulate gravity.

Fighting God Armor

After obtaining a piece of the Golden Armor, he equipped it. The Golden Fighting God Armor changes its shape according to its wearer and can regenerate by drawing on the power of the user.

Moon Glitter

Moon Glitter is a large, heavy two handed sword with a jet black blade created by Ore God
Godbard
 out of the black ore created by Rudeus. Due to Moon Glitter being able to blend to the night but reflects the moonlight as proof of its existence, Orsted names it Moon Glitter. Alek later gives Moon Glitter to Sieghart to assist his friend
Pax Jr.
.

Achievements

He was a part of the
Seven Great World Powers
 until he was defeated by Rudeus (albeit with his allies).

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Quotes

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Trivia

Ironically enough, after being defeated by
Orsted
, he joined
Orsted
's group in an almost similar way
Rudeus
 did (Kneeling, Losing both of his hands).

After the battle with
Orsted
, he sealed his dominant arm to learn about the true meaning of what it is to be a 'hero'.

Kaunis Freean Asura
===================

SPOILER ALERT!

This page contains
spoilers!
  Read at your own risk.

Kaunis Freean Asura
 is a king of Asura Kingdom after the Laplace Campaign.

Appearance

Personality

Perugius describe him as a not-great man, a coward, who hated fighting, and was always on the run.  He was bad at studying,  had not an ounce of martial talent, and was always sneaking out to the city to get drunk and ogle bar wretches.  However, Perugius respected him because even though he didn't have the ambition to become king, he had the most important factor to become one.

Background

He was the third prince of Asura, after the death of his family during the Laplace War, he became the heir to the Asuran throne and later became the king after the wars end. He was a great king and gave direction to the war-torn kingdom of Asura, allowing it to become the sole kingdom to rule the western half of the Central Continent.

He was the reason why Asura was spared internal turmoil postwar.

Plot

Power and Abilities

Trivia

He is one of the four friends that
Perugius Dola
 had during the Laplace Campaign.

He is the only Asuran King to receive Perugius's backing until the reign of
Ariel Anemoi Asura

Kishirika
=========

Redirect to:
Kishirika Kishirisu

Kishirika Kishirisu
===================

Information

Chronology

Relationship

Power and Abilities

Gallery

Kishirika Kishirisu
 (
キシリカ・キシリス
,

Kishirika Kishirissu
)
 is a member of the
Immortal Demon Clan
 and the former empress of the
Demon Continent
.

Spoilers ahead!

She is a recurring character who usually offers aid to
Rudeus
 and his acquaintances as thanks her doing her favors, having been the one who granted him his
Demon Eye
.

Appearance

Headless statue of Kishirika before her death.

Kishirika looks like a little girl with curve-less figure. She has pale skin, voluminous and wavy violet hair, and a pair of goat-like horns. She also has different color eyes that can spin to change color, due to her various
Demon Eyes
.

Personality

Kishirika is hilariously simple-minded, gullible and carefree, yet being haughty and ambitious. She is depicted as using the 妾 (
warawa
, lit. "mistress") pronoun to refer to herself, which is usually used in fictional settings to represent archaic noble female characters. She will gratefully grant a wish within her power, for anyone who helps her.

She loves her
fiancé
 but she doesn't mind if he sleeps with other women, mostly because they can't be intimate with her child-like body for the time being.

It's worth noting that she tends to hold grudges; when
Rudeus
 knocked her out for her mistake and handed her over to
Atofe
, she was mad at him and almost didn't help him escape from Atofe's castle.

Background

Kishirika Kishirisu was the daughter of the
First Demon God
 and the then Demon Empress
Kirisis Calisis
. She was an infant when her father was killed by the
First Dragon God
, and was saved from the collapsing Demon World by the Demon King
Necross Lacross
 (Badigadi and Atofe's Father) and Demon Dragon King
Laplace
 and grew up in the Human World.

During the Human-Demon Great War, Kishirika Kishirisu, the Immortal Demon Empress who commanded the magic race, engaged in battle but suffered a swift defeat, leading to her imprisonment for three centuries.

Following her reincarnation, she would boldly declare her true identity, yet her claims were often met with disbelief or indifference. Frequently faced with hunger, she finds herself living more as a beggar than an Empress.

Plot

Volume 2 - Infancy Period

Before the
Teleport Incident
, she was one of the many who took notice of the phenomena that was occurring over the
city of Roa
. She attempted to see what was the cause with her many
Demon Eyes
, however, it appeared that the culprit skillfully concealed their identity.

Volume 4 - Juvenile Period - Voyage

Rudeus
, under the guidance of
Hitogami
, encountered Kishirika in an alley in Wind Port, being pulled by a strange man. Misunderstanding the situation, he attacked the man, knocking him out in one hit. However, Kishirika was starving, as she hadn't eaten  much since she had been reborn, so Rudeus gave her some food. She gratefully accepted, and in exchange, offered him a demon eye, suggesting he take the
Foresight Eye
. Rudeus agreed, however not realizing that he was speaking to the real Kishirika. He was thus surprised when she actually changed his eye into the Foresight eye.

Volume 6 - Juvenile Period - Homecoming Chapter






Kishirika using her Clairvoyant Eyes to locate Rudeus' Family



Kishirika had a drinking contest against
Tallhand
 who she defeated but was nearly taken in as a slave for being unable to pay for the drinks.
Roxy
 paid for her, saving the situation. In gratitude, Kishirika informed Roxy of where Rudeus' family was located at Roxy's request, with her
Clairvoyant Eye
 and also informed her that
Zenith
 was in the
Teleport Labyrinth
 at the
Begaritt Continent
.

Volume 14 - Young Man Period - Summoning Chapter

A year prior, Kishirika had found herself in
Rikarisu Town
 and ended up drinking a large amount of wine, which belonged to
Atoferatofe Rybak
. As a result, Atoferatofe came to Rikarisu in search of Kishirika to punish her. However, she didn't know how Kishirika currently looked and thus couldn't find her.

Kishirika, however, spent that time starving in the city, trying to get food, while wearing a hood. Eventually, when Rudeus and his company arrived in the town with
Cliff
 giving food to Kishirika, who he believed was simply a beggar. She later gave Cliff an
Identification eye
.

Volume 22 - Young Man Period - Organization Chapter

She was tricked by Atoferatofe Rybak's imperial guards and imprisoned. Later on, she met
Rudeus
 who gave her donuts and asked her to find a man named
Geese
. She also revealed the truth about the Fighting God, and that she and
Badigadi
 were formerly
Hitogami
's apostles and told Rudeus to be wary of Badigadi due to him still feeling indebted to
Hitogami
. She gave Rudeus the
Clairvoyant Eye
 for giving her a donut. Before she left, Atofe asked her the location of Earl and
Kalman III
, but Kishirika rejected until Rudeus showed her
Randolph
's ring. She promised Rudeus that she would  help with anything as long as it doesn't involve
Hitogami
.

Quotes

To Rudeus:
 “My belly aches from the hunger…and this man was going to provide me with a meal”.

Atofe's soldiers:
 "Lord Kishirika, please cease this! Please do not provoke Lord Atofe any further!"

Kishirika:
 "Shut up! This One followed you lot because you told This One you would feed This One something good and all This One gets is poor treatment! This One shan't feel better until This One has said at least that much!"

Trivia

She has low metabolism (compared to a human's), so eating about 14 skewers can last her one year.

Kishirika said that
Rudeus
 is "disgusting" when she saw him for the first time, wondering if he was a twin with a stillborn brother
. This is due to Rudeus' having an immense quantity of magic power/mana.

This is omitted in the anime, where Kishirika just said he's disgusting without mentioning anything else.

She and
Badigadi
 were once
Hitogami
's apostles before the Human-Demon Great War.

She hates
Hitogami
 and even told Rudeus that he could ask for her help for anything as long as it doesn't involve Hitogami.

In
Episode 12
, Kishirika switches her eyes like a slot machine and also show some fruits before switching to her Magic Power Eyes on Rudeus.

A running gag in series is that Rudeus occasionally imagines the possibility of Kishirika appearing out of nowhere, like being born as his child or summoned from a magic circle.

It is hinted that Kishirika possesses a large amount of mana, as
Orsted
 said she can't be summoned by the small summoning magic circle he made for
Rudeus
 due to her mana capacity
.

According to Badigadi, she cannot leave the Demon Continent
.

References

Kishirika Kishirisu/Power and Abilities
=======================================

She does not seem to possess great fighting capacity as she panicked upon being threatened to be sold into slavery by a simple bar keep.

Immortality

She seems to be immortal, but it's likely that she just revives after death with her age reset.
Badigadi
 once mentioned that because of how thoughtless she is, she dies pretty often, so it wouldn't be strange for her figure to turn back to that of a child, considering the fact that
Badigadi
 revived in a much smaller figure when he was killed by
Rudeus
.

Demon Eye

Kishirika using her Clairoyant Eye
Kishirika's switching her demon eyes
1/2

She's most known for her ability to produce, control and give demon eyes. She carries 12 types within her body, each with their own unique ability and it's possible the number increases as she ages.

Kurt
====

Kurt
 is an adventurer from
Demon Continent
. He is the leader of a party named
Tokurabu Village Toughs
.

Appearance

He is a pretty young boy with white hair and a pair of horns sticking out of his forehead.

Personality

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Background

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Plot

A young adventurer of
Rikarisu
.

When his party was in quest in the Petrified Forest, they were ambushed by a group of monsters that killed one of the member of his party.
Dead End
 arrived and saved them.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Power and Abilities

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Equipment

He uses a normal sword.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Quotes

"Yeah, I know! Im not blind! And the three of us wanted to stay together to the end! But you know what? We knew death was a possibility! Any adventurer's party prepared to face that risk-young or old!"

"I'm grateful that you stepped in to save us, but it was our job to keep ourselves safe. If anyone's to blame, it's me! I'm the one who took this task and got us in over our heads!"

Trivia

Even though it is described in the light novel that he only has one horn, in the anime he has two.

Labyrinth City Rapan
====================

This article is about the Chapter 100 Manga Page. For the City, see
Rapan
.

Labyrinth City Rapan
 is the 100th chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Elinalise Dragonroad

Summary

Rudeus and Elinalise arrives at the Labyrinth City Rapan. Despite being exhausted from the journey, they head to the Adventure Guild and finds Geese trying to convince a
Beast Race
 adventurer to assist him and is outright refused. Elinalise and Rudeus greets Geese, much to his surprise that they arrived faster but agrees to take them to Paul.

Before entering the inn where Paul is staying, Geese asks Rudeus and Elinalise to avoid picking a fight since is in bad shape to which Rudeus agrees while Elinalise will somehow try...

Appearances

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Elinalise Dragonroad

Geese Nukadia

Lilia Greyrat

Paul Greyrat

Shierra

Roxy Migurdia
 (mentioned)

Skills

none

Regions

Begaritt Continent

Rapan

Adventure Guild

Unnamed Inn

Monsters

Succubus
 (mentioned)

Differences from Light Novel

The event Rudeus is charmed by a Succubus and attacks Elinalise has been cut

The event where Rudeus and Elinalise travel with the Desert Warriors to Rapan has been cut

Paul asks Lilia for water while in the Light Novel, Rudeus uses
Earth Magic
 and
Water Magic
 to conjure an earthen cup with water for Paul to drink

Language
========

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!





A book for learning Human Tongue to Demon God Tongue (red characters) in the Anime



In the
Six-Faced World
, there are many different
languages
, mainly determined by
Races
 and geographic. Accent do differ between locations.

Human Tongue

Human languages ​​are used by the human race, human languages ​​are one of the languages ​​that do not bear the name of the God of their race. Humans in the Central Continent and Millis Continent use human languages. These two languages ​​are divided with a great difference but they coexist in the same human kingdom with contrast, but there are slight differences in the accents between these continents, such as the difference between American English and British English.[1]

In the
Anime
, Human Tongue is simplified to Japanese (or other languages) in most cases.
Paul Greyrat
 and
Zenith Greyrat
 are the only characters who had spoken Human Tongue in the first of
Episode one
.
Silent Fitz
,
Nanahoshi Shizuka
, and
Rudeus Greyrat
 also spoke Human Tongue in Season 2, Episode 9,
The White Mask
.




Human language alphabet english version



Spoken Language

The spoken language of Human Language is based on the Basque language, but undergoes consonant substitutions. The vowels are unchanged but most consonant are swapped. For example, the word “magic” in Human language will be pronounced as “pavia”. First, the word “magic” is translated to Basque, which is “magia”. Then, change change the consonant, which gets “pavia”

Beast God Tongue

The Beast God Tongue is used by the
Beast Race
,
Dwarves
, and
Elf
 which mainly lived in the
Great Forest
 in the
Millis Continent
. Named after the
Beast God
.






Basque edition of the human language alphabet



In the
Anime
, the Beast God Tongue is first debuted in the episode
Missed Connections
.

Demon God Tongue

The Demon God Tongue is used in the
Demon Races
, which mainly lived in the
Demon Continent
. It is named after the
First Demon God
. Some races such as
Migurd
 communicate telepathically, most of the cannot speak Demon God Tongue.






Provisional alphabet of   阿泥妹飯 @AnimeFan2333. Zulu character correspondence table in Demonic Language; Note that there are consonant substitutions.



In the
Anime
, the Demon God Tongue is mainly used when
Roxy Migurdia
 communicates with other Demon races.

Fighting God Tongue

Fighting God Tongue is used by
Humans
 lived in the
Begaritt Continent
, it is named after the Fighting God, which is one of the
Seven Great Powers
, but not an actual
God
. The Fighting God Tongue is slightly similar to the Human Tongue but the only differences are the vocabulary and way of things are expressed which Rudeus describes to be English mixed with German in it.

Sky God Tongue

Sky God tongue is used by the
Heaven race
, named after the
Heaven God
.

Ocean God Tongue

Used by the Ocean Race, named after the Ocean God.

References
