Laplace
=======

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Information

Relationships

Laplace
 (
ラプラス
,

Rapurasu
)
 is a powerful demon who waged war against humanity 500 years ago before being sealed by the
Seven Great Heroes
. In reality, there are actually two Laplaces,
Demon God Laplace
 and
Technique God Laplace
, having been split into two whilst fighting the
Fighting God
. While it is mentioned that he will revive in the future, neither of his two halves actually appear in the main story.

Appearance

"A mixed race of demons and dragons. Where and how were you born?"

-First Dragon God

Being born with
Dragon Tribe
 and Demon blood, Demon Dragon King Laplace before he was split in two was described as over 2 meter tall with silver hair with patches of green but has lesser scales compared to those of the Dragon Tribe. In addition he had fangs, claws. a set of wings, transparent white skin and two golden eyes.

Demon/Magic God Laplace was described to have emerald green hair, and gentle eyes.

Personality

"I killed beasts and ate them, but the lonely feeling did not heal."
-Laplace

In his early life at the Demon World, Laplace lives a primal life where he would prey, live and die by instinct by feeding of the demonic beasts at the corner of the Demon World. But after seeing a family of demonic beasts together, Laplace begins to feel a sense of loneliness that he is unable to cope with and begins to search for people like him and eventually finds a town but is seen as a monster. Despite being treated as a monster and being forced to retreat, he persisted to return as he does not want to feel lonely
 which persisted even when he begins to live in the
Human World
 until
Rostelina
 joins him.

Ever since being brought to the Dragon World, Laplace is fiercely loyal and devoted to the
First Dragon God
 who saved his life and
Lunaria
 who he considers like her real mother even though they are not related by blood. Even after the destruction of the Dragon World, Laplace faithfully follows the First Dragon God's last mission to him to prepare techniques, magic and knowledge for
Orsted
 to defeat
Hitogami
.

Background

Meeting the First Dragon God

"Alright. If the Demon God neglected you for so long, he wouldn't mind if I just take you away, even though there are so many uses, what a waste..."

First Dragon God

Even Laplace himself does not know where he was born. Ever since becoming aware as a child, Laplace found himself in a cave at the corner of the
Demon World
, a land of death, full of miasma and roaming demonic beasts where he goes hunting monsters for food and sleeping on a regular basis. Laplace soon felt lonely after witnessing some demonic beasts huddling and playing with each other and decides to wander and finds a demon town but its inhabitants viewed him as a monster and the Demon King of the town fought and injured him but he manages to escape. Laplace would eventually encounter a hydra that spits fire and poison mist where his injuries from it would not heal like it normally does after eating and sleeping.

On the brink of death, Laplace is saved by the
First Dragon God
 and brings him to the
Dragon World
, an inverted land where the mountains grew from above while a clear blue endless sky and white clouds is seen below. Upon arriving at the First Dragon God's home in Kayos,
Lunaria
 greets them and the First Dragon God tells her that he plans to raise the child with her and gives him the name Laplace.

Dragon Warrior Training and Dragon Tamer

Laplace is then trained by
Dora
 at the command of the First Dragon God to become a Dragon Warrior and for the next decades, Laplace is trained on how to speak the Dragon God Language along with different subjects about the Dragon World, how to use
Dragon Battle Aura
 and how to fly.
 After completing his Dragon Warrior training, Laplace becomes Dora's subordinate and his first task is to train dragons that are the mounts used by the Dragon Tribe. This is where he first meets a
red dragon
 who was initially hostile towards him but eventually is able to tame him. Laplace names him Saleyakt and afterwards he would rise into prominence because of his ability to train dragons that are considered untrainable by traditional methods.

During the spawning season, Laplace becomes Dora's temporary replacement on being in charge of all the dragon training facilities in the Dragon World and his work is appraised highly even by
Maxwell
 for the high quality dragons that he trains and being used by his unit.
 After
Crystal
's death, Laplace attends the meeting with the First Dragon God and the Dragon Generals where he is there as Dora's substitute. Laplace is assigned to conduct further investigation after Maxwell who also aids him by assigning
Gora and Scrubava
 to assist him in the investigation.

Search for Crystal's Killer

Despite the support from the Dragon Generals and his subordinates, Laplace is still struggling to find the suspect for years until the
Human God
 appears in his dreams and tells him about his
Demon Eye
 that he uses to look at the Gold Dragon's nest where Crystal's remains were found. With the use of his Demon Eye, Laplace found a trace of the culprit and managed to locate his hideout but the culprit
Necrolia Nacrolia
, is also in the hideout and kills Gora and Scrubava leaving Laplace to battle the Demon King on his own. After days of fighting both Laplace and Necrolia are on the verge of exhaustion and in desparation, Laplace unconsciously uses Dragon Battle Aura Explosion which destroys the mountain they were fighting . Laplace is the first to wake up and realizes that Saleyakt has brought him and Necrolia to the ledge they are at now then he restrains Necrolia's arms and legs and brings him back to Kayos.

Laplace is welcomed by
Szilard
 who handles the interrogation of Necrolia and the Dragon Warriors stationed at the gate also are shouting with joy for capturing the culprit. Laplace fell into deep sleep for three days and three nights afterwards then had a meal with
Lunaria
, reports to
Maxwell
 that his subordinates has died in battle and finally visited
Dora
 who has already finished spawning safely. After reporting his capture of Crystal's killer, Dora asks him to give their child a name to which he names him
Perugius
.

Demon Dragon General Laplace

Another meeting is held by the First Dragon God and the Dragon Generals where Laplace reports of his search for Crystal's killer, the
Human God
 appearing in his dream and telling him about his
Demon Eye
, his battle and eventual capture of Necrolia then he hands Necrolia over to
Szilard
. After Szilard's report, the Dragon Generals urged the First Dragon God to go to war against the Demon World but the First Dragon God refuses and will negotiate with them instead. At the suggestion of Szilard to reward Laplace for his accomplishment, the First Dragon God names him Demon Dragon General Laplace and the successor of
Crystal
 as a Dragon General.

New Mission at the Human World

Demon/Magic Dragon King Laplace was the sole survivor left of the Five Dragon Generals after the incident which caused the inhabitant of the four destroyed Worlds to escape into the Human World and the collapse of the Dragon World. He was the second generation Dragon God after the first passed away.

Laplace escaped the collapsing Dragon World and drifted to Human world. He became the second generation Dragon God. He researched about methods and techniques to overthrow
Hitogami
. He taught to those who called themselves "Dragon God" the techniques he had developed over a long time. All for the sake of passing down the power to
Orsted
 who came to the future, and said to possessed the greatest strength among the dragon-tribe.

He went to human-demon race world war where he fought against
Fighting God
 who was Human God's apostle and his soul was split into two halves. Laplace, who was split in two, lost his memory and became two, the human-hating [Demon/Magic God] and [Technique God], whose aim was to overthrow god.

[Demon/Magic God] Laplace lost the power of
dragons
. He only remembered the enormous amount of magic knowledge and that he must definitely kill 'human' forgetting the God part. For that purpose, he rallied the demon race to exterminate the 'human race'. He was cursed the same way
Orsted
 was, however he was able to transfer the curse to the
Superd race
.

[Technique God] Laplace who lost the power of magic, only remembered the enormous amount of techniques and that he must definitely teach and pass them down to someone. Thus Technique God created the Seven Great Powers ranking and devoted himself in studying those techniques.

Plot

Mushoku Tensei

Mushoku Tensei Sequel

Since the planned sequel series seems to be taking place around the time which the Demon God Laplace would finally reincarnate, it is very likely that he will finally make his debut here. Particularly, he is set to play a vital role in several major storylines. Most obvious is
Perugius'
 quest to finally kill him for good and avenge the members of the Seven Great Heroes who died whilst sealing him 500 years ago. However, he is also set to be deeply involved with
Orsted's
 quest to kill
Hitogami
, since he holds the final key the former needs to enter the latter's realm. If the events play out like in Orsted's previous loops, then
Ruijerd
 and
Norn's
 daugther,
Luicelia
, will play a major role in his eventual defeat.

Power and Abilities

Dragon Battle Aura

Trained by Dora to be a Dragon Warrior, Laplace's
Fang Technique
 has enough destructive power to be considered "deadly" and is among the few Dragon Warriors who can match Dora in combat.

Dragon Battle Aura Explosion

During the battle against Necrolia Nacrolia, Laplace concentrated his remaining strength in desperation, which caused his Dragon Battle Aura to swell below his heart and to explode like a suicide bomb, with enough force to destroy an entire mountain and was felt even in Kayos. However, he admitted that he did not know how to activate this ability.

Original Self

Before he was split into two beings, Laplace was considered the most powerful entity in the world. As one of the Five Dragon Generals, he had enormous physical strength, night vision and a demon eye that allowed him to track and sense enemies. Laplace could also fly.

Technique God

Technique God Laplace has the Dragon Power and knows many techniques in the world to overthrow 'God'. He created the Seven Major World Power system and ranked himself 1st. But, he loses some part of his memories, leading him to only remember his objective is to overthrow 'God' by teaching those who call themselves Dragon God all of his technique and lost all of his Magic Power, making him unable to use magic and knows only physical combat.

Demon/Magic God

Demon/Magic God Laplace has the enormous Magic Power and a master of all magic. He lead the demon race to exterminate 'Human' 400 years ago and ranked 4th in the Seven Major World Power system. But, he loses some part of his memories, leading him to only remember his objective is to kill 'Human' by leading the demon race in his military campaign and lost all of his Dragon Power, making him unable to use battle aura. Although he could not use battle aura, he was still so strong that he killed four of the seven heroes that led humanity in the Laplace War and the remaining three(
Dragon God Urupen
,
Perugius
,
North God Kalman
) were unable to kill him even with the help of
Ruijerd Superdia
 who could see his weak point with his third eye and thus, had to seal him to end the war.

.

Equipment

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

Original Self

Is considered a talented Dragon Trainer whose dragons that he tamed are appraised highly by Maxwell.

Defeated and captured one of the Eight Demon Kings Necrolia Nacrolia, who killed Crystal.

Achieved the title of Dragon King under the first Dragon God.

Became the second to hold the title of Dragon God following the first one's death.

Is the one of known living survivors of the Dragon World along with Saleyakt and Perugius before its destruction.

Demon God

United the entire demon race under his rule and led their most successful war against humanity.

Technique God

Created the
Seven Great Powers
 system.

Though having rank himself #1, the Technique God is actually a placeholder for his original self.

Quotes

"Let's continue the story once I'm done. No worries, because no story is as miserable as those of Dragon World’s."

Trivia

Laplace is formerly a second generation Dragon God.

Similar to Orsted, he holds a curse of fear and hate, which according to
Perugius
 is a curse that shakes the innermost heart of people.

He sent his traits into the future people so that he could reincarnate into the future. This is a technique used by the Ancient Dragon Race, and is a required step to prevent his soul from being rejected by an incompatible body. As a result, many people have recently been born with traits similar to him. (This has been called the "Laplace Factor")

Kishirika Kishirisu
 describes him as a handsome looking guy.

His name is likely a reference to scholar
Pierre-Simon Laplace
 and
Laplace's demon
.

In the removed chapters of Aisha, in the story of the legendary Hero Alus, The First Sage (who was assumed to be Magic Dragon King Laplace) granted Alus the power to properly wield the four treasures Alus borrowed from the other four Sages in order to defeat the Demon Lord.

Laplace is the person who named
Perugius
.

Demon-Dragon God Laplace only needed to eat once every one hundred days and only needed to sleep only once every few years.

Demon-Dragon God Laplace is one of the few beings known to posses a Divine-Jewel although it is unknown whether that Divine-Jewel was destroyed during his fight with the Fighting God.

Demon-Dragon God Laplace's power was comparible to Dragon God Orsted.

Laplace/Relationships

Information

Relationships

First Dragon God

"Hmm. I decided to come after hearing that there was a monster with the form of a man but... How interesting. A mixed race of
Demons
 and
Dragons
. Where and how were you born?"

-TheFirst Dragon God on meeting Laplace

Laplace first meets the First Dragon God after the latter is wounded by a
monster with many heads
 where Laplace was at the brink of death due to being poisoned and bleeding. After healing his wounds, the First Dragon God takes Laplace to the
Dragon World
 and adopts him to be his son
 where he would eventually become one of his
Five Dragon Generals
 after capturing
Necrolia Nacrolia
, Crystal's killer.
 Laplace would then accompany the First Dragon God as his assistant on the summit of the
Gods
 where he is presented as proof that the Dragon Tribe has no hatred towards the Demon Race and they agree to have peace and Laplace would become the ambassador on behalf of the Dragon Tribe to the other worlds.

Lunaria

"You're Dragon God's adopted son, then you are my child as well. Please rest assured, this is your home too."

Lunaria to Laplace

Lunaria welcomes Laplace after the First Dragon God adopts him and would also cares for Laplace while he adjust to his new life that Laplace would consider Lunara to be her mother.
 After Laplace begins working for Dora, he would also spend time with Lunaria telling about his work on training dragons like a family.

Dora

"Show respect and submit to me. I don't tell lies. Be true and trust me with all your heart. No whimpering or saying I can't. Its a waste of time. If you don't give up, I will surely raise you into a fine dragon warrior."

-Dora to Laplace

At the First Dragon God's instructions, Armored Dragon General Dora educates Laplace on words of the Dragon Tribe Tongue that he learns after a year followed by writing, history, geography, status, relationships, etiquette, industry and other common knowledge of the Dragon Tribe then she trains Laplace on becoming a Dragon Warrior and how to fly.

After Laplace completes his training under her wing, she assigns Laplace to train Dragons that is the main mount of the Dragon Tribe and later names him to be his substitute an supervising the Dragon Training Grounds since the spawning season has started.
 After Laplace captures
Crystal
's killer, Dora is among the Dragon Generals who approved Laplace to be Crystal's successor as the Demon Dragon General of the First Dragon God.

Perugius Dola

"I have a request for those who read this book. There is a child of the Dragon Tribe who does not know his name in this world. I have forgotten many things that happened, but this too was one of my missions. This child has silvery hair, must be a nameless man by now. Please tell him, "Your real true name is Perugius." Perugius, son of Dora-sama, the Great Dragon King Dora"

-Laplace

After Laplace captures
Crystal
's killer, Laplace reports this to Dora who is grateful for what he has done and asks Laplace to name her and Crystal's child. Although Laplace was reluctant but decides to name the child Perugius, which also makes him to be Perugius' godfather.

Saleyakt

Saleyakt is the first Red Dragon the Laplace tames but instead of taming him in how the Dragon Tribe does, he forms a bond with him by eating and sleeping together but Saleyakt would only listen to Laplace.
 Saleyakt would also help Laplace tame other dragons
 and later saves him after his battle against
Necrolia Nacrolia
 and remains to be his companion in the Dragon World and later the Human World.

Necross Lacross

Necross Lacross first meets Laplace when he was still living in the Demon World where he would defeat and kick him out when he tries to enter the city. After the
Gods
 agreed to cooperate, Laplace and Necross Lacross recruited collaborators from the
Six-Faced World
 to serve as ambassadors to assist other worlds to advance each other's civilization.

Before the destruction of the Demon World, Laplace is assigned to witness its destruction and finds Necross fleeing and upon learning what has happened to him, Laplace tells him to use the portal to reach the Human World.

References

Laplace Factor
==============

Laplace Factor
 (
ラプラスの因子
,

Rapurasu no Inshi
)
 is a unique trait in capability, or sometimes bodily appearance, a rare percentage of people are born with. It is a result of the Demon God
Laplace
 sending his soul from the past into the present by having it attached itself to multiple bodies in preparation of his revival.

Origin

Approximately
400 years
 prior to the start of the story, when Demon God Laplace was defeated and sealed by the, presently-known,
Three Legendary Demon-God Slayers
 he initiated a reincarnation method by which he would reincarnate in the far future. This method of reincarnation involves sending the soul of oneself into the future and plant itself onto multiple people to search for the perfect vessel. Those said people would have unique traits, though mostly dormant, originally associated with Laplace's internal or physical features. When those people give birth to children, Laplace's traits they inherited will be passed down to their offspring. As a result, slight bodily changes start to appear in children.

The process of bodies adapting to the soul would repeat for numerous generations, and slowly, when Laplace's predicted time of reincarnation gets closer, the dormant traits starts to awaken signaling the body-adaptation is getting nearer to the ideal. By this point in time, the person in possession of the factor would have already noticed their abnormality, by intuition or when exhibited for any person to notice. It must be noted that the traits awaken in different persons possessing the factor.

The reincarnation will occur when an adapted body possessing the factor perfectly matches with the soul. Taking over the body of the soul it was originally supposed to be in and be born while pretending to be it. This was originally a technique of reincarnation perfected by the
first generation Dragon God
 which had been used by many ancient
Dragon Race
 people to reincarnate into the present. Laplace's knowledge of this technique owed to him already having learnt it before he was split from the
Demon-Dragon King
 self; knowledge of this technique was passed to his Demon God self.

Known Characters with a Laplace Factor

Rudeus Greyrat

Sylphiette Greyrat

Sieghart Saladin Greyrat

Characteristics of People with a Laplace Factor

Increased magic potential and capacity (in most cases)

Green hair (some cases)

Can't wear or have trouble wearing
Battle Aura
 (most cases)

Increased strength and endurance (
Sieghart
)

When entering
Perugius
'
Castle
, they emit light particles out of their bodies (all cases)

Lara

Lara Greyrat

Lara Greyrat
============

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Lara Greyrat
 is the second child and daughter of
Rudeus Greyrat
 and the first daughter he had with
Roxy M. Greyrat
. She is the older sister of
Lily Greyrat
 and the half sister of
Lucy Greyrat
,
Ars Greyrat
,
Sieghardt Saladin Greyrat
 and
Christina Greyrat
. It was prophesized that she will be an important person in the future and destined to be the savior that the
Doldia Tribe
 were waiting for.

Appearance

Lara has light blue hair and eyes like her mother
Roxy
 that covers most of her forehead except the middle with a single ahoge and her mouth is just like Rudeus. Because of the color of her hair that could be viewed as green that is matches the hair of the Superd Tribe, her mother and
Sylphy
 worry about it since she might get bullied
.

As she reaches adulthood, she has the appearance of a 13-14 year old human girl, resembling Roxy so much that Rudeus may mix up with them when viewed from the back, which makes her tie her hair into a single braid to differentiate from her mother.

Personality

On the outside, Lara seems to be stoic and has a stern personality, but in reality it is actually due to her telepathy which she usually uses for communicating frequently with
Zenith
 and
Leo
.

She is mischievous, independent and likes making pranks to anyone for her amusement even if its
Kalman III
 or Orsted.
 Despite this she is also shown to be caring to her younger siblings especially Seig comforting him when he cries. She gets along with Ars, the two of them often causing mischief.

Background

"As I thought, Roxy's child is special."

-Orsted

Before Rudeus and Roxy were married,
Hitogami
 tried to get rid of Roxy many times, first by telling Rudeus to get a
Demon Eye
 from
Kishirika Kishirisu
, leading him to avoid meeting Roxy in Wind Port
. He then attempted to stop him from going to the
Teleport Labyrinth
 to save Zenith (and Roxy)
 which failed because of Rudeus and Roxy having a strong fate. Hitogami further manipulated Rudeus by leading him into a situation that would end up with Roxy falling ill and die later due to
Magic Stone Disease
 while Roxy is pregnant with Lara, but this was prevented by the intervention of
his future self
.

Hitogami confronted Rudeus in his dream because of this and angrily told him the future that Lara along with Rudeus' descendants would ally with
Orsted
 to kill Hitogami
. A compromise was eventually established that if Rudeus kills Orsted, Hitogami would leave his family alone. However, Orsted defeated Rudeus and made him his subordinate
. On the day of Lara's birth, there was a heavy snowstorm and Lara's shoulder being caught due to her larger size being a child of a
Human
 and Migurd, Lara was born safely with no complication
.

Plot

Volume 20 - Young Man Period - Zanoba Chapter

She cried when Rudeus said that he's going to
Shirone
 to help
Zanoba
 until Roxy said that she's going together with Rudeus.

Mushoku Tensei Novel Volume 20.5 - Intermission Chapter

Eris
 once found her attached to
Leo
 like a backpack in one of her patrols with Leo.

Volume 22 - Young Man Period - Organization Chapter

Lara traveled to the Demon Continent with her parents to visit her
Grand
parents
 in Roxy's hometown. It was there that Rudeus and Roxy discovered that Lara had the power to use Telepathy which is a trait that was skipped in Roxy. Roxy proposed to Rudeus that Lara should live with her grandparents for a while since Roxy felt that she would be an outcast with her special traits. Lara somehow overheard this and later pleaded with her mother to not leave her and spoke.







Jobless Oblige

Sieghart
 mentioned that  she became a researcher at
Ranoa Magic Academy
 after her graduation of Asura Royal Academy, and her research subjects are summoning magic and divination magic.

Redundancy
The Last One to Leave the Nest

In the last chapter, Lara and Leo leave the house, searching a place with high concentration of mana and promising to Sylphy and Roxy that she is going to back with a boy (Rudeus and Eris will be dead when she comes back). Before she parts, Sylphy gives her cuisine recipes, Eris gives her a knife amulet, Roxy gives her her old hat and Rudeus gives her his 『Arrogant Water Dragon King』, she also takes an old robe of Rudeus.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Power and Abilities

Telepathy

Because she is part
Migurd
 on her mother's side, Lara has telepathic abilities that normal Migurd have. It was discovered that she had this ability when Rudeus and Roxy took her with them to visit her grandparents. Her parents did not know that she held this ability since no one capable of verbal communication are able to use telepathy, and Roxy was the sole person in the Migurd village born without it.

However, it appears that her telepathy is not limited to Migurds, as she often uses it to communicate with
Zenith
,
Leo
 and
Beat
.

Magic

Divination Magic

Summoning Magic

Equipment

『Arrogant Water Dragon King』 (Aqua Heartia)

She received the 『Arrogant Water Dragon King』 from her father as a parting gift before she left her house. Rudeus knows since a long time she wanted this staff.

Trivia

She is the Hero that Leo guards, with a fate strong enough to steal the destiny from the original hero of all of
Orsted
's previous loops.

After an embarrassing incident that happened when Rudeus mistook Lara as Roxy, he never sneaks up to Roxy from behind again.

References

Latreia House
=============

The
Latreia House
 is a old noble earl Family that lives in the
Holy Country of Millis
, more precisely in its capital
Millishion
.

Backstory

The Latreia House is a distinguished family among the earls that has deep ties with the
Order of the Temple
 and is part of the
Demon Race Expulsion Faction
. The head of the house is Count
Carlyte Latreia
 married to Countess
Claire Latreia
.

Members

Claire Latreia





Claire Latreia



She is the wife of Carlyte Latreia, mother of
Zenith
,
Therese
,
Edgar
, Anise and Saula and is the daughter of Ralkan and Melody Latreia.

She likes people that are fair and righteous and hates crimes. In conclusion, she's a genuinely good human being who is just toos frequently because of it.

Carlyte Latreia

He is the husband of Claire Latreia and the father of Zenith, Therese, Edgar, Anise and Saula.

He was born Carlyte Granz is the Head of the Latreia House and Battalion Commander of the Order of the Temple's [Sword Group].

Zenith Greyrat

She is the Daughter of Claire and Carlyte Latreia, wife of
Paul Greyrat
 and mother of
Rudeus
 and
Norn Greyrat
.





Zenith Greyrat
 (neè Latreia)



After leaving the Latreia household, she married Paul and the moved to
Buena Village
 where they had Rudeus and Norn Greyrat.

Following the
Teleport Incident
, however, she was transported into the
Teleportation Labyrinth
 and encased within a mana crystal. After being rescued, she awoke as a
Miko
, but was left in a constant dream-like state.

Therese Latreia

She is the third daughter of Claire and Carlyte Latreia and aunt of Rudeus and Norn Greyrat.






Therese Latreia




Therese is the Company Commander of the Order of the Temple's [Anastasia Keep] and the protector of the Miko of Memory.

Company Commander of the Order of the Temple's [Anastasia Kee] and , the protector of the
Miko of Memory
.

Edgar Latreia

He is the eldest son of the Claire and Carlyte Latreia and Platoon Leader of the Order of the Temple who is stationed to a town west of Millishion.

Saula Latreia †

Daughter of Claire and Carlyte Latreia.

Anise Latreia

Daughter of Claire and Carlyte Latreia.

Ralkan Latreia

Previous Head of the Latreia House, Melody's husband and Claire's father who was a Company Commander of the Order of the Temple.

Melody Latreia

Wife of Ralkan Latreia and mother of Claire.

Family Tree

Lauri Shirone
=============

Lauri Shirone is one of Pax Jr.'s granddaughters. Lauri was personally educated by Pax Jr. and due to her talent as a knight, she has become one of his Knight commanders.

Laws
====

Laws
 was a hunter of
Buena Village
 and is
Sylphiette
's father and
Elinalise
's son.

Appearance

As a half-elf, he has pointy ears that are shorter than Sylphy's. Laws is a very attractive man. He has blond hair that almost glittered, and he was slender without lacking muscle definition. Because he inherited the best parts of both elf and human.

Personality

As a father, Laws was deeply concerned with his daughter that was constantly bullied.

Background

Laws was the son of Elinalise and the father of Sypliette. He lived with his family in Buena Village where he also earned his living. He was a friend of
Paul Greyrat
.

Plot

He died through unknown means after the Mana Calamity.

Power and Abilities

Laws was a skilled hunter who often assisted
Paul Greyrat
 in monster extermination around the village.

Trivia

Laxus
=====

Laxus is the Death God that precedes
Randolph Marianne
. He was the creator of the 『The Bone Ring of Laxus』.

Personality

Laxus was very loyal to the demon lord he served. After
Vita
 controlled his master and caused his death, Laxus was hellbent on killing Vita, developing various tools and strategies to counter him. He was very persistent, as he continued with his quest until his last breath.

Background

Laxus was the loyal subordinate and best friend of the demon lord he served. After Vita controlled his master, Laxus defeated him as he discovered the truth. As a revenge for his friend, Laxus was hellbent on killing Vita, developing various magic tools and strategies to counter him, including the Bone Ring made from the demon lord's bones. He exterminated the entire slime tribe during the process, but was unable to reach Vita as he escaped to the labyrinth "Netherworld" and infested the guardian.

It's presumed that Laxus was defeated by
Randolph Marianne
 at some point of time, who inherited his title as the Death God and took his bone ring.

Plot

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Power and Abilities

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Equipment

Note: This section is under construction and revision

Trivia

.

Leo
===

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Leo
 is a Sacred Beast that the Doldia Tribe was serving. It was said that he was born from the Sacred Tree and that together with his partner will be the savior that the Doldia Tribe were waiting.

Appearance

Leo's size is about 2 meters, he has short limbs, but he will grow larger since he is still just a puppy.

His fur is silver.

Personality

Despite being a holy symbol, Leo is playful and mischievous, often sneaking away from its sacred house to meet Rudeus, who saved him from smugglers.

Background

He is the Sacred Beast, a type of magical beast born once every few hundred years that don’t have a proper name. It only appeared when the world faced a crisis, and when it became an adult it would set out alongside with a hero, using its great power to save the world.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Plot

With the Torrential Rainy Season approaching in
Millis Continent
, Leo was captured by a group of smugglers and he meets Rudeus who releases him from the
Barrier Magic
 imprisoning him. But before they leave, Rudeus is captured by
Gyes Dedoldia
 who brings him to the Dedoldia Village deep in the Great Forest
 (he and his tribesmen mistakenly thought that Rudeus
sexually assaulted
 the Sacred Beast, even though he was just playing around with him like with a (gigantic) puppy).

He later on get's summonded by Rudeus using a magic circled given to him by
Perugius
 and he becomes
Rudeus
 pet in order to protect Rudeus family, specifically
Lara
 as she is "the savior" he is destined to protect.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Power and Abilities

Physical Abilities

Leo can move at high speed to a target before they have a chance notice or draw their weapon and then bite their limb that breaks their bones just by shaking his head violently. Leo also possess strength that he can throw a target he has bitten spinning through the air that could cause them to pass out when they hit a wall. While Leo's real strength is not known but it is believed that if he uses his full strength, he could easily bite of the head of a
Human
.

Intellectual Abilities

Leo is very intelligent that he is able to understand
Beast God Language
 and is also toilet-trained.

Strong Fate

"As I thought, Roxy's child is special."

-Orsted

Leo is protected by a strong fate that Orsted uses as a means for Rudeus to protect his
family
 from
Hitogami
's schemes.

Telepathy

"It's serious! It's serious!
Lara
-sama has wet herself!"

Leo telepathically communicating with
Zenith

Leo is able to communicate telepathically with with Zenith
 and Lara.

Mysterious Power

It's not known what power Leo possesses but Orsted himself confirms that it's so high it simply can't be compared to the likes of
Almanfi
.

Equipment

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Quotes

Gyes:
 “To think that this boy would lay his hands on your holiness… Gah…!”

Leo:
 “Woof!”

Gyes:
 “What? It didn’t bother you? How benevolent…!”

Trivia

Those of the Beast Race can understand what he is saying. This, however, might be only limited to Leo's caretakers or active tribemen as Ghislaine is shown to be unable to understand his words specifically.

Leroy Greyrat
=============

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Leroy Greyrat
 is the son of Ars Greyrat and Aisha Greyrat whose relationship was initially opposed by rest of the
Greyrat Family
 but Rudeus eventually accepts them when Aisha became pregnant with Leroy.

Personality

Rudeus describes Leroy to be a rowdy boy like both his parents and inherited his mother Aisha's Intelligence and his father Ars' perverse fondness for large breasts.

Background

"As Ars grew, so did that feeling... But I still tried to restrain myself! After all, we're a decade apart! Not to say that he's the firstborn, thus needs a proper prospect for continuing the Greyrat House legacy! But Ars said he loves me too!"

-Aisha Greyrat

Ever since
Ars Greyrat
 was born,
Aisha Greyrat
 has grown fond of the child. As Ars grew up he also becomes close to Aisha and they eventually fall in love.
Rudeus Greyrat
 later finds out of their relationship and affair that shocks him along with the rest of his family. Despite the strong objections especially by her mother
Lilia Greyrat
, Aisha insists that she loves Ars and will marry him but Rudeus refuses and decides that Ars will attend the
Asura
 Royal Academy that Aisha refuses but eventually agrees to Rudeus' recommendation. The next day, Aisha elopes with Ars leaving the family a letter: "We will live our own lives."

Around a year of searching, Rudeus manages to find Aisha who is already pregnant with Leroy. Aisha was willing to die as long as Leroy would live but Rudeus refuses and after further talking things out with Aisha, they return to the Greyrat House.

Plot

Back at the Greyrat House, Lilia is horrified that Aisha is pregnant and grabs a knife but Rudeus stops her. After settling the matter with the family, the punishment is decided that after Aisha gives birth, she will study at Asura Royal Academy and Ars will continue his study at
Sharia
 while Leroy will be under the care of Lilia and Rudeus' family.

4 years later, Ars graduates and he tells Rudeus that he is ready to be with Aisha and races to Asura Kingdom to marry her who also graduated and is working under
Ariel Anemoi Asura
. Ars, Aisha and Leroy settles down in Sharia and buys a house but often visits the Greyrat House.

Trivia

As he exists now, he is now part of the canon because the story of his background was appeared in
Light Novel Extra Edition Volume 3
 following the deletion in the web novel.

His daughter, Feris Greyrat, is also part of the canon.

References

Lets Go Home
============

Let's Go Home
 (帰ろう)
Kaerou
) is the Twenty-third episode of the
second season
 (47th overall)
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on June 23, 2024 and also the fifth episode of the
Labyrinth Arc
 for the Anime.

Synopsis

After a fierce battle with the
Manatite Hydra
, Rudeus and the others rescued Zenith. The price was Rudeus' left arm and Paul's life. Furthermore, Zenith seemed to have lost her memory that causes Rudeus to be fall into regret and despair after the death of his father Paul. Then Roxy approaches him...

Plot

Devastated with Paul's death, Rudeus recalls his parents from his previous life and regrets not having paid his respects when they died.

At their Inn at Rapan, Rudeus is yet to come to terms with
Paul
's death and as he hold on to
Paul's Beloved Sword
, he thought out loud how he should have saved anyone from their
family
 but not him and he struggles on how to move forward. Roxy then enters the room and invites him to walk around the city but Rudeus refuses. Roxy then sits beside Rudeus and she tells him that she considers her
time
 at
Buena Village
 to be the happiest time of her life and being an
Adventurer
, people close to him can die and she has gone through
it in the past
. But Rudeus tells her that
her

parents
 are both fine and she does not understand in anger. Rudeus then realizes that he thought he was getting things right after being
reincarnated
 into the
Human World
, but he neglected the clashes of his family and he is still the same. Roxy consoles him and considers her life as a bliss in Buena Village that he sees Paul and Zenith like a second family. Rudeus gets up and walks away but Roxy grabs him by the hand and pushes him to the bed that surprises Rudeus as Roxy tells him to leave everything to her and they share a kiss...

Next morning, Rudeus wakes up and sees Roxy beside him who also wakes up and after getting dressed, they resume their talk where Roxy tells him to move forward and its what Paul would have wanted.

At the hallway, Elinalise sees Rudeus and Roxy come out of their room and realizes what has happened. Roxy then tells Rudeus that she needs to talk to Elinalise and he should go ahead and talk to Lilia.

At Zenith's room, Rudeus sees Lilia is feeding Zenith who is still unresponsive and apologizes for leaving her to care for her mother but Lilia assures her that it is her job since Paul has passed away and they talk about Zenith's condition who is physically well but lost her memory. Lilia then tells him of Shierra's findings that being trapped in the
Magic Crystal
 caused a magical impairment while Elinalise told her that she is unlikely to recover. Rudeus offers to help in caring for Zenith but Lilia tells him to focus on his own duty and it is what Paul wanted so Rudeus tells her that they should go
home
.

At the Southern Desert Region, Rudeus, Roxy, Elinalise, Talhand, Geese, Shierra, and Vierra are traveling in formation around the coach, where Zenith and Lilia are riding, being pulled by Jirou.
T-Rex Lizards
 then attack them where Rudeus and Roxy uses
Fireball
 against them while Elinalise, Talhand and Shierra
tanks
 them and Vierra uses
Protection Magic
 on the cart with Geese on
lookout
. They then reach a cliff side that Rudeus uses
Earth Lance
 to lift up the party instead of needing to climb it and when it begins to get dark, Rudeus creates an
Earth Fortress
 to shelter them for the night.

That night, Rudeus and Roxy are on guard duty by the campfire outside the Earth Fortress where Rudeus reflects on how he loves both Roxy and
Sylphiette
 and tells Roxy he is already
married
 and about to have a
child
. But Roxy tells him that Elinalise already told her and it was her choice to take advantage of him when he was mourning. Rudeus asks Roxy if he can repay her in anyway so Roxy tells him that she fell in love at first sight when Rudeus
rescued
 her. She then explains that since Sylphy is not here to support him, she did what she had to do since Elinalise and Geese planned to leave him alone while Lilia is busy taking care of Zenith. With all this happening, Roxy confesses she loves Rudeus in tears who tries to console her but she tells him she does not need to do anything.

At Lumen Forest, Rudeus' group are leaving the Teleportation Circle Ruins then Rudeus tells everyone to remove their blindfold to the surprise of everyone that they are now in a snowy forest and Roxy asks where they are so Rudeus tells her that they are in a forest near
Sharia
. Talhand is surprised that they are really at the Northern
Central Continent
 while Geese now understands how Rudeus and Elinalise
travelled
 to Rapan so fast to which Rudeus tells them keep this a secret and they resume their travel.

That night, while on guard duty. Elinalise confirms to Rudeus that neither him nor Sylphiette are members of the
Milis Religion
 unlike
Cliff Grimoire
 who is a devout follower and is only allowed to have 1 wife. With this said, Elinalise urges Rudeus to marry Roxy as she can't stand seeing Roxy like this and she is her close friend since they
travelled together
. Rudeus is still struggling on what to do as he recalls how he calls Paul a scumbag and now about to do what he
did
 to their family. Elinalise then asks how are Zenith and Lilia afterwards and is told that they were happy despite a rough start so Elinalise assures him that he can love Sylphiette and Roxy equally being Paul's son. But Rudeus does not know what Sylphy and Roxy will say so Elinalise leaves to calls Roxy to hear her thoughts on the matter.

Roxy approaches the campfire where Rudeus is on guard duty who tells her how her teachings saved her in his
journey
 and after gathering his courage and would rather be called a scumbag than having regrets, he tells Roxy to change her name to "Roxy Greyrat" and he loves her. Roxy while initially calm, she realizes what he means and manages to compose herself to tell him that they need to have Sylphiette's approval and they both agreed to leave it there for now. Roxy goes back to sleep and as the sun rises, Rudeus places his hand on Paul's Sword and as if talking to him, he tells Paul that they are the same.

Letter of Invitation (Episode)
==============================

Letter of Invitation
 (推薦状
Suisenjō
) is the fourth episode of the
second season

Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on July 30, 2023.

Synopsis

Rudeus, who had become impotent and let out the feelings he had been harbouring, hit it off with Soldat and later accepts his offer to
join him
 so they began to work together. While staying in the town of Pippin, Rudeus is visited by Elinalise, who was once a member of the same party as
Paul
,
Fangs of the Black Wolf
, and she as been traveling with
Roxy
. She gives Rudeus some information about
Zenith
.

Plot

Rudeus spends the next two years adventuring with Soldat's
Stepped Leader
 party, jumping from town to town, in hopes of spreading the story of Rudeus, eventually culminating in him slaying a
red dragon
 singlehandedly. He could not bring himself to go back to Rusenburg, because he knew Counter Arrow would only distract him from his main objective. Shortly after, in the city of Pippin, Elinalise finally catches up to Rudeus and informs him that Paul and Roxy had already set off to the
Maze City of Rapan
, Begaritt Continent to find
Zenith
 and takes around 1 year to travel. In the meantime, Rudeus decides to stay in the
northlands
 until winter passes before traveling to Rapan himself, and he quickly finds out about Elinalise's
sexual promiscuity
.

Some time later, Rudeus receives a letter from the Ranoa University of Magic inviting him to attend as a "special student" due to his recent exploits. Rudeus is intrigued, but wants to find Zenith first. That night, Rudeus encounters the Human-God in his dreams again, with Hitogami advising him to enroll at the University and investigate the
Teleport Incident
 there, promising that doing so will cure his erectile dysfunction. Rudeus is persuaded to accept the University's invitation and journeys to Ranoa with Elinalise. Meanwhile, it is shown that Sylphie, Ariel, and Zanoba are also students at the University.

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Soldat Heckler

Elinalise Dragonroad

Hitogami

Conrad

Cliff Grimoire
 (cameo)

Badigadi
 (cameo)

Sylphiette
 (cameo)

Ariel Anemoi Asura
 (cameo)

Nanahoshi Shizuka
 (cameo)

Luke Notos Greyrat
 (cameo)

Zanoba Shirone
 (cameo)

Linia Dedoldia
 (cameo)

Pursena Adoldia
 (cameo)

Locations

Central Continent

Basherant Kingdom

Pippin

Ranoa Kingdom

Sharia

Ranoa Magic Academy

Ogre Island

Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 8

Prologue: Quagmire, the Adventurer

Chapter 1: Letter of Invitation

Trailer

Library Labyrinth
=================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!





The
Princess Ariel Faction
 in the Library Labyrinth



The
Library Labyrinth
 is a castle owned by
Demon
 King
Beethove Tovetha
 where copies of books from all over the
Human World
 are stored.

Geography

The Library Labyrinth is a castle located deep in the Wraith Forest in the Hyleth Region of the
Demon Continent
.

Entry





Rudeus and Eris at the entry room of the Library Labyrinth in the Light Novel



"Good day to you, Demon King. A pleasure to make your acquaintance. I am Rudeus Greyrat. This is an incredible library you have here."

-
Rudeus Greyrat

While the physical entry to the Library Labyrinth is not revealed,
Orsted
 creates a
Magic Circle
 for Rudeus and the
Princess Ariel Faction
 to teleport into to the labyrinth where they will be inside the castle at a room with a stone floor and walls similar to
Dragon Tribe
 Ruins that also houses a Teleportation Circle. The only difference is the Library Labyrinth has a proper door and the room is filled with the smell of ink, parchment and mold even if there no books in the immediate area.

Background

"I am Demon King Beethove Tovetha, of the Nen Tribe. Welcome to my castle, Future Author-in-the-Making."

-Beethove Tovetha

Demon King
Beethove Tovetha
 of the Nen Tribe is described by Orsted to be a bookworm who uses his
All-Seeing Demon Eyes
 to make copies of books all over the
Human World
 that he stores in a castle that eventually is called the Library Labyrinth.

While the exact date when the Library Labyrinth is created by Beethove Tovetha is unknown, it has books accounting the life of
Kaunis Freean Asura
 during the
Laplace Wars
, implying that Beethove Tovetha has been creating books for the Library Labyrinth for 400 years or even earlier.

Population

The Library Labyrinth is the home of Beethove Tovetha where he spends his time recreating books. There is also a bunch of
Monsters
 mostly comprise of an enormous number of knee high bipedal
ants
 who dig through the walls and making shelves to house the created books, smaller
slimes
 who collects the resulting rubble by the ants and reform those in their bodies to more book shelves. Finally
Cthulhu Snails
 who protects the Library Labyrinth from enemies.

Despite being a labyrinth that has monsters that normally attack any intruders like the
Teleportation Labyrinth
, they act as familiars of Beethove Tovetha but they are not aggressive and don't attack intruders to the point that they don't even spare a glance at them and continue with their work when they spot them.

Plot

"The vast majority of literature about Kaunis Freean Asura is grouped together by publication date. It would be difficult to gather everything ever written about him, but you would still find more in there than you would in Asura's national library."

-Orsted

After Rudeus is defeated by Orsted in their
second battle
, Rudeus becomes Orsted's subordinate and is given the mission to make
Ariel Anemoi Asura
 to be the next queen of
Asura Kingdom
. In order to accomplish this, the
Princess Ariel Faction
 needs the backing of
Perugius Dola
 who questions Ariel what is the trait of a true king like his friend
Kaunis Freean Asura
 and Ariel's ancestor.
 Since then, Ariel has been staying at the
Chaos Breaker
 as a guest of Perugius but is struggling to find the answer.

Rudeus informs Ariel that they can learn more about Kaunis in the Library Labyrinth as suggsted by Orsted to which Ariel immediately accepts and with the use of Orsted's Teleportation Circle the Princess Ariel Faction enters the Libary Labyrinth

Initially, they were on guard but the monsters on the Library does not attack and simply ignores them when they see Ariel's group so they begin to search for information about Kaunis. Days later, the monsters nor Beethove Tovetha has shown no hostilities towards the Princess Ariel Faction so Rudeus tries to communicate with Beethove Tovetha and he is successfully able to do so by communicating with writing. After showing Beethove Tovetha the book provided by Orsted, he gives Rudeus the journal of
Derrick Redbat
 and he shows it to Princess Ariel.

References

=================

 is the 83rd chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Volume 1

Light Novel
===========

Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation
 (無職転生 〜異世界行ったら本気だす〜
Mushoku Tensei: Isekai Ittara Honki Dasu
) is a series of
high fantasy
 light novel written by Japanese author
Rifujin na Magonote
 featuring illustrations by
Shirotaka
. Set in a fictional
swords and sorcery
-styled world known as the
Six-Faced World
, the story follows a jobless recluse getting involved in a traffic accident who ends up getting reincarnated as
Rudeus Greyrat
, son of a village knight and a healer. The series is structured as a
coming-of-age
 story of Rudeus journeying through the experiences of growing up and leading a decent life, something he never achieved in his past life.

The series began with the first book released on January 23, 2014, by
Media Factory
 under their MF Books imprint. The main story concluded with the 26th volume released on November 25, 2022.

Background

Mushoku Tensei originated as a
web novel
 series authored by Rifujin na Magonote. The web novel began serialization on November 22, 2012 on the user-generated website
Shōsetsuka ni Naro
 and it quickly gained recognition on the site.
 The series was soon licensed by
Kadokawa
 under
Media Factory
's
MF Books
 imprint and officially began its light novel series publication on January 23, 2014 featuring illustrations by
Shirotaka
.

A
manga
 adaptation of the light novel illustrated by
Yuka Fujikawa
 began shortly after on May 2, 2014, published by Media Factory and serialized in
Monthly Comic Flapper
 magazine.
. And a TV-series
anime
 adaptation produced by
Egg Firm
 and animated by
Studio Bind
 began on January 10, 2021.

Seven Seas Entertainment
 licensed the light novel under their
Airship
 imprint for localization in English on July 18, 2018.
 The first paperback volume was launched on May 21, 2019. A revised edition of the first 9 volumes of the English light novel was issued on March 2021 following claims of content censorship.

Plot

An unnamed 34-year-old Japanese NEET is evicted from his home following his parents' death. Upon some self-introspection, he concludes that his life was ultimately pointless. He intercepts a speeding truck heading towards a group of teenagers in an attempt to do something meaningful for once in his life and manages to pull one of them out of harm's way before dying. Awakening in a baby's body, he realizes he has been reincarnated in a world of sword and sorcery. He resolves to become successful in his new life, discarding his past identity for his new life as Rudeus Greyrat. Due to inherited affinity and early training, Rudeus becomes highly skilled at magic. During his childhood, he becomes a student of demon magician Roxy Migurdia, a friend to demihuman Sylphiette, and magic teacher to noble heiress Eris Boreas Greyrat.

Light Novel Extra Edition Volume 1
==================================

Information

Summary

Light Novel Extra Edition Volume 1 (無職転生　～蛇足編～1 lit: Mushoku Tensei Extra Edition 1)
, also known as
Mushoku Tensei: Redundant Reincarnation Volume 1
 in the English release is the first volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 Light Novel Extra Edition, which covers the prologue and first chapter of the
Redundancy

web Novel
.

Synopsis

The story after the decisive battle...

After the decisive battle in the Kingdom of Biheiril,
Rudeus Greyrat
 won.
A collection of stories depicting the aftermath of the people surrounding him!

The first volume of the series covers
Norn Greyrat
's marriage story - "Wedding of Norn", "Lucy and Papa" depicting
Lucy Greyrat
's first
school
 attendance,
Doga
 and
Isolte Cruel
's matchmaking story - "
Seven Knights of Asura
 Story", a newly written short story depicting
Ghislaine Dedoldia
's homecoming as well as four chapters of "The
Woman
 Who Was Once Called a "Mad Dog".

The story after the fierce battle is here!

Light Novel Extra Edition Volume 2
==================================

Information

Summary

Light Novel Extra Edition Volume 2
 also known as
Mushoku Tensei: Redundant Reincarnation Volume 2
 in the English release is the second volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 Light Novel Extra Edition, which covers  fourth, fifth and sixth chapter of the
Redundancy

web Novel
.

In January 19, 2024, the official X (formerly known as Twitter) of the series @MFBooks_Edit tweeted the release date of Volume 2 is on May 24, 2024 that has the cover page and is available for pre-order for either the regular edition and deluxe edition where the deluxe edition includes an "acrylic stand illustration"

Synopsis

A deluxe special edition that includes a special acrylic stand with the second volume of the book “Extra Edition”!!

Rudeus Greyrat
 was victorious after a decisive battle in the Kingdom of Biheiril.

A collection of stories depicting the aftermath of Rudeus and the people surrounding him, "The Extra Edition".

The second volume of the series includes "Let's Make an Automaton!" the story about the production of an
automaton
 and the troubles that come with it, and "
Millis Diary
" which describes the journey that Rudeus planned to make memories with his family and additional perspectives of
Eris
,
Kalman III
, and
Orsted
. In addition to "The God Who Lives in the
Holy Land of Swords
", which tells the story of Rudeus' visit to the current
Sword God

Jino Britts
, it also includes four newly written short stories, "Children of the
Greyrat
", which depict the daily lives of the children of Rudeus.

Life continues even after the decisive battle.

What are Rudeus' thoughts and what will he do after that...?

A life-over-reincarnation fantasy, a story that continues after the main story, the second in the series!

And, you will also receive an acrylic stand with an illustration of
Sylphiette
,
Roxy
,
Eris
, and others!

Light Novel Extra Edition Volume 3
==================================

Information

Summary

Light Novel Extra Edition Volume 3
 also known as
Mushoku Tensei: Redundant Reincarnation Volume 3
 is the upcoming third volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 Light Novel Extra Edition.

On April 4, 2025, the official X of the series @MFBooks_Edit tweeted the release date of Volume 3 is on June 25, 2025

Synopsis

A special edition with an acrylic stand featuring an original illustration by Shirotaka-sensei!

After the decisive battle in the Kingdom of Beheril, Rudeus Greyrat was victorious. The "Extra Edition" is a collection of stories that depict what happened to him and the people around him afterwards.

The third volume of the series includes the long story which revolves around the elopement of Rudeus' son Ars. This special edition depicts the family's greatest crisis from both Rudeus and Ars' perspectives!

Life continues even after the decisive battle. What will Rudeus think and do after that...?

The third volume of the series of life-restarting reincarnation fantasy stories that weave together the aftermath of the main story!

And you can get an acrylic stand with an original illustration by Shirotaka-sensei of Rudeus and Eris in your hands!
A deluxe special edition that includes the third volume of the "Stolen Amount" book with a special acrylic stand!!

Light Novel Special Book
========================

Mushoku Tensei ~ Isekai Ittara Honki Dasu ~ Special Book
 (無職転生 ～異世界行ったら本気だす～ スペシャルブック), also known as
A Journey of Two Lifetimes
 is a volume celebrating the release of the final volume featuring a chronology of Rudeus life, various unique story and illustrations and an interview of
Shirotaka
.

Contents

A special collection of new stories, art, and more after the finale of the bestselling Mushoku Tensei light novels that inspired the hit anime!

The epic journey has reached its conclusion, but plenty of stories are left to tell for the Jobless Reincarnation cast! Return to the Six-Faced World with this special collection of new adventures while catching up with your favorite characters. This treasure trove of Mushoku Tensei works includes:

The publication history of Mushoku Tensei

The life chronology of Rudeus Greyrat

“Message of Congratulations,” a special manga from various artists

Four brand-new short stories

Special featured story written by Rifujin na Magonote

Exclusive long-form interview

Illustrations

Light Novel Volume 1
====================

Information

Summary

This is the first volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 light novel.

Synopsis

English (Seven Seas)
DEATH IS ONLY THE BEGINNING!

Kicked out by his family and wandering the streets, an unemployed 34-year-old shut-in thinks he’s hit rock-bottom—just as he’s hit and killed by a speeding truck! Awakening to find himself reborn as an infant in a world of swords and sorcery, but with the memories of his first life intact,
Rudeus Greyrat
 is determined not to repeat his past mistakes. He’s going to make the most of this reincarnation as he sets off on the adventure of a second lifetime!.

Synopsis from Seven Seas.

Chapters

Prologue

Chapter 1: Is This Another World?

Chapter 2: The Creeped-Out Maid

Chapter 3: A Textbook of Magic

Chapter 4: Master

Chapter 5: Swords and Sorcery

Chapter 6: Reasons for Respect

Chapter 7: Friends

Chapter 8: Obliviousness

Chapter 9: Emergency Family Meeting

Chapter 10: Stunted Growth

Chapter 11: Parted

Extra Chapter: The Mother of the Greyrat Family

Anime Special Edition

In commemoration of the anime, Volume 1 was re-released with a new cover. This version includes a special 24 pages booklet with a new short-story Named "Sylphiette and etiquette" and a showcasing the anime and light novel versions of the character designs of Rudeus, Sylphiette and Lilia.

  is a original chapter narrating how Zenith met Paul and her personal experience in the Greyrat Household.
