Light Novel Volume 1/Summary
============================

Information

Summary

Prologue

A thirty-four-years-old unemployed and reclusive man is disowned and kicked out of the house by his siblings following the death of their parents. As he wanders along the streets aimlessly reflecting upon his ugly and regretful past he suddenly notices a truck speeding towards a group of three students. Realizing the students had not noticed the out-of-control-truck headed for them, the man rushes in with the intent to pull them away only for him to end up directly in line with the truck's path. He is pinned by the massive truck against a wall ultimately killing him.

Chapter 1: Is This Another World?

As he opened his eyes, he is blinded by a dazzling light but as soon as it lifts away he notices a young woman and a man of about the same age; they seem to be talking in an unfamiliar language. He then realized, to his dread, he could not move his body believing he had woken up after the accident with his limbs lost. A month later, he finally sums his situation; he had been reborn with his memories intact and he is no longer in Japan, and the two persons he saw was most likely his parents now. Half a year later, he quickly begins to pick up on the language and learns to crawl around the house finding out they lived far out in the countryside with a maid on staff. One afternoon, he happens to catch a glimpse of his father practicing sword swings in the yard. Surprised by his odd behavior he slips from the window and hits his head which caused his mother to immediately run up to him. He is again taken aback when his grief-stricken mother recites an incantation of sorts, thinking it was silly, but in the next moment his pain was gone. In the wake of it all, he ultimately comes to an understanding - he has been reincarnated into a radically different world of swords and sorcery. Feeling as if this is his formerly unattainable second chance in life, he decides he would live his life right this time with his former life's experiences to help him.

Chapter 2: The Creeped-Out Maid

Lilia's point of view

Lilia used to be a royal handmaiden and a guardswoman at the Asura Palace. After her leg was caught in an assassin's dagger her movements were still hindered after recovery, leading to her being discharged from her position. Wanting to not put her life in danger again, she arrived at the Fittoa Region where she eventually found a new job in the remote Buena Village. Her employer happened to be her former swordsmanship acquaintance, Paul Greyrat, who was in search of a house-maid following the pregnancy of his wife Zenith. Their newborn, Rudeus, was an unsettling child—Lilia thought—reminding her of unpleasant memories of a depraved minister during her days at the Asura Palace. For the first year, she lived in fear of the child believing he was possessed by a demon. But soon, Rudeus began to change; he would hole up in Paul's study all day and Lilia sensed earnestness and diligence from him in contrast to his crude dullness from just a few months earlier. With nothing to fear about the boy any longer, Lilia figured it was best to leave the boy well enough alone.

Chapter 3: A Textbook of Magic

It had roughly been two years since he was reincarnated as Rudeus and he could now walk and talk in the world's language. Having decided to live his life properly this time, he makes an effort to study and learn various things about the world. He grows particularly attached to a beginner's textbook on magic where he is engrossed over the concept. Wanting to get practical, he recites an incantation to successfully conjure a Water Ball; to his surprise, he manages to conjure up the second and third silently with intuition alone but was physically drained by the fourth due to mana exhaustion. He spends the following days trying to get behind the mechanism of projectile magic and investigating how his mana reserves expand by draining mana everyday. Finally, wanting to start experimentations on magic he decides to build up his magical potential by regularly exhausting his mana.

Chapter 4: Master

Rudeus turned three-years-old, and one day he accidentally blasts a hole in the wall practicing magic. Paul and Zenith rushed in only to end up confused and astonished by the sight. Confirming Rudeus's aptitude for magic they decide Rudeus would learn magic under a private tutor in the morning and swordsmanship with Paul in the afternoons. They eventually hired a magic tutor and contrary to what Rudeus had imagined a magic tutor should look like, a young blue-haired girl called Roxy Migurdia shows up at their doorstep. Roxy initially thinks Paul and Zenith had overestimated their three-year-old's talent but quickly, she is shocked by Rudeus's ablity to silently cast spells and acknowledges his aptitude. From the following day onwards, Rudeus spent the mornings practicing magic with Roxy, physical training with Paul in the afternoons, and then spell experimentations by himself in the evenings. Rudeus soon becomes an Intermediate-ranked mage after four months of diligence and his knowledge of the world progressively starts to expand thanks to Roxy's lectures. During their lessons, he learns Roxy is actually a demon while proceeding to take note of an especially dangerous race of demons called the Superds to never mess with them should he encounter them. After roughly another year, Rudeus successfully advances to Advanced ranked in all branches of magic.

Chapter 5: Swords and Sorcery

Rudeus is now celebrating his fifth birthday. In this world it is customary to celebrate on the fifth and tenth birthday, and finally on the fifteenth when one is considered an adult. Paul gifts him a real sword and a practice sword, a botanical encyclopedia from Zenith, and a wand from Roxy. The following day while practicing swordplay Paul expresses his worries Rudeus might not be interested in learning swordsmanship at all as he was more proficient in magic. At the end, Rudeus comforts him by showing his determination to learn the way of the sword. But again, during the middle of his class Roxy relays her thoughts to Rudeus that he could strive to become a knight instead of a mage. While Paul saw in Rudeus a talent for magic, Roxy saw in him a passion for the sword. Rudeus is concerned over this situation but before he could give his answer Roxy abruptly mentions his graduation is coming up very soon, leaving him in disbelief.

Chapter 6: Reasons for Respect

Roxy had decided his graduation examination would be held outside the house. Rudeus is reluctant and nervous about this idea but Roxy ultimately forces him into riding out with her. As they rode through the village, Rudeus is burdened with anxiety when the villagers gaze towards their direction. However, soon enough he realizes they are not looking at him but Roxy, who despite being a demon had made a name for herself. Rudeus sensed her trustworthy presence and finally calms down. After an hour they stop at a desolate grassland and Roxy then instructs she was going to cast the Water Saint-level spell Cumulonimbus. After her demonstration Roxy informs the test was that he should attempt the same spell himself with the goal of maintaining the effects for an hour. Rudeus starts to chant the incantation but for his own convenience he applies scientific methods from his previous world to keep the spell's effects steady for an hour without expending mana. Roxy, taken aback by his feat, ends the examination on the spot an grants him the "Water Saint" title. The next day, before departing, Roxy gifts Rudeus her amulet of the Migurd tribe to get him out of trouble when demons were included. As she finally goes on her way to explore the world and hone her magic more, Rudeus found the most profound sense of respect for Roxy remembering all the invaluable knowledge she had given and for taking him to the outside world.

Chapter 7: Friends

Rudeus was no longer frightened by the outside world; venturing outside, greeting the villagers and exploring the surrounding lands is now routine to him. One day he decides to make his way up a small hill to scout the village's layout but instead he ends up encountering three kids abusing a lone boy covered in mud. Eventually, Rudeus steps in and successfully drive the bullies away by flinging magic mudballs and rescues the boy. After washing off the filth off the boy, Rudeus is surprised to find he had a very pretty face with emerald-green hair and the boy revealed himself to be a half-elf. Later that day when they went to play on the hill Sylph, the boy, showed an earnest determination to learn magic from Rudeus. Affirming to his desire, Rudeus begins tutoring him. The sun had gone down went Rudeus returns home only to find a vexed Paul waiting for him. Paul had been misinformed by one of the bullies' parent that Rudeus had punched their son, and now Paul demands Rudeus an apology absolutely refusing to his side of the story and eventually ended up striking him. Rudeus, annoyed by Paul's stubbornness, proceeds to break his conscience with words leading to a heavy-hearted Paul apologizing instead. Rudeus, now relieved that he was finally willing to listen, explains the full story and goes on to comfort Paul who was feeling miserable as a parent.

Paul's point of view

It was an afternoon, one of the villagers came to Paul and complained his son, Rudeus, had punched their kid. Paul decided he would need to scold his son properly on how he needed to be very careful with the power he wields. But that evening when Paul demanded an apology, Rudeus had no intention whatsoever of apologizing and led to him out striking Rudeus in the face out of reflex. Rudeus started to speak venomously and slowly Paul came to a realization, while he was trying to get his son apologize for his wrong usage of power, he himself had hit him in the heat of the moment; he was now in the wrong and had to apologize. After hearing the full story he was relived to hear it was not Rudeus' fault after all. Paul felt miserable for repeating the same mistakes as his late father and his immatureness but Rudeus didn't blame Paul. In the end he comforted Paul to learn from this and Paul felt proud to have an understanding son.

Chapter 8: Obliviousness

Rudeus turned six, his day-to-day life had not changed much and he was still stuck at a level in swordsmanship. Daily magic training with Sylph is now a daily routine and he had made remarkable progress over the year. Now Sylph is eager too learn silent spellcasting like Rudeus. To Rudeus' surprise, he is able to pull off silent spellcasting at first try and his self notions of being special disappears. But before they could continue, a downpour came and they rush back to the Greyrat estate in soaked clothes. In the bath, Sylph particularly objects getting naked but Rudeus, wanting to pick on him, suddenly strips him. To his shock, Sylph was not a boy as he had preconceived but a girl after all.

【Paul's

POV

】

Paul came home from work to find his son assaulting his only friend Sylphiette. When he asked for the reason Rudeus only apologized deeply unlike how he snapped back previously. Seeing his boy utterly dejected made Paul a bit uneasy. He directed to Rudeus, if he wanted forgiveness then he needed to apologize to Sylphiette. Rudeus immediately apologized to Sylphiette for his behavior -  he thought she was a boy due to her short hair. When he heard the apology, for the first time Paul felt his son was dumber than he imagined.

【Rudeus' POV

】

After a lot of apologies, compliments, and reassurances, Rudeus finally got Sylphie to forgive him. He found out her name was actually Sylphiette and figured he would call her “Sylphie”. But ever since that incident, Sylphie had very been wary of him.

One day, on Paul’s advice, Rudeus went to Sylphie hoping to reconcile with her, but her reply made him realize he himself was the barrier all along. He had been treating her differently ever since he found out she was a girl. As a result, Syphie didn’t know how to react. Understanding she wanted normalcy, Rudeus decided he would treat like he did before and try his best not to fluster her.

Chapter 9: Emergency Family Meeting

Zenith had learned she was pregnant. The Greyrat household was abuzz at the announcement. It was a day of bubbling joy and countless smiles. The problem didn’t arise until about a month later. Their maid, Lilia, had discovered that she was pregnant, as well. The family was in shock. Paul nervously blurted out the child might be his. And thus was convened an emergency family meeting.

Lilia first proposed she would give birth in Fittoa and then raise the baby back in her hometown. However, Zenith immediately rejected the idea since it was physically impossible not only for the mother but also for the newborn. Zenith was grappling with two separate emotions: her fondness for Lilia and her feelings of betrayal. Rudeus, not wanting to see his family break apart, decided he would help Lilia to solve the problem. He cleverly came up with a plan that used Lilia as the victim of Paul, evidently Paul being the scapegoat. Rudeus turned to his mother and deceitfully crafted a story of Paul making moves on Lilia, and Lilia not able to defy the master giving in to his desires. Paul was in shock by the development but Lilia was able to play along; Rudeus pushed a bit further and Zenith consequently gave in. She finally announced Lilia would be staying with them as family.

【

Lilia’s POV

】

Lilia was the one who seduced Paul. She no initial intention but, after hearing Zenith and Paul release lascivious sounds night after night and to clean a room that scented of a very satisfied man and woman – she had her needs building up.

That came crashing when Zenith got pregnant. Knowing Paul had an abundance of libido, it got into Lilia’s head that this was her opportunity, and invited him to her room. All in all, she blamed herself.

But to her surprise, Rudeus forgave her.  Even though he must have already sensed Lilia was purposely avoiding him, he chose her and her child over his feelings and came up with a plan that allowed her to stay at the house. He has truly earned her respect. Lilia decided at that moment, once her child has grown up, she would see that they made their way into Rudeus’ service.

【

Lilia’s POV – end

】

Several months had passed. Rudeus felt Lilia had begun to open up to him bit by bit ever since that incident.

Soon after, Zenith gave birth. It was a rough experience, with Lilia in her own difficult condition. With the help of a midwife from the village. The birth was a success, to Rudeus’ joy, a baby girl was born. The relief was short-lived, however, as Lilia went into labour as well. Rudeus quickly prepared all the things with magic and the midwife handled the rest. Another girl was born.

Zenith’s daughter was named Norn. Lilia’s daughter was named Aisha.

Chapter 10: Stunted Growth

Rudeus turned seven years old and his sisters were growing quickly. Recently, he had not been able to advance in his swordsmanship at all, still cemented at Beginner level. Surpassing Paul, who was Advanced-level in all three schools and heavily experienced, now seemed nothing more like a pipe dream.

One day, while they were in sword practice, Paul brought up the topic of school. Rudeus was curious about it, but Paul immediately put off that idea. Instead, he recommended trying out adventuring and venture into labyrinths. Rudeus wanted to give it a shot but assessed it was impossible for him as a peaceful life suited him more. Their conversation was interrupted by Sylphie.

Sylphie had been coming to Rudeus’ house to study. Discerning how rapidly Sylphie was growing, Rudeus felt like she’d leave him in the dust in no time. He sighed audibly about having no choice but to go to school or adventuring to learn more things, but to Rudeus’ surprise, Sylphie threw herself at him and obstinately rejected about him leaving the village. Seeing her not wanting him to go away, Rudeus had creeping thoughts - maybe he could just stay at the village with Sylphie and enjoy a slow life. Suddenly, a letter arrived.

The letter addressed to Rudeus, was from Roxy. It opened up by explaining how she had been living as a magic tutor as the court magician at Shirone Kingdom, tutoring the prince. She revealed she had finally achieved Kingly-level Water spells and was walking towards being a Divine-level magician. She wholeheartedly believed, Rudeus must have already achieved Imperial-level or even reached Saintly-level in all other branches and finally recommended her alma mater, the Ranoa University of Magic if Rudeus should want to pursue higher magical studies.

The letter was a wake-up call for Rudeus. His respected master was expecting even greater achievements from him, while just now he had been thinking it was fine to stay at the current level forever.

Rudeus thought he couldn’t leave Sylphie behind, and decided he would ask his father to pay for both their fees. However, Paul out-rightly shot down his request. Rudeus agreed to his Paul's explanation why he couldn't, but asked him to search for a job so that he can earn Sylphie’s fees for university to which Paul agreed.

【
Paul’s POV
 】

Paul wasn’t expecting that. His son was only seven but he was already talking about university and getting jobs to earn fees.

During his adventuring days, Paul remembered someone telling him – rush too fast through your life, and your life will end before you know it. He thought it was a load of crap; Paul was someone who rushed through life, he believed humans had a very limited window of time. But now, Rudeus sprinting forward so fast it made Paul nervous about letting him go.

Recently, Paul also sensed Sylphie had been attached to Rudeus too much. Sylphie needed to learn to stand on her own. Paul thought they might need some time part.

And so with those prospects in mind, Paul wrote a letter.

【
Paul’s POV – end
 】

Chapter 11: Parted

One morning, during sword practice, Paul abruptly asked Rudeus what he would do if he had to stop seeing Sylphie. But before Rudeus
could form a proper answer, as if Paul had already known the answer, he suddenly unleashed bloodlust and leaped towards Rudeus.

Rudeus was bewildered at the sudden dramatic change; he felt the cold and silent death – Paul – rushing towards him. Out of pure instinct, he immediately created a blast with magic that launched him backward, but to his no surprise, Paul immediately closed the distance. Rudeus had to catch both his legs at once; but before he finished prepping Paul was one step away from him! In a blind panic, Rudeus swung a careless attack with his sword, which Paul skillfully deflected. Rudeus already knew for a fact a counterstrike was coming, but he couldn’t do anything – a short, sharp blow came down to his neck and he blacked out.

Rudeus woke up and found himself tied up inside a box. Across him sat a woman – brown skin, muscular physique, with animal ears and tails. She introduced herself as Ghislaine and that she was going to be his acquaintance. Rudeus looked outside the window in the box and saw they were moving across a land he knew nothing of. He was in a carriage, tied up, and on an unfamiliar land – alarms went inside Rudeus’ head. When he asked the woman about the situation, Ghislaine handed out a letter from Paul.

He read the letter, Rudeus finally understood what was going on. Paul had beaten him unconscious and sent him away for a job. The job required him to stay at the Citadel of Roa for five years to tutor a violent young lady. And he would get swordsmanship training from Ghislaine, who Paul remarked as a Sword King, while he would also coach her on basic education. Additionally, in five years, once he finishes providing the young lady solid education, his contract entitles him to a special reward: a payment covering the cost of tuition for two people to the University of Magic.

【
Paul's POV
】

Paul’s son, Rudeus, was lying unconscious on the ground. This method wasn’t particularly an admirable one but Paul came to the conclusion he had no choice. He was trying to beat his son unconscious to send him away for a job he would most likely refuse if presented to him directly.

Paul was surprised by how well Rudeus responded the instant he made the first move. Though the fight lasted for only a few seconds, it actually took Paul three steps to strike him, which one too many to deal with a magician. Paul was proud of his son's knack for battle.

Paul proceeded to hand over his letter for Rudeus to Ghislaine and unceremoniously dumped Rudeus in the carriage. Looking at the carriage moving away down the road Paul silently addressed to Rudeus. He had never wanted to part this way but felt he could not have convinced Rudeus to take the job. Still, as a father, Paul couldn’t just do nothing and had to rely on this crude method. He expected his clever son to understand sooner or later. Paul knew his son would have some harsh experiences, but just like him, he wholeheartedly believed Rudeus would grow stronger and find things he loved that way. After all, he was his own son.

【
Paul's POV - end
】

Extra Chapter: The Mother of the Greyrat Family

【
Zenith’s POV
】

Zenith Greyrat, born in the Holy Country of Millis and by birth a member of the aristocracy, was a clueless child who did everything her parents told. As a member of the aristocracy, her life had already been set down the road. But she didn’t end up following it. Zenith’s life changed forever on her fifteenth birthday. She had a terrible fight with her parents and ran away from home. She had been sick of letting her parents control her life.

Zenith was hopelessly naïve. A band of thugs spotted her immediately and out her into their party as a healer. But, to her luck, a man came to her rescue and dragged Zenith into his own party. That was how she met her
husband – Paul Greyrat. Zenith and Paul were total opposites in how they lived their lives, but she slowly grew attracted to him.

She slept with Paul one fateful day, but to her carelessness she got pregnant after a single night. To her incredible surprise, Paul did the honorable thing to marry her. Then she bore his child, his name was Rudeus Greyrat.

⌊
Timeskip: post-Chapter 9
 ⌋

At the moment, Zenith was watching Rudeus. He crouched next to his little sisters’ cribs. Whenever they made a fuss he would make a silly face to amuse them; it always ended with a satisfied grin on his face. It wasn’t a usual occurence. Rudeus always had the most serious expression on; he never looked particularly satisfied. But now, he was making silly faces to amuse his little sisters. Seeing him like that put Zenith in a good mood herself.

Zenith recalled the early years with Rudeus. She felt he secretly looked down on the rest of the family due to his incredible talent. But Zenith had it all wrong. She realized it in the midst of their greatest family crisis. Rudeus stepped in to guide things to a neat conclusion. She, at that time, understood that he did love his family in his own way.

Suddenly, Zenith was waken up from memories by Norn's cry. It was time for her milk; Zenith proceeded to feed her. Norn looked satisfied and put her away in her crib. But then, Aisha started to cry next. After checking up on her Rudeus turned towards Zenith with an anxious face. He said Aisha was hungry too and Lilia was out at the moment. For a moment, Zenith thought if breastfeeding Aisha would make her feel anger or revulsion. But immediately she shook off her uncertainty and picked up Aisha. When she started to feed, she felt nothing other than her warm, pleasant awareness of motherhood just like with Norn. She was truly glad.

Zenith was looking out of the window stroking Rudeus’ head beside her. Outside was a peaceful spring afternoon, golden fields of wheat stretched out endlessly. She felt utterly content. The peace they had now was only because Rudeus intervened that day.
Thank god for Rudeus
, she thought.

【
Zenith's POV - end
】

’ life beckons as he throws himself into his research, house-hunting, and planning a wedding. But then an unexpected letter, bearing shocking news, arrives to interrupt the young couple’s domestic dreams. It seems the past still isn’t done with Rudeus, and neither is a certain
mysterious white-masked girl!

What happens when all hope is shattered beyond recall?

Light Novel Volume 13/Summary
=============================

Chapter 1: Roxy's New Job

The chapter opens a couple months later after the return from the
Begaritt Continent
.
Rudeus
 and
Roxy
 wake after their night together. A flashback occurs and takes place a month after the return from the Begaritt Continent. Roxy tells Rudeus that she wants to become a teacher at
Ranoa Magic Academy
. They decide to head to the school in order for Roxy to become a teacher. When they arrive at Vice Principal
Jinas
 office, they see him at his table with piles of paperwork as usual. Upon seeing Roxy, his old student, Jinas was shocked. Roxy tells Jinas that she wants to become a teacher much to Jinas surprise. As they start talking, Rudeus leaves the room as he felt left out in the conversation. Rudeus heads to Zanoba’s research room.
Zanoba
, upon seeing Rudeus is shocked as just 6 months ago Rudeus told Zanoba he was going to come back in 2 years. Zanoba shows Rudeus what he’s been working on for the past half year. It was a glove like magic tool that can be used as a left hand for Rudeus which he had lost. Rudeus comes up with
Zariff’s Prosthetic Hand
 as a name for the hand since Zanoba and Cliff worked to make it. After a bit of talking, Roxy enters the room and tells Rudeus that she got the job. After, Rudeus goes around and introduces Roxy to his friends such as
Rinia
,
Pursena
,
Ariel
,
Luke
 and
Nanahoshi
. He didn’t go to Cliff because there were sultry sounds coming from his room and didn’t want to interfere. They leave school and head home but Rudeus realizes that’s he didn’t introduce Roxy and his wife. Rudeus says that he will eventually introduce her as his second wife.

Chapter 2: Year Three

Rudeus
 gets up and gets prepared to go to
school
 for his third year. Before anything, he takes a look at his daughter
Lucy
. Rudeus had thoughts of Lucy being someone reincarnated but quickly brushed that aside. They also hire a nurse to take care of Lucy when they’re at school. They eat breakfast and head to the school. At the entrance, they encounter
Rinia
 and
Pursena
. Upon hearing about Rudeus’s second wife, they tell
Sylphy
 to not get outclassed. Sylphy makes a expression that’s shows discomfort and Rudeus thought that she was feeling uneasy on the inside. Loudly, Rudeus announced that he loved Sylphy and the people cheered. He then said that he also loved
Roxy
 which most people booed at since most of the people were believers of Millis. Slyphy, visibly embarrassed, hurries to get to her duties. It was at this point that Rudeus remembered that in school she was Fittz. Roxy also hurries away after finding out there was a morning gathering for teacher. Rudeus then heads to homeroom. He then finds out from Rinia and Pursena that there are many rumors going around on how Rudeus lost his left hand.
Cliff
 then calls Rudeus over and asks why he hadn’t greeted him upon his return. Rudeus states that it was because he sounded really busy with
Elinalise
 so he decided not to bother. The homeroom teacher walks in with Roxy and states that Roxy will be their homeroom teacher next year as he is returning to his hometown. Roxy introduces herself as “Roxy M. Greyrat” and also says that she was Rudeus’s second wife. Cliff was visibly upset upon hearing the news however, since Rudeus wasn’t a Milis believer, he calmed down. Later, Rudeus heads home with Sylphy and Roxy. Rudeus then describes his life at home afterschool. Roxy prepares for her classes tomorrow,
Aisha
 makes dinner, Sylphy cuddles with Lucy but occasionally trains her magic and
Lilia
 took care of
Zenith
. When everyone was asleep at night, Rudeus sneaks into the basement, into a secret room to pray in front of the “holy relic”.

Chapter 3: Training with Norn

The chapter opens a month later.
Rudeus
 is seen waking up and grabbing a stone sword he had made to use as a practice sword.
Norn
, in her gym outfit goes outside to train with Rudeus. They do workouts just so that they can get Norn’s body in shape and ready to learn the sword. After the workout, Norn asks Rudeus if she could start learning the sword. Rudeus thought for a second and then agreed but warned Norn that he was going to be strict. Norn agreed. In the evening, Rudeus and Norn is seen in the third external training ground near
Ranoa Magic Academy
. Rudeus warns Norn on quitting learning the sword, which includes the fact that Rudeus won’t teach her again and that Rudeus would never allow Norn to use
Paul’s
 sword. They start by running with a sword in hand as in a battlefield, you need to know how to run fast with a sword in hand. Rudeus also discovered that Norn is reluctant to hitting someone with full force so Rudeus offers to stand still and be a dummy for Norn. Eventually, she gets rid of her reluctance to hit people. They spar at the end which Rudeus wins without even trying. As Rudeus was applying healing magic to
Norn
, he spots a bunch of onlookers. Rudeus tells Norn to leave and change. He then walks over to the onlookers and asks what they were doing. They were all scared to speak at first but one of them eventually said something. He said that Rudeus was bullying Norn as she never expressed the want to learn how to use the sword according to him. He also stated that he forced Norn to learn the sword. Rudeus quickly clears up the misconceptions telling them that she was his sister and that she’s training by her own will.
Rudeus
 discovers that this group of onlookers was like a fan club for Norn.
Rudeus
 establishes a fan club for Norn consisting of around 30 members and also making rules on contacting Norn. Three days later, Rudeus was kicked out of the fan club for bathing with Norn.

Chapter 4: Can I Keep Him?

Aisha
 was seen in the garden caring for the plants with
Zenith
. They were pulling out weeds.
Rudeus
 then remembers a time when Zenith would always spend her time pulling out weeds from her garden. Aisha then tells Rudeus to wait in her room because she wants to show him something. Later, Rudeus goes to Aisha’s room. He looks around the room and notes what’s inside. He stated that the room was perfectly clean from top to bottom. He also states how there were plants near the window and how there was a doll that’s looked like a magician on her bed. He also checked out her closet which has maid clothes, panties, shirts and other girly clothes. All of them were neatly folded or hanged. Suddenly, Rudeus hears sound coming from somewhere. He looks everywhere until he finds out that one of the plants was a
Treant
. Aisha then enters the room. They argue about whether or not to keep the Treant. Aisha threatens to tell
Sylphy
 and
Roxy
 about the hidden shrine in the basement. Just then, Roxy walks into the room. Aisha was about to tell Roxy about the shrine but was stopped by Rudeus with his hand. Roxy looks at the Treant and was amazed. Roxy states that the Treant was harmless meaning Aisha could keep it. They decided to name it
Baby Treant
 or
Beet
 for short. Rudeus established rules such as not letting Beet near
Lucy
, training it to not hurt anyone, everyone must be informed on what the plant is and it must be disposed immediately if it hurts anyone.

Chapter 5: Paternal Dignity

Three months pass and it’s the summer.
Rudeus
 is looking at
Lucy
 thinking about
Paul
. He thinks that he finally understands what it means to be a father. He also wonders if this is what Paul felt like when he had Rudeus. Suddenly, Lucy starts to cry. Rudeus tries to calm her down by making faces like his father had done.
Suzanne
, the nurse and Rudeus’s old adventure friend, walks up to them. After exchanging a couple words, Suzanne says it was time to breast feed Lucy so Rudeus goes into his room to study the
mana
 absorbing magic stone he got from when they fought the Hydra. He figured out that in order for the mana absorption to work, you need to put mana in the back of the stone. However, the amount of mana needed needs to be more or equal to the amount of mana the spell or magic circle has. It was like distortion magic but better since it can dispel completed spells. After,
Zanoba
,
Ginger
, and
Julie
 arrive at the
Greyrat
 household. Zanoba tells Rudeus about the progress he’s made on investigating the automatic doll. He says that he has finished investigating the hands and are now moving onto the feet. He also tells him that he has to make a new prosthetic hand from scratch which could take a month. Then, Julie goes up to Rudeus and gives him a doll of
Ruijerd
 she was assigned to make. Rudeus notes on how Julie had improved. They also talk about
Norn
, who seems to have a hidden talent for writing. She wrote a story on Ruijerd and Julie can’t stop asking Rudeus to read it to her. It is revealed that Rudeus wants
Roxy
 to teach him King ranked water magic.

Chapter 6: A Water King is Born

At school, lustful noises can be heard from a gym locker room.
Roxy
 runs out the the gym locker as the student council arrive on the scene.
Luke
 and
Fittz
(aka Sylphy) arrive and Luke says that
Rudeus
 was attacking a “female student”. Luke hands the situation to Fittz to deal with. Fittz sighs as she tells Roxy that many people still don’t know that Roxy is teacher. Fittz also scolds Rudeus for what happened. Fittz thought that Rudeus was trying to seduce Roxy but then realizes that Rudeus was just trying to get Roxy to teach him King ranked water magic. Roxy didn’t want to because she was scared that her student would become better than her but she agreed eventually. Later in the day, Rudeus,
Sylphy
, and Roxy head out the the outskirts to learn King ranked water magic. Roxy demonstrated the King ranked water magic [
Lightning
]. It starts as the Saint ranked water magic [
Cumulonimbus
] but after a few more
incantations
, lightning struck a tree completely disintegrating it. Roxy then fell as the spell used up all her magic. Rudeus tries to use the spell. He uses it without any problems. Sylphy also tries but failed on the last part. After this, Rudeus officially becomes a King ranked water magic user. As they were riding home, Roxy and Sylphy are both visibly exhausted. On the way home, Rudeus thinks about what had happened throughout his life. He also creates a weaker version of [Lightning] called [Electric] for numbing the nervous system of his opponents.

Chapter 7: The Wedding Ceremony

The chapter starts after they get home.
Rudeus
 decides to sleep in another room separate from
Roxy
 and
Sylphy
 as he knows they are tired and unwilling to do “things”.
Aisha
, seeing Rudeus going to sleep alone, invites him to sleep with her (NOT SEXUALLY). To Rudeus’s surprise,
Norn
 also wanted to sleep with him (ALSO NOT SEXUALLY). As he sleeps, he thinks about the relationships he has with Roxy and Sylphy. Being the pervert he is, he wants to have a threesome with them. The next morning, he goes to
Cliff
’s laboratory. When he walks in, he sees Cliff researching how to remove curses and
Elinalise
 sitting near a window. Cliff was researching the mana absorbing magic stones. Ryder’s brings up the wedding of Cliff and Elinalise and offers to help but was rejected as Cliff wanted to do it himself. Rudeus starts talking to Elinalise and she brings up the topic of a threesome with him, Roxy, and Sylphy. Rudeus denies it at first but after hearing that she could make it happen, Rudeus agrees. However, Rudeus will have to give Elinalise
Asura Kingdom
's treasured
aphrodisiac
. Rudeus agrees to give it to her as she fantasizes about a drugged Cliff on their wedding night. A month later, at Saint
Milis
 Church, Cliff and Elinalise are about to get married. A priest stands in the middle of them as he says oaths. Cliff and Elinalise say their oaths, kiss each other on the forehead, and they get married under the Milis church. As everyone looks at the newlyweds, Roxy looks at Rudeus with a red face. Rudeus has never had a wedding ceremony with Roxy before. So he kisses Roxy on the forehead. Sylphy gives an expression that she also wants one so she kisses her on the forehead as well. Norn, looking embarrassed that someone of her relation is doing this at a wedding, complains. However, Rudeus picks her up and kisses her on the forehead as well. Aisha also comes and asks for a kiss on the forehead so he gives her one. Then, he remembers a letter from Paul saying to hold a celebration once everyone is reunited. Rudeus decides to hold a big celebration for his sisters’ 10th birthday and Roxy’s wedding.

Chapter 8: A Lucky Man

Rudeus
,
Roxy
, and
Sylphy
 all go downtown to search for a present for
Norn
 and
Aisha
. The present is a secret to them. As they walked, they saw many merchants busily running by with carts full of goods. A festival was taking place that celebrates the harvests of the year. There were also many of the beast race whom have come to take the hands of
Rinia
 or
Pursena
. It’s is revealed that there is another reason for coming here. With
Elinalise
’s instructions, they would find a hotel to stay at and perform the deed. They spend the whole day searching for presents. However, what Roxy doesn’t know is that he’s also searching for a present for her as well and the celebration is both for his sisters and for Roxy. They stumble upon a clothing store and they decide to buy Norn and Aisha new clothes as a present. Norn would be getting a colored overcoat and Aisha would be getting embroidered boots. Suddenly, while browsing the store, Roxy sees something that stops her in her tracks. It was a magicians robe with a hat on it. She looks at the price tag on the hat and silently declares it too expensive. Sylphy and Rudeus notice this and then Roxy’s present was also decided. They walk around some more and as the shops start closing, they head towards a tavern that Elinalise told Rudeus to go to because it was the perfect place to do the deed. But what Rudeus didn’t expect was for Roxy and Sylphy to already know about this place. Sylphy was worried that Lucy would have no one taking care of her but Rudeus got
Lilia
 to do that. Roxy also had concerns about school but Rudeus also took care of that. Without anything to worry about, they gave themselves to Rudeus’s care. First they had dinner, then they do the deed.

Chapter 9: Birthday Party

The next morning,
Roxy
 and
Rudeus
 lead
Norn
 and
Aisha
 out of the house so that
Sylphy
 and
Lilia
 can prepare the party. Roxy, Rudeus, Norn, and Aisha all go fishing together. However Norn, Aisha, and Rudeus have no idea how to fish. Luckily, Roxy knew how to and taught all of them how to fish. They also agreed that the loser would have to obey whatever the winner says. Roxy also starts talking with Norn as they don’t have a very good relationship since she’s a second wife and Roxy wishes to fix that. Later on, Aisha is in the lead and Rudeus is dead last. Rudeus decides to activate his demon eye but still can’t catch anything while Aisha already caught 4 fish. When the sunsets, they head home. They talk about their day and how fun it was. Norn and Aisha were arguing about who had more fish and who’s were bigger. When they arrived home, Sylphy, Lilia, and
Zenith
 all surprise Norn and Aisha. Norn had no clue this was happening and was in shock. Aisha was just surprised. They head into the dining room which was decorated with flowers and Rudeus gives a speech about the family’s reunion. Rudeus then calls Sylphy to take out the presents. Aisha opens her’s and gets new boots, Norn opens her’s and gets a new jacket. Aisha goes to show Lilia and Norn goes to show Zenith. However, unexpectedly, Zenith’s usually blank face expressed a smile for a brief moment and everyone saw. Everyone was overjoyed to see Zenith express emotions at last. Finally, it was time for Roxy to open her present. She was confused at first but it was revealed to be her wedding gift. She opens it to see the hat that she had wanted from the store. Tears of happiness stream from her eyes as she thanks Rudeus and Sylphy deeply. After that, they start eating the food prepared.

Chapter 10: Graduation Day

A year passes and
Rudeus
 was about to be a fourth year. He talks about everyone’s condition.
Lucy
 had also spoken her first words being Rudi and mama.
Suzanne
 had also stopped being the nurse as the contract was over. Rudeus,
Sylphy
, and
Roxy
 attend the graduation ceremony. They announced that
Rinia
 and
Pursena
 were representatives. After the graduation ceremony, Rudeus visits
Nanahoshi
. She’s sick again as usual. For the past year, she had had fevers and coughs and despite Rudeus curing her with
detoxification magic
, it always comes back in a weeks time. Just then, Rinia and Pursena walks into the room. They ask Rudeus to watch their duel before they leave the school. They arrive to the spot where they first met each other. Whoever wins becomes head of the clan. They start the duel with Rudeus being their judge. After a long fought battle, Pursena comes out on top. The next morning, they leave without saying anything to anyone else.

Chapter 11: Phase Four

Days after the graduation ceremony,
Nanahoshi
,
Rudeus
,
Cliff
, and
Zanoba
 all gather in Nanahoshi’s room for phase 3 of her experiment. Rudeus starts pouring magic into the magic circle. The circle shines multiple different colors and then a watermelon appears. Since they didn’t know if watermelons existed in this world, for now they called it a success. Everyone gathered at a tavern for a celebration. While everyone was celebrating,
Norn
 goes to Rudeus and tells him that she had joined the
Student Council
. Rudeus was worried at first because sword training on top of writing a book and now student council business might be too much pressure for her. However, Rudeus approves this anyways as he believes his little sister will find a way to make it work. Suddenly, they hear Nanahoshi yell “let’s cut the watermelon!”. So they cut it and everyone got a slice. As they did Rudeus realizes it’s seedless. There is no known method in this world to make a seedless fruit so it confirmed that the experiment was a success. Later on, Nanahoshi discusses phase 4 of the experiment with Rudeus. Nanahoshi brings up a person that can help them with phase 4 of her experiment. Rudeus asks who this person is and Nanahoshi replies with
Armored Dragon King Perugius
.

Extra Chapter: Sharpening the Mad Dog's Sword

Eris
 and
Nina
 meet the Water King
Isolde
 and train with her. Eris was able to best Nina. Nina was able to best Isolde. Isolde was able to best Eris. They all shared advice with one another to improve their sword skills.

Summary

This article is for the fourteenth volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 Light Novel, which covers the Summoning Arc. Its contents corresponds to volume 15 of the
Web Novel
.

Synopsis

CASTLE IN THE SKY

Nanahoshi
,
Rudeus
, and the rest of their group take a trip to
Perugius Dola
’s mysterious floating fortress, seeking adventure and a once-in-a-lifetime chance to learn new magic. What they find instead is disaster as one of their members is struck down by a deadly
illness
. How far will Rudeus go to save a dear friend’s life?

Light Novel Volume 14/Summary
=============================

This article
lacks information
 and requires expansion. Please
expand this page
 to include missing information to help improve the article.

Information

Summary

Chapter 1: Floating Fortress

Nanahoshi
 and
Rudeus
 heads to
Perugius
’s location with
Ariel
,
Sylphie
,
Luke
,
Roxy
,
Elinalise
,
Cliff
, and
Zanoba
. They’ve been walking for half a day and finally reach a stone monument that says “Monument Of
Seven Great Major Powers
”. Nanahoshi then takes out a golden flute which looks more like a whistle cause it has no finger holes. A couple seconds later, a man appears out of no where. He looked around and saw Roxy. He said the demon race wasn’t allowed on the sky castle because Perugius disliked them. Roxy looked flattered but was cheered up by Rudeus with a kiss. He said that Perugius was going to use teleportation magic to teleport them to the sky castle. Once they were teleported, They arrive on the sky castle and are greeted by
Sylvaril
. She leads them through the castle which was laced in art and structures. Zanoba was extremely excited. Before they continued, Sylvaril stopped and looked at Rudeus and Sylphie. She asked if knew someone by the name of
Hitogami
. Rudeus hesitates as when he answered the question to
Orsted
, he almost killed him. Sylphie says that she’s never heard of anyone with such a name. So they continue walking through the castle. They reach the door which leads to where Perugius is. Ariel requests a room to put their things in and to change into formal clothes. After they change, they go back to the door. Rudeus, about to meet Perugius, has an uneasy feeling.

Chapter 2: An Audience with Perugius

The group walks into a room with
Perugius
 sitting on a throne.
Arumanfi
 on his left and
Sylvaril
 on his right. The rest of his familiars on either side of the group.
Nanahoshi
 spoke first and Perugius agreed to teach her summoning magic.
Ariel
 spoke next and Perugius saw right through her and tore down her goal of getting his aid. Then
Rudeus
 speaks up and Perugius tells him is mana resembles
Laplace
. Rudeus asks him about how to cure
Zenith
's curse and he says he doesn't know. Then he looks over at
Elinalise
 and describes saving her 200 years ago from a Labyrinth. Something that she never mentioned before. Rudues says that they can discuss it later. Next is
Zanoba
 who asks about the dollmaker's crest from the blueprints in Rudeus' basment. Perugius says that it belongs to the Maniacal Dragon King,
Chaos
. Lastly,
Sylphie
 asks her question. But before she can Perugius says that he will give a name to her son if she has one. She then asks about the Displacement Incident. He then explains that it was an accident and not manmade. After all of that, everyone proceeds to their guest rooms.

Chapter 3: The Past and a Curse, Summoning, and Jealousy

Elinalise
 finally tells
Rudeus
 about her past and how her curse came to fruition. However, she explains that she never got her memories back from before she was saved from the Labyrinth and that
Zenith
's situation is different from hers. Elinalise returns to
Cliff
 with Rudeus not learning anything new about Zenith's Curse. After breakfast, Rudeus,
Nanahoshi
, Cliff, and
Zanoba
 go to a separate room and learn about summoning magic from
Sylvaril
. Rudeus interrupts a lot with questions. He apologizes but Sylvaril compliments how passionate he is on the subject. She teaches them about the two different types of summoning magic. Fiend and Spirit summoning. She also reveals that she is not one of
Perugius
' ancient spirit familiars. Rather she is one of the skyfolk that he saved during
Laplace
's War.

Before lunchtime Sylvaril asks them what they would like to eat and whether if they wanted something specific. Cliff asks for something from
Millis
. Zanoba asks for something from Shirone. Nanahoshi says she'll go with whatever. Rudeus then asks for many different Japanese food ingredients. Sylvaril says that they don't have anything similar to what Rudeus asked for. Though she knows of something similar to soy sauce in the
Biheiril
 Kingdom.
Arumanfi
 takes an hour to go fetch the supposed item. However, he doesn't come back with soy sauce but something that looks similar to miso soup. Rudeus then asks for some white fish considering that they already had rice and miso. Nanahoshi also got a plate of what Rudeus requested. The food tasted terrible but she appreciated the gesture from Rudeus and thanked him.

After their afternoon lecture, Rudeus began to wander the halls of the fortress. He then spots Zanoba and Cliff who want to investigate some nearby stairs. However, they are unsure as to whether they are allowed to go that way. Nanahoshi pops up and says that they can go and that they would find something that they would enjoy. So, with Nanahoshi as their guide they venture below the main floors of the fortress. They go down several flights of stairs never finding anything interesting in any of the rooms with open doors. Down there they find some architechture from before the first Great Human-Demon War. They finally make it to the bottom to find a room with murals on the walls. They decipher that the murals are connected and tell a story but they can't tell any specifics about it. Then Arumanfi and Perugius pop up at the door that they came in. The group explains that they were just exploring and that's why they were down there. Perugius says he does not mind and that he was not the one who created the murals. Explaining that when he first acquired the castle that nothing was in it besides the murals. He also says that he isn't fond of the paintings.

Arumanfi guides the group back up to their rooms. While Rudeus is sitting in his room,
Sylphie
 enters and she talks about Ariel struggling with Perugius. Rudeus advises her on it. Sylphie then plays a prank on him and acts like she's super jealous of him spending so much time with Nanahoshi. They hug and Rudeus explains that she's just a friend and Sylphie gets over her slight jealousy. As Sylphie opens the door to leave, Nanahoshi is seen standing their and says she heard everything and isn't interested in Rudeus while having a massive coughing fit. Sylphie tries to help her by casting detoxification magic on her to no avail. Nanahoshi then coughs up blood and collapses onto the floor, losing consciousness. Sylphie extremely scared and shocked about the situation and denies that it had anything to do with her. Rudeus reassures her and calms her down as he had seen the whole ordeal. He then tells her to go get help from either Cliff or Perugius.

Chapter 4: Lament

Nanahoshi is now in the sickbay. The group finds out the she has Dryne Syndrome. A disease that infected humans over 7,000 years ago when they didn't have mana. Nanahoshi laments about her whole situation and how unfair it is. Rudeus sympathizes with her and promises to help her. He, Elinalise, Zanoba, and Cliff prepare a journey to the demon continent to ask
Kishirika
 for help as she is one of the few people that was alive during that time.

Chapter 5: Return to the Demon Continent

Chapter 6: Search for Kishirika

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Chapter 7: An Audience with the Immortal Demon King

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Chapter 8: Showdown with the Immortal Demon King

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Chapter 9: A Day in the Floating Fortress

Perugius tests Ariel. He asks her what is the most important factor for a ruler. Ariel is unsure. Perugius tells her to take her time and think about it.

Chapter 10: Turning Point (Part 4)

Rudeus returns home. He explains to his family everything that occurred over the past few days, including the details regarding Zenith's curse. He falls asleep and then sees Hitogami again. Hitogami reveals what would have happened if Rudeus had followed his previous advice. Paul would still be alive, and Roxy would also somehow be alive (but Roxy and Rudeus would not be married of course). Rudeus would have been married instead to Rinia and Pursena. Hitogami then ends their encounter by requesting that Rudeus go check on his home's basement. Rudeus is more trusting of Hitogami at this point, and agrees. Rudeus then wakes up. As Rudeus is about to leave his room and check the basement, he sees an old man who introduces himself as Rudeus from the future.

Chapter 11: An End and a Beginning

The old Rudeus from the future stated that he arrived here via past teleportation magic. He warned Rudeus that if he were to go to the basement, as per Hitogami's instructions, it would trigger a chain of events that would cause a mouse to infect Roxy with magic stone disease, which causes one to slowly turn into a rock and then die. Killing Roxy is apparently part of Hitogami's plan. Old Rudeus explains that Hitogami also somehow manipulated events so that Princess Ariel returns to Asura to start her revolt. Sylphie to follows Ariel and she is killed in battle. Old Rudeus advises present Rudeus to forgive Eris and reform his connection with her, and send a letter to her in the Holy Land of Swords. Old Rudeus also advises present Rudeus to be skeptical of Hitogami, but to avoid direct confrontation. His third piece of advice was for Rudeus to "consult with Nanohoshi". After giving the above advice, Old Rudeus gives present Rudeus his diary from the future, and then dies.

After Old Rudeus dies, present Rudeus then cremates his self from the future. He then goes to the basement and confirms the mouse that would infect Roxy with magic stone disease, and kills it, with plans to send the mouses' corpse to the magic guild to be studied. Rudeus remains unable to go to sleep, and so begins writing a letter to Eris.

Extra Chapter: The Birth of a New Sword King

In the Holy Land of Swords,
Eris
,
Nina
, and
Jino
 all kneeled in front of
Sword God Gull Farion
. He announces that one of them will become a sword king. The Sword God asked the three of them a question. He asked what is the difference between sword saint, sword king, and sword emperor. Jino answered with weapon. Sword God was furious as the answer was completely wrong. Nina answered desire. The Sword God accepted that answer. He also asked her if she’d rather get married or become Sword King which she replied Sword King, much to Sword God’s disappointment. He turned to Eris and asked the same question to which she replied resolve. The Sword God said it was wrong but Eris refused to believe it was wrong as her past experiences especially that from
turning point 2
 proved to her resolve was the answer. Sword God, impressed had her battle with Nina to see who would become Sword King. Nina charged at Eris first and was going for a finishing blow. However, Eris reacted to that by doing one of her attacks which ended up winning her the title of Sword King. Sword God asked Eris what she was going to do next. Eris responded that she will return to her family. After the ceremony
Nina
 and
Jino
 began to fight with wooden swords.

Light Novel Volume 15
=====================

Information

Summary

This is the fifteenth volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 light novel, which covers the Human God arc. Its contents corresponds to volume 16 and the first two chapters of volume 17 of the web novel.

Synopsis

English (Seven Seas)
SECOND CHANCE
Rudeus’s brief meeting with his time-travelling future self leaves him struggling to process the terrible suffering that version of him endured. But he might be able to avert those losses in this timeline, if he takes his future self’s advice–starting with reaching out to Eris for the first time in years!

Synopsis from Seven Seas.

Chapters
