Light Novel Volume 15/Summary
=============================

Information

Summary

Chapter 1: The Diary (Part 1)

Rudeus reads the diary from his future self, which described the following events. Roxy became infected with Magic Stone disease, which was identified by Cliff and his Eye of Identification. This can only be healed with God rank detoxification. So, Cliff, Zanoba and Rudeus go to the Holy Kingdom of Milis using teleport magic circles to get the book with God Class Detoxification chants. Unfortunately, this book is within a cathedral that cannot be entered unless you are archbishop level. They decide to steal the book but are caught. Cliff dies during the battle and the magic teleporting circle that they used is destroyed. They also become wanted men in the Milis region. By the time Rudeus and Zanoba arrive home, Roxy was already half crystalized and had died. Elinalise is informed of Cliff's death, and leaves town while heavily pregnant. Rudeus then becomes depressed due to Roxy's death and dependent on alcohol. He begins neglecting Sylphy. Sylphy then leaves with Ariel who has returned to the Kingdom of Asura. Rudeus then decides to chase after Sylphy by following her to Asura. During his travels, he frequently runs into Eris. She is unable to properly express her feeling towards Rudeus and so just hits him. Rudeus discovers that Ariel has returned to Asura in order to gather an army to perform a coup d'etat. This fails however, and so Ariel, Sylphy, and Luke all die.

Chapter 2: The Diary (Part 2)

Rudeus continues to read the diary from his future self, which described the following events. After Sylphy's death, Rudeus spent more time going to brothels. He also frequently ran into Eris, who also was living in Sharia. Rudeus continues to have mixed feelings about Eris. The Milis Church put a bounty on the heads of Rudeus and Zanoba due to their exploits from stealing the God Class detoxification chant book. Zanoba completes his automaton research. He is able to create essentially a robot that looks like Sylphy and acts like her as well. Rudeus ends up destroying this robot. Zanoba ultimately mass produces his robots. Rudeus develops a hatred for Hitogami. He vows to get stronger in order to kill Hitogami. Throughout this process, he loses touch with his family; only Aisha stays in touch. To augment his physical strength, he and Zanoba develop fully body armour similar to his prosthetic hand, which Rudeus can augment with magic to improve his physical strength.

Future Rudeus continues to work on his magic over the years, developing gravity magic, electricity magic, voice magic. However, he becomes a bad person; he would frequently get into arguments, do whatever he wanted, and occasionally raped women. Rudeus continued to run into Eris, and so he begins to falsely suspect that she is affiliated with Hitogami. Rudeus continues to try to gather more information about Hitogami by questioning beings who are long-lived. He ends up trying to speak to Atofe, but ends up fighting her and her imperial guard, including Moore. During the battle, he becomes careless and is saved by Eris, but then she is killed as a result. After Eris' death, Ghyslaine explains to Rudeus that Eris has loved him all this time and had followed him around for this reason. Ghylaine blames Rudeus for Eris' death.

Years pass, and Zanoba dies, killed by the Order of the Temple. Julie, Ginger, and Aisha are killed as well. With this, Rudeus no longer has any living loved ones. There was no mention in the diary of the fate of Lucy, Norn or Lilia. Through his travels, Rudeus discovers the nature of this world, which is that it shaped like a cube, with six sides: Dragon world, Human world, Demon world, Beast world, Ocean world, Sky world. The interior of the die is the Void World, where Hitogami resides. Rudeus learns that in order to travel to the Void World, one must collect the 5 ancient Dragon Race treasures. However, collecting all 5 treasures turns out to be impossible within his lifespan. Rudeus then learns how to travel to the past and he decides to go to the past to correct his mistakes. The diary then ends here.

Chapter 3: Resolve

After finishing reading his future self's diary, Rudeus has a discussion with Sylphy and Roxy. He vaguely reveals that someone has shown him the future in which a bad person would cause terrible things to happen to his family. Rudeus then broaches the subject of adding Eris to their polygamous relationship. Sylphy and Roxy initially object, since they know that Eris broke Rudeus' heart, which resulted in his erectile dysfunction. Rudeus reassures them that he now knows that this was actually a misunderstanding. Both Sylphy and Roxy tentatively agree to accepting Eris, depending on how well Rudeus' and Eris' are able to reconcile in their meeting together.

Rudeus then falls asleep, and he sees Hitogami in the white void. Hitogami is initially extremely frustrated at the fact that future Rudeus has disrupted Hitogami's plans to kill Rudeus' family. Hitogami reports that Orsted is trying to kill Hitogami, but cannot do so alone. However, Rudeus and his descendants are not affected by Orsted's curse, which cause all beings to hate Orsted. This means that Rudeus' descendants may end up assisting Orsted and kill Hitogami, which would destroy the world. Furthermore, Rudeus and his descendants have 'strong fate', which means that Hitogami has difficulty with changing their fate. So, because Rudeus and his descendants have strong fate and may end up helping Orsted to kill Hitogami, Hitogami tries to kill Rudeus' descendants to prevent his own ultimate death. Rudeus tells Hitogami that he will do anything for him if he is able to save his family. Hitogami therefore suggests that if Rudeus wants to save his family, he needs to kill Orsted.

Rudeus then wakes up. He vows to kill Orsted to save his family from Hitogami.

Chapter 4: Nanahoshi's Hypothesis

Rudeus consults with Nanahoshi, in accordance with his future self's instructions. He tells her everything about his future self's encounter, the diary, and his dream with Hitogami. After spending the day reviewing the diary and thinking, Nanahoshi discusses her hypotheses with Rudeus, which is as follows. Rudeus and Nanahoshi were transported into this world by someone whose goal is to kill Hitogami. Nanahoshi was transported so that she may create some currently unknown method to kill Hitogami, while Rudeus was transported so that his descendants and Orsted could kill Hitogami with that method.

Nanahoshi then suggests to Rudeus that he team up with Orsted instead. Rudeus refuses, since Hitogami is unreachable, while Orsted is within this world. He reasons that for the purpose of protecting his family from Hitogami, it would be easier to kill Orsted as commanded by Hitogami, than to kill Hitogami himself. Rudeus then begs Nanahoshi to help him kill Orsted. She is reluctant, as Orsted has saved her in the past, but ultimately agrees to help.

Chapter 5: A Letter from Afar

Eris gets ready to leave the Holy Land of the Sword to meet up with Rudeus in Ranoa, who she hasn't been in contact for many years. Just prior to departing, she receives a letter from Rudeus. The letter describes how Rudeus initially thought Eris had rejected him, but he now knows this was a misunderstanding and that she actually loves him. Rudeus informs Eris in this letter that he currently has two wives, but is willing to accept Eris has his third wife. Eris' two friends argue over whether Rudeus is an asshole or not. Rudeus' letter also included a post script, which stated that he planned to challenge Orsted to battle, with the caveat that he may not survive. Eris becomes excited at this, and she and Ghyslaine head off toward Rudeus.

Chapter 6: Preparations

Rudeus works on his preparations to kills Orsted. He works on creating full body magic armour that his future self also used, with the help of Zanoba and Cliff. He decides that he needs to find a suitable partner to fight Orsted; Badigadi was missing, Ruijerd wasn't present, and Perugius refused. He rules out Zanoba, Cliff and Elinalise since they are his friends. He considers begging Eris to help fight, if she were to arrive in time. He puts the subject of finding a partner on hold for now. Rudeus also considers various battle tactics to take down Orsted, including using traps and sneak attacks.

During these preparations, Hitogami then reappears to Rudeus in his dreams. Hitogami is quite pleased with Rudeus' decision to try to kill Orsted, but warns that he will wipe out Rudeus' family if he fails. Hitogami offers advice on building the magic armour and suggests that Rudeus use magic tools in his fight. Hitogami again confirms that he cannot see Orsted's future but can see his own, and so he sees that in the future he is killed by Orsted and Rudeus' descendants. Rudeus gets Hitogami to promise that if he kills Orsted, that Hitogami will leave Rudeus and his family alone.

A month passes, and the magic armour construction is making good progress. It stands 3 meters tall, which is much larger than the armour that future Rudeus created for himself. By making the armour bigger, the engineering was easier and it was more robust. Rudeus also goes shopping with Roxy to buy magic tools. He comes up with an idea to multiple of the same tool together so that he can fire off his stone cannons in rapid succession like a gatling gun. They enlist the help of a craftsman to help make this tool. Rudeus then consults with Nanahoshi. They come up with the idea of using poison. They also come up with a plan to lure Orsted. Using Ariel's connections, Rudeus buys the poison that he plans to use against Orsted. Rudeus chooses his planned battleground against Orsted and practices using traps. He also learns close quarters combat from Elinalise.

Chapter 7: Readying for Battle

Another month passes, and the magic armour is complete. It is 3 meters tall, and he wears it like a mecha suit. It has a gatling cannon installed on one hand that fires stone cannons. The other hand has a magic absorbing stone. The armour is also equipped with a shield with Paul's Tantou sword attached, which can ignore armour. Elinalise reveals that she is pregnant with Cliff's child. Cliff confirms this for himself with his Identification eye. Rudeus tests out the magic armour by sparring with Sylphy and Zanoba. Sylphy's magic and Zanoba's punches are ineffective against the armour. Rudeus is quite pleased with the armour.

Back at home, Roxy announces to the family that she is pregnant. The whole family congratulates her. Rudeus notes that this was a stark contrast to the atmosphere when Lilia revealed her pregnancy due to Paul's infidelity, many years ago. Aisha reveals she has successfully cultivated rice in their garden. Rudeus is excited at the idea of being able to eat rice regularly again. The family then enjoys their dinner in celebration.

After dinner, Rudeus informs his family that he will be fighting a strong opponent, without specifically naming Orsted, and that his preparations for the past few months have been leading to this. He warns them that there's a chance he may not survive. Later that evening, Rudeus explains the whole situation to Roxy and Sylphy. He explains that he plans to fight Orsted, about the revelations from Hitogami, and that if he fails to kill Orsted, his family will be in danger. Sylphy and Roxy promise to protect their family and accept the fact that Rudeus will be fighting Orsted, possibly never to return.

Chapter 8: Quagmire vs. Dragon God

Orsted is lured into a deserted village, presumably by Nanahoshi. He is pricked by a poisoned handle and triggers a trap inside a building. Rudeus then follows up with a barrage of long range magic attacks, including a massive explosion like a nuclear bomb. Despite all this, Orsted takes minimal damage. Orsted then closes the distance between himself and Rudeus. Rudeus is able to do some damage to Orsted with his sword, whose force increases exponentially proportional to the enemy's defense. Orsted is then able to cut off both of the armour's arms off, including Rudeus' right arm. Orsted continues to damage Rudeus and his armour. Rudeus then ejects himself from the magic armour and the armour is destroyed. Outside of the armour, Rudeus is quickly defeated and seriously injured. Before killing Rudeus, Orsted questions Rudeus regarding why he came after him. Rudeus explains that Hitogami told Rudeus that his descendants would help Orsted kill Hitogami, which would destroy the world. Rudeus further explains that if he kills Orsted, Hitogami will spare Rudeus' family. Rudeus then crawls to Orsted's legs and begs that he give up on killing Hitogami. Orsted refuses and so Rudeus bites Orsted's leg, with the intention of launching a magical suicide attack, but Orsted uses Disturb magic and kicks him away. Before Orsted can kill and finish off Rudeus, Eris suddenly appears.

Chapter 9: Berserker Sword King vs. Dragon God

A few days prior to Orsted and Rudeus' battle, Eris and Ghyslaine arrived in Sharia city. They find Rudeus' home and meet his family. Eris then finds out that Rudeus has headed off on his own to kill Orsted.

After Orsted and Rudeus' battle had commenced, Eris and Ghyslaine are able to locate them by the sounds of battle and seeing a large explosion. Eris finds Rudeus just as he is on the verge of death. Eris faces Orsted while she leaves Ghyslaine to tend to Rudeus. Eris notes that Rudeus has been able to inflict a significant amount of damage to Orsted. Despite this, looking at Orsted, Eris recognizes that she is unable to defeat him alone. Orsted comments in surprise that Eris is risking her life for someone other than Luke, who was apparently fated to be her husband. Eris responds that she doesn't know of anyone with that name.

Eris thinks back to her last meeting with the Sword God, where he offered her one of three swords before she departed. She chose the Phoenix Elegant Dragon Sword, which has the ability to negate one's opponent's Battle Aura defense, or at least weaken it. The Sword God also gives a piece of advice for her confrontation with Orsted, which was to never move first, because of his strong counterattack, due to his proficiency in Water God sword style.

As Orsted and Eris face off, Orsted is surprised at the fact that Eris doesn't approach to attack. He comments that the Eris in front of him is different than the Eris he knows. Eris and Orsted then fight, with Eris remembering other bits of advice that the Sword God Gull Farion gave her, regarding fighting Orsted. Eris was able to cut off Orsted's hand, but he quickly reattaches it and heals the rest of his injuries from his battle with Rudeus. Eris then transitions from Sword God style to North God style and throws a secondary sword at Orsted, which is easily repelled.

At this point, Rudeus stands up, his injuries healed, but drained and near death. Roxy and Sylphy have arrived to support him. Eris and Sylphy then plan to fight Orsted, while having Rudeus escape with Roxy and Ghyslaine. Seeing this, Orsted then declares that he cannot allow Rudeus to live while he is allied with Hitogami. However, he does note that Rudeus can potentially be useful, with his magic armor, his immense magical power, and immunity to Orsted's curse (the curse which cause all living beings to fear Orsted). Therefore, Orsted offers Rudeus to betray Hitogami and join him. Orsted states that with his power, he should be able to protect Rudeus and his family from Hitogami, but is not able to give any absolute promises. Rudeus agrees to join Orsted to be his subordinate.

Chapter 10: Eris Greyrat (Part 1)

After his battle with Orsted, life returns to normal. Orsted heals Rudeus as promised. Both his missing upper limbs are regrown. Rudeus is also given a magic bracelet, which possibly prevents him from being spied on by Hitogami. Orsted also gives instructs Rudeus to contact him again once his magic has replenished. Rudeus reflects that he doesn't regret betraying Hitogami and in fact feels that Orsted is much more trustworthy. After returning, Rudeus then informed all those who helped him against Orsted that he lost and in fact has now joined him.

Eris has now started living with Rudeus and his family. Rudeus finally hears via Sylphy that Eris has been single-mindedly training for the sole purpose of fighting Orsted along with Rudeus. Rudeus discovers that from Eris perspective, he has betrayed her by marrying other women while she has been training. However, despite this, Roxy informs Rudeus that Eris is actually expecting him to propose to her, to be his third wife. Rudeus sees Eris teach swordplay to Norn. He notes how she has grown as person, as she is now able to logically explain concepts to a beginner, compared to her past self who would only learn things by instinct. Eris and Rudeus then talk. They apologize to each other for breaking the other's heart. Rudeus admits that he does love his current wives Sylphy and Roxy more than Eris. Eris states that she still loves Rudeus. As Rudeus did not explicitly state that he loves her back, she then challenges him to a duel She declares that he must love her as well if she wins, and that if he wins, she will leave.

Chapter 11: Eris Greyrat (Part 2)

Eris and Rudeus face each other, preparing to duel, outside of Sharia city. Ghyslaine acts as their judge. The fight commences but neither side moves to attack. Rudeus announces that he doesn't want to fight if it means that Eris will leave and declares that he loves her as well. Eris walks up to Rudeus and questions if he will still love her, despite her shortcomings compared to Roxy and Sylphy. Rudeus reassures her that he still loves her regardless. They then share an embrace. Rudeus gives a marriage proposal to Eris, and she accepts.

Back at home, during dinner, Rudeus announces that Eris will be his wife. Roxy and Sylphy accept Eris into their family. Aisha and Norn aren't happy with Rudeus for taking on a third wife, but ultimately accept Eris as well. Ghyslaine announces that now she has left Eris in Rudeus' care, her mission is done. She plans to go back to the Asura Empire to enact revenge on those who killed Sauros Greyrat, Eris' grandfather and her former master. Rudeus warns Ghyslaine that Water God and North Emperor are hired by Asura Empire, and Ghyslaine acknowledges she would not be able to defeat them alone. Rudeus suggests that Ghyslaine consider allying herself with Princess Ariel. She agrees to speak with Ariel.

Rudeus goes back to his bedroom, and finds Eris inside. Eris is very sexually assertive, and they have sex. The next morning, Rudeus receives a letter from Orsted.

Chapter 12: The Summons

In Orsted's letter, he asks Rudeus to meet him in a hut outside Sharia city's suburb, and tells him to come alone. Rudeus is nervous as he wants to make a good first impression with his new boss. Rudeus meets Orsted in the hut and it turns out that unbeknownst to Rudeus, Eris has also followed Rudeus there. Eris continues to distrust Orsted and warns him not to harm Rudeus. Orsted states that he will fulfill his promise right now, to protect Rudeus' family. They plan to summon a guardian magical beast which possesses strong fate to protect Rudeus' family. Orsted reasons that this will provide adequate protection as Hitogami cannot manipulate the fate of inhuman beings and cannot manipulate a large number of people at once. However, Orsted warns that since they cannot predict or monitor Hitogami's actions, they should also frequently check in on his family.

Orsted sees that Rudeus has several questions for him and gives him permission to ask them. Rudeus asks to know about Orsted himself. They first review Orsted's curse, which is that Orsted is feared and distrusted by all living creatures, with certain exceptions such as Nanahoshi and Rudeus. Rudeus reveals that this may be because he is from a different world, like Nanahoshi. Other exceptions to this curse are those from the ancient dragon-tribe. Next, Rudeus learns that Orsted's ability to be invisible from Hitogami's view, is actually not a curse. It is actually a technique developed by the first generation Dragon God for fighting Hitogami, which allows him to see fate and deviate from the path pre-destined by fate. The downside of this technique, however. is that it causes your magic regeneration to be 1000 times slower. Therefore, Orsted cannot freely use magic and cannot fight to his fullest ability. He reveals that he had actually used up a considerable amount of magic power in his fight against Rudeus, and so cannot fight seriously for a while. Therefore, Orsted is relying on Rudeus to act on his behalf. Rudeus then asks why Orsted is fighting Hitogami. Orsted reveals that his father, the first generation Dragon God, was killed by Hitogami. Since then, the ancient dragon-tribe's greatest wish, and the sole reason for existence of subsequent Dragon Gods is to defeat Hitogami. Orsted reveals that he is the 100th generation of of Dragon God, and that he was sent from the past to the present, by his father, using a method of reincarnation.

Chapter 13: Explanations

Orsted reveals that he has been alive for the past 2000 years. Rudeus thinks to himself that Orsted's grudge against Hitogami is too strong to be solely fueled by revenge for his father. He asks Orsted to clarify the reason for his grudge, but Orsted gives a vague answer. Nevertheless, Rudeus decides to trust Orsted.

Rudeus then asks about the Laplace factor. Rudeus reviews what he knows about Laplace. He was responsible for a war 400 years ago. He had a lot of magic power but unable to use Battle Aura. He was ultimately sealed by Perugius and two others, but will soon revive. He caused the downfall of the Superd tribe. Orsted reveals that Laplace's method of reviving is the same as the method of reincarnation used by the dragon-tribe. Laplace was previously a Demon Dragon King, who was one of the the 5 first generation Dragon Warriors. Laplace fought against the first generation Dragon God, and perhaps realized that Hitogami had manipulated, and so became the Dragon God's subordinate once again. The first generation Dragon God died, while Laplace survived. He escaped the collapsing Dragon World and drifted to this world. He became the second generation Dragon God and his goal was to defeat Hitogami. Laplace started the Human-Demon race war and fought the Fighting God, who was Hitogami's apostle. As a result of the battle, Laplace's lost his memory and his soul was split into two halves, into the Demon God, and the Technique God. Demon God Laplace lost the power of dragons but retained his magic knowledge and magic power. He also hated the human race and so rallied the demon race to exterminate humans. Technique God Laplace lost the power of magic but retained his knowledge of techniques. He created the Seven Great Major Power ranking. His goal was to overthrow Hitogami.

Orsted explains that the first generation Dragon God invented the method of reincarnation, where you send one's soul into the future, taking over another being's body and ultimately reviving. However, to reduce the chance of the other being's body rejecting one's soul, the Dragon God implanted his factor into multiple people. This factor is passed onto their descendants and modifies their bodies slightly. Orsted explains that many dragon-tribe members have used this method of reincarnation, including Perugius. Demon God Laplace, prior to being sealed by Perugius, distributed his factor and sent his soul into the future for the purpose of reincarnating himself. Currently, people with Laplace's characteristics and possessing the Laplace factor are beginning to appear, characteristics such as an aptitude towards magic, having a large amount of magic power, green hair, and having demon eyes at birth. Sylphy and Rudeus are examples of such people, although Orsted reassures Rudeus that he and Sylphy are not Laplace himself. Orsted further reassures Rudeus that while Rudeus did reincarnate, he likely reincarnated in the body of a baby who was destined to be stillborn, and therefore did not displace someone else's life.

Rudeus next asks Orsted about the mana calamity. Orsted however is unable to give any further information. Rudeus then shares with Orsted the diary from his future self. Rudeus then clarifies the terms of his working relationship under Orsted. Orsted reassures Rudeus that he will receive breaks to see his family, to Rudeus' relief. Next, Rudeus asks about receiving money to support his family, to which Orsted gives him a valuable dagger and a bag of gems, which can be sold for considerable sums of money. Orsted says he will read the future diary and they agree to meet again the next day.

Extra Chapter: A Wild Blade Finds Its Sheath

Eris awakens in one of Rudeus' rooms and remembers how she become his third wife. She dreamed of fighting Orsted for many years, imaging various outcomes, but never expected Rudeus to join Orsted. Fighting Orsted was one of only two objective of her life. All that remains now is for her to spend her life with Rudeus.

Looking at herself in the bathroom, she compares herself with Sylphi and Roxy. She feels she doesn't measure up, and her self-confidence is low. She leaves the bathroom and finds Aisha, Lilia and Sylphiette preparing food. She tries to help, but because of her high cutting ability with blades, she accidentally cuts the pumpkin and the cutting table.

After finding that housework isn't her forte, she decides to work and obtain money. She goes with Roxy to find a job at the magic university. Roxy suggests that a gatekeeper role at the university may be a good fit for her due to the job's simplicity. Roxy leaves Eris in front of the gate as a test. Eris then sees a suspicious man try to enter, and she tries to stop him. The man tries to show proof that he works there. Suddenly a gust of wind, blows at his hair. When the man tries to hold his wig down, Eris prevents him from doing so. Therefore, his wig blows away. It turns out that this man was the principal Georg, and feeling both anger and shame, Eris was fired.

Eris is returns to the house feeling depressed and useless, as she can neither do housework nor work a job. When Eris arrives home, she finds Norn talking with a student from the aristocratic class, who demands that Norn become his fiance, and therefore allow him to form a connection with Rudeus and Ariel. Seeing this student bothering Norn, Eris arrives and cut his belt, threatening to cut him the next time. The student then runs away.

Roxy and Sylphi arrive home and thank Eris. After discussing the events of that day, Sylphi reassures Eris that she doesn't need to worry about feeling useless, because there are things that only Eris can do, such as protect Rudeus. Eris now begins to understand that everyone has their own talents and flaws, and that she isn't useless after all.

As Eris leaves, she meets the gaze of Zenith. Eris thanks her. In her mind she felt that Zenith answered saying "say that to Rudeus". Eris now feels more happy as a wife.

Light Novel Volume 16
=====================

Information

Summary

This is the sixteenth volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 light novel, which covers the Asura Kingdom Arc Part 1. Its contents corresponds to volume 17 of the web novel.

Synopsis

English (Seven Seas)
LONG LIVE THE KING
Now officially Dragon God Orsted’s underling, Rudeus receives his first mission: to make Princess Arielle the next king of Asura Kingdom! Mighty as the endeavor might seem, it’s just the first of many steps he’ll have to take if he’s going to help Orsted bring down the Man God.

Synopsis from Seven Seas.


Chapters

Chapter 1: The First Mission

Chapter 2: Guardian Beast

Chapter 3: Opening Move

Chapter 4: Mind Made Up

Chapter 5: Working Together

Chapter 6: Orsted's Suggestion

Chapter 7: Library Labyrinth

Chapter 8: The Armored Dragon King and the Second Princess

Chapter 9: Before Traveling to Asura Kingdom

Extra Chapter: The Black Wolf Sword King

Illustrations

Adaptation Notes

Differences from the original web novels

Chapter 5: Working Together:
 In the WN Ariel find the answer to Perugius question with the help of Rudeus, in the LN she wasn't able to find the answer, leading to the events of
Chapter 6 and 7.

Chapter 6: Orsted's Suggestion:
 New original chapter for the light novel.

Chapter 7: Library Labyrinth:
 New original chapter for the light novel.

Chapter 9: Before Traveling to Asura Kingdom:
 the WN chapters "
The Men Meeting"
 and the
"The Women Meeting"
where merged in this chapter, also have new events.

References

Light Novel Volume 16/Summary
=============================

Information

Summary

Chapter 1: The First Mission

The next day, Rudeus goes back to the hut to meet Orsted. He comes alone this time. Outside the hut, he sees Zanoba lying face down, still alive. Orsted explains that the previous night Zanoba went to collect the broken magic armor and unexpectedly encountered Orsted. Due to Orsted's curse, Zanoba decided to fight him. Fortunately, Orsted used hyponosis magic to put Zanoba to sleep for a few hours.

Orsted and Rudeus then resume their main discussions. Orsted has finished reading Rudeus' diary. But before discussing that further, he asks Rudeus to recount all his conversations with Hitogami. Rudeus describes each of his encounters and conversations with Hitogami in detail, including the advice given and its consequences. After hearing this, Orsted suggests that Hitogami seems to have manipulated Rudeus to change history, and that given that Rudeus has strong fate, history was originally not supposed to change. Orsted, however, still doesn't understand why Hitogami changed history to this degree. Orsted will therefore try to once again change history to one that is favorable to him. Rudeus wonders if they can collect the hidden treasures and reach Hitogami. Orsted replies that the last treasure is in Laplace's possession, who will revive in about 80 years. Orsted believes that Hitogami has the ability to be trusted by all living beings, and so has difficulty dealing with irregularities such as Rudeus.

Orsted states that their first mission is to readjust history so that Ariel will become Asura Kingdom's queen. In the original timeline, Ariel should have become queen and was in fact protected by a considerably powerful fate. Originally, there were three key people to her rise in power, guardian magician Derrick Redbat, Eris Greyrat, and Tristina Purplehorse. Derrick was a shrewd man and ambitious, and was originally Ariel's guardian magician. He would have persuaded Perugius to assist Ariel. He would have remained as Ariel's advisor and eventually become prime minister. Eris would have married to Luke, and together they would have protected Ariel from assassins. Tristina was a child from Asura's upper aristocracy's family Purplsehorse, but was abducted when she was 8 years old and became a sex slave to senior minister Darius Ganius. Ariel helped Tristina before she could be disposed of in secret. As a result, Darius Ganius lost his position and first prince Gravel lost influence.

Orsted and Rudeus plan to find Tristina to force senior minister's downfall. If they fail, they plan for Rudeus to kill Darius. Orsted reveals that next month, in January, the information that the king has fallen ill will arrive, but until then, they will continue their preparations. They consider using the magic armor that is currently broken, but they need time to miniaturize it, so they shelve that idea for now. Instead, Orsted promises to give Rudeus a robe, since he cannot wear Battle Aura. They discuss Fighting God's armor. It was built by Demon Dragon King Laplace. While it gives you great power, it also controls your mind, similar to the Superd tribe's spears. Orsted also gives Rudeus a magic circle which can summon a guardian magical beast to protect his family. Rudeus plans on summoning the beast tomorrow. Rudeus worries that one of his descendants will become Laplace, but Orsted reassures him that this will not be the case. Rudeus asks Orsted to forgive Nanahoshi for luring him during their fight and to place the blame on himself instead. Orsted agrees to forgive her. Finally, Orsted gives him a ring that works like a compass, allowing Rudeus to contact Orsted in emergencies.

Rudeus then leaves the hut and carries Zanoba back to Ginger's room.

Chapter 2: Guardian Beast

Rudeus reflected on the fact that Orsted implied that there would always be "next time" if they failed. He considers the possibility that Orsted may have time travel abilities similar to his future self. Rudeus pushes these thoughts out of his mind and vows to try his best without relying on do-overs. Rudeus works on improving his combat power by sparring with Eris. Rudeus asks Cliff and Zanoba to repair and improve the magic armor, by making it smaller and more efficient.

Rudeus gathers his family to their garden as he plans to summon the guardian magical beast. Various family members distrust Orsted and are skeptical that Orsted's summoning magic circle is safe, but Rudeus reaffirms his trust in Orsted. Rudeus activates the magic circle and ends up summoning Arumanfi, Perugius' servant. Arumanfi is very annoyed for being separated from his connection with Perugius and demands that Rudeus annuls their new contract. They quickly annul Arumanfi's new contract with Rudeus, with Perugius' help. Rudeus tries the summoning again. This time, he pictures summoning a lion. He ends up summoning a large dog. Eris soon points out that the dog looks similar to the Holy Beast that they met in Dorudia village. Rudeus worries about angering the Dorudia tribe for taking away the Holy Beast, but he decides against once again annulling the contract. They name the animal Leo.

Chapter 3: Opening Move

Luke comes to Rudeus' house and directly asks for Rudeus' support in Ariel's bid for the throne to Asura Kingdom. Ariel has given up on persuading Perugius to support her. Rudeus suspects that Luke has been influenced by Hitogami as in his future self's timeline. Luke denies knowing Hitogami; he says he is making this request of his own accord. Rudeus tells Luke that he will consider his request to support Ariel and get back to him later. Rudeus thinks to himself that he isn't sure if supporting Ariel would be acting in according with Hitogami's plans, and so he wants to consult with Orsted first.

Chapter 4: Mind Made Up

Rudeus meets with Orsted. They update each other on what has happened on the last 10 days. Rudeus tells Orsted that the Holy Beast Leo was summoned as his guardian magical beast. Orsted is surprised that such a powerful beast was summoned. They feel that the safety of Rudeus' family is now nearly guaranteed. Rudeus informs Orsted that he has asked Cliff to help solve Orsted's curse by developing a magic tool. Orsted has asked Perugius to help Ariel become queen, but Perugius refused, as he isn't certain that Ariel is worthy of becoming queen. Rudeus informs Orsted about Luke's visit with him, about the fact that Luke may be Hitogami's apostle and that Luke asked for Rudeus' support for Ariel. Orsted insists they should still help Ariel. However, Orsted suggests killing Luke, as he is quite certain that Luke is Hitogami's apostle. However, Rudeus is reluctant to kill someone, especially an acquaintance. Rudeus responds that he is concerned that if they kill Luke, they will have taken away a major source of emotional support for Ariel and that he may be vital for her to become queen. And furthermore, Hitogami may have taken into account that Orsted would try to kill Luke. Orsted agrees to hold off on the idea of killing Luke.

Rudeus asks Orsted how many people Hitogami can manipulate. Orsted replies that Hitogami can use future sight on up to three people, although he could manipulate more people without using future sight, he typically limits to manipulating three people. Next, Orsted gives Rudeus a robe, as previously promised, to improve his defense in combat. It has considerable magic resistance and is highly blade resistant. It also reduces the weight of the wearer by half and allows one to move very quickly.

Back at home, Rudeus has a discussion with Sylphy. He confirms that he will be supporting Ariel for queen, as per Orsted's orders. Sylphy remains distrustful of Orsted and asks what Orsted has to gain by doing this. Rudeus replies that Orsted wants political connections. Orsted's plan is to ask Perugius' to support Ariel, as Perugius has political influence. They discuss the fact that Rudeus will be going to Asura Kingdom to support Ariel. Sylphy states that she wants to come as well, to support her friend. Rudeus warns Sylphy to be aware that Hitogami can manipulate anyone, and reveals that Luke is likely being manipulated. Sylphy declares that if Luke ever were to betray Ariel, she would kill Luke. Rudeus thinks to himself that if they were forced to kill Luke, he would take it upon himself to do it.

Chapter 5: Working Together

Rudeus, along with Sylphy, goes to Sky Castle and sees Ariel having tea with Nanahoshi. Ariel looks tired and depressed. They join for Sylphy for tea. Nanahoshi tells Rudeus that Orsted has forgiven her for her betrayal. Ariel notes that while she was afraid of Orsted, she didn't hate him. Rudeus wonders if the Orsted's curse is less effective on her and if Hitogami may be manipulating her. Ariel muses that she had planned to ask for Rudeus' support in the past, but decided against it. She felt Rudeus was too powerful and she wasn't worthy to control that power. Rudeus counters that while he has great magic power, he considers himself an average person with all the worries of an average person. Rudeus tells Ariel that he intends to support her. Ariel is very grateful. She inquires if supporting her was Orsted's idea. Rudeus lies so that he can feed Hitogami false information via Luke; he tells her that it was actually his idea to support her, but that he has Orsted's blessing.

Ariel's group's discuss that their first goal is to gain Perugius' support, given his wide influence. Rudeus brings up Perugius' question: What is the most important factor to a king? Perugius promised that if Ariel came up with the correct answer, he would offer her his support. Rudeus thinks to himself that Ariel's former guardian magician Derrick Redhat would have been the one to tell her the correct answer to the question. So, he asks Ariel about Derrick. Ariel suddenly remembers that Derrick death was what inspired her to become king. She recounts how Derrick sacrificed himself to save her life. Prior to this, she had no interest in being king. She recounts Derrick's final words, which implored her to become the king. Inspired by the sincerity of his dying words, she decided to strive for the throne. Despite Ariel remembering her reason for wanting to be king, she is still unable to answer the question of what is a king's most important factor. (In the Web Novel, she is actually able to come up with the answer to the question at this point, and the story continues on in chapter 8 of this volume).

Chapter 6: Orsted's Suggestion

After the reunion with Ariel,
Rudeus
 inform about what happened to Orsted and the possibility to search about the first King of Asura to find the answer. Orsted proposes to go to the Book Labyrinth, a place where exist a copy of every book of the world made by a demon king, this place is located in the demon continent and they need to teleport. Orsted give to Rudeus a sketch of a certain book if he don't find the necessary information

Rudeus now in Chaos breaker he find Ariel, talk a bit and inform the plan to search in the labyrinth, she accepts the plan. The next day in the base of operation of Orsted they find a magic circle in the basement, The person that go are Rudeus, Sylphiette, Luke, Ariel, Eris and Ghislaine Rudeus formarly presents Eris and Ghislaine as escort to Ariel, in the end they use the magic circle.

Chapter 7: Library Labyrinth

They appear in a room similar to the others teleport rooms, Eris excitedly wants to explore but is stopped by Rudeus, when they enter, they find hallways of books, arranged from oldest to newest and in the center of the labyrinth they find the Demon king Betobe, a huge slime with a eyeball that use his tentacles to write the books. They avoid him decide to search a book about the first king of Asura, Gaunis.

They find a book, he was the third prince during the Laplace war, after his older brother and parent were killed he became the next king of Asura, also find that he have many achievements but in the same time he wasn't perfect, and commonly he went to taverns, got drunk and fought. Rudeus also find books about Mikos, one of them is called "the powerless God" a miko that can change the rules of the world and can nullify the power of gods and abilities, Rudeus think how to remove curses and may help Zenith, taking notes of this in his diary.

He realizes that one of the tentacle started a copy of his diary, and Rudeus write in his diary that he want conversation with the demon King and he appear, because the future diary of Rudeus was a interesting experience of a alternative future, the demon king grant to Rudeus a wish, he show him the sketch that Orsted drew and he give him a book, that book is the Diary of
Derrick Redbat
.

After reading his diary, Ariel find the answer of being king and pass the diary to Luke, crying because the content, when they almost leaving, the demon king becomes angry because a tear of Luke damage the diary and he start to attack.the group start to run way meanwhile they block every attack and they leave the labyrinth.

Chapter 8: The Armored Dragon King and the Second Princess

Ariel arranges an audience with Perugius to once again ask for his support. Perugius reiterates his question: "What is the most important factor of a king?" Ariel's answer is "to inherit wills", that is to be influenced by others. Perugius laughs at this answer and calls her a fool. Ariel stands her ground and admits she may be a fool. She declares that she intends to state her true feelings. She further states that if their ideals aren't compatible, then despite the fact that she wants his assistance, they may not be able to work well together. Perugius is impressed with Ariel's conviction and agrees to lend his support. Ariel thanks Perugius, and leaves.

Rudeus stays behind and asks Perugius if Ariel gave the correct answer. He confirms that Ariel's answer was wrong. However, the way Ariel carries herself reminds Perugius of his old friend from many years ago, Kaunis, who was called the "Ideal King".  Rudeus asks Perugius, "what is the ideal king?", which Perugius refuses to answer. Perugius asks why Rudeus didn't bring up Orsted's in Ariel's negotiations with him. Rudeus thinks to himself that it's because he knows that Orsted had already asked Perugius himself to support Ariel and was refused. Rudeus gives a non-committal answer. Perugius calls him out on this and leaves.

Ariel, Luke, Sylphy and Rudeus plan their next steps. Ariel announces that she has heard news of her father's illness. Rudeus is surprised, as according to Orsted, they had expected the news to come later. Rudeus wonders if Ariel may be influenced by Hitogami. They then debate on the best way to travel to Asura Kingdom. Rudeus suggests teleporting to a magic circle just outside the kingdom. The reason he offers up is to better hide the fact that they used teleportation magic. In his mind, the reason for this is to give him an excuse to track down Tris, who will be key to taking down Darius, which will weaken the First Prince's faction. Sylphy, Luke, and Ariel all feel that they should instead directly teleport to Asura Kingdom to avoid the dangers associated with travel, and avoid assassins and mercenaries. Sylvaril, one of Perugius' familiars, announces that all the magic teleportation circles inside Asura Kingdom have been destroyed and so it is impossible to teleport directly into Asura Kingdom. Rudeus wonders who could have done this. Therefore, they are forced into Rudeus' initial proposal, which is to teleport to a magic circle just outside the Asura Kingdom border.

Chapter 9: Before Traveling to Asura Kingdom

Leo integrates himself into Rudeus' family and acts as their guard dog. Ghyslaine confirms that Leo is from the Dorudia tribe.

Rudeus, Cliff, and Zanoba meet to have dinner at a fancy restaurant. Cliff and Zanoba are concerned that Rudeus is now working under Orsted. They feel that Orsted is too dangerous and cannot be trusted. Rudeus tries to tell them the truth at first, that Orsted has a curse that causes others to fear and hate him. Cliff and Zanoba remain unconvinced, however. Rudeus therefore lies and tells them that he actually plans to kill Orsted in the future, and so needs their help to upgrade the magic armor. Rudeus also asks Cliff for help on reducing the power of Orsted's curse; Rudeus lies by saying that the curse is like a barrier that weakens his opponents. Cliff and Zanoba agree to help Rudeus.

While Rudeus was drinking with his friends, Roxy, Sylphy, and Eris held a meeting. This is the 26th regular meeting between for Roxy and Sylphy, but the first one for Eris. Roxy explains to Eris that the purpose of these meetings is to help their communication and dispel any feelings of envy. They all discuss how they came to meet Rudeus and the history of their relationship with him. Lilia also joins them and reminisces on her past history with Rudeus as well. They all start drinking alcohol. Elinalise joins them and starts drinking as well, despite being pregnant. Only Roxy doesn't drink as she is also pregnant. She casts detoxification magic on everyone once they all finish drinking.

Rudeus meets Orsted. He reports that Ariel successfully persuaded Perugius and the news that the magic circles to Asura Kingdom are broken. Orsted believes that the destruction of the magic teleportation circles were caused by Hitogami. Orsted further deduces that Hitogami's disciple must therefore be First Prince Grabell or Senior Minister Darius. This is because only people with great political influence can access and destroy the magic circles, as they are all well guarded by soldiers. Orsted reiterates that Luke is likely an apostle of Hitogami. He speculates that the third and last apostle is someone talented with the sword or magic. Based on this, he believes that the North Emperor Auber and Water God Reida are likely candidates. Orsted tells Rudeus that all the potential apostles of Hitogami, Darius, Auber, Reida can be killed, while Luke should continue to be observed and killed if necessary.

At home, Rudeus and Sylphy announce to the family that they will be leaving for Asura Kingdom and will be gone for 3-4 months. Eris decided for herself that she would go as well. Norn and Aisha tease Rudeus that he is likely to come back with another wife. Rudeus wants to protest that this won't be the case, but knows he no longer has any credibility on this matter. Rudeus notes that since both he and Sylphy are leaving, they are leaving their daughter Lucy without any parents at home. They leave Lucy for Lilia to raise. Since Roxy is staying behind at home, Rudeus tries to spend more time with her before he leaves. They agree to name their future baby Rolo or Lara if the baby is a boy or girl respectively.

Extra Chapter: The Black Wolf Sword King

Eris and Ghyslaine, accompanied by Rudeus and Sylphy, go to meet Ariel for the first time. Eris and Ghyslaine worry about the fact that they lack knowledge on manners and etiquette in high society. Eris is particularly worried about this as she doesn't want to reflect poorly on Rudeus. Rudeus isn't concerned about himself, but rather on damaging Sylphy's reputation. Eris thinks to herself that she doesn't think of Sylphy as part of her family, but rather considers her to be more of a comrade. Rudeus suggests that Sylphy teach them etiquette until they arrive in Asura Kingdom, to which Sylphy agrees.

Eris introduces herself to Ariel, followed by Ghyslaine. Ghyslaine immediately makes clear that her goal is primarily to exact revenge on Sauros' behalf. Ariel promises Ghyslaine to help her find the perpetrators for Sauros' death. Ariel thinks to herself that it was likely a feudal lord who caused Sauros' execution in order to weaken the forces of the first prince. She considers the possibility that it may have been someone within her own faction, and that this may cause issues with Ghyslaine in the future. Ariel looks at the three in front of her: Eris, Ghyslaine, and Rudeus. Although they are powerful and support her for now, Ariel realizes that they have not sworn fealty to her. Ariel correctly suspects that Rudeus is only supporting her on Orsted's instructions, although Rudeus denied it earlier. Ariel doesn't understand what Orsted is planning, and she remembers the fear she experienced when she first saw Orsted. Nevertheless, Ariel feels secure in the fact that Rudeus only follows Orsted to protect his family. Therefore, Rudeus will not hurt Sylphy, and Sylphy will not hurt Ariel.

Ghyslaine and Elinalise meet in a bar to catch up on each other's lives. They comment on how they wish the rest of their old crew could have been there: Geese, Talhand, Paul, and Zenith. Elinalise describes Paul's final moments and the circumstances that led up to it. They reminisce on how they both used to be sexually interested in Paul. Ghyslaine responds that she was in estrus at that time. Ghyslaine is shocked at how Zenith has lost her memories and personality. They then talk about their past adventurer days as well as things that have happened since the mana calamity and since meeting Rudeus. Ghyslaine muses that her former master Philip died in the mana calamity, but his killer is also dead. Her focus is now on exacting Sauros' killers and she has joined as Ariel's escort for this reason. Before returning home, Elinalise asks Ghyslaine to take care of her grandchild Sylphy and her husband Rudeus. Ghyslaines agrees to do so.

Light Novel Volume 17
=====================

Information

Summary

This is the seventeenth volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 light novel, which covers the Asura Kingdom Arc Part 2. Its contents corresponds to volume 18 of the web novel.

Synopsis

MISSION AGAINST HITOGAMI AND HIS APOSTLES

It's been a few weeks since they returned from the
library labyrinth
.
Rudeus
 accompanies
Ariel
 to the
Asura Kingdom
 to complete the Mission in making Ariel queen. In preparation for the decisive battle, the group prepares the stage at the royal castle of Ars.

On the day of the party that happens after overcoming many obstacles. Ariel take down the enemy power of the
First Prince
. However, the enemy also has a trump card hidden, ending up in a predicament...?. Can Rudeus protect Ariel in ascending to the throne?

Chapters

Chapter 2: The Red Wyrm’s Upper Jaw

Chapter 3: Suspicions and Theories

Light Novel Volume 17/Summary
=============================

Information

Summary

Chapter 1: The First Mission

Ariel
's group, including
Sylphiette
,
Luke
, Elmore, Kleene,
Rudeus
,
Eris
 and
Ghislaine
 leave Sharia, headed towards the
Asura Kingdom
 to help make Ariel the King, and take a magic teleportation circle to Sky Castle Chaos Breaker. After greeting
Perugius
, they take a magic circle that transports them to a ruin near the
Red Dragon’s Upper Jaw
. Because it is almost night, the group rest near the road.

On Rudeus's turn for night patrol, he goes into the forest and meets
Orsted
, who is following the group. Rudeus reports on the events of the past few days. Orsted advises that the forest of the Red Dragon’s Upper Jaw is the most likely place for
Darius
 to send soldiers to kill Ariel, as it is still within Asura Kingdom's jurisdiction, while being distant enough to avoid creating big news. They speculate that the North Emperor
Auber Corvette
 is likely to appear there as well. When they discuss the matter of Luke being an apostle, Orsted reveals that
Hitogami
 can only reassign his apostles at certain turning points in the future. In this case, the turning point is when Ariel does or does not become queen. Until then, apostles cannot be swapped or changed, and any apostles that die cannot be replaced. Rudeus is annoyed at not having received this crucial information earlier. They finish their conversation and Rudeus returns to camp.

Chapter 2: The Red Wyrm’s Upper Jaw

The group arrives at the forest of the Red Dragon’s Upper Jaw, which is the most likely place to be ambushed, according to Orsted. The group stop for a moment at the location where Ariel's group was ambushed when she was fleeing Asura Kingdom to Ranoa. She pay her respects for the people that she lost that day.

The next day, the group is ambushed by a group of soldiers. Ghislaine, Eris and Sylphiette fight the group of soldiers. Meanwhile, Luke protects the carriage, with Rudeus in the rear. Using his Eyes of Foresight to monitor the situation, he is looking for and anticipating a surprise attack from Auber. The North King
Wii Taa
 appears and challenges Ghislaine to a duel. He uses his polished armor to reflect the sun's light to periodically blind Ghislaine, and so Ghislaine struggles to fight Wii Taa. Rudeus sees this and summons Mud Rain, therefore nullifying Wii Taa's strategy and allowing Ghislaine to take the opportunity and deal a serious injury to him.

After helping Ghislaine, Rudeus looks to the rear and unexpectedly finds that Auber has appeared from a hole in the road, Auber tries to kill Rudeus, but Auber is repelled. Auber and Rudues briefly fight. When Ghislaine, Eris, Sylphi arrive to support Rudeus, Auber and his group decide to retreat. Luke stares in disbelief as he sees that the soldiers they just fought have the Milbotts crest, meaning that his father
Pilemon Notos Greyrat
 has betrayed Ariel.

Chapter 3: Suspicions and Theories

Luke is still in disbelief at the fact that his father betrayed Ariel. Ariel, in contrast, had fully expected this. Because Auber and his group may continue to ambush them, Rudeus proposes that they try to smuggle themselves into the country. By doing this, Rudeus thinks to himself that he would also be able to complete one of his objectives, which is to find Tris.

Luke voices out loud that he feels Rudeus's recent actions were strange, and that he doesn't trust him. Luke suggests to Ariel to retreat temporarily, and to ask for further reinforcements from Perugius. However, Ariel decides to follow Rudeus plan. They change their course to find smuggling bandits.

During Rudeus's turn for night patrol, he meets Orsted again. They talk about recent events. They are now more certain than ever that Luke is an apostle, but they agree to leave him alone for now. After returning to camp, Rudeus finds that Ariel up and awake. She asks him to accompany her on a walk in the woods.

Chapter 4: Ariel’s Choice

After entering the forest, Rudeus and Ariel sit on a trunk and start with some trivial small talk. Suddenly, Ariel brings up Luke and the fact that she believes that he is betraying them. Rudeus says that he is probably being manipulated, but he hesitates to reveal that Hitogami is behind this. Ariel requests to meet Orsted to understand why he is helping her. Before Rudeus can give an answer, Orsted appears. Even after being affected by Orsted's curse, Ariel regains her composure and they start to talk.

Orsted explains that a being called Hitogami is his enemy and is currently siding with Darius and
Grabell
, the First Prince. Orsted reveals that 100 years into the future, if Grabell becomes king, it leads to events where the kingdom of Asura will fall, but if Ariel becomes king, the kingdom will survive. Hitogami wants Asura kingdom to perish because the person who will defeat him is born in Asura Kingdom. Ariel learns that there are only 3 Hitogami apostles at one time, and that Luke, Darius and either the North Emperor Auber or Water God
Reida
 are the current candidates. Ariel decides to became  Orsted's subordinate.

Chapter 5: Tristina

The group enter to the territory of the band of thieves, where they are surrounded and the leader appears. Using code phrases learned from Orsted, Rudeus indicates that he wants their group to be smuggled and to meet Tris. They arrive to a hut and the group rests while they wait for Tris.

Some hours later, Tris arrives. Rudeus engages with her, but she comes across as guarded and suspicious. Thinking to himself, Rudeus tries to comes up with a plan to gain her trust over time and slowly reveal their group's goal to overthrow Darius. Ariel sees Tris and instead goes for the straightforward approach. She identifies Tris as
Tristina Purplehorse
, a noble daughter that she met several years ago.  Tris also recognizes Ariel and immediately lets her guard down. Ariel asks about the fact that Tris had gone missing and how she came to be a bandit. Tris reviews her life story, starting with how she was kidnapped and became a sex slave for Darius. She was then sold to bandits to become their boss's concubine, then trained as a thief, and then became a free woman when the boss changed. After hearing her story, Ariel promises to exact revenge on Darius on Tris's behalf. Ariel asks Tris to testify against Darius about being his sex slave. Tris accepts and joins their group. Rudeus looks at this exchange in admiration at how Ariel was able to skillfully and easily get Tris on their side.

Chapter 6: On the Road

The next day, led by Tris, they arrive at a lake and a cliff with a secret cave. After several hours of walking through its labyrinthine tunnels, they leave the cave and arrive in Asura kingdom territory. As the group passes by the
Fittoa Region
, Rudeus, Sylphy and Eris reminisce about the past.

The group then arrives at a town named Rickett, which connects to the Asura capital. They stop at an inn associated with the thief guild to rest, while Tris goes out to gather information. Tris returns and goes to delivers her news to Ariel, while Rudeus and Ghislaine are on guard duty. Rudeus then hears some arguing in Ariel's room and goes to investigate. He enters to the room to find Ariel and Luke arguing. Rudeus learns that Tris has confirmed that Pilemon was one of the culprits in the execution of Sauros, and that Ariel will keep her promise with Ghislaine to kill him. Luke is angry as he still believes that Rudeus is aiming to take over the Notos house. Ariel states that after taking power, she has no intention of granting nobility to Rudeus, which Rudeus is grateful for since he had no intention of accepting such a position. The next day, Luke admits that he did indeed receive advice from Hitogami. The advice was a warning of Rudeus's betrayal; that Rudeus's goal is to be lord of Notus House, that he will defect to Darius's side, and that all of his actions and the events that occurred to the group are the result of his scheming.

Days later, with Luke still hostile against Rudeus, they arrive at the capital city Ars.

Chapter 7: Ars, the Royal Capital

The group goes to the Ariel's second house within Asura, which will be their base. As they travel through the commoner district, they see that Ariel is still popular with the common people. When they enter the noble's district, a soldier runs up to them. They reveal themselves to be
Isolte
, one of Eris's acquaintances from the Holy Land of the Sword, and they chat for a bit. The group then arrives at Ariel's second house.

Ariel says that she needs ten days to gather her allies and prepare her Venue to take down Darius and the first prince's faction. They decide to use Sylphy disguised as Ariel as bait to draw in the enemy, giving them an opportunity to launch their attacks to reduce the enemy's forces.

Chapter 8: Duel at Dusk

Ariel works on her preparations to gather her allies. Their group is frequently attacked by assassins targeting Sylphy, who is impersonating Ariel, while the real Ariel hides as a maid. At one party, Luke meets his father, Pilemon. They discuss why he betrayed Ariel. Luke pleads for him to return to Ariel's faction, but Pilemon refuses.

On day nine, preparations for the Venue have been completed. The plan is for Ariel to host a party, with all the major nobles of Asura in attendance, where she will announce that Perugius is supporting her, and reveal Darius' crimes to the other nobles to guarantee her ascension to the throne. That evening, as the group returns to their base, an assailant blocks the road and announces himself as the North King 『Twin Swords』
Knuckle Guard
, a pair of swordsman who are twins. Eris decides to fight them. Meanwhile, Wii Taa appear with black armor and confronts
Ghislaine
 for a rematch.

While they fight, Rudeus searches for Auber, who he suspects is waiting for a surprise attack. Using his spirits of light, Rudeus notices a strange cloth on the side of one of the stone walls and without hesitation fires a stone cannon. Auber is able to evade a mortal wound, but his leg was pierced, severely limiting his mobility. Eris defeats the twin swordsman Knuckle Guard, though suffers a major injury to her arm, and Ghislaine overwhelms Wii Taa thanks to her great night vision, cutting off his arm. Wii Taa then throws a smoke screen and tries to attack the carriage, hoping to find Ariel. However, Sylphy was inside instead and she counters with a Flame Tornado, which clears the smoke screen and illuminates their surrounding. They see Auber escape using his pair of claws to climb up the wall and he disappears. They Wii Taa trying to escape in an alley, but they decide to pursue and finish off Wii Taa.

Rudeus chases Wii Taa into an alleyway, but he finds him already dead with a hole in his chest. Rudeus quickly realizes that the wound was made by Orsted. The others assume the wound was caused by a Stone Cannon from Rudeus, as no one but himself is aware that Orsted is helping them. And even though Auber escaped, their group's plan to reduce the enemy's strength was a success, as two North Kings were killed.

Chapter 9: Ariel’s Battlefield

Several important nobles, including the leaders of the Boreas and Notus house, Senior Minister Darius arrive at Ariel's party. When the party begins, Ariel introduces Tris to everyone in attendance as the long lost Tristina Purplehorse. Tris recounts her lifestory to all the nobles, from how she was betrayed by her family and sold to become Darius's sex slave, to how she became associated with a band of thieves and regained her freedom, leaving out the fact that she also became a thief herself, to avoid tarnishing her reputation. Darius accuses Tris of being fake, and brings in the head of the Purplehorse house, Tris's father. However, Ariel had anticipated this and had already contacted the Purplehorse family, and the head of the Purplehorse house confirms that Tris is indeed real and claims that she was stolen away by Darius. With this, Darius's reputation is badly damaged.

The first prince Grabell then arrives at the party. He states that Darius should not be punished despite his crimes, as he is an important player in running Asura Kingdom. He calls for a vote among all the nobles in attendance, asking them to confirm their allegiance to him and Darius, or Ariel. Before the vote commences, Ariel announces she has one more person to introduce. The nobles see the Sky Castle floating in the night sky and Perugius makes his entrance, along with his 12 familiars. Upon his entrance, it is clear that he is very well respected among the nobles of Asura, commanding more respect that even Ariel or Grabell. Grabell offers Perugius the highest ranking seat among the three seats of honor. Perugius politely declines and offers it to Ariel instead, making clear to everyone that it is Ariel that he supports.

Just as Rudeus was thinking that everything was going well for them, something falls from the ceiling to interrupt the party. It is revealed to be Water God Reida Reia, who has come to support Darius.

Chapter 10: Rudeus’s Battlefield

Water God Reida has a sword technique that allows her to kill all opponents within a certain radius around her, the second they move even the smallest of muscles. With this, she easily kills two of Pergius's familiars,
Almanfi
 and Trophimus, knocks out one of the nobles, and damages Rudeus' Zaliff Gauntlet as he sent mana to the ring in his finger which contacts Orsted. No one else dares to move anymore for fear of being instantly killed, including Rudeus, Ghislaine, and Eris. Reida commands Auber to kill Ariel and finish the job they were hired for. Suddenly, apprentice knights appear, including Isolte. Isolte demands her master to tell her what is going on. Reida states that she intends to murder Ariel, with the fabricated motivation being money, and then intends to let herself die at the hands of Isolte, who will become a hero and carry on the Water God style. As this happens, Rudeus tries to come up with a plan to save Ariel from Auber without being attacked by Reida. Rudeus considers using electric magic to attack Reida and Auber simultaneously. Suddenly, the air changes and everyone senses Orsted's presence approaching. At Reida's instructions, Auber grabs Darius and runs away. Reida begins to explain her motivations. She reveals that, as a child, Darius saved her from having her hands cut off by a mob, and therefore she feels she owes him her life. She had forgotten about this for many years until recently, when she had a revelation in a dream, which told her to come back to the royal palace, where she could return the favor to Darius. With this, it's confirmed that she is an apostle of Hitogami. Orsted then arrives and promptly kills her with a single strike.

With Reida dead, Rudeus, Ghislaine, and Eris are now free to move. They chase after and quickly catch up to Darius and Auber. Darius mutters in frustration at this turn of events. He reveals that he was told by Hitogami to destroy the magic teleportation portals, and recall Auber to the capital to protect himself from Rudeus. Darius tries to negotiate with Eris and Ghislaine by claiming that he has been helping the Boreas house rebuild the Fittoa territory. However, he also reveals that he directly led to the death of Sauros. Eris and Ghislaine therefore resolve themselves to kill him. Seeing that negotiations have failed, Auber launches an attack. Auber is able to badly damage Rudeus's leg, almost cutting it clean off, and stab Eris in the abdomen with a poisoned kunai, but he receives an arm injury from Ghislaine. Rudeus then launches an exploding Stone Cannon at Darius. Although Auber blocks the rock bullet, its fragments blind Darius and distract Auber. With that opening, Eris damages Auber's other arm, followed by Ghislaine landing a killing blow. The battle over, Ghislaine then kills Darius. Rudeus heals all their injuries. They cure Eris's poisoning with the antidote Orsted told Rudeus Auber kept on him to treat that poison he carries as well.

They head back to the party venue and are greeted with an unexpected sight. They see Luke holding a dagger against Ariel's neck. Luke orders Sylphy to kill Rudeus, if she wants to save Ariel.

Chapter 11: The Madness of Luke

A few minutes prior, after Orsted had killed Reida and left, Luke convinced himself that Orsted is evil. Pilemon then bows to Ariel and claims he only pretended to betray her. Ariel is angry at this bold-faced lie as she knows Pilemon sent assassins to kill her. She tells him to have some pride and at least admit his betrayal. Ariel sentences Pilemon to be executed right there and asks for Luke's sword.

Luke experiences mixed feelings about his father. On one hand, Pilemon had protected Ariel all those years until his betrayal. And although he was never close with his father, he didn't hold any bad feelings toward him either. Without thinking clearly, Luke holds his sword to Ariel's neck. Luke continues to be extremely suspicious of Orsted. He voices his concern at Rudeus being Orsted's subordinate and asks Sylphy if she trusts Orsted. Sylphy confirms she doesn't trust Orsted, but she trusts Rudeus. Rudeus then enters the venue. While still holding his sword to Ariel's throat, he asks Sylphy who she would choose to save, Ariel or Rudeus. Sylphy chooses Rudeus without hesitation. Luke then regains his senses and releases Ariel. He continues to distrust Orsted, but he decides to support Ariel regardless. He braces himself for execution for his betrayal, but Ariel forgives him. Ariel decides not to execute Pilemon, as he was just a pawn in Darius' game, and Ghislaine reluctantly agrees with this decision, with Eris's encouragement.

Perugius watched this entire exchange in amusement. Grabell remained seated in his chair, exhausted, and his strongest backer dead. Isolte grieves over the dead body of the Water God Reida.

Chapter 12: Ten Days in the Capital and the Truth About Orsted

Rudeus recounts the 10 days following the event at the venue. During these 10 days, Pilemon is stripped of his position, and placed under house arrest. Luke becomes the Notus family head. Luke's brother is able to ease tensions between their family and Ghislaine. Ghislaine continues to work as Ariel's escort as a permanent employee.

On Day 1, Rudeus has a meeting with Orsted. Rudeus is worried that Ariel's ascension to king is still not guaranteed, and is concerned about other traps set by Hitogami. Orsted is not worried, however. He reveals that he wasn't being truthful to Rudeus when he said he could see the future, because up until this point he never fully trusted Rudeus and was monitoring him during these events to see if he would betray Orsted. He explains that he has the ability to reset himself to the year 330 with his memories intact, whenever time progresses for 200 years beyond that point, even if he dies. Hitogami, in contrast, doesn't retain his memories with each reset and so isn't aware of Orsted's reset ability. Orsted reveals that he has reset well over 100 times. Therefore, Orsted reassures Rudeus that based on all the previous timelines that he has seen, Ariel is guaranteed to become king at this point.

On Day 3, Isolte visits Eris and Rudeus in their home, which was gifted to them by Ariel. Isolte makes clear that she holds no grudge against Ariel or her faction for Isolte's master's death. Isolte makes clear she came to visit only to see Eris. Eris and Isolte then spend some time together exploring the Imperial city, with Rudeus joining as well to make sure Isolte didn't try to attack Eris.

On Day 5, Rudeus and Sylphy have dinner with the Boreas house. Eris was not invited as the Boreas are still wary of her and are not interested in welcoming her back.

On Day 8, Tris returns to the aristocracy. Ariel plans to use Tris to broker deals with her group of thieves. Perugius returns to Sky Castle, where he can revive his two familiars who were killed.

On day 9, Sylphy and Rudeus meet Ariel. Ariel thanks Rudeus for all his help and admits that without his advice and help, she never would have gotten this far. Ariel asks if Rudeus wants anything in return. Rudeus asks for a license to sell his Supard race figurines and books, as well as workshops to help with mass-producing. Ariel agrees to this request. Ariel likewise thanks Sylphy for guarding her for the past several years. Ariel and Sylphy spend some time talking and laughing together.

With their work done, Rudeus prepares to leave Asura Kingdom.

Chapter 13: Farewells and Changes

Ghislaine holds a sword training session with Rudeus and Eris, reminiscent of the old days. They finish their training session with Ghislaine and Eris sparring. Ghislaine then says her goodbyes to Eris. Once Ghislaine leaves, Eris cries.

Before their departure, several nobles from Ariel's faction, who knew Sylphy, come to see her off. Luke says goodbye to Sylphy and Rudeus as well. They forgive each other for distrusting the other and they say goodbye on good terms.

For the return trip, they will go to Sky Castle with Perugius, and then teleport to the ruins near the outskirts of Sharia city. Therefore, the return trip to Sharia will be much faster than the initial trip there. By the time they enter Perugius's castle, the sun had set, and so they spend the night there. Rudeus speaks with Sylphy. Sylphy expresses that she would like to spend more time raising their daughter Lucy, now that she no longer has the role of Ariel's guard. Sylphy states that she initially wanted to be like Eris, who is comparable to Rudeus in terms of combat ability. However, she realizes this would be impossible for her at this point and so she sets her new goal as focusing on raising her family.

Chapter 14: Home Again

Rudeus, Eris, and Sylphy return to Magic City Sharia, having been gone for 2 months. Rudeus is relieved to see that nothing has changed since he left and his family is still safe. Aisha and Lilia welcome them home. Roxy's pregnancy continues to progress well, but she is ashamed at how her body has changed. She reveals to Rudeus that she is particularly sensitive about the fact that her bell button is now protruding outwards, as she recounts how Rudeus previously told her how her belly and navel were perfect. Rudeus reassures her that she still likes her new navel. Rudeus hugs her growing belly and Roxy welcomes him home.

The next day, Rudeus greets all his friends, Zanoba, Cliff, and Elinalise. He greeted Nanahoshi as well while back at Sky Fortress. He then visits his father's grave. Rudeus speaks out loud all the events of the past 2 months. Rudeus then reflects on the fact that he was very lucky this time to return with no casualties on his side. The past journey had several lucky occurrences, such as Orsted appearing to kill the Water God, and Auber carrying his antidote on him. He resolves himself to continue to get stronger so that he can continue to protect his family, without being as reliant on luck.

Light Novel Volume 18
=====================

Information

Summary

This is the eighteenth volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 light novel, which covers the Subordinates arc. Its contents correspond to volume 19 of the web novel.

Synopsis

RUDEUS TRAVELS AROUND THE WORLD

Rudeus
 completes his first mission to make
Ariel
 the next King of
Asura Kingdom
. Since then, a year and a half has passed, receiving numerous missions from
Orsted
, and when he returned to his
house
, he purchased her old senpai
Linia
 from a slave merchant.

One day, a letter arrives from the Doldia village to Rinia ["Urgent, the
Holy Beast
 is missing! search!]  Rudeus decides to go to the Great Forest to talk about the situation of Leo. Visiting again the prison of the village, he finds an unexpected person.....
