Light Novel Volume 2/Summary
============================

Prologue

He darted through the hallways; his pursuer was a "wild beast". The creature’s terrifying voice rang out as it chased him relentlessly. Its words booming throughout the manor made his legs tremble.

Rudeus
 was fear struck as he hid in the shadows, terrified. The whole scenario started an hour prior.

Chapter 1: The Young Mistress’s Violence

It was evening when Rudeus arrived in the
Citadel of Roa
. The carriage had reached their destination, the liege lord’s gigantic manor. Rudeus was startled by a voice that boomed from outside the reception room. A muscular man about fifty years old stormed in who, after a loud exchange, permitted Rudeus' stay at the manor, and then stormed out of the room the way he came in. The man was
Sauros Boreas Greyrat
, liege lord of the Fittoa region, and also
Paul’s
 uncle – the butler explained to Rudeus. Next, a man appeared in the doorway. He introduced himself –
Philip Boreas Greyrat
, the liege lord’s son. Philip then went on to elaborate about the young mistress Rudeus was about to tutor. Rudeus believed he had a chance to make her listen to him and explained a trick of his to Philip. This "trick" was to pretend to have the
Young Mistress
 kidnapped, with Rudeus helping him escape through his use of magic, reading, arithmetic, etc. to encourage her to want to learn these things on her own. Showing interest in Rudeus’ plan, Philip called the girl.

And so, Rudeus finally met the Young Mistress. Rudeus’ first impression –
fierce
. He was greeted with a strike to the face. Rudeus’ second impression –
violent
. Not waiting for a response, Rudeus slapped her back to make her aware of the pain. But to his surprise, she pinned him down. Rudeus managed to escape, however she came flying at him with the fiercest look Rudeus had ever known. Rudeus, fear struck, broke into a run. This was how she, like a wild beast, chased the terrified Rudeus around the manor.

Exhausted from the pursuit, the Young Mistress eventually gave up and returned to her room. Rudeus decided he won’t give up on this job and teach the violent girl a lesson. He went and asked for Philip’s cooperation on the plan he explained before. Philip, amused to see the result, immediately began preparation.

Chapter 2: All According to Plan?

When Rudeus opened his eyes, he found himself in the middle of a dirty storehouse with the Young Mistress. So far, the plan has been progressing smoothly. All that remained was for him to create a magnificent escape with her using his great intellect. But when one of the “kidnappers” came in to silence the Young Mistress, he was way too violent. There was something wrong, Rudeus came to realize, something went wrong with the plan and they ended up with real kidnappers. Rudeus now had to come up with a plan to escape without attracting trouble. He slipped out of a window he created with the Young Mistress to end up being greeted by an unfamiliar town that wasn’t Roa. Rudeus then made a proper promise with Eris, in order to get her home she must properly hire him, to which she agreed hurriedly.

The next morning, they reached Roa. At the sight of the liege lord’s manor in the distance, they let heir guard down. Suddenly, two men grabbed the Young Mistress and disappeared into the alleyway. Rudeus immediately blocked their escape. His opponents were the two men who previously kidnapped them. Rudeus created an explosion above the buildings to startle the kidnappers. He succeeded in snatching away the Young Mistress from the man holding her. With the Young Mistress in his arms, they were able to get away but, the other man threw his sword at tremendous speed straight at Rudeus. Rudeus froze and thought his life would end there, but right at that moment, someone flew in to deflect the sword – it was
Ghislaine
. She beheaded the men in an instant and the fight ended immediately.

They finally reached the manor and the Young Mistress had regained her spirits. She arrogantly announced she would hire Rudeus as per the promise and allowed him to call her by her name – Eris.

Side Story: The Aftermath and the Boreas Greeting Style

Rudeus learned the one pulling the strings behind the incident was the butler, Thomas. A perverted noble had caught his eyes on Eris and offered him money to kidnap her. The incident was, reportedly, resolved by Ghislaine’s involvement; Philip directed Rudeus to give all the credits to her instead to divert the problems Rudeus would face. As they were talking, Sauros turned towards Rudeus and, on behalf of Eris, asked if he would teach her magic. Rudeus told Sauros that she should learn to ask for the things she wants herself, and so he called her out.

Ordered by her grandfather, Eris stood in front of Rudeus to ask him to teach her magic. Eris, glaring coldly at Rudeus, made her request while imitating a cat-girl. To his shock, Rudeus could not process her behaviours and was scared of what might happen next. She was not cute at the least; not bashful, but she looked angry. Rudeus decided he would need to stop this weird custom before it causes trouble for him down the line. After an effort, the Boreas style of asking for favours was abandoned.

Chapter 3: Her Ferocity, Unabated

It had been a month since Rudeus took up the job of a tutor. Eris proved to be a very violent and a problematic pupil; though she would pay attention to magic classes, she always ran away when it came the time for the other subjects. Anyone who came after her would get punched; Rudeus wasn’t willing to get himself into such a situation.

Finally with the help of his other student, Ghislaine, Eris gave an effort to the other classes. Whenever Eris felt unmotivated Ghislaine recounted stories of her adventurer days, where she would highlight the importance of education in practical situations; Eris listened closely and it would always fire her up. To Rudeus, it seemed Eris very much so wanted to become an adventurer.

Rudeus was progressing well in swordsmanship under Ghislaine’s guidance, more so than he ever could under Paul. He felt a large part of his improvement was thanks to having a rival – Eris. Although she seemed far more gifted with a sword, an opponent of almost equal strength helped him propel up his techniques too.

At the end of each day, Rudeus spent time in his room preparing for the next day’s lessons and finally review his own magic textbook. In such manner, his days as a tutor passed rapidly.

Chapter 4: Staff Meeting and Sunday

Six months had passed and Rudeus organized a staff meeting with Ghislaine and Eris' etiquette teacher,
Edna Leylune
. Before the meeting he convinced Phillip to allow Eris to have one day of per week, and informed Edna of this change as well - effectively giving himself a day off as well with no reduction in pay. On their first day off Rudeus and Eris headed out to the mercantile district where Rudeus visited multiple shops to learn the prices of things he was interested in. Eris laughed at Rudeus for writing down the prices of these items, but when he instructed her on the importance of managing one's own wallet she listened and understood.

Rudeus also learns about the
Armored Dragon King Perugius
 and his impressive involvement of sealing
Laplace
 in the human vs. demon war 400 years ago after Rudeus saw his floating castle,
Chaos Breaker
.

Chapter 5: The Young Miss Turns Ten

Another year had passed in which time Eris became Intermediate-tier in swordplay in addition to her 10th birthday quickly approaching. This meant a large celebration party in which she would be forced to dance, resulting in all her lessons for a couple weeks being etiquette lessons. However, Edna was unable to teach Eris how to dance as she disliked moving to the rhythm of the beat as it was different from her own, but with some help from Rudeus and pretending that each step is dodging a sword attack or feint she was able to at least mimic the dance moves. During the party Rudeus used this same trick to help calm Eris down and prevent her from embarrassing herself. Overall it was a great party and at the end of the night Rudeus invited Ghislaine and Eris to his room where he presented them with their apprentice wands, and they ate food and drank together.

The next morning Rudeus ascends the stairs of the one place in the mansion he was not supposed to go, only to find Sauros getting busy with one of the cat-eared maids. They had a brief conversation in which Sauros says he was praying to an ominous red gem floating in the sky.

Chapter 6: Learning A Foreign Language

Rudeus reads a book giving an overview of this world's history. Around 15,000 years ago there were seven worlds each with their own people, but they all converged onto the current world when the others were all destroyed by an evil Dragon God who was later slain by his own commanders. Since then 3 Great Human-Demon Wars broke out, with the most recent being caused by the Demon God Laplace and his invasion of human territories. It ended when Laplace was sealed by a group of 7 heroes, Dragon King Perugius being one of them. A truce among humans and demons was created where any restrictions on travel for demons to continents primarily inhabited by humans were lifted and the two races can live in peace, on paper. Although in practice the demons are still persecuted in many human dwelling areas.

Rudeus also started to learn another of most common languages in the world, the Beast God tongue, spoken primarily in the nothern part of the Millis Continent where the Beast race has their largest settlement and the Demon God tongue, spoken on the
Demon continent
. After a year Rudeus turned 9 and was able to successfully learn the Beast God tongue from Ghislaine, and he got a reply from Roxy after sending her a letter to help him learn the Demon God tongue including a complete dictionary and notes about each demon race hand made by Roxy. She also told him that
the prince
 she is now tutoring bought a creepily accurate figurine of her, which unknown to her was actually made by Rudeus.

Chapter 7: Absolute Promise

Rudeus turns 10, and successfully learned the Demon God tongue as well as the Fighting God tongue, spoken on the
Begaritt Continent
. He is now only unable to speak the Sky God tongue and the Sea God tongue out of the most common languages. He is also approaching the Intermediate tier in swordplay while Eris had reached the Advanced-tier. Rudeus was also increasing his proficiency with magic through his continued creation of lifelike figurines.

Because Paul was disowned from the Notos Greyrat family another member took over being the head of the household, and would possibly send assassins towards Rudeus if they found out who he was. Because of this Rudeus was unable to have as large a party for his 10th birthday as Eris did, however she organized a surprise party for him where everyone in the manor attended. During the party Rudeus was given a magic staff,
Aqua Heartia
, an extremely expensive magical staff that makes it much easier to cast all types of magic especially water magic. The party ended with just Rudeus and Phillip left, where Phillip explains that he lost the battle to become the head of the Boreas Greyrat family to his older brother James. He has not given up on this dream though, and offered to let Rudeus marry Eris and help him seize control of the Boreas family, saying he would put Eris in Rudeus' bed that very night. Rudeus politely declined, not wanting to get involved in any political machinations.

After Rudeus left to return to his room he found Eris sitting there wearing a negligee, and told him she was there to keep him company since she thought he must be lonely and that today was a special day. Because of that she let him grope her a little bit, but Rudeus pushed too far causing her to get mad and beat him up. After a couple minutes she returned and promised him that in 5 years after he turned 15 that she would go all the way with him.

Chapter 8: The Turning Point

Roxy leaves her position as royal court magician and personal tutor of the 7th prince of the Shirone kingdom after he student turned 15 according to her original contract. She also did this in order to find out what was going on in the Fitoa Region due to the strange colors of the sky.
Dragon God Orsted
, Perugius,
Sword God Gal Falion
 and Demon Emperor
Kishirika Kishurisu
 also all noticed this disturbance in the sky, with Perugius sending out one of his 12 familiar,
Almanfi
 to investigate. This lead to Almanfi nearly killing Rudeus due to mistakenly thinking he was the one causing the disturbance when he was merely trying to show Ghislaine and Eris his Saint tier water magic. Before they could talk about what was going on a bright light enveloped the entire sky causing the entire Fittoa region and all its people to disappear.

Epilogue

Six months later Roxy arrived at the Fittoa region only to see for herself that the entire settlement truly was gone, and next to nothing was left of what used to be there being merely a field of grass now. Roxy learned that a mana calamity occured causing all residents of the Fittoa region to be teleported to random location all across the world. Many are still completely missing. Paul left a note saying that he has a search team of adventurers in the Millis continent searching for anyone affected by the calamity including Zenith, Lilia, and Aisha who are still missing, while Norn is with Paul, and that since he knows Rudeus is capable he will be searching for him last. Roxy made up her mind to help search for Rudeus and inform him of what happened by finding a search party and heading to either the Begaritt or Demon Continent.

Extra Chapter: The Forest Goddess

A side story about Ghislaine being teleported in the middle of the Ejin Forest in the middle of the Central Continent's Conflict Zone. There was a battle going on there where the newly formed Markien Mercenary Country was being surrounded by both the Dikuto Kingdom and the Broze Empire in their alliance to take down the new threat, and the Markien Mercenary Country staked their victory on one final ploy to send out 10 of their soldiers through the forest, which was known to be extremely dangerous so no one entered it, to assassinate the Dikuto Kingdom's king while dressed in the uniforms of the Broze Empire. This resulted in the company of 10 being saved by Ghislaine who was teleported there, and who assisted them in slaughtering their way through the Dikuto Kingdom base and eventually killing their king. Right before his death he ordered his army to break the alliance and attack the Broze Empire, thinking it was them who started it, allowing the Markien Mercenary Country to take advantage of the situation and beat both countries with their meager remaining army. This caused the leader of the company of 10 to create a good luck charm of Ghislaine's figure, with all his men following suit causing "Laine" to become the Markien Mercenary Country's Goddess of Protection lasting more than 100 years, all without her knowledge.

References

Light Novel Volume 20
=====================

Information

Summary

This is the twentieth volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 light novel, which covers the Cliff arc. Its contents corresponds to volume 20.5 and the earlier portion of volume 21 of the web novel.

Synopsis

CLIFF HOMECOMING

Rudeus
 returns with
Zanoba
 from Shirone Kingdom to Ranoa Kingdom. One day, a letter arrives to
Cliff
, who is graduating from the Magic University of Sharia, from his grandfather in
Millis
. As with Zanoba, he suspected that may be a trap of
Hitogami
.

Rudeus also receives a letter from the Latreia family,
Zenith's
 parents' house. What is waiting for Rudeus and the others who came to
Millishion
?

Chapters

Chapter 1: Plans for the Future and Cliff's Concerns

Chapter 2: The Zanoba Store

Chapter 3: Cliff and the Institute of Magic Student Council

Chapter 4: Cliff and Zanoba's Graduation Ceremony

Chapter 10: The Pope, and...

"The Zanoba Store"

Light Novel Volume 20/Summary
=============================

Information

Summary

Chapter 1: Plans for the Future and Cliff's Concerns

Rudeus reviews his discussion with Orsted where they came up with 3 courses of action. The first is to use the Rude Mercenary Company for intelligence gathering. The second is to make connections with influential people with political power and warn them of the war that will occur in 80 years. Examples include Ariel, the next queen of Asura Kingdom and Cliff, the grandson of the Pope of the Milis religious order. The third is to gather warriors who will help Orsted to fight Laplace in his place. They plan to gather those whose fate is already to fight Laplace and who won't easily become Hitogami's disciple, such as Ogre God, Dwarf God, disciples of Water God Style and Sword God Style, North God Karuman III, Death God Randolph, and Ruijerd. Rudeus considers the fact that Hitogami will likely try to influence people within Rudeus's organization and disrupt their plans. Rudeus reasons that since Hitogami is limited only 3 disciples, the plan is to have a large enough organization that the effect of 1 or 2 betrayals doesn't cause significant disruption to their plans. Rudeus brings up with Orsted the need for a method of communication when they are separated. Orsted suggests creating a device similar to the Seven Great World Powers stone monuments and adventurer guild cards. Orsted intends to build the communication device himself. Lastly, Rudeus wants a method for transporting his Magic Armor Mark 1, which is quite bulky. He plans to use summoning magic, but he is currently unable to summon inorganic matter. Rudeus hopes that with some practice, he will be able to do this.

Rudeus visits Cliff. Cliff and Elinalise were having sex earlier in the day, when Rudeus tries to visit. Cliff has a haggard appearance when he greets Rudeus, which has been the case since his child was born. Elinalise greets Rudeus while breastfeeding her baby. Cliff reveals that he has received a letter from his grandfather in Milis. The letter expresses how the grandfather cares for Cliff's well-being and looks forward to Cliff's return; the letter also warns Cliff that there is conflict within the Milis religious order and that Cliff should prepare himself for this if he should return. Cliff indicates that his initial intention was to return to Milis after graduating and that he was prepared to deal with the scheming within the Milis religious order. However, now that Cliff has a family, he is concerned for the well being of his son Clive, as the Milis religious order readily targets the weak and Cliff isn't confident that he can protect his son. Furthermore, Cliff's grandfather is still unaware that Cliff has married an elf and Cliff worries about the scandal this might trigger, as some factions of the Milis religion persecute anyone who isn't human. Therefore, Cliff is conflicted. On one hand, he wants to return home, but on the other, he realizes that he would be exposing his wife and child to danger, and because of his wife's elf heritage, his grandfather might be put in danger as well. Rudeus doesn't know what the right decision is, either. Rudeus offers for Cliff to join Orsted's faction. Cliff would receive Rudeus' and Orsted's support and protect Cliff's family. In return, Cliff would prepare for Laplace's revival. Rudeus explains the plan in detail to Cliff and about their plan to prepare for the battle with Laplace 80 years in the future. Rudeus feels he's offering Cliff a good deal. Cliff asks for more time to think about the offer. Although Rudeus is confused as to why Cliff doesn't agree right away, he respects the request for more time to decide. Cliff plans to give Rudeus an answer at the graduation ceremony, which is in 2 months.

Chapter 2: The Zanoba Store

Rudeus visits Zanoba. As Zanoba is no longer a prince, he has sold off his royal possessions to raise money and bought a house near Rudeus. He lives there with Ginger and Julie. Rudeus pays Zanoba a salary for research and development on the magic armor. Rudeus enters Zanoba's home, to find Zanoba and Julie making dolls together. Rudeus asks Zanoba to resume their project to produce and sell Ruijerd dolls. Rudeus hopes that this will allow him to more easily find Ruijerd, partly so that he can recruit Ruijerd in the fight against Laplace, and partly to simply meet Ruijerd again. Another motivation for resuming the production of the figures is to draw in craftsmen, who may also have ideas for improving the Magic Armor, whose development has stalled. Zanoba and Julie agree to start mass producing Ruijerd figures.

Chapter 3: Cliff and the Institute of Magic Student Council

Cliff visits the staff at the university and submits his thesis, "Tools that suppress curses". The staff at Ranoa University are enthusiastic. They feel this research is going to be recorded in the history books. However, the top graduates are already decided and so although his thesis was the best of that season, Cliff will not be recognized as a top graduate. Cliff doesn't mind this. In the past, he may have thrown a tantrum, but over the years he has changed and no longer feels the need to have the title of the top graduate. Still, Cliff is dissatisfied because his thesis is only on "Suppression" and not "Removal",

He wants to return to Milis, but he doesn't want to endanger his family. He thinks on Rudeus's proposal of join Orsted, He knows that almost all his growth was thanks to Rudeus, but for some reason he doesn't like this fact. He never doubted that he himself was a genius, but when he says that phrase, he feels better about himself.

When he leaving the university, he finds Norn and the student council in a discussion over a Wraith who was draining the mana of the students. Norn is conflicted, as there aren't any adventurers or priests available with exorcism magic to defeat the monster, but she doesn't want to ask her brother for help. Cliff decides to help Norn. Together with the student council, they go to the basement warehouse. This warehouse has several relics. Due to a cleaning proposed by Norn, someone possibly destroyed the old seal which sealed the Wraith. The group finds the wraith and start to fight. The wraith controls various skeletons, whose skill is proportional to the skill of the person while they were alive. The student council group starts to fall apart. Cliff uses his magic eye, finds the weak point of the wraith and defeat the wraith with his magic. They discover that the wraith was born because hundreds of years ago, a teacher locked some students in a room, who ended up dying. The teacher then sealed the room.

Cliff and the student council make an honorary funeral for the deceased students. Cliff asks Norn why she didn't ask Rudeus for help. She answers that she wanted to do everything by herself, as much as possible. They then talk about their future plans. Cliff asks Norn if she will ask Rudeus for help in the future. She responds that she wants to use the knowledge that she's gained at school and to see her own limits. Cliff thanks Norn and in turn, she also thanks Cliff for helping her for all those years.

Lying in his bed at night, Cliff sees the face of Elinalize, and remembers when he first met her. Although she was different than what he expected, she also was more beautiful than expected. They talk and Cliff decides to walk with his own feet and to only ask for Rudeus's help only if necessary, as he don't want to grow dependent.

Chapter 4: Cliff and Zanoba's Graduation Ceremony

In the two months before the graduation ceremony, Rudeus and Zanoba worked on setting up their first store front. They were supported with advice from a member of their mercenary group, who used to own a store but failed. Rudeus reflects on how he was hesitant to accept advice from someone who failed, but decided to give him a chance. They set up their shop as a small warehouse in the outskirts of the workshop district. The small warehouse has enough room to carry their inventory, and it has an associated store front.

At the graduation ceremony, Cliff and Zanoba are lined up with the rest of the graduates. Zanoba was allowed to graduate despite recently dropping out, since he's a special student and Vice Principal Jinas was accommodating. There are about 500 graduates. The student council, led by Norn, are present as well. Brooklyn von Eruzais, a graduate from the royalty of Neris Dukedome, was recognized at the ceremony as a Graduate representative. Rudeus sees Cliff, who has a listless face. Rudeus notes that Cliff in the past would have been angry at not being chosen as representative. After all, Cliff's achievements at Ranoa overshadows all the other graduates. He achieved advanced rank in all four attack magics, advance rank in healing magic, advanced rank in detoxification magic, intermediate rank barrier magic, and advanced rank exorcism magic. On top of that, there is his thesis on suppressing curses. Rudeus looks closer at Cliff''s face and recognizes that he looks troubled. Rudeus speculates that this is because Cliff still hasn't decided on whether to accept Rudeus's offer to join Orsted.

After the graduation ceremony, Rudeus meets with Zanoba and congratulates him. Zanoba notes that although he thought the graduation ceremony would be just an annoyance, he actually enjoyed it. The graduation representative, Brooklyn von Eruzais, introduces himself to Rudeus and challenges him to a duel. Brooklyn acknowledges that he was only recognized as a graduation representative due to his family's influence and that his test results were always second to Cliff. Brooklyn has wanted to test his strength against Rudeus ever since he defeated Badigadi in one hit. Brooklyn explains that when he returns to his home country, he will inherit a position where he is responsible for his subordinates and so will not have the opportunity to test his own strength at his own convenience. Rudeus agrees to the duel.

Rudeus easily defeats Brooklyn. Brooklyn seems to have know this was how it was going to go, and graciously accepts his loss. Other graduates then gather and challenge Rudeus to duels as well. After that, Rudeus dueled with about 20 people. They all left feeling satisfied. The duels weren't tiring for Rudeus, but Zanoba, who was the referee, was tired. They then go meet with Elinalise and Cliff, who were watching the duels from the rooftop. Rudeus congratulates Cliff on his graduation. Rudeus asks Cliff what his plans are. Cliff states that he will stay with his family for the next year, at least until Clive stops breastfeeding. As it takes two years to travel from Sharia to the Holy Land of Milis, Cliff wants to return home two years after graduation, as he feels obligated by a sense of duty. Cliff plans to use the teleportation circles to shorten the travel time. In terms of joining Orsted's company, Cliff declines for now. He wishes to climb the ranks of the Milis order with his own strength, without Orsted's support. Rudeus understands. Rudeus is reminded of the people who challenged him to a duel earlier. It is the desire to test one's own ability. Once he stands at the top of the Milis order, Cliff will become Rudeus and Orsted's associate. After one year, Cliff will leave his family behind for an indeterminate period of time, until he is at the top. Although not happy, Elinalise has accepted Cliff's decision. Rudeus is conflicted. By respecting Cliff's decision, Rudeus risks having Cliff being in a position where he will be murdered, meaning that he will lose his connection to the Holy Milis Kingdom as well as the person best at studying curses. But Rudeus also acknowledges that by allowing him to struggle alone, this may spur personal growth in Cliff. Rudeus decides to respect Cliff's decision. Rudeus thinks to himself that it may be three years before Cliff rejoins them. In the meantime, Rudeus plans to get in touch with Ariel, and increase their mercenary force. Cliff and Rudeus finish their serious conversation. They all go celebrate Cliff and Zanoba's graduation.

Interlude: A Country Bumpkin Visits the City

Nina Farion, from the Holy Land of the Sword, receives a letter. She can read the fact that it comes from Isolte, but she lacks the literacy to read the letter's contents. Illiteracy is not uncommon in the Holy Land of the Sword. She finds someone educated to read the letter for her. The letters contents summarized the events over the last few years. Reida has died and Isolte has taken over the dojo. The coronation for Ariel will occur soon. There is a festival for one month before and after the coronation. Isolte invites Nina to come for the celebration. Nina immediately decides to go.

Arus, the capital of Asura Kingdom, is full of people who have come for the coronation. This is more people than Nina had ever seen before. She also learns that people are also here for the White Knight parade.

Nina meets a merchant. She learns about certain streets that are less crowded. Seeing that she is unable to read, the merchant offers to sell her a picture book and doll; the end of the book has a section for helping one to learn the characters. Nina reluctantly accepts. Nina notes that the doll is of the Supard race.

Nina sees Eris along with Rudeus and Lucy. Nina is shocked at the fact that Eris, who was regarded as a “beast” and “mad dog”, could get married and raise a family. Though not visible to Nina, Roxy, Sylphy, Zanoba, and Julie were nearby as well.

Nina decided against meeting with Eris and instead went to Isolte’s dojo. Nina meets Isolte and her disciples. Nina will be staying at Isolte’s home while in Asura. Isolte shows Nina their home. Nina is relieved at the fact that Isolte doesn’t seem to have a partner.

Isolte invites Nina to a small gathering. Nina agrees to go. Nina soon regrets accepting the invitation when she is forced to change into a dress and is led to a large mansion and realizes that the “small gathering” is actually a large party for nobles.

At the party, Nina goes to the bathroom, but then gets lost. She wanders the venue and sees a room with Ariel and Rudeus inside. She catches glimpses of their conversation and suspects that Rudeus is blackmaililng Ariel for sex. Nina intends to kill Rudeus and save Ariel. Before she does that, she notices Eris standing behinid her. Nina considers her chances of beating both Eris and Rudeus. Ariel and Rudeus then leave the room and greet Nina and Eris. Nina quickly realizes that Ariel wasn’t being threatened. Ariel explains that she was just negotiating with Rudeus. Ariel realizes that Nina was just trying to help her, and so Ariel thanks Nina and introduces herself. Ariel explains that this party was organized by herself and Rudeus.

At the party, Rudeus recruits allies for Orsted. He asks the party attendees to lend their forces to Orsted approximately 80 years in the future, when a certain person wakes up. Nina, like the other attendees, are puzzled by this request, but nevertheless nod and agree.

After the party, Nina was told to stay behind at the venue. Eris informs her and Isolte that this mansion, the party venue, has been gifted to Rudeus by Ariel. The three women, Nina, Eris, and Isolte talk to each other. Speaking with her friends as a group, Nina is reminded of the old days when they trained together.

In the time before Ariel’s coronation, Nina explores the city with Isolte and Eris. After the coronation, Nina returns to the Land of the Holy Sword. She reflects on her visit to Asura Kingdom. She had agreed to join Orsted’s camp for the war in 80 years. She thought of the uncharacteristically happy Eris and how she married Rudeus. On arriving back home, she is greeted by her cousin Jino Britts. Upon seeing him, Nina asks Jino if they want to get married. Within a few months, they got married.

Interlude: Coming-of-Age Ceremony

Norn is doing well as student council president. She is quite popular as president. She is progressing in her magic and swordsmanship. The Rudo Mercenary company is doing well, with Aisha, Linia, and Pursena in charge.

Norn and Aisha's 15th birthday is approaching. The 15th birthday is especially important as it marks becoming an adult.

Rudeus initially plans on throwing a big party, but Roxy points out that Norn would likely prefer a smaller event. Rudeus then tries to plan the party in secret with the rest of the family, but it is pointed out that the party doesn't have to be a surprise and there's no reason to keep the planning process a secret.

The family discusses their plans regarding gifts. Lilia plans to give Norn a handkerchief, and Aisha an apron. Sylphy plans to give Norn a book, and Aisha a quill pen. Roxy plans to give Norn custom-made armor, and Aisha a trowel (magic tool) for gardening. Eris plans to give Norn a sword belt, and Aisha a normal belt. Rudeus plans to give Norn a figurine of Paul, but is unsure of his gift for Aisha. The rest of the family assure Rudeus that Aisha will likely enjoy whatever gift he provides.

Norn was delighted about the birthday party. Aisha had a surprised expression and muttered "I see, so I'm an adult now...".

On the day of the event, Aisha and Norn went to the mercenary office and school respectively, as usual. Aisha returns from the office. She received birthday congratulations, but no gifts as the Beast race do not have this custom. Aisha asks to watch the party preparations. She just watches patiently. Rudeus wonders what she is thinking about. Possibly about what it means to be an adult, or possibly just judging their skills. The food and decoration preparations are then completed. Norn returns home, carrying lots of gifts.

The party begins with Rudeus giving a short speech. He speaks of what it means to be an adult, such as being responsible, continuing to learn, and to have a goal. Lila then gave a speech about when Paul and Zenith were young, and when Norn and Aisha were born. The gifts were then presented. Norn was happy to receive her gifts. Upon receiving her gifts, Aisha also was outwardly joyful, but Rudeus wonders if her smiles are fake. For his gift to Aisha, Rudeus gives her a Migurd pedant, a replica similar to one given to him by Ruijerd. Aisha thanks Rudeus. She didn’t show her “happy face”. She had a blank expression, as if thinking deeply.

After opening the presents, the family enjoyed dinner and the cake. More students then stopped by with gifts for Norn. Linia and Pursena, along with their mercenary group members, then stopped by, having brought along a recently killed wild boar as a gift. Their group wishes Aisha a happy birthday. Aisha accepts their gift and congratulations with a genuine laugh and smile. The wild boar was put on a fire to roast. Everyone enjoyed the feast, with the Beast Race from the mercenary company and stray students joining in. The party eventually ended and everyone left. Aisha muses to herself about what it means to be an adult. She still doesn’t know what it means, but admits that it doesn’t seem unpleasant. Rudeus replies that he doesn’t know the answer either.

Chapter 5: Growth and New Horizons

Rudeus has discovered how to effectively summon his magic armor by using bidirectional magic circles. Orsted has made progress on a communication device. Although not a telephone, it is a lithographic communication device. Anything drawn on the main lithograph is copied onto the sub lithograph. However, the device is heavy and consumes significant magic power so it works best as a stationary device. The first pair has been installed in Orsted's office and one of Ariel's private rooms.

In terms of Rudeus's children, Lucy is now 5 years old. She learns magic from Sylphy and Roxy and learns to swing a stick with Eris. As an older sister, she also gives attention to her younger siblings Lara and Arus. Lara, the future messiah, is now 2 years old. Sacred Beast Leo continues to always be by her side. Arus is now 1 year old. He loves breasts. He smiles with delight whenever he is held and pressed against a female chest. Whenever Rudeus holds him, however, he cries.

After Rudeus's graduation, they go to a tavern to celebrate Cliff's farewell party. Cliff plans to set off on his own to Milis and climb the ranks on his own. Once becoming an executive officer, Cliff plans to return for Elinalize and his son Clive. After the party, Elinalize pulls Rudeus aside and asks him to go to Milis to support Cliff. Although Rudeus previously promised Cliff that he wouldn't help him, Rudeus agrees with Elinalize that Cliff would likely require his help. Rudeus decides to go to Milis.

Rudeus returns home to Aisha, Norn, and Lilia who were already at home. They have received a letter from Claire Latreia, Zenith's mother. The letter was a response to Rudeus's letter which was sent five years ago, which reported Zenith's illness. The letter commands Rudeus to bring Zenith back to Milis, as well as Norn and Aisha. Rudeus is initially surprised by the delayed response, but then remembers that it would take at least two years for mail to travel each way to Milis. Aisha and Norn indicate with their facial expressions that Claire is an unpleasant person to deal with. Rudeus was already planning to go to Milis, so he states that he will go and bring Zenith. Aisha protests that she was planning to set up a mercenary group and Zanoba shop in King Dragon Kingdom. Rudeus replies that he feels that their priorities should shift to Milis, having received this letter. Norn outright refuses to go, as she wants to finish school. Rudeus asks if Aisha would accompany him and Zenith to Milis, where she can set up a mercenary group there. Rudeus tells Aisha that she does not have to meet her grandmother. Aisha therefore happily agrees to go to Milis. Lilia also agrees to accompany them to Milis. Rudeus wonders if Lilia is also reluctant to meet Claire, as Claire is likely an adherent of the Milis faith, which doesn't look favorably on polygamous marriages. They agree to set of dd in about one month. Reflecting back on Norn and Aisha's reaction to their grandmother Claire, Rudeus wonders what kind of person she is.

Aisha starts preparing the paperwork she will need to set up a mercenary group in Milis. Cliff was informed that Rudeus would also be heading to Milis, given the letter he received from Claire Latreia. Cliff didn't hate the idea of Rudeus coming along and in fact was relieved. So, Rudeus,   Lilia, Aisha, and Zenith will be heading to Milis, in addition to Cliff. Sylphy is staying home to manage the kids and housework. Roxy is staying home as well due to poor relations between the Demon race and the Milis kingdom. Eris was prepared to go, but Lilia strongly advised her not to go, as Claire is a "finicky individual" and would likely not get along well with Eris.

Just as the group were ready to leave, it was discovered that Sylphy was pregnant.

Chapter 6: Onward, to Millishion...

Sylphy is pregnant. In the past, Rudeus notes that he would have deliberated on whether to depart on the business trip. Rudeus runs around the garden with glee. Lilia, in contrast, is panicking. She is torn between staying to support Sylphy and with accompanying Zenith to Milis. While Sylphy does several supports, in the form of Roxy, Eris, and Elinalize, she also has three young children to look after as well. Rudeus debates staying home while Sylphy is pregnant, to prioritize his family over work. Zenith then suddenly grabs Lila's hand and leads them to Sylphy, placing Lila's hand on Sylphy's shoulder. It was as if Zenith was trying to ask Lilia to look after Sylphy, and trying to say that she would be alright on her own, so Lilia should stay behind. Lilia therefore agrees to stay home and asks Aisha to take care of Zenith in her place.

They head off. Rudeus brings the lithograph for communication. He also brings a summoning scroll for the mark 1 armor. He wears the mark 2b armor. Over the past month, Rudeus has heard a lot about Claire Latreia. In summary, she's extremely stubborn and strict. From Norn, her only memories of Claire are of Claire getting angry at her for not doing well enough in her studies. From Aisha, she was scolded by Claire for doing better than Norn. As per Lilia, Claire is someone who values lineage and the Milis doctrine. Rudeus is not worried, however, as Claire's description reminds him of Sauros Boreas Greyrat. He reasons that as long as he is civil, that he will be fine. Rudeus asks Cliff about the House Latreia as well. Cliff states that his house Grimoire and House Latreia are enemies. House Grimoire is pro magic race, while House Latreia is anti magic race. House Latreia also has produced several members of the Temple Knights. Cliff muses that with Rudeus's connection to House Latreia, that he will not eventually become his enemy. Rudeus reassures Cliff that he has no intention of being his enemy. They joke that one of Rudeus's kids can marry Cliff's kid, Clive, to solidify their friendship.

They use the teleportation circle in Orsted's office, which brings them to a forest approximately 7 days of travel outside of Milis. They buy a horse carriage at a city and arrive uneventfully at the capital of Holy Milis country, Milishion.

Chapter 7: Cliff's Homecoming

They arrive at the capital city of Milis, Milishion. Rudeus is amazed at the beautiful white palace. Cliff agrees, but wonders if the people who run it from the inside are "dirty", sleazy and unethical. They decide to take a carriage to Cliff's family's estate. After 10 years, Cliff has returned to Milishion.

They enter through the Adventurer's district. They see lots of people of different races. They then see Gisu.

Gisu is very happy to see the group. He tells them what happened when they parted in Sharia. Gisu, Talhand, Vera, and Shera arrived on schedule in Asura Kingdom. There, they sold the magic stones for a fortune. Vera and Shera retired from being adventurers with their share and returned to their home town. Gisu lost all his money to gambling and sank into debt. Talhand, seeing Gisu's terrible state of debt, sold off his magic gauntlets, which took his entire fortune to produce, to pay off Gisu's debts. Rudeus notes that they must have been very good friends for Talhand to help Gisu to that extent. Together, Talhand and Gisu traveled back to Milis. From here, Talhand returned to his hometown, leaving Gisu alone. Gisu has returned to adventuring.

Before entering the religious district, Gisu says his farewells and leaves on his own once again. As suddenly as he appeared, he suddenly departed. Before leaving, he asks Rudeus if he remembers Paul's words while they were in the labyrinth. Rudeus remembers.

They arrive at Cliff's house by sundown. To Rudeus's surprise, it is just an ordinary single family home as opposed to a large mansion. Cliff explains that his grandfather, the Pope, has a room at the headquarters, so this house isn't used. As it is already late, Cliff invites Rudeus and his group stay at his home, which Rudeus accepts. They enter the house and find the place very dusty. Rudeus volunteers Aisha to help with the cleaning, to Aisha's disgust. As a group, they clean the house and then have dinner.

Rudeus, Aisha, and Zenith all sleep in the guest room. Rudeus asks Aisha if she wants to be his maid for the foreseeable future, as Lilia wishes. Aisha is not sure. They briefly discuss who Aisha's future love interest could be. They plan to go to the Latreia house tomorrow. Aisha says that she will go as well, despite her dislike of Claire, to fulfill her promise to Lilia.

Chapter 8: The House of Latria

They enter the Latreia residence. Rudeus marvels at how large the house is. The guards immediately hurry towards the mansion the moment they see Zenith. Aisha again reminds Rudeus of the fact that their grandmother, Claire Latreia, is an extremely unpleasant person. Rudeus nevertheless feels that he will be OK as he has experience dealing with unpleasant people.

Their group is welcomed into the home. They wait for Claire in the drawing room. Rudeus notes that Aisha is dressed as a servant with her usual frilly dress. Rudeus invites Aisha to sit while they wait and Aisha hesitates, but reluctantly agrees.

An old woman, who Rudeus quickly identifies as Claire, enters the room. Rudeus stands to greet her, but is ignored. Claire is accompanied by Andel, who introduces himself to Rudeus as their family physician. Claire then reprimands Aisha for sitting down, as she labels Aisha as merely a maid. Rudeus quickly tries to defend Aisha, explaining that he told Aisha to sit down, and that Aisha is his sister and should not be treated as a maid. Claire responds people are identified based on their clothes and that those wearing a maid uniform will be treated as a maid. Rudeus asks why he was initially ignored. Claire ignored him as she couldn’t rule out the possibility that he was an imposter, and judged it best to not reply to his greeting. Claire acknowledges that Zenith is real and that she remembers Aisha. She asks Rudeus to prove that he is his grandson. Rudeus states that the fact that he has brought Zenith and Aisha and has her letter is proof enough. Claire’s eyebrows twitch. She responds that she is then not able to recognize him as a member of Latreia. Rudeus counter that that he is one of the heads of the Greyrat family and has no need to be recognized as being a part of the Latreia family. He explains that he has close ties with Queen Ariel and that he is a subordinate to Orsted the Dragon God. Seemingly acknowledging his social standing, Claire apologizes for her earlier impoliteness and properly introduces herself as Claire Latreia, wife of the battalion chief of the Temple knight party. Likewise, Rudeus gives himself a proper introduction to Claire.

They all take a seat and have tea. Rudeus invites Aisha to sit as well. Claire’s eyebrows twitch, but she does not protest. Zenith is being examined by the physician. Rudeus apologizes for being unable to cure Zenith. Claire dismissively replies that a village such as Rudeus’s hometown would likely have limited means to treat curses. Rudeus counters that he has actually had significant access to expertise in healing magic, through the healers in Sharia as well as through the help of both Orsted and Perugius. Claire doesn’t believe that Rudeus knows Perugius. She then abruptly changes the subject and asks how Norn is doing. Rudeus explains that she is enrolled in Ranoa Magic university, and that she was left behind so that her studies wouldn’t be affected. Rudeus tells Claire that Norn is doing well in her studies and is student council president, to Claire’s surprise. Claire then commands Rudeus to bring Norn to Milis after her graduation, so that Claire can find a partner for Norn to marry. Claire makes clear that the person that Norn marries is ultimately Claire’s decision, as the head of the family. Rudeus reflects on how the warnings were true about Claire being unpleasant.

The doctor finishes his examination of Zenith. He notes how Zenith’s body is healthy, and that she appears younger than her actual age. The doctor then asks Rudeus and Aisha various questions such as about Zenith’s diet, day to day activities, physical, and mental health. He tells Claire that he sees no issues with Zenith and that even her mind seems stable. Claire asks if Zenith can give birth to more children, which the doctor confirms is possible. Rudeus jokes that he feels they are planning his mother’s second marriage. Claire gives him a cold look. She states that in Milis, a woman’s worth is dependent on her ability to give birth.

Claire then abruptly changes the subject again and tells Rudeus to cut ties with the Priest of the Pope’s faction. She is aware of his friendship with Cliff. The Latreia have started to associate with the Cardinal’s faction, who wish to ostracize the demon race. Simply not supporting the Pope’s faction is not enough, Claire commands that Rudeus cut all ties with anybody associated with the Pope’s faction. Rudeus asks if he at least remain friends with Cliff. Claire refuses. She states that if he continues to associate with the Pope’s faction, he will not be permitted to stay in the Latreia house. Rudeus feels the situation is hopeless and tries to calm himself. He rationalizes to himself that he knew Claire had a difficult personality and that he knew his friendship with Cliff could cause problems with his relationship with Claire.

Claire commands Rudeus to leave Zenith here and to depart. Referring to Zenith, she announces that as long as “this thing” can give birth, Zenith can be married off. Claire intends to marry her off to the nobility of the Cardinal faction. Claire notes that Zenith’s healthy body is a blessing in disguise. Rudeus is livid at hearing these words from Claire, at how she treats her own daughter like an object.

Rudeus is not able to remember what happens next. He remembers shouting loudly, grabbing Zenith and quickly leaving the Latreia residence, easily pushing any guards aside with magic. He soon finds himself at the border of the holy district. When Rudeus’s anger settles down, he is comforted by Aisha with a hug. Aisha muses that they weren’t able to make a connection with the Latreia house for their mercenary company. Rudeus had almost forgot about this. He announces that he doesn’t want Claire’s assistance anyway. Rudeus decides to try to make connections with Cliff’s faction instead. It is now late, so they decide to once again lodge at Cliff’s house.

Chapter 9: Headquarters of the Millis Church

Rudeus returns to Cliff’s house. He sees Cliff hugging an unfamiliar woman. Rudeus initially assumes that Cliff is cheating on Elinalize. Cliff asks Rudeus why he has returned, as Rudeus had initially planned to stay at the Latreia house. Rudeus recounts his visit to the Latreia house and his meeting with Claire. Cliff tries to get Rudeus to consider the situation from Claire’s perspective. He has Rudeus consider that by marrying Zenith to nobility, she will be able to receive assistance. Rudeus acknowledges to himself that he didn’t consider this. Cliff offers Rudeus to stay at his home. Rudeus considers sending Zenith back to Sharia, to protect her from the Latreia. But Cliff suggests that it would be a pity to send her back so soon after finally returning to her hometown. Rudeus agrees that its reasonable to least let Zenith visit her hometown before heading back to Sharia.

Cliff introduces Wendy, the unfamiliar woman. She is a childhood friend of his, from when they lived together in the orphanage. She was hired to do housework at Cliff’s place (???).

Rudeus asks Aisha of her opinion on whether he should send Zenith back to Sharia at once, or to stay for a short while to let her visit her hometown. Cliff confirms that he feels his house will be safe from the Latreia. They ultimately feel that the chance of being harassed by the Latreia is low, and that they will remain in Cliff’s house. Cliff offers for Rudeus to meet his grandfather and make connections with his faction. Rudeus agrees.

The next day, they go to the Milis Church Headquarters. Rudeus is stopped at the entrance as he doesn’t have a license to enter, although Cliff does. Cliff enters and promises Rudeus he will make a temporary license for him. Rudeus decides to stroll around the grounds outside the building. Rudeus admires the Saraku flowers, a plant with pink colored flowers that bloom at the beginning of spring. He then sees a plump young lady with a frill dress. She is surrounded by 7 men who shower her with praise and address her as Miko-sama. They are wearing armor and Rudeus estimates that they are at least Advanced rank in sword play. The men turn towards Rudeus and ask if he is a follower of the Milis faith. When he doesn’t answer immediately, they unsheathe their swords and point it at him. They accuse Rudeus of being an infidel and heretic. Rudeus tries to apologize. They then decide to kill him. Rudeus continues to try to de-escalate as he doesn’t want to cause a scene and ruin the beautiful garden. Rudeus prepares his magic for combat when a female knight interrupts to ask what is happening. The men address her as captain and claims that Rudeus was inflicting danger to Miko. Rudeus retorts that this is a lie. The female knight then recognizes Rudeus and warmly welcomes Rudeus. The woman is Therese Latreia, Zenith’s younger sister and Rudeus’s aunt. The person who assisted Rudeus during his voyage from the Milis Continent to the Central Continent many years ago. Therese is the leader of these men. On her command, the men quickly withdrew their swords.

Rudeus chats with Therese. Rudeus tells her about his meeting with Claire. Therese tries to defend Claire, saying that there might have been a misunderstanding. Therese is in high spirits. She asks Rudeus how Eris is doing and learns that they are now married with a child. Therese is currently the Miko’s escort and manages these men. The Miko then joins the conversation. Rudeus introduces himself as Dragon God Orsted’s subordinate and as Eris’s husband. It turns out that Eris was the one that saved the Miko’s life over 10 years ago, when she set out to exterminate Goblins but ended up stopping an assassination. The Miko thanks Orsted for ultimately saving her life. But Rudeus clarifies that he and Eris actually didn’t know Orsted 10 years ago. But if she feels a sense of debt toward Orsted, Orsted would be able to express his appreciation in the future. Rudeus explains that Orsted has a curse that makes people hate him. The Miko stares at him and confirms he is telling the truth. She reveals that this is her power as a Miko. Rudeus asks her if Hitogami has appeared in her dreams. She denies that this has ever occurred and states it can never happen. Rudeus believes her and wonders if it may be somehow related to her power. The Miko then asks Rudeus to tell her more about Eris. Rudeus agrees but before he can do so, he is interrupted by Cliff calling out for him, presumably having attained a license for him. Rudeus and the Miko and her entourage part ways. They promise to meet again to talk about Eris. Rudeus entrusts a message to Therese to pass to Claire, that he will “carry the responsibility for my mother’s problem so interference is futile”. Therese agrees to pass on the message.

Chapter 10: The Pope, and...

Just before entry Rudeus was thoroughly scanned for any weapons. The church was designed like a maze. It was designed to defend against enemy invasions similar to a castle. Cliff guided Rudeus smoothly. He states that Rudeus can't use Magic here as it was guarded by a barrier of Saint or King tier.Cliff's grandfather, Harry Grimoire(Pope) had the appearance of a gentle old man with a magnanimous heart. Cliff introduces Rudeus, but the Pope had already done his fair share of research about his life and purpose for coming here. When Rudeus was in the middle of processing why the Pope knew so much about him, he didn't even react to him. This led the Pope to believe that Rudeus was a badass and capable of being called the right hand of Orsted. The Pope told about everything he knew about Rudeus from where he was born to how he ended up here. Rudeus corrected him about some details like how he was tutored by Roxy and also about how some of his fights were helped by his friends and that he didn't do everything alone. The Pope considered Rudeus to be quite honest.

The purpose of Rudeus for being here were mainly: 1. To Establish the Rudo Mercenary Group in Milis. 2. To get permission to sell the Superd figures. 3. To form an alliance with Orsted for the future. The Pope wanted Rudeus to make his intentions clear. Did he befriend Cliff to get these things and would he support Cliff from here on out? To which Rudeus stated that he wanted to help Cliff because of his request to let him grow on his own. Rudeus would abstain from doing anything to support Cliff unless he wanted him to until Cliff became a Strong Figure in Milis. The Pope was quite happy from Rudeus's answer as he thought Cliff had finally made a True Friend. The Pope agreed to the 1st Demand but hesitated about the 2nd as even though their side were the Demon Integrationists, the Cardinalists (The side which Latriea family supported) had more influence and the future Pope would also be from their side. So he wouldn’t be able to grant his demand as he didn’t have that power. Rudeus understood that the Pope subtly implied that for his 2nd Demand to be met, he would also have to support the the Pope’s side and defeat the Cardinalists first. Rudeus was conflicted that this would count as help for Cliff, even though it was a bit of a gray area as he was also doing it for his own sake. He thought about leaving it for another day as he didn’t have to do everything in 1 day.

Rudeus left the meeting, feeling tired after encountering two exceptional individuals from opposite factions.Rudeus thought about which side he would pick, it was easy for him to choose the Demon integrationists but he felt conflicted as Therese who had saved his life twice was from the other side, also he didn't had any problems with Miko(Blessed Child) either except his entourage; Even though he didn't like Latrieas specially Claire but he couldn't forget the debt he owed them for funding paul's search party and also for taking care of his little sister, So he decided to postpone deciding a side for the time being. Rudeus planned to meet Miko a few more times to better understand her abilities and determine if she was an apostle of Hitogami, although he knew it would be nearly impossible to deduce. He resolved to stop overthinking about apostles and deal with them as they appeared, as it could be anyone Miko, Claire, or even the Pope. Next, Rudeus decided to focus on setting up the Mercenary building. He intended to install a contact tablet and consult Orsted about the matter. Since Aisha was proficient in handling business affairs, he entrusted her with managing the details, such as selecting a location and attracting merchants. Once he had made these decisions, Rudeus headed home.

Rudeus was making his way to Cliff's residence, contemplating his food choices. Upon entering the house, he witnessed an unusual scene: Aisha was angrily yelling at Wendy, which was out of character for her. Concerned, Rudeus intervened just as Aisha was about to strike Wendy, urging her to explain the situation. Aisha struggled to find the right words, and Wendy stepped in to provide the details. Here's what had happened: Geese had arrived and claimed to be a friend of Zenith. Seeing Zenith in distress, he wanted to take her out of the house. Aisha added that they hadn't returned since then.

Rudeus felt a bit perplexed and requested Aisha to start from the very beginning. Aisha began by describing Geese's visit that afternoon to Cliff's house. Although Aisha hadn't personally seen Geese, she became convinced after Wendy described his appearance, way of speaking, physique, equipment, and the content of their conversation. Aisha had been away at the market to get supplies and, upon her return, immediately searched for Zenith but found no trace of her. This left Aisha on the verge of tears. Rudeus reassured her, believing that Geese might have lost track of time but trusted that he wouldn't allow any harm to come to Zenith, despite his lackluster combat skills. Rudeus decided to wait for a while, hoping they would return. When Cliff returned after sunset and learned about the situation, he scolded Wendy, albeit not severely as she had no ill intentions.

As dinner approached, Rudeus made the decision to search for Zenith. Worries flooded his mind, considering the possibility of Zenith being kidnapped by the Latria household or Geese getting into a fight. Aisha insisted on joining the search, suggesting they split up. However, Rudeus deemed it unsafe and took Aisha along. He equipped himself with armor and, lacking confidence in horse riding, carried Aisha in a princess-carry position, running faster than a horse. Rudeus couldn't shake off the fear of repeating a situation like Shirone's, while fearing his lack of knowledge and confusion between allies and enemy; He steeled himself for whatever lay ahead.

Light Novel Volume 21
=====================

Information

Summary

This is the twenty-first volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 light novel, which covers the Zenith arc. Its contents corresponds to the latter portion of volume 21 of the web novel.

Synopsis

ZENITH IS KIDNAPPED

Zenith was abducted by someone and disappeared. Rudeus scrambles the city of Millishion to find her. "I am the son of Zenith. My dad told me to protect my mother even if I die". Is it possible to recover Zenith safely?

Information

Summary

Chapter 1: Playing Dumb

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Chapter 2: A Chess Problem

Rudeus, the next day, would meet with the Pope, where he explains to him about Zenith being abducted last night by the Latrias and seek help to find Zenith. The Pope, in return, would ask what Rudeus is willing to do for him. Rudeus responds, suggesting kidnapping the blessed child. Cliff tried to change Rudeus' mind, but Rudeus was angry because he couldn't let this go. The reason was that he couldn't let Zenith be treated like an object, as she couldn’t say no, and he wanted revenge against Claire. In the end, Cliff managed to change Rudeus' mind about the kidnapping and connect him with someone who could reach out to Claire. Rudeus would come to the realization that he should have contacted Therese first before approaching the pope.

Rudeus would try to meet with Therese by coming to the church garden every day, so as not to seem suspicious. The reason for this was that the Blessed Child rarely leaves the inner sanctum—only every few days is allowed to walk around the church garden. After finally meeting with Therese, she agreed to speak with Claire about the situation and even offered to talk with her father and brothers if Claire is reluctant to speak.

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Extra Chapter: The Berserker Sword King and the Blessed Child

Extra Chapter: Therese Looks for a Husband

Therese has been visiting the Latreia mansion more often lately, and one day Claire asks her when she’s planning on getting married. Though Therese protests that the only reason she’s still single is because her mother hasn’t arranged a marriage meeting for her, Claire reminds her that Therese herself was the one who didn’t want to be caught up in a power struggle, and Claire was merely respecting her wishes. Resigned to the fact that she’ll never find a partner without her mother’s assistance, Therese agrees to go through a marriage meeting.

The candidate is Dusklight Moorkite, a 27-year-old templar. Having prepared for the worst, Therese is satisfied with his background heading into the meeting, but she freezes up upon seeing his face. It’s Therese’s coworker, Dust Box of Anastasia Keep. Anastasia Keep was formed as a group of anonymous knights to prevent foreign spies from targeting their families; thus, Therese didn’t know about Dusk’s true identity before the meeting. Although she realizes that the marriage meeting itself is jeopardizing their jobs, Therese decides to seduce Dust, pretending she doesn’t know him. Dust, sees through her act and rejects her advances, demanding an explanation. Therese says that she now has no choice but to discharge Dust from Anastasia Keep for the Miko’s safety… unless Dust gets married to her and protects her from any potential assassins. Dust says that it wouldn’t be feasible… because if he were threatened by assassins, he would slaughter all his family members so they wouldn’t become hostages. Therese, remembering that all the Anastasia Keep knights are Millis fanatics, cools her head, and the two agree to call off the marriage.

Returning to the Latreia mansion, Claire begins lecturing Therese, claiming that Dust wasn’t suited to be a Latreia family member’s husband. Therese resolves to do better next time, praying that her next candidate won’t be as poor of a match as Dust was.

Extra Chapter: The Monkey and the Wolf

With the help of the advices of Hitogami, Geese was able to run away and evade their pursuer, and with him, they started to device a plan to gather "friends'' like Rudeus. The plan is to use Hitogami to call a person in his dreams to a reunion and Geese recruit the person, so they can have more than 3 people that can help Hitogami. Because he is afraid of a betrayal, he only wants a small but powerful group. Following Hitogami advice, Geese arrives to a snow land and find a snow dragon killed and a swordsman near the body, The swordsman was depressed and Geese says that Hitogami can grant him the wish to fight Orsted, the swordsman ask him why he help someone like Hitogami

Geese remember part of his life. He was an average person in his village and to be someone recognized in life, he decided to run away from his home and become an adventurer. As an adventurer, even though he was trying his best, he was barely average, and with his skill, he was only doing low rank quests and was basically the same as he was doing in his village. One day, when he was in danger against a monster, he met hitogami for the first time and following his advice he survived. After he became an apostle and always followed his instruction, he was able to rank up, joining to Black Fang Wolf party, which became famous  and doing hard quests until the disband of the group. but in the end  he still felt that he was a regular person.

In the end Geese respond that even if he uses other people, he wants to be recognized, Hitogami needing him even though he is a weak person is important for him. The man decides to join the Geese and he says that the place of the decisive battle is already decided.

Spoiler:
The Swordsman
.

Light Novel Volume 22
=====================

Information

Summary

This is the twenty-second volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 light novel, which covers the Organization arc. Its contents corresponds to the earlier half of volume 22 of the web novel.

Synopsis

REUNION WITH PAST ENEMIES

An apostle of Hitogami, who had been hiding until now, was finally discovered. Rudeus, who is now gathering his strength to fight, decides to persuade Atofe, the immortal demon king who reigns in the Demon Continent to make her a powerful ally.

However, negotiations are difficult for the group of Rudeus. "Atofe-sama. Could you please listen to me before a fight?" Rudeus's party fights against a demon king that can't understand words.

Information

Summary

Chapter 1: Coming Home and Making Reports

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

(The main change is that Zanoba is going to join to Rudeus in his travel to Kingdom of Dragon King (KDK), because is worried about Pax Jr.)

Chapter 2: Randolph's Woes

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Chapter 3: The Politics of the King Dragon Realm

Searching for help to increase his probability of success, Rudeus and Zanoba are going to meet Shagar, the first commander of KDK and an old friend of Randolph. They arrive at a training ground, but the general was busy training the soldiers, meanwhile a man called Vio Von Dragon arrives and starts to talk with Rudeus about Asura and KDK armies. Because the general is going to train until the sunset and Von Dragon Surname also has power in the kingdom they leave to talk.

In a restaurant, they start to talk about the situation of the country, how Millis believers arrived in the kingdom  causing some problems and the weird movements of some countries in the strife zone. After Rudeus and Zanoba left, they returned to the training ground but the general already left, so the group decided to install his base of operation.

Chapter 4: The Naughtiest Kid

Rudeus, using the teleport circles, travels to Asura to visit Ariel. he reaches to the deepest part of the kingdom, the king room and finds a gatekeeper Doga. He doesn't want to let Rudeus pass because he needs proof that he is Rudeus, after a large discussion Ariel opens the door and he is able to enter.

Rudeus already knows that Ariel was responsible for the recent movements of the countries in Dragon King Real and he wants her to stop that so he can negotiate with them, Ariel easily accepts. After leaving the room he finds Ghislaine,The leader of the seven knights and an old man with long black hair, they also talk a bit.

Spoiler:
Old man with long black hair

Chapter 5: The King of the King Dragon Realm

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Interlude: Blue and Red

Roxy was in the house creating a test for the school of Ranoa, suddenly she felt a burning smell inside of the house,  searching for the source of the smell, she arrives to the kitchen and find Eris that wanted to cook a meal for herself but failed, Roxy use magic to clean the mess. Roxy decides to make a meal for Eris, Eris asks Roxy if she can teach her the demon language, because now, Rudeus, Roxy and Eris are going to the Demon continent, and she wants to understand what is happening. She accept, also Roxy and Eris feels a little closer.

Chapter 6: Infiltrating Fort Necross

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

(The main difference is that in the end Atofe kidnaps Rudeus, flying away).

Chapter 7: Dueling Atofe's Ultimate Four

Roxy and Eris watch how Atofe is flying away with Rudeus, Eris loses her composure and starts to follow Atofe cutting his guards, but Roxy stops her and says that she needs to remain calm. Eris remembers her training with Isolte to not let her bloodlust control her and decides to trust in Roxy, Roxy says this is going to be something like a ritual where Rudeus is the princess and they need to rescue him.

After that, appears the four heavenly kings of Atofe and they fight one by one where everyone is a least North king rank, Eris defeats the first knight easily, the second one have a slime type of body, but with help of Roxy and her, Eris also defeat him, and the third battle was about to start.

Chapter 8: Imprisoned in Fort Necross

Rudeus is thrown into a pink room that looks like it was made for a captive princess. After Atofe leaves, Moore arrives and explains the situation to Rudeus. The reason that she captured Rudeus was because she misinterpreted his words when he said that he came in the name of the kingdom of Asura. To solve the situation, Rudeus says that he wants the role of "The princess that helps the heroes" to participate and Moore accepts,  and he is able to leave the room.

Chapter 9: Princess Rudeus Enters the Fray

The battle of Roxy and Eris against the other two kings continues and the other Atofe guards are defeated. After the battle, Rudeus arrives and heals them. Atofe appears in a flashy way with the help of Moore, and another battle is about to start.

Chapter 11: Number Four

Extra Chapter: The Monkey and the Dreaming Youth

In the Bergarit continent, Geese was traveling the desert with the help of Hitogami and from his own experience, he was able to evade every danger and arrived at a small village, Geese asked to the villager where he can find a certain man and they tell him that man is in a hill alone. Geese climb the hill and find a young man with long black hair. He was waiting for a hundred of years for a legendary Behemoth to fight him and become the greatest hero of the history and a recent prophecy of hitogami, he knows that he is going to find that monster here.

The next day Geese watch how a colossal monster appears near the village, but was easily defeated by that man and all the villagers claim that man is a Hero. That man didn't feel that is a hero and wasn't satisfied with the battle, expecting something more legendary. Geese say to him that he knows the location of the “evil” Superd race and the Dragon God Orsted, and defeating both of them can transform him into the greatest hero of the history. He agreed to join his cause.

young man with long black hair

Light Novel Volume 23
=====================

Information

Summary

This is the twenty-third volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 light novel, which covers the Fourth Child arc. Its contents corresponds to the latter half of volume 22 of the web novel.

Synopsis

TO THE HEAVENS: THE TRIAL OF PERUGIUS

The fourth child Sieghard was born, with the same green hair as Laplace. However, one of the Perugius familiars who witnessed the scene, told to Rudeus and the others to come to the sky citadel with the baby.

"If this kid grows up and really causes a war with the human race then I will deal with it ... "Rudeus tries to prepare himself for his family.

When Perugius heard this, his answer was...

Chapters

Chapter 1: The Green-Haired Baby

Chapter 2: Path to the Divine Continent

Chapter 3: Aluce, City of the Divine Continent

Chapter 4: Christening

Chapter 5: Teleportation Device to Another World

Chapter 6: Nanahoshi's Fate

Chapter 7: The Mad Dog's Old Stomping Grounds

Chapter 8: A North God, an Adventurer, and More...

Chapter 9: A North God, a Mercenary, and More...

Chapter 10: The Second Eye

Extra Chapter: Geese and His Final Ally

Adaptation Notes

Differences from the original web novels.

This volume covers the last 4 chapter of Web Novel Vol 22

In the web novel, in a short event, Sieg was baptized in Perugius' castle, while in the light novel Perugius gave Rudeus a trial, and he travelled with his wives and Sieg to an old Ruins of the Laplace in the Divine Continent, and Sieg was baptized there.

New chapters of Rudeus and Eris traveling to Sword Sanctum and the Conflict Zone.

New Chapter about Geese and Badigadi.

Light Novel Volume 23/Summary
=============================

Note:
 Information to be added later on

Chapter 1: The Green-Haired Baby

Chapter 2: Path to the Divine Continent

Chapter 3: Aluce, City of the Divine Continent

Chapter 4: Christening

Chapter 5: Teleportation Device to Another World

Chapter 6: Nanohoshi's Fate

Chapter 7: The Mad Dog's Old Stomping Grounds

Chapter 8: A North God, an Adventurer, and More...

Chapter 9: A North God, an Mercenary, and More...

Rudeus and Eris arrive in the town of Hammerpolka in the Strife/Conflict/Warring States region after parting with Sara and the Amazonesses. On the lookout for the North God Kalman and Geese, they run in to Zoldat, who is facing off against a group of Milis Knights demanding that he hand over a Demonkind party member. Rudeus gets the knights to back down after realizing that they were acting on his request to track down Geese. Zoldat tells Rudeus about his clan's funding and how he spends his days tackling labyrinths and acting as a mercenary. Rudeus asks if he has considered retiring, to which Zoldat responds that someone needs to look after the new recruits. Zoldat then tells Rudeus that Kalman was indeed in the Strife/Conflict/Warring States region a few years back—he taught the new recruits North God style swordmanship despite not using a sword himself. Having learned that Kalman is no longer there, Rudeus gets ready to leave, but not before telling Zoldat that he'll always be welcome in Orsted Corp. should he ever need a job. Zoldat comments that Rudeus has come a long way from the time when he begged Zoldat to take him to a brothel and got so drunk that he wanted to kill himself. Eris demands to know what Zoldat is talking about, and Zoldat, not realizing who she is, retells the story of volume 7 chapter 6, complete with pantomime and sound effects. Eris and Zoldat then introduce themselves, and Zoldat, surprised, asks if Eris returned to Rudeus knowing that she had driven him to the verge of suicide. Eris runs out of the room; Rudeus realizes that Eris knew about his previous experiences, but she had never heard about just how cornered he felt firsthand. Rudeus says goodbye to Zoldat and goes to find Eris, locating her sprawled on the ground staring up at the sky. She states that she did something horrible to Rudeus by leaving him behind, but Rudeus tells her that he would never have met Sara or Zoldat if she had stayed. Eris tells him that she won't suddenly leave without telling him ever again. As the two prepare to leave, they notice some townsfolk staring at them; the townsfolk tell them that in their religion, the forest goddess "Laine" was searching for a red-haired woman, and telling her her whereabouts would bring about fortune and victory. Rudeus and Eris then locate the graves that Ghislaine made for Philip and Hilda, upon which Rudeus imagines what must have transpired when they were teleported. Eris says that her parents would have been happy to know that they got married, and Rudeus agrees that both would have been happy (for very different reasons). Rudeus decides to move their remains to a graveyard for Asuran nobility, where they are buried near a grave that reads "Here lies a ferocious lion." Returning to Sharia, Rudeus reports his findings to Orsted and learns that Kishirika has been apprehended.

Chapter 10: The Second Eye

Extra Chapter: Geese and His Final Ally

Light Novel Volume 24
=====================

Information

Summary

This is the twenty-fourth volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 light novel, which covers the first half of the Final Battle arc. This volume corresponds to the earlier half of volume 23 of the web novel.

Synopsis

SEEKING SUPPORT

Rudeus arrives at Irel City in Biheiril Kingdom to request Ruijerd’s support in his battle against Geese. The road to Ruijerd is a bumpy one, but after ten long years apart they finally reunite. Will Rudeus’s impassioned pleas for aid in the Laplace War reach Ruijerd’s heart? The answer might surprise you!

=====================

Information

Summary

This is the twenty-fifth volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 light novel, which covers the Decisive Battle arc Part 2. This volume corresponds to the latter half of volume 23 of the web novel.

Synopsis

DEAD END AGAIN!　WHO WILL BE THE WINNER OF THE DECISIVE BATTLE?

While the communication tablet and the transfer magic circle in the various locations stop functioning, Rudeus and his friends gather at the village of the Superd tribe.
Just as Geese had hoped, a strike force from the Kingdom of Biheiril was approaching the village of the Superds. Along with the strike force, the Northern God Kalman III, the former Sword God Gal Farion, and the Ogre God Malta appear.
With the world's strongest fighting force against them, the battle for the fate of Rudeus and his friends is about to begin!
"...... I am Rudeus Greyat "Quagmire", a subordinate of the Dragon God.
I'm Alexander Karlman Ryback, the North God!
In the meantime, what will happen to Geese who don't show up for the final battle? ......
