Light Novel Volume 26
=====================

Information

Summary

This is the twenty-sixth volume and the final installment of the
Mushoku Tensei
 light novel series, which covers the Conclusion Arc. This volume corresponds to volume 24 of the web novel.

Synopsis

The last of Hitogami's apostles, Badigadi, appears with Geese. Rudeus and his team are confronted with the strongest opponent of all, who possesses the demonic power of being able to regenerate his body over and over again and is equipped with the legendary "Fighting God Armor" created by Laplace.
"The duel is on. I accept the duel. All of us here will fight with you."
What will happen in the inevitable, all-out battle to the death?　And what will be the outcome of the long battle with Hitogami? The story of Rudeus is now complete!

Light Novel Volume 3
====================

Information

Summary

This is the third volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 light novel.

Synopsis

English (Seven Seas)
THE ROAD TO ADVENTURE

Teleported to an unfamiliar land by a mysterious magical disaster, Rudeus and Eris are going to have to rely on their own wits to survive—and on each other! Which is easier said than done, especially when they find themselves face to face with one of the Superd, the murderous demon race Roxy warned Rudy about…

Synopsis from Seven Seas.

Chapters

Light Novel Volume 3/Summary
============================

Chapter 1: The Con Artist Who Claimed to Be a God

Rudeus
 wakes up while moving at at an incredible speed through the sky. After concentrating his mana he starts slowing down and eventually lands, then immediately loses consciousness.

He "wakes up", but realizes he's dreaming, and meets a man calling himself the
Man God
 in this dream. Rudeus immediately distrusts him, but the Man-God still gives him some advice. The Man-God says to rely on the person Rudeus will meet when he wakes up, and to do what he can to help him. He also learns that he is currently in the
Demon Continent
, which is a much harsher environment than his
original home
 and is very difficult to survive in.

Chapter 2: The Superd

Rudeus wakes up and meets
Ruijerd Superdia
, one of the Superd who
Roxy
 told him to avoid at all costs, but quickly realizes he is not nearly as fearsome as the stories portrayed him to be. Through his conversation he learns he truly is in the northeast corner of the Demon Continent, about as far away from Fittoa as one could be. Ruijerd promises to return him and
Eris
 back home. Once Eris wakes up she starts crying and trying to run away from Ruijerd, but her legs give out and she falls down, a common reaction according to Ruijerd. Rudeus is able to comfort her and make her realize Ruijerd is someone they should become friends with, and she eventually agrees.

Chapter 3: A Master’s Secrets

The next day Ruijerd leads Rudeus and Eris to the village he was staying at, a journey of less than a mile that took 3 hours due to Ruijerd stopping the group every 15 minutes to kill a group of monsters. The village turned out to be the Migurdia tribes village, the hometown of Roxy and thanks to the pendant she gave Rudeus they were cleared of their initial suspicions and allowed to enter the village, meeting Roxy's father in the process.

Chapter 4: The Foundations of Trust

Meeting with the village elder, Rudeus tells him who they are and how they ended up there, prompting Ruijerd to once again promise his assistance in getting Rudeus and Eris back home. This leads to Ruijerd, who is over 500 years old, telling the story of his people and how

they were an elite group of soldiers under Laplace during the Third Great Human-Demon War. During this war Ruijerd was his people's leader and forced his men to use the Devil Spears given by Laplace which greatly enhanced all their combat abilities making them nearly invincible, at the cost of corrupting their souls and turning them into the battle crazed maniacs of the stories who would kill friend, foe, women, and children without hesitation. After being tricked into attacking their own village, with Ruijerd killing his own wife and son but in the process having his Devil Spear broken by his son, he woke up from his battle crazed state. He did the same for the rest of his comrades, but the damage had already been done. The Superd race was then hunted down and persecuted for their crimes, with Ruijerd currently being unsure if he is the last of his people, or if they have a secret village somewhere.

After hearing the story, Rudeus decided to help Ruijerd clear the name of his people, to Ruijerds great surprise. This would allow Ruijerd to help Rudeus and Eris while on the road, and for Rudeus to help Ruijerd while they were in cities, since he was feared to the point of being unable to enter cities currently. This felt like the beginning of a good relationship to Rudeus, but he was a little anxious that he was doing exactly what the Man-God wanted him to.

Chapter 5: Three Days to the Nearest Town

The group of 3 get on their way towards heading back to the Fittoa region, and before leaving Roxy's mother and father gift a short sword and some Demon Continent money to the group. As they started the 3 day journey towards the nearest town Rudeus convinces Ruijerd to teach them basic survival and combat skills so that Rudeus and Eris could survive on their own if it came to that. Rudeus completely destroys a monster with a single shot, successfully slaying his first monster, and over the course of the night the group fights several different monsters including
stone treants
, a giant tortoise, an acid wolf, and a group of pax coyotes.

Over the course of those 3 days Rudeus started to better define the positions of each of the 3 members of the group with Eris as the frontline attacker, Rudeus as the backline supporter casting spells when necessary, and Ruijerd in a flex position to cover any blind spots. They start accumulating their experiences and Ruijerd also teaches Eris about maintaining her weapon. He also informs the group that the Superds spears are a part of their body growing up, and once they reach a certain age they harden and fall off, which is why the Superd as so attached to them.

Chapter 6: Infiltration and Impersonation

The trio finally arrive at their first Demon Continent city,
Rikarisu
, which is one of the three largest settlements on the continent. After creating a stone helmet for Ruijerd as a disguise, the group entered the city and headed to some market stalls to buy some initial supplies. Rudeus buys some dye for Ruijerd's hair and turns it blue, with the cover story that he is actually one of the Migurd but is pretending to be a Superd, in an effort to decrease any suspicions of him while at the same time hopefully spreading rumors that the Superd aren't as dangerous as they seem. He also bought a cloak with cat ears for Eris which to Rudeus' surprise she immediately liked.

Chapter 7: The Adventurers’ Guild

The next stop was the
Adventurers' Guild
 where the group of three registered as rank F adventurers and created a party with the name "Dead End" the name associated with the "bloodthirsty killing machine" Ruijerd. Before registering they announced to everyone in the building that Ruijerd was in fact a Superd, but because of the blue dyed hair everyone burst out laughing and did not believe it. After registering, the group narrowly avoided a conflict with another group of adventurers after they tried to trip Rudeus and the rest. Another bout of laughing ensued when the group left without taking on a single job.

Chapter 8: The Adventurers’ Inn

As it was getting dark the group decided to head towards an inn, and chose a newbie-adventurer friendly one. Inside the group met another newbie group of three called the
Tokurabu Village Toughs
 who tried hitting on Eris and got beat up in the process. After some worrying about the groups budget, as they only had about enough to last 2 weeks, and they wouldn't earn much through adventuring until they advanced their party's rank, Rudeus fell asleep. In his dream he meets the Man-God again who tells him to accept the quest to find a lost pet at the adventurer's guild.

Rudeus wakes back up in the middle of the night to see Eris staring out of their room's window. He goes over and eases her anxiety about getting back home safely, realizing that he was not the only one feeling such things.

Chapter 9: The First Job: The Value of a Life

After accepting the lost pet job, the trio find themselves in an underground room filled with dozens of "lost" pets, who had actually been captured by another
group of three
 in order to profit off the eventual Adventurers' Guild quests that would be posted to find them. The trio capture and handcuff the petnappers, and as Rudeus began interrogating one of them he kicked hard enough to fly across the room resulting in Ruijerd instantly slicing his throat with his spear, killing him instantly.

This event left Rudeus very shaken up, to the point of even being afraid of Ruijerd. Because of that Rudeus comes up with a whole speech about why Ruijerd should not kill people anymore no matter what, in order to disprove the claims that the Superd are a group of bloodthirsty killers. After some back and forth and Rudeus essentially pleading with him, Ruijerd hesitantly agrees.

Chapter 10: The First Job Completed

Then Rudeus goes on to interrogate the other two remaining petnappers, and learns about their operation. After some internal debate about what to do with them and whether he should just off them to prevent any rumors from spreading, Rudeus comes up with the idea to have the two, who are D rank adventurers and able to advance to C rank, advance to C rank and start taking on C or even B rank monster hunting quests, while Dead End (Rudeus' party) will accept their E rank quests, and the two groups will swap. This allows Dead End to slowly rank up while earning money equivalent to B and C rank quests. Ruijerd is strongly opposed to this plan as he does not want to team up with those he deems as evil, but thanks to Eris' shouting and explaining that this is for Ruijerd's own benefit and that Rudeus is smart enough to come up with good plans, he reluctantly agrees.

Afterwards the trio return to the client whose pet was lost, and return it, causing the little girl whose pet it was to become extremely happy. They then return to the Adventurers' Guild to collect their reward and successfully mark the quest as complete. One of the men who had previously laughed at Ruijerd for "pretending" to be a Superd comes up and has some small talk with the group, eventually offering his help as a rank C adventurer if they ever needed it, since he doesn't mind helping newbies, a man with horse head named
Nokopara
.

Chapter 11: A Smooth Start

The next morning Rudeus meets up with Vizquel and Jalil, whose party name is P Hunter, and were the two adventurers who were running the petnapping scam, and exchanged their first set of quests. The job Rudeus ended up picking out for themselves was to slay Pax Coyotes, and by killing a few and using the scent of their blood to attract more, they were able to kill over 100 in a couple of hours. And in only three days Dead End was promoted to rank E, thanks to P Hunter performing the lower ranked jobs for them.

After a few days of taking on these jobs the group started to earn enough money for them to upgrade their gear. Eris got a full set of light armor including a breast plate and some other small protective pieces, and Rudeus got a robe made from the hide of a Mackey Rat which offers some protection against stabbing weapons due to how tough it is. While they were purchasing these items Ruijerd was spying on P Hunter to see how they were performing their side of things, and they were approaching even F ranked jobs with a good attitude and diligence, making sure to mention and praise Dead End Ruijerd at the end of each job.

Chapter 12: Children and Warriors

After another 3 weeks Dead End hit D rank, but Rudeus wanted to continue milking the relationship with P Hunter as that allowed him to take on a B rank quest to slay a mysterious snake type monster in the
Petrified Forest
 a days journey away from Rikarisu. After arriving, Rudeus finds two other adventurer parties already there on similar jobs. The rank D Tokurabu Village Toughs, who they met earlier, as well as the rank B
Super Blazers
. The three groups decide that whoever slays the monster first gets the reward, but Ruijerd realizes that the three kids making up the Tokurabu Village Toughs are not nearly strong enough to survive in the petrified forest due to it being the home of many rank B monsters, and decides that they should tail that group to ensure their safety since Ruijerd always does what he can to protect children.

After a short while the Tokurabu Village Toughs run into an Executioner, the zombified remains of an adventurer, a rank B monster. They started running away from the Executioner, only to run into a group of rank B Almond Anacondas, and Ruijerd wants to rush in to help them immediately, but Rudeus holds him back to wait for the perfect moment to save them to have them be as grateful as possible to Dead End. However this backfires and one of the Tokurabu Village Toughs gets cleaved in half by the Executioner. This prompts Ruijerd to act to guarantee the safety of the other two, and in a matter of moments Ruijerd and Eris kill the group of Anacondas and Rudeus summons a large rock to crush the Executioner. After a heated exchange of words with Ruijerd being furious at Rudeus for stopping him and allowing one of the three children to be killed, and Rudeus feeling extremely guilty about his greed leading to that death, the leader of Tokurabu Village Toughs stands up for himself and says that he and his group were prepared to die the moment they accepted the quest, and the fault lies solely on them. This wraps up the discussion with Rudeus still feeling extremely guilty and making a note that he needs to think about his actions to make sure he doesn't make a similar mistake in the future.

Rudeus' group then Tokurabu Village Toughs to the entrance of the forest so they can bring their fallen comrade back home, and then they reenter the forest and find the mysterious snake monster, along with the six corpses of the Super Blazers. It turned out to be a Red-Hood Cobra, a rank A  massive snake like monster. Ruijerd says that he is more than capable of defeating the monster on his own, settling the debate of whether they should fight it or not. Rudeus uses his tandard opening move of using Stone Cannon, however the cobra was able to dodge it, but thanks to the endless slashes from Eris and Ruijerd the cobra grew tired and after multiple missed shots one of his Stone Cannon's finally landed and killed the cobra.

Chapter 13: Failure, Chaos, and Resolve

After returning to the Guild to complete their quests, they once again ran into Nokopara, who had realized the two parties were exchanging quests, which is against Guild rules and could get them banned from accepting all quests on the Demon Continent. He decides to black mail them to give him some money each month to keep him from telling the Guild, and after talking to the remaining members of the Tokurabu Village Toughs, he had proof that Rudeus, Eris, and Ruijerd, a D ranked party, were taking on a rank B quest while P Hunter was inside the city taking on a much lower ranked one.

After some internal debate of what to do, Rudeus decides to flood the entire city of Rikarisu, since it was built into a crater, but right as he starts casting the spell Ruijerd washes out the dye from his hair, reavealing that he truly is one of the Superd. After doing so he threatens Nokopara forcing him to not reveal that the group broke the Guild's rules, and then gets chased out of the city by the guards. Rudeus and Eris then collected their belongings from the inn and purchase the equivalent of a horse drawn carriage on the Demon Continent, a large lizard like creature, before leaving the city.

The two met up with Ruijerd outside the city, and Rudeus had a heart to heart conversation with him, where he doubled his resolve to help Ruijerd restore his people's reputation, and Ruijerd truly recognizes Rudeus as a warrior and trusts him. And the next morning they see that Ruijerd shaved his head, since his green hair was one of the most notable features about him and something people feared the most.

Chapter 14: The Beginning of Our Journey

As the group moves towards the next city, Rudeus calls a group meeting to discuss the plans moving forward. He mentions that while he is the group leader, the other two should come forward with any ideas they have to improve the group overall, and they decide the best course of action for now is to head towards Wind Port, the southernmost city of the Demon Continent where they can travel by boat to the Millis Continent, hike across there, and there travel by boat again to reach the Central Continent.

As the group travels, Eris starts learning the Demon God tongue, and Ruijerd starts to teach her more about the sword. They would have mock fights ending with her being sprawled on the ground with a spear at her neck. Rudeus attempted to participate too, but after a few rounds he realized that he wasn't learning much, while Eris had likely become better than Paul at this point. Rudeus also engages in a full on mock battle against Ruijerd, earning much praise from him, but because he started at close range he lost badly.

Over the course of a year the group steadily made their way towards Wind Port, and managed to reach rank A in the process. As they got closer, they also started encountering human warrior who came to the Demon Continent to train and increase their strength. All of whom who challenged Ruijerd to a duel lost handily. Even after revealing his name and identity some would continue to be respectful and Ruijerd would tell the tale of his people to them, while they would have looks of astonishment the entire time.

Extra Chapter: The Princess of Asura and the Angel

Ariel Anemoi Asura
, the second princess of the
Kingdom of Asura
, and
Luke Notos Greyrat
, her guardian knight and second son of the Greyrat family, were having their usual tea time in one of the palace gardens.
Derrick Redbat
, an Advanced rank magician, was also one of Ariel's guards, and desperately wanted her to attempt to ascend the throne and become Queen of Asura. Ariel herself thought this was a foolish path of action as she was fourth in line for the throne, and her two older brother had many more connections than her and were desperately fighting for the throne. However due to the cunning and suspicious nature of all nobles in Asura and Ariel's popularity with the common folk, nobles from the
first prince
's faction wanted to make an attempt at her life. Derrick was just returning to his guard duty when he suddenly finds a Terminator Boar, a rank D monster charging towards her Ariel, and assumed this to be part of their plot after overhearing they wanted to do so, however this event actually occurred to the Fittoa Displacement Incident teleported the monster here by pure chance. He gave his life protecting Ariel, and in his final words begged her to take the throne and make Asura into a better country, causing her to look at him in a new light. Luke however was not enough to slay the Boar on his own, but thankfully Derrick's prayers were answered and a white haired angel falls from the sky blasting the boar to pieces as his consciousness fades and he passes away.

Light Novel Volume 4
====================

Information

Summary

This is the fourth volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 light novel.

Synopsis

EYES OF THE DEMON

Continuing their journey, Rudeus, Eris and Ruijerd have a run in with a figure from legend–none other than the Great Emperor of the Demon World, Kishirika herself! When the trio lend her their aid, Kishrika rewards Rudy with a strange new power…one that might just be more than he bargained for.

Chapters

Chapter 1: Wind Port

Chapter 2: Missed Connections, the Prequel

Chapter 3: Missed Connections, the Sequel

Side Story: Missed Connections, Extra Story

Chapter 4: The Sage on Board

Chapter 5: The Demon in the Warehouse

Chapter 6: The Beastfolk Children

Chapter 7: Free Apartment

Chapter 8: Fire Emergency

Chapter 9: Slow Life in the Doldia Village

Chapter 10: The Holy Sword Highway

Extra Chapter: Guardian Fitz

Adaptation Notes

This volume was adapted into the following material:

Light Novel Volume 4/Summary
============================

Chapter 1: Wind Port

Rudeus
 celebrated his 11th birthday a couple days ago, and the first thing they do once they arrive at
Wind Port
 is stop by the Adventurer's Guild. There, after
Eris
 gets in a brief scuffle, they learn about their nicknames. "Mad Dog" Eris, "Guard Dog"
Ruijerd
, and "Kennel Master" Rujerd who is Rudeus but his name has been messed up and he has a negative image associated with him, while Ruijerd is rumored to be kind hearted.

The group then heads to the port checkpoint, only to discover that in order to cross the border to the
Millis Continent
 with a
Superd
, they would need to pay 200 green ore coins, a massive sum that would take over a year to earn. Rudeus thinks that he could sell his staff or hire a smuggler as alternatives, but doesn't like any of those three options.

That night he gets more advice from the
Man-God
, which is to buy some food at a street stall and search the alleyways by himself. He agrees right away to follow this advice as he doesn't think he has any other better options.

Chapter 2: Missed Connections, the Prequel

After following the Man-God's advice to the letter, Rudeus ends up meeting
Kishirika Kishirisu
, and in exchange for the food he gave her, she gives him a
Demon Eye
. After explaining six different types he's able to pick from, Rudeus chooses the
Eye of Foresight
, which allows him to see the different branches of possible things that can happen a couple seconds in the future.

Chapter 3: Missed Connections, the Sequel

Realizing that he did exactly what the Man-God wanted him to made him want to tear out his demon eye and crush it, since he still doesn't think the Man-God is someone he should trust, but regardless he returned back to the inn they were staying at. After a week he was able to master the demon eye, and was able to see 1-3 seconds in the future depending on how much mana he used, as well as see completely normally if he wished. While he was doing that, Eris was training with Ruijerd all day.

After announcing that he was able to control his Eye of Foresight, Ruijerd suggested that he have a duel with Eris, so they could both see the results of their training. The result of that battle was Rudeus' complete win. He was able to see exactly what Eris was going to do, and even without using his magic he countered her and won. In his cocky state he even dueled against Ruijerd in a bare handed fight, but lost completely after the first exchange after seeing multiple possible futures and not knowing how to react.

That night Rudeus decides to sell his staff to earn enough for the boat's fee to the Millis Continent, but as he walks outside Ruijerd confronts him and tells him he is okay with the smuggling plan as it would lead to a better outcome. After they both agree on that, a man approaches them saying that he just so happens to be a smuggler,
Gallus Cleaner
. In exchange for smuggling Ruijerd, once they arrive in Millis, the group would set the other slaves being smuggled free since Gallus thinks they're more trouble than their worth, while his comrades disagree.

Side Story: Missed Connections, Extra Story

Roxy
 arrived at Wind Port along with
Elinaline Dragonroad
, a female elven tank, and
Talhand
, a male dwarven magician, both of whom were members of
Fangs of the Black Wolf
, the same adventuring party that
Paul
 and
Zenith
 were part of before they settled down in the Fittoa Region. The three just happened to meet on their way towards the Demon Continent are grouped up since it would be safer to travel together, since Elinalise and Talhand saw Paul's letter about helping search for his missing family members and agreed to help.

While trying to gather information on any who were teleported to the Demon Continent from the Displacement Incident, Roxy also sees Eris and Ruijerd sparring out on the beach, the same week that Rudeus was inside his inn learning to control his Demon Eye. But since she had never met the two before she quickly left after getting scared by Ruijerd's gaze and the group of three quickly left Wind Port to continue searching the entire Demon Continent, just as Rudeus and his group headed to the Millis Continent.

Chapter 4: The Sage on Board

Eris and Rudeus boarded the ship that would take them to the Millis Continent after handing Ruijerd over to the smugglers that would sneak him through. Through the journey Rudeus got to witness an S ranked party guard the ship from a giant octopus monster, thinking to himself that him, Eris, and Ruijerd were individually much stronger than each member of that party, but they achieved that rank through their teamwork, which Dead End was severely lacking. Eris also gets extremely seasick, with Rudeus needing to constantly cast heal on her to ease her pain. After a few more days they eventually arrived at the city of
Zant Port
 on the Millis Continent.

Chapter 5: The Demon in the Warehouse

After taking residence in a less than savory inn, the rest of them being booked for the three month long rainy season that would soon start preventing any travel, Rudeus headed towards the warehouse that was housing Ruijerd to pick him up as well as set the other slaves there free, as per his agreement with Gallus.

Rudeus arrived at the warehouse and after a long walk through multiple secret passageways and doors he arrived at the room where Ruijerd was being held. After a quick exchange about where the slaves were being kept, Ruijerd tells Rudeus that he will kill all of the guards and smugglers while Rudeus can save the seven beastfolk children who are the slaves they are supposed to set free.

Chapter 6: The Beastfolk Children

As Ruijerd quickly dispatched with all the guards, Rudeus found the group of seven children and healed their numerous wounds before leaving the warehouse. Just as they were leaving one of the seven said that there was a dog being held captive that also needed to be saved, so Rudeus went back to do that while Ruijerd led the children to the outskirts of the city where Rudeus would meet back up with them.

After rescuing the dog from a magic circle, Rudeus was then incapacitated by a group of beastmen who found the smugglers warehouse using a voice attack thinking that Rudeus was one of the kidnappers. It turns out the dog was also the beatsmen's
Sacred Beast
 Rudeus was then taken back to the beastfolk village as a criminal, while one of the other beastmen found Ruijerd and the kidnapped children. Through their conversation the beastmen learned that Rudeus was Ruijerd companion, and apologized for taking him into custody, but Ruijerd knew that Rudeus would be fine and prioritized returning the children to their parents and getting Eris before setting Rudeus free.

Chapter 7: Free Apartment

Five days had passed, with Rudeus being locked in a wooden cell the entire time. He could have easily escaped but he was waiting for Ruijerd to come back and for him to be absolved of his crimes. However on that day another person was thrown into the cell with him, a man named
Geese
. Seven days had now gone by, still with no word from Ruijerd and no sign of being let out of the cell. As Rudeus was getting more and more anxious and ready to escape on his own, he suddenly sees that the forest was on fire.

Chapter 8: Fire Emergency

After escaping from the cell, Rudeus and Geese see the entire village up in flames along with humans in battle gear chasing the beastfolk down, killing the adults, and kidnapping the children. Rudeus decides to help them even though they falsely imprisoned him for a whole week, summoning massive clouds above the forest to create a heavy downpour and put out the fires. Once the attackers noticed Rudeus doing this they started rushing towards him, but were quickly knocked out with his Stone Canon.

After clearing away the smoke the beastmen were able to fight much better and began to start pressing the human back. Along with Rudeus' help they continued slaughtering the attackers and rescuing the children who had been kidnapped, even saving the women who had stood guard by Rudeus' cell for the past week, with a look of great surprise on her face. Eventually the beastmen warrior and Rudeus ran into Gallus, who had planned this whole thing from the start. After he leaked the information about the warehouse with the kidnapped children, he planned for Rudeus and Ruijerd to distract the beastmen warrior who went to save the children, and him and his men would swoop in the village and kidnap the rest of the children while all the warriors were gone.

After Rudeus refused Gallus' offer to join him, Gallus quickly kills three beastmen warriors that attacked him all at once, leaving Rudeus worried if he can take on Gallus, who is Saint ranked in the North God Style. Just as Gallus started to take his leave since Rudeus had no plans to attack him, the Sacred Beast attacked him, giving Rudeus an opportunity to save the hostage and square off against Gallus with the Sacred Beast at his side. Gallus launched multiple fierce attacks against Rudeus, with Rudeus forced to defend the entire time with no chance to counter attack. Thankfully Geese threw a powder filled bag at Gallus flustering him and giving Rudeus enough time to cast explosion and knock Gallus out.

We then learn that the plan to kidnap the beastfolk was even more well planned and complicated with attacks being carried out against all the villages simultaneously, and the kidnappers managing to kidnap 50 children. They were just about to sail off when Ruijerd and the other beastfolk warriors who had not returned yet attacked them and saved the children. This is what was going on while Rudeus was in the cell for a week. Gallus was then handed to the Zant Port officials, and all the rescued children were returned to there parents.

Chapter 9: Slow Life in the Doldia Village

As thanks for saving the children of Doldia village, the village elder Gustav invited Rudeus, Eris, and Ruijerd to spend the rainy season with them since travel is nearly impossible. Through some conversation Eris learns that Ghislaine was born in this village, however she was extremely violent and someone unworthy of being respected, completely opposite from her current self. Rudeus tried to learn the unique beastfolk voice magic that was used against him to render him unconscious, but he was only able to do a much weaker version since it requires the specialized vocal chords the beastfolk posses. Ruijerd became great friends with Gustav, exchanging stories with him from "back in the day", and Eris befriended two of the younger beastfolk children. As the relatively peaceful days went by, three months passed and the rainy season ended.

Chapter 10: The Holy Sword Highway

The trio then head off for the capital of Millis, along with Geese who sweet talked his way into being able to join. They traveled along the Holy Sword Highway, which was a road that went straight through the Great Forest, and since it contained mana monsters would never go near it. Along the way Eris asked Geese to teach her how to cook, but he recounted a tale of how he taught
a women
 in his previous adventurer's party how to cook, and she used that to convince one of
the guy
s in that party to marry her, resulting in the party splitting up and Geese giving up being an Adventurer.

Rudeus also learns about the Seven Great Powers, which are the seven strongest warriors in the world, engraved on magic stones throughout the world that automatically update. In order they are the Technique God,
Dragon God
, Fighting God,
Demon God
,
Death God
,
Sword God
, and North God, with the top three all being missing, and the Demon God Laplace being sealed away after the
Third Human-Demon War
.

After a little over a month of traveling, the group finally exited the Great Forest and once again entered the domain of men.

Extra Chapter: Guardian Fitz

Fitz once again has a dream about what happened to them during the Displacement Incident, which was suddenly being teleported thousands of feet in the air, and barely surviving using all the magic they could muster and thanks to the teachings of their master who taught them about some of the fundamental principles of nature. This was the same person who fell from the sky and helped save
Ariel Anemoi Asura
 (in
the extra chapter of the previous volume
), causing Ariel to employ Fitz in Derricks place, since Derrick passed away and Fitz was more than quality being at least intermediate tier in all attack magic schools and being able to cast spells without chanting.

Ariel also started fulfilling Derrick's wish of her becoming Queen of Asura, as she was currently bolstering her allies behind the scenes, planning for a day 10-20 years in the future when those allies would have been planted in positions of power, enough to solidify her claim as Queen. That night one of the highest ranking nobles in all of Asura,
Minister Darius
, as well as the first Price, Grabel, were discussing Ariel's recent movements and decided that it was been to have her assassinated. Thankfully Fitz was able to stop this assassination attempt, nearly losing his life to poison but his silent casting of Detoxification magic saved him. The attempts at Ariel's life continued, forcing her to plan her escape from the royal palace under the guise of studying abroad.

Light Novel Volume 5
====================

Information

Summary

This is the fifth volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 light novel.

Synopsis

FATHER VS. SON

Rudeus and his party arrive in Millishion, capital of the Holy Country of Millis—only to find themselves tangled up with yet another attempted kidnapping. But the real shock comes when the kidnappers’ very familiar boss shows up on the scene. What will this unexpected reunion bring?!

Chapters

Chapter 1: The Holy Country of Millis

Chapter 2: Paul's Story

Chapter 3: Family Squabble

Chapter 4: Reunited

Chapter 5: Objectives Confirmed

Chapter 6: One Week in Millishion

Interlude: Eris The Goblin Slayer

Chapter 7: To the Central Continent

Interlude: Roxy's Homecoming

Extra Chapter I: Dragon Meat, Nanahoshi Style

Extra Chapter II: The Death of Ariel

Light Novel Volume 5/Summary
============================

Chapter 1: The Holy Country of Millis

The group arrives at the beautiful city of Millishion, and just as soon as they enter the city Geese says his goodbyes and leaves the group. After arriving at the inn Rudeus decides tomorow will be a free day for each person to do whatever they want, so that he would have enough time to finally write a letter back to Paul in the Fittoa region since he still doesn't know the extend to which the Displacement Incident has affected people. Eris decides that she'll go and hunt some goblins and Ruijerd says he's going to say hello to an acquaintance of his.

While heading back to the inn after buying some ink and paper, Rudeus see a group of what look to be kidnappers carrying a child in a burlap sack and running very quickly. Due to Dead End's motto to never abandon a child in peril, he decides to tail the group and rescue the child. After realizing that he had snuck his way into a crate of underwear, he revealed his location and alerted the kidnappers inside the building that he was there. He quickly took out four of them with weakened Stone Cannons to knock them out, but the group kept calling in reinforcements preventing him from being able to escape. Eventually a women in bikini armor and a sword began attacking Rudeus, with her large breasts distracting him and preventing him from doing anything more than dodging her attacks, giving enough time for the groups boss to come in.

Rudeus felt that the groups boss looked extremely nostalgic, but he couldn't place why. The boss was obviously extremely drunk while fighting against Rudeus, but was also skilled enough for Rudeus to give the fight everything he had just to keep up. Soon enough, the man even landed a slash cutting off the underwear Rudeus put on his head to hide his face, but this caused the man to stop fighting instantly, recognizing Rudeus, causing Rudeus to recognize that this man was his father, Paul.

Chapter 2: Paul's Story

We see the Displacement Incident from Paul's point of view. At the time of the incident he happened to be holding Norn, so both of them teleported together to the southern region of Asura. Thanks to Paul's adventuring habits he had a Asuran gold coin and his adventurers card tucked into the sheath of his sword, which he always kept on him. He quickly sped back to the Fittoa Region, taking two months to get back, and saw that everything had vanished once he arrived. Thanks to the butler under Philip, Alphonse, a refugee camp was already under construction, and with Paul's help it was finished within a month, recuing people across the country in the process. Afterwards, Paul headed to the other of the two largest countries in the world Millis, to set up base there and rescue even more people, while also searching for Rudeus, Zenith, and the rest of his family.

In the first six months Paul and the other volunteers had rescued hundreds of people affected by the incident, some had even been sold off as slaves and so needed to be bought back, or stolen when they couldn't be bought. Whatever needed to be done, Paul would do it to get them back. The next six months weren't nearly as good as the first. Most of the news was Fittoa residents who had been found dead, and fewer and fewer people were being rescued. The families of those found dead almost all blamed Paul for not finding them fast enough. And after another six months Paul had resorted to drinking to escape the thoughts of what had happened to his own family, since he still had no word on them.

Paul was also drunk on this very day, when suddenly his squad members told him that one of their warehouses was being attacked by a young magician.

Chapter 3: Family Squabble

Rudeus and Paul walk over to a nearby bar to talk after the fight. As Rudeus tells Paul what he's been doing the past year and a half Paul angrily yells at him to stop talking and informs him that while he was on his little adventure with a cute young miss and invincible bodyguard, Paul was searching for the thousands of displacement people including his own family. During their conversation tensions were high causing them to get into another fight which Rudeus easily won thanks to his demon eye and since had been Paul drinking even more. However Zorn stepped in between them to stop it. Rudeus was extremely shocked and angry at himself for not even thinking about how others could have been affected by the incident as well, causing him to leave the bar and go back to the inn, with him and Paul not having resolved anything, and Paul looking with disgust at Rudeus.

After a while Ruijerd and Eris arrived back at the inn ready to share the events of their happy day with Rudeus, but notice that Rudeus was extremely depressed. After some back and forth about what happened Rudeus tells the story of how he ran into Paul for the first time in a year and a half, and Eris says that she'll beat him up for what he did. Ruijerd tells Eris to not get involved in family squabbles, and after some hesitation comforts Rudeus to great effect, hugging him and helping him recover emotionally.

Chapter 4: Reunited

We get a look at Paul's perspective of his fight with Rudeus, and how he got so angry since Rudeus described his adventure as a walk in the park without any major issues or dangers. After explaining as much to Geese, who had found Paul and was trying to see what happened, Geese told him that he expected way too much of his 11 year old son who had never gone on an adventure before and was probably skipping all the dangerous parts of the story to prevent Paul from worrying as much about him. After a long conversation about how Paul was too quick to judge, he vows to come back tomorrow and fix things with Rudeus.

The next morning the two meet up in the same bar, with Ruijerd taking the irate Eris outside with him to allow the two to converse privately. Ruijerd's only words to Paul were "You have every right to say your piece. But the only reason that you
can
 is that you son is still alive". Paul and Rudeus both apologize to each other and begin sharing information about the state of the Fittoa region and what had gone on since the incident. Eventually they both felt the conversation was going nowhere and was extremely awkward, but the bartender came over to the pair, who were the only two inside the place now, and told Rudeus to at least look Paul in the eyes even though he had no idea what the situation was.

After doing so Rudeus saw the look of an extremely anxious and worried man who was on the brink of tears. This made Rudeus realize how Paul was feeling, similar feelings to how he had felt in his previous life, and caused him to propose to his father to pretend yesterday never happened. Paul reluctantly agreed, and the Rudeus runs into Paul's arms and says "Father! I've missed you so much!", and after a moments hesitation Paul responds and they both start sobbing. For a while they both stayed there like that, having fully made up, and reuniting for the first time in five years.

Chapter 5: Objectives Confirmed

Now that the father son duo were together again and had gotten past the awkward stage, they were freely joking around and discussing the events that had gone on in each others lives for the past 5 years, including an update on
Sylphie
 who was able to use even healing magic without an incantation, something Rudeus was still unable to do. Unfortunately she was still missing so her whereabouts were unknown.

Afterwards, Rudeus, Ruijerd, and Eris head back to their inn to discuss their plan moving forward, after having gained a lot of information from Paul, as well as a hefty sum of money intended for the safe travel of any Boreas household members, inclduing Eris. Rudeus decides to continue his journey to return Eris back to her hometown, even knowing that everything there has completely disappeared. And thanks to Ruijerd's acquaintance likely being a man of nobility, they were even able to obtain a letter of introduction to help avoid paying the astronomical sum of 100 king's coins for a superd to cross to the central continent. The group decide to spend a week in Millishion before heading off.

Chapter 6: One Week in Millishion

The next day, Rudeus goes to see Paul at the Fittoa Search and Rescue Squad's headquarters, but he's extremely busy after having spent the last month getting drunk every day, so Rudeus schedules a dinner with him four days later. During those four days Rudeus and the crew take on a B rank mission, to slay a Leaf Tiger, which was killed with one slash by Eris due to the group being used to the much fiercer monsters on the Demon Continent. Four days later Rudeus, who reluctantly allows Eris to join, both meet with Paul and Norn at the restaurant.

Eris was still mad at Paul for how he reacted to seeing his son, and Norn was still mad at Rudeus for punching her dad when in her opinion he hadn't done anything wrong. So the mood was tense for a while, but gradually evened out throughout the night, although Eris was still a bit hostile, and Norn still wouldn't look Rudeus in the eyes. And a couple days later a similar scene was reenacted as Rudeus set off towards the west end of the Millis Continent, while Paul continued working to ensure the Fittoa residents who were still in the Millis Continent would obtain safe passage back to their homeland.

Interlude: Eris The Goblin Slayer

Cliff Grimoire was an orphan in Millishion adopted by Harry Grimoire, a very high ranking member of the Millis Church. Thanks to his innate talents and the funding of his adoptive father he was able to obtain advanced rank healing, detoxification, divine strike, and fire magic, and intermediate rank in the other three offensive magic disciplines. Due to his immense talents and longing to be an adventurer, he snuck away from his home and registered. However he did not realize that since he was a newbie rank F adventurer no party was willing to accept him.

Today was Dead End's off day, where Eris went to go hunt goblins, and she just happened to run into Cliff looking down on other adventurers for not accepting him, and after intervening he started following her and tried to show off his power in front of her. Unfortunately for him, Eris was using Rudeus as her standard, and very few people in the entire world could compare to him in terms of magic capabilities.

Eventually, the duo ended up deep in the forest where they found the Blessed Child, an important woman in one faction of the Millis Church, being attacked by assassins from the other prominent faction. Eris decides to intervene immediately, slicing two of the men in half, as the other encircled her. Thanks to the single remaining knight protected the Blessed Child who helped Eris, she was able to break out of the encirclement and eliminate another of the assassins, while the last one got away. The knight introduced herself as
Therese Latria
, offering her assistance to Eris if she ever needed it, and quickly left with the Blessed Child.

It turned out that Cliff was actually the true grandson of the current pope of Millishion, who hid Cliff in an attempt to keep him safe during the current power struggle going on within the church, and the Blessed Child who Eris had just saved was a member of the opposing faction of the Pope. With this development not going the Pope's way, he decided to send Cliff away to study in
a foreign land
.

Chapter 7: To the Central Continent

After two months on the road, the group reached West Port, and their first stop was the customs office to try and secure passage to the Central Continent. After handing over the letter Ruijerd received, the duke in charge of the office met with the group, and we learn that Ruijerd's acquaintance was actually Galgard Nash Vennick, Commander of the Missionary Knights, one of the three holy military orders of the Millis Church. The duke in charge of the office detested demons however, and refused to let Ruijerd board the ship by claiming the letter to be a forgery.

After some moments of discussion and Rudeus trying to use Eris' Boreas Greyrat name, a female Temple Knight entered the office, and she just so happened to be the woman Eris saved from assassins a couple days prior, as well as Zenith's sister, Therese Latria. She used her authority to take the three under her protection, completely ignoring Duke Bakshiel. Thanks to that the group was finally able to obtains safe passage to the Central Continent, and Therese even provided Eris with medicine to help her seasickness.

Interlude: Roxy's Homecoming

At the same time as Rudeus set sail towards the Central Continent, Roxy returned to her hometown on the Demon Continent for the first time in many years. Due to her inability to understand the telepathy that every other member of her race was able to do, she felt very ostracized from her village. However after seeing her mother cry she spent three days with her parents, and was even able to relax around them towards the end. After leaving she went to Rikarisu, and after arrived confirmed her suspicions that Rudeus was the "Kennel Master" of Dead End that she had been hearing so much about on her journey, realizing they had crossed paths without even knowing it right when she arrived on the Demon Continent. Her, Talhand, and Elinalise decided to finish searching the northwest region of the continent for any displaced Fittoa residents however.

Extra Chapter I: Dragon Meat, Nanahoshi Style

The trio arrived at Eastport in the Dragon King Realm, and decide to buy some food at a restaurant that was emitting a great smell, one that Rudeus even found to be nostalgic. The restaurant was a bit rundown and shabby, and only had two items on the menu, but Rudeus couldn't resist his curiosity, and they all ordered Dragon Meat, Nanahoshi Style. Once the food was delivered, to Rudeus' shock it was a three piece meal very similar to a typical Japanese meal, which gave him high hopes for an excellent meal, but after tasting it he flipped out on the chef and had to be dragged out by Eris and Ruijerd since it was so below his standards.

Unknown to Rudeus however, the chef was Randolph Marianne, the Dead God, ranked fifth among the Seven Great Powers. And after his scathing review, Randolph decided to close shop and finally accept the offer of the High General of the King Dragon Realm, Shagall Gargantis, to join him.

Extra Chapter II: The Death of Ariel

A rumor started speeding around the capital of Asura that Ariel had died while traveling to the Ranoa University of Magic. In order to verify these claims an information dealer started retracing her steps and interviewed several men. The first was a man who worked at the last border checkpoint before leaving Asura, who had indeed seen Ariel and went against his order to keep her in town for a couple days to stall her and let her through immediately. It turns out that a few days prior some suspicious looking men in black clothing had crossed the border a few days prior, likely lying in wait for Ariel and her guards in the forest beyond the border.

The second man saw the fight between Ariel's guards and the assassins, and saw "Silent Fitz", Fitz's nickname, using beginner tier spells at perfect timings to kill the assassins and help the other guards who were struggling against them. However as the fight dragged on it was seven assassins versus Fitz and three other guards, and when all the assassins mobilized towards Ariel and a group of three maids after a fake-out that they were going towards Fitz, one managed to sneak through and decapitate one of the group of four right before him and the rest of the assassins were all killed. The eyewitness said it was Ariel, however the royal family has magical implements that allow for very good disguises, and the information broker later heard from another soldier stationed at the border that he saw Ariel no doubt about it leaving the forest after the fight.

This was the tale of how Ariel successfully escaped from the Kingdom of Asura and enrolled at the Ronoa Magic Academy.

A tip from the enigmatic Man God leads to the Shirone Kingdom, where Lilia and Aisha are being held captive in the palace. Rudeus and company head to the rescue—only to get swept up in some nasty, unfinished business Roxy left in her wake! Family reunions are one thing, but can Dead End deal with saying goodbye to one of their own?

Light Novel Volume 6/Summary
============================

Note: The following article is under construction

Chapter 1: Route Selection

Rudeus
 turned 12 as he arrived in the city of East Port in the King Dragon Realm, and after choosing an inn he held a group meeting to discuss which route they would take to get the the
Asura Kingdom
 in the northern region of the Central Continent. After some discussion they chose the safest route which should take about 10 months due to the other alternatives being much more dangerous and likely not saving any time.

That night Rudeus meets with the
Man God
 in his dreams again, and Rudeus receives more detailed information from the Man God about the location of his still missing family members in exchange for being less hostile towards him in the future. The Man God tells Rudeus to go to the Shirone Kingdom, where he will find both
Lilia
 and
Aisha
 after following some specific actions such as sending a letter and making sure not to use his real name. This also included seeing visions of the future through his Demon Eye, causing him to get extremely nauseous after he woke up. Not only that, but this worried Rudeus greatly, as he thinks the Man God likely gave him the last set of advice so that he would get the Eye of Foresight, allowing him to see these visions from the Man God, making him wonder just how all knowing and powerful this mysterious figure is, and what his true objectives are.

Chapter 2: Rice

The next morning Rudeus tells the group that they will make a stop in the Shirone Kingdom, and Rudeus is thankful that
Eris
 and
Ruijerd
 both agreed so fast without asking any questions. Unfortunately due to some problems with their carriage, the group had to spent an entire week in Wyvern, the capital of the King Dragon Realm which is the third largest country in the world. Amoung the good he saw in the city was rice, which he happily purchased and cooked himself to try to fulfill his dream of eating rice again in this new world. However even after adding a raw egg on top it was still less than a C in terms of taste compared to what he was used to in Japan, and that was being generous.

After leaving Wyvern and along the way to Shirone, Rudeus continued stopped by the Adventurer's Guilds and would use the name Dead End, which would hardly elicit much of a response at all anymore, since the threat of the Superd was nonexistent to the people living on the Central Continent. Rudeus also continued eating the rice produced by the various regions they traveled to, and different versions of a dish similar to Japanese fried chicken, all failing to meet his expectations. And finally after four months of this, the group reached the Shirone Kingdom.

Chapter 3: The Shirone Kingdom

As the group arrives in the capital of Shirone, Latakia, Rudeus starts another team meeting. Thinking about the Man-God's words, he creates fake names for each of them to use while in Shirone and buys supplies to sent
Roxy
 a letter since she was a court magician of the Shirone Kingdom the last time Rudeus wrote to her. After sending the letter he walks into some small alleys, and realizes he's seeing the exact scene the Man God showed him, with his younger sister Aisha being grabbed by two city guards. Rudeus thought that the guards did not look happy performing their duty, but he nonetheless saw Aisha crying and immediately helped her once she asked him for it, using his magic to catapult them into the sky to get away from the soldiers.

Chapter 4: There Is No God

After calming down from the traumatic events she just experienced, Aisha asked Rudues to buy some paper and a pen so she could write a letter to her father. After asking if she could ask anyone else for help, perhaps a brother, she says that she does have a brother, but her mom told her brother was capable of such advanced magic at a young age that she doesn't believe her, and found Rudeus' secret stash of Roxy's panties and thinks of him as a pervert. Rudeus can't blame her for thinking that, and so continues to hide his identity but says that he will help save Lilia.

Aisha tells Rudeus the details of her and Lilia were teleported to Shirone Kingdom's Royal Palace and were arrested, yet no matter how many times they tried to explain the situation they were not let free and were unable to send any letters. Through the conversation Rudeus learns that Aisha is really a natural born talent, and is extremely well spoken, well mannered, and knows a lot of useful information from her rigorous training under Lilia. After exhausting herself she fell asleep and a few hours later Ruijerd and Eris return but were unable to gather much information.

The next day a knight of the seventh price's imperial guard came to the inn Rudeus was staying at to guide him to Roxy. After reaching what he thought was Roxy's room, it turned out to be the seventh prince himself,
Pax Shirone
, and he was led into a trap. After entering the room Rudeus sees Lilia next to Pax, the prince, and then falls into the trapdoor that was set up causing him to be trapped inside a King tier barrier that prevents him from using any magic. Pax explains that he was holding Lilia and Aisha captive to lure Roxy to the palace so that he could then trap her, and force her to be his sex slave.

Pax then leaves Rudeus, but he was able to overhear his conversation with the knight who led Rudeus to the palace, Ginger, and learns that Pax is holding many of his knights families hostage to force them to do whatever he wants, which is why they are still looking for and trying to capture Aisha even when they are actually unwilling to do so, and are even falsifying reports claiming that the man who saved Aisha the previous day was a large brawny man. As Rudeus sits in captivity, he thinks about all the potential mistakes he made when listening to the Man-God's advice, and if things will truly work according to what the Man-God told him.

Chapter 5: The Third Prince

While Rudeus was trying to come up with a way to escape the King tier barrier, with absolutely no luck, the third Prince
Zanoba Shirone
 introduced himself to Rudeus. It turns out that Lilia still had Rudeus secret box containing a pair of Roxy's underwear that he stole, and Zanoba opened that box and noticed that the underwear were the same pair that Roxy was wearing in the statue of her that he bought. Zanoba thought that there must be some connection between Rudeus and the statue, and since he was absolutely obsessed with statues to the point of it being his only joy in life, he pledged his loyalty to Rudeus after discovering that he was indeed the creator of the figurine. Rudeus first order was for Zanoba to help him escape the barrier, causing Zanoba to tell Rudeus that he will be right back.

Chapter 6: A Speedy Resolution

Zanoba, as it turns out, was a Blessed Child. One who had a particular gift setting him apart from normal humans, abnormal strength. The strength to lift a full grown adult man up with just one hand and easily rip off his head even as a child, which he had done many times before giving him the nickname "Head-Ripping Prince". This allowed him to get Pax, bringing him to the room with the barrier with his hand on Pax's head, and threaten to rip his head off if he didn't release Rudeus, all so that he could save Rudeus, the wonderful doll maker. This plan worked wonderfully, and everyone was saved.

Rudeus also learned about how the soldier's families who were held hostage by Pax were rescued by Ruijerd, and that for all the trouble they caused both Pax and Zanoba were to be banished, under the pretext of studying abroad. Pax was sent to be a hostage in the King Dragon Realm, while Zanoba was sent
somewhere else
. And Lilia and Aisha were going to be personally escorted all the way to Paul by the soldiers who families were saved. Rudeus remarked that even though he felt like he was dancing in the palm of the Man-God to a  terrible tune, everything turned out perfect in the end.

Chapter 7: The Birth of My Little Sister, The Maid

At the small town inn, Rudeus and Lilia are sitting while Eris and Aisha talked about Rudeus and his capabilities in magic. Lilia thanks Rudeus for saving her back there in the castle, where he wants to give those gratitude to Ruijerd instead. Lilia asks Rudeus out of concern for Aisha, which he responds that she is exceptional at best. Lilia considers on letting Aisha go along with him but he does not want to as she is too young and she is too inexperienced. Lilia gives Rudeus the pendant given by Slyphy for his 10th birthday and Roxy's panties in the chest box, which Rudeus is thankful for. She hugged Rudeus behind her back, he tells her about her chest padded from his back while feeling smothered. Lilia says that he never changed at all with a small laugh she had.

Before Rudeus and his party departs, Aisha asked Rudeus a favor if he could take her along but Rudeus rejects her despite she wants go with him. Rudeus gives Aisha his forehead protector as a remembrance of him. Aisha talks about men wanting her body and making children to which Rudeus shrugs her off and tells her not to talk about those stuff. As she asks Rudeus about not mad at her for calling him a pervert, to which confuses him. She went back to the carriage and making a promise with him to see each other soon. Rudeus realize that Aisha tested him if she could trust him from her and her mother's rescue, calling her "a brilliant, clever little girl" while departing off from Shirone Kingdom.

Chapter 8: An Adult

Chapter 9: The Second Turning Point

Chapter 10: The Wide, Gaping Hole In My Chest

Chapter 11: Journey's End

Chapter 12: The Reality of the Calamity

Chapter 13: The Young Miss's Resolution

Interlude: The Two She Encountered

THE MOTHER OF ALL ADVENTURES

Despite his attempts to focus on the task at hand, Eris’ absence weighs heavy on his heart, and so Rudeus gambles on a dangerous new venture to distract himself from his newfound loneliness—accepting an A-rank job all by himself.

Lilia
=====

Redirect to:
Lilia Greyrat

Lilia's Rescue
==============

Lilia's Rescue
 (
リーリャ救出
,

Rīrya Kyūshutsu
)
 is the 44th chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Lilia Greyrat

Ginger

Summary

Appearances

Characters

Lilia Greyrat

Ginger

Rudeus Greyrat

Aisha Greyrat

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Ruijerd Superdia

Zanoba Shirone

Pax Shirone

Roxy Migurdia
 (Flashback)

Skills

Regions

Others

Differences from Light Novel

Trivia

Navigation

Lilia Greyrat
=============

Information

Chronology

Relationships

Gallery

Lilia Greyrat
 (
リーリャ
・
グレイラット
)
 is a maid of the
Greyrat household
. In her past, she was
Paul Greyrat
's classmate in a swordsman dojo before a crippling injury forces her to leave her position as a princess guard and she becomes a maid to Paul and
Zenith Greyrat
. After working through the revelation with the family, she is taken in as Paul's second wife and becomes closer friends with Zenith.

Appearance

Lilia is a very beautiful
Human
 woman who as has reddish-brown hair that is tied up in a half bun while she has chest-length hair strands resting on either side of her shoulders, violet-purple eyes and she has a very slender and voluptuous body with very large breasts.

She usually wears a maid outfit, she wears oval-shaped glasses and hairband having lays on both sides.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Personality

Most of the time, Lilia is emotionless because of her training in becoming a guard-maid, but shows more expressions after becoming
Paul Greyrat
's second wife and She also believes in superstitions like evil spirits.

Background

Lilia is the daughter of
Augusta
 and
Flute
 who owns a dojo of the
Water God Style
 in the Southern Region of Asura Kingdom. When Paul ran away from his home, he is taken in by Augusta with the intent of having him marry Lilia and take over the dojo because of his talent in the sword. But Paul refuses and when Paul is trying to escape, he ends up in Lilia's room where he rapes her before running away for good.






Lilia protecting Ariel from assassins



Lilia then becomes a guard-maid for the Silver Palace in
Asura Kingdom
. Usually doing a maid's job, but if there's anything that happens, they would pick a sword up to protect their master. Lilia faithfully accomplished her own duty. As a maid there were no complaints, but as a swords fighter, she only had average ability. Because of that, in a battle against the assassin who targeted
Ariel Anemoi Asura
 who was born not too long ago, from one moment of carelessness, she was slashed and injured on the leg by the opponent's short sword. Poison had been applied to the short sword. It was a poison specially made to assassinate royalty.

There was no antidote or
curing magic
 that could treat such a troublesome poison. The wound was immediately treated, thanks to the doctors trying out various methods to cure the poison, but even though her life was secured, there were side effects left from it. There were no problems in her everyday life, but she could never run or stomp with her full strength. The kingdom sacked her without hesitation. Lilia also accepted it. Losing her ability, it's a given to be sacked. Lilia left the capital. The mastermind behind the assassination attempt was not found. Lilia knew deeply of the rules in the concubine's palace and that she might become the next target. Or perhaps the kingdom purposely made Lilia leave to lure out the mastermind. She always wondered why she, who had no background, was accepted in the concubine's palace. Then she finally understood why: they only wanted to hire a maid who could be used and then discarded. Changing horse carriages, she arrived at
Fedoa
 on the far borders which had extensive agricultural lands besides the
Citadel of Roa
, the heart of this place where the ruler was living in, there were only extremely wide wheat fields, a quiet place.

Lilia intended to find work here. But being injured, she was unable to find a job based on strength. It's possible to teach sword dueling, but it's best to be hired as a maid, because the salary is higher. In that place, the number who can use and teach swordsmanship is high, but a maid who had been fully taught to handle house affairs is relatively uncommon. The salary will be higher when there is less competition. But getting hired by the ruler of Fedoa or any similar upper class noble is dangerous. The people of that level definitely had ties to the king. If they knew that she was a maid who worked for the concubine palace, there was a possibility that she would be treated as a tool for politics. And because of that, Lilia stayed far away. She didn't want to experience that kind of near-death situation again. Even though it was a little unfair to the princess, Lilia hoped to stay far away from the royals' contention for power. But if her salary was too low, there wouldn't be enough money sent to her family. Trying to find a safe job and guaranteed salary wasn't easy.

Lilia came across an advertisement note. In Fedoa's village of
Buena
, a lower class knight was hiring a maid. On the top of that, the note said it would give special priority to someone with experience in taking care of children and knowledge as a midwife.
Paul Greyrat
 employed Lilia without any fuss. It seemed that his wife
Zenith Greyrat
 was about to give birth, and he was very anxious. Lilia was fully taught in knowledge and technique for the princess's birth. Moreover, she was someone that he knew, and her birthplace was already known. Lilia was received with a warm welcome. Lilia's salary was more than what she had expected, and her wish was also achieved.
The child
 was born.

Plot

Infancy Period

After Lilia accepted the job as the maid of the
Greyrat family
 where she assists in giving birth to
Rudeus Greyrat
. But upon seeing Rudeus' face showing a perverted face, she take on an immediate dislike for Rudeus, thinking that he was a creepy child who made weird expressions especially when he was pressed against a woman's chest like he is possessed by an evil spirit. Despite getting along with Zenith, Lilia avoided Rudeus whenever she could, often turning the other way. Once, she had even found his box which had
Roxy Migurdia
's panties in it but she did not say anything about it.

Later in the volume, she had carried
Paul's child
, which was announced shortly after
Zenith Greyrat
's news that she was pregnant once more. It had come to a shock to everyone and she was willing to take the blame and get kicked out because it was she that had succumbed to temptation, and seduced Paul to bed with her but it is snowing at the time and travelling while pregnant is dangerous so Zenith was at a lost on what to do.

However, her attempt to shoulder the blame and move out was prevented by Rudeus who had made up the story that it was Paul that had taken advantage of her. It had left Paul in a precarious situation but it saved her to no longer have to move and Zenith was able accept her as a family member.

She had then felt indebted to Rudeus, the child she had always disliked, having no way to thank him because he was not obligated to do that for her, especially when he knew the truth clearer than anyone. He had saved her unconditionally and selflessly, saying that the child that was in her was still his sister.






Lilia and Aisha during the
Teleport Incident



Lilia, from that moment onwards decided to devote her life to serving him to repay her debt and also plans to raise Aisha to server Rudeus. She married Paul as the second wife as he was forced to take responsibility but she still remained the faithful maid of the Greyrats. Her child,
Aisha Greyrat
 was born a few hours after
Norn Greyrat
 healthily.

In
K417
, she was forcefully separated from the Greyrats due to the
Teleport Incident
 and was transported to the
Shirone Kingdom
 with her biological daughter.

Volume 6 - Juvenile Period - Homecoming Chapter

Lilia and
Aisha Greyrat
 officially reappeared and were declared alive and tries to get into contact with Roxy, not aware that she already left Shirone.

Approximately two and a half years after the happening of the
Teleport Incident
, it was told to
Rudeus Greyrat
 by
Hitogami
 that the mother and daughter pair were detained in the Kingdom. He immediately went to rescue them and was unfortunately captured by
Pax Shirone
.

Later, it was discovered that Lilia and Aisha had been transported right into the Royal Palace and were seen as foreign spies. They were sentenced to prison stay but by letting lose
Roxy Migurdia
's name, who had been a Royal Court Magician for a period of time in the
Shirone Kingdom
 and
Paul Greyrat
's name, they were spared and were sentenced to confinement.

When reports about the event had came in, they were to be free. However, the
7th Prince of the Shirone Kingdom
 interfered, capturing them once more and putting them into confinement. He had wanted to use Lilia and Aisha as bait to get Roxy back to the Kingdom and his attempts had not been fruitful because the news never reached Roxy.

During that time period, she had taught Aisha the ways of a maid, social etiquette and academic subjects in hopes that she would be competent to serve Rudeus, a method she thought was fitting because he had saved Aisha's life from having to live on the streets.

In the viewpoint of Rudeus, it was said that she had even taught Aisha who was only six in the arc to use her body (cuteness) to get what she wanted, saying that she did not need money to get the letter sent. Whether it was presumed that all letters or information about Paul would be paid for in advance or she was to seduce was not made clear.

When she had heard that Rudeus was captured, she had tried to save him but was only dragged away miserably by the guards. Due to her leg injury, she was less competent and could not hold against them.

She was later saved by Rudeus when Pax Shirone was arrested and when they reunited, she had presented him with the holy box that he very much treasured and received his heart-felt thanks. She had even asked if Aisha could accompany him and devote herself to him and was disappointed when he said that Aisha was better off with her parents than without.

She had reluctantly agreed to the situation, saying that Aisha needed more training before she was ready.

Power and Abilities

『Sword Techniques』






Lilia sparring in the Game



Lilia has attained Intermediate-ranked
Water God Style
 from training in her father,
Augusta
's dojo but it was not enough for her to be an instructor of the dojo. Because of this, Augusta has been training
Paul Greyrat
 who is talented in the sword and plans that he would marry Lilia so that they eventually inherit the dojo.

Trivia

Lilia apparently has a desire for Rudeus to show her daughter the same affection he shows to his wives.

It is later revealed in
Volume 9
 that the one Lilia protected and got injured for was princess
Ariel Anemoi Asura
.

Lilia lost her virginity to
Paul Greyrat
 when they were training at the dojo many years ago when Paul sexually assaulted her. In hindsight, however, she was glad it was to him rather than the fat nobles in the castle she worked at.

The Light novel version added the glasses for Lilia.

The names of Lilia's parents appear for the first time on a YouTube live stream about the
Mushuko Tensei

Mobile Game
.
