Lilia Greyrat/Chronology
========================

Lilia is the daughter of
Augusta
 and
Flute
 who owns a dojo of the
Water God Style
 in the Southern Region of Asura Kingdom. When Paul ran away from his home, he is taken in by Augusta with the intent of having him marry Lilia and take over the dojo because of his talent in the sword. But Paul refuses and when Paul is trying to escape, he ends up in Lilia's room where he rapes her before running away for good.

Lilia then becomes a guard-maid for the Silver Palace in
Asura Kingdom
. Usually doing a maid's job, but if there's anything that happens, they would pick a sword up to protect their master. Lilia faithfully accomplished her own duty. As a maid there were no complaints, but as a swords fighter, she only had average ability. Because of that, in a battle against the assassin who targeted
Ariel Anemoi Asura
 who was born not too long ago, from one moment of carelessness, she was slashed and injured on the leg by the opponent's short sword. Poison had been applied to the short sword. It was a poison specially made to assassinate royalty.

There was no antidote or
curing magic
 that could treat such a troublesome poison. The wound was immediately treated, thanks to the doctors trying out various methods to cure the poison, but even though her life was secured, there were side effects left from it. There were no problems in her everyday life, but she could never run or stomp with her full strength. The kingdom sacked her without hesitation. Lilia also accepted it. Losing her ability, it's a given to be sacked. Lilia left the capital. The mastermind behind the assassination attempt was not found. Lilia knew deeply of the rules in the concubine's palace and that she might become the next target. Or perhaps the kingdom purposely made Lilia leave to lure out the mastermind. She always wondered why she, who had no background, was accepted in the concubine's palace. Then she finally understood why: they only wanted to hire a maid who could be used and then discarded. Changing horse carriages, she arrived at
Fedoa
 on the far borders which had extensive agricultural lands besides the
Citadel of Roa
, the heart of this place where the ruler was living in, there were only extremely wide wheat fields, a quiet place.

Lilia intended to find work here. But being injured, she was unable to find a job based on strength. It's possible to teach sword dueling, but it's best to be hired as a maid, because the salary is higher. In that place, the number who can use and teach swordsmanship is high, but a maid who had been fully taught to handle house affairs is relatively uncommon. The salary will be higher when there is less competition. But getting hired by the ruler of Fedoa or any similar upper class noble is dangerous. The people of that level definitely had ties to the king. If they knew that she was a maid who worked for the concubine palace, there was a possibility that she would be treated as a tool for politics. And because of that, Lilia stayed far away. She didn't want to experience that kind of near-death situation again. Even though it was a little unfair to the princess, Lilia hoped to stay far away from the royals' contention for power. But if her salary was too low, there wouldn't be enough money sent to her family. Trying to find a safe job and guaranteed salary wasn't easy.

Lilia came across an advertisement note. In Fedoa's village of
Buena
, a lower class knight was hiring a maid. On the top of that, the note said it would give special priority to someone with experience in taking care of children and knowledge as a midwife.
Paul Greyrat
 employed Lilia without any fuss. It seemed that his wife
Zenith Greyrat
 was about to give birth, and he was very anxious. Lilia was fully taught in knowledge and technique for the princess's birth. Moreover, she was someone that he knew, and her birthplace was already known. Lilia was received with a warm welcome. Lilia's salary was more than what she had expected, and her wish was also achieved.
The child
 was born.

Plot

Infancy Period

After Lilia accepted the job as the maid of the
Greyrat family
 where she assists in giving birth to
Rudeus Greyrat
. But upon seeing Rudeus' face showing a perverted face, she take on an immediate dislike for Rudeus, thinking that he was a creepy child who made weird expressions especially when he was pressed against a woman's chest like he is possessed by an evil spirit. Despite getting along with Zenith, Lilia avoided Rudeus whenever she could, often turning the other way. Once, she had even found his box which had
Roxy Migurdia
's panties in it but she did not say anything about it.

Later in the volume, she had carried
Paul's child
, which was announced shortly after
Zenith Greyrat
's news that she was pregnant once more. It had come to a shock to everyone and she was willing to take the blame and get kicked out because it was she that had succumbed to temptation, and seduced Paul to bed with her but it is snowing at the time and travelling while pregnant is dangerous so Zenith was at a lost on what to do.

However, her attempt to shoulder the blame and move out was prevented by Rudeus who had made up the story that it was Paul that had taken advantage of her. It had left Paul in a precarious situation but it saved her to no longer have to move and Zenith was able accept her as a family member.

She had then felt indebted to Rudeus, the child she had always disliked, having no way to thank him because he was not obligated to do that for her, especially when he knew the truth clearer than anyone. He had saved her unconditionally and selflessly, saying that the child that was in her was still his sister.

Lilia, from that moment onwards decided to devote her life to serving him to repay her debt and also plans to raise Aisha to server Rudeus. She married Paul as the second wife as he was forced to take responsibility but she still remained the faithful maid of the Greyrats. Her child,
Aisha Greyrat
 was born a few hours after
Norn Greyrat
 healthily.

In
K417
, she was forcefully separated from the Greyrats due to the
Teleport Incident
 and was transported to the
Shirone Kingdom
 with her biological daughter.

Volume 6 - Juvenile Period - Homecoming Chapter

Lilia and
Aisha Greyrat
 officially reappeared and were declared alive and tries to get into contact with Roxy, not aware that she already left Shirone.

Approximately two and a half years after the happening of the
Teleport Incident
, it was told to
Rudeus Greyrat
 by
Hitogami
 that the mother and daughter pair were detained in the Kingdom. He immediately went to rescue them and was unfortunately captured by
Pax Shirone
.

Later, it was discovered that Lilia and Aisha had been transported right into the Royal Palace and were seen as foreign spies. They were sentenced to prison stay but by letting lose
Roxy Migurdia
's name, who had been a Royal Court Magician for a period of time in the
Shirone Kingdom
 and
Paul Greyrat
's name, they were spared and were sentenced to confinement.

When reports about the event had came in, they were to be free. However, the
7th Prince of the Shirone Kingdom
 interfered, capturing them once more and putting them into confinement. He had wanted to use Lilia and Aisha as bait to get Roxy back to the Kingdom and his attempts had not been fruitful because the news never reached Roxy.

During that time period, she had taught Aisha the ways of a maid, social etiquette and academic subjects in hopes that she would be competent to serve Rudeus, a method she thought was fitting because he had saved Aisha's life from having to live on the streets.

In the viewpoint of Rudeus, it was said that she had even taught Aisha who was only six in the arc to use her body (cuteness) to get what she wanted, saying that she did not need money to get the letter sent. Whether it was presumed that all letters or information about Paul would be paid for in advance or she was to seduce was not made clear.

When she had heard that Rudeus was captured, she had tried to save him but was only dragged away miserably by the guards. Due to her leg injury, she was less competent and could not hold against them.

She was later saved by Rudeus when Pax Shirone was arrested and when they reunited, she had presented him with the holy box that he very much treasured and received his heart-felt thanks. She had even asked if Aisha could accompany him and devote herself to him and was disappointed when he said that Aisha was better off with her parents than without.

She had reluctantly agreed to the situation, saying that Aisha needed more training before she was ready.

Lily Greyrat
============

Lily Greyrat
  is the fifth child and the third daughter of
Rudeus Greyrat
 and the second daughter he had with
Roxy M. Greyrat
. She is the younger sister of
Lara Greyrat
, the younger half-sister of
Lucy Greyrat
,
Ars Greyrat
,
Sieghardt Saladin Greyrat
 and the older half-sister of
Christina Greyrat
.

Appearance

Lily has the same hair color as her mother and her sister.

Personality

She is a carefree person and loves anything related to Magic tools and Magic Items. She is a natural airhead and has no sense of direction, which often makes her lose her way when she travels between her home and her workplace.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Background

Lily inherited the
Magic Armor
 research, and the production of an All-Purpose Magic Armor was completed in K483. It was useful for reducing the amount of casualties during the subjugation of large monsters.

Plot

Jobless Oblige

She still lives in
Rudeus
' house, working for Zanoba Company, in the Development and Repair of Magical Tools Division.

Redundancy -
The Last One to Leave the Nest

She still lives in Ranoa, but she already left
Rudeus
' house.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Power and Abilities

As a sibling of Greyrat family, her fencing and magic skills were well above the ordinary. She is also a highly skilled researcher.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Quotes

Lily: "Nii-san, would it be alright if I whacked you on the head with this to see how it looks?"

Sieghart: "Get fucked."

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Trivia

She's bad at riding a horse even though she was taught when she was small. She can getting on it but is at a complete loss at what to do next.

Reference

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Linia
=====

Redirect to:
Linia Dedoldia

Linia Dedoldia
==============

Lineana Dedoldia
 (
リニアーナ
・
デドルディア
)
 or
Linia
 (
リニア
)
 is a member of the Doldia Tribe. Debuting at the
Ranoa Magic Academy
 alongside
Pursena
, they were delinquents who terrorized the school until
Rudeus
 put them in check. Following their graduation, she ended up in debt and became a slave. Fortunately, Rudeus saved her by purchasing her, after which she became his maid.

Appearance

Linia has short, grey hair with a pair of cat ears and a tail of the same color. Like many females of her tribe, she has large breasts.

Personality

Linia is an arrogant, boisterous and frivolous person who likes to flaunt her authority to people beneath her. She is very impulsive and easily provoked, but is quick to submit to and flatter people who are much more powerful. She is also clumsy and tend to overestimate her abilities, which sometimes led her into trouble.

Despite appearing nonchalant, she does care about her friends, shown when she asked
Rudeus
 to take
Pursena
 as a caretaker of
Leo
.

Background

Due to the fact that the most recent two generations of the chief's family aren't bright enough, her
grandfather
 sent her to the
Ranoa Magic Academy
 along with Pursena, in hope that they would gain knowledge and wisdom in a place where their influence is less effective. However, because of her linage as a Royalty of the Beast Race, Linia was treated with great care and became pampered. Linia with
Pursena
 became arrogant and acted like delinquents, committing various offences like playing truant, bullying, and extortion. Many beast race delinquents joined their ranks, and their gang became the biggest troublemaker in the school.

In her second year,
Ariel
,
Fitts
 and
Luke
 enroll in the
Ranoa Magic Academy
 and gain greater influence than that of Linia and
Pursena
, which lead to them trying to beat the fresh-blood in order to gain back influence, but that failed miserably as
Fitts
 single-handedly defeated Linia,
Pursena
 and their gang. She and Pursena are humbled for good and shape-up to become model students after their temporary imprisonment in Rudeus's dorm. In contrast to the calm and collected Pursena, Linia is more emotional and hot-tempered.

Plot

After graduating she become a peddler selling goods from Asura to the North and vice-versa. However she gained her funds through loaning, eventually she found herself unable to pay her loans and thus she was taken into custody and turned into a slave. One day she escaped and run away, she was then found by
Eris
 and decided to help her. She was then picked up by
Eris
 to become her pet. She then later helps set up and joins the
Rude Mercenary Company
 to help pay off her debt to
Rudeus Greyrat
 after he bought her to stop her from getting sold off to an Asuran Noble.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Power and Abilities

Superior agility, their physical strength, and the characteristics special to their race.

Howling

Fire Magic -
 Advanced Rank

Water Magic -
 Intermediate Rank

Earth Magic -
 Elementary Rank

Wind Magic -
 Elementary Rank

Healing Magic -
 Elementary Rank

Detoxification Magic -
 Elementary Rank

Equipment

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Quotes

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Trivia

Linia ends her sentences with
Nya
 (ニャ), or
mew
 in English, a common trait among cat beastfolks in Japanese fantasy works.

There is a number of hints that she is fond of
Rudeus
. Whenever he sexually harasses her, she does not resist and occasionally even tempts him to do so.

Linia's (リニア) true name is Lineana (リニアーナ) and Linia is her nickname
. Her true name was first mentioned in
Light Novel Volume 4
 Chapter 9, but never seen again.

The total value of the fine alcohol that
Pilemon Notos Greyrat
 gifted to Ariel (the one Rudeus gifted to the Demon King Atoferatofe) is double the price he paid to buy Linia as a slave (300*10 Asuran Gold Coins).

Later on confirmed that's Eris's "domination" of her is simply hugging her until she bruises.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Loss
====

Loss
 is the 110th chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Manatite Hydra

Summary

Everyone is shocked by the Manatite Hydra suddenly eating off a burned neck while Elinalise attacks another neck and uses Ice Smash and calls on Roxy who uses Flame Thrower. The Hydra then uses Fire Breath causing Rudeus to call on everyone to gather behind him and uses Water Shield and somehow they are all unharmed while Roxy estimates that it takes at least 10
Magicians
 to match what Rudeus' Magic Power. After the Hydra stops, the party resumes attacking...

Volume 1

Lucy Greyrat
============

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Information

Relationships

Lucy Greyrat
 (
ルーシー・グレイラット
,

Rūshī Gureiratto
)
 is the first child of
Rudeus Greyrat
 and
Sylphiette Greyrat
.

Spoilers ahead

She is the older sister of
Sieghardt Saladin Greyrat
 and the oldest Half-Sister of
Lara Greyrat
,
Ars Greyrat
,
Lily Greyrat
 and
Christina Greyrat
.

Appearance

She has the same hair color as
Rudeus
. She also has pointed ears from her Elf Heritage that she inherited from Sylphiette, although shorter than her mother. She is still growing.

Personality

Spoilers ahead

She has a tendency to run away from
Rudeus
 whenever he's at home, possibly because she doesn't see
Rudeus
 as a father since he doesn't spend much time with her, but recently the distance between the two has been shrinking. She once thought
Orsted
 was her father because he has white hair just like her mother.

Around the ages of 4-5, she fully recognizes
Rudeus
 as her father and plays with him when possible, but laments the fact that his work takes him away for months at a time.

Later when she grows up, she starts to believe that Rudeus holds no expectations from her or any of his other children due to which they start to grow apart until she has a heartfelt talk with him just before her marriage to Clive.

Background

Lucy is the first born child between Rudeus and Sylphy who are childhood friends from
Buena Village
. But the two got separated and due to the
Teleport Incident
, their circumstances greatly changed as they eventually both ended up in
Ranoa Magic Academy
,
Sharia
 where they reunited and got married
. Before Rudeus journeys to the
Teleportation Labyrinth
 in the
Begaritt Continent
 he decides that he would name their child to be Sirius if its a boy and Lucy if it is a girl but this was met with uneasiness with everyone in the family as it was considered taboo so Rudeus decides to give the name when he returns.
 When the baby was born, Rudeus finally names her Lucy taken from the first names of his name (Ru) and Sylphiette's name (Sy) (Rusy or roughly Lucy which makes more sense in Japanese) to which Rudeus is glad that his child is a girl otherwise the baby would be named after
Paul
 who died from the Teleport Labyrinth.

Plot

Spoilers ahead

Mushoku Tensei Volume 20.5 - Intermission Chapter

She is currently learning Magic from Sylphy and
Roxy
, while watching
Eris
 swing a stick around. She also likes
Leo
 and will occasionally groom his matted fur. She had gotten in trouble with Sylphy when she used her mother's brush to groom Leo.

Redundancy
Nanahoshi Gourmet

Lucy and
Clive
 start a relationship and they are going be married in the future.

Redundancy
The Last One to Leave the Nest

Lucy and Clive are married and live together in the
Holy Country of Milis
.

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Power and Abilities

It is known that she is currently learning magic from her mother and Roxy, however, her current skill and ability is unknown. She has also received tips from
Orsted
 and watched
Eris
' swordplay, implying an interest in learning the latter.

Equipment

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Achievements

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Quotes

Spoilers ahead

「but
mama
 and
Leo
 is both white!」

Lucy:
 "...Papa, hug."

Rudeus:
 "Come here... okay, good, be a good girl now!"

Lucy:
 "Mm..."

Norn:
 "Ehh~ the bell peppers too? I don't like bell peppers..."

Lucy:
 "Leaving the bell peppers is no good! Adults have to eat things even if they aren't delicious!"

Lucy:
 "Papa. What's wrong? Stomach hurts?"

Rudeus:
 "No, well a little, I accidentally hurt mama's feelings."

Lucy:
 "Then, you should say sorry."

Rudeus:
 "Lucy. Even if I tell Mama I'm sorry, I don't think that will help, her feelings will still be hurt."

Lucy:
 "But, Papa won't hurt Mama's feelings anymore?"

Rudeus:
 "I won't."

Lucy:
 "Well then Mama will forgive you!"

Trivia

Spoilers ahead

She once thought
Orsted
 was her father since his hair was white like her mother's. She was also once given a piggyback ride by
Orsted
 while she pulled on his hair.

Like
her father
, she is not affected by
Orsted
's curse.

She is the only of Rudeus' children on inherit her father's hair color.

Lucy Greyrat/Relationships
==========================

Rudeus Greyrat





Lucy together with Rudeus and Sylphiette



Rudeus is Lucy's father who she initially avoids when she was young but grew to love him and she also mentions that Rudeus' smell gives her a peace of mind. Lucy is also aware of the accomplishments of Rudeus even when he was young and she sees him as an amazing person and thinks that Rudeus does not expect much from her but she still wants Rudeus to praise her.

Sylphiette

"It is important to make friends, okay? And you must never bully the weak, okay?"

-Sylphiette to Lucy

Sylphiette is Lucy's biological mother who she calls "White-Haired Mama" because of the color of her hair. Lucy describes Sylphiette to be a talkative person and would persuade her to always make friends.

Roxy Migurdia

"Live however you want, if you don't understand something then just ask someone."

-Roxy to Lucy

Roxy is Rudeus' second wife who Lucy calls "Blue-Haired Mama". Lucy describes Roxy to be a reserved person who never persuades her about anything. But she considers Roxy to be very knowledgeable and always answers any questions Lucy asks her.

Eris Boreas Greyrat

"It's important to protect someone. For that reason you must become strong."

Eris to Lucy

Eris is Rudeus' third wife who Lucy calls "Red-Haired Mama" who Lucy describes to never speak much and would also be the one who trains Lucy in the Sword styles and to discipline her if she does something out of line.
 During a family meeting it was decided that Lucy will being studying at
Ranoa Magic Academy
 at age 7, Eris disagrees with the notion but did not strongly oppose it.

Zenith Greyrat

Zenith is Lucy's grandmother and is aware of her circumstances on why she is now unable talk and Zenith's tendency to be absent-minded and being together with
Beat
. When Lucy feels sorry or gets angry, Zenith would caress her head which Lucy describes her to be a mysterious granny.

Clive Grimoire

Clive is Lucy's half-uncle but she still treats him like a younger brother since he is the same age as Ars and 2 years younger than her.
 At age 12, Lucy and Clive started dating.
 When Lucy became 18 years old, Lucy brings Clive to Rudeus and tells him that she will marry Clive.

Orsted

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

References

Luicelia Supardia
=================

Redirect to:
Luicelia Superdia

Luicelia Superdia
=================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Luicelia Superdia
 (
ルイシェリア
・
スペルディア
)
 is the daughter and only child of
Norn Greyrat
 and
Ruijerd Superdia
. According to
Orsted
, she will play a vital role in the battle against the resurrected Demon God
Laplace
 in the future.

Appearance

Luicelia's face has a striking resemblance with her mother Norn and shares similar hairstyle of sporting a ponytail at the back of her head but also has the distinctive features of the
Superd Tribe
 race such as emerald green hair, a red gemstone in her forehead and a tail.

Personality

She’s a very reserved person, honest and would immediately kill her enemy but she was someone who battled on in difficult circumstances, tried very hard and earnest on surface, a beautiful Demon.

Orsted

Luicelia inherited her father’s rigid stubbornness and her mother’s clumsy nature. Despite her stoic appearance, Luicelia is an emotionally rich girl who loves gossip stories. She’s a quiet yet confident individual, which often leads her to speak in blunt terms.

Background

Luicelia is the daughter of
Ruijerd Superdia
 and
Norn Greyrat
 who are brought together once again at the suggestion of
Orsted
 who has become attached to Luicella during his countless timeloops he has gone through where Luicelia has helped him on countless occasions and he feels indebted to her. Thus Orsted asks
Rudeus
 to arrange for the marriage of Norn and to the surprise of Rudeus when he learned that Norn will be married to Ruijerd, his comrade and close friend.
 Due to the Superd race's prolonged childhood and slower maturation there was a time when Luicelia once resented being left behind by her cousins, but later she made peace with it. Decades later, she works directly under
Ars
 and is a member of the Ogre Empire's special elite forces .

Plot

"Rest assured. I won't die."

-Luicelia to Ars

Luicelia would later work under the Biheril Kingdom where she would be known as the Shadow Chasing Demon for her reputation of not letting her enemies escape her pursuit and works along side
Henry
. After eliminating a spy, she discovers the long-lost Volume 29 of Rudeus’ Chronicles and delivers it to Ars Greyrat. She is also entrusted with eliminating anyone who uncovers the Ogre God Empire’s secret fortress and plays a critical role alongside Henry in a high-risk operation, Aisha’s final invasion plan against the Asura Kingdom, devised before her death.

Power and Abilities

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Equipment

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Achievements

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Quotes

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Alternate Timeline

In the previous timeline, she was the last Superd and helps
Orsted
 to fight
Laplace
.

Luke
====

Redirect to:
Luke Notos Greyrat

Luke Notos Greyrat
==================

Luke holding a sword to Ariel's throat.



Luke Notos Greyrat
 (
ルーク
・
ノトス
・
グレイラット
)
 is
Rudeus'
 cousin and the personal knight to princess
Ariel Anemoi Asura
 alongside court mage
Fitts
. Despite being connected to such major characters, he himself only has a minor supporting role; a womanizer and mediocre knight.

Appearance

Luke is tall, well-built and extremely good looking. He has brown hair and wears it in a combed back style. A standard Ikemen, or cool handsome guy.

Note: This section is under construction and revision

Personality

Luke is a playboy and, like the rest of the Notos Greyrat family, has a fetish for large boobs.

Although he plays around with most girls, he treats his liege, Ariel Anemoi Asura with utmost reverence, with her safety and well-being as his top priority.

Luke also treats
Fitts
 as a colleague and friend instead of a girl to fool around with.

Tricked by
Hitogami
, he considered Rudeus as his enemy and lost reason. However, Ariel was, in the end, able to bring him back to his senses.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Background

Luke was born into the Notos Greyrat family as an Asura Kingdom high noble. He was tasked at a very young age into the appointment of being the Guardian Knight of second princess Ariel Anemoi Asura alongside Derrick Redbat.

He was very fervent in his duties as a guardian despite his frivolous attitude to girls and his mediocre skills. He was so loyal that he sacrificed himself for his charge when they were attacked in the garden by a terminate boar. Sword-less, he tried to protect Ariel despite knowing that he could not win, even after he saw Derrick killed in front of him.

After being saved by Sylphy, who was teleported to them due to the metastasis event, he continued to guard Princess Ariel with Sylphy who was Silent-Fitts.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Plot

Luke Notos Greyrat does not appear many times in the first half of the volumes. However, starting with Volume 8, Luke takes a much larger role in the main cast. He serves as the primary knight to Princes Ariel, and a close friend and coworker to Sylphiette. During the earlier portions of Volumes 8 and 9, Luke primarily antagonizes Rudeaus, who he believes is a bad influence on Sylphy, and due to his status as the son of Paul Notos Greyrat, who is Luke's uncle.

During the latter half of Volume 9, Luke's opinion of Rudeaus change. Realizing the state of Sylphy's love for Rudy, he provides her with a powerful aphrodesiac in order to potentially heal his Erectile Dysfunction.

Tensions rise with Princes Ariel and her faction, and in order to potentially sway votes in her favor, Luke goes to Rudeaus to ask him to join them. Rudy had already pledged his alegience to Ariel and Luke for their assistance in both curing his illness, and allowing him to marry Sylphiette, essentially releasing her from her duty to them (Though Sylphy stays as one of Ariel's personal Bodyguards). Rudeaus accepts, and not much happens in regards to Luke until the begining of Volume 17.

During the events of Volume 17, Luke is visited by Hitogami, who tells him that he should be weary of Rudeaus's betrayal, along with general, vague, advice about keeping Ariel safe during their travels. It is heavily implied that Hitogami also tells him things about Pilemon Notos Greyrat, Luke's father, deceiving him about his father's position with Ariel's faction. This is understood as when Ariel's caravan was attacked by assassins in the second act of Volume 17, Luke is incredibly supprised and even a bit shaken by the Notos Seal being on the armor of their attackers.

In the Third Act of Volume 17, after being held hostage by the Water God, Luke watches his father being belittled by Princes Ariel. Pilemon's betrayal of her faction needed to be punished, so Ariel asked Luke for his blade to execute his father. At this, Luke snaps, going mad and taking the Princes hostage instead, holding his sword to her throat. Though it is not seen by the others in the room, he is holding the side of his blade there as to not hurt the princes. Eventually, when Rudeaus walks in, Luke tells Sylphiette that she would need to kill Rudy in order to save Ariel's life. Sylphiette refuses, and eventually, the tension lowers. Luke releases Ariel, and believes that his proper punishment is to be executed. However Ariel pardons him, and in turn, his father as well.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Power and Abilities

Despite being Princess Ariel's guard, Luke's skills are stated to be mediocre. However, he makes up for it with sheer loyalty, not hesitating to sacrifice his own life for his liege.

Sword Techniques

Intermediate-ranked Sword-God Style

Elementary-ranked Water-God Style

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Equipment

Steel-Cutting Sword

A sword that can easily tear straight through steel.

Enchanted Shoes

Shoes that allow the user to run at twice its normal speed.

Flame Trapping Cloak

A cloak that helps the user maintain a constant body temperature.

Gloves of Overpowering

Gloves that reduce any impact to the palm of the wearer's hand by half.

Reinforced Undertunic

Made of material that is resistant to blades.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.






Ariel forgiving Luke for holding a sword to her throat.

Seven Knights of Asura
.

Eris
 and end up being a happy couple together in the original timeline. This was made impossible by Rudeus' involvement in the current timeline, but he still fell in love with Eris at the first sight.

Luke was the first person who danced with Eris at her 10
th
 Birthday

Because he doesn't possess strong fate, Hitogami is able to use him to see Rudeus' action in
Volume 17
.

Luke indirectly contributed in curing Rudeus' ED by giving one of his aphrodisiac potions to Sylphy.

Lunaria
=======

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

"You're Dragon God's adopted son, then you are my child as well. Please rest assured, this is your home too."

Lunaria to Laplace

Lunaria
 (
ルナリア
,

Runaria
)
 is the
Original Human God
's daughter and the wife of the
First Dragon God
. She is also the mother of
Orsted
.

Personality

Laplace
 describes Lunaria as a caring and kind person who treats everyone around her like family despite initially being disliked by the Dragon Tribe who quesions why the First Dragon God would marry someone outside the Dragon Tribe. After a century or so, Lunaria was ever-benevolent like a goddess that when talking to her, everyone felt an unusual peace which lead to her being accepted and adored by all the Dragon Tribe like one of their own.

Background

"I did not love Lunaria, but she did her best for the Dragon World. She used her power as a scion of daughter to enrich the Dragon World."

-First Dragon God

Lunaria became the wife of the First Dragon God at the suggestion of the Human God. By the time Lunaria became pregnant, the First Dragon God realizes that she seemed more special than the
Dragon Tribe
 and grew to love her that he always spends time with her when he is home.
 When the First Dragon God brings Laplace to their home, Lunaria welcomes him and stays by his side, watching over him serenely but lets the servants take care of his other needs despite her own child is about to be born which makes Laplace view her like his mother as well.

"Fufufu. Husband, please give the child a name."

-Lunaria

For the next decades, Lunaria's belly would grow and Laplace would become a Dragon Warrior to which Lunaria arranges a celebration and would listen to his stories about the different dragons he has trained and is becoming known throughout the Dragon World for his accomplishments. Lunaria gives birth to Orsted when cooperation and peace is has been made by the other Gods to which the First Dragon God and Laplace are on the meeting. By the time they have returned, the celebration has already started and Lunaria presents Orsted to the First Dragon God who rushed to the mansion upon realizing what has happened and Lunaria asks that he names their son. The First Dragon God surprisingly did not give his son's name yet then the Five Dragon Generals also came and is impressed by the child that leaves them with a solemn expression and soon the other Gods also arrives at the Dragon World to give their blessings. When the festival is nearly over, Demon Emperor
Kirisis Calisis
 arrives and Lunaria welcomes her close friend with a smile and lets her see the child to which Kirisis states that he will become a smart and wise man in the future.

With the relationship with the Demon World steadily improving and no signs of conflict from the other worlds as well, this is seen as the peaceful era in the six worlds until the fateful day where Lunaria is found dead in a pool her own blood in the middle of her room.

Legacy

"I can't forgive the one who killed Lunaria. I'm still trembling with unprecedented rage... Even if we turn other worlds into enemies, will you follow me?"

-First Dragon God to Laplace

The First Dragon God and Laplace finds Lunaria dead in a fetal position protecting her child until the end.

At the sight of Lunaria's remains, the First Dragon God's roar is heard in the entire Dragon World and his fist covered with Dragon Battle Aura punches a hole that blew off a solid chunk of Dragon Roar Mountain.

The First Dragon God commands the Dragon Generals to search for the murderer but asks Laplace to stay and mourn with him.

A Dragon Tribe funeral is first held where Lunaria's remains is carried to the center of Kayos by family members namely the First Dragon God and Laplace to be placed on an altar where eulogies are recited and prayer for a safe rebirth.

Lunaria's remains are then brought to the end of the city to begin a funeral procession where her remains is carried by the Dragon God and accompanied by his son who is carried by Laplace moving in a clock-wise direction around the city.

The Dragon Tribe in the city performs the salute of highest honor upon seeing the procession and attend the funeral by assembling in its inner perimeter.

The First Dragon God brings Lunaria's remains to a building with walls filled with names of Dragon Tribes who died but Lunaria's name is carved on a stone tablet which is for special people in the Dragon Tribe.

The Dragon Tribe's funeral rites concludes with the remains being cast in to a hole that leads to the sky but a Human funeral is conducted next for Lunaria.

The First Dragon God brings Lunaria to the garden beside his mansion and burns Lunaria and together with Laplace, they buried her bones and ashes into the ground then planted a small sapling above will grow into a tree through the power of the dead and while the tree lives, the living would never forget the dead.

The Dragon Generals give their report from their investigation of Lunaria's murder which lists suspects from the other worlds to which the First Dragon God decides to confront them and wage war against the other worlds.

After the death of the Beast God, Heaven God, Sea God and Demon God which also destroys their respective world at the hands the First Dragon God, he orders the attack on the
Human World
 next that shocks the Dragon Generals on why he would attack Lunaria's home world and decides to stop the First Dragon God that resulted into a battle.

After the battle, the Human God struck the First Dragon God and admits that he plotted the death of Lunaria and how he manipulated them all to wage war on the other worlds and eventual destruction.

Power and Abilities

Mage Guardian Fitz

Silent Fitz

Magic
=====

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Magic
 (
魔術
,

Majutsu
)
 refers to the manipulation of
mana
 stored in the body to generate supernatural effects known as
Magic Spells
.

Mana

Magic requires an energy source in order to produce its effect in the corporeal world.
Mana
 (
魔力
,

Maryoku
, lit. "Magical Power")
 is the natural energy source for employing and invocation of magic.

All living beings existing in the
Six-Faced World
 innately have mana in their body. Souls normally dissipate into mana after death and can get reincorporated into the environment. The only known exception to this is people from outside the Six-Faced World that have been summoned. Summoned people are incapable of holding mana inside their body, thus incapable of using magic.

Mana or magical power reserve of a person is generally believed to be inherited and the amount one has is determined at birth. Due to the existence of individuals with the
Laplace Factor
 (such as
Rudeus
 and
Sylphy
) having enormous amounts of aggregate mana that increased since their birth, they were considered to be the only exception. This is later proved to be incorrect and not linked to the Laplace Factor. All people are capable of increasing their aggregate mana amount by stimulating their mana from a young age (seen in
Julie
). The ability to learn silent spell-casting is also linked to practicing the skill at a young age.

History

Long before the
Great Human-Demon War
, the world was engulfed in an unceasing spiral of battle and chaos. During that time, in order to fight their enemies the
High Elves
 race entreated with the spirits of the forests to control natural inorganic elements like the wind and the earth. In this manner, the first magic spells were born. Modern form of magic took its form from humans imitating the spells used by the High Elves in battle and reworking them to convenience. Magic was mostly used only in battle and fending off obstacles. As a result, a large portion of the spells that came to exist are combat spells.

Mechanism

Conventional Spell-casting

Magic Spells

Magic Spells
 (
詠唱
,

Eishō
, alt. "Incantations")
, in this method, one recites a set of words to perform magic. Magic Spells acts as an activation trigger for magic, where uttering the words would create the effect without having to focus on the
Mana
 coursing through one's body. As such, magic spells are much less flexible than silent spell-casting due to a restricted amount of control one has while tuning the magic.

Magic Spells are the common method for using magic as it is relatively easy to use. A
magician
 typically uses magic spells from when they were a beginner all the way to when they became a master.

Magic Circles

Rudeus pouring mana to a Magic Circle.
Multi Layered Magic Circle.
Magic Circle for healing in
Ranoa Magic Academy
.
1/3

Magic Circle
 (
魔法陣
,

Mahō-jin
)
 invented by Demon Empress
Kirisis Calisis
, this method involves one inscribing patterns using a specialized ink or carved patterns to cast a spell. Magic circles cast the inscribed spell at a predetermined power whenever mana is poured into it. Because of this, magic circles have the least flexibility of all spell-casting methods, albeit being the easiest and fastest to use.

Depending on the kind of Magic and rank, a Magic Circle's can be larger but its work around is to create multiple layers of Magic Circles on a single plane to achieve a single spell.

Earlier, magic circles were widely used until one magician succeeded at greatly shortening incantations. But for the more complex rituals involved in Summoning magic, where greater efficiency wasn't attainable, magic circles remained the primary means.

Mixed Magic

Mixed Magic
 (
混合魔術
,

Kongō majutsu
)
 or Combined Magic is magic where the caster uses consecutive spells to alter or enhance the effects of a single spell. Spells such as Dry Steaming (Wind and Fire) and Frost Nova (Wind and Water/Ice) are examples of melded magic. Melded magic is exclusive to attack magic; these are familiar and easy to piece together with basic knowledge of science.

Truncated Spell-casting

Truncated or shortened incantations are very similar to conventional spell-casting; the caster recites a predetermined set of words corresponding the magic they are using. With shortened incantations, as used by
Roxy
 and Rudeus, cast times and flexibility are drastically improved over conventional casting. The casting of melded magic also becomes much easier due to the reduced downtime between incantations.

Silent Spell-casting

Silent spell-casting or Incantation-less spell-casting involves the caster manipulating mana itself in order to produce the desired effect. This method, unlike incantation and magic circles, does not require preparation for invocation as the caster only needs strong imaginative power to mold mana to their will.

It follows a process the caster calculates in their mind: First, the caster calls forth the shape of the spell they wish to use. Next, there is a window of time where they can add additional magical power to impact its size. Third, the velocity of the spell with which it will travel is adjusted. Finally, the caster releases the finished spell from their hand.

Silent spell-casting is a particularly unorthodox method of performing magic for almost no mages are able to completely skip the incantation. Since the process is convoluted and relies heavily on the caster's understanding of the spell, until the birth of Rudeus Greyrat, this method of spell-casting is not formally taught anywhere. However
Roxy M. Greyrat
 wrote a paper detailing the specifics of voiceless magic and began to introduce silence spell casting into standard magic curriculum, which helped give rise to many prominent mages.

Types

Main Category:

Attacking Magic

Attacking Magic
 (
攻撃魔術
,

Kōgeki majutsu
)
 is comprised of spells that manipulate mana into tangible elements. The power, speed, effective range, and area of these spells are dependent on the amount of mana poured into them.

It is divided into four schools:

Fire
: Generate fire/heat.

Water
: Generates water and in extension, ice and steam (melded with fire magic).

Wind
: Manipulates gases.

Earth
: Generates earth, Manipulates earth and minerals.

Healing Magic

Healing Magic
 (
治癒魔術
,

Chiyu majutsu
)
 mainly comprises of spells used for healing injuries and removing toxins.

It is further divided into four schools:

Healing
: Magic for healing injuries.

Detoxification
: Magic for purging poisons and disease.

Divine Strike
: Magic used against incorporeal monsters and demons.

Protection
: Magic for increasing one's defenses and create barriers (distorts mana in a finite space. Effects include nullifying magic activation and altering magic regeneration rate).

Summoning Magic

Summoning Magic
 (
召喚魔術
,

Shōkan majutsu
)
 is used to call forth powerful beings to carry out the summoners's bidding.

It has two types of summons:

Fiends
: A class of beast that have intellect.

Spirits
: An intelligent being called forth to reside in an artificial body, has been stated by Rudeus to be much akin to Mana Programming.

Special Category:

Inherent Magic

Inherent Magic
 (
固有魔術
,

Koyū majutsu
)
, is a magic of race secret with a special activation method.

Howling (Originally dubbed "voice magic" by
Rudeus
)

Teleport

Gravity Manipulation

Time Travel

Hypnosis

Magic Disruption (Ran Ma)

Reincarnation

Divination

Temporary Soul Summoning (Used only by
Hitogami
)

Magic Rank Title

Rank

Title

Scale

1

Beginner / Elementary

Basic mana manipulation.

2

Intermediate

Advanced mana manipulation.

3

Advanced

Complex mana manipulation. Generally large area of effect.

4

Saintly / Holy

Large scale complex mana manipulation. Usually spells that affects the weather.

5

Kingly

Builds upon Saint-class Magic by increasing its effectiveness.

6

Imperial / Emperor

Further enhances the scale of King-class Magic

7

Divine / God

Continental scale magic.

Spell rankings are typically proportionate to the amount of mana necessary to cast the spell. There are exceptions however, such as with
Badigadi
 and
Orsted
, Rudeus's magic is considered to be of a higher rank despite using lower ranked magic as the base.

It has been stated that only 1 in 20 people is born with the capacity of using mana and of those, only 1 in 20 is capable of learning how to master it and becoming a mage. However, only 1 in a 100 of those is actually capable of becoming an advanced magician in only 1 element.

The magician's ranking title is determined by the most advanced spell they could cast.

Diseases

Since the Human-Demon Wars, there are also several magic related diseases that are known to exist and in time the denizens of the Human World became immune to it or a way to treat them has been discovered.

Magic Stone Disease

Magic Stone Disease is an extremely rare magical virus that turns that kills its host by gradually turning it to a purple magic stone starting from their feet and eventual death upon reaching half of their body at the very least.

Drain Syndrome

Drain Syndrome is a magical illness first found in Humans from the early ages into the Laplace Wars that affects a child born with out any magic capacity who absorbs magic externally and after accumulating it for 10 years, they will fall ill and die.

Known Advanced Magic Users Important to the Story

Rudeus Greyrat

Sylphiette

Roxy

Orsted

Cliff

List of Known Voiceless Magicians

Rudeus Greyrat

Sylphiette

Juliette

Orsted

Sieghart

Trivia

The number of magicians capable of using shortened or silent spell-casting are very few because the method was previously unknown.
Roxy
,
Rudeus
,
Sylphy
 and
Moore
 were the few individuals capable of using the silent spell-casting method before it was popularized by Rudeus.

It is stated by
Future Rudeus
 that, "Magic in this world is omnipotent. Once you realize that, you can essentially do anything."

Many attack magics function by converting mana into physical substances. It appears that the materials manifested take a while to stabilize, as evidenced by the fact that projectiles from attack magic can be disintegrated by using manatite stone, but figurines created by Rudeus aren't affected
.

Magic Circles of the Sixth Stratum
==================================

This article is about the Season 2 Episode 21 Anime. For the Chapter 106 of the Manga, see
Magic Circles of the Sixth Floor
.

Magic Circles of the Sixth Stratum
 (第六階層の魔法陣)
Dai Roku Kaisō no Mahō-jin
) is the Twenty-first episode of the
second season
 (45th overall)
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on June 2, 2024 and also the third episode of the
Labyrinth Arc
 for the Anime.

Synopsis

Rudeus
,
Paul
 and the other members of the
Fangs of the Black Wolf
 party successfully rescues Roxy, who somehow survives alone in the Teleportation Labyrinth for a whole month so they decide to return to the city of Rapan for Roxy to recover. Although he was concerned about Roxy's occasional aloofness, Rudeus enjoyed reminiscing about the past. Three days later, they once again enter the Teleportation Labyrinth and at an increased progress in conquering each of the floors!

Plot

At the Third Floor of the Teleportation Labyrinth, Roxy continue finding an exit while marking the walls of the path she walked as she battles or avoids the
Tarantula Deathlords
 she encounters. After stepping into a Teleportation
Magic Circle
, Roxy ends up at the same place that already has multiple markings. Despite being exhausted she still wants to pursue her dreams of being a teacher and to have a family like her
father

mother
. Still considering that death is imminent, Roxy steps in the Teleportation Magic Circle once again.

After using
Frost Nova
 on the monsters that cornered Roxy, Rudeus is relieved then embraces a surprised Roxy and breathes in her scent. She pushes him back since she smells but Rudeus doesn't mind. Roxy then thanks him and introduces herself, causing Rudeus to drop his
staff
 and throw up in shock.

The party decides to head back to Rapan for Roxy to recover where Talhand carries Roxy on his back while Rudeus follows behind her reminiscing how Roxy has not after not seeing her for over
10 years
. After Rudeus explains why he threw up, Roxy explains that she did not recognize the Rudeus she knew back then to the Rudeus she sees now which relieves Rudeus but also realizes that
Sylphiette
 must have been shocked as well that he does not recognize her in their
reunion
 and plans to apologize to her when he returns.

At the inn, Lilia, Shierra, and Vierra welcome the party back, and are relieved that Roxy has returned. Rudeus later sneaks up on Roxy's room who is still asleep to check on her.

Days later, Roxy apologizes for the trouble she caused, but Paul tells her not to be bothered by it and then tells her to thank Rudeus for breaking through the walls and saving her in time. Rudeus accepts Roxy's thanks but also asks him to call him "Rudy" like she used to as he still considers her to be his master. Geese then discusses his plan to enter the Teleportation Labyrinth in 3 days so Roxy would not be affected by a curse that will prevent her from entering the labyrinth but Rudeus thinks at that it is his original world's version of trauma. Paul then gives Roxy the
"An Exploratory Account of the Teleportation Labyrinth" book
 to study and the meeting concludes for the preparation of their next attempt.

As Roxy is reading the book, Rudeus is restless and moves around causing Roxy to call him that he is distracting her but asks him to explain to which Rudeus quickly agrees. As they read through the book, Rudeus notices that Roxy seems tense but concludes that she might be conscious of how tall he has become.

Back at the Third Floor of the Teleportation Labyrinth the party now with Roxy included, they battle through the hordes of
Iron Crawlers
, Deathlord Tarantulas and
Mad Skulls
 but Rudeus notices that Roxy seems to be looking at him then looks away then the latter calls to take a break as she is out of
Mana
.

As the party is taking a break, Geese continues studying the book while trying to figure out where the Teleportation Magic Circle to the fourth floor is located. After Roxy leans on Rudeus' back to rest, she also asks that they explore a Labyrinth together sometime in the future that Rudeus immediately agrees as Roxy goes to sleep.

The party then enters the Fourth Floor that looks more like a ruin than an ant nest where Paul confirms their plan with Geese to explore the floor for a bit before returning to Rapan. As Rudeus internally complements Paul to be reliable but Paul alerts him that a pair of
Armored Warriors
 are approaching. Rudeus declares he will use
Stone Cannon
 on them but Roxy stops him since they can use
Water God Style
 to counter his spells and suggests to provide support for now. After Rudeus tells them he will use
Quagmire
, Elinalise tells Paul which target to attack as the enemies sink due to Rudeus' Quagmire. As Paul and Elinalise engage the warriors, Roxy to coordinate their magic where she uses
Icicle Edge
 then Rudeus uses Stone Cannon that defeats the Armored Warrior battling Elinalise while Paul finishes off the other. Rudeus complements Paul who seems to be stronger but the latter dismisses it and urges everyone to move forward while passing Elinalise who chuckles at how Paul looks very happy for being praised by his son.

The party leaves the Teleportation Labyrinth and upon reaching the outside, they discuss what supplies they need for to deal with the armored enemies while Rudeus is wondering if Zenith will be okay with the pace they are going but notices Roxy looks at him but immediately looks away.

At Rapan, Rudeus and Roxy are together where they purchase the talfro root while discussing what other supplies they will need. Rudeus then tests out a sword that when he thrusts it, a shockwave is produced to knock back its target that Roxy mentions it will be perfect for Elinalise but they cannot afford it.

At the Pub, Roxy details her journey that shocks Rudeus that they
missed each other
 when they were at
Wind Port
 and Rudeus is glad that she was searching for his
family
. Roxy then tells her past on her time in
Ranoa Magic Academy
 then she was hired by Paul and she has changed because of her time in
Buena Village
 and affirms that they will rescue
Zenith
.

Next day, back at the Fourth Floor, Elinalise tests out her newly purchased
Gladius
 and is satisfied with its performance after cleanly cutting through an Armored Warrior. Having easily progressed through the Fourth Floor, Geese has already charted a map for the fourth floor and confirmed that the room they are on should have the Teleportation Magic Circle to the fifth floor and the party move forward.

At the Fifth Floor, Geese burns a talfro root like incense where its smoke causes the
Devouring Devils
 to run away and Geese is pleased by its potency and accuracy of the book, prompting Paul to decide not to return to Rapan and continue exploring.

At the Sixth Floor, the party is on alert since can sense the
Guardian
 is nearby. Geese is scouting the final room that has three Teleportation Magic Circles and mentions that this is as far the author of the book have reached so Rudeus volunteers to analyze the Magic Circles. Roxy questions if he has figured it out, but Rudeus has not yet. He mentions that
Nanahoshi Shizuka
 might be able to solve it. Roxy then asks if she is his girlfriend, which Rudeus denies, much to Roxy's relief. Rudeus then details his findings that one of the circles is a trap that leaves one of the remaining two will teleport them to the seventh floor as the party concludes that its like a coin flip chance to get there. When asked, Geese details that the party always fails at coin flips unless
Ghislaine Dedoldia
, who is currently at the
Holy Land of Swords
 makes the choice. This Rudeus volunteers to conduct further investigations before they decide.

At a glance, the room looks special but Rudeus believes that the floor doesn't end here. Paul disagrees, with nothing to base it on, but still encourages Rudeus to take his time. Paul then grabs Rudeus' shoulder, planning to tell him something, but after glancing at Roxy, he decides to tell Rudeus after they return to the inn. Rudeus presses Paul, but he still refuses, concerned it might hurt the party's morale. Instead, Paul tells him the different functions of his
two

swords
 that he cannot use only one due to their different roles. As Paul returns to the rest of the party, Rudeus realizes that the room is similar to the room from the ruins that he and Elinalise entered that has the
Teleportation Magic Circle
 to Begaritt Continent.

Rudeus then asks Geese to check if there are any hidden stairs and while initially in doubt, Geese also realizes that it is possible and begins to investigate. Geese brings out his short sword and begins tapping the floor with its pommel while his ear is on the ground and finds a hollow floor. After Geese confirms there are no traps, Rudeus destroys the said hollow floor with Stone Cannon, and the stairs are uncovered. Geese announces the finding, and the party rises to their feet in astonishment and amazement. They take turns slapping Rudeus' back in praise, while Elinalise remarks that the room is indeed the same as the ruins they entered before. Roxy also follows suit with a lighter tap. After Geese scouts the stairs, the party descends together, approaching the Teleportation Magic Circle, which is glowing in deep blood red.

Adaptation Notes

Light Novel Volume 12

Chapter 4: Her Emotional Perspective

Chapter 5: The Indomitable Magician

Chapter 6: Easy as Pie

Chapter 7: The Magic Circles on the Sixth Floor

Differences with the Light Novel:

The event where Roxy narrates her dream to have a husband occurs after Rudeus rescues her while in the Light Novel, it occurs before being rescued

New event where Rudeus and Roxy are shopping at Rapan and sees the Gladius that Elinalise will purchase has been added

New event where Rudeus and Roxy are at a pub drinking has been added while in the Light Novel, they are drinking together with Talhand for a supposed meeting of
Magicians

The event where Rudeus' party destroys the eggs of the Devouring Devils has been cut

Magic Circles of the Sixth Stratum/Gallery

. Please add to the contents of this page, but only images that
pertain
 to the article.

Parents

Magic Spells
============

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

This article is about a list of known Magic Spells and Spell Incantations. For the concept, go to:
Magic

Magic Spells
 (
詠唱
,

Eishō
, alt. "Incantations")
 are the various supernatural effects created by the art of Magic by utilizing
Mana
 residing inside a body. Magic Spells are divided into three categories, namely: Attack, Healing, and Summoning magic. Attack Magic has largest number of spells while Summoning has the least.

Melded Magic are a high-tier category where the spells are a composite of at least two or more Attack spells. Mastery of this type of spells require at least Advanced level proficiency at one school of Attack magic.

Special Magic are those type of spells which do not fit into the three main categories. This type of spell cannot be taught normally to a mage and its mastery is generally unique to a handful of persons.

Attack Magic

Water

Name

Rank

Effect

Image/s

Waterball
水弾

Elementary

Materializes and hurls a mass of water.

Roxy's Water Ball.
Rudeus' Voiceless Water Ball.
Sylph's Voiceless Water Ball.
1/3

Water Shield
水盾

Elementary

Creates a spout of water from the ground forming a defensive wall.
 Water Shield can also protect its caster against a Red Dragon
 or
Manatite Hydra
's Fire Breath
 if enough Mana is used to create a huge wall of water.

Rudeus casting Water Shield against a Manatite Hydra Fire Breath
Rudeus casting Water Shield against Crimson Dragon in the Anime
1/2

Water Arrow
水矢

Elementary

Launches a bolt of water, roughly twenty centimeters long, at a target.

Ice Smash
氷撃

Elementary

Strikes an opponent with a mound of ice.





Elinalise using Ice Smash in the Anime

氷刃

Elementary

Creates a sword made out of ice.

水蒸

Materialize enormous amount of water droplets and bombard the area that soaks anyone in the area, making them vulnerable to being frozen.

Flood Flush
水流

Flood the ground with water.
 In the Teleportation Labyrinth, Roxy also uses Flood Flush to prevent the Manatite Hydra from attacking Paul and Elinalise and wash them away from the hydra's range.






Roxy using Flood Flush in the Anime



Icicle Field
氷結領域

Freezes all objects in its area of effect and is more effective against wet targets.






Roxy using Icicle Field in the Anime

氷霜撃

Launches a barrage ice bolts to a target.

氷槍

Mana

Materializes an earth bullet that travels to a target and explodes causing a cloud of sand to appear in its area that causes difficulty in breathing and reduces visibilty. Inhaling the cloud also disrupts the use of abilities.

Rudeus using Sand Cloud against Pursena in the Anime

岩砲弾

Intermediate

Materializes and launches a piece of bullet shaped rock in high speed. Stone Cannon is one of Rudeus' signature spells that when he set the projectile hardness, spinning speed, and travel speed at maximum, it is able to break through even Orsted
 and
Badigadi
's
 Battle Aura.

Melded Magic

Name

Composites

Effect

Image/s

Deep Mist
濃霧

Waterfall + Heat Island + Icicle Field

Generate fog over an area to conceal the user from enemies.
 Deep Mists uses Waterfall and Icicle Field to conjure water and immediately freeze them but this process can be skipped in snowy terrains and use Heat Island to generate a fog.






Rudeus using Deep Mist in the Anime.



Magma Gush
溶岩

Fire spell + Earth spell

Creates spontaneous burst of lava.

Quagmire
泥沼

Water spell + Earth spell

Turns the ground into a muddy swamp that immobilizes the enemy.
 Due to Rudeus' primarily using this in his adventures, he became known as "Quagmire".

Rudeus using Quagmire on Grizzlies
Rudeus using Quagmire against Paul
1/2

Bora Blast
寒冷突風

Icicle Field + Blast

Release a strong gust of freezing wind to disable the enemy.

Frost Nova
フロストノヴァ

Water Splash + Icicle Field

Soaks the enemies with water droplets and freezes them over. The more Mana is used, those affected can be frozen even deep within their core.






Roxy seeing Rudeus' variant of Frost Nova that freezes into the core



Mud Rain
泥雨

Water spell + Earth spell

Create rain that contains mud causing the ground to be slippery and loose.

Blast
突風

Fire spell + Wind spell

By using fire and wind magic simultaneously.  It shoots a blast of hot wind.

Barrier

Name

Rank

Effect

Image/s

Magic Shield
魔力障壁

Elementary

Conjures a semi-transparent barrier that blocks magical attack. It has the power to isolate flames or cold and reduce their effect. As an elementary level spell, it can also be cast via incantations,

Physical Shield
物理障壁

Intermediate

Conjures a barrier that blocks physical attack
 and impedes passage on the area it is cast.






Rudeus knocked back by a barrier in the Anime



Spirit-Sealing Barrier

Saint

The barrier that's able to prevent undead monsters from leaving a confined space. It might not able to fully confine a high level wraith.

Confinement Barrier

King

The barrier that confines the target individual within it. Magic is rendered unusable inside, and it is highly resistant against physical and magical attacks from the outside.






Confinement Barrier in the Anime.



Badigadi's Sealing Barrier

Divine

The barrier developed by Perugius to seal the
Demon God
. It is powered by
Badigadi
's mana and amplified by the King Dragon Sword Kajakut and the Fighting God Armor,  It divided Badigadi's flesh into five parts and sealed in separate locations, whereas the barrier confining Badigadi's main body cannot be released without releasing the remaining parts.

Illusion Barrier

Unknown

Illusion Barrier is used by the
Dragon Tribe
 to protect the Teleportation Circle Ruins through out the Human World from outsiders by concealing its entrance with an illusion to erect another scenery and blends with its surroundings. Like most barriers, it uses a medium to maintain its effect like a monument bearing the emblem of Saint Dragon General
Szilard
 found in Lumen Forest near
Sharia
. To release the Illusion Barrier, Mana must be poured on the tablet by putting your hand on the tablet and reciting the incantation that is only known by the Dragon Tribe members and
Nanahoshi Shizuka
 and is a closely guarded secret since Teleportation Magic is forbidden.






Rudeus unsealing an Illusion Barrier in the Anime



Summoning Magic

Name

Users

Effect

Image/s

Dragon Gate
龍門

Orsted
,

Perugius Dola

Summons a gate engraved with an ornate dragon statue that is either colored silver to absorb magic power
 or colored gold which absorbs
Battle Aura
.
 Dragon Gate was developed by Dark Dragon King
Maxwell
 during the
Six-Faced World
 era as a method to weaken demonic power at the height of the war between the
Dragon World
 and Demon World.

Orsted summoning Dragon Gate in the Anime.
Dragon Gate cracking after absorbing Nuclear Explosion.
Orsted summoning Dragon Gate in the Manga.
Dragon Gate, absorbing Rudeus' magic power.
1/4

Monster Summon
魔獣召喚

Orsted
,

Perugius Dola
,

Rudeus Greyrat

Summons an existing creature in the world using magic circles. The magic is bound by covenant upon founding that prohibits summon of intelligent humanoid races. It is possible to specify conditions when performing the summon, but summoning creatures that has more mana than the summoner is difficult and has the risk of the creature losing control.






Rudeus summoning Leo



Spirit Summon
精霊召喚

Perugius Dola
,

Rudeus Greyrat

Creates a spirit out of user's mana that functions according to the user's design, similar to computer programming. The summoned spirit would cease to exist upon mana depletion under normal circumstances, but it is possible to summon highly intelligent and powerful spirits that could last for hundreds of years using secret arts developed by Armored Dragon King
Dora
.

Otherworld Summon
異世界召喚

Nanahoshi Shizuka

Summons an object or organism from another world (earth in particular). It is only achievable by using highly complex multi-layered magic circle.
 The more complex the intended summoning subject is, the larger and more complicated the magic circle becomes.






A successfully summoned watermelon.



Summon Lamplight Spirits

Nanahoshi Shizuka
,
Rudeus Greyrat
,
Perugius Dola

Summon radiant spirits that fly up and circle around the caster to provide light in dark areas. The light from the spirits is brighter than a torch which removes the reliance for them that is also a hindrance since one of your hands is sealed off by holding a torch. The spell also works even with little magic power applied to it that it lasts a long time even when used by
Paul Greyrat
 or
Geese Nukadia
 making it seem like the consumed magic power is almost nothing. Nanahoshi gives Rudeus a Summon Light Spirit scroll which he uses on the
Teleport Labyrinth
 and later starts drawing new magic circles for the spell when their stocks run out.

Lamplight Spirits following its caster in the Anime
Nanahoshi casting Summon Light Spirits in the Anime PV
Summoning Circle for Lamplight Spirits in the Anime

Unique / Unclassified Magic

Disturb Magic
乱魔

Orsted
,

Rudeus Greyrat
,
Sylphiette

Disturb Magic cancels the magic of an opponent by disrupting the magic and causing it to never take shape and scatter. Disturb Magic only targets one part of the body which is seen on Orsted's first battle against Rudeus where Disturb Magic seals the magic on Rudeus' right hand but he is able to use magic with his left hand.
 Rudeus and Sylphiette also practices Disturb Magic by the former struggling to maintain the spell and the latter tries to disrupt it.

Rudeus Greyrat

声の魔術

Gyes Dedoldia

, Rudeus Greyrat

Orsted

Beast race's unique magic that stuns the opponent with a magic-infused howl.
 Other races could use it too, but would be much less effective.






Gyes using Howling in the Anime.



Teleportation Magic
転移魔術

Orsted
,
Rudeus Greyrat
,
Perugius Dola
 etc.

Allows the user to travel to corresponding sites almost instantaneously using magic circles. There are three types of them: bi-directional, single-directional, and random teleportation circles.

Electric
電撃

Rudeus Greyrat

Miniaturized version of Lightning that shocks and paralyzes opponents with electricity.
 Since electricity affects nervous system directly, it is capable of bypassing the target's
Battle Aura
 defense.






Rudeus casting Electric



Time Travel Magic
過去転移魔術

Future Rudeus

A special magic developed from Teleportation Magic that allows the user to warp to the past, using a certain object as a marker. It consumes an enormous amount of mana to travel back for even a short period of time. When the user's mana is insufficient, he might end up leaving certain body parts behind.






Future Rudeus travelled back in time.



Gravity Magic
重力魔術

Future Rudeus
,
Kalman III

Magic that manipulates gravity, enabling the users to fly or levitate objects.

Hypnosis Magic
催眠魔術

Orsted

A hypnosis magic passed down among the Nuka Tribe that put a person to sleep.

Incantations

The usual length of a magic's Incantation is the higher the rank, the longer the Incantation is. For example, an Elementary Rank Water Magic Incantation has only a few sentences while a God Rank Detoxification Spell can be long enough to be in a book as thick as a dictionary.

Name

Chant

Healing

"Divine power is rich and nourishing. It offers the strength to rise again to those who have lost their strength. Healing."

Water Ball

"Let the great protection of water be on the place thou seekest. I call a refreshing burbling stream here and now. Water Ball."

Water Cannon

"Supple spirit of water and princess of streams that flow through the earth, sweep away all things with your hidden inner might."

X-Healing

"Oh merciful mother of gods, please heal this one's wounds, and let him recover with a healthy body. X-Healing."

Detoxification

"May the cleansing light of the skies wash over this body, so that the darkness from within may be expelled. Detoxification."

Exorcist Rate

"Then our God gives grace to the Mother Earth! I do it against the law of nature, and give the foolish person Heaven's vengeance! Exorcist Rate."

Fireball

"Let the great protection of fire be on the place thou seekest. I call the bold heat of a torch here and now. Fireball!"

Cumulonimbus

"Grand spirit of water and imperial prince of lightning who ascends the heavens, grant my wish and bring about a savage blessing. Display your might to insignificant beings. Strike awe with a blow of your divine hammer on the anvil, and cover the land in water! Ah, Rain! Sweep all else away and expel everything! Cumulonimbus!"

Exodus Flame

"Raging spirit of flame, bastard of hell! Rise to the land of man and swing your fist! Strike down my sworn foe and consume them within darkness! Exodus Flame!"

Dragon Gate

"That dragon lives solely while following the path of chivalry. The nails on his hands are long and sharp, for he never raises a fist. The second dragon clenches his fist in anger. His nails broken, his teeth fell, but the feeling has been conveyed. He held chivalry in his hand, yet did he abandon chivalry? The third dragon that died. He who possessed the most ephemeral eyes Dragon General of Lustrous Green Scales. By the name of Armored Dragon King Perugius, I summon --"

Let fear strike the heart of man as thy divine hammer strikes its anvil and over the land with water! Come, o rain and was everything away in thy flood of destruction!
I call upon you, mighty spirit of light, shining lord of the heavens! Do you see the impudent foe towering before us? Do you see your sown enemy, in all his arrogance? I would be the holy blade that strikes him down! Let your radiant power teach him that the Emperor yet reign supreme! Lightning!"
