Trivia

Cumulonimbus' name is taken from the cloud types Cumulus (fluffy cotton like clouds) and Nimbus (dark rain clouds)

The chant for Dragon Gate and Illusion Barrier references Saint Dragon General Szilard who has green and silver scales and is the second Dragon General to die while describing his injury after battling the
First Dragon God
.

References

Magic Stone Disease
===================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Magic Stone Disease
, also known as
Petrification Syndrome
, is an extremely rare
Magic
 disease that turns the body of the infected into magic stone.

Background

Magic Stone Disease is known to exist in the
Human World
 since the Human-Demon Wars or earlier, when
Kishirika Kishirisu
 was ruling as the Demon Empress. She has knowledge of this disease, that is also passed to those who are given her
Identification Eyes
 in recent times
.

Cause

"I have no idea where the rat came from or when it got down there. Most likely, it sneaked into my luggage from the
Demon Continent
 or while I was in
Perugius
' floating fortress. It doesn't really matter where it came from, though."

-Future Rudeus

Rats are the main carriers of Magic Stone Disease because some of them have resistance to it but will eventually die eventually. These infected rats can be identified easily by their teeth that turns into violet crystal. Humans or other animals could also be infected by consuming the contaminated food eaten by these rats.

Infection

The pathogen of Magic Stone Disease is not airborne and infects orally, but it doesn't persist for very long and it disappears around a day, resulting in a very low infection rate. Moreover, it only infects pregnant women. When infected, the pathogen grows inside the fetus and proceeds to remold it into magic stone, which results in the death of the growing baby. At this point the mother also begins to exhibit symptoms of the disease, such as having fever and becoming bedridden. Finally, the body of the mother would start turning into magic stone (beginning from her feet), and she would also die in a few weeks if left untreated
.

Treatment

Magic Stone Disease is only curable by God Rank Detoxification Magic. The only book for the chant of God Rank Detoxification Magic belongs to the
Milis Religion
 in
Millishion
, where they have exclusive rights to it and is only made available for archbishop rank or above. Transcribing the book takes time since it is as thick as a dictionary, whereas stealing it would result in the perpetrators being labelled as the worst criminals by the Milis Religion and hunted down for life by Millishion's Holy Knight Orders
.

History

"The fact that after changing history this way, in the end a favorable future for him awaits... Thus I will make you change history, to a future that will be favorable to me."

-Orsted to Rudeus

Hitogami
 plotted to kill future
Roxy Migurdia
 and her unborn
child
 through the rat infected with Magic Stone Disease. Since pregnancy weakens those who have a strong
Fate
 that Hitogami cannot manipulate easily otherwise.

Cliff Grimoire
 identifies the disease and together with
Zanoba Shirone
, Rudeus infiltrates the Millis Church and steals the book of God Rank Detoxification Magic in hopes to cure Roxy.

Being hunted by the Holy Knights Order of Millishion resulting in the death of Cliff and Roxy still dies in the end, resulting to Hitogami's plan to succeed.
 .

30 years later,
Future Rudeus
 realized how Hitogami used the Magic Stone Disease to kill Roxy and travelled back in
time
 to warn his
younger self
.

Future Rudeus died after talking with Rudeus, who later went to the basement and killed the rat before it could infect the food Roxy will eat, and later sent its remains to the
Magician Guild
 for study
.

Hitogami confronted Rudeus in his dreams for the failed plan to kill Roxy, but agreed to a compromise if Rudeus kills
Orsted
.

Rudeus was defeated by Orsted and became his subordinate against Hitogami, while Orsted agreed to protect his family to ensure Hitogami is prevented from targeting Rudeus'
Family
.

References

Magic Tools
===========

Redirect to:
Magic Tools and Magic Items

Magic Tools and Magic Items
===========================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!





Magic Tools and Magic Items in the Manga



Magic Tools
 (
魔道具
,

Ma Dōgu
)
 are specially crafted equipment that feature a carved magic circle. When a user channels their mana through the tool and recites an incantation, the magic circle activates, unleashing the desired magical effect. As long as the user has remaining
Mana
, the magic tool can be used repeatedly
.
Magic Items
 (
魔力付与品
,

Maryoku Fuyo-hin
)
, on the other hand, are objects infused with mana that possess unique and specific abilities. By performing a specific action or trigger, the user can activate the item's magical effect. Magic Items have a limited number of uses per day, but their mana reserves naturally replenish over time
.

Aside from the direct use of
Magic
, Magic Tools and Magic Items are developed and manufactured by the Magician Guild in
Sharia
 to aid people in adventures or even their everyday life.

List of Magic Tools

Devil Spear





Devil Spears in the Manga



A Trident weapon made by
Laplace
 as a gift for the Superd race, have a high resemblance with the Superd spear excluding his jet black color, this magic tool amplified their bearers’ physical capabilities several times over, nullified the effects of the humans’ magic, and heightened the Superds’ already sharp senses even further, but slowly erodes the mind of his user.

Owner:
Superd Tribe
,
Ruijerd

Lithograph Stone

Based off of the seven powers stone created by Technique God, Orsted created a stone that would allow long range communication through writing on the Large Stone. Anything written on the main stone will appear on the sub-stones. Having a main and a sub-stone for the other person's main stone, will allow for long range communication.

Owners:
Orsted
,
Ariel

Enchanted Shoes

Shoes that allow the user to run at twice its normal speed.

Owners:
Fitz
,
Luke

Flame Trapping Cloak

A cloak that helps the user maintain a constant body temperature.

Owners:
Fitz
,
Luke

Gloves of Overpowering

Gloves that reduce any impact to the palm of the wearer's hand by half.

Owners:
Fitz
,
Luke

Magical Sunglasses

A pair of sunglasses that aids in the detection of enemies.

Owners:
Fitz

Steel-Cutting Sword

A sword that can easily tear straight through steel.

Owners:
Luke
,
Paul

Snow Melting Furnace

Rudeus pouring mana in to the Snow Melting Furnace in the Anime
A Snow Melting Furnace in the Manga
1/2

Snow Melting Furnaces are seen at the cities of the Magic Triumvirate in the Northern
Central Continent
 and are used during the winter. During snowy days, the citizen's daily activities are at a halt so the city posts a job request open to all citizens or
Adventurers
 regardless of rank to gather snow around the city and bring them to the entrance of a park sized plaza where the furnace is located. The snow is then piled up to form a huge donut shape hill surrounding the furnace where a magician pours
Mana
 to the furnace which activates the
Magic Circle
 around the furnace that heats then melts the snow gathered. The more mana is poured to the device, the more snow it melts.
 In the Anime, the Furnace is portrayed as a tower where Rudeus places his hands on a tablet to activate it.

Owners: Magic Triumvirate

Magic Armor

An expansion of the 『Zariff's arm』 system, it is a magic armor that boosts the wearer's physical capabilities in much of the same way as the Fighting God's Golden Armor. Rudeus had Zanoba and Cliff work on the armor and was given details about the Fighting God's golden armor by Hitogami. The next versions of the armor are black and smaller to reduce mana consumption.

Owner:
Rudeus
.

Magic Armor Mk Zero

The Prototype of the MK I, even though it is a prototype, this armor has even more power that the MK I, but has a worst magic efficiency out of all the magic armors, lasting even less time that MK I, even with Rudeus's Mana.

Owners:
Rudeus
.

Magic Armor Mk I

First version of the MK series, is a armor of 3 meters that was painted in camouflage and extremely bulky, having a godly combat capability equaling the Fighting God's Golden Armor. The downside of 『Magic Armor Mk I 』 is that consume a huge amount of magic. Because that only Rudeus can use this armor.

Owners:
Rudeus
.

Magic Armor Mk II

It was a complete set that could be separated into arm parts, leg parts, and torso part. It was a jet-black armor and helmet. A tuned-up version of the 『MK. I』.  If worn, it could provide physical ability similar to that of a Saint Ranked swordsman. Eventually Roxy would create a tool that was mounted on the back of the 『MK. lI』. She named it the『Scroll Vernier』. It has a bulky steampunk look to it that carries folded scrolls ready for activation. If a button near the waist is pressed with magic power, a corresponding slot with a scroll is automatically activated. There are 5 slots by each hand with a total of 10 types of scrolls.

Owner:
Rudeus
.

Magic Armor Mk III

Due to Cliff moving to Milis, Roxy has joined Zanoba in the development of the 『Magic Armor Mk III. The Magic Armor used by Rudeus during his last years. Its height was a little more than 2 metres and its ability was the same as the 『MK. I』. This  Magic Armor became the basis  for the mass-production of the All-Purpose Magic Armor Series later on.

Owners:
Rudeus
,
Lara Greyrat

Magic Wand

The wands are use to channel magic more easy, increasing the efficiency of the magic casted, his rank is determined by the wood and the Magic rock.


Arrogant Water Dragon King (Aqua Heartia)


An A-Rank wand personally made for Rudeus, this wand is made from a rough and bony wood that comes from a Elder Treant. The tip of the staff is adorned with a large Magical stone that is the size of a fist that comes from a stray dragon located in the Begaliid's continent. This staff greatly improves the efficiency of Water Magic, and to a lesser extent the efficiency of Earth, Wind and Fire magic.

Owners:
Rudeus
,
Lara Greyrat

Stone Cannon Gatling Gun

A weapon that Rudeus had Roxy and her friend Jacqueline who’s a specialist in the creation of Magic Items in Sharia. After taking Hitogami's suggestion to create a magic tool that shoots magic that only Rudeus can handle, for the fight against Orsted. This weapon is able to fire off 10 of his standard 『Stone Cannon』 per second. Rudeus only uses this weapon in conjunction when wearing the 『Magic Armor Mk I 』.

Owners:
Rudeus

Shotgun Cannon

A weapon that Rudeus develop after taking Orsted suggestion about the Gatling gun to make it fire multiple stone cannon in one shot to counter Water God Style practitioner. Rudeus stated that this weapon is a very user friendly weapon.

Owners:
Rudeus
,
Lara Greyrat

 Zariff's Prosthetic Arm

From Zanoba's research of the doll left by the previous owner of Rudeus' house, Zanoba with the help of Cliff were able to create an artificial prosthetic arm. With the chant, "『Oh Earth, become thine Arm.』", the magic tool can be activated, and can be deactivated with the chant 『Oh Arm, return to Earth』. It can also allow the wearer to feel tactile feedback from the fingers. Later, Rudeus with the help of Zanoba and Cliff, they made a second version where the arm can also fly out as a Rocket Punch.

Owners:
Rudeus
.

The Scroll Vernier






Character design of Rudeus latest equipment. The Scroll Vernier in the Mushoku Tensei light novel



The second Roxy made machine. A tool that was mounted on the back of the『Magic Armor MK. lI』. It has a bulky steampunk look to it that carries folded scrolls ready for activation.

If a button near the waist is pressed with magic power, a corresponding slot with a scroll is automatically activated. There are 5 slots by each hand with a total of 10 types of scrolls.

This steampunk-inspired device, mounted gracefully on the back of Rudeus' 『Magic Armor MK. lI』 , exemplifies both style and practicality.

The Scroll Vernier offers Rudeus a wealth of strategic possibilities. By harnessing magic power and activating the waist-mounted button, Rudeus can swiftly access a specific scroll housed within the corresponding slot.

The Scroll Vernier's true strength lies in its adaptability, accommodating a diverse range of scrolls that cater to various combat scenarios, Rudeus can seamlessly harness offensive, defensive, and support magic with remarkable ease.

Owner:
Rudeus
,
Lara Greyrat

 Curse Supressing Tools






Curse Supressing Tool prototype for Elinalise in the Anime



The Curse Suppressing Tool takes the form of panties that is made by Cliff for Elinalise to supress the
Curse of Promiscuity
 on her but it it has two problems: 1. The ugly appearance but Cliff mentions he is able to make a better looking tool with the help of Nanahoshi and Zanoba; 2. The tool requires a huge amount of Mana to which Rudeus agrees to provide.

Rudeus hold the Curse Suppressing Helmet in the Light Novel
Rifujin na Magonote
 wearing a Curse Suppressing Helmet
1/2

Cliff also created a Curse Suppressing Helmet for Orsted to suppress the
curse
 that causes all denizens of the
Human World
 to fear and hate him.

Owners:
Elinalise Dragonroad
,
Cliff Grimoire
,
Orsted

Magic Tower






Millishion's Magic Towers in the Anime



Millishion has erected 7 Magic Towers that forms a circle around the city which prevent floods from occurring by keeping the water of the lake at a fixed level which was a problem in the city until the towers were built especially during the rainy season. The Magic Tool is not comprised of the whole tower but it is inside while the tower is used to protect the Magic Tool that controls the flooding and for further protection, a large scale Barrier Magic is used on the tower.

Owners:
Millishion

,

Sara using her Magic Earring

List of Magic Potions

Mana Recovery Therapy (Magic Potion)

Five years after the final battle with Geese. Rudeus has been researching mana recovery to improve Orsted’s mana recovery rate. Eventually, he produced a potion that restored mana, but for some reason, Orsted’s mana didn’t recover.

Possibly because of the difference in the quality of mana between the human race and dragon race or an entirely different reason.

The potion itself was quite popular among the adventurers so their true intentions weren't completely in vain.

The mana potion became such a great success that the era of swordsmen being the strongest ended. Not only that, but it was helpful in improving the magician’s social status as well.

Aphrodisiac






Mushoku Tensei Anime - Season 2 Episode 12: It’s an image of the aphrodisiac tonic that Rudy and Sylphy drank when they were about to have intercourse.



It was made in the Fittoa Region. It's made from the petals of the Batirusu flower and Philip Boreas Greyrat had a monopoly on the purification method.

After the teleportation incident, the production of the product discontinued. Because the formula is a mystery and the Aphrodisiac is considered a rare product by the public. A single bottle cost fifteen Asura Gold Coins. After the mana disaster, the Aphrodisiac currently costs one hundred Asura Gold Coins on the high end.

Trivia

Atofe mistakenly thought that 『Magic Armor Mk I 』 was the Fighting God Armor but, later on realized it wasn't and comment that it has the power and speed equaling Fighting God Armor.

The
『Zariff's Prosthetic arm』has the strength to restrain Zanoba's Miko Power.

The Magic Stone of
『Arrogant Water Dragon King』is worth over 100 Asuran gold coins. The stone is worth over 100 Asuran gold coins.

Aphrodisiac is considered a rare product by the public. A single bottle cost fifteen Asura gold coins. After the mana disaster, the Aphrodisiac currently costs one hundred Asura gold coins on the high end.

Magician
========

Redirect to:
Classes#Magicians

Main Page
=========

Redirect to:
Mushoku Tensei Wiki

Malta
=====

Malta
is the Ogre God and the leader of the
Ogre
 race living on the Ogre Island.

Appearance

Malta is single horned red ogre with a height of almost 3 meters, with a build similar to a large tree. He wears a globular bell-like choker on his neck and a tiger-striped rumen on his waist.

Personality

In spite of his appearance, Malta is a social and kind person that he won’t attack people not hostile against him. He cares deeply in his people, willing to go great length to protect them.

Background

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Plot

In the year K430, because Geese states that
Rudeus
 was going to destroy the
Biheiril Kingdom
, he goes to Sharia and destroys
Orsted
 's office to reduce his strength.

In the Battle in Biheiril Kingdom, he fights against
Zanoba
 and
Doga
, and was able to defeat them, but
Atoferatofe
 takes the Ogre Island as a hostage, making Malta withdraw from the battle.

After the battle, Rudeus accepts the surrender of Malta, with the condition to helps in his fights against Geese, and accepts. They have a party in the Ogre island, but
Badigadi
 appeared with the Fighting God armor, he decides to fight him with Atofe and
Kalman II
, and loses his life in the battle.

Power and Abilities

His strength and endurance exceed even
Zanoba
, being able to defeat both Zanoba and
Doga
 at the same time. He is nimble even with his huge body.

Even Orsted states that he wouldn't be able to defeat Malta easily.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Equipment

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

Defeating
Badigadi
 (albeit without the fighting god armor)

Could have possibly defeated Rudeus if not for Atofe's intervention

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Quotes

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Trivia

His main language
 is the Demon God Tongue, but also he can speak the human tongue in a limited manner.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Man-God
=======

Redirect to:
Hitogami

Mana
====

Mana
 (
魔力
,

Maryoku
, lit. "Magical Power")
 is a form of energy that exists in
Mushoku Tensei
. It is the source of all
magic
 and is comparable to energy in our world. Mana exists in almost every aspect of the
Six-Faced World
.

Background

All living beings (
humans
 and other
Races
, including
Monsters
 and plants) have mana within their bodies. However, beings like
Nanahoshi Shizuka
 are unable to hold mana within their bodies since they have tripped into the world but this mana externally accumulates over time, until their body begins to react negatively to it which is referred to as
Drain Syndrome
.

According to the
Dragon Tribe
 researchers' hypothesis: a power possessed by every living creature permeates the Six Worlds which is called
Dragon Battle Aura
 by the Dragon Tribe while the Demons call it
Mana
 or Magic Power that is said to maintain a natural equilibrium within the Six Worlds. However, the power of the Six Worlds suddenly declined, creating significant imbalances. If the power diminishes significantly in one world, it'll absorb power from another world to compensate which results to the teleport incident, causing not only trees and animals but also people to disappear.

Mana Flow





Mana in the
Anime
 depicted as a yellow and orange matter flowing through the body



Like blood, Mana circulates throughout the body of every living being.

Because of the internal constant Mana flow (which, like
Disturb Magic
, disrupts the formation of other flows), it is impossible to materialize magic inside the body. Every living being in the Six-Faced World has a similar protection. The notable exceptions are Elinalise, who can transform the naturally accumulating mana in her body into a magic stone because of her curse, and those afflicted with Magic Stone Disease, which forcibly transforms their bodies into magic stones.

Magic

Magic is the manipulation of mana. It can be classified into the following: Attack magic (basic elements), Healing magic (buff/debuff), Summoning. Furthermore, unorthodox magic that is difficult to classify under the three main categories are referred to as unique magic (or original magic in cases of innovation, such as Electric).

It should be noted that while magic does seem to follow the law of conservation of energy, it demonstrably doesn't. Otherwise, Rudeus' mass would be equivalent to that of his body, plus the total mass that can be generated with his mana.

Mana Capacity

Mana capacity refers to the total amount of mana a person can store and use for
Magic Spells
 and
Battle Aura
. It's analogous to the concept of a reservoir holding water: the larger the reservoir, the more water it can hold, and the longer it can sustain the flow.

A person's magical power reserve, or mana, is generally believed to be inherited, and the amount one has is determined at birth. Individuals with the
Laplace Factor
, such as
Rudeus
 and
Sylphy
, have enormous amounts of aggregate mana that has increased since birth; therefore, they are considered the only exception. However, this was later proven incorrect; it is not linked to the Laplace Factor. Anyone can increase their total mana by stimulating it from a young age, as seen with
Julie
.

A person with a larger mana capacity can cast more powerful spells or a greater number of weaker spells before exhausting their reserves. This can be a significant advantage in combat situations, allowing one to sustain their attacks or unleash devastating blows.

Rudeus Greyrat
 possesses a massive mana capacity, estimated to be several times larger than the average magician. This allows him to cast powerful spells and perform feats of magic beyond the capabilities of most individuals.

Roxy Migurdia
 possesses a smaller mana capacity compared to Rudeus but excels in efficiency and control. This allows her to cast highly precise spells with minimal waste of energy.

Orsted
 possesses an immense mana capacity.

Individuals with the
Laplace Factor
, like Rudeus and
Sylphiette
, have enhanced magic aptitude and much greater mana capacity than most magicians.

Mana capacity is not the only factor that determines the effectiveness of a mage. Other aspects like talent, skill, and knowledge can also play a significant role.

The series does not provide a specific measurement unit for mana capacity, making direct comparisons between characters somewhat ambiguous.

References

Manga
=====

There are a total of fifth manga series helmed by different artists based on the original
Light Novel
 by
Rifujin na Magonote
 and
Shirotaka
.

Mushoku Tensei

An unemployed otaku has just reached the lowest point in his life. He wants nothing more than the ability to start over, but just as he thinks it may be possible…he gets hit by a truck and dies! Shockingly, he finds himself reborn into an infant’s body in a strange new world of swords and magic. His identity now is Rudeus Greyrat, yet he still retains the memories of his previous life. Reborn into a new family, Rudeus makes use of his past experiences to forge ahead in this fantasy world as a true prodigy, gifted with maturity beyond his years and a natural born talent for magic. With swords instead of chopsticks, and spell books instead of the internet, can Rudeus redeem himself in this wondrous yet dangerous land?

Synopsis by Seven Seas Entertainment

Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation
 (無職転生 〜異世界行ったら本気だす〜
Mushoku Tensei: Isekai Ittara Honki Dasu
) is a manga adaptation of the
Mushoku Tensei
 light novel written by
Rifujin na Magonote
. The manga series is illustrated by Yuka Fujikawa. The manga, published by
Media Factory
, debuted in the June edition of
Monthly Comic Flapper
 magazine in 2014.

With the first volume released on October 23 of 2014, the series has been compiled into 16
tankōbon
 volumes as of December 2021. In January 2015,
Seven Seas Entertainment
 announced its licensing of the manga series for localization in English
 and released the first volume on November 24, 2015. As of July 2021, 13 volumes have been translated to English.

Depressed Magician Arc

'
After his separation with Eris, Rudeus falls into the depths of depression. He travels to Rosenberg, the second city of the Duchy of Basherland, to search for his missing mother, Zenith. Desperate, Rudeus tries to accept a high-ranking request alone in order to make a name for himself. However, by chance, he ends up working with a party of B-rank adventurers called the Counter Arrow. One of the party members is a girl named Sarah, who reminds him of Eris...!.

Synopsis by FW Comic Alter

Mushoku Tensei: Isekai Ittara Honki Dasu: Depressed Magician Arc
 (『無職転生 ～異世界行ったら本気だす～ 失意の魔術師編』 Mushoku tensei ~ isekai ittara honki dasu ~ shitsui no majutsu-shi-hen”) is a manga adaptation of the
Mushoku Tensei
 light novel written by
Rifujin na Magonote
 and illustrated by Kazusa Yoneda based in the events of
Light Novel Volume 7
, that was omitted in the original manga adaptation. The manga is published by FW Comics Alter and debuted early digital in December 20, after the final episode of the anime adaptation.

Roxy Gets Serious

Roxy’s life is a lonely one–out of all her tribe, she’s the only one without the power of telepathy. Her days pass in silence, while people speak words she can never hear. But when she saves the life of a wandering witch, Roxy gets the chance of a lifetime: the opportunity to study as a magician’s apprentice, and leave her strange home behind! Don’t miss this brand-new tale in the Mushoku Tensei universe: the journey of Roxy, fated to be a star among magicians!

Synopsis by Seven Seas Entertainment

Jobless Reincarnation: Roxy Gets Serious
 (無職転生～ロキシーだって本気です～
Mushoku Tensei: Roxy datte Honki Desu
) is a spin-off manga series written by
Rifujin na Magonote
 and illustrated by Shoko Iwami based around the early life of the character
Roxy Migurdia
. The manga, published by
Media Factory
, began serialization in the web-based
ComicWalker
 magazine on December 21 of 2017.

With the first volume released on March 22, 2018, the series has been compiled into 9 volumes as of December 2021. In September of 2018,
Seven Seas Entertainment
 announced its licensing of the manga for localization in English
 and released the first volume on April 30, 2019. As of March 2020, 5 volumes have been released in English.

Volumes

Volume 2
Volume 3

Volume 6
Volume 7
Volume 8
Volume 9
Volume 10
Volume 11
Volume 12

Eris Seriously Sharpen her Fangs

Eris Boreas Greyrat is a former noble girl, who one day was transported to the other side of the world with her cousin Rudeus. She grew as a swordswoman, but ultimately was unable to save Rudy as he was nearly killed. Deciding that she wants to be someone who can support him rather than the other way around, Eris decides to leave Rudeus and go on her own journey.

Jobless Reincarnation: Eris Seriously Sharpen her Fangs
 (無職転生～エリスは本気で牙を砥ぐ～
Mushoku tensei ~ erisu wa honki de kiba o togu ~
), also known as
Eris Gaiden
 is a spin-off manga series written by Okano Yuu and illustrated by Higake Take based around the character of
Eris Boreas Greyrat
 after her separation with Rudeus in the Events of
Light Novel Volume 6
. The manga, published by Gangan, began his serialization in the App of Gangan Online magazine on March 15 of 2022.

Volumes

Volume 1

I'll Be Serious Even in 4-koma

A 34-years-old jobless recluse has been reincarnated into a world of swords and sorcery!
The popular life-redo fantasy "Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation" has become a 4-panel manga! I'm going to be serious even in 4-panel!

Original Synopsis on ComicWalker, translated

Mushoku Tensei: I'll Be Serious Even in 4-koma
 (無職転生 ~ 4コマになっても本気だす~
Mushoku Tensei: Yon-koma ni Natte mo Honki Dasu
) is a
4-panel
 spin-off manga series written by
Rifujin na Magonote
 and illustrated by Nogiwa Kaede. The manga adapt the events of the first sixth
light novel
 volumes in a comical tone.

The series, published by
ASCII Media Works
 debuted in the monthly magazine of
Comic Dengeki Daioh G
 edition N°64 on October 25 of 2018
 and concluded in the edition N°84 on August 27 of 2020.
. It has been compiled into three volumes, the first volume launched on October 26, 2019 and the last was released on December 26, 2020.

Volumes

Volume 1
Volume 2
Volume 3

Anthology

Mushoku Tensei: Anthology
 (無職転生〜異世界行ったら本気だす〜アンソロジー
Mushoku Tensei: Isekai Ittara Honki Dasu - Anthology
) is a group of short stories focusing on the characters
Roxy Migurdia
,
Eris Boreas Greyrat
, and
Sylphiette
. The first volume launched on March 22 of 2019 and the final volume on December 26, 2020.

Volumes

humans
.

Roxy receives Rudeus letter with his request on wanting to learn the
Demon Language
 so he writes a book on how to learn the language.

Sylphiette is carving a pendant that according to her father
Laws
 it is a lucky charm for the
Elf
 race and longs to see him again someday

Eris is told by Philip and Alphonse that the gift they are preparing for Rudeus, the
Aqua Heartia
 is already being prepared.

Manga Volume 1
==============

This is the first volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 manga adaptation.

Synopsis

A SECOND CHANCE IN A NEW WORLD!

An unemployed otaku has just reached the lowest point in his life. He wants nothing more than the ability to start over, but just as he thinks it may be possible…he gets hit by a truck and dies! Shockingly, he finds himself reborn into an infant’s body in a strange new world of swords and magic.

His identity now is Rudeus Greyrat, yet he still retains the memories of his previous life. Reborn into a new family, Rudeus makes use of his past experiences to forge ahead in this fantasy world as a true prodigy―gifted with maturity beyond his years and a natural born talent for magic. With swords instead of chopsticks, and spell books instead of the internet, can Rudeus redeem himself in this wondrous yet dangerous land?

Chapters

Chapter 1:
Could It Be? An Alternate Universe!

Chapter 2:
Master

Chapter 3:
The Reason For Respect

Chapter 4:
Friendship

Family Meeting and Growing Pains

Mushoku Tensei
 manga adaptation.

Synopsis

HOMECOMING

After a disastrous meeting with the deadly, enigmatic Orsted, Rudeus just barely manages to escape with his life. But there is light at the end of the tunnel, because he and his companions have at last reached their destination: Rudeus’s home, Fittoa. After a magical calamity flung its denizens around the world, what has become of Fittoa? And what fate awaits those who have finally returned?.

CAUGHT IN A QUAGMIRE

Two years have passed since Rudeus bitterly parted ways with Eris, the girl he loves. Now he wanders the north as an adventurer for hire, searching for any sign of his mother, Zenith. He finally gets the clue he’s been looking for from a friend of his old magic tutor, along with an unexpected invitation: a chance to attend the famous Ranoa University of Magic.

Manga Volume 13
===============

This is the thirteen volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 manga adaptation.

Synopsis

THE TRUE FACE OF SILENT FITZ

Rudeus enrolled at the Ranoa University of Magic to unravel the secrets of a magical calamity, but he keeps getting caught up in new kinds of trouble. Now he’s in the position to dish out some trouble of his own, with two animal-eared bullies at his mercy. Between being the new top dog on campus and experiencing some very confusing feelings for the charismatic Silent Fitz, Rudy’s school days aren’t easy!

Manga Volume 2
==============

This is the second volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 manga adaptation.

Synopsis

“IF ONLY I COULD JUST START OVER AGAIN…”

Reborn into a world of swords and magic, Rudeus―a former 34-year-old deadbeat otaku―is determined to live his new life to the fullest, yet things take a surprise turn when Rudy is sent to stay with a faraway relative.

In exchange for them teaching him sword fighting, Rudy agrees to tutor his second cousin. However, it turns out the only thing his new pupil is interested in is giving everyone a hard time! Rudy devises a strategy that may finally get his disrespectful cousin in line, but when a staged kidnapping goes awry, Rudy will need to rely on his skills and her obedience to save their very lives!

Chapters

Chapter 6:
Separation

Chapter 7:
A Young Girl's Rage

Chapter 8:
Complacency

Chapter 9:
The Boreas Family Greetings

Chapter 10:
Eris's Depression

Short Novel: Taming The Mad Dog

Side Story:
The Greyrat Household Maid

!?

,

SKELETONS IN THE CLOSET

Having recently become tutor to the hot-headed young Eris, Rudy is elated to be deemed worthy by the eccentric side of his family. But the Boreas household seems to have more than a few dark secrets, and while the opportunities for knowledge and romance are tempting, there are some mysteries better left unsolved.

Manga Volume 4
==============

This is the fourth volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 manga adaptation.

Synopsis

“ALL YOU HAVE TO DO.... IS TRUST ME”

Rudeus Greyrat’s new life takes a shocking turn when the country of Roa is overcome by a blinding light, leaving the fate of his family and friends unknown. He and his student Eris are transported to the Demon Continent, a foreign land which is strange even to Rudy. When a mysterious figure, claiming to be a god and offering advice, Rudy must decide whether or not this stranger can be trusted. Can Rudy and Eria make it back home, or will this be the last new world in which Rudy ever awakens?

Manga Volume 5
==============

This is the fifth volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 manga adaptation.

Synopsis

“IT ISN’T OVER AS LONG AS I DON’T GIVE UP”

Rudeus, Roxy’s esteemed disciple, has disappeared along with most of the Fittoa Territory after a mysterious blinding light engulfed it. Now, Roxy’s journey to find him begins. Meanwhile, Rudeus “Rudy” Greyrat and Eris continue trying to find a way home, with the aid of those they’ve met in the Demon Continent, including Ruijerd, The Superd warrior. Can Rudy handle the pressures of getting home, protecting Eris and clearing the name of the Superd race, or has the prior-NEET finally found a task even his new zest for life can’t overcome?

Manga Volume 6
==============

This is the sixth volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 manga adaptation.

Synopsis

WHAT THE FUTURE HOLDS

Magical calamity has sent Rudeus to the opposite end of the world! But the journey itself is not without its own excitement. On the way to his hometown, he comes to the aid of a rather scantily-clad young girl. In return for his aid, she offers to grand him a wish, anything that he wants. The ability he receives is certainly powerful and Rudeus soon finds himself getting glimpses into the future–but even a fancy new power can’t keep him out of trouble.

Chapters

Chapter 28:
My Name Is...

Chapter 29:

FAMILY REUNION

Rudeus has conquered the Demon Continent and traveled across half the world. Along the way, he’s made friends and bested enemies. Now, finally, their long adventure is nearing an end. When Rudeus finds his father Paul, it has all the makings of a tender moment–so why does it turn into a father-son brawl? Is Rudy doomed to repeat al the mistakes of his past life?

Master
======

This article is about the anime episode titled "Master" You may be looking for
the anime episode
.

Master
 (
師匠
,

Shishō
)
 is the second chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Roxy Migurdia

Summary

While initially unimpressed by Rudeus's standing, Roxy begins his training to see his potential as mage. But with his agoraphobia from his old life still lingering, Rudy convinces Roxy to confine the training to the backyard instead where Rudeus using wordless magic convinces Roxy he would be worthwhile to teach. With Roxy's magic training in the morning and swordplay with Paul in the afternoon, Roxy also teaches Rudeus general knowledge of the world; Rudeus discovers that Roxy is from the magic race of the demon continent. Given her hair color, Rudeus' parents were probably afraid of her when she first arrived because her hair sometimes looks green under the sun, which would be similar to the Superd race- a dangerous and ferocious race from the last war. Despite Roxy's distaste for it, Rudeus decided to refer to Roxy as "Master" in his heart. Over the next two years, Rudeus continued his training under Roxy and improved his spells. When the family celebrates Rudeus' fifth birthday, overwhelmed by the love and celebration since his last had none of that on his birthdays. He receives an encyclopedia from Zenith, a pair of swords from Paul, and a wand from Roxy, who declares that it's time for his graduation exam outside of the House.

Appearances

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Zenith Greyrat

Paul Greyrat

Lilia

Roxy Migurdia

Skills

Water ball

Healing

Regions

Buena Village

Fittoa Region

Master (Episode)
================

This article is about the anime episode titled "Master" You may be looking for
the manga chapter
.

Master
 (師匠
Shishō
) is the second episode of the
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on January 17, 2021 .

Synopsis

Rudy begins training with his new magic tutor and learning swordsmanship from his father. He makes rapid progress, but traumatic memories from his past life leave him too afraid to go outside. Is his second chance already doomed to failure?

Plot

Rudeus reminisces about his past life, when he was expelled from home and was hit by the truck that killed him while attempting to save some teenagers. He spends the next months training in magic with Roxy until the day of his five-year-old birthday party, when Roxy declares that she has nothing more to teach him and will hold his graduation exam. The next day, Rudeus leaves his home for the first time accompained by Roxy. He gets distressed over his past trauma, when he was severely bullied by his classmates in school that led to him become recluse, but he ends up overcoming it once realizing how Roxy blended well with the villagers, despite all the prejudice she usually suffers due to her foreign traits. In the exam, Rudeus manages to summon a massive thunderstorm and Roxy declares that he passed. Roxy then departs to continue her journey and Rudeus thanks her for everything she has done for him.

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Paul Greyrat

Zenith Greyrat

Lilia

Roxy Migurdia

Nanahoshi Shizuka

Locations

Buena Village

Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 1

Prologue

Chapter 4: Master

Chapter 5: Swords and Sorcery

Chapter 6: Reasons for Respect

Differences with the light novel:

The prologue chapter of the Volume 1 appear as a reminiscence of Rudeus.

The clothes of Rudeus before his reincarnation was different.

Rudeus explaining how he maintain the Saint Magic Cumulonimbus was cut.

Trailer

1-17(日)放送第2話予告：『無職転生 ～異世界行ったら本気だす～』次回予告②
Episode 2 Trailer, January 15

Gallery

View Gallery

Click here to view the Gallery

Trivia

When Rudy attempts to walk in on his parents having sex to mess with them, he spots Roxy outside their room. In the manga, she's silently spying in them; in the episode she's masturbating to the sound of their lovemaking.

Arc System work is credited in the ending for a few posters of the Guilty Gear Series which can be seen behind his bed, one featuring the character Dizzy and another featuring artwork from the back of box of the Dreamcast version of Guilty Gear X. Alongside these you can see a figure of the character Dizzy on his PC and brief game play of Guilty Gear XX once more featuring Dizzy fighting the character Ky Kiske.

The author stated that November 22 was when Rudeus dies in his previous life
, the same date that the first chapter of the Web novel (11/22/2012), meaning that he was bullied in 1992-1994, and in the flashback the bullies take photos of him with a flip cellphone, but the first flip cellphone with camera was the
Sanyo SCP-5300
, that was made in 2002.

Matsukaze
=========

Matsukaze
 is a horse that
Ginger
 bought for
Rudeus
 for his journey to
Begaritt Continent
 to help
Paul
 in saving
Zenith
 at the
Teleportation Labyrinth
.

Appearance

Matsukaze is a bulky dark horse.

Background

Horses in the
Human World
 are monstrously strong in general compared to their slender counterparts at Earth especially the horses that are native in the northern
Central Continent
 like Matsukaze that can push their way through the constant snowy terrain.

Plot





Rudeus purchasing Matsukaze in the Anime



After Matsukaze is purchased at the recommendation of
Ginger
, Rudeus hires an
Adventurer
 to accompany Rudeus and
Elinalise
 to Lumen Forest, the location of the Teleportation Circle to Begaritt Continent that was provided by
Nanahoshi Shizuka
. Upon reaching the the forest, Rudeus tasks the adventurer to return the horse back to the
Greyrat House
 since they do not know the size of the Teleportation Circle at the time and it would be wiser to acquire another mount in Begaritt that is suited to the local climate there.

Rudeus,
Sylphiette
 and
Roxy Migurdia
 rides Matsukaze to the outskirts of
Sharia
 where Roxy plans to teach the two
Lightning
. On their way, Sylphiette compares Matsukaze to the horses of
Asura Kingdom
 knights that causes Matsukaze to sound his disapproval and causing Roxy to console him causing Rudeus to wonder if Matsukaze can understand their
Human Language
 or Roxy is a horse whisperer. Arriving at the outskirts of the city, Rudeus creates an
Earth Fortress
 for Matsukaze to ensure there will be no accidents like what happened with
Caravaggio
 and to protect Matsukaze from the rain before they begin.

Abilities

Roxy Migurdia: "Matsukaze is really a good horse, He's calm and does what he's told, but he's also very strong."
Sylphiette:"Yep. You don't see a horse like this everyday.

Physical Abilities

While Matsukaze's speed isn't that great, has has massive physical strength as seen in its constitution that it can carry 2 weeks worth of luggage without having it's movement slowed including 2 passengers.

Trivia

Matsukaze
 is considered the most neglected of Rudeus' household pets.

References

Matsukaze

Maxwell
=======

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

"We the Five Dragon Generals, have fought side-by-side for tens of thousands of years. One of us is gone. It is unforgivable if we don't avenge Crystal's death."

Maxwell to Laplace

Dark Dragon King
Maxwell
 is one of the
First Dragon God
's Five Dragon Generals who is from the Dark Dragon Tribe and in charge of hunting dragons and monsters that threaten Kayos and the Dragon Tribe cities.

Appearance

Maxwell has blue-silver scales, steel eyes and is much smaller than the average Dragon Tribe, giving the impression that he is small and flighty. He always have a wretched smile and speaks rather crudely.

Personality

Maxwell despite his looks is talented, hardworking and loyal. Maxwell is even more martial than
Chaos
 and when a situation occurs, he is always the first to jump into the breach but still prioritizes the safety of the
First Dragon God
 and fellow Dragon Generals when it comes to deciding a course of action.

Background

There were many who spoke ill of Maxwell behind his back. But those who knew him well never mocks him. Due to his hard work of exterminating monsters that appeared throughout the Dragon World, only few members of the Dragon Tribe are killed by monsters.

Plot

Maxwell presents his report on his investigation of
Crystal
's death on the meeting with the Dragon God and the remaining Dragon Generals and concludes that it was impossible for a gold dragon to kill Crystal leading
Szilard
 to consider that a demon could have killed him. When Chaos vehemently opposed
Laplace
 finding the killer Maxwell-who is unusually supportive of the idea, calms him down by explaining that the killer could be isolating each Dragon General one by one and suggests they move in pairs.

A few days later, Maxwell meets Laplace once again and introduces
Gora and Scrubava
 to assist him on the investigation. Laplace was in doubt of himself by this gesture but Maxwell praises him for the dragons he trained are used by his Dark Dragon Team was a big help and assures him that he will immediately aid him when the need arises.

Laplace meets with Maxwell after recovering from his battle against
Necrolia Nacrolia
 and informs him that Gora and Scrubava has died in battle. Maxwell attends another meeting where Laplace and Szilard gives their report then Szilard also confirms that he personally executed Necrolia to which Maxwell implied that he would have executed Necrolia himself if he is still alive. When the First Dragon God names Laplace to be Crystal's successor as Dragon General, Maxwell although initially shocked, he acknowledges Laplace's strength to defeat even one of the Eight Demon Kings.
 When the Dragon God's child is born, Maxwell goes all over the Dragon World to gather meat for the parade announced by Szilard which lasts for decades and like the rest of the Dragon Generals, Maxwell is also impressed by the child and left with a solemn expression.

Maxwell and the rest of the Dragon Generals accompanies the First Dragon God as he battles and defeats the Gods of the Beast World, Ocean World and Sky World one after another and resulting to the destruction of each world just by the power of the First Dragon God and the Five Dragon Generals.
 But for the Demon World, which is comparable in fighting strength with the Dragon Tribe and in addition, the Eight Great Demon Kings matched strengths with the Five Dragon Generals so the full force of the Dragon World's Dragon Warriors is brought to wage war on the Demon World. The war between the Dragon World and Demon World lasted for decades where its a a cycle of the invading army is repelled by the defending army and the defending army will invade in retaliation and be repelled back. During this time every innovation and technology is focused on winning the war where Chaos develops the Dragon Gate to weaken demonic power.

Due to the advancement of magic and technology, the war between the Dragon World and Demon World have caused massive casualties for both sides. The Dragon Tribe follows the Human God's suggestion to isolate the Eight Demon King one by one and defeat them which causes the
Demon God
 to appear in the battle field and duel the First Dragon God. After the First Dragon God defeats the Demon God, the Dragon Generals brings him back to the Dragon World while the Demon World begins to collapse.

--To be added--

Maze Of Love
============

Maze Of Love
 (
愛の迷宮
,

Ai no Meikyū
)
 is the thirteenth chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Roxy Migurdia

Summary

In a town square, the Bard sings a story of Roxy.

Several years ago, a team of E-Ranked adventurers approach Roxy for recruitment needing a mage, only to turn them down as she is A-Rank; surprising them given her youthful appearance. As Bard swoons at her popularity with others her age, Roxy tries to correct her but stops thinking it futile. Seeing Roxy as a talented mage at a young age, she follows Roxy thinking it would be the start of an incredible story to tell, so Roxy voices her not being responsible for whatever befalls the Bard.

Later, Roxy partners with the "Triad" Adventurer team and starts to develop an attraction for team leader, Sam. After clearing a dungeon level, bard and Roxy learn from party member Dohn that, while Sam and Pamela are a couple, he is in love with Pamela yet wants her to be happy, so he refrains from imposing out of respect for her personal space. As the group gets rest, Sam tries seducing Roxy, but inquires to his being with Pamela. As Sam says not to worry, a Death Claw Tiger finds them and Sam runs out with Roxy in hand, leaving the other three as fodder to further his escape. Pamela wakes up to find the Death Claw attack, but when Dohn tanks the damage, Roxy lets go of Sam to defend the others and slays the Death-Claw.

Roxy uses Healing on Dohn, but after hearing Sam's disregard for them, she slaps him and calls him out. As Roxy dreamed of finding an adventurer in a labyrinth to rescue her and start a romance, she finds Sam is not that dreamt of adventurer, and tells Pamela what Sam did and tells her of Dohn's love for her. Leaving with righteous indignation, Roxy's exit is undercut by her tripping over a rock and the ladies seeing her panties; Roxy acts like it didn't happen.

In the present, Pamela meets the Bard, telling her that the group immediately disbanded, then she married Dohn and the two have been living well together since. Both talk about how thankful they are to Roxy's involvement, leading to Roxy elsewhere in the world to sneeze, sensing someone talking about her somewhere.

Appearances

Characters

Roxy Migurdia

Bard

Pamela

Dohn

Sam

Skills

Regions

Mi'nal
======

Mi'nal is the son of the
hobbit
 chief, Bi'nal.

Appearance

Mi'nal is about half of
Rudeus
' height, with the face of an adult man and a tiny beard growing in.

Personality

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

His circle of friends as he was growing up included
Rayfort
 and
Linia Dedoldia
, and he enrolled in
Ranoa Magic Academy
 as a special student.

Migurd
======

Migurd
 (
ミグルド
,

Migurudo
)
 are a Demon race from the Biegoya Region of the
Demon Continent
.

Background

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Traits





Male and Female Migurds in the Anime



Migurds have blue hair, small childish body and long lifespan of 200 years. Their physical growth stops when they reach middle school age and finally can grow older again after they reach 150 years.





Migurd's telepathic ability in the Anime



They have a special ability that allows them to communicate telepathically to each other depicted as lights on their forehead at a close distance without seeing each other, with the exception of
Roxy
.

Culture





Migurd Village in the Anime



Migurds live in the desert region of the Demon Continent and uses the shells of
Giant Stone Turtles
 for rooves of their homes.

The Migurd are closely related to the Superd and used to get treated much the same as they were. But like most races in the
Human World
, they also use the infamous tales of Superd to scare their children to go to bed.

Known Migurds

Lara Greyrat
 (half)

Lily Greyrat
 (half)

Rokari Migurdia

Rowin Migurdia

Roxy Migurdia

Rokkus Migurdia

References

Miko
====

Redirect to:
Miko of Memory

Miko of Memory
==============

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

The
Miko of Memory
 (“Blessed Child of Memory” in Light Novel), also known as the
Miko of Millishion
 is an unnamed young girl born with a special power that allows her to see memories by looking into people's eyes.

Appearance

The Miko of Memory has long, wavy blonde hair with bangs, and has blue eyes with a pink diamond-shaped pupil
.

Personality

The Miko is a kind and compassionate person, such that she willingly allow herself to be abducted by
Rudeus
 to aid his quest of saving
Zenith
, despite him knocking out her personal
guards
. Perhaps due to her ability to read minds, she is exhibiting a calm and understanding demeanor most of the time. However, she becomes shy and frightful when meeting the person she admires for the first time
.

Background

When it was discovered the Miko can see read people's memories, she had her name taken from her, and she was referred to only as the Miko-sama by her subordinates. She became the trump card of Cardinal
Leblanc Mcfarlane
 who was competing against Pope
Harry Grimoire
,
Cliff Grimoire
's grandfather for power, as she was a shrine maiden who possessed wondrous power which allowed the
Demon Race Expulsion Faction
 to regain its influence and resulting to a bloody power struggle within the Milis Religion. The Miko of Memory is often used for interrogations, however permission to use her power is regulated by the Cardinal that even the Royal Family of Millishion has to apply for permission to use the Miko's power.
.

Plot

Volume 5 - Juvenile Period - Reunion Chapter

During Eris's goblin subjugation accompanied by
Cliff Grimoire
 in
Millishion
, she saves the Miko and Therese from a group of assassins, who Cliff recognized were people who were his teachers.

Volume 8 - Youth Period - Special Student Chapter

It was mentioned that a few years ago in Milishion, there was an attempt on a Miko Shrine Maiden's life. Because this incident was the work of the Pope's faction, the internal struggles intensified.

Volume 21 - Young Man Period - Cliff Chapter

Of the little freedom she was allowed, the Miko frequently chose to come to the garden in the
Great Church
, and is always escorted by her guards. Ten years after being saved by
Eris Boreas Greyrat
, once she was about 20, she met Rudeus while out in the garden she usually frequented, and discovered that he was Eris' husband. She began to meet him frequently, and became friends with him. In the time, Rudeus was also conversing regularly with one of her guards,
Therese Latreia
, who was also Rudeus's aunt, about the situation with his mother.

Rudeus meets with the Miko once again and asks her to sign a petition to prevent the removal of Therese from being her guards to which he agrees and it was also said the Miko has a weak
Fate
. She said that she could live up to 30 years before dying due to assassinations and to prevent this, she requests to join the
ORSTED Corporation
 and became part of Orsted subordinates. Rudeus accepts her request and also throws in a Magic Beast to protect her who they later names Nurse and her life expectancy prolonged to at least 50.

The Miko meets with Rudeus who is accompanied by Eris and the tells her she wants to be a
Swordsman
 like Eris who she idolizes since saving her life. After following Eris' instructionss in swinging a stick, the Miko also sees Eris' memory on how she trained at the
Holy Land of Swords
 and begins training her body.

Powers and Abilities

Miko Power - Telepathy






The Miko of Memory reading Zenith's memories



When looking into someone's eyes, Miko is able to see one's "surface memories", memories that a person has in mind. This also extends to being able to see related memories to that subject, and the longer she stares into someone's eyes, the more of that person's memories she sees.

This power makes her perfect for interrogations, because when asked a question regarding a crime, it's impossible for someone to
not
 think of the question or its answer. This is often how her powers are used. This power also allows the Miko to see the memories of her subject even from several years ago but it also leaves her very exhausted afterwards
.

Trivia

She seems to have a weak Fate, as according to Orsted, in all timelines where
Rudeus
 didn't exist, she never reached past the age of 30 and usually died around the age of 10. It's likely that assassins were the cause of her death in these timelines.

Miko has an owl as a guardian beast/familiar summoned on behalf of her named Nurse. Rudeus mistaken her request as a naming Miko herself, and gave the name referencing the Eroge "Miko Miko Nurse".

After meeting with Eris in the church headquarters she wanted to become like Eris, so she started training and become more slim, though using sword or magic was prohibited.

Reference

Milis Continent
===============

Redirect to:
Millis Continent

Milis Religion
==============

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Template:Location





Emblem of the Milis Religion seen through out the Holy Kingdom of Milis



Milis Religion
 is the largest religious organization in the world founded by Saint Milis that is found almost through out the continents where humans live.

Headquarters





The Great Church in the Anime



The Great Church is the main headquarters of the Milis Religion located in
Millishion
, Holy Kingdom of Milis,
Millis Continent
.  The current leader is Pope
Harry Grimoire
,
Cliff Grimoire
's grandfather.

Factions

The Milis Religion followed the scripture saying that "all
Demons
 should be destroyed" and rejected the Demon Race. But 300 years ago, a priest read its scripture that said: "All races are equal under Millis" and questions if the Demon Races are equal as well, which caused a division in the priests and causing the religion to split in 2 factions that are in a power struggle since then.

Demon Race Acceptance Faction






Assassins of the Demon Race Acceptance Faction



Also known as the Pope Faction lead by the current Pope
Harry Grimoire
 is the larger faction that has the influence among the majority of the general populace and the
Order of Instruction
. 50 years ago, the Acceptance faction influence rose after they put an end to the escalating conflicts with the
Beast Race
 and other denizens of the
Great Forest
, and for the next 30 years since then had complete control of the religion and Millishion's affairs. Despite being a religious organization, assassinations is still a method used by both factions especially towards the opposing faction's pope candidate.

Demon Race Expulsion Faction






Emblem of the Demon Race Expulsion Faction seen in even in the Commercial District



Also known as the Cardinal Faction lead by
Cardinal Leblanc McFarlane
 is the faction of the Milis Religion who zealously follows the old teachings of the Milis Church that the Demon Race should be completely expelled and has a close relationship with the
Latreia House
 and the Order of the Temple and at the peak of their influence, non-human races were strongly oppressed in Millishion which resulted many quarrels with the inhabitants of the Great Forest. While currently losing influence among the 2 factions for the last 30 years, this has changed when the
Miko of Memory
 was born and joins the Demon Race Expulsion Faction to become the candidate for the next pope. The influence of the Demon Race Expulsion rose to the point that even the Royal Family needs permission from the Cardinal to even use the powers of the Miko.

Legends

Necklace of Milis






Milis Religion Wedding Ceremony



Before heading to certain death, Saint Millis gave an ornamental necklace to her most beloved who gave him a kiss on his forehead and wished for his return. When Saint Millis was in danger, her beloved one offered the necklace to God who was touched by the exquisite necklace and beloved's love and intervenes to save Saint Millis.

This become a part of the Milis Religion wedding ceremony where a replica of the Necklace of Milis is a requirement of every Milis Church. The priest hands over the necklace to the groom who puts it on her bride. Then the bride kisses the groom on his forehead, a kiss of oath similar to the legend.

Holy Sword Highway






Blue Dragon Mountain Range's gap said to be made by Milis



"In these times of suffering, the righteous one endured. In these days of hardship, he cultivated strength."

Milis Holy Sciptures Atomos Chapter 12, Verse 31

During the war between humans and demons, Saint Milis plans to use his holy sword to defeat the demon army but this takes time to focus the attack. While Milis is preparing the attack, Peter Dolior the commander of the human army and Milis' closest friend fought to hold off the demon army and died in battle until Milis brings down his holy sword on the demon army. The power of the holy sword reached from Millishion, cuts a gap through the Blue Dragon Mountain Range, through the Great Forest, then across the ocean and struck the demon king that instantly kills him at the place now known as
Wind Port
.

The place where Milis launched the attack is now known as the Holy Sword Highway that is still bursting with
Mana
 from Saint Millis, so even if the surrounding area is flooded because the rainy season of the Great Forest, the road remains dry and further proof of that, there are absolutely no encounters with monsters.

Trivia

Milis Religion shares similarity with the
Catholic Church
 from the pope being its head to even its teachings.

References

Millis Continent
================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!





 Map of Millis Continent



Millis Continent
 (ミリス 大陸
Mirisu Tairiku
) is the continent where the ratio of Human Race and Beast Race is 50:50, people living there follow
Milis religion
 similar to Catholics, and have a church but there are peoples who do not follow. In terms of marriage, they strictly follow the policy of monogamy.

It lies Southeast of the
Ringus Sea
.

Population

The population of Beast Race is almost the same as the Human Race. The Human settles in the West plains while the Beast Race is secluded in the eastern jungles.

The main languages spoken are the Human Tongue and Beast-God Tongue

Geography

In the north there's the Great Forest, in the south there's the Holy Milis Kingdom. Splitting those two regions is the Blue Dragon Mountain Range, with the Holy Sword Highway going straight through them from top to bottom with not a single monster on the Highway.

Holy Country of Millis

The second oldest and most powerful kingdom after the Asura Kingdom. It is the Holy Land of the world's largest faith - the
Milis Religion
.

Millishion

The capital of the Holy Country of Millis. It is said to be the most beautiful city in the world.

Great Forest

A huge woodland that occupies the northeastern half of the Continent. It is home to various races - the Beast Race resides in the northern part of the forest, Hobbits in the northwest, the Dwarves in the southwest, and the Elves to the southeast.

The forest has 3 months of torrential rain every year.

Dedoldia Village

The settlement where the Dedoldia Tribe lives.

Blue Dragon Mountain Range

The Blue Dragon Mountain Range is the border that separates the Great Forest and the Holy Country of Millis thus effectively separating the human and beast race territory. The Holy Sword Highway passes through by a gap in the mountain that is wide enough for 2 carriages to pass at the same time. Rock slides almost never happens here which is believed to be the divine power of
Saint Millis
 and one of the reasons Millis is worshipped very well.

Despite the namesake, Blue Dragons are almost never seen here since they fly all around the world, but they always return to the Blue Dragon Mountain Range for nesting and raising children. At the southern most base of the Blue Dragon Mountain Range lies a Dwarf town that is famously known as a blacksmith town because of its high quality and cheap swords and armor.

Holy Sword Highway

A road constructed by the Holy Country of Millis that crosses the continent, from West Port to Millishion and from Millishion through the Great Forest to Zant Port. Due to the story that the creation of the highway was from a single swing of Saint Millis' sword that sliced straight through the Blue Dragon Mountain Range, the Great Forest, and even cut down a Demon Lord on the Demon Continent, the road is eventually named "Holy Sword Highway". Despite the doubts on the story, the road is still bursting with
Mana
 from Saint Millis, so even if the surrounding area is flooded because the rainy season of the Great Forest, the road remains dry and further proof of that, there are absolutely no encounters with monsters even now.

Zant Port

A port located in the North of Millis Continent, where his ships travel to Wind port in the
Demon Continent
. Also known as Saint Port or Zanto Port. Before the start of the 3 months rainy season, the inns of Zant Port are usually booked in advance for a long period as travelling across the Great Forest is impossible because of floods.

West Port

A port located in the West of Millis Continent, where his ships travel to East port in the
Central Continent.

Currency

Royal Notes (50,000 yen = 500 USD)

General Notes (10,000 yen = 100 USD)

Millis Gold Coins (5,000 yen = 50 USD)

Millis Silver Coins (1,000 yen = 10 USD)

Millis Large Copper Coins (100 yen = 1 USD)

Millis Copper Coins (10 Yen = 10 cents)

Note: This section is under construction and revision>
.

Gallery

Zant Port in the Anime
Dedoldia Village during the 3 months rainy season
Emblem of the Holy Country of Millis in the Anime
Holy Sword Highway with the Seven Great Powers Monument in the Anime
Blue Dragon Mountain Range in the Anime
Holy Sword Highway's gap that goes through the Blue Dragon Mountain Range
1/6

References

Millishion
==========

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!





Millishion in the Anime



Millishion
 is a
Human
 city and capital of the Holy Country of Millis,
Millis Continent
 which is said to be the most beautiful city in the
Human World
 for its majesty and harmony.

Geography

Millishion is located in the of central region of Millis Continent and is bordered by the Blue Dragon Mountain Range from the north and beyond is the Great Forest while making possible to get a full view of the city just by looking at it from the Holy Sword Highway. The Nikolaus River flows from Blue Dragon Mountain Range to the city that is the main source of water for the sparkling blue Grand Lake at the center of the city. Flooding was a problem for the city in the past due to the 3 months of torrential rainy season until the creation of the Seven Magic Towers to perfectly control the water and projects a barrier around the city.

Background

On the final battle of the
Laplace Wars
, the final kingdom left behind in the human race is the Holy Country of Milis, who rallied its entire army to resist lead by the 7 heroes. But due to the beast races acting as a blockade in the Great Forest and ally of the demons, the 7 heroes convinced the beast race to ally with them instead by kidnapping their children and threaten them. After a short time, the 7 heroes led the Holy Knight Orders and the beast races to attack the Laplace army. After the fierce battle, 4 of the 7 heroes died, but the entire main Laplace army was completely routed, and successfully sealed the Demon-God
Laplace
. The only 3 survivors are, Dragon God
Urupen
, North God
Kalman I
, the Armored King
Perugius Dola
 and are called the [The three heroes who vanquished the Demon God].

Laplace was defeated, but the human race was also exhausted and it was impossible to continue fighting therefore, a treaty was signed
with the moderate faction's Demon King. The treaty removes the blockade from the
Demon Continent
 thus allowing the demon races to travel freely to other continents and the discrimination towards the demon races are all banned.
 Despite the treaty, the discrimination towards the demon races is still as deep as before especially between the Milis Religion's
Demon Race Acceptance
 and
Demon Race Expulsion
 factions who are in a bitter power struggle in Millishion to this day.

Areas

Millishion has multiple entrance in its districts but with the exception of the Adventurers District, entering the other district will put Adventurers through a certain amount of questioning and it can take quite a bit of time.

Adventurers District

Located in the south, the Adventurers District is the place where the Adventurers gather where all sorts of shops and inns aimed towards Adventurers. There's also a slum area, gambling place and the slave market is in this district rather than the commerce district. Near the district's entrance to the city, there are inns and stables that provides a service to take luggage to the inn for adventurers that are not in other towns.

Holy District

Located in the west, there is the Holy District where a number of places for those related to the Milis Religion is located such as the enormous Great Church and the Knight Orders has their headquarters in this district.

Residential District

Located in the north, is the Residential District where the section of private houses and blocks also follows the harmony of blue and green seen through out Millishion. This is the place where the family of nobles, knights and average citizens live but fundamentally they are all private houses in the residential district.

Commercial District

Located in the east, the Commercial District is where all sorts of merchants gather which has a large number of shops, but the structures are small. It's a place where many companies meet and widen their trade contacts together seen in any business district and services like Blacksmiths and Auction houses are here as well.
 The 2 factions of the Milis Religion is also shown here by posting the emblems of the faction they are affiliated with below their sign post particularly the Demon Race Expulsion who refuses to sell their wares to demons or even throw them out of their shop.

Points of Interest

White Palace

The White Palace is Holy Country of Millis' Seat of Power floating at the center of the Grand Lake and home of the Royal Family. The Seven Magic Towers encircling the White Palace protects it from floods and because of the barrier from the towers, no walls are needed.
 Unlike Asura Kingdom's Royal Family, The Milis Church holds most of the power so having an audience the Millishion's king is only for formality.

Adventure Guild
 Main Headquarters

The Adventure Guild Main Headquarters is a silver glowing two story building and is the largest building in the Adventurers District at the end of the main road. Being the main headquarters, it is also the largest Adventure Guild Headquarters in the world and the main lobby is larger than the banquet halls of the
Citadel of Roa
.
 Since there is no Adventure Guild Headquarters in the Great Forest, non-human adventurers like the elves, hobbit, dwarves and beast race uses either Millishion or Zanto Port as their base or take requests on either places and because of this, adventurers in Millishion regardless of race are treated without bias.

A permanent job request in Millishion is the Goblin-Subjgation Job that it is also stated on the request to not tear of the request on the board and simply bring the gathered goblin ears to the counter for 10 Milis copper a piece and it can be accepted by adventurers regardless of rank. Goblins are E-ranked magic beasts that are almost a rat-like existence in the
Human World
 and only appears in the forests or plains. Although goblins are weak, if they are left unchecked, they would steadily increase in population and start to attack nearby villages.

Great Church

The Great Church is the Headquarters and the center of faith of the
Milis Religion
, the world's largest religious organization which is a 4 storey building with a golden onion-shaped dome at the top and has 4 courtyards matching the 4 seasons respectively.

Magic Towers

Millishion has 7 Magic Towers that are huge
Magic Tools
 that encircles the city to control the water levels of the lake and prevent flooding in the city especially during the rainy season. The tower is so tall and massive that it takes several minutes to circle it and at close distance, the top of the tower cannot be seen. The Magic Tower houses the Magic Tool like a case and it is also by protected soldiers and a large scale barrier magic where faint symbols around the tower can be seen. Because of the tower being unique only to Millishion, it is also a famous tourist spot for the city's visitors.

Orphanage

The Orphanage is run by the Milis Religion where it is said to be the symbol of their prestige and authority. As such, there were no problems with the management and the orphaned children were able to grow without worries and eventually be adopted by their foster parents or those who reaches age 10 would enter school also managed by the Milis Religion. At school, they train for five years for either
Swordsmanship
 or
Magic
 that suits their talent where those who excelled not only studying but also in the sword ang magic would join the Holy Knight Order while the majority becomes Adventurers. Thus, many adventurers were alumnis of the orphanage and would occasionally return to the orphanage while greeting their former teachers and tell fun stories of their adventures to the orphans and Cliff at the time is among those orphans who longed to be an Adventurer.

Holy Knight Orders

"Don't say anything too dangerous, or else if those Holy Knights overhear it, they'll still capture you even if it's a joke you know?"

Geese Nukadia
 to
Rudeus Greyrat

Millishion's military has three knight orders and are said to be the second most powerful nation after
Asura Kingdom
. Under the leadership of the 7 heroes and the combined forces of the Holy Knights Orders and Beast Race, Millishion is the only human kingdom that survived the Laplace Wars.
 Assassinations of other knight order members are not unusual especially those opposing factions of the Milis Relgion.

Order of the Church





Order of the Church Knights in the Anime



The Order of the Church is entrusted with matters of national defense like patrolling Millishion and arresting would be criminals. They wear white armor and are neutral on their stance in the expulsion or acceptance of the demon race.

Known Members

Belmondo Nash Venick

Belmondo is the son of Galgard and Lieutenant Commander of the Order of the Church's [Arrow Group]. He is a one-eyed man with scars on his face and is around 40 years old.
 During the conference with Pope Harry Grimoire and Rudeus, Belmondo testifies that the cardinal summons them to collect the corpse of the person who killed the Miko of Memory and damaged the country but this doesn't match the actual situation and adopts a neutral stance on the dispute.

Reilbard

Reilbard is the Battalion Commander of the Order of the Church's [Arrow Group].
 After the conference with the Pope and Rudeus, Reilbard joins Belmondo to arrest Carlyte and Claire but they were stopped by Zenith.

Order of Instruction

The Order of Instruction is a mercenary group who wears silver armor that sends young knights to areas of strife for combat experience, and at the same time is responsible for spreading the teachings of Milis to various places. Participating in one of the Order of Instruction's expeditions is a coming of age ceremony for all Holy Knights.

Known Members

Galgard Nash Venick

Galgard Nash Venick - the Grand Master of the Order of Instruction is an unrefined, taciturn man who rarely laughs. How Galgard became an acquaintance of
Ruijerd Superdia
 is unknown but in the past he had returned as a survivor of the Demon Continent expedition, and over the past few decades he's been the driving force behind the Order of Instruction being successively known as the the strongest. Since the time Galgard had become Grand Master, the survival of the Order of Instruction rose past 90% and because of numerous people he had saved, all knights hold him in respect.

Order of the Temple

"However, the Order of the Temple is a gathering of religious zealots, myself included. That's why even if we understand that there's no chance of winning, we have no choice but to fight."

-Therese Latreia






Therese Latreia wearing an Order of the Temple Armor in the Anime



The Order of the Temple are the most feared of the 3 orders due to their infamous Inquisitors, tasked with stamping out heresy. They wear blue armor and are aligned with the Demon Race Expulsion Faction of the Milis Religion.

Known Members

Miko of Memory

Leader of the Order of the Temple and candidate to be the next Pope.

Leblanc McFarlane

Cardinal of the Milis Religion who manages of the Order of the Temple and assists the Pope like a prime minister to a king.

Carlyte Latreia

Born Carlyte Granz is the Head of the Latreia House and Battalion Commander of the Order of the Temple's [Sword Group].

Therese Latreia

Company Commander of the Order of the Temple's [Anastasia Keep], the protector of the Miko of Memory.

Edgar Latreia

Eldest son of the Latreia House and Platoon Leader of the Order of the Temple who is stationed to a town west of Millishion.

Ralkan Latreia

Prevous Head of the Latreia House and Claire's father who was a Company Commander of the Order of the Temple.

Magic

Millishion has one of the most advanced Barrier Magic and Healing Magic in the world.

Barrier Magic

The Barrier Magic generated by the 7 Magic Towers is one of the reasons why Millishion is the only human kingdom that survived the Laplace Wars.
 The office of the Pope is also protected by Barrier Magic classified to be at least Saint Rank for additional security.

Healing Magic

Despite the very advance healing magic provided by Millishion's schools, most people stop learning healing magic after attaining elementary rank. If one learns healing magic to the intermediate rank, that person can work in Milis's hospital, so it is heavily favored upon in school.

Detoxification Magic

Millishion houses the book for God Rank Detoxification Magic where at least an Archbishop rank of the Great Church can access. In an alternate future,
Rudeus
 tries to learn the magic by transcribing the book but it is as thick as a dictionary so he steals the book instead.

Earldom

I'll be an earl's wife who wouldn't feel ashamed no matter where I went, and be annexed in the Holy Kingdom of Milis' nobles' list. That is my life. A [road] for the Milis' noble's daughters. But I didn't walk on that [road].

Zenith Greyrat

In addition to the royal family and the Milis Religion, Millishion is also influenced by the noble families of earls. From a young age they enter school to learn magic and/or sword techniques that would eventually lead to either taking over the head of their family, join the priesthood of the Great Church or enlist with the Holy Knight Orders.

Latreia House

A distinguished family among the earls that has deep ties with the Order of the Temple and part of the Demon Race Expulsion Faction. The head of the house is Count Carlyte Latreia married to Countess
Claire Latreia
.

Grimoire House

The most influential family of the Milis Religion and part of the Demon Race Acceptance Faction. The head of the house is Pope Harry Grimoire and the leader of the Milis Religion.

Trivia

Millishion having 7 Magic Towers follows the notion that 7 is a lucky number seen through out history. Such as the 7 Worlds, 7 heroes,
Seven Great Powers
 and 7 ranks for Sword Styles and Magic.
