References

Mimir
=====

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Mimir
 was a healer of the party
Counter Arrow
.

Appearance

Mimir was a man of average height and weight who wore a plain white robe

Personality

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Background

Mimir was on a separate party that fought the monsters attacking the
Milbots Region
 and formed a new party with the surviving adventurers called
Counter Arrow
 which included
Timothy
,
Suzanne
,
Sara
 and
Patris
.

Plot

Mimir and the party traveled to Rosenburg in the
Northern Regions of the Central continent
, searching new quest for his level where they meet
Rudeus
 on a carriage.

In a mission in Trier Forest, a blizzard greatly lowers the visibility of the party and and they were ambushed by a group of
Snow Buffaloes
 that killed him and forced the party to leave Sara behind.

Legacy

Timothy confirms to Rudeus that Mimir is dead and was regretful of his decision to retreat and leaving Mimir and Sara behind.

Suzanne consoles Timothy that the party followed his command and they would all have been wiped out if they stayed behind.

Rudeus searches for Sara in the forest alone where he kills the Snow buffaloes and was able to find the remains of Mimir's head and places it on his bag.

After rescuing Sara, Rudeus informs her what happened to Mimir and the latter carries Mimir's remains back to Rosenburg to be buried.

Power and Abilities

Mimir was a healer able to use intermediate rank in
Healing magic
, beginner rank
Detoxification magic
, and
Divine magic
 like
Exorcist Rate
.

Equipment

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

Attained Rank B Adventurer

Quotes

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Trivia

Like
Mimir
 from Norse Mythology his head was carried around after their respective deaths.

Mimiru

Minitona Dedoldia
=================

Minitona Dedoldia
 is the second daughter of
Gyes Dedoldia
, and
Linia Dedoldia
's sister.

Appearance

She has grey hair and brown eyes, with a sun-kissed tan like her father and aunt. Her tail is the same color as her hair, and she usually wears common tribal apparel.

Personality

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Background

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Plot

She was one of the beast folk that Rudeus and Ruijerd rescued from the smugglers. Following Rudeus aiding her father in saving the village from a smuggler's capture, she bonded with Eris and learned more about her aunt Ghislaine.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Power and Abilities





Minitona training with Eris in the Anime



Superior agility, physical strength, and the characteristics special to her race.

Voice Magic

A unique magic of the Dedoldia race, that can manipulate the sound of her voice.

Can be used to find enemies with a far-reaching howl or to stun them.

Minor Characters

This page is for the List of Minor characters of Mushoku Tensei, arranged by continents.

Asura Kingdom

Amarant Notos Greyrat





Amarant in the Game



Amarant Notos Greyrat
 (アマラント・ノトス・グレイラット) was Paul's father and Rudeus's grandfather who is always in conflict with Paul which eventually cause the latter to relinquish his nobility and became an adventurer.

Valentina Notos Greyrat





Valentina in the Game



Valentina Notos Greyrat
 (バレンティナ・ノトス・グレイラット) was Paul's and Pilemon's mother,
Sauros Boreas Greyrat
's sister and Rudeus's grandmother, she was born with a weak body.

Augusta

  (オーガスタ) is an Advance Water God style instructor and
Lilia
's father and Paul's father-in-law, he has a friendly relationship with Water God
Reida Reia
.

Flute






Flute in the Game



Flute (フルート) is
Lilia
's mother and Paul's mother-in-law.

Gustaf

An information broker that was hired by Pilemon Notos Greyrat to confirm if Ariel Anemoi Asura lost her life when she ran away to Ranoa.

Alphonse

Teleport Incident
 and its rebuilding.

' nursing mother who also acts as her ettiquette and dance instructor.

Rudeus

Troubadour






Troubadour in the Manga



Troubadour is a female bard in the
Manga
 who composes songs based on the people she encounters on her journey like
Roxy
.
 She then encounters
Sylphiette
 where she witnesses her use of
Healing Magic
 with voiceless incantation and encourages her to have confidence in her magic abilities then she manages to leave Fittoa before the Teleport Incident manifests.
 Troubadour is later seen in Sharia, Ranoa Kingdom where she witnesses
Nina Farion
 who is scheming to capture Rudeus but is defeated by
Badigadi
. After Rudeus defeats Badigadi, Troubadour watches Nina depart from Sharia who was visibly shaken after witnessing the defeat of the Demon Lord with a single Stone Cannon.

Ranoa Magic Academy
. At the academy, Elmore also gathers information and intelligence for Ariel aside from her servant duties and is a close friend of
Sylphiette
.

Kleene Elrond in the Manga

Citation needed
]

Halfaus Asura

Halfaus is the second prince of Asura Kingdom that is supported by the Eurus and Zephyrus nobility although he does not have the desire to become king.
Orsted
 causes the downfall of the major nobles that supports him to weaken his will to fight on becoming king.

Bandit Leader

Unnamed leader of the Thieve's Group located at a forest bordering Asura Kingdom and Red Wyrm Mountain. Rudeus establishes contact with the Bandit Leader via passwords provided by Orsted and requests a smuggling job to be handled by one of their members:
Tina Trush
 to pass the back roads of Asura Kingdom without being ambushed by the First Prince's Faction.

Enzo Moreira






Enzo Moreira in the Manga



Enzo is a Sword Saint who trained bandits in the
Sword God Style
 that raids a village by the Holy Land of Swords.
Gal Farion
 sends Eris to kill him after receiving a letter from him.

Jed Bluewolf

Jed is the Office Head of the Asura Kingdom's Reference Room. In K485, Jed published the book Asura Kingdom's <Biography of Rudeus Greyrat> compiled from various references from Rudeus' family and famous books from various authors and kingdoms.

Couleur Elrond

Couleur is the Assistant Office Head of Asura Kingdom's Reference Room. In K485, Couleur works as a recoder for the publishing of the the book Asura Kingdom's <Biography of Rudeus Greyrat>.

James Boreas Greyrat






James in the Game



James Boreas Greyrat holds a position of Cabinet Minister in the Asura Kingdom capital who became head of the Boreas Family after Sauros decides to let his sons fight with each other with the winner becoming the head.
 After Sauros' death due to the plot of other nobles and became the scapegoat of the
Teleport Incident
, James became Feudal Lord of the
Fittoa Region
 and struggles with the rebuilding of Fittoa and the search of its citizens. James also refuses to take Eris in and plans to have her be
Pilemon Notos Greyrat
's concubine.

Gordon Boreas Greyrat

Gordon Boreas Greyrat is one of Sauros' sons who also fought to become head of the Boreas Family but he marries into the Eurus family under the manipulations of James thus ending the route of being head of the Boreas.

Nights Eye Crow

Nights Eye Crow in the Anime
Nights Eye Crow battling Sylphiette in the Anime
Nights Eye Crow in the Manga
1/3

Nights Eye Crow is a female assassin working for Darius who is notoriously known to be responsible for the death of countless Asuran Nobles. Nights Eye Crow attempted to assassinate Ariel but she was defeated by Fitts and with such achievement, Fitts is recognized capable and worthy to be Ariel's Magic Guardian.

Sharia

Febritto

Febrrito in the Anime
Febritto in the Manga
1/2

Febritto is the manager of a Slave Market in Sharia owned by the Liam Company. When Rudeus was looking for a female dwarf child they can use to make statues for Zanoba, Febritto did not recommend the child they have due to her poor health but they bought her and named her
Julie
.
 In the Anime, Febritto is not named but credited in the ending as 受付の男 lit: Receptionist.

Voiced by:
Japanese
 Yuuki Tamai

Jacqueline

Magic Items
 in Sharia. Jacqueline is also the creator Rudeus' Signature Equipment such as Stone Cannon Gattling and Stone Cannon Shotgun.

Goliade






Goliade in the Anime



Goliade is a muscular girl studying at
Ranoa Magic Academy
 who confronted Rudeus for his apparent theft of underwear at the girl's dormitory but Fitts intervenes then threatens her to stand down so she is forced to back down.
 After Rudeus defeats Badigadi, Goliade is terrified of Rudeus like most of the students.

Voiced by:
Japanese

Kimiko Saitō

Frau “Flowing Clouds” Claudia

A statue of Frau Claudia in Ranoa Magic Academy in the Anime
A statue of Frau Claudia in Ranoa Magic Academy in the Manga
1/2

A magician from the guild “Leaves from the World’s Tree”, she planned to weaken her opposite faction by dealing with Barkol to attack them, but the plan backfired and almost resulted in her death. After being saved by
Alex
, she helped the group defeat the Emperor Dragon King. Later, she became the 56th guild leader in the Magician Guild of their generation and the first principal of the
Ranoa Magic Academy
.

Melissa






Melissa(left) in the Anime



Melissa, also known as Marissa is a female
demon
 with bird-like features such as feathers in her arms and Norn's room mate at the
dormitory
. Through Melissa's help, Norn is able to catch up with the lessons of the academy and get used to her new life in there. After Ruijerd, it was Melissa's help that changes Norn's impression towards demons from what her grandmother
Claire Latreia
 told her that they are evil creatures.

Japanese

Norn's Teacher(right) in the Anime



Norn's Teacher is a middle aged female Human who's name is not revealed with short gray hair who encouraged Norn to follow Rudeus' example and tells Rudeus about her previous interactions with her.

Norn's Friend in the Anime



Norns friend is a female
Beast Race
 who's name is not revealed and looks like a raccoon dog with a round face, timid eyes and a bob hair cut. When Rudeus visits their classroom, she is the first to tell Rudeus about her interactions with Norn
 and on the next day, she is seen walking together with Norn.

 suitors who challenged Rudeus to marry Pursena Adoldia but is defeated by him with a Quagmire (in the Light Novel) and Stone Bullet.

Japanese

Grace

Grace is a royal knight tasked with guarding the ranoan pricess in her pilgrimage journey, she meet Rudeus and his party when Roxi gets tasked with helping guard the princess

Basherant

Balda

Balda of the Great Cave, also known as Balda of the Hammer because of his tendency to beat anything to shape with his hammer whether its a building or his students is a first class dwarf craftsman and a 30 year veteran architect belonging to the Magician Guild of Basherant Kingdom. Balda is an old friend of
Talhand
 and
Elinalise Dragonroad
 who heard about Rudeus of the Quagmire from them. Balda worked on the renovation and repair of the second
Greyrat Family
 Household in
Sharia
, Ranoa Kingdom which took him two weeks to complete.

Elise






Elise in the Anime



Elise is an escort in Rosenburg who greatly respects Rudeus for healing out of kindness a young girl whom Elise treats like a younger sister which non payment would otherwise result to the girl being turned to a
slave
 during his mission to gather snow. Elise also realizes that Rudeus is afflicted by impotency after separating from Eris and she is also present when Sara broke up with him. Next morning, Elise meets Sara again asking for Rudeus but Elise angrily rebukes her and tells Sara of Rudeus' ailment.

Conrad is a seasoned adventurer in his 40 and the leader of the Rank A party Cave A Mond that comprises a Magic-Warrior and 3 Magicians where Rudeus would occasionally or temporarily join for missions. Conrad is also an Advanced Rank Fire Mage who dropped out of Ranoa Magic Academy on his fifth year and informs Rudeus that the letter he received is real and gives further details about the
Special Students
 which eventually led to Rudeus to study there.

Chiki

Full name Chiquita, an assassin with a petite build. She was found dehydrated in the middle of a desert by
Alex
, later helped him defeat the Emperor Dragon King. She had a crush on Alex.

Shaina Marianne

She got the nickname “Death God Knight/Reaper Knight” due to her exceptional danger evasion sense and secretly being hunted by Barkol, a Chief Knight of Milis, that often leads to her teammates’ death. She saved
Alex
’s life in the fight against the Emperor Dragon King.
Randolph Marianne
 is the grandson of her and Alex.

 First wife that lost her life in the

.

Guella Ha in the Anime



Guella Ha is the lizard that is tamed by Ruijerd and has been the ride of the
Dead End
 party through out the Demon Continent. During their journey, Guella Ha has grown attached to Eris that would lick her head and leave her hair drenched in drool. The lizard is eventually sold and Rudeus gives the lizard the name Guella Ha before they set sail for the Millis Continent as bringing the lizard will cost additional for them.

Bagura Hagura

Is the Demon king of the city of Krasma, he have connections with the Seafolks race.

Millis Continent

Great Forest

Giger

She was the Beast God who rallied the Beast Race to defend the Great Forest. Fighting on the front lines with might and wit, Giger successfully defended the Great Forest and earned his fame as the hero of the Beast Race. In extension, the Doldia tribe descended from Giger became the royalty equivalent of the Great Forest and the guardian of the Sacred Beast.
.

Laklana in the Anime



She is the Dedoldia Woman that take care of Rudeus when he was imprisoned in the Doldia Village. In addition to being the guardian and caretaker of the
Sacred Beast
.

Makoto Koichi
;

Millishion

Harry Grimoire

Pope of the
Milis Religion
 and
Cliff Grimoire
's grandfather. After the attempted assassination on the
Miko of Memory
 had failed, the conflict between the relgion's faction intensifies. So Harry sends Cliff to Ranoa Magic Academy for refuge from the conflict.
 He meets with Rudeus who is introduced by Cliff and grants him permission to sell Ruijerd Dolls and allow the establishment of the
Rude Mercenary Company
 in Millishion.

The commander of the missionary knights of Millishion, Ruijerd saved his life in the past, he also use the nickname of Gash Broche.

A Duke that was the director of the Millis continental customs office.

A merchant that comercialize goods between the Bazaar and Rapan

The head of Galban guards that protect the caravan, aka "Hawkeye" due to his
demon eye
 ability to sense monsters from far away.

Tont✝

One of the guards that protect the caravan of Galban, died in bandit attack.

Carmelita

One of the guards that protect the caravan of Galban, aka "The Bonecrusher" and had a child with Tont.

Dragon World

Gora and Scrubava

Gora and Scrubava are Dragon Warriors from the Steel
Dragon Tribe
 who were recruited by
Maxwell
 to join his unit and later become subordinates of
Laplace
 and joins his search for
Crystal
's killer.
 They were both killed by Necrolia Nacrolia who found his hideout while battling along with Laplace.

Necrolia Nacrolia

Necrolia Nacrolia is a demon with dark skin, four arms and red eyes who is one of the Eight Great Demon Kings and son of the
Demon God
 who orders him to stop the progress of the Dragon Tribe's Teleportation Research. Nacrolia manages to kill Crystal but is unable to teleport back to the Demon World due to a flaw in planning and is gathering materials to return but he is captured by Laplace and turned over to
Szilard
.

Demon World

Kirisis Calisis

Demon Emperor Kirisis Calisis is the wife of the First Demon God and the mother of
Kishirika Kishirisu
. Kirisis is a brilliant magician and the inventor of
Magic Circles
 and Laplace mentions her to be the source of all the magic known today. When the Gods agreed to foster cooperation between the Six Worlds, Calisis did her best to serve the
Dragon World
 and because of her intelligent, competent and calm personality which reminds them of
Lunaria
, many of the Dragon Tribe change their perceptions toward demons. In addition to both being fellow wives of Gods, Calisis and Lunaria become close friends because they share similar personalities and this would gradually diminish the hostility of the Dragon World towards the Demon World.

Necross Lacross

Immortal Demon King Necross Lacross is one of the Eight Great Demon Kings of the Demon World and the father of
Badigadi
 and
Atoferatofe Raibaku
. After the Gods agreed to foster cooperation between the Six Worlds and he worked together with Laplace to recruit collaborators from the Six Worlds to help advance each of their civilizations and maintain the peace.
 During the war between the Dragon World and Demon World, Necross is imprisoned after being accused of collaborating with Laplace to kill Kirisis and is thrown to prison. Necross managed to break out of prison and finds the Demon World on the verge of collapse and tries to escape with the Demon God's baby but he was found by Laplace and asks that he let them go while protecting the baby. Laplace lets them go and directs them to a portal to the Human World after hearing his story.

Other

Al Farion

Human race. The First Sword God, active around the time of the First North God. Implied to be an ancestor of
Gal Farion
.

Reidar

The first Water God, double god tier in sword and magic (Water God Class Magician). Saved a kingdom from a Water Dragon King but the king broke the promise and refused to let him marry the princess, who left the kingdom on her own and eloped with him. Thus formed the traditions that the Water Gods would adopt the name Reidar (if male) or
Reida
 (if female), and their spouses need to give up their family.

Auber Corvette
 that
Dead End
 Party meets on their way to Wind port.

English
 Austin Sisk

Largon Hargon

Underground Demon King Largon Hargon is one of the Great Demon Kings at the service of Great Demon Empress Kishirika Kishirisu who fought at the First
Human-Demon Wars
. He is a God Ranked Earth Magician who created the Galgau Ruins beyond the reach of humans and creates underground tunnels and roads for ambush.

Feroze Star

Feroze Star is an Emperor Rank Fire Magician and one of the 7 heroes who fought in the
Human-Demon Wars
 with Perugius. Feroze was worried that he might not be able to return before leaving for battle so he names his unborn son after him. Feroze dies in battle against Demon King Ryner Kaizel and his final moments thinking of his unborn son that he will never meet. His son inherited his name and his legacy but stories about him is mixed such as he became a magnificent magician in his own right and some stories say that he became a good for nothing nobody. Feroze Star's tale is known by everyone that naming an unborn child before going on a journey would bring a terrible disaster.

Big Bro






Big Bro in the Manga



"Big Bro" is a young man who is observing Soldat Heckler until he gets attacked by a bird monster and tells Soldat to call him "Big Bro". He later brings him to their settlement and to an old man who plans to teach
Swordsmanship
 to Soldat.

Unnamed Old Adventurer






Big Bro in the Manga



Soldat is raised and trained by an Old Adventurer who also lives in the dumps and walks with 2 peg legs. Upon seeing Soldat he immediately takes a liking to him and trains him in the sword.

Reference

Miracle
=======

Miracle
 (
ミラクル
,

Mirakuru
)
 is the twenty-fourth chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Roxy Migurdia

Elinalise Dragonroad

Summary

Visiting a market place in Wenport, Roxy reminds Elinalise that they need to gather intel but the elf is too keen on flirting, a continuous effect of her nymphomaniacal curse- handy for Elinalise with talkative men in town. Stopping for a bite to eat, Elinalise asks if Roxy likes boys, like Rudeus, earning a flustered reaction; and deflecting with a bad joke. As Roxy is enjoying her lunch, the food stall owner credits her new chef, a girl relocated by the Fittoa incident. The young girl recalls her initial fear being suddenly relocated, but how she was rescued and employed by the shop owner who knew Human language. As the shop owner and the girl hug familiarly, Elinalise awes at their love as Roxy notes her romantic side; Elinalise shares that she has a son and misses him. Seeing the girl happy, Roxy feels more encouraged that Rudeus is doing well given his studies and abilities. While Roxy wishes the girl and shop owner well, a sudden breeze blows up her skirt for the girl to gaze in awe, and runs away in shame. The crewman from the ship
(who returned Roxy to her cabin when she was seasick)
 walks by and stops long enough to meet the girl, recognizing him as her father. The two happily reunite, as Roxy continues running after her sacred panties provided another miracle.

Appearances

Characters

Roxy Migurdia

Elinalise Dragonroad

Skills

None

Regions

Others

Differences from Light Novel

Is a original chapter for the manga.

Trivia

Is the shortest chapter of the manga with only 8 pages

Navigation

Missed Connections
==================

Missed Connections
 (すれ違い
Surechigai
) is the thirteenth episode of the
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on October 10, 2021.

Synopsis

Roxy is looking for Rudeus and the others who have disappeared. While searching for clues, Roxy hears rumors of the infamous Dead End, and comes to Wind port with Elinalise and Talhand, acquaintances of Paul. In the meantime, Rudeus and his friends make a deal with the smuggling organization of Gallus, and cross over to the continent of Millis, which they have been longing for on the condition that they free the slaves in the hideout......

Plot

TBA

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Ruijerd Superdia

Roxy Migurdia

Elinalise Dragonroad

Talhand

Gyes Dedoldia

Gustav Dedoldia

Minitona Dedoldia

Tersena Adoldia

Holy Beast

Gallus Cleaner

Nokopara
 (Flashback)

Blaze
 (Flashback)

Dale
 (Flashback)

Locations

Demon Continent

Wind Port

Millis Continent

Zant Port

Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 4

Side Story: Missed Connections, Extra Story

Chapter 4: The Sage on Board

Chapter 5: The Demon in the Warehouse

Chapter 6: The Beastfolk Children

Differences with the light novel:

Roxy's feelings about leaving and returning to the Demon Continent were cut.

The description of Elinalise and Tallhand's equipment was cut.

The details about howRoxy's group formed and made their way to the Demon Continent as well as the Asura Kingdom's actions were cut.

A short scene where Rudeus sells the Lizard that was used as transport was cut.

A short scene where the boat that was traveling to Zant port was attacked by a octopus and defended by a S-rank party was cut.

In the Light Novel, the smuggler hideout was a warehouse near the wharf.

In the light novel, there were seven children - some were beast race and some were elves. The anime has only six children and they are all beast race.

The anime kills one of the beast children.

A short scene where Ruijerd and Rudeus gathered and burned the corpses of the smugglers was cut.

In the light novel, the trap that maintained captive the holy beast was a magic barrier that came from a tool of the upper floor and a chain in his body.

A short thought of how the two beast man looks similar to Ghislaine was cut.

In the light novel, the voice magic used by Gyes is with both hands near his mouth.

In the light novel, there is a short scene where Gustav meets Ruijerd which was cut.

Mobile Game
===========

Mobile game visual

Mushoku Tensei
-
 I'll Seriously Try Even If It's Made Into a Game
 (
無職転生 ～ゲームになっても本気だす～
,

Mushoku Tensei ~Game ni Nattemo Honki Dasu~
)
 is a mobile game that was announced on October 10 of 2020
 and has been released on March 27, 2021. The game ended its service on August 31 2022.

The game was developed by
Aiming Co., Ltd
 and is published by Beaglee Co, is available on Android/iOS. The game is free-to-play with micro-transactions.

Story

The game use a is partially voiced and the story is displayed like a visual novel, sometimes using scenes from the anime. the characters portraits use live 2d models for playable characters and normal 2d models for not playable characters. The game follow the same story that the light novel with some elements and changes from the anime, the game also include stories released in other mediums like the novel stories from the manga version.

The game so far cover until the Volume 3 of the light novel.

The game also contain scenarios supervised by the author and specials non canon scenarios made only for the game.

Scenarios Supervised by the Author

Paul Gaiden: Runaway arc
Paul Gaiden: Training arc

Gameplay

The game is a RPG where you use 3 characters and a support from another player to fight waves of enemies and clear the stages. In combat, the normal attack is automatic, meanwhile the player control the use of the 2 special skills of each character.

To obtain characters, you need to summon them through the gacha using the currency named "Phantom stones" that you obtain during the gameplay or buying it with real money, the rarity of the characters are between 3☆ (common), 4☆ (Uncommon) and 5☆(rare) the higher the rarity, more strong the character, you can equip and upgrade them with items and additional copies of the same character (Base character + 5 copies)

The characters  are divided in different class, each one with his own vantage and disadvantage against the other classes, if there isn't a vantage, they deal and receive neutral damage

Mages (Fire>Wind>Earth>Water>Fire....)

Light and Dark (Deal and Receive effective damage to the opposite class)

Sword style (Sword God>North God>Water God>Sword God......)

Warriors (Deal and Receive effective damage to the other classes)

Main Menu

In the main screen one can see the user name, current summoning stones in possession, stamina, level, active events and navigate through the other options of the game. The character that appear here depends of the leader of the last party group used.

Adventure Guild

You can obtain materials to upgrade you characters, fight raid battle against monster with other users and other special battle here.

Battle

Menu where you can use your characters to battle, the main battle mode is loosely based in the events of each light novel volume, divided in 3 parts of 15 battles each one, with a boss every 5 battle.

Story

You can read the main story and side story of Mushoku Tensei here. To progress in the story, you need to progress in the Battle mode.

Adventure preparation

Menu where one can organize his party, upgrade the characters and weapons and sell unnecessary character/items for money and medals.

Memory

You can see a profile of the playable characters.

Achievements

You can claim rewards like Phantom stones or items after clearing certain conditions in the game.

Store

You can buy with real money summoning stones or exchange special currency like medals for items.

Gacha

Place where you can spend your phantom stones to obtain characters or friend points to obtain items, the characters that you may obtain depends of the active banner and some of them are active for a limited time

Options

You can configure certain options of the game, see your friends oand bind the account to your mail.

Playable Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Sylphiette

Roxy Migurdia

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Paul Greyrat

Zenith Greyrat

Lilia

Ghislaine Dedoldia

Almanfi

Ruijerd Superdia

Elinalise Dragonroad

Talhand

Nokopara

Monsters
========

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Monsters
 are creatures that mutated from normal creatures in presence of
mana
, which pose threat to people in the world.

Overview

Monsters are the result of sudden mutations in normal animals. If they are lucky enough to grow in numbers, establish themselves as a new species, and develop intellect over the generations, they become fiends - a class of beasts that have intellect. But apparently, many creatures that possessed intelligence but still attacked humans are referred to as monsters; there are also cases of fiends growing more savage and brutal over the generations, reverting back into monsters. Due to the fact that monsters thrive on
Mana
, areas with higher mana density like the
Demon Continent
 or Labyrinths like the
Teleportation Labyrinth
 tend to have more powerful monsters.

As such, the
Adventure Guild
's Rank C and above requests are mostly subjugating a certain group of monsters or gathering parts of monsters for crafts and/or proof of kills. Adventurers usually have books on how to handle different kinds of monsters in their current region like <<
Fittoa
's Monsters, Ecology and Weaknesses>> found in the
Greyrat
 Household in
Buena Village
.

There are also plant-based monsters called Treants, which are typically ordinary plants that had sucked up too much magical energy and mutated into violent creatures. There are a considerable variety of specific monsters that fell into this broad category, but their basic patterns of behavior are very similar: they pretended to be normal trees and attack anyone who come too close. After some time, they produce seeds that grow into more of their kind
.

List of Monsters

*Monster names in Italic are those that don't have an official name, or the name is unconfirmed.

Central Continent

Name

Rank

Habitat

Description

Assault Dog

E

Asura Kingdom





Advancing Assault Dogs


Assault Dogs are canine monsters that move about like trained Dobermanns
.

Terminate Boar

D ~ B

Asura Kingdom

Sylphiette defeating a Terminate Boar in the Anime
Terminate Boar towering over Rudeus
1/2
Terminate Boars are bipedal, four-armed porcine monsters
. They usually attack with a loyal pack of assault dogs. They're ranked D individually, but could be ranked C or even B when attacking with their packs
.

Vampire Treant

?

Asura Kingdom

Vampire Treants are vine-like parasitic treants that latch on other small treants to drain them off fluids and mana. Their presence would greatly reduce the number of small treants in the area
.

Red Leaf Tiger

B

Ejin Forest

Red Leaf Tigers are one of the most vicious monsters in the Ejin Forest
.

Karentosaurus

A

Ejin Forest

Karentosaurus is a giant green lizard over 5 meters in length. It is the ruler of the Ejin Forest
.

Shironian Flying Rat

D

Shirone Kingdom

These are monsters similar to flying squirrels about a meter in length. They are capable of flying between trees in high speed, slicing through their victim's neck
.

Lesser Treant

F

Worldwide

Lesser Treants are mutated saplings that tend to imitate ordinary trees until a target wander into striking distance. They are weak and slow enough that an average adult with no real training could chop one apart without too much difficulty
.

Wraith

?

Worldwide





A wraith appearing in ruins


Wraith are undead monsters formed from restless souls. They look like translucent humanoid figures without legs that float in the air, and are impervious to most attacks. Fire spells could burn away a wraith temporarily, and the only way to get rid of them for good is using
Divine Strike Magic
. They would animate a group of skeletons to fight for them
.

Skeletons

?

Worldwide






Skeletons animated by a wraith


Skeletons are undead monsters animated by a wraith. Their skill level and weapons depend on the person they were before death
. They are immortal as long as the wraith animating them remains intact; smashing them with blunt force attacks is the most effective way to disable them temporarily, but they would eventually piece themselves together. Divine Strike Magic could erase them permanently, but the wraith could always summon a new one
.

Deadly Wraith

A

Worldwide

High-ranking wraiths that could use attack magic and command its skeletons in a more vicious manner. They could only be defeated with advanced or higher level
Divine Strike Magic
.

Red Dragon

A ~ S

Red Dragon Mountain Range


https://mushokutensei.fandom.com/wiki/File:MT-AN-S1-E08-WEBM-01.webm



A Red Dragon attacking Orsted with its fire breath


Red Dragons are the most ferocious and dangerous among dragon species, and are regarded as the strongest monsters on the Central Continent. A single one is within lower S-rank, but they typically gather in hordes of several hundred. Of special note was their detection ability: they never miss anything that encroach on their territory, even animals as small as a dog. Since the mountain range is the place these creatures call home, it came to be known as the Red Dragon Mountains: an impassable mountain range that is a symbol of death.
While Red Dragons are formidable in combat abilities, they are terrible fliers that couldn't take flight from flat terrain. To fly, they needed to leap off tall cliffs or run down a long slope. Although the Central Continent had tall mountains, the land is mostly occupied by rolling plains and forests, thus it is rare for those living on the plains to be attacked by a Red Dragons. Granted, occasionally there would be individuals that gets caught in a turbulent wind and fall to the plains, bringing devastation to the area. When this happens, soldiers or adventurers would be called in to deal with the disturbance
. Forty A or S-ranked adventurers is the minimum recommended number of members for dragon slaying
. (Or one "Quagmire" -
Rudeus Greyrat
)

Northern Territories

Name

Rank

Habitat

Description

Luster Grizzly

B

Lake Cuculu

Luster Grizzlies trapped in Rudeus' Quagmire
Luster Grizzlies attacked by Timothy's Ex Flame
Sleeping Luster Grizzlies
Luster Grizzlies covered in mud
1/4
The Luster Grizzly is one of the more common kind of monsters found in the northern region of the Central Continent. In appearance, it is basically a large bear with a white coat and a single black stripe that ran vertically down its middle. They move in sizable packs, and when winter drew near, they work together to build up huge collective stockpiles of food. At that time of year, their attacks on humans grew much more frequent.
They were comparatively mellow in the summer months, when they tended to hang around sources of water to mate. They couldn't see too well in the dark and move sluggishly at night, thus the standard method of dealing with a large pack is to find them during mating season and launch a surprise attack at night
.

Snow Drake

A ~ S

Galgau Ruins, Ilbron Cave

Counter Arrow Party battling Snow Drakes in the Anime
Snow Drake in the Anime
Snow Drake remains
Rudeus facing Snow Drakes
1/4
 Snow drakes are a lesser kind of dragon with pure white scales. They had no wings, and tend to be three or four meters in size. Instead of soaring through the skies, they nest deep inside caves and dungeons, typically in large groups. Being powerful creatures usually found in packs, they are considered S-ranked threats in combat. They hated bright light, which meant they don't venture above ground very often. They are said to be relatively docile, rarely attacking anyone unless their nests are threatened.
Their scales has strong resistance to ice magic making it superb heat insulators to be used in constructions, or as materials for crafting shields and armors
.

Giant Bat

F ~ E

Galgau Ruins






Giant Bats in manga


Giant bats are bats about a meter in size
.

Giant Frog

?

Galgau Ruins

Giant frogs residing in underground lakes that would jump on preys that approach the water surface. They are more than 5 meters in size and have blue-colored skin
.

Snow Buffalo

?

Trier Forest

Snow Buffaloes in the Anime
Rudeus searching through the pile of corpses gathered by the Snow Buffaloes
A herd of Snow Buffaloes in the Manga
1/3
Snow buffaloes are carnivorous bovine monsters that flock together in wooded areas, forming a singular herd in each forest. Their gray coats made for superb camouflage in a blizzard, allowing them to launch surprise attacks on unsuspecting adventurers. They generally spend the winter in one area, birthing and rearing their young in the snow. If someone was attacked by a herd, it was usually because that person had trespassed on their territory. Unlike wild animals, they don't immediately flee when attacked and will continue fighting until they realize they cannot win. They also have a habit of leaving left-overs other than bones into a pile to use the stench to lure other animals to be their steady supply of food.
.

Snowfall Treant

?

Northern Territories






Snowfall Treant towering over Rudeus


Snowfall Treants are low-ranked monsters exclusive to the northern region that are ordinary treants during summer. Snow accumulate on their branches during winter, in which they use to impede passing people by dumping snow in an attempt to bury them
.

Icefall Treant

D

Trier Forest

Icefall Treant protected by Ice Armor
Icefall Treant feigning death
1/2
Icefall Treants are considered D rank but can go higher depending on their size which grows as they age. They are able to use ice magic, enabling them to hurl large blocks of ice on their targets and conjure a coat of ice armor to protect themselves. They are able to move around, capturing other creatures with their roots instead of killing them to slowly drain them for nutrients. Since they lack intelligence, they could only repeat simple attack patterns and will feign death when they realize that they cannot defeat their enemy or are rendered unable to attack
.

Mustard Treant

?

Northern Territories

Mustard Treants are treants living in the forests of the Northern Territories. They produce seeds with a nut inside that looks similar to a walnut, and its shell resembles buckwheat chaff. The shells can be crushed and made into stuffing material of pillows
.

Giant Spider

?

?

As their name implies, they are large spider monsters. Their silk can be made into fishing lines
.

Riadiata Frog

?

?

Radiata Frogs are a type of frog monsters. Their air sac can be made into fishing floaters
 and condoms.

Snow Buck

?

Northern Territories

Snow Bucks are giant deer-like monsters. Their fawns would bury themselves in small caves under the tree during winter, in order to avoid their natural predators
.

Ice Claw Tiger

?

Northern Territories

Ice Claw Tigers are carnivorous tiger monsters that dig through snow and ambush their prey from within. Snow bucks are one of the species among their prey
.

Snow Dragon

S

Northern Territories

Snow Dragons are rare mutated individuals of snow drakes. They are more than twice as large as snow drakes, capable of using ice breaths and high-level water magic. Though unable to fly, they are capable of three-dimensional manoeuvres within valleys using their strong leg. Sometimes they would attack snow drake packs to prey on them
.

Earth Dragon

A ~ S

Earth Dragon's Valley

Earth Dragons are dragon-type monsters that could use earth magic, with the appearance of giant lizards with a rocky shell on their back. They build their nests on the walls of the valley, and would not attack people unless their territory is intruded. Perhaps thanks to their shell, they have a peculiar habit of ignoring enemies coming from above, but fiercely attack enemies that come from below. They are natural enemies of Red Dragons
.
Earth Dragons dislike the shining blue fungi growing at the bottom of the valley, thus they would refrain from approaching the area. People who fall into the valley could avoid their detection by spreading the blue liquid obtained from the hidden cave shrine on body
.

Invisible Wolf

?

Forest of No Return

As their name implies, Invisible Wolves are invisible canine monsters. When they die, they would lose their invisibility, revealing their true form as quadrupedal monsters with white fur
.

King Dragon

A ~ S

King Dragon Mountain Range

King Dragons are a species of dragons that could use gravity magic. The 48 magic swords and the King Dragon Sword Kajakut crafted by Julian Jalisco are made from the materials extracted from King Dragon King's body.

Scythe Hound

Scythe Hounds are canine monsters larger than wolves with fangs protruding from their mouth like scythes. Their common tactics is to lure some party members away from the main group and defeat both groups separately
.

Fenris Wolf

S

Millis Ruins

Fenris Wolves are giant six-legged wolves with black fur, giant fangs and two flaming tails. It is a type of monster that usually resides in the mountainous regions in the
Demon Continent
. One of them is the guardian of the Millis Ruins Labyrinth. They are highly intelligent and agile, able to identify and effectively counter the tactics used by their opponents
.

Ibri Lizard

?

Country West

Ibri Lizard is a type of giant lizard over ten meters in length with purple-red skin. The Ibri disease always spreads near the area where these lizards live, and they always made their turf near the Eant flowers that could cure the disease. Some scholars theorized that Ibri Lizards are spreading the Ibri disease, so that they could prey on people who come to pick the flowers
.

Giant Centipede

D

Gamonda Ruins

As their name implies, Giant Centipedes are venomous centipede monsters about two meters in length that live in the ruin in groups. They are also commonly found in forests, but it's rare to find them in large groups
.

Demon Continent

"First, there are no roads. There's a path, but it's nothing like the ones in Milis Continent and Central Continent, paths with few
monsters that are safe don't exist anywhere. No matter where you walk around, C rank or above monsters just come out to attack you."

-
Geese Nukadia
 to
Paul Greyrat
 on the monsters of the Demon Continent

Name

Rank

Habitat

Description

Acid Wolf

C

Biegoya Region

Acid Wolves are large canine monsters over 3 meters in length that could spit some kind of caustic fluid from their mouths
.

Great Tortoise

?

Biegoya Region






Great Tortoise slain by Ruijerd


Great tortoises are giant tortoises that are commonly found on the plains of the Demon Continent. The are usually around 8 meters in length, whereas the largest of them could be over 20 meters
. Their meat is a staple food source and the
Migurd
 tribe use their shells as the roofs of their houses
.

Pax Coyote

C

Biegoya Region






Dead End
 battling Pax Coyote in the Anime


The Pax Coyotes are canine monsters about 2 meters in length that tended to come by the dozens. They aren't exactly pack animals - a single coyote formed its own group by reproducing once every few months through division, almost like an amoeba. Any given group would steadily swell in size over time, with all the new coyotes under the complete control of their leader. If that leader happened to fall in battle, a different coyote would instantly assume its position. Their strength is mostly in their sheer numbers, but their perfect coordination and discipline make them genuinely dangerous
.

Stone Treant

D

Biegoya Region

Stone treants are treants that disguise themselves as rocks and attack anyone that comes too close. They are usually slain to be used as firewood
. Their seeds are edible and often served as fried beans in the bar
.

Giant Stone Turtle

?

Biegoya Region

Giant turtles that roams about in the plains. Magic stones could be found in their body, but they are rare and hard to find
.

Executioner

B

Petrified Forest






Executioner in manga


The Executioner is a type of humanoid monster formed from the zombified remains of someone who'd been an adventurer in life. They are equipped with enormous swords and suits of thick plate armor that would dissolve into thin air when they are defeated. The sheer weight of their equipment meant they couldn't move too quickly, but they are extremely sturdy and wield their weapon with surprising finesse
.

Almond Anaconda

B

Petrified Forest






Almond Anaconda in the Anime


Almond Anacondas are snake monsters travel in groups of three to five. They took their name from the distinctive almond-like pattern on their bodies, which were typically about 3 meters long. Their fangs are full of deadly venom, and they move with great agility
.

White Fang Cobra

B

Gaslow Region

White Fang Cobras are venomous snake monsters. They are agile and covered with magic-resistant scales
.

Red Hood Cobra

A

Gaslow Region, Petrified Forest






Red Hood Cobra defeated by Dead End


Red Hood Cobra is a more powerful variant of White-Fang Cobra. They are larger in size and far more agile, with enough reflex to dodge projectiles after they're launched. Their scales are tough and resistant to fire magic, whereas their fangs are enormous and full of deadly venom
.

Dead End Party riding atop Geraha, a Transport Lizard


 These six-legged lizards are the main riding mount of the denizens of the Demon Continent. Ruijerd tamed one of these lizards that the Dead End Party used as their mount on their journey through the continent that is named
Geraha
. Geraha eventually got sold to a lizard merchant since bringing the lizard to the ship will cost taxes and the main mount of the
Millis Continent
 are horses
.

Goblin

E

Forest Boundaries






Goblins in the Anime


Goblins are a species of monster that mostly lived on the boundaries between forests and open plains. They are humanoid in shape and use crude weapons, but couldn't comprehend human speech. In small numbers, they are mostly harmless, but if left alone for too long, they would rapidly reproduce and begin attacking any nearby villages. They are considered a somewhat dangerous pest. However, as they reside on the outskirts of wooded areas, they also acted as a sort of natural buffer against the more dangerous monsters that spawned inside forests. They are weak creatures and could be slain without too much difficulty by any young man or woman who knew how to use a sword
.

Utan

Forest Boundaries

A monkey-like monster
.

Blue Dragon

A ~ S

Blue Dragon Mountain Range

Blue Dragons are dragon type monsters that fly across the world, only return to the mountain range to nest when they were laying eggs or raising their young, like migratory birds. The difference is that they return once every 10 years
.

Large water striders surfing swiftly across the water during rainy seasons, only to leap up suddenly and attack

Sandworms are worm monsters that wait motionlessly in earth and burst out of the ground to attack their preys when they pass by. The forest dwelling variants are about 20-30cm in diameter
.

Phalanx Ant

Great Forest

Phalanx Ants are ant-like creatures that march around in an orderly formation like army ants, consuming everything in their path. The variants in the great forest are much smaller than those in the Begaritt Continent
.

Begaritt Continent

Name

Rank

Habitat

Description

Sea Dragon

A

Northern Region

Sea Dragons are aquatic dragon-type monsters. Magic stones produced by them could be made into high quality water-attribute magic staves
.

Succubus

C

Desert

Succubus disguised as a woman
Succubus true form while flying
Succubus in the Manga
1/3

Succubus is a kind of monster that looks like a voluptuous woman at a glance. Their skin is blue and they have some characteristics similar to that of a bat, like the face and wings. Their nails are also abnormally long
. Their combat strength is around E-rank, but is classified as C-rank monsters due to the threat they pose
. They are originally rare monsters native to the southwest region of the
Demon Continent
, but are currently spread across the entire Begaritt Continent due to
Laplace
 deliberately mass producing and releasing them onto the continent to break the human defense there.
Succubus can release pheromones that smell like an intolerable stench to women and a charming sweet scent to men, which would cloud men's judgment and put them into uncontrollable lust. They would then bring a few victims back to their lair for consumption, leaving the remaining men fight each other to death, as charmed men would see other men as enemies. The only way to nullify the effect is using intermediate or higher level
detoxification magic
 or having sexual intercourse with a woman
.
Sometimes a succubus may command a group of Giant Bats as its subordinates, mostly to separate the females from the males
.

Giant Bat

F ~ E

Desert

Giant bats are bats about a 50cm to a meter in size. A succubus might command them during its attack on parties with both females and males.

Twin Death Scorpion

B

Desert

Twin Death Scorpion in the Anime
1/1
Twin Death Scorpions are giant scorpions around 2 meters in length. Its tail is split in two, and it could lash both sides around independently of the other. Their stings deliver a very dangerous poison that could only be cured by Intermediate-level Detoxification magic. These creatures have a relatively tough carapace, but they aren't too nimble
.

Cactus Treant

C

Desert

Cactus Treant are C-rank treants capable of shooting needles at their enemies and using basic earth magic
.

Sandworm

?

Desert

Sandworms are worm monsters that wait motionlessly in the sand, waiting for a prey to pass above, at which point they burst out of the ground to attack it. The species in the desert are over 5 meters long and around meter in diameter, big enough to swallow a human whole
.

Phalanx Ant

E ~ S

Desert

Phalanx Ants are bright red ant-like creatures that march around in an orderly formation like army ants. Each ant is around 30 centimeters to a meter in size. They also came in different shapes: some have wings, while some even have oddly human-looking lower bodies. The queen is over 2 meters in length and has the upper body of a female human.
Phalanx Ants are one of the most dangerous monsters in the desert. Unlike other ants, they don't establish static colonies but spent their lives in constant motion, eating everything in their path. They did have a number of natural predators, but their sheer numbers made them capable of overwhelming any terrestrial foes, including stray dragons. At certain intervals, they would pause their journey to make a temporary nest, where they breed and replenish their numbers with the next generation. None of the individual ants are that powerful -- smaller ones are probably E-ranked, whereas larger ones could be D or C, but a group of thousands is a threat in high S range.

Gyroraptor

?

Desert






A pack of Gyroraptors


Gyroraptors are bipedal lizards resembling velociraptors that appear in groups, feasting on animal corpses
.

Sand Garuda

C ~ A

Desert

Sand Garudas are giant chicken-like monsters about 5 meters in size that prey on Gyroraptors. They are said to be a particularly large species of Garuda. A single specimen is considered a C-rank monster, but those that move in packs are classified as B or A-rank threats, depending on their size
.

T-Rex Lizards

?

Desert

These are giant lizards resembling T-rex that prey on Sand Garudas
.

Behemoth

S

Desert

A docile Behemoth that is not attacking Rudeus and Elinalise in the Anime
Rapan encaged by the remains of a Colossal Behemoth defeated by
Kalman II
 in the Anime
1/2
As their name implies, Behemoths are colossal monsters that have lengths ranging between 100 and 1000 meters. According to Rudeus, they look like blue whales that have multiple elephant-like legs attached. They are quite docile by the monster's standard as they tend to leave people alone unless attacked. It's hard to kill them as their outer hide is extremely tough, their sheer size makes ordinary attacks futile, and they can escape by burrowing deep underground when they're in danger. Despite their massive size, hardly anyone has ever found a Behemoth corpse
.
It is said that the Maze City of
Rapan
 was built inside of the rib cage of an especially large Behemoth slain by
Kalman II
, and many labyrinths nearby appeared due to the remains after its death.

Griffon

B ~ A

Desert

Griffon evading Rudeus' Earth Heddgehog n the Anime
Griffon in the Anime
Griffon working in pairs in the Anime
An attacking Griffon in the Light Novel
1/4
Griffon are sand-colored monsters with body of a lion and head of an eagle. They are territorial and would guard their own turf closely. Despite being unable to use magic, they are physically powerful and are capable of flight. In addition, they possess enough intelligence to organize coordinated attacks and ambushes in a flock. They are ranked B individually and A in a group
.

 kept one of them as their household pet and named it
Jirou

Tarantula Deathlord

Tarantula Deathlord shooting web to disarm Roxy

1/4
Tarantula Deathlord is a type of huge poisonous spiders. Even though they are tarantulas, they spits out webs with accuracy that can disarm their target. Their poison can be cured using elementary detoxification magic
.

Iron Crawler

B

Floor 2 ~ 3

Roxy using Earth Fortress to stop the advance of Iron Crawlers
Roxy using Flame Slice on an Iron Crawler
A swarm of Iron Crawlers
1/3
Iron Crawlers are caterpillar monsters with tough carapace and significant weight, resembling heavy tanks which makes them the frontline when attacking an enemy.
. They are about one meter tall and two meters long. Contrary to their heavy appearance, they are rather fast
.

Mad Skull

A

Floor 3 ~ 4

Mad Skull hurling Mud on Roxy's Earth Fortress
Roxy using Blizzard Storm on a Mad Skull
A Mad Skull in the Anime
1/3
Mad Skulls are monsters resembling headless giants made of mud, about 2.5 meters in height, with a girth that spoke to their durable nature. These creatures have a human skull buried in its chest area, which also happens to be their weak point. They move slowly, but they could shrug off any blows dealt to the mud-covered parts of their body, and could hide the skull inside their body when they sense danger. Their method of attack is to sling mud or use a spell similar to Stone Cannon.
Though Mad Skulls look like simple golems, they are quite intelligent, capable of issuing commands to lesser monsters like Tarantula Deathlords and Iron Crawlers into formations to attack or command them to defend a Teleportation Circle to prevent their enemies from escaping. They would attack in formation with Iron Crawlers in the vanguard, Death Road Tarantulas in the middle to shoot webs, and themselves at the rear to sling their mud.
.

Armored Warrior

A

Floor 4 ~ 5

Two Armored Warriors in the Anime
Roxy using Icicle Edge against the Armored Warrior
Elinalise using her Gladius to cut the Armored Warrior
1/3
Armored Warriors are animated suits of rusty armor that makes light weapons ineffective against them and they have four arms, each holding a razor-sharp blade
. They can use the
Water God Style
 to counter both physical and magical attacks. Since they are considered undead monsters, they are weak against earth and
Divine Strike Magic
.

Devouring Devil

A

Floor 5 ~ 6

Devouring Devils being repelled by the smoke of a burnt Talfro branch
Devouring Devils in the Anime
1/2
Devouring Devils are monsters with a large gaping mouth and razor-sharp fangs. It also had long limbs and pointed claws that enable them to scale the walls and ceiling, allowing them to penetrate the formation of an adventurer's party. They are quick and are capable of dishing out powerful attacks, but have low defenses. Their eggs are dark, oblong-shaped and coated in liquid, resembling cockroach eggs
.
The best countermeasure against them is to burn the roots of Talfro tree like incense. They hated the smell so much that they would descend from the ceiling and lay low on the floor, making them easy targets
.

Manatite Hydra

S

Floor 7

Manatite Hydra lying dormant before the Magic Crystal
Manatite Hydra viewed from the side
Manatite Hydra cameo in anime
Manatite Hydra in season 2 trailer
Elinalise tanking a hydra attack while Paul and Rudeus attacks
Manatite Hydra in the Anime
Manatite Hydra nullifying magic
Rudeus using Water Shield against the Fire Breath
The remains of a Manatite Hydra being defeated
1/9
Manatite Hydra is the guardian of the Teleportation Labyrinth and is stationed at the Magic Crystal that is said to be the center of the Labyrinth where he is usually seen dormant but will attack anyone who approaches but does not pursue them and returns to being dormant near the Magic Crystal if the intruders leave or are dead. It is a nine-headed dragon approximately twice the size of a Red Dragon. Its body is covered with sharpened emerald-green scales that can nullify magic attacks and cut the victim's body upon contact. It is capable of regenerating itself when one its heads is cut, unless the wound is immediately cauterized. Each of its heads is capable of attacking independently, and each head can unleash a powerful fire breath. To defeat the monster, all its heads must be cut off or destroyed, with the wounds seared to disable its regeneration. However, like most monsters, the hydra is intelligent and can bite off the seared neck to regenerate it. When he senses that he is in danger like when it has 3 heads remaining, it would go berserk and attacks frantically until defeated.
.
The last recorded encounter with Manatite Hydras dates back to the Second Great Human-Demon War, and the species were said to be annihilated by the explosion that created the
Ringus Sea
. The magic stone scales taken from the monster retain their ability to nullify magic attacks: by applying mana to the back of the stone, the front emits an energy wave that breaks down magic
.

Crab Monster

?

Demon God Labyrinth

Tiny crab monsters smaller than a fingertip that live at the bottom of the underground lake in the labyrinth's first level. They would swarm and devour any creatures that dive deep enough into the lake
.

Dullahan

S

Demon God Labyrinth

The guardian of the labyrinth. It is a headless undead knight with wearing black armor, with a few swords impaling its body. When he was alive, he was the strongest among the five great demon kings during Second Great Human-Demon War, and the leader of
Kishirika
's elite guards. He was said to be strong enough to subdue
Atofe
. After becoming an undead, he would only stand down when told the results of the war, and the fact that he could stop fighting
.

References

Moore
=====

SPOILER ALERT!

This page contains
spoilers!
  Read at your own risk.

Information

Story

Relationships

Appearance

Moore is the captain of
Atofe
's guards.

Appearance

Moore is an immortal demon who looks like an imposing middle-aged man, with white hair and beard and reddish-brown eyes.

Personality

Moore presents himself as a calm and affable soldier, serving as the voice of reason in Atofe's guard. However, he is fiercely loyal to Atofe and is not above deceiving outsiders for the sake of his master.

Background

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Plot

Summoning arc

Rudeus and Zanoba first meet Moore when they are taken to Kishiriku Castle. Moore advises them not to accept any rewards. When Atofe enters the room, Moore attempts to scold her, leading Atofe to stab him in the head with her sword, but he gets up seemingly fine. When Rudeus fails to refuse the reward Atofe was trying to give him and consequently knocks her unconscious, Moore tells them to run before she wakes up.

This was a trap prepared by Moore as Kishirika says Atofe like to chase her prey so Moore was preparing the perfect opportunity for her to do so.

Power and Abilities

Immortality

He will regenerate even after losing a head or being cut into two.

Magic

Chant Omission: he is able to shorten the incantation for magic.

Combat Expertise: Thanks to his combat experiences, he is able to match
Rudeus
 in a battle of magic, despite the latter having the advantage of silent spellcasting and a much larger mana capacity.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Equipment

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Quotes

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Trivia

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Moore/Story
===========

Summoning arc

Rudeus and Zanoba first meet Moore when they are taken to Kishiriku Castle. Moore advises them not to accept any rewards. When Atofe enters the room, Moore attempts to scold her, leading Atofe to stab him in the head with her sword, but he gets up seemingly fine. When Rudeus fails to refuse the reward Atofe was trying to give him and consequently knocks her unconscious, Moore tells them to run before she wakes up.

This was a trap prepared by Moore as Kishirika says Atofe like to chase her prey so Moore was preparing the perfect opportunity for her to do so.

After establishing a strategy, Rudeus' group begins their attack once again. After confirming that burning the hydra's neck that was cut off did not regenerate, they coordinate their attack and defense accordingly. When hydra only has 3 heads remaining it did something unexpected...

Mushoku Tensei

Mushoku Tensei (Novel series)

Mushoku Tensei: Isekai Ittara Honki Dasu Anthology side: Roxy
=============================================================

Redirect to:
Anthology side: Roxy

Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation
=====================================

Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation
 (無職転生 〜異世界行ったら本気だす〜
Mushoku Tensei: Isekai Ittara Honki Dasu
, lit. "Jobless Reincarnation: I Will Seriously Try If I Go to Another World"), abbreviated as
Mushoku Tensei
 (無職転生), is a Japanese light novel series written by
Rifujin na Magonote
 with illustrations by
Shirotaka
. The series originally started as a web-based novel series in late 2012 uploaded by the author on the website
Shosetsuka ni Naro
; following its success on the site's popularity it was acquired by
Kadokawa
 within the following year under their publishing house
Media Factory
, and officially began its publication as a light novel series in early 2014 under the
MF Books
 label.

Seven Seas Entertainment
 licensed the light novel under their
Airship
 imprint for English localization on July 18, 2018, following large requests in their monthly reader survey. The digital edition of the first volume was launched early on April 4, 2019 while paperback edition was released on May 21, 2019. In March 2021, the first nine English volumes were revised for a more legitimate translation.

Story

Plot

An unnamed 34-year-old Japanese NEET is evicted from his home following his parents' death. Upon some self-introspection, he concludes that his life was ultimately pointless. Walking down a street he intercepts a speeding truck heading towards a group of teenagers, in an attempt to do something meaningful for once in his life he manages to pull one of them out of harm's way before getting himself in the way of the truck and dying. Awakening in a baby's body, he realizes he has been reincarnated in a world of sword and sorcery. He resolves to become successful in his new life, discarding his past identity for his new life as Rudeus Greyrat. Due to inherited affinity and early training, Rudeus becomes highly skilled at magic with help from his previous life's intuitions. During his childhood, he becomes a student of a demon magician Roxy Migurdia, a friend to half-elf Sylphiette, and a tutor to noble heiress Eris Boreas Greyrat. Rudeus tries his best to live this new life with no regrets to leave behind.

Setting

The story is set in a hexahedral world referred to as the
Six-Faced World
. A fantastical world with each side inhabitated by various races: the Dragon World of the Dragon race; the Demon World of the Demon race; the Sky World of the Skyfolks; the Beast World of the Beastfolks; the Sea World of the Seafolks; the Human World of the Human race; there also exists the seventh world - the Void World where nothing exists and is a channel connecting the six worlds. All the five worlds, however, with the exception of the Void World have been destroyed and now only the Human World remains where all the survivors of the other world fled to. As a result, the Human World has been filled with a variety of races with language and culture distinct to region regarding the history of that place.

The protagonist reincarnates into the Human World in an era that is similar to the
Middle Ages
. And as a result of being born in the Six-Faced World, where every living being is birthed infused with
Mana
, Rudeus is granted the ability to use
Magic
.

Characters

Main Category:
Characters

Rudeus Greyrat
: Before his reincarnation, he was an overweight 34-year-old Japanese NEET who became a recluse following his high school persecution. After his reincarnation, he discards his past identity and works to make his new life as Rudeus Greyrat meaningful. As such, he adopts a calm persona, though his past life's perversion sometimes emerges and scares those around him.

Roxy Migurdia
: A demon from the Migurdia species known for their telepathy, blue hair, youthful appearance, and longevity. Because she can't use telepathy, she leaves her village due to feeling isolated from her peers. Unable to make a stable living as an adventurer, she becomes a traveling tutor and eventually becomes Rudeus' teacher.

Sylphiette
: Rudeus' childhood friend who is part human, elf, and beast race. Due to her
Laplace Factor
, a genetic material granting its owners enhanced magical abilities if trained at a young age, her hair is green. Rudeus' influence helped her learn how to cast magic without chanting.

Eris Boreas Greyrat
: A noble girl and distant relative of Rudeus. She is short tempered and violent but has potential in the
Sword God Style
. After Rudeus manages to gain her trust, she becomes a student under him learning how to read and write along with Magic. Slowly, during the years she spends with Rudeus she grows to have feelings for him.

Media

Web Novel

Original novel series on which the light novel is based on. A total of 286 chapters in the main storyline were written within November 22, 2012, and April 3, 2015 which was hosted for free-reading on
Shosetsuka ni Naro
.

Light Novel

Novel series with approximately the same plot as the web-version, featuring illustrations by Shirotaka. Officially being published by
Media Factory
 ever since January 23, 2014, it is currently ongoing with 24 volumes released.

Manga

Manga series based on the light novel, it is illustrated by
Yuka Fujikawa
. It has been serialized in Media Factory's
Monthly Comic Flapper
 seinen magazine since May 2, 2014 and is currently ongoing with 15 volumes released.

Drama CD

Drama based on the Labyrinth arc of light novel
volume 12
. It was published by
Frontier Works
 on April 26, 2017.

Video Game

Smartphone
gacha
-RPG with story-campaign up to light novel
volume 3
 and other scenarios supervised by the author. It is developed by
Aiming
 and was released on March 27, 2021 for Android and iOS.

Anime

Anime series adaptation based on the light novel, it is produced by
Egg Firm
 and directed by Manabu Okamoto and Hiroki Hirano at
Studio Bind
. The first episode aired on January 10, 2021 and is currently ongoing with second cour arriving in October 2021.

Music

Original soundtracks of the anime adaptation is composed by Yoshiaki Fujisawa. The first album was released on April 21, 2021 and the second album is scheduled to release on January 19, 2022. All opening theme songs and the ending theme song were performed by Yuiko Ohara.

References

External Links

Administrators

This wiki is dedicated  to the
Mushoku Tensei
 light novel series and its subsequent adaptations. We are striving to turn this place into a reliable source of information for the series, but to do that we need your help! This wiki is being constantly updated and we encourage you to join us on our task to expand this wiki with new articles and improve older pages with valuable edits.

Anonymous editing has been disabled for this wiki. To contribute, you must login or sign up for a
free account
. After that, you can
get started
 and help out by editing typos, work on
article stubs
 or leave feedback in comments and talk pages. You may also consider creating
wanted pages
.



If you need help, you can refer to the
Help pages
,
FANDOM University
 or ask
an admin
.

About

Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation
 (無職転生 〜異世界行ったら本気だす〜
Mushoku Tensei: Isekai Ittara Honki Dasu
, lit. "Jobless Reincarnation: I Will Seriously Try If I Go to Another World"), abbreviated as
Mushoku Tensei
 (無職転生), is a Japanese light novel series written by
Rifujin na Magonote
 with illustrations by
Shirotaka
. The series originally started as a web-based novel series on November 22, 2012 uploaded by the author on the website
Shosetsuka ni Naro
; following its success on the site's popularity it was acquired by
Kadokawa
 within the following year under their publishing house
Media Factory
, and officially began its publication as a light novel series on January 23, 2014.

SYNOPSIS

An unnamed 34-year-old Japanese NEET is evicted from his home following his parents' death. Upon some self-introspection, he concludes that his life was ultimately pointless. Walking down a street he intercepts a speeding truck heading towards a group of teenagers, in an attempt to do something meaningful for once in his life he manages to pull one of them out of harm's way before getting himself in the way of the truck and dying. Awakening in a baby's body, he realizes he has been reincarnated in a world of sword and sorcery. He resolves to become successful in his new life, discarding his past identity for his new life as Rudeus Greyrat. Due to inherited affinity and early training, Rudeus becomes highly skilled at magic with help from his previous life's intuitions. During his childhood, he becomes a student of a demon magician Roxy Migurdia, a friend to half-elf Sylphiette, and a tutor to noble heiress Eris Boreas Greyrat. Rudeus tries his best to live this new life with no regrets to leave behind.

 (転移の迷宮) is an S-ranked labyrinth located beneath the desert of the
Begaritt Continent
 that is accessed by a cave of a cliff north of the city of
Rapan
.

Ending Theme 4

My Dream Home
=============

My Dream Home
 (夢のマイホーム
Yume no Mai Hōmu
) is the thirteenth episode of the
second season
 (37th overall)
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on April 7, 2024.

Synopsis

Rudeus is engaged to Sylphy, but he doesn't know the procedure for marriage in this
world
, so he consults Zanoba and Cliff. When Rudeus hears that his first priority is deciding on a house to live in, he is introduced to a large but cheap property by a real estate agent. It is said to be a haunted property where visitors die mysteriously due to a curse...

Plot

Rudeus is in his room, saying his prayers to the shrine that he just added a box inside it. At the Special Student Classroom, the other students notices that Rudeus is different to which Rudeus announces that his condition (ED ailment) has been cured. While some of the students congratulates him, Linia and Pursena are on guard since they can sense that he is in heat. Rudeus then meets Nanahoshi who got annoyed with him for talking about her crush.

During lunch, Rudeus consults with Cliff and Zanoba about what he needs to prepare before a wedding and he is advised that he needs a house so he goes to a listing agency to look for a house he can afford. Rudeus eventually finds a house that is unusually cheap but is rumored to be cursed since its previous residents were murdered after hearing noises at night so he asks Cliff and Zanoba to help in exorcising the house.

The three begin to search each rooms and floors of the house but no one is there so they decide to spend the night there where they take turns guarding while the rest sleeps. That night, Cliff hears a noise and wakes up Rudeus and Zanoba to search the house once again. Rudeus is ambushed by the "ghost" but Zanoba protects him and when Cliff and Rudeus tries to use their magic on it, Zanoba still hold the ghost in place despite being attacked, destroying his club and damaging his clothes. The ghost turns out to be a doll that can move and the one responsible for the murders so they brought it back to Ranoa Magic Academy to be studied which Zanoba volunteers to do the research.

With the "ghost" dealt with and renovations completed, Rudeus takes Sylphy to the new house and they tour every room until they reach the Master's bedroom, currently the only room that is furnished and has a large bed. Rudeus once again proposes to Sylphy who is still reluctant as she still has her duties as
Ariel Anemoi Asura
's
Guardian Magician
 but eventually accepts.

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Sylphiette

Cliff Grimoire

Zanoba Shirone

Juliette

Linia Dedoldia

Pursena Adoldia

Nanahoshi Shizuka

Locations

Central Continent

Ranoa Kingdom

Sharia

Ranoa Magic Academy

Haunted House

Adaptation Notes

Light Novel Volume 10

Chapter 1: Backing

Chapter 2: Things to Prepare Before Marriage (Part 1)

Chapter 3: Things to Prepare Before Marriage (Part 2)

Chapter 4: Dramatic

Differences with the Light Novel:

The event where Rudeus hires
Balda
 and the house renovation has been cut

My Name Is...
=============

My Name Is...
 (
妾の名は
,

Warawa no na wa
)
 is the twenty-eighth chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Roxy Migurdia

Rudeus Greyrat

Summary

Rudeus and Eris try to board a ship to take them back to the Asura Kingdom, but the ship fare is inflated due to discrimination against Rujeird, they head back to a tavern and come up with ways to earn money but they just end at a roadblock. Meanwhile, Roxy heads out into town after being intrigued about the group,
Dead End
, after hearing rumours about them. As Rudeus comes back from purchasing food, she stumbles upon a
little girl
 who was been harassed by a strange man, he rescues only to find that she didn't want to be rescued. She introduces herself as Kishirika Kishirisu, the great demon lord empress. At first, Rudeus assumed that she was just an imposter who was a big fan and played along, then to her delight she asked him make a wish. After three silly wishes, she then stabs his eye to grant him a magic eye.

Appearances

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Roxy Migurdia

Kishirika Kishirisu

Eris Greyrat

Ruijerd Superdia

Hitogami

Elinalise Dragonroad

Laplace
 (mentioned)

Skills

Earth Magic

Stone Cannon

Regions

Others

Differences from Light Novel

Trivia

It was revealed that Rudeus has more magic power than Laplace.

Navigation

My Older Brothers Feelings
==========================

This article is about the Season 2 Episode 17 Anime. For the Manga article , see
A Big Brothers Feelings
.

My Older Brother's Feelings
 (兄貴の気持ち
Aniki no Kimochi
) is the seventeenth episode of the
second season
 (41st overall)
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on May 5, 2024 and also the second episode of the
Sisters Arc
 for the Anime.

Synopsis

Norn, who started living in the dormitory of Ranoa Magic University, has become a shut-in. Rudeus tries to somehow save Norn by identifying himself with his previous life, and heads to Norn's classroom. Rudeus is shocked by the words he hears from Norn's classmates... Norn, on the other hand, is also worried about how to deal with her older brother Rudeus.

Plot

At Ranoa Magic Academy, Rudeus is visibly angry upon learning that Norn has locked herself in her room and is seen walking with Linia and Pursena who tries to reason with him while onlookers are in awe as Rudeus passes by and finally reaches Norn's classroom and enters.

Rudeus explains the situation to Norn's classmates and asks whoever is responsible to come forward and apologize. A
Beast Race
 with a raccoon dog face, timid eyes and bob hair cut raises her hand and tells Rudeus that she compared Norn with Rudeus which made angered Norn then Norn's teacher also mentions she also talked to Norn after she did poorly and to follow his brother's example and try a little harder which Norn while holding back tears nods and said she'd do her best. The rest of the class also chimes in on doing the same thing causing Rudeus to realize that Norn hates being compared to Rudeus.

At the
School Yard
, Rudeus is still hurt by recent development as Linia and Pursena looks on then Sylphiette arrives and assures Rudeus that its now his fault. Linia and Pursena also encourages Rudeus who thanks them but still doesn't now what to do since Norn has a reason not to leave her room.

Rudes is walking on the hallway still deciding on what to do but is unable to do so but Sylphy, Linia and Pursena catches up with him and Linia mentions she has a plan.

That evening, the students are spreading word that Ariel is giving a speech at the dining hall despite being so sudden and they head to the School Yard to listen while Sylphiette informs Rudeus that most students have left and he sneaks in the Girl's Dormitory and enters with
Earth Lance
 where Linia is waiting for him and carries him through the hallway with a laundry cart until they reach Norn's room at the end of the hall.

Rudeus knocks and gives his name but Norn does not respond. Upon opening the door, Rudeus remember his past self but proceeds to enter and sees Norn still seated at her bed, covered with her blanket. Rudeus recalls his past life on how he ignores his older brother who visited his room to try and reason with him but was ignored and his brother eventually gave up on him.

While Rudeus is seated next to her bed, Norn reflects on how she became afraid of Rudeus since she met Rudeus who was hitting Paul and causing Norn to push him away and begins to hate him. When she arrives at Sharia, her impression on him got even worse on how he seems happy while their father is still on the midst of rescuing
Zenith
 but she decides to be careful not to upset him and not to be kicked out of the house.

When Norn decides to live in the Dormitory, she was surprised that Rudeus allowed her and although she knows the reason, she felt sad and felt pain in her belly. Norn's situation got worse when she begins classes where she is constantly being compared to Rudeus and along with the pain in her belly leading to eventually causing Norn to stay in her room.

Norn then remembers her talks with Paul and Ruijerd where both assures him that he is not who she think he is. Norn then sees Rudeus who apologizes on what has happened and after hearing his words, Norn breaks down in tears and cries on Rudeus' chest after the latter sits beside her.

Next day, Rudeus and Sylphie are glad to see that Norn's mood has greatly improved, and Rudeus is impressed that Norn was able to accomplish something he couldn't in his past life. He then considers that if
Nanahoshi Shizuka
 returns back t0 Earth, he will ask her to send a message to apologize to and thank his older brother.
