Notes

Nanahoshi
=========

Redirect to:
Nanahoshi Shizuka

Nanahoshi Shizuka
=================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Information

Story

Relationships

Appearance

Nanahoshi Shizuka
 (
七星

静
香
,

Nanahoshi Shizuka
)
, also known as
Silent Seven Stars
, is one of the people
Rudeus Greyrat
 saved from being hit by a truck in his previous life. However, in that moment, she was transported to this world some time after Rudeus, resulting in the
Teleport Incident
. Afterward, she was taken in by
Orsted
 and eventually became a successful entrepreneur whilst searching for a way back to Earth.

Appearance

Nanahoshi is a Japanese teenage girl with long black hair, described as being above average in appearance. She's more often seen wearing a white mask without any particular characteristics.

Personality

Due to her desire to go back home and her unattached attitude to the
Human World
, Nanahoshi tends to like being alone. She's serious when working and enthusiastic when it comes to things related to her old world. Before meeting
Rudeus Greyrat
, she spent all her time indoors and didn't like meeting people as she didn't want to grow attached to anyone in the world. Additionally, she maintained low contact to avoid the possibility of contracting unknown pathogens, and uses that to justify her isolation.

Background

Nanahoshi was saved by
Rudeus Greyrat
 in his former life's final moments and was teleported to the
Human World
 later known as the
Teleport Incident
 where she is transported in her original body unlike Rudeus who is reincarnated as a baby. After finding herself in the plains of Asura Kingdom, she meets
Orsted
 and with his help she learned the Human God language after a year, gained knowledge about the Asura Kingdom and was able to meet Perugius. During this time, Nanahoshi established business contacts, introduced innovations and products that are mainly for her convenience and benefits such as improving the food, clothing and soap for hair cleaning. Using Orsted's influence as the Dragon God for her backing, she is able to convince some Asuran merchants to arrange distribution routes for her products that allows her to have passive income so she could gain enough influence to search for her friends, and develop a way to return home.

Plot

Nanahoshi was first introduced in volume 6 of the LN/WN accompanying
Orsted
 when they encountered
Dead End
 on their journey to the
Fittoa Region
. After Orsted mortally wounded
Rudeus Greyrat
, she told Orsted to spare Rudeus' life, so Orsted cast healing magic on him.

Nanahoshi meets with Rudeus once again at
Ranoa Magic Academy
 where she establishes herself as a Class A Mage because of the sweeping changes she introduced in the Academy and is also a Special Student. After giving an explanation of her intentions, Nanahoshi, Rudeus and
Sylphiette
 begin researching on the cause of the
Teleport Incident
.

Nanahoshi is among the guests who attends Rudeus and Syphiette's wedding
 and for helping with her research on Summoning Magic, Nanahoshi allows Rudeus and his friends to accompany her when she goes to meet
Perugius Dola
 in his Sky Castle
.

Power and Abilities

Magic Abilities






Nanahoshi activating a Magic Circle for
Summon Light Spirits
 in the Anime



Nanahoshi has no magic power due to being from another world where magic didn't exist. This means she can't use magic or wear
battle aura
, though she can still use Magic Items, which work with their own Magic Power.

Summoning Magic

Due to her training from
Perugius Dola
, she has extensive knowledge in summoning and teleportation magic, having studied it as part of her research to go back to her and
Rudeus Greyrat
's original world.

Physical Abilities

For some reason, her body does not age; her hair never grows longer, and her nails keep the same length regardless of how much time passes, yet she still needs to consume food and pass waste, and could still get sick. Nanahoshi suspects that it's because she's from the future, or a different world.

Intellectual Abilities

It is shown that Nanahoshi is a very skilled negotiator and businesswoman, enabling her to setup many systems that monetize her knowledge from earth and even using the Magician Guild as a bank. As a result, she has multiple streams of income that make her very wealthy, allowing her to focus on her research. She also holds influential positions in several organizations and is Rank A among the Magic Guild because of her accomplishments and contributions that she was offered to be Rank S but she declines since her interests is to return home.

Nanahoshi is also a skilled researcher that she collaborated with Rudeus on several researches such as the development of the Magic Potion and Teleportation Magic formations which they kept in records at an Encrypted Memoir written by both of them in a cypher and most likely in Japanese Language.

Equipment

Nanahoshi blocking magic and physical attacks of Fitts in the Anime
Nanahoshi's Magic Rings in the Anime
Nanahoshi's 3 magic rings in the Manga
Nanahoshi activating her first magic ring
1/4

Magic Rings

Unlike
Rudeus Greyrat
 who is reincarnated into the
Human World
, Nanahoshi has no Magic Powers so she uses Magic Rings to protect herself when
Orsted
 is not there. Nanahoshi possesses three magic rings that are
Magic Items
 she wears in her right hand. First worn in the index finger, through unknown means, prevents magic from working near the caster as shown when
Sylphiette
 failed to cast attack magic on her which triggers when she points the ring to a target. The second worn in the middle finger, creates an invisible barrier in front of her that prevents any physical attacks as seen when Sylphiette tried to punch her and like the first ring, it also triggers on a target she points at. The third worn on the ring finger, allows Orsted to know her location using a compass, when infused with magic.

Achievements

Achieved Rank A in the Magic Guild

Quotes

To
Rudeus Greyrat
: “I was probably summoned to this world in order to create a method for your descendants to kill the
Human God
 in the future. That’s why, as long as I don’t create that method, I won’t be able to return to my original world. My return magic will fail.”

Etymology

Nanahoshi
 means "seven stars" (七星).

Shizuka
 means "quiet" (静) (
shizu
) and "fragrance, fragrant" (香) (
ka
).

Trivia

Nanahoshi has a disease called Drain Syndrome. It's a condition that occurs when a human with little or no magical power naturally accumulates magical power over time, until their body begins to react negatively to it. Because of this, she must regularly drink tea made from Sokasu Grass, which will alleviate her condition by releasing the accumulated Magical Power through her waste. However this does not cure her condition, as she must continue to drink the tea from Sokasu Grass.

In the redundancy chapters,
Zanoba Shirone
 and
Rudeus Greyrat
 created an automaton modelled after Nanahoshi. It was almost identical to her except for the hair length, completed with even the naughty bits. It was created without Nanahoshi knowledge and consent, and later named
Anne
.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Nanahoshi Shizuka/Relationships
===============================

Information

Story

Relationships

Appearance

Friends

Shinohara Akihito





Nanahoshi and Akihito in the Anime



Aikihito is Nanahoshi's friend in Japan. When Nanahoshi is transported to the
Human World
, she also begins searching for his friends with Orsted. Although Nanahoshi considers the possibility that he isn't in the
Human World
, she is also working on finding a way back to Japan.

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Rudeus Greyrat

Rudeus and Nanahoshi researching Teleportation Magic in the Anime
Rudeus telling Nanahoshi of his journey to the Teleportation Labyrinth
Rudeus tending to Nanahoshi while in his home
Nanahoshi showing Rudeus a Teleportation Ruins to Begaritt Continent
1/4

Rudeus and Nanahoshi first meets Rudeus at the Dragon Wyrm Mountain when she was travelling with Orsted who easily defeats him and his party. At Nanahoshi's request, Orsted heals Rudeus' wounds that would otherwise kill him. Nanahoshi and Rudeus meet again at
Ranoa Magic Academy
  where the latter tried to flee in panic but they were able to clear the misunderstanding and they agreed to work together with Fitts on her research. Nanahoshi and Rudeus were able to get along well since they were both Japanese. Rudeus cares for Nanahoshi that when she falls into depression, Rudeus brings her to his
home
 to nurse him to health
 and when Nanahoshi is afflicted by
Drain Syndrome
, Rudeus searches for a cure and manages to do so and encourages her to keep finding a way to return home.

When Rudeus decides to go to the
Begaritt Continent
, to rescue her mother
Zenith
, Nanahoshi tells him the location of a Teleportation Ruins that takes his journey to Begaritt and back to be only 4 months instead of 1 year which Rudeus is grateful as he is able to make it back for Sylphy to give birth to Lucy.

Due to their apparent closeness and how Nanahoshi seems to comfortably talk with Rudeus in japanese, people around them believe that they will become lovers but Nanahoshi denies this
 while Zanoba concludes that Rudeus' interaction with Nanahoshi is more like how Rudeus interacts with his
younger

sisters
.

Through her cooperation with Rudeus, they are known through out the
Human World
 for their ground-breaking inventions such as the creation of the Magic Potion, which also ended the period where Swordsmen are considered the strongest and the Teleportation Magic Circles that made travelling through different nations faster and safer but only Rudeus is blamed by the
Milis Church
 to be <The Person who broke the Taboo>.

When Nanahoshi is put in Time Stasis where she only wakes up every 30 days, Rudeus among those who will visit her and give her japanese food made by Aisha with the ingredients of the Human World and Rudeus would also give her additional letters for his family in Japan about his life in the Human World and also would consult with Nanahoshi about how to interact with her daughters like with
Lucy Greyrat
 who eventually grows up and marries
Clive Grimoire
. Nanahoshi keeps these letters with her and is not sure if delivering these letters will suffice for everything that Rudeus has done for her but she intends to tell Rudeus' family on earth of how Rudeus took care of her without leaving a single detail.

Sylphiette





Fitz attacking Nanahoshi in the Anime



Nanahoshi and Sylphiette are acquaintances and although Sylphiette is shown to be uneasy towards Nanahoshi due to his apparent closeness to Rudeus they still get along and Sylphiette would also help in doing Nanahoshi's research.
 While Rudeus was away at the
Teleportation Labyrinth
, Sylphiette also took care of Nanahoshi by bringing her meals, helping with shopping, casting
Detoxification Magic
 when she got sick and also letting her stay in the Greyrat house to use the bath and in return, Nanahoshi allows Sylphiette,
Ariel Anemoi Asura
 and
Luke Notos Greyrat
 to accompany her when she goes to see Perugius.

Linia Dedoldia





Nanahoshi and Linia in the Manga



Nanahoshi initially doesn't plan to make friends with anyone in the Human World, Nanahoshi eventually became friends with Rudeus and the rest of the Special Students. During the celebration of Nanahoshi's research completion, Linia doesn't seem to mind that Nanahoshi is fondling her ears and later took her back to her room when Nanahoshi is completely drunk.

Aisha Greyrat

Aisha and Nanahoshi became friends ever since Nanahoshi started visiting Rudeus' house.
 Nanahoshi gave advice that they need uniforms and manners to succeed when Aisha establishes the
Rude Mercenary Company
 and also agreed to sponsor them.

After Nanahoshi's return magic to Earth failed, Nanahoshi is placed in a sleeping state where she only wakes up once a month. When she is awake, Aisha's cooking based from food from earth through trial and error such as Yaki Onigiri, Miso Udon, Sandwich and Takoyaki are delivered by Rudeus to Nanahoshi where they usually eat together until Nanahoshi sleeps again for that month.

Other

Perugius Dola

Perugius became Nanahoshi's teacher for her research of summoning magic and circles after Nanahoshi is able to conduct Summoning from another world with the help of Rudeus and his friends. When Nanahoshi falls ill with Drain Syndrome, Perugius uses one of his familiars to discover the disease and stop her time but refuses to assist beyond this since his purpose is to prepare for the return of
Laplace
.

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Orsted

Nanahoshi and Orsted travelling together in the Anime
Nanahoshi and Orsted in the Manga
Nanahoshi and Orsted encountering Dead End Party in the Light Novel
1/3

After Nanahoshi is transported to the Human World during the
Teleport Incident
, Orsted is the first person she meets and they started traveling together and teaches her all the basic knowledge of the world and bringing her to the various Dragon Tribe Ruins that has a teleportation circle. After an undefined number of years, he left her in Ranoa Magic Academy.

Like Rudeus, she is immune to the Orsted curse of feel fear to him.

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Anne

Nanahoshi: "Well, its fine. So, what's her name?"
 Rudeus: "We haven't come up with one yet."

Anne is an automaton doll that is based from Nanahoshi's facial appearance but with shorter hair. Although Nanahoshi was initially displeased on the initial reason on why Anne is created by Rudeus Nanahoshi, Nanahoshi gives her the name "Anne" is officially designated as Automaton SS-01 Anne where SS stands for Seven Star, the meaning of Nanahoshi's Japanese name while the rest of the automaton doll are referred to as the Seven Star Series Anne. Incase Nanahoshi's friends ever appear, the dolls were also given a name "Nanahoshi Hajime" and should one of them ever meet one of her friends after saying that name, the doll would proceed to tell her relationship to Nanahoshi.

References

Nanahoshi Shizuka/Story
=======================

Information

Story

Relationships

Appearance

Mushoku Tensei

Background

Nanahoshi was a normal student of the Earth, in the road of a rainy day and in a middle of a fight with her friends
Shinohara Akihito
 and Kuroki Seiji, they were almost hit by a truck, but were saved by a Fat Man, but by unknown reasons she was summoned to the Human World, in
Asura Kingdom
, being the cause of the Mana Calamity in Fittoa region. She meets
Orsted
 that taught her the basic knowledge of that world and she start to travel the world with him searching a way to return to her home.

In her travel with Orsted she started to use the name of
Silent Seven Star
 using the knowledge of her world and having the backing of the Dragon God, she started to gain connection and wealth, with the hope that she may find her friends, in one of those travel she meet
Rudeus Greyrat
, after Orsted leaves him on the verge of death and feeling that he may be related to her world, she ask to Orsted to save his life and he accepts.

Orsted presents Nanohoshi to
Perugius
, and he taught her summoning magic, that may help her to return to the Earth, after that she decides to go to Ranoa Magic academy, because the reputation that she made with the years and how she improve the dally life in the academy she reached to Rank A in the Magic guild a become a special student leaving Orsted and making the school her base.

Years later she meets Rudeus again in Ranoa, discovering that he also was from the Earth (but she still doesn't know that he is also Japanese and the guy that saved the group from the truck), after talking they decide to help themselves, she helps Rudeus, teaching him summoning magic, and Rudeus helps her with magic power for her investigations. Even with his power, she barely makes any progress in the next few months, but with the help of
Zanoba
 and
Cliff
, she succeeds in summoning a item from her world.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Volume 22 - Young Man Period - Organization Chapter

The final stages of the multiverse teleportation circle are being made as it was completed and she had Rudeus and Perugius test the device, With Perugius operating and controlling it and Rudeus supplying the magic power. After teleporting many objects and living beings much larger than her into her original world, the circle was ready to send her back to her home world. She decided to use the bath in Rudeus's home and stay the night. While She and Rudeus were drinking and she was wondering how much time may have passed since she was in this world, Rudeus told her that ten years have passed since the traffic accident and time may not have changed much in the other world. After hearing that, she figured out Rudeus's identity in the previous world. She was asked to keep it a secret since Rudeus was ashamed of who he was in that world and gave her a letter to deliver to his siblings from that world.

The final day came and they used the multiverse teleportation circle to send her back to her original world, but then a strange black colored light appeared and the attempt to send her back failed. The magic circle failed as if the power was absorbed somewhere else. Perugius was mad at Rudeus and started blaming Rudeus for the failure of the device, thinking Rudeus cut off his power. Rudeus then stated that he didn't cut off his power and in fact increased his power. After the confusion, they were able to determine that if the mana supply were cut off, the magic circle would have lost its light. Mana was definitely used, but it seems as if something was tampering with the process. They found a crack in the circle that should not have broken. Nanahoshi left the room and Rudeus went after her. After the failure at using the multiverse teleportation circle due to some type of interference, she developed a hypothesis that her friend,
Shinohara Akihito
, who likely teleported into the world in the future and saved a Miko that had the power to rewind an object's time. Nanahoshi hypothesized that he likely also met Orsted and created a device that would amplify the Miko's power. The reason why she was summoned to the world was to create the multiverse teleportation device and the reason she is unable to return now is because her future self is supposed to return to her world in the future with her friend. She then decided to have her time stopped so that she may live long enough to the future 50 to 80 years from now and use the teleportation to allow her friend to go back home as well.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Mushoku Tensei Sequel

Nanahoshi's fate is one of the major story threads that remained unresolved by the end of Mushoku Tensei, continuing to be kept in suspended animation by
Perugius
 to await
Akihito's
 arrival so she might go back to Earth. Because of this, she is likely to once again play a major role in the planned sequel series.

References

Nina
====

Redirect to:
Nina Farion

Nina Farion
===========

"Even if you ask me how... Since you'll win as long as your sword is
the faster one, there's no need for stuff like bloodlust, right?"

Nina to Eris and Isolte

Information

Relationships

Nina Farion
 is the daughter of the previous Sword God,
Gal Farion
, as well as the wife of the current Sword God,
Jino Britts
.

Appearance

She is a beautiful girl, with flowing dark blue hair gathered behind her. She has a modest bust, and a well toned physique. Her battle attire consists of A silver breastplate, complete with pauldrons on her shoulders and a pair of fingerless gauntlets. She wears metal greaves, while leaving her upper legs exposed save for the blue tabard she wears beneath her breastplate which drapes over her thighs. She keeps her sword attatched to her belt, on her back. She also wears a fur-lined cape over her armor when traveling in harsher climates.  Her overall appearance makes her seem dignified.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Personality

Nina was initially a proud and conceited young woman who had idealistic and naïve expectations about life, very much like a frog in a well. She slowly changed after meeting and losing to
Eris
, and her later encounter with
Badigadi
 and
Rudeus
. During her training with Eris and
Isolte Cruel
, her paradigms were shifted as she learnt more about the true meaning of strength and the Sword God Style.

Her unusual calmness was judged by
Reida Reia
 to indicate potential in the
Water God Style
, albeit Nina is adamant on only practicing the
Sword God Style
. Like her father, she's also rather impatient and assertive, as indicated by her marriage proposal to Jino and swift invitation to her bedroom afterward.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Background

Nina Farion was raised up in the Holy Land of Swords, being the eldest daughter of the Sword God, Gal Farion. She was a prodigy who attained Sword Saint rank when she was 16, and was speculated to advance to Sword King and Sword Emperor when she turned 20 and 25 respectively.

During her childhood, Nina is also forbidden to enter the Sword God Style Main House and formed a secret organization with Jino and the children of her age during their breaks from training but later gets disbanded when Nina and Jino became Sword Saints at the same time where their growth was considered to be quite fast.

Despite her being Gal Farion's eldest daughter, she was taught instead by Sword Emperor
Timothy Britts
. She has been practicing with the sword since a very young age, the Sword God Style being all she knew about the world.

Plot

Nina was introduced as an opponent for
Eris
 in Volume 8. Nina was angry that Eris pre-emptively attacked Jino before their duel even began, and vowed to kill Eris during her duel. When the duel began, Nina was able to break Eris's sword and expected the victory, but instead was beaten unconscious by Eris' fists and kicks. Being shamed in front of her peers, she began to hate Eris and began a rivalry with her.

Nina was unable to find time for her rivalry and to be in contact with Eris since seemed to be constantly busy with training with
Ghislaine Dedoldia
 and Gal Farion. Nina tried once to isolate Eris from the rest of the students but it failed since Eris shows no interest in making friends and barely talks to anyone. In another attempt to get back on Eris, Nina tells her that she would never find a man if she is always so dedicated to training, which Eris denies and says that she already had a man and their conversation turned Eris showing off her love story with Rudeus, which Nina envies and believes that she lost even in love. Nina comes to the conclusion that Eris must be lying and goes off to investigate Rudeus.

Nina is shocked by the information which easily floods in about Rudeus and his accomplishments; she starts to doubt the rumors and sets the goal to beat Eris by beating the man she looks up to and enslave him. Nina sets her goal and heads to
Ranoa Magic Academy
 to find Rudeus, and follows some Dedoldia beast men who were also looking to defeat Rudeus at the time. Nina is able to find Rudeus and finds that another Beast man has beaten her to the punch and challenges Rudeus, which he beats him within an instant to Nina's shock thinking that mages are weak in close quarters combat.






Nina vs Badigadi



Attempting to challenge Rudeus again, Nina finds him later to find that there are many more beast men challenging him and she is put in the back of the line. That's when Badigadi shows up and trying to cut to the front by challenging all the combatants in line already, for some reason Nina finds herself attacking the Demon King and is easily cast aside and her sword broken. Rudeus comes out and has his duel with Badigadi which Nina spectates and is shocked by the power he demonstrates. When Nina returns, she starts to understand the power that Eris strives to attain and resolves to become stronger... and carry another sword in case her sword breaks again.

When Reida and Isolte arrives at the Holy Land of Swords, Nina escorts them to Gal who discuss to them his plans on Eris' sword training. Nina asks if he can also join the training to which Gal permits and tells him to get Eris. After numerous sparring between Eris and Isolte where Eris could not land a blow on Isolte, Nina also spars with Isolte and she was able to defeat her. Noting her unusual calmness for a Sword God Style user, Reida asks Nina if she likes to train in Water God Style as well but Nina declines.  Gal and Reida then have an agreement that from dawn to noon, Nina, Eris and Isolte will train with their respective teachers then from noon to dusk, the three will practice and train together.

One month later, a strange triple deadlock has formed where Eris beats Nina, Nina beats Isolte and Isolte beats Eris. On one of the three's discussions, Eris reveals that her constant release of blood lust is actually a high level technique of the
Superd Tribe
 that
Ruijerd Superdia
 taught her, to which Isolte points out that Eris intentionally provokes her opponent to attack. During this time, Nina improves her sword technique with Eris and Isolte's help and grew close to them.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Power and Abilities

『Sword Emperor』
She has prowess comparable to Eris', if not slightly weaker. However, she possesses the ability to not emit any bloodlust or killing intent that is rare among Sword God Style swordsmen, which allowed Nina to repeatedly defeat Isolte, whom Eris struggled to even keep up with. She has become a Sword Emperor as of the Redundancy Chapter.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Equipment

Unnamed Swords






Nina Farion's equipment in the Light Novel



Nina wields a curved sword featuring a knuckle bow. She wears this sword horizontally across her back, secured loosely below her belt. Additionally, following her encounter with
Badigadi
, Nina carries a second, shorter sword, which is sheathed above her primary one.

Achievements

Sword Emperor

Quotes

"That's true. Please go easy on me."

Eris: "Nina, you read it!"

Nina: "Eh? I can't read words either."

Eris: "What? If you can't read words when you need to, then you'll be in trouble!"

Nina: "Even though you say that so arrogantly, you can't even read it yourself!"

Trivia

Nina was interested in Jino Britts, partly due to her finding out that Eris was not a virgin and not wanting to lose to her.

Nina casually proposed to Jino Britts, which he accepts and the two get married.

Like most people in the Holy Land of Swords, Nina cannot read.

No Such Thing As a Free Lunch
=============================

No Such Thing As a Free Lunch
 ( 只より高いものはない
Tadayori Takai Monohanai
) is the fourteenth episode of the
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series  originally broadcasted on October 17, 2021.

Synopsis

Rudeus is captured in the village of the Beast Tribe for a crime he didn't commit. While hoping that Eris and Ruijerd would come and pick him up, Geese (a member of the demon tribe) is thrown into the same prison cell after cheating while gambling. Rudeus explores the possibility of escaping from prison while talking with Geese when suddenly a group of smugglers attack the village.

Plot

TBA

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Geese Nukadia

Gyes Dedoldia

Gustav Dedoldia

Minitona Dedoldia

Tersena Adoldia

Gallus Cleaner

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Ruijerd Superdia

Holy Beast

Sauros Boreas Greyrat

Darius Silva Ganius

Grabell Zafin Asura

Ariel Anemoi Asura
 (Cameo)

Luke Notos Greyrat
 (Cameo)

Fitss
 (Cameo)

Locations

Millis Continent

Great Forest

Doldia Village

Central Continent

Asura Kingdom

Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 4

Chapter 7: Free Apartment

Chapter 8: Fire Emergency

Manga Volume 6

Chapter 32:
Emergency

Differences with the Light Novel:

In the light novel, the design of Rudeus' prison was a cabin with Iron bars.

When Rudeus escaped with Geese, he froze the tree where his clothes and staff were in order to prevent them from being damaged by the fire, wearing only the the vest he acquired from Geese. In the anime, he retrieves them.

In the anime, Gyes replace Gimbal, another beastman.

In the light novel, Gimbal was killed in the battle against Gallus. In the anime, Gyes was injured instead by Gallus.

A short scene where Rudeus checked if Gallus was unconscious or not after the battle was cut.

In the light novel, Rudeus doesn't fall unconscious after the battle.

A short scene that explains how the holy beast was kidnapped and the smugglers plans was cut.

Sauros execution is shown in the anime. In the Light Novel, it took place off screen and was only mentioned in the
6th Volume
.

Trailer

TVアニメ『無職転生』次回予告⑭：10-17(日)放送第14話「只より高いものはない」予告

Gallery

View Gallery

Click here to view the Gallery

Trivia

The anime added a scene of Sauros execution which only appeared in the Manga version. It was not present in the Light Novel.

Nokopara
========

This article
lacks information
 and requires expansion. Please
expand this page
 to include missing information to help improve the article.

Nokopara
 is a rank-C-adventurer. He previously formed
a party
 with
Blaze
 and
Roxy Migurdia
.

Appearance

Nokopara has the appearance of a muscular man with the head of a horse.

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Personality

He is clever and found out about
Rudeus
' job trading scheme. He is also greedy and not afraid to blackmail
Dead End
 in order to get some extra money, only being stopped by
Ruijerd
's intimidating revelation. He's known for teasing people such as with
Roxy Migurdia
.

Background

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Plot

Entry-Level Adventurers arc

He recommended
Rudeus
 to take the pet rescue quest when he first went to the adventurer's guild in
Rikarisu.
 He also tried to extort money out of
Dead End
 by blackmailing them after finding out that they traded jobs with P-hunters, but
Ruijerd
's intervention halted it.

Later he meets up with
Roxy
 and suggests that she visits her family.

He later reunites with Elinalise and Rudeus but Nekopara doesn't remember him, he decides to help them on their quest of finding Kishirika and eventually tell the group about
Atoferatofe
 and about how she is also looking for her.

Power and Abilities

Nokopara is weak in combat, but is clever and cunning enough to establish a extensive underground information network in Rikarisu. He is able to dig out people's weakness to blackmail them, or gather comprehensive information for a particular subject in a short amount of time.

Equipment

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Achievements

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Quotes

To Ruijerd:
 “I-I’m sorry! I h-had no idea you were the real deal! P-please, don’t kill me! Please!”

Trivia

Nokopara's race is supposed to be one of the
Beast Races
, but classified as Demon Race due to siding with
Kishirika
 during the Great Human-Demon Wars.

Norn
====

Redirect to:
Norn Greyrat

Norn Greyrat
============

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

This article is about the character page. For the Manga Chapter, see
Norn Greyrat (Manga)
.

Information

Story

Relationships

Appearance

Norn Greyrat
 (
ノルン
・
グレイラット
)
 is the second child of
Paul Greyrat
 and
Zenith Greyrat
, the younger sister of
Rudeus Greyrat
 and the older half-sister of
Aisha Greyrat
. She initially had a bad relationship with her brother and an inferiority complex due to constant comparisons to her genius siblings. However, over time, she reconciled with Rudeus and grew out of her self-esteem issues.

Appearance

Norn has blond hair and green eyes.

As an adult, she is noted to be a beauty by her brother
Rudeus Greyrat
 and she has similar looking features as her mother
Zenith Greyrat
 while Norn had also inherited her mother's curvaceous figure.

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Personality

Due to being teleported with only
her father
, Norn has a strong attachment to him and hates anyone that hurts him. Because of this, she initially hated
her brother
 after he got into a fight with her father. She has also shown to be quite stubborn, refusing the make up with him until years later.

Due to her father often being busy with work, she grew up to be an independent person. However, beneath her outer demeanor, Norn developed a serious inferiority complex due to constantly being compared to her outstanding siblings. Over time, this became so bad that she nearly became a shut-in, though she managed to pull through once she realized that her siblings loved her. Norn has shown herself to be a hardworking girl. It's just that she of prone to making mistakes under pressure. She is well-rounded person and prefers to separate
her family
 matters with her school life.

She is a devout believer of the
Milis Religion
 which is instilled by her mother's side of the family, and thus she strongly disapproved of Rudeus taking
Roxy
 as the second wife, since it's against that religion to have more than one wife. She later slowly accepts the fact that Rudeus has several wives. She seems to have a similar disposition toward may-december romances; having an obvious crush on
Ruijerd Superdia
, yet believing for the longest time that they could not be together due him being her peer by centuries.

Background

Norn is the second child of Paul and Zenith who was born a few hours prior to
Aisha Greyrat
 on the same day where she used to live in the
Village of Buena
 in the Boreas Region before the
Teleport Incident
 and later moved to the
Millishion
,
Millis Continent
 for a few years with Paul and briefly with the Latreia family.

For most part of the story, she lives with
her brother
 in
Sharia
 with
her family
 and attends the
Magic University of Ranoa
.

Like Rudeus, She has
Greyrat
 Nobility and Latreia Nobility blood in her.

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Plot

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Alternate Timelines

Orsted Time Loop

In a world where Rudeus does not exist, Norn became an
adventurer
 where she would also sing and dance as a fighting
Classes#Bard
. She also formed a party with fellow adventurers who have similar interests and journeys toward the northern
Central Continent
 and is by standards a Rank B adventurer despite neither her Swordsmanship nor Magic are outstanding. During one of her requests, her party was annihilated by a demonic
monster
 where Norn would have died but was saved by Ruijerd. To Norn, it was love at first sight and they begin to journey together.

Norn would repeatedly try to get close to Ruijerd but he ignores her advances until he discovered that the Superd Race had been wiped out by
Drain Syndrome
 and fell into despair. Norn devoted herself in caring for Ruijerd who is moved by her affection and they got married. They live together in a corner of the
Biheiril Kingdom
 where Norn would eventually get pregnant but Ruijerd wall also be afflicted by Drain Syndrome and dies. Norn raised their child named
Luicelia Superdia
 by herself and eventually her life also comes to an end but is said to look satisfied in her deathbed.

Future Rudeus

In the timeline of
Rudeus
 from an alternate future, Norn avoids speaking with Rudeus who has become depressed and a drunkard after Roxy died and in the later years, she is barely mentioned afterwards leaving what happened to her is unknown.

Power and Abilities

Unlike her parents and siblings, Norn does not have any outstanding abilities. However, she manages to rise above her peers by sheer effort which earns the respect of her family and peers alike. In a way, Norn is a "jill of all trades, but a master of none," being able to use both magic and
Battle Aura
, but not specializing in either. Also, her lack of talent means she will likely never be able to rise above the intermediate level.

Physical Abilities

Norn is trained by Rudeus in using the sword after Paul's death and she attains
Intermediate Sword God Style
.

Magic Abilities

『
Healing Magic
』

Her rank is unknown, but she is at least Elementary level. Norn used a healing spell on
Cliff
.

『
Divine Strike Magic
』

Her rank is unknown, but she is at least Elementary level. Norn used Exorcise to destroy a skeleton controlled by a wreath when helping Cliff.

Writer

Norn took interest in writing when she finds out that Rudeus is trying to make a storybook about Ruijerd who just started on the physical apperance of Ruijerd, Norn volunteers to help him since Ruijerd would tell her stories about the
Superd Tribe
 during their journey to Sharia. After her initial manuscripts, Rudeus sees Norn as a talented writer where her methods of presenting the story she is writing to be interesting.
 Through her adulthood, Norn has authored several books, that greatly affected the impression of those around her and also has been referenced by other books such as The Asura Kingdom's Dossier on Rudeus Greyrat.

Equipment

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Achievements

Becoming the Student Council President of
Ranoa Magic Academy
 and serving for three years.

Becoming an established writer.

Writing a history book on the
Superd
,
"The Great Adventures of the Supard Race"
, which helped clear much of the distain surrounding the race.

Writing Rudeus' biography:
"The Great Magician - Rudeus Greyrat"
.

Writing Aisha's biography:
"The Anguish of a Genius - Aisha Greyrat"
.

Writing her own autobiography:
"An Average Human Surrounded By Geniuses"
.

Quotes

The moment we arrived at Ruijerd's place, Norn immediately ran to him and hugged him by his belly.

Norn:
 "I'm glad... I'm so glad..."

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Trivia

As of Volume 18, Norn is the Student Council President and is admired for her dedication.

Has her own fanclub, which initially contained paparazzi like people, after seeing this
Rudeus
 established a fanclub to protect Norn.

In other loops, Norn was fated to become an adventurer and get saved by
Ruijerd
, whom she then eventually married and had a
child
 with. That child became an important piece in the fight against
Laplace
.
Orsted
 is indebted to that
child
.

The name of
Aisha
 and Norn are based of playable characters in the video game
Ogre Battle: The March of the Black Queen.

Norn Greyrat/Relationships
==========================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Information

Story

Relationships

Appearance

Family Members

Paul Greyrat

Norn has a great amount of love and respect for her father and was with him the longest out of the two sisters after the Metastasis Event scattered them, she was with him for most of that time.

Following his descent into depression, Norn remained respectful and understanding towards him and hated it when her brother Rudeus beat her father down during their first meeting. She refused to reconcile with Rudeus even after Paul admitted to being the one at fault. She ultimately wanted to go with Paul to save her mother, even though she knew she'd be a burden, because she didn't want to go to her grandmother, who she hates, or her brother, who she hates and fears. Regardless Paul sent her off to her brother's instead.

When news arrived that the rescue party was in need of help, but Rudeus didn't move to provide aid, Norn tried to go to their father herself despite not knowing how to get there or having the skills to even survive the trip, so Rudeus chose to go in her stead. When Rudeus later returned with news of Paul's death, she was heartbroken. The item she inherited from her father was his
favorite sword
 that she keeps in her room and would pray for her father from there. She has since begun training in swordsmanship under her brother and later his third wife Eris and also seeks to become an adventurer just like her father before her.

Zenith Greyrat

Zenith is Norn's biological mother and inherited lots of her features such as her hair color, body figure and her faith in the
Milis Religion
. Despite Zenith becoming unresponsive, due to being a Miko, Norn would still greet her as she leaves for school and would also talk about various things with her such as her life at school.

Rudeus Greyrat

Rudeus seeing Norn off in the Anime
Norn realizing how Rudeus really cares about her in the Anime
Norn and Rudeus studying together in the Anime
Norn confronting Rudeus for deciding to make Roxy her second wife
Norn sword training with Rudeus in the Anime
1/5

Rudeus is Norn's older brother whom she does not know of since he left when she was a baby and only hear stories and praises about him from his parents. When she first meets her brother in
Millishion
, he was violently beating up their father after their reunion. The results of this brought her to hate her brother, despite her father later telling her that he was also in the wrong and that they had reconciled. She didn't want anything to do with her brother, and when her father went to rescue her mother, she wanted to go with him instead, but she was instead sent to her brother's house in
Sharia
.

Her hatred for Rudeus turned to fear gradually during the trip partly because their guard, Rujierd, a close friend of Rudeus, constantly praised her brother, as did her sister Aisha. She feared that perhaps, as Rudeus once hit her father, he might be violent and hit her as well. Upon their reunion she found Rudeus returning after a night out drinking with his wife
Sylphy
, the exact image he once beat up their father for, and scorned him more. This reaches the point where she chooses to remain in the dorms rather than her brother's house, and she interprets his readiness to send her there as proof he doesn't want her around.

However, while at the magical academy, she finds several people praising her brother's personality and skills where she also gets compared to him most of the time. She learns that he's become something like the don of the school, assembling all of the delinquent students under him but is respected by everyone because he effectively brought order to this lot and keeps them from causing trouble. Finally realizing that her brother might not be the kind of horrible person she imagined, she becomes a recluse and refuses to leave her room. Rudeus himself sneaks into the girl's dorm to talk with her here, and they reconcile at long last.

When Norn tried to go and help their father who is still in the
Begaritt Continent
, despite not knowing how to get there or how to survive the trip, Rudeus went in her stead. He returned with a missing arm, news of their father's death, and their mother, who was in a mentally invalid condition. The shock of this greatly affected her, but she didn't speak ill of her brother after seeing his missing arm and realizing that it must've been caused by the battle.

She does take issue when Rudeus proposes making
Roxy
 his second wife, due to being a devout Milis believer and having previously proclaimed how she wanted an honest marriage like her brother and Sylphy did, however she was silenced by Sylphy herself, who notes that they aren't
Milis believers
 and is apparently okay with the arrangement. While this has disillusioned her a bit, it seems she's ultimately come to accept it over time as her brother's private matters. When
Eris
 later becomes Rudeus' third wife, she is staggeringly quick to accept it since it's already happened before.

She later asks Rudeus to teach her swordsmanship, and continues with it despite the harshness of his lessons. She states to him that her ultimate goal is to become an adventurer, and he notes that while he won't stop her he will be worried about her safety.

By the request of the Dragon God Orsted, she was bethrothed. Though initially somewhat reluctant, she gleefully accepted the arrangement at the mention of Ruijerd Superdia being her soon to be. As Rudeus prepared the wedding, she prayed, reflecting back on her past and on her relationship with Rudeus, whomst she akinned to fullfilling both the motherly and fatherly role in her life, as he was always with her and always supported her through thick and thin. During the ceremony, she cried about her gratitude towards Rudeus, fully accepting and loving him as her brother whomst she could always rely on.

Lilia Greyrat

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Aisha Greyrat

Aisha is Norn's younger half-sister. Since young, Norn had constantly been compared to her, especially by her grandmother who told her that, as the legitimate daughter, she should always be superior to her. However, this proved to be impossible, as Aisha was a genius who could do anything she set her mind to. As a result, those around Norn constantly told her to be more like Aisha, causing her to develop an inferiority complex. On top this, Norn's personal relationship with Aisha was also not good, as the two often scuffled.

Unbeknownst to Norn, however, Aisha also had an inferiority complex toward her, believing that, as she was the legitimate daughter, their relatives loved her more.

Ultimately, after Norn overcame her inferiority complex, she and Aisha made up and are now on much better terms with each other and she would finally beat her at something many years later: being the first to get married.

In a deleted chapter about Aisha's affair with Ars, a child of Rudeus and Eris, she could never forgive her and was, together with Rudeus, strongly against the relationship. Though Rudeus reluctantly accepted the engagement, Norn has still not forgiven her.

Claire Latreia

﻿She does not seem to like her maternal grandmother﻿ due to Claire's strict attitude and education. During Paul's depression, Claire wanted to take Norn away from him forcibly but was talked down by her husband. Claire does love Norn, and had high expectations of her, but she ultimately failed to mold her in any way to her ideal image of a noble lady. She warned Norn not to become an adventurer like her mother, which finally insulted Norn enough to alienate her.

In truth Claire loves Norn and Zenith, despite outwardly appearing to hate Norn for being inferior to Aisha, and Zenith for disobeying her and becoming an adventurer. She wanted to tell Norn to just do her best and not compare herself to Aisha, but she failed to relay those thoughts. She also wanted Zenith to return and acknowledges that Zenith, contrary to her expectations early on, would've been a great mother to Norn if given the chance.

Ruijerd Superdia





Norn and Ruijerd's wedding



Norn first met Rujierd when he was escorting her brother and Eris back to the former's home. Still being fearful of her brother at the time after he got into a fight with her father, he was the only one of his companions who she felt comfortable around.

When Paul decides to have Norn to start living with Rudeus in
Sharia
, Norn vehemently refuses to go and runs away but she is saved by Ruijerd. Ruijerd agreed to be her escort to which Norn reluctantly agreed. From Ruijerd’s introduction, she develops an obvious crush, feeling like a fairytale princess rescued by her knight, enchanted by his smile and third eye bathed in sunlight.
 Over the course of their journey together, the shy Norn came to clearly rely on the protective Ruijerd and when she is unable to sleep Ruijerd would tell her stories about his past and the Superd Race. Ultimately though, the two were forced to part ways after their journey was complete. Norn, still scared of her brother, initially didn't want to be separated from Ruijerd, but he managed to convince her to at least give her brother a chance.
 Norn also begins working with Rudeus in restoring the honor and reputation of Ruijerd and the Superds and through the stories Ruijerd told her, she writes a book that helped the people learn the truth of Ruijerd's history.

Many years later and during the events of Biheiril Kingdom, Norn is deeply shaken by the news of Ruijerd’s condition, recalling their past together, his kindness, the stories he shared, and the comfort he gave her. Despite her overwhelming desire to help him, Norn chooses to stay with Lucy, who is distressed from being left alone. However, when Lucy learns the full story, she urges Norn to go help Ruijerd and so Norn finally decides to leave, determined to be there for Ruijerd, just as he had always been there for her.

Upon arriving at Ruijerd's house she nurses and looks after the sick Ruijerd. When Ruijerd recovers she's so happy that she hugs him and starts sobbing and hiccuping with a flushed flace. They stuck together in times of rest, Norn being taught many things by Ruijerd and Norn constantly looking to cook him food. When it was time to return to Sharia, the shy Norn wanted to give a memento to Ruijerd, but Ruijerd tells her that he'll never forget her.

In
K431
, Orsted orders Rudeus to arrange for Norn's marriage with Ruijerd much to Rudeus' surprise. After Rudeus talks to Norn, she immediately tells Rudeus that she accepts the marriage to make the arrangements immediately. The two got married in a Superd and Milis style wedding and had a child they named
Luicelia Superdia
.

Sylphiette

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Roxy Migurdia

Note: This section is under construction and revision

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Note: This section is under construction and revision

Friends and Associates

Cliff Grimoire

"Study hard and learn your magic. It will be a great relief to your brother Rudeus and your father, where ever they might be... In the end, you pray. Saint Milis is always watching over us."

Cliff Grimoire to Norn

Norn knows that Cliff is one of Rudeus' acquaintances from the Ranoa Magic Academy and also attended Cliff and
Elinalise Dragonroad
's wedding ceremony. They formally talked when Norn was in tears in the Milis Church in Sharia due to her uneasiness for forcing Rudeus to journey to the
Begaritt Continent
 in her stead to help Paul in rescuing Zenith. Because of them both being followers of the
Milis Religion
, Norn is able to open up to Cliff about her worries and taking to heart the advice of Cliff, Norn now has a goal to achieve while waiting for Rudeus and their family to return.

Melissa





Melissa(left) in the Anime



Norn's room mate and best friend. Through Melissa's help, Norn is able to catch up with the lessons of the academy and get used to her new life in there. After Ruijerd, it was Melissa's help that changes Norn's impression towards demons from what her grandmother
Claire Latreia
 told her that they are evil creatures.

Others

References

Norn Greyrat/Story
==================

SPOILER ALERT!

This page contains
spoilers!
  Read at your own risk.

Information

Story

Relationships

Appearance

She was born in the
Buena Village
 which was destroyed due to the Metastasis event. She then later moved to the Milis Kingdom with her father
Paul Greyrat
 and committed to Milis Faith there. She had attended school in the Milis Kingdom before she had moved to Sharia to live with her brother.

When she was 5, it was the first time she met her brother
Rudeus Greyrat
 who was seen plummeting her father to the ground. She instantaneously hated him and interjected the fight, officially ending it. From that point onwards to their reunion, she continues to hold that sentiment towards him.

She was often compared to others as a child and she disliked it. She was always told to be 'more like her brother' and 'to be better than her sister
Aisha Greyrat
' by her grandparents. She is seen to be suffering from an inferiority complex due to the constant comparison which caused her to have the mindset that she would not be better than anyone else.

When she was in her teens, she hated the decision of having to move in with her brother and his new wife
Sylphiette
. At some point in the Younger Sisters Chapter, she nearly became a shut-in in the dorms and was saved by her brother who understood what she was going through and offered her comfort.
 She shares a close attachment to her brother due to that incident, feeling like
Rudeus
 was just like her father
Paul Greyrat
.

From that moment on, her relationship with her brother became better and under his persuasion, she and her sister became on better civil terms. She and
Aisha Greyrat
 later becomes close friends with one another and are often seen together and helping one another.

She was then seen working hard on her academics, magic and swordsplay, becoming more forthcoming with her emotions. Under the careful tutoring of
Roxy
,
Eris Greyrat
,
Sylphiette
 and
Rudeus Greyrat
, she becomes more proficient and above average at those areas. Through that, she forged a closer bond with her sisters-in-law.

She assisted her brother in writing a book to clear the stories of horrors about the Supard Race that were partially true, which later turned out to be her own book. Her brother had complimented her on her gift for words which led to her writing several more before her death.

Throughout the story, she is seen to play some roles. She often helps out with the household chores and likes to dote on her nephews and nieces a lot.

The most prominent part about her was her becoming Student Council President of the Magic University of Ranoa, a feat that even surprised her grandmother
Claire Latreia
. She was seen as a calm and collected person who devoted herself to her duties.

In fact, she was so popular in terms of looks and dedication that she had a fan club that was later more organized thanks to her brother's work behind the scenes. She was adored by many and served as President for three years before she graduated.

After graduation, she became an office lady in a Magic Guild, sorting out paperwork and finances. Although that is her main job, she still helps her brother with the biddings he had been given.

References

Norn Greyrat (Manga)
====================

This article is about the Manga Chapter 94. For the Character page, see
Norn Greyrat
.

Norn Greyrat (Manga)
 is the 94th chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Norn Greyrat

Summary

Norn recalls his encounters with Rudeus and how she came to hate him. Then she recalls her life in Millishion where she is always compared to Aisha which causes her to develop an inferiority complex. This remains until shereunites with Rudeus in Sharia and she feels like she is on her own even though Rudeus permits her to live in the academy dorms. Going back to the present she sees Rudeus in front of her, sitting down watching her...

Volume 1

Norn and Aisha
==============

Norn and Aisha
 (ノルンとアイシャ
Norun to Aisha
) is the sixteenth episode of the
second season
 (40th overall)
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on April 28, 2024 and also the first episode of the
Sisters Arc
 for the Anime.

Synopsis

Rudeus' younger sisters Norn and Aisha has arrived and begins to stay at the
Greyrat House
. However, in contrast to the cheerful and energetic Aisha, Norn is shy and withdrawn towards Rudeus... Rudeus, who is at a loss on how to treat his two younger sisters who are complete opposites of each other decides follow Paul's instructions and decides to send them to study at Ranoa Magic Academy, but...

Plot

Rudeus and
Ruijerd
 are at the living room where Ruijerd informs him what he has been doing and eventually heads to East Port and together with
Ginger
, they volunteer to escort Norn and Aisha to Sharia while Sylphiette accommodates the two and currently in the bathroom. After their discussions about
Eris
, Ruijerd mentions that he will be leaving tomorrow but assures Rudeus that he will return.

Next day, Rudeus sees Ruijerd and
Badigad
i staring at each other by their gate where the latter leaves upon seeing Rudeus. When asked, Ruijerd explains that they have a history long ago that Rudeus concludes it was grudges from the
Laplace War
 and invites Ruijerd to have breakfast with them before he go.

After breakfast, Norn wants to go with Ruijerd, still resenting Rudeus for attacking Paul back at Millis, but he tells her not to think about that and to rely on Rudeus and assures Norn that they will meet again. At the living room, Rudeus formally welcomes Norn and Aisha and he is given a lockbox containing coins and valuable items from
Paul
 for funds and two letters from Paul. Following Paul's request in the letter, Rudeus decides that his sisters go to school, but Aisha declines and claim that school has nothing to teach her while Norn also refuses as well, but they both agreed to take entrance exam.

That night, Rudeus consults with Sylphiette on Aisha wishing to be his maid to which Sylphiette doesn't mind since they are neglecting the house as they are always at school and its what Aisha wants, but she is also worried about Norn.

The exam result arrives and Aisha happily shows that she got a perfect score and Rudeus agrees let Aisha help with the house and talk with Sylphiette. Norn, who scored below average, wants to live in the
dormitory
, which upsets Aisha when Rudeus permits her under the impression that Norn is getting special treatment and that she is the daughter of a concubine, but Rudeus assures her that he doesn't see her that way and sees as her as his real sister.

Days later, Norn is about to leave the Greyrat House where Rudeus give him numerous advises and also tells Norn to return to the house in 10 days.

At Ranoa Magic Academy, Rudeus is worried upon seeing Norn who seems to be alone but is approached by Linia and Pursena and gives him a bag while telling him to open it when he is alone. While wondering the contents of the bag, Rudeus meets Luke and tells him to accompany him to the Student Council Office. When they arrive, Ariel tells Rudeus the activities of Linia and Pursena of forcing new students to give up their underwear, making Rudeus realize the contents of the bag and gives it to Ariel.

With the problem sorted, Rudeus, Sylphiette, Ariel and Luke sees Norn who is apparently lost so Ariel asks Luke to guide her while Rudeus looks on still worried.

At the school grounds, Rudeus scolds Linia and Pursena for their stunt where Norn sees them and is driven away by the two to which Rudeus tells them she is his sister and further warns them they will be punished if they pull a stunt like that again.

As everyone in school goes about their everyday life, Norn is alone in her dormitory room...

Characters

North God Style
===============

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

“North God Kalman I used a sword, but there is no need to stick to the sword.”

North God Kalman II

North God Style
 (
北神流
,

Hokushin-ryū
)
 is one of the three major schools of swordsmanship.

Characteristics

The main focus of this style is not on techniques or developing specialties, but rather on a method for staying alive and approaching a battle with the highest chance of winning. It relies heavily on the practitioner's adaptability and use of their surroundings. Consequently, this style uses many tricks instead of refined techniques.

This utilitarian style of swordsmanship includes non-sword fighting techniques, such as first aid and tracking, as well as the ability to fight while physically disadvantaged. Because of this, different North God Style factions have different approaches to battle, resulting in very disparate fighting styles among their practitioners. Practitioners may dual-wield swords or use non-sword weapons, such as battleaxes and staves.

Due to their adaptable style and reliance on tricks, they are a hard counter for
Water God Style
 because most of their peculiar tricks are hard to parry or counter. At the same time, however, this style is weak against the
Sword God Style
 because the latter is a straightforward style that aims to finish off opponents with one attack before being overwhelmed.

Many adventurers and mercenaries learn North God Style because of its versatility, which is necessary on unpredictable battlefields.

Known Techniques

Techniques of the North God Style are unique to their user except for a number of fundamental techniques.

Sword Throwing Techniques





A North God Style sword throwing technique



Sword Throwing Techniques: When a North God Style Swordsman is cornered or rendered immobile, they will throw their sword. The sword is flung at high velocity with the blade whirling violently. This technique has enough impetus to even cut magic fireballs. During
Eris
' battle against
Orsted
, she uses another variant of sword throwing technique she witnessed from Auber once. She trained to draw a sword from the scabbard with one hand as fast as possible.

Used by an unnamed thug,
Auber Corvette
 and
Eris Greyrat

Four Legged Form





Paul using Four Legged Form while dodging
Rudeus
' Rock Bullets in the Anime



Four Legged Form
 (
四足の型
,

Yotsuashi no Kata
, lit. "Quadrupedal Form")
: The user charges using their arms and legs similar to a beast race, making them a smaller target compared to moving in two legs while drawing their weapon when closing the distance to attack their target.

Used by
Paul Greyrat

Hazy Cross

Hazy Cross
 (
朧十文字
,

Oboro Jūmonji
)
: The moment both swords are swung and blocked, the user throws them away and draws the remaining sword to stop the enemy through a gap in the enemy's defense.

Used by
Auber Corvette

Teardrop Bullet

Teardrop Bullet
 (
落涙弾
,

Rakurui-dan
)
: It involves throwing a bag full of powdered spices at the enemy.

Used by
Auber Corvette

Ranks

There are seven ranks in the North God Style.

North God

The North God is the most powerful practitioner of the North God Style and leader of the school. Practitioners who are of Saintly level and above may call themselves a Saint, King, Emperor or God of the North God school. However, unlike the
Sword God Style
 and
Water God Style
 systems, the title of God rank can be assumed by more than one person as long as their strength and skills are approved by most of the practitioners of their faction. There are no clear qualifications for a practitioner to become a North God since the North God ranks have only been held by immortal swordsmen of the
Kalman
 lineage.

Due to the different factions in the North God Style, Kalman III hates the techniques from outside his faction but after battling Rudeus, he changed his mind become versed in all the techniques of every faction that he now teaches his student.

North Emperor

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

North King

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

North Saint

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Advanced

A standard Advanced North God Style Practitioner can self consciously use their
Battle Aura
. Until the the Advanced rank, the focus for lower rank is learning the foundations.

Intermediate

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Beginner

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Known Practitioners

North God:
Kalman I
,
Kalman II
,
Kalman III
,
Atoferatofe Rybak

North Emperor:
"Peacock Sword" Auber Corvette
 †,
Doga
,
Sieghart Saladin Greyrat

North King:
"Light and Darkness" Wii Taa
 †,
"Twin Swords" Knuckle Guard
 †,
Sieghart Saladin Greyrat
 (Former), Kalina of Wind

North Saint:
Eris Greyrat
,
Gallus Cleaner
, Bese Beine of Water

Advanced:
Paul Greyrat
 †

Beginner:
Rudeus Greyrat

Unknown Rank:
Randolph Marianne
,
Orsted

Trivia

The headquarters of the North God school is located in the Kingdom of Dragon King on the
Central Continent
.

Most of the North God Style practitioner have peculiar/unique traits that differ from one another, usually it's easy to know the trait just by knowing their nickname.

North God Style is regarded as the second strongest sword style after Sword God Style.

Due to the numerous factions of the North God Style, it is more lenient in granting the title of Kings, having slightly less than 50 known North Kings around the world
, way more than Sword Kings and Water Kings.

Most antagonist swordsmen appearing in series are North God Style practitioners.

The
author
 states that
Ruijerd's
 strength is equal to a North Emperor.

Rudeus describes the North God Style give off the
Jackie Chan
 vibes

Nuckel
======

Redirect to:
Nuckelgard

Nuckelgard
==========

This article
lacks information
 and requires expansion. Please
expand this page
 to include missing information to help improve the article.

One of the
Three Swords of the North God
, Twin Blade, a pair of
Mildett
 twins named Nuckel and Gard.

Appearance

Nuckel and Gard are Mildetts, and therefore they had rabbit-like ears. They were also twins and had the exact same face, to the point where them moving could create the temporary illusion that it was one person splitting in two.

Personality

Extremely talkative and loose lipped revealed during their assassination attempt on
Ariel Anemoi Asura
 where they revealed who they were and who hired them.

Background

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Plot

Hired by
Darius Silva Ganius
 to take part in an assassination attempt on
Ariel Anemoi Asura
 when Ariel and her bodyguards
Rudeus Greyrat
,
Eris Boreas Greyrat
,
Ghislaine Dedoldia
,
Luke Notos Greyrat
, and
Sylphiette
 were traveling back from speaking with
Pilemon Notos Greyrat
 to Ariel's residence. While Ariel took a secret underground passageway back to her residence and Sylphiette used a magic item to disguise herself as Ariel, Nuckelgard,
Wii Taa
, another of the Three Swords of the North God, and
Auber Corvette
 attacked them in the middle of the street at night. They fought against Eris causing her to suffer a major blow to shoulder before ultimately being slain by her blade.

Power and Abilities

Rudeus noted that on their own they were each "North Saint level at best".

North
 King

Equipment

Black non-reflective armor and a straight sword.

Achievements

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Quotes

Nuckel
: "Alone, we are only half a man."

Gard
: "Together, we are a man complete!"

Trivia

They had many assassination attempts on their own lives, where they noted that none of their assassins had ever mentioned who hired them, which contrasted their willingness to give up such information.

ORSTED Corporation
==================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

This is all in preparation for the war which will take place in 80 to 100 years. I will organize the Anti-Hitogami faction, gathering men to defeat Laplace and support Orsted. I'll create Orsted's armed forces.

Rudeus Greyrat

ORSTED Corporation
 is an organization founded by Rudeus that gather forces to support Orsted in his battle against Hitogami.

Background

In order to reach
Hitogami
, Orsted needs acquire the treasures of the Five Dragon Generals, one of them belongs to
Laplace
 who will be reborn in the future and will start another war on humanity. But Hitogami cannot be defeated if Orsted is depleted his
Mana
 from his battle against Laplace. So Zanoba proposes to recruit companions separate from Orsted to enhance their fighting force and gather allies while moving freely.

Headquarters





(Right)ORSTED Corporation Headquarters when it was a hut



Initially built as a hut located in the suburbs of Sharia, Ranoa Kingdom and where Rudeus built his first Magic Armor for his second battle against Orsted. The hut is renovated into a 1 storey building that has a conference room, sleeping room, research room and an armory containing all of Rudeus' magic tools and armor that he locks with Earth Magic to avoid being stolen.

A basement has also been created made by Rudeus' Earth Magic which has 20 rooms with plans of adding a teleportation magic circle on each of them but currently only 5 of the rooms have a teleportation magic circle in
Asura Kingdom
, Holy Kingdom of Milis, the Great Forest, Kingdom of the Dragon King, and the southern part of the
Demon Continent
.

Members

Orsted

The titular Head of the ORSTED Corporation and referred to as President or Chairman by Rudeus in his narrations. Orsted usually stays in corporation's headquarters when not in a mission and also gives out orders on the operations of the corporation and approval of recruitments.

Rudeus Greyrat

First subordinate of Orsted and Founder of ORSTED Corporation, also known as the Dragon God's right hand who carries out missions on Orsted's behalf and recruiting members.

Ariel Anemoi Asura

Second Subordinate of Orsted, Ariel is one of the main sponsor of the ORSTED Corporation after becoming queen of Asura Kingdom. In addition to being a major shareholder, Ariel also pledges her army in the case of a decisive battle.

Zanoba Shirone

Third Subordinate of Orsted, Zanoba is also in charge of developing Rudeus' Magic Armor especially after
Geese Nukadia
 reveals that he is preparing for war against them.

Miko of Memory

The Miko of
Millishion
 and becomes a member of the corporation after Rudeus gives her a bracelet with the Dragon God's emblem and an owl that she names Nurse that serves as her guardian beast.

Faria Steer

The receptionist of the Corporation. She is part of the long-eared tribe and is called "Little Elf-Chan" by Rudeus.

Kalman III

Initially an enemy, he happily joined the ORSTED Corporation after being defeated by the Dragon God in battle.

Ars Greyrat

Helps Rudeus and travels with Aisha during his tasks.

Godbard

Godbard is the current Ore God of
Talhand
's generation who swore loyal to the Dragon God for a large number of black stone created by Rudeus with Earth Magic that the Magic Armor is made of.

Subsidiary

Rude Mercenary Company

Reference

OVA 01
======

Redirect to:
Eris The Goblin Slayer

Ogre Empire
===========

Orsted

On the front line
=================

Redirect to:
Opening Theme 8

Only
====

Redirect to:
Ending Theme 1

Opening Theme 1
===============

Tabibito no Uta
 (旅人の唄 lit. "Traveller's Song") is the first opening theme of the
Mushoku Tensei
 anime performed by Yuiko Ōhara. It was released as a digital single on the anime's official premiere day on January 10, 2021.

The song was first used in the anime as the end-credits theme song for
Episode 1
. It officially debuted as the opening theme from
Episode 3
 and was used as the theme from the episode onwards. The song does not have a special video-animation sequence for the credits as it is integrated into real-time scenes of the story, and varies for every episode.

A collection of creditless opening videos for episodes 3-5 was included in the
Blu-ray Chapter 1
 release.

Opening Theme 2
===============

Mezame no Uta
 (目覚めの唄 lit. "Awakening Song") is the second opening theme of the
Mushoku Tensei
 anime performed by Yuiko Ōhara. It was released as a digital single on March 15, 2021.

The song was first used in the anime as the opening theme song for
Episode 10
. The song does not have a special video-animation sequence for the credits as it is integrated into real-time scenes of the story, and varies for every episode.

Creditless opening videos for episodes 10 and 11 were included in the
Blu-ray Chapter 2
 release.

 anime performed by Yuiko Ōhara. It was released as a digital single on October 17, 2021.

The song was first used in the anime as the opening theme song for

 anime performed by Yuiko Ōhara.

The song was first used in the anime as the opening theme song for

. The song does not have a special video-animation sequence for the credits as it is integrated into real-time scenes of the story, and varies for every episode.

Opening Theme 7
===============

spiral
 is the seventh opening theme of the
Mushoku Tensei
 anime performed by LONGMAN.
The song was first used in the anime as the end-credits theme song for
Episode 25
. It officially debuted as the opening theme from
Episode 26
 and was used as the theme from the episode onwards. It is the first opening song which has a special video-animation sequence for the credits.

Official Music Video

Original Human God
==================

Background

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Plot

A featureless man with a mosaic covered face and while he was the weakest, he was also the most respected by all the other gods and was considered their leader. he was the one who suggested that all the gods come together and share their knowledge and technology with each other for the benefit of all worlds. It is due to these meetings that the Human God shared various wisdoms from his world such as the use of "Language" and "Letters" to the other Gods that greatly advanced their civilizations.

Legacy

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Trivia

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

References

Original Soundtrack
===================

Redirect to:
Original Soundtrack 1

Original Soundtrack 1
=====================

Mushoku Tensei Original Soundtrack 1
 (『無職転生 ～異世界行ったら本気だす～』 オリジナル・サウンドトラック1) is the official soundtrack album for the first cour of the
Mushoku Tensei
 TV-anime composed by
Yoshiaki Fujisawa
 (with the exception of track #21 and #37, which was composed by
Yuiko Ohara
). The album was released enclosed with
Blu-ray Chapter 1
 special edition on April 21, 2021. The album comprises of a total of 30 tracks in the regular digital edition and 37 in the special physical edition.

Musicians

Strings
:
Yu Manabe Strings

1st Violin
: Yu Manabe, Tomomi Tokunaga, Ayaka Jomoto, Natsue Kameda

2nd Violin
: Masahiko Todo, Naoko Ishibashi, Kyoko Ishigame

Viola
: Masaki Shono, Hyojin Kim

Cello
: Masutami Endo

Contrabass
: Koji Akaike

Percussion
: Ryoichi Kayatani

Recorder
: Takashi Yasui, Kenji Kaneko

Crumhorn
: Takashi Yasui, Kenji Kaneko

Irish Flute
: Akio Noguchi

Tin Whistle
: Akio Noguchi

Uilleann Pipes
: Akio Noguchi

Oboe d'amore
: Satoshi Shoji

Shawm
: Satoshi Shoji

Bass Oboe
: Satoshi Shoji

Viola da gamba
: Hiroshi Fukuzawa

Bulgarian Voice
: Dessislava Stefanova

Guitar and all other instruments
: Yoshiaki Fujisawa

Original Soundtrack 2
=====================

Mushoku Tensei Original Soundtrack 2
 (『無職転生 ～異世界行ったら本気だす～』 オリジナル・サウンドトラック2) is the official soundtrack album for the second cour of the
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series composed by
Yoshiaki Fujisawa
. The album was released enclosed with
Blu-ray Chapter 3
 special edition on January 19, 2022.
