VGMdb

Orsted
======

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Information

Chronology

Powers and Abilities

Relationships

Gallery

"I am already preparing and moving while thinking about what will happen in a hundred years time. What has happened and what will happen, everything is strategic preparation. Because of Nanahoshi and you, things have become distorted..."

Orsted to Rudeus Greyrat

Orsted
 (
オルステッド
,

Orusuteddo
)
 is the current
Dragon God
, a title given to the strongest member of the
Dragon Tribe
, and the sworn enemy of
"Human God"
.

Spoilers ahead!

Initially an antagonist, nearly killing
Rudeus
 twice due to his affiliation with Hitogami, he later becomes a major supporting character, after "Human God's" true nature is revealed.

Appearance

Similar to other Dragon Race people such as
Perugius
, Orsted has silver hair and golden
sanpaku
 eyes with an overpowering look.

He carries no visible equipment and wears a white coat adorned with fur.

Personality

Due to having the
curse
 of being hated and feared by all living things that see his face, Orsted has rather poor social skills and carries a somewhat distant attitude. When it comes to his objective, he is absolutely ruthless and would not hesitate from destroying anything on the way, no matter who or what. He would not hesitate to attack any apostles of
Hitogami
, usually without actually even taking the time to listen to them and has almost killed
Rudeus
 twice because of this.

However, he has an unexpectedly soft side to him, being patient and kind towards his comrades. Furthermore he has shown himself to be extremely kind towards children, especially Rudeus' children who are immune to his curse and thus don't fear or hate him. He is also very humble, preferring to refer to his followers as comrades rather than subordinates in spite of the vast power and standing differences. Orsted has an empathetic side as he profoundly apologizes to Rudeus for hiding the fate of the Superd Tribe from him.

He tends to become more emotional on topics that involve the
Dragon Race
 as he was quite angry at Rudeus when he mentioned the Dragon Race and spoke of
Perugius
. However, he does not get along with the other Dragon Race and seems to hate the Dragon Kings.

Background

Laplace: "A name"
First Dragon God: "Name?"
Laplace: "The name of your child?"
First Dragon God: "Orsted. This child's name is Orsted"

Orsted was born roughly
10,000~20,000 years ago
 in the Dragon World from the union between his father, the
First Dragon God
, and his mother
Lunaria
, the daughter of the Human God. However, at the time of his birth, his father had still not decided on a name for him yet despite his wife urgings to give him one.
 The world was split into six in this era, each home to a different race and ruled by a god: the human world, dragon world, demon world, beast world, ocean world, and sky world. However, at some point, Orsted's mother ended up being killed under mysterious circumstances. The
"Human God"
, claimed that the other gods had conspired against the Dragon God, resulting in his wife's death. Enraged, the Dragon God would wage a war of retribution against the other worlds.

The war ended up killing the other gods and destroying their worlds, with only the human world being spared his wrath and prompting survivors to flee there. However, after destroying the demon world, the dragon god's ward,
Laplace
, learned that the Demon God's wife had also been mysteriously murdered. Realizing that the person he thought had been Human God was, in fact, an imposter who had planned all of this, the furious Dragon God intended to go to war with the human world as well. However, at this point, his generals could no longer tolerate their liege's constant warmongering and turned on him, resulting in a battle so great that it left the First Dragon God getting extremely weakened while the dragon world began to collapse as well. Seeing this chance, Hitogami mortally wounds him.






Orsted defeating Gal Farion in the Manga



In the end, the First Dragon God was left mortally wounded whilst the surviving dragons departed for the human world. Though too weakened to kill the false Human God, the Dragon God managed to seal him in the
void between worlds
 before succumbing to his wounds. Before this happened, however, the dragon god used his power to send his son 10000 years into the future with a mission to kill Hitogami. He also ordered Laplace to await his son's arrival and develop techniques that can be used to kill Hitogami when the time comes. Upon sending his son to the future, the First Dragon god also finally decides on a name for him: Orsted.

On his journey in the
Human World
, Orsted battles and soundly defeats
Gal Farion
 who was at the time still a
Sword Saint
. Although Orsted completely defeats Gal, he spares him and let him go without missing a limb.

Achievements

Achieving the title of Dragon God, which is only given to the strongest member of the
Dragon Tribe
.

Ranking #2 among the
Seven Great Powers
.

Effectively being #1 due to the actual #1 being absent throughout the entirety of the Mushoku Tensei.

Mastering virtually every combat technique in the world, be it swordsmanship or magic, at God-Rank making him the strongest character in Mushoku Tensei.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Quotes

Orsted:
 "You. Are you perhaps familiar with the name
Hitogami
?"

Orsted:
 "When you die, be sure to deliver a message to Hitogami for me. Tell him that the Dragon God Orsted will be the one to kill him."

Orsted:
 "Choose! Rudeus Greyrat! Side with Hitogami, and lose everything to me! Or follow me, and fight Hitogami together! If it's you, since it's you who is immune to my curse, then you should be able to choose with your own will!"

Rudeus:
 "From my view point, you seem to hold a great grudge towards Hitogami, what is the reason?"
Orsted:
 "Is there someone who does not hold a grudge against that piece of trash?"
Rudeus:
 "...That's true."

Orsted:
 "There are many who call themselves Dragon Kings. They live as they please with that tiny pride of theirs and die because of a foolish enemy. But you are different. Therefore, don't call yourself that, Rudeus Greyrat."

Orsted:
 "I, too, want to try fighting believing in my comrades for once."

Orsted:
 "Possessing the Fighting God Armor and the King Dragon Sword. I assume that you'll have no excuses when you lose with both?"

Orsted:
 "Choose. Become my follower or die."

Trivia

Orsted is so skilled and experienced in combat that he could take at least five different courses of actions in one second of prediction, making Rudeus completely unable to counter him even with the
foresight eye
.

The curse of being hated and feared by all living creatures does not apply to members of the ancient Dragon Race,
Nanahoshi
, Rudeus and Rudeus' descendants.

Orsted tends to give an intimidating gaze. When he met Rudeus and Nanahoshi, he also asked why they are not looking away (indicating they are unaffected by the curse, otherwise they would).

Orsted usually deals the killing blow to his enemies by punching a hole through their chest, earning him the nickname "donut maker" among some fans.

Orsted unexpectedly enjoyed the company of Rudeus's child,
Lucy
, giving her a shoulder ride when she was small and even taught her a trick to do magic when she had difficulties.

Even though he is ranked second in Seven Great World Power, Orsted is said to be strongest in the world, surpassing the Technique God.

Orsted often checks on Rudeus's family when Rudeus was out to make sure that they are safe.

He is the 100th generation of the Dragon Gods.

He stopped counting after 100 "returns" (+100 times * 200 years= +20,000 years old), however his actual age is unknown.

At the start of every loop, he spends 10 years training his body.

In one of his loops, he fought Hitogami in the Void World and lost.

Orsted has kept notes about how to replicate the effects of the helmet created by Cliff, so in future loops he can create it himself, however he said that he wouldn't be able to improve on it on his own.

Orsted has notes regarding the changes happening to the world due to Rudeus's influence, in the off chance of a future loop with Rudeus.

If Rudeus exists in future timeloops, Orsted intends to postpone obtaining the treasure of Mad Dragon Chaos, so that, Rudeus, Zanoba and Chaos can work together on the automaton that Rudeus and Zanoba invented.

As Orsted has been reincarnated in a human body like Perugius, he doesn't have wings on his back like the original Dragon race.

Knows of Rudeus's reincarnation as well that he is of the same world as Nanahoshi.

References

Orsted/Chronology
=================

Information

Chronology

Powers and Abilities

Relationships

Gallery

Mushoku Tensei

Volume 2 - Juvenile Period - Home Teacher Chapter

He appears for the first time in the Red Dragon mountain range, killing two Red Dragons in self-defense with one strike each. Noticing the abnormal mana gathering in the Fittoa Region as a precursor of the Teleportation Disaster, he curiously heads in its direction.

Volume 6 - Juvenile Period - Homecoming Chapter

Initially, he and Nanahoshi were walking by the Red Dragon Lower Jaw and accidently meet
Dead End
. After hearing that Hitogami visits Rudeus in his dreams, he fights against Dead End and easily defeats
Ruijerd
 and
Eris
 while holding back, and almost kills Rudeus after rupturing his inner organs. However, he was scratched by Rudeus' Stone Cannon after being caught off guard. He then spared and healed Rudeus per
Nanahoshi
`s request.

Volume 15 - Young Man Period - Human God Chapter





Orsted defeats Rudeus.



Under the orders of the Human God, Orsted was ambushed by
Rudeus
 who managed to damage him with magic powerful enough to utterly decimate the city-sized location of the battle, forcing the Dragon God to fight seriously. Summoning the "Godblade", he completely overwhelmed Rudeus by destroying the Magic Armor and slicing off his right arm, but then he faced Eris who managed to put up a fight against him due to her arduous training. Hearing the story about Hitogami's threat from Rudeus, he decided to make him his comrade in his fight against the
Human God
.

Volume 16 - Young Man Period - Kingdom Chapter

Rudeus learn more about Orsted, his history and his curses. He also explained to Rudeus about
Laplace
 and flow of destiny before moving over to their plans to defeat Hitogami. They decide on their first goal to make
Ariel
 the queen of Asura Kingdom, correcting the course of history which
Human God
 disrupted to gain an advantage over Orsted.

Volume 17 - Young Man Period - Asura Kingdom Chapter

He ordered Rudeus to help Princess Ariel and kill
Hitogami
's apostles who changed the flow of fate. He tailed Rudeus and his party from the shadows, occasionally appearing to advice and help. In the venue, he answers Rudeus' emergency call for help and easily kills Water God Reida. After the events in Asura Kingdom, he told Rudeus the real truth: Orsted is a looping existence that has experienced the world for more than 100 times and that Rudeus is a new existence outside the loops.

Mushoku Tensei 'Sequel'

By the time of Mushoku Tensei's end, Orsted's mission to kill
Hitogami
 is one of the major story threads that remained unresolved. However, Rudeus did see a vision where his and
Roxy's
 daughter,
Lara Greyrat
, helped Orsted and an unknown individual, presumably
Shinohara Akito
, enter the void between worlds to finally seal the malicious god. Thus, Orsted is likely to remain a major character in the planned 'sequel' series.

Orsted/Powers
=============

Redirect to:
Orsted/Powers and Abilities

Orsted/Powers and Abilities
===========================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Information

Chronology

Powers and Abilities

Relationships

Gallery

"I shall grant my child my every technique, and to him the ability to remain concealed until he could defeat Hitogami... but that will not be enough. He must find out what happened to Human God, and how Hitogami obtained divine powers in the first place. Until then, defeat is inevitable."

-First Dragon God to Laplace

Power and Abilities





Dragon God Orsted considered to be the most powerful being of the Human World



A descendant of both the
First Dragon God
 and
true Human God
, Orsted is a demi-god with potential surpassing mere mortals.
 He is the current holder of the Dragon God title, which is only given to the strongest member of the
Dragon Tribe
, who are themselves considered the strongest species. As a result of his kind's advanced lifespan and great power, along with being stuck inside a time loop, he has either mastered or has knowledge of virtually every form of swordsmanship and magic. He is also a quick learner, mastering
Rudeus'
 dual casting technique after just seeing it once.

Currently, Orsted is the strongest being in the
Human World
, having surpassed the Technique God, Demon God and
Laplace's
 original self.
 He is powerful enough to destroy the entire world according to
Hitogami
, being held back only by one weakness that forces him to be careful with how much of his power he uses at once: a slow mana-recovery. Every occasion where he does go all-out has ended in his overwhelming victory, defeating fellow God-Rank opponents like Rudeus,
Reida Reia
, and
Kalman III
 with relative ease. In one of his loops, he even managed to defeat the
Sword God
,
North God
, and a Demon Lord at once.
 It's said that if Orsted were to deliver an all out serious attack, entire continents would disappear.

Physical Abilities

Orsted's physical capabilities are unrivaled within the series, he easily defeated North God
Kalman III
 even when the latter was equipped with Dragon king sword Kajakuto, the magic blade that controlled gravity and the Fighting God armor; the same armor that withstood an attack that split a supercontinent into two.

His reaction speed is completely beyond any other character as he was able to perceive a lightning bolt from the sky and was about to run from its course; had he not been trapped by Rudeus. He was capable of casually reacting to and deflecting Water god
Reida Reia
's trump card, "Sword of Deprivation" before easily killing her.

As mentioned above, Orsted has mastered all styles of swordsmanship including the Sword God style, this allows him to use Longsword of Light, its variants and its equivalents in other sword styles perfectly. Infact, his mastery with Longsword of Light is such that he can recreate its usage without the need of a sword at all, using his own hands as swords instead.

His outstanding physical abilities has allowed him to perform feats such as killing 2 red dragons with one hit each. Defeating
Ruijerd
 in 10 seconds with just punches. Punching Rudeus several hundred meters away while he was wearing magic armor Mk. 1.

Stamina and Resilience

Orsted is never shown to be tired in his limited combat scenes. Has high pain tolerance and was not bothered by his arm getting cut off, that he even picked it up and used his own severed arm as a weapon.  He is able to withstood several of Rudeus' strongest attacks while he was donning the Mk. 1 Magic Armor that that is said to imitate the Fighting God Armor.

Also, being from the ancient dragon tribe, he can survive for about 100 days without food and go without sleep for 10 days due to their high resilience.

Combat Ability





Orsted using
Water God Style
 Flow against Eris



Most of Orsted's abilities and sword techniques are God ranked, the highest attainable. He tends to fight defensively to see how his opponent attacks, observes an opponent's attacks he has never seen before to learn the technique or spell himself
  otherwise he tends fight only with his bare hands and Saint Dragon Battle Aura when he knows the opponent's skill or technique they are using, giving the impression that he does not fight seriously but he gradually adjusts to using magic depending on how strong the opponent is. Orsted usually finishes off his opponent by punching a hole in their chest with his claws especially on apostles of Hitogami
 called Claw Technique, a part of the fundamental fighting style of the Dragon Tribe:
Teaching of Nail, Fangs and Wings


Saint Dragon Battle Aura

Rock Bullet breaking through Orsted's Saint Dragon Battle Aura
Orsted fighting with his bare hands and Saint Dragon Battle Aura to defeat
Ruijerd
1/2

The strongest unarmed fighting style that makes the least use of mana in combat. Created by the previous Dragon God
Urupen
 that protects the user from most magic spells and sword techniques. Orsted learns Saint Dragon Battle Aura from a secret note left behind by Urupen and with that information, he successfully learns his predecessor's greatest fighting style and mastered it to the highest level.
 On their first battle, Rudeus is able overcome the Saint Dragon Battle Aura to wound Orsted's hand using the intermediate rank spell Stone Cannon, which had it's power increased to a very high level with the abilities of Silent Spell-Casting.

As a testament to its toughness, Rudeus's Stone Cannon could barely break through Orsted's Battle Aura, despite being able to completely blow away strong opponents like Badigadi (who has a King Tier battle aura) and Atofe (whose battle aura should be even higher than Badigadi's).

For reference, Nina's Longsword of Light technique (when she was at the rank of Sword Saint) barely scratched Badigadi.


https://mushokutensei.fandom.com/wiki/File:MT-AN-S1-E08-WEBM-01.webm



Orsted's Saint Dragon Battle Aura protecting him from a Dragon's Fire Breath



Intellectual Abilities

Orsted knows most if not all people in the world, at the very least those of great importance, including how and when they are born and from whom due to his multiple reincarnation time loops. Orsted would give Rudeus what seems to be odd missions on the surface (eg. rescuing an adventurer in a labyrinth, helping a merchant lost in the forest, going to the slave market to buy a slave to be sold somewhere else or even helping a young female dwarf thief called Tal Qi) but they are step-by-step preparations. Thus those people they help will be useful to Orsted in the future and making it the key to not only make sure that he is in his best condition for the [decisive battle] but also for Rudeus to establish a network of new contacts and friends.

In addition to his multiple reincarnation time loops, he knows how to battle against every kind of opponent such as crushing the lungs of a magician to prevent them from casting spells and can give advice on improving the Gattling Gun to combat Water God Style users. After
Ariel Anemoi Asura
 becomes the next Queen of
Asura Kingdom
, Orsted begins training Rudeus on different magic and tactics such as fire mage and swordsman strategies that are hard to defend against. With his knowledge of the ultimate attacks of all three sword styles and how to counter each one, Orsted also teaches Rudeus numerous techniques, especially from the
Sword God Style
, like what to be careful of and what to counter with that Rudeus made very good progress for only a year that he feels that he has been fooling around too much in the past.

Magic Abilities

Knows most
Magic Spells
 but because of his slow mana regeneration he rarely uses magic unless fighting a strong opponent.

Silent Spell-Casting

Orsted is among the few people who can use spells without the use of chants. Despite this, Orsted is puzzled that Rudeus needs to use the chant of a new spell being taught to him before he can use its voiceless incantation version.

Healing Magic

On his second battle against Rudeus and Eris, Orsted combines Silent Spell-Casting with Healing Magic that restores his severed arm and his wounds fully healed in an instant.
 After the battle, Orsted heals Rudeus' wounds that also restores the arm that was severed from the
Teleport Labyrinth
  which is classified to be at least King Rank Healing Magic. He has also healed the hole he put in Rudeus' chest. Although the rank of this healing magic is never confirmed, it wouldn't be far off to assume it is Emperor or God class.

Summoning Magic

Although the magic rank is not specified, Orsted is able to write a magic circle for Summoning Magic for a being to serve as a guardian of Rudeus' family against Hitogami. Almanfi describes the Summoning Magic to be "a complex technique" and when used with Rudeus' magic power, it is able to override the contract of Almanfi as
Perugius Dola
's familiar which Almanfi deems impossible.

Voice Magic

Magic of the Doldia tribe that uses sound. The user howls or roars to disrupt an opponent's balance like an electric shock and paralyze them. One of the only spells which cannot be replicated with a Magic Circle

Hypnosis Magic

Magic of the Nuka tribe that Orsted uses to put his opponent to sleep

Disturb Magic

Disturb Magic in the Anime
Rudeus using wind magic with his left hand while his other hand is sealed by Disturb Magic
Orsted using Disturb Magic against Rudeus in the Manga
Rudeus' right hand sealed by Disturb Magic
1/4

Disturb Magic (Ran Ma) cancels an opponent's magic by disrupting the magic and causing it to never take shape and scatter. Ran Ma only targets one part of the body. On Orsted's first battle, Ran Ma seals the magic on Rudeus' right hand but is able to use magic with his left hand.

Dragon Gate

Dragon Gate in the Anime
Dragon Gate absorbing the magic power of Nuclear Explosion
Orsted summoning Dragon Gate in the Manga
Dragon Gate, absorbing Rudeus' magic power
1/4

Orsted summons a gate engraved with dragon statues that absorbs the magic power of his opponent. When Dragon Gate is used against Rudeus, the gate cracks leaving some of the effects of Rudeus' magic to make a smaller explosion causing Orsted to remark that Rudeus' magic power is on the same level as
Laplace
.

Unnamed Presence Search Technique

Orsted can use an unnamed magic technique to search for presence of people in a certain radius(although it could be the case that the radius depends on the amount of mana he puts in). He used it in his second battle against Rudeus to search and quickly catch up to him. Also, he once used it to find Lara when she got lost in his office. Since he is quite mindful of using mana, it could be inferred that this technique uses negligible or minimal amount of mana.

Gravity magic

Reincarnation Technique

When Orsted dies while alive, or once 200 years have passed since beginning the technique, he is sent back in time to the winter of the year 330 of the Armored Dragon era, precisely to the northern forests of the
Central Continent
. He has executed this time-loop more than 100 times—but stopped counting after reaching that threshold. Technically, this is a time rewind—a loop that resets everything up to that point, erasing all prior events. What carries over between each loop are Orsted’s knowledge and skills. Physically, the first ten years of each loop are spent retraining and restoring his physique.

Effect

By falling outside the
world's natural order
, Orsted becomes undetectable by
Hitogami
, who thus cannot observe his present or future. Instead, Hitogami sees alternate, incorrect futures in which Orsted doesn’t participate.

Because the secret art remains constantly active—continuously consuming mana—Orsted’s mana recovers at a rate 1000 times slower than normal. For perspective, while
Rudeus
 can recover from a drained state in about 10 days under normal conditions, Orsted would take roughly 30 years to regenerate his mana. As a result, Orsted must conserve mana and cannot unleash his full strength freely.

Weaknesses

Slow Mana Regeneration

Due to the numerous Magic Circles placed on Orsted, he has extremely slow mana regeneration (he may not be able to replenish his mana capacity fully in 100 years) due to his unique situation of time loop reset via reincarnation slowing it down, making him reluctant to use magic as he is saving it for when he faces Hitogami.

Dragon Tribe Curse

"Ever since I was born, I was indeed shunned by all living creatures."

-Orsted

Orsted has a curse on him that makes all living creatures of the
Human World
 whether its man, beast, demon, etc., either hate him or fear him extremely. However, this is not a problem for people not of this world like Rudeus and Nanahoshi.

Although it is not directly implied to be a curse until it was mentioned by Hitogami, this effect of fear and hatred towards the Dragon Tribe is traced beginning from the
Six-Faced World
 Era where the Dragon Tribe waged war on the other worlds and after witnessing the First Dragon God kill the other Gods, and with it, the world that those Gods ruled is also destroyed and the denizens of that world to flee in fear to the Human World. Due to the final battle between the First Dragon God and Hitogami, this caused the Human World, now merged with all the terrain characteristics of the rest of the worlds to be beset with all sorts of natural disasters such as tornadoes, hurricanes, tsunamis, earthquakes and lightning with plague all the denizens of the Human World with fear and loathing. This permeates throughout the world which resulted in all the denizens of the Human World to fear the Dragon Tribe especially the Dragon God.

Equipment

Orsted's Coat

Rudeus finding Orsted's Coat in the Anime
Rudeus wearing Orsted's Coat with the Curse Supressing Helmet
1/2

Orsted wears a white coat that has sleeves, reaches above his feet, a black fur-like trim collar and is adorned with several belt and buckle that is strapped above his torso and waist. The coat is made from the pelt of an ancient white dragon that carries an absurd amount of magic power, possesses high physical and magical defense. It also possesses self-restoration against aging and damage over time but because Ancient White Dragons are now extinct, it is a unique item. Rudeus describes the coat to be bulky but warm and feels nice which is similar to Red Dragon's pelt.

Curse Suppressing Helmet

A black helmet developed by Cliff that suppresses the curse that causes him to be feared and hated by everyone who looks at him.

『Godsword』






Orsted using Godsword against Rudeus



Godsword, also known as Godblade is a katana that Orsted summons by pressing his hands together, making Godsword materialize from his left hand after separating them slowly that he uses on his second battle versus Rudeus and later against
Kalman III
. A lot of
Mana
 gets consumed just by summoning Godsword. Rudeus estimates it takes around 15% of Orsted's Mana just to summon godsword. Using godsword Orsted can cut anything within several kilometers range(except certain magical items such as Yulian's cursed swords, Paul's tantou, fighting god armor, etc.). It also has a time restriction of at least 10 minutes which is the time it took for Orsted to defeat Kalman III even though Kalman III was using the Fighting God Armor and Dragon King Sword Kajakuto.

Curses

Orsted's curse affecting all creatures of the world
Curse on Orsted causing even dragons to fear him
1/2

According to Hitogami, Orsted was said to have 3 curses. However he only has 1 curse, and 2 of these "curses" are the result of the
First Dragon God
's technique used on him.

The curse of being hated and feared by all living creatures in this world.

The 'curse' of being invisible from Hitogami's view. In reality this is a result of the secret technique which allows him to "reset" when he fails a loop.

The 'curse' of being unable to go all-out in combat. This is later revealed to be a side-effect from the technique that the first Dragon God used on Orsted to send him forward in time and repeat the time loop until he beats Hitogami. It causes him to have extremely slow magic power restoration, thus he can't freely use magic and several of his techniques.

References

Orsted/Relationships
====================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Information

Chronology

Powers and Abilities

Relationships

Gallery

Family

First Dragon God

Laplace: "A name"
First Dragon God: "Name?"
Laplace: "The name of your child?"
First Dragon God: "Orsted. This child's name is Orsted"

The First Dragon God is Orsted's father. Although The First Dragon God is normally decisive on making choices, he didn't give Orsted his name near the destruction of the Dragon World then also grants him his power and knowledge to fulfill his wish and the wish of the
Dragon Tribe
 - the defeat of Hitogami.
 Since then, the succeeding generations of the Dragon God including Orsted has been making his preparations for his eventual battle with Hitogami and ensures that the original timeline that he refers to be ordained by
Fate
 to be followed.

Lunaria

"Fufufu. Husband, please give the child a name."

-Lunaria

Lunaria is Orsted's mother. Lunaria protected Orsted in his infancy with her body when an unknown assailant attacks and her body is seen in a fetal position clutching Orsted.

Laplace

"The Demon Dragon General Laplace is the only one left of the first generation
Five Dragon Generals
. Laplace escaped the collapsing
Dragon World
 and drifted to this
world
, to carry out a certain mission, He became the second generation Dragon God."

-Orsted to Rudeus

The First Dragon God planned to raise Laplace as a son, a mix race of the Dragon Tribe and
Demons
 with the intent of eliminating the hatred towards hybrids which in turn prepare for Orsted's birth who is also a mix race of the Dragon Tribe and
Human
.
 Although it is implied that Orsted is aware of this and what has become Demon God Laplace, he is preparing for Laplace's reincarnation, the war against him in order to retrieve the relic in Laplace's posession that he needs to open the way to the
Void World
 and battle Hitogami.

Friends

Nanahoshi Shizuka





Orsted and Nanahoshi in the Manga



Orsted is the first person Nanahoshi encounters after being transported to the
Human World
 and assists her and adjusting to her new life. He recognizes Nanahoshi as "useful" and was very interested in her otherworld knowledge that he trusted her enough allow her to travel the world together and later introduces her to
Perugius Dola
 to begin her research on Summoning Magic.
 They later parted as Nanahoshi enters
Ranoa Magic Academy
 to continue his research but Orsted gave her a magic tool in form of a ring that allows her to summon him.

Subordinates

Rudeus Greyrat

Rudeus is Orsted's first 'subordinate' (Orsted considered him a comrade but Rudeus insisted upon being called a subordinate).

During the first time that they met, Orsted realizes Rudeus is unaffected by his
curse
 and is also bewildered that Rudeus is
Paul Greyrat
's son which to his knowledge Paul only has
two

daughters
. When Orsted heard the name of Hitogami from Rudeus, he thought that Rudeus was an apostle. As such, Orsted '
fought
' (a one-sided beatdown, really) against
Dead End
, which ended with Orsted having an overwhelming victory, where Rudeus is on the brink of death. However, as per the suggestion of Nanahoshi, he spared his life and heals his chest wound. After some years, Orsted
battles
 Rudeus and defeated him again, making him his subordinate after battling his Magic Armor. In the beginning, Orsted didn't really trust him, but as time passed, Rudeus becomes one of the few people that he can call a friend and in turn Orsted watches over his family.

Ariel Anemoi Asura

Orsted initially plans to make Ariel to be the Queen of
Asura Kingdom
 as he remembers in true timeline ordained by
Fate
, that if she becomes the Queen, it'll lead to the existence of a powerful person pivotal in the fight against Laplace

So he gives Rudeus his first mission, which is to assist Ariel on becoming queen.
 On their journey to Asura Kingdom, Ariel realizes Rudeus' intentions and asks him to meet with Orsted. Although Ariel is initially afraid of Orsted, Ariel willingly becomes his subordinate after hearing his plans and the future of Asura Kingdom.
 When Ariel becomes queen, she continues serving Orsted by sending him information about the Kingdom's activites such as the marriage of
Isolte Cruel
 and
Doga
.

Zanoba Shirone

"In that case, I would have you work under Rudeus and take orders from him. If you propose we make more allies, then that is what we shall do."

Orsted to Zanoba

After the death of his brother
Pax Shirone
, Orsted concludes that the current time loop is a failure but Zanoba who wants to avenge his brother interjects and suggests that they gather allies in preparation for war against
Laplace
 which eventually lead to the establishment of the
ORSTED Corporation
 and Zanoba also becoming Orsted's subordinate who is also the co-developer of the
Magic Armor
 .

Kalman III





Orsted defeating Kalman III in the Light Novel



Aleksandar"Orsted-sama... But I'm still not yet qualified as a North God..."
Orsted:"That's exactly why you should train him. If you watch him and raise him all by yourself, you just might discover what it is about the North God Style you are lacking."

Aleksander becomes Orsted's subordinate after the Decisive Battle, wanting to learn about the truth behind a hero. After becoming Orsted's subordinate, he usually stays at the Orsted Corporation Headquarters, and has become quite doctile.

At Orsted's suggestion, Aleksander trains
Sieghart Saladin Greyrat
 in the
North God Style
 with the intent that he might become the North God in the original timeline who lost to
Sword God

Jino Britts
 and fell into despair but after training a child, he became the strongest North God in history. By being with one of Rudeus' children, Orsted considers the possibility for Aleksander to realize what makes Rudeus strong and perhaps become a more noble and stronger North God than in the one in the original history.

Greyrat Family

Rudeus' family with the exception of his children are still affected by Orsted's curse but agrees that Rudeus becomes his subordinate despite their mistrust towards him. Rudeus eventually asks Cliff to create a
Curse Supressing Helmet
.

Lucy Greyrat

Orsted has a soft demeanor towards Lucy.

When Lucy was young and met Orsted for the first time, she mistook him for her father, due to Orsted's white hair, which is similar to Sylphie's.

Lara Greyrat

As I thought, Roxy's child is special.

-Orsted after Rudeus' report of summoning
Leo
 to protect Lara

As part of the agreement for Rudeus to become his subordinate, Orsted gives him a scroll containing a magic circle to summon a protector for his family.
 Like most of Rudeus' children, Lara frequently visits the
ORSTED Corporation
 Headquarters and is also unaffected by Orsted's curse. For the case of Lara, Orsted feels unease towards Lara especially when he is target of her pranks which he doesn't mind. Out of all the people Orsted knows, Lara is the only person he has no idea how she'll grow up and also believes that this is the reason why Hitogami is afraid of her and even did much effort try to kill her before she is born.

Others

Hitogami

Before you die, give Hitogami a message:"Dragon God Orsted is going to kill you."

-Orsted to Rudeus

Ever since the death of the
First Dragon God
, Orsted's father due to Hitogami's machinations, the next 99 generation of Dragon Gods has lived their life to defeating Hitogami and is the sworn enemy of Orsted and the entire dragon race. Orsted hates him so much that he would fly into murderous rage upon hearing Hitogami's name.
 This hatred towards Hitogami also extends towards anything concerning Hitogami that he would repeatedly tell Rudeus to not to believe anything he says. Even Hitogami's apostles are also that target of his hatred that he would kill them on sight but Rudeus is able to convince Orsted to spare some of his disciples like
Luke Notos Greyrat
 since it might affect other people that are important in Orsted's plan like Ariel who is close to Luke after surviving together on their journey to Sharia after their exile. During his countless loops, Orsted continuously prepares to kill Hitogami by writing all the changes in history he was and was not involved with and memorizes all their outcomes to eventually prepare for his battle against him and would repeat the course of actions that benefits him.

Perugius Dola

"In this
world
 there are three people you should never fight:
Technique God
,
Fighting God
, and Dragon God. Among those three, Dragon God Orsted is the strongest and the most ruthless."

Perugius to Rudeus

Perugius and Orsted are both from the
Dragon Tribe
. Despite this, Perugius tends to not get involve with Orsted's motives as he prioritizes his upcoming battle against Laplace and also refuses to aid Rudeus against his
second battle
 against him but Perugius allows Orsted entry of
Chaos Breaker
 and usage of his Teleportation Circles.

References

P Hunter
========

P Hunter
 was a party formed by
Jalil
 and
Vizquel
 on the
Demon Continent
.

History

A former Adventurers' Guild party based in
Rikarisu City
, who would primarily take on lost pet quests, eventually leading to them capturing animals they thought to be lost pets whenever they saw one on the streets, accepting the quest to find them, and then cashing in on the reward since they found the "lost" pet. Roman caught on to their misdeeds, and forced his way into the party as their "bodyguard", but was really just blackmailing them into giving him a portion of their earnings while doing none of the work. However
Rudeus
 and the members of
Dead End
 stumbled upon this operation, and after some blackmail got them to stop the shady business and eventually forced the members to briefly join Dead End, resulting in P Hunter being disbanded.

Members

Jalil

Vizquel

Former Members

Roman

Abilities

Trivia

They were able to advance to a C rank party, but did not do so for a long while as it would make them unable to accept E rank quests, which they frequently did. However, Rudeus forced them to rank up to C once they met.

References

Navigation

Parents
=======

This article is about the
Anime Season 2
 Episode 22. For the Chapter 111
Manga
 article, see
Parents (Manga)
.

Parents
 (親)
Oya
) is the Twenty-second episode of the
second season
 (46th overall)
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on June 16, 2024 and also the fourth episode of the
Labyrinth Arc
 for the Anime.

Synopsis

Rudeus and his friends are transported to the seventh floor and finally see Zenith! However, a giant Manatite Hydra, the guardian of the Teleport Labyrinth, stands in their way. The Hydra is a legendary creature thought to be extinct, a formidable enemy from the
Second Human-Demon Wars
!

Plot

At the Sixth Floor of the Teleportation Labyrinth, Rudeus, Paul, Roxy, Elinalise, Geese and Talhand are about to step into the Magic Circle after confirming they are ready. Despite Geese suggesting they can turn back for now Paul decides to move forward and everyone check their gear. At Rudeus' request Roxy gives him some of her
Healing Magic
 Scrolls and promises to support him to ensure he does not use the scrolls. After checking on everyone if they are ready, Paul tries to tell something to Rudeus but the latter suggests to save in until they return home and they all step in the Teleportation Circle to the seventh floor.

At the seventh floor, the party continues exploring and they reach a huge hall and they see the Labyrinth Guardian who happens to be a
hydra
 as Geese exclaims he never seen one before but Paul sees Zenith trapped inside the Magic Crystal as the hydra prepares to attack them. Paul attacks immediately despite Geese calling him out not to rush in, causing Elinalise and Talhand to commit while Roxy and Rudeus casts
Icicle Break
 and
Stone Cannon
 respectively to support them but both spells are nullified before it touches the hydra. Meanwhile, Paul dodges and attacks the hydra attacks and severs two heads. The hydra retaliates but Elinalise bashes the head aside with her
Buckler
 that halts the attack but is wounded in her left shoulder. She stabs with her
Gladius
 but it got stuck between the scales. The hydra attacks Paul and Elinalise again but Roxy uses
Flood Flush
 that causes masses of water to appear before Paul and Elinalise that and pushes them back from the hydra's attack range. Talhand follows up with
Earth Pillar
 above the hydra but it also got nullified as Rudeus notices hearing the high pitch sound indicating their spells are nullified and ponders on retreating. Roxy then calls out that the two severed heads have regenerated at high speed and calls out to retreat but an enraged Paul attacks again, causing Talhand to call on Geese who runs ahead and throws several smoke grenades to distract the hydra. Paul halts his advance as he cannot see his target just as Geese grabs onto him to force him to fall back who still refuses until Elinalise slaps him and they all fallback. Elinalise calls on Rudeus who uses
Deep Mist
 then Roxy calls on retreating back to the Magic Circle to the sixth floor.

Back at the Sixth Floor, Rudeus
heals
 Elinalise's wounded left shoulder then checks on Paul who is now seated by the wall and still enraged as he mentions that he really saw Zenith and tries to calm down at Rudeus' suggestion. But when Rudeus questions if Zenith is still alive, Paul angrily grabs Rudeus by his collar and berates Rudeus, causing Talhand to tell them to stop. Paul continues to tell off Rudeus on being so calm upon seeing Zenith but Rudeus points out to him that being mad won't solve anything as he internally reflects that he is indeed too calm and recalls his relationship with Zenith back in
Buena Village
 during his
childhood
 and hasn't seen her for nearly 10 years.

Rudeus then calmly reviews what they learnt but Paul grabs Rudeus' collar and chastised his reaction. Geese and Talhand forces them apart and Elinalise also chimes in to have a discussion while Paul sits down, still upset and everyone follows suit and sits in a circle. Upon seeing Roxy worried, Rudeus tells her that he is alright since this is not the first time he had a
quarrel
 with Paul so Roxy clears her throat and mentions she can help Zenith then Elinalise mentions she knows someone in a similiar situation and assures Paul that Zenith is alive but their immediate problem is the hydra. Geese adds that they have never seen a hydra that has those kind of scales before then Talhand points out the its high speed regeneration is a problem. Roxy explains that they are dealing with a
Manatite Hydra
 where its scales can absorb
Mana
 that she thought to be a fairytale and upon clarification, Roxy tells Rudeus that
Magic
 should work at point blank range, leaving the hydra's regeneration to be the only issue. Rudeus then tells the party that searing a decapitated neck with fire like
Heracles
 did in Greek Mythology should prevent its regeneration. Meanwhile, Paul continues to give angry looks. The rest of the party is willing to try it then Geese got Paul to accept. Paul who has now calmed down expresses his appreciation of what the party has done to find Zenith and asks them to help him one last time and the party encourages him. Paul then complements his son coming up with a plan unlike him who cannot be calm and charges head on then tells Rudeus to rescue Zenith even if it kills him.

With their strategy established, the party returns to the seventh floor where the hydra lies in waiting and Paul signals the battle to begin. Paul leads the charge while Rudeus uses his
Foresight Eye
 to predict the hydra's movements. Paul dodges every head attack and severs one of the heads then Rudeus aims his
Fireball
 at it but it also got nullified and concluding he needs to move much closer and Paul telling him to stay close behind him as the severed hydra's head regenerates.

The hydra continues its attack that are being
Tank
 by Elinalise and Talhand while Paul severs another head and signals Rudy to launch another Fireball at the severed head but the another head attacks Rudeus that is blocked by Elinalise who dashes in front of Rudeus to block with her Buckler and immediately decapitated by Paul. Rudeus immediately uses another Fireball at the newly decapitated neck and confirms that the seared neck did not regenerate. Paul is encouraged by this and decapitates another head and after Rudeus sears it, he heals Elinalise's injured shoulder after blocking a hydra attack meant for him. Paul and Rudeus follows through the strategy while Roxy follows Talhand to heal him while he is tanking but is got caught by one of the hydra head by his leg that Paul immediately severs. Roxy immediately heals Talhand who falls to the ground as the battle continues. The hydra suddenly bites off a neck that was seared causing Paul call it out and to prevent it from healing so Elinalise leaps to the severed head by the hydra and thrusts his Gladius to it then uses
Ice Smash
 on the head to freeze it then calls on Roxy who follows up with
Flamethrower
 on the frozen neck to prevent its regeneration.

The Hydra, with three heads remaining, is suddenly taking a deep breath which Paul notices and calls out that something is incoming. Rudeus, having battled a
Red Dragon

before
, is recognizing that the Hydra is using its Fire Breath and calls on everyone to gather to him. Once they do, Rudeus is using
Water Shield
 to summon a huge wall of water just as all the remaining Hydra's three heads use Fire Breath on them, but it is absorbed by the Water Shield. The Hydra eventually stops using Fire Breath, so at Rudeus' call, Paul resumes attacking to sever another head, which Rudeus follows up with a Fireball on the severed neck and does the same on one more head. This causes the Hydra to tremble and attack everyone at the same time, where Paul moves Rudeus out of its range, Elinalise dodges, and Talhand blocks the attack on Roxy. While the party is recovering from the attack, the final head attacks Rudeus, but Paul kicks him out of the way and gets struck instead. Rudeus, having recovered, finds himself face to face with the final head. He strikes the eye with his left hand, causing the Hydra to shut its eye and severing Rudeus' left hand just as he finishes casting 3 Stone Cannons that burst out from the Hydra's head, destroying the Magic Crystal that absorbs mana. The Hydra is frantically dragging Rudeus off the ground as he calls on Roxy, and she finishes off the final head with Flamethrower and collapses by its side.

Rudeus, still on the ground, sighs in relief that the battle is over but feels the pain in his left hand and uses
Shine Healing
, which closes the wound and restores his left limb except for his hand. Upon checking on Paul, he notices everyone is shocked into silence, and to his horror, sees Paul on the ground with his lower body missing. Their eyes meet, and upon seeing Rudeus, Paul wordlessly sighs in relief as blood comes out of his mouth and the light goes out of his eyes...

Moments later, the Magic Crystal encasing Zenith begins to crack and shatter as she falls to the ground still unconscious. The party is later seen leaving the Teleportation Labyrinth with Talhand carrying Zenith on his back. Roxy tries to talk to Rudeus, but like everyone else, she is at a loss for words.

At the Inn in Rapan, the party is welcomed by Lilia, Shierra and Vierra but when they are told that Paul has passed away, Lilia is shocked but remains silent while Vierra and Shierra weeps. Lilia then approaches and embraces Rudeus as he tells him to get some rest and she will handle things from here. At his room, Rudeus takes off his robe and lies down as he recalls the moment he burns the remains of Paul and goes to sleep.

Four days later, Rudeus and Lilia are watching over Zenith who is still sleeping and as Lilia wonders if she will wake up, Zenith opens her eyes to the relief of Lilia and helps her sit up. Rudeus calls on to Zenith who looks at him so Lilia introduces him but Zenith blankly stares back and utters incomprehensible words. Lilia realizes what has happened in disbelief while Rudeus is still stunned but also realizes that Zenith is now a husk, his heart shatters.

Adaptation Notes

Light Novel Volume 12

Chapter 8: The Guardian of the Teleportation Labyrinth

Chapter 9: Mortal Combat

Chapter 10: Parents

Differences with the Light Novel:

The event where the party battles monsters while leaving the Teleport Labyrinth has been cut

The event where Rudeus burns Paul's remains occurs in a flashback upon returning to the inn, while in the Light Novel, it occurs after defeating the Manatite Hydra.

The event where Rudeus remembers his parents from his past life and finally mourns for their deaths before Zenith wakes up was instead included in
Episode 23
.

The event where Zenith wakes up has Rudeus and Lilia present, while in the light novel, Vierra is also there but bursts out the door to inform the rest that Zenith has woken up

Trivia

This episode showed Paul Greyrat's sacrifice and demise. It was aired on June 16, 2024, which is
Father's Day
 in many countries.

In irony, Rudeus' left hand that was severed by the Manatite Hydra, is named Heracles

Parents (Manga)
===============

This article is about the Chapter 111 Manga. For the
Anime Season 2
 article, see
Parents
.

Parents
 is the 111th chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Rudeus

Geese Nukadia

Roxy Migurdia

Paul Greyrat

Summary

Despite defeating the
Manatite Hydra
, Rudeus and the group are at a loss due to Paul's death. they cremate his remains and took his ashes and remaining equipment with them while Rudeus recalls his previous life on how he did not event attend his parent's funeral when they died. They return to Rapan to report what has happened and rest while waiting for Zenith to wake up. Rudeus imagined that Zenith will wake up that everything will be alright but to his surprise Zenith is unresponsive causing Rudeus to fall in despair.

Paul
====

Redirect to:
Paul Greyrat

Paul Gaiden: Runaway arc
========================

Information

Summary

Paul Gaiden: Runaway arc
 is the first story released for the mobile game and supervised by the author.

Synopsis

Born as the long-awaited eldest son of a high-ranking aristocrat,
Paul
 was already demonstrating a liberal attitude toward sexuality at the age of five.

His father, Amaranth, instructed him to go to school in order to develop his education and awareness as a nobleman and Paul was sent to a school in the Milbots Region. However, he doesn't find appealing the school's lessons and ends up skipping all classes except for the sword fighting class.

There is no place for him here. ....

As a nobleman, he is torn between his family's disparity, the love of his family, and the various relationships at school, which eventually lead to a huge rift.

Chapters

Chapter 1: Paul Notos Greyrat.

Chapter 2: Blood Is Not an Issue.

Chapter 3: A place to relax.

Chapter 4: Paul 5-year-old party.

Chapter 5: The Epitome of Aristocratic Society.

Chapter 6: The Interest of the Sword.

Chapter 7: A Rebuke from My Father.

Chapter 8: Rustling Feelings.

Chapter 9: The Talent of Swordsmanship.

Chapter 10: Pilemon.

Chapter 11: Paul 10 years old.

Chapter 12: The World of Adults.

Chapter 13: Womanizing.

Chapter 14: The Bad Boy of the Notos Family.

Chapter 15: The Start of House Arrest.

Chapter 16: A Small Sense of Harmony.

Chapter 17: Operation Escape from House Arrest.

Chapter 18: Conditions for Lifting House Arrest.

Chapter 19:  Determination to Save My Mother.

Chapter 20: Finding a Doctor in the Slums.

Chapter 21: A Disgusting World.

Chapter 22: An Eccentric Bonbon.

Chapter 23: A Test of Skills in the Slums.

Chapter 24: A Posse of Bad Boys.

Chapter 25: Someone Who Cares.

Chapter 26: The Troubled Fullness of Life.

Chapter 27: The Shame of the Notos Family.

Chapter 28: In Search of Freedom.

Paul Gaiden: Runaway arc/Summary
================================

Information

Summary

Chapter 1: Paul Notos Greyrat.

In the year K388 eldest son of Notos family, Paul Notos Greyrat was born, he was loved by his mother Valentine. Five years later, the butler is searching for Paul asking the maid if she knows his localization, but she dont know. After he leaves, the maid says to Paul that he can already leave his hiding place under the skirt, after they talk a bit, Paul leaves the house.

Chapter 2: Blood Is Not an Issue.

The father of Paul, Amarant summon his son Paul, asking to his son to act more as a noble of the Notos family, and he need to stop of touching the maids, Paul says that is not fun and says that he started to do that because Amarant do the same to them, Amarant excuse himself and partially allow his action because he know that he have the Notos Blood, before they conversation end, he ask again to his son to act more as a noble because his birthday party is going to be soon.

Chapter 3: A place to relax.

The butler is searching again for Paul, he wanted to hide again below a skirt, when he was searching, find his mother, he tried to hide below his mother skirt, but she didn't allow it, she says that he needs to be respectful with the girls. For her, even if Paul doesn't act as a noble, she loves his son and his cheerful disposition, after the end of the conversation they hug. Even if Paul like the sensation below the skirt, he love more to hug his mother.

Chapter 4: Paul 5-year-old party.

The Notos household is now celebrating the fifth birthday party of Paul and he is receiving the aristocrats for his party, after that he goes with some noble girls older than him to see the garden of his house. In the garden and being surrounded by cute girls, he thinks that being in the Notos family is not that bad, he also saves one of those girls to don't fall in the dirt of the garden.

In the night, his father find that is good that he start to act as a aristocrat and find that is time to go to the school where he can learn history, etiquette, swordsmanship and magic, Paul doubt for a moment but his father says that he may find cute noble girls. Some weeks later, Paul is now studying at a school in the Milbots region, for him the school is not fun.

Chapter 5: The Epitome of Aristocratic Society.

In the school, Paul finds an aristocrat using his position as a noble against another aristocrat of less rank. He doesn't like that, so he walks away. Paul almost always skips the class, but because he was alone, he decides to make a friend, when he is returning he meets the harassed lower rank noble named Seaton, when Paul tries to make him his friend with a casual conversation, the other noble appears to harass him again, but Paul intervenes.

After a discussion, Paul say his full name (Paul Notos Greyrat), after that high rank noble decides to extent his hand but Paul declines his bow, after feeling offended, he left, when Paul tries to continue his conversation with Seaton, he immediately apologizes for being rude with a noble of higher rank and left.

Paul dont understand that treatment because of his lineage when he only wanted a friend and feels that the school still is boring, so he still continues to skip almost every class excluding swordsmanship.

Chapter 6: The Interest of the Sword.

Paul is attending the class of the Water God style, which is taught by a female instructor and is the only class that never misses. The instructor asks him to attend the other class but he  replies that he dont have interest in the aristocrats class and doesn't have talent in magic, and having a discussion, Paul sees how weak is his will and starts to cry. The instructor ask him if she can do something and he ask supplementary lessons and she accept. Paul tries to start being a little more serious about the school. Some days later, Paul temporarily returned to his house because of the school vacations.

Chapter 7: A Rebuke from My Father.

After Paul returned to his house, his father was angry because he knows how Paul is in the school, and how he doesn't act as an aristocrat, because of that, he hired some tutors to study in the home. Paul sees that for the first time his father Amarant wasn't talking as a father, but as an aristocrat, after that he ran to his mother's room and hugged his mother, and for a moment, he was able to forget everything.

Chapter 8: Rustling Feelings.

Almost two years passed since Paul entered the school, he still skipped supplementary classes excluding swordsmanship. In one of his school break, His mother tells him that she is pregnant, Paul feels sad because the kind hand of his mother that was always for him is now directed to her belly. Paul left the room because was going to start his swordsmanship instruction with a oppression in his chest.

Chapter 9: The Talent of Swordsmanship.

In his house, Paul is now training in the Sword God Style with another female instructor, even though it is hard to learn two different styles, it is more fun for him.

After the training, Paul asks her how he was. She feels that he has talent, but she doesn't want to praise him much because some people grow confident and may stop his training. After Paul faints for the training, he is carried by her to the mansion.

Chapter 10: Pilemon.

A few months later, the second son of the Notos family, Pilemon Notos Greyrat, was born. On one of the few school holidays, Paul wanted to see the garden with his mother, but she cannot because she is taking care of the baby, instead, she wants to have tea with him in her room. Paul feels sad because now he barely sees and spends time with his mother and begins to feel that his own existence is disappearing in the house.

Chapter 11: Paul 10 years old.

Paul is now 10 years old, and he continue the training with the sword in school, the water god style instructor see that he can use water god and sword god style really well but finds that if the noble guys learn mostly the water god style, he learning sword god style fits him better. Suddenly the teacher says that she is going to leave soon because is going to have a child, surprised Paul asked if she was married, but she says that is from a relation with the principal of the school. She was worried about Paul and what is going to do in the future, but because he doesn't want to worry her, he says that he is going to be ok. Some days later, the teacher retires and Paul never meets her again.

Chapter 12: The World of Adults.

The Notos household is now celebrating the tenth birthday party of Paul. Paul was sad because his mother couldn't accompany him because Pilemon is sick and angry with his father because is more focused talking with other aristocrats even though it is his birthday party.

Philip arrive and start to talking with Paul and start to talk some miscellaneous stuff, The brother of Philip, James arrives and ask to Philip to choose better his elections of friends. Thinking that he didn't know him, he confronted James, but he did know him as the problematic child of the Notos family that only knows how to use a sword and doesn't know how to be noble. Philip indirectly stop discussion them saying that is time to dance and James left.

Paul dislike how is James, Philip says that he dont need to worry and is better to dance with some girls that are looking him. He took one of the girls and started to dance. Even though he has problems, the girl helps him. After the dance she says that finally payed the favor for saving her to dirt her dress in the garden in the party of 5 years ago because a noble cant dirt the dress. Paul start feeling something in his chest, the girl invite him to leave for a moment and rest. They arrive to a empty room and the girl hug him, they talk a bit and Paul kiss her, after that Paul follow the flow of the moment and they have sex.

After the end of the party, Paul is dismissing the guests, Philip sees him differently and asks what happened, Paul says that he stepped in an amazing world, and feels that he can't escape from it.

Chapter 13: Womanizing.

Paul starts to play with the aristocratic girls, and the girls accept mostly because they want to have a connection with the Notos Family, one of the many girls warns him that he is playing with fire.

One day when Paul was training with Philip, A noble guy appeared and challenged Paul to a duel because he slept with his fiance. Paul didn't want to apologize because it was consensual, and he wanted a formal duel so there isn't a problem if someone is killed, the noble in the end retreat. A week later, Paul received a letter from his father to return to the house.

Chapter 14: The Bad Boy of the Notos Family.

After he returns to the house, his father Amarant asks Paul why he was asked to return to the house, Paul tries to excuse himself but his father hits him. He doesn't mind if he plays with girls, but complains that his son doesn't see the balance of power with the other aristocrats family's, because he receives a letter from a noble family about the last fight in the school. Amarant feels pitiful that Pilemon has a brother like Paul, after the conversation, he orders his servant that he can't leave his room.

Chapter 15: The Start of House Arrest.

Paul arrives at his room and sees that his father has already prepared the room for the house arrest. The butler leaves and locks the room. For a free being like him, Paul finds that is boring that calculative life of an aristocrat. Several days passed since Paul was locked in his room. Behind the door, Paul heard how everybody praised Pilemon, comparing him to Paul's past attitude.

Paul briefly remembered how Pilemon visited him in one of those days. After the butler left him alone, Pilemon thanks him because everybody is praising him because of Paul's behavior. Paul doesn't mind it, but thinks about how Pilemon changed in the years that he wasn't able to see him. After they talk, Pilemon left and Paul see how he had the face of those aristocrat that looks down the other people. Even though he already knows that he is not loved by his father, he knows that it is not the case for his mother.

Chapter 16: A Small Sense of Harmony.

Her mother, Valentine, visits him in secret every night. She tries to ask her husband to forgive his son but so far, she wasn't able to convince him. Paul wasn't visited by his father since his house arrest, but his mother says that he love him and he still expect him to become the head of Notos Family, Paul want to hear that from his father and still want to tries to fit in the aristocrat world. After they finish the conversation, Paul hugs his mother but feels something wrong. After that night his mother stopped to visit him.

Chapter 17: Operation Escape from House Arrest.

For a long time, Valentine doesn't visit Paul and thinks that his father discovered their secret reunions. The maid that was with Paul since he was a child and now is the chief maid, appears and brings him food. Paul asked her if something happened to his mother, but she was ordered to don't give any information. Paul tells her how she was the only of the few people kind to him, after a short conversation, the maid accepts to tell him.

His mother was sick and unable to move in her bed and his father was calling doctors and surgeons inside and outside of the territory, but without good results. Paul was angry with himself and wanted to see his mother. He made a plan to escape for a long time and needs the help of the maid, so she decides to help him.

Chapter 18: Conditions for Lifting House Arrest.

Paul was able to escape from his room using the maid skirt like he was a child years ago, after that he goes alone to the room of his mother. When he entered, he found that the room was filled with the odor of medicine, with the curtain closed and his mother sleeping. When he approached and touched her, see how she lost weight and remembered that feeling of her last visit. Paul hates himself for not realizing before , and uses a basic healing spell, but it does not work. He kissed his mother and left the room and went to the office of his father.

He apologize to ashamed the Notos name and his father easily accept and lift his house arrest, but prohibited him to visit his mother, telling him that she was too sweet to him, and may be the cause of his carefree attitude, after that he is ordered to leave the office without telling him that Valentine was sick. He Is surprised to see how easy he lifted the house arrest but sees how his father is not interested in him.

Chapter 19:  Determination to Save My Mother.

After Paul leaves the office, he hears a conversation between Amarant and his subordinate that there is a rumor that in the slums there exists a good doctor, after hearing that, he decides to go to the slums.

Chapter 20: Finding a Doctor in the Slums.

Paul for many days went to the slums searching for that doctor without good results. One day he was contacted by a prostitute with information, but it wasn't good news. After she sees his low spirits, the prostitute offers himself to Paul and he accepts.

Now at night,  on the road to his house, he has the feeling that he heard the voice of his mother and starts to run to his house.

Chapter 21: A Disgusting World.

Paul arrives at the mansion and runs to his mother's bedroom, and finds that his father and brother are crying beside her bed and his mother is now dead. When Paul tries to approach her, his brother stops him and says that was his fault, when they were starting a discussion, Amarant shuts them up, and picks Philemon meanwhile he pierce Paul with his gaze. Amarant also blames Paul that he killed her, because her body has always been weak, but she put so much effort for Paul and he forbade him to visit his mother's body until his funeral. After that Paul continued to go school until his graduation.

Some years later, the Notos family is now celebrating Pilemon's 5 years old Birthday party, and by obligation, Paul participates, now even the girl that he lost his virginity runs away, because they now are being evaluated. When he started to talk with Pilemon indirectly asked him to leave his birthday party and he complied. After seeing how restrictive the Aristocratic world is, Paul's patience reaches his limit and decides to go to the slums and liberate his frustration with a fight.

Chapter 22: An Eccentric Bonbon.

Paul arrives at the Mansion at midnight and the chief maid finds him that he is injured, Paul says that he is fine, even if he lost the fight and his money, he wants to have a rematch with them. The next day, now with a training sword, he goes back to the slums and starts a fight against them to recover his lost money. After some time, the name of Paul was known in the slums as a weird kid that always lost and recovered his money.

Chapter 23: A Test of Skills in the Slums.

Paul was spending his time with the prostitute that meet some time ago. She asked him if he is really a noble, because he doesn't act as one. Paul confirm that saying he no like their attitude, meanwhile he think how different are the adult woman compared to the aristocrats girls.

After leaving the prostitutes, some boys of his age stop him, saying that he still dont meet his boss Rudd, Paul says that he is not interested in boys and after Paul insults their boss they start to fight,thinking that is a good way to train his sword.

Chapter 24: A Posse of Bad Boys.

Paul was able to win the fight, but the boss of the boys, Rudd appeared, he talked to Paul, but he wasn't listening, instead he was seeing the girl behind Rudd named Mary Anne, because she was cute. Radd wanted Paul as a subordinate, but he declined and they started to fight. Radd swordstyle was like the north god style, so  Paul wasn't able to win and the fight ended with a draw.

After that, Paul daily went to the slums to fight Radd as a excuse to see his sister Mary Anne, one day, Radd offers him the title of boss if he can win against him, Paul thinks to decline his offer, but after seeing that he may be near Mary Anne, he fight and was able to become the new boss of the boys of the slum.

Chapter 25: Someone Who Cares.

The chief maid asked him what he was doing every day, Paul answered that it was training. The maid says that his father is going to leave and inspect the territory and is a chance to speak with him. He doesn't like the idea, but he wants to follow the advice of the maid that always helped him.

Paul decides to wait for him near the carriage and when he arrive a tries talks to him, he only ignored him, and after a briefly talk with his butler he decides to go up to the carriage first. The chief maid, angry, decides to confront Amarant but Paul stops her, after that he asks her to don't protect him more to save her job, she says that she doesn't mind it.

Chapter 26: The Troubled Fullness of Life.

Paul was now talking with Mary Anne inside the hideout in the slums about the situation of his family and she comforted Paul. When Paul tries to seduce her, Radd arrives and says that is a good opportunity to show the power of the new boss to the other groups, because it looks like that is going to be a long fight, he decides to spend more time in the slums.

Chapter 27: The Shame of the Notos Family.

When Paul was in the slums, he felt lighter and more free than in the mansion. After he return to the mansion his father call him, when he arrive to his office he finds his father and his brother Pilemon, without saying anything, Amarant wanted to hit Paul but he was able to evade it, saying that after he rob the Sun (Valentine) to the house, he is dirtying the Notos family name. Paul complains how now he wanted to talk and the three start a discussion, in the middle of this, Amarant launches another punch that hits Paul. Pilemon reveals that they know that he goes and plays in the slums. Amarant, angry, says that his actions will tarnish the Notos family name that was built after many generations.

Chapter 28: In Search of Freedom.

The discussion between the family members continues, Amarant forbids Paul to leave his room again and Pilemon complain that he killed his mother, this angries Paul and jump over his brother and start to punch his face, Amarant separate them and angry, decides to disinherit Paul and order him to leave the house, Paul gladly accept. The butler wants to stop their sudden decision and tries to stop Paul that was already leaving, but he was able to run away.

Now in an unnamed  road, Paul thinks what his mother may think if she sees him that he dropped his Notos name, but believes that she may be happy because she loved his carefree life. Paul abandoned the house where he was raised at 12 year old.

Paul Gaiden: Training arc
=========================

Information

Summary

Paul Gaiden: Runaway arc
 is the second story released for the mobile game and supervised by the author.

Synopsis

Armored Dragon King Year 399, Paul is 12 years old.

He was born as the eldest son of a high class nobleman, but he abandoned the name of his family and the privileges of nobility, and became just Paul.

He decides to travel out of his domain, and looking for a place to stay, he breaks into a swordsmanship dojo in the town and decides to use it as an lodging.

During the search for a place to stay, a mysterious man appears and Paul fights him, but is easily defeated and loses his consciousness.

When he wakes up, he finds a girl who calls herself Lilia in front of him. ...
