An Adventurer Caught in a Quagmire

Quest of Memories
=================

Quest of Memories Game Visual

Mushoku Tensei ~I'll be serious when I go to another world~ Quest of Memories
 (
無職転生 ～異世界行ったら本気だす～ Quest of Memories
)
 is an RPG game for PC that is developed by LANCARSE Ltd and published by Bushiroad Games to be released on June 20, 2024.

The game will be available on Steam, Nintendo Switch, PS4 and PS5.

Story

The story of Mushoku Tensei ~I'll be serious when I go to another world~ Quest of Memories revolves around Rudeus and Eris, who are transported to the
Demon Continent
 due to the
Teleport Incident
 and it begins with their encounter of Ruijerd...

In addition to the familiar story from the
Anime
, the game also includes many original game scenarios!

As you interact with original characters and complete quests, The adventures of Dead End is depicted more clearly as they journey back to
Asura Kingdom
...!

Furthermore, the events regarding Sylphiette's journey, Roxy together with Elinalise and Talhand on their journey on the Demon Continent which have not been depicted until now will be revealed in the game...!

Challenge various difficulties that befall Rudeus and his friends.
How would you overcome it?

Gameplay

World Map
Fields
Battle System
Mini Games




Visit various towns and fields viewed from above the
Human World
 that offers various treasure chests and areas to complete your progression.






Enjoy an Immersive adventure in the fields while uncovering the map with the auto mapping functions







Turn based battle with high strategic play. Battle
Monsters
 while exploring the field where you utilize various mechanics such as Magic chants.







Play various mini games like a management simulation game where Roxy helps run a restaurant.



--To be Added--

Playable Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Sylphiette

Roxy Migurdia

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Ghislaine Dedoldia

Ruijerd Superdia

References

Races
=====

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

There are a variety of races that exist on the
Six-Faced World
. Around
20,000 to 10,000 years ago
, the War of the Gods resulted in the the fall of the other five worlds and all the survivors fled to the
Human World
 and settled in their suitable habitats. Consequently, the Human World is now populated by multiple Races
.

Human

Paul Greyrat, A male Human Warrior in the Anime
Zenith Greyrat, A Female Human in the Anime
Human nobles attending a party
1/3

Humans
 (人族,
Jinzoku
) are the most dominant race in the world. Similar to humans on earth, the human race in the Human World have relatively weak physique, short lifespan and high intelligence such that most innovations in the world are the work of humans and have the most developed civilization compared to other races.
 They are the majority race in the
Central Continent
,
Begaritt Continent
 and
Millis Continent
. Humans on the Central Continent and Millis Continent speaks Human Tongue with slightly differing accents, whereas humans on Begaritt Continent speaks Fighting God tongue.

Most of the important characters in series are humans. Some prominent humans in series include:

Rudeus Greyrat

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Ariel Anemoi Asura

Zanoba Shirone

Nanahoshi Shizuka

See list of human characters:
Category:Human

Elf

Elinalise, a female Elf in the Anime
Elinalise, a female Elf in the Light Novel
1/2

Elves (
長耳族
,
Erufu,
 lit. "Long Ear Tribe") are a race of people who currently live in the southern part of the
Great Forest
 in the Millis Continent. They are sometimes classified as demon race, but it was possible that they are new species that developed during the Chaotic Period. As their name implies, their most prominent physical characteristic is their long and pointy ears, which provides them with very good hearing ability. Other than that, they usually have a slim body, whereas female elves tend to be flat-chested. Their fertility is rather low, but they have very long lifespans, capable of staying in their prime for hundreds of years. They also have a very good sense of direction, able to navigate effortlessly even in difficult terrains like the Great Forest and deserts
.

It is said that magic was originally created by the High Elves, the ancestors of Elves. Long before even the Great Human-Demon War, when the world was engulfed in the unceasing spiral of battle and chaos, the High Elves, in order to fight their enemies, entreated with the spirits of the forests to control the wind and the earth. And thus, the first magic spells were born
.

List of known Elves:

Elinalise Dragonroad

Rayfort Magnafold

Laws
 (Elf-Human hybrid)

Fariasteer (Elf-Human hybrid)

Randolph Marianne
 (Elf-Human-Magic Demon Race hybrid)

Clive Grimoire
 (Elf-Human-Halfling hybrid)

Sylphiette Greyrat
 (Elf-Human-Beast Race Hybrid)

Lucy Greyrat
 (Elf-Human-Beast Race Hybrid)

Sieghardt Saladin Greyrat
 (Elf-Human-Beast Race Hybrid)

Roland Grimoire
 (Elf-Human-Beast Race-Halfling Hybrid)

Dwarf

Talhand, a male Dwarf in the Anime
Julie a female Dwarf in the Anime
1/2

Dwarves
 (
炭鉱族
,
Dowaafu
, lit. "Coal Mine Tribe") are a race of people who currently live at the foot of the Blue Dragon Mountain Range in the Millis Continent
. They are sometimes classified as demon race, but it was possible that they are new species that developed during the Chaotic Period. Dwarves are short in height: male dwarves have a stout build, whereas female dwarves are similar to young human females. They love alcohol and are highly tolerant against it. Their lifespan is longer of humans, capable of living for at least several hundred years
.

As a race of craftsmen and blacksmiths by birth, dwarves have naturally dexterous hands and high affinity towards earth and fire magic, but abhorred water and wind magic. They are adept in crafting weapons, armors and various arts, and the best craftsman would have the chance to ascend as the Ore God. Culture wise, dwarves would raise all children of the same generation together, and they would treat each other as siblings
. They won't get an official name until they are seven, and when they do, they receive a name that's fashioned after something they're good at, something they're attracted to, or something they like
.

List of known Dwarves:

Talhand

Julie

Godbard

Halflings/Hobbits

Cliff Grimoire, a Hobbit Hybrid in the Anime
1/1

Halflings
, also called
Hobbits
 (
小人族
,
Hobitto
, lit. "Small People Tribe") are a race of people who currently live in the northwestern part of the
Great Forest
 in the Millis Continent, with populations in
Zant Port
 and
Millishion
. They are sometimes classified as a demon race, but it is possible that they were a new species that developed during the Chaotic Period. They are small in stature and look like human children; it is believed (namely by Paul Greyrat) that they use this resemblance to deceive people.

List of known Halflings:

Gaa Fuu

Wi Suu

Wii Taa

Mi'Nal

Cliff Grimoire
 (Human/Halfling Hybrid)

Clive Grimoire
 (Human/Elf/Halfling Hybrid)

Roland Grimoire
 (Human/Elf/Beast Race/Halfling Hybrid)

Dragon Race

Orsted the Dragon God in the Anime
1/1

Main article:
Dragon Tribe

Dragon Race
 (龍族,
Ryuzoku
) are the original inhabitants of the Dragon World, and the strongest of all races in terms of fundamental physical capabilities. They have wings, powerful talons and tough scales, and are the first race that could wield
battle aura
 effectively. They could live for more than a hundred thousand years, thus they only have children every several thousand years
. After the fall of the five remaining worlds, most of the dragon race perished with the Dragon World, whereas many of the remaining members escaped to the Human World were killed by other races as an act of vengeance. As a result, very few dragon race members remain in the present days
.

List of Dragon Race:

Laplace
 (Dragon-Demon Hybrid)

Orsted
 (Dragon-Human Deity Hybrid)

Perugius Dola

Urupen

First Dragon God

Szilard

Dora

Maxwell

Chaos

Crystal

Demon Race





Various Demon Races in the Anime



Demon Race
 (魔族,
Mazoku
) are the original inhabitants of the Demon World. The classification of Demon Race are less specific during recent times, and it became the umbrella term for the races sided with
Kishirika
 during the Great Human-Demon Wars. As a result, some races originally belonging to Beast Race are also categorized as Demon Race. There are a significant number of species, with very diverse range of physiology, abilities, and lifespan. Most Demon Race are bipedal humanoids that are radically different in appearance when compared to humans, but there are a few exceptions. Their primary language is Demon God Tongue.

There are some exceptionally powerful individuals among the Demon Race that become rulers of a certain region, which are known as Demon Kings (魔王,
Maou
). The one stood on top of all of them is the Demon Empress
Kishirika Kishirisu
.

Migurd

Roxy a female Migurd in the Anime
Migurds in Roxy's home village
1/2

Main article:
Migurd

Migurds
 are one of a Demon Races that resemble humans the most. Adult Migurds have the appearance of teenage humans with blue hair and eyes. They have a lifespan of around 200 years, and would retain their look as human teenagers until about 150 years old. Their special ability is to communicate with their kind via telepathy.

Superd

"If you see a someone that has emerald hair and a ruby-like stone on their forehead, don't approach them. If you have no choice but to talk to them, you must not anger them."

-Roxy warning Rudeus about the Superd Race

Ruijerd, a male Superd in the Anime
Superd Tribe during the Laplace War
1/2

Main article:
Superd Tribe

Superds
 are a tribal race of warriors from the
Demon Continent
. Adult Superds look very similar to humans, except for their pale skin, green hair, and red gem (third eye) on their forehead that allows them to detect living beings and the flow of mana.They are born with a forked tail, which hardens and falls off to become their trident spear as they grow up.

Due to the tales of their fearsome rampage without distinguishing ally from enemy during the Laplace War four hundred years ago, they are loathed and feared by all races. As a result, they are heavily discriminated, whereas green hair and spears are regarded as bad omen. They are currently almost extinct, with the only known surviving group living in a forest in the
Biheiril Kingdom
.

List of known Superds:

Ruijerd Superdia

Luwelia Superdia

Ruiweld Superdia

Rydelios Superdia

Luicelia Superdia
 (Human/Superd Hybrid)

Immortal Demon Race

Badigadi, a male Immortal Demon Race in the Anime
Kishirika, a female Immortal Demon Race in the Anime
Badigadi of the Immortal Demon Race in the Light Novel
1/3

The
Immortal Demon Race
 are descendants of the
First Demon God
. Males have jet black skin and six arms while females only have two arms. Their most prominent traits are their
Demon Eye
  and immortality that allows them to regenerate after their bodies are destroyed, but temporarily causing their bodies to shrink before the flesh is reassembled
 . They could even revive themselves after being completely obliterated, but this process would take thousands of years. Currently only the Dragon Race know the method to kill them permanently.

List of Immortal Demon Race:

Kishirika Kishirisu

Badigadi

Atoferatofe Rybak

Necross Lacross

Necrolia Nacrolia

Kirisis Calisis

Kalman II
 (Human/Immortal Demon Race Hybrid)

Kalman III
 (Human/Immortal Demon Race Hybrid)

Randolph Marianne
 (Human/Immortal Demon Race/Elf Hybrid)

Ogre





Malta, the Ogre God


Ogres
 (鬼族,
Onizoku
)are a group of Demon Race currently residing in the Ogre Island of the
Biheiril Kingdom
. They are very tall and muscular, with males reaching 3 meters tall. They have protruding lower jaws with canine teeth sticking out upwards, while having horns on their head. Their preferred drink, nicknamed ogre water, is in fact soy sauce.

About a hundred years ago, the ogres were under attack by sea folks and were driven into a desperate state. When they were losing hope, the prince of Biheiril Kingdom and a few adventurers came to the Ogre Island to conquer the tribe and claim the rumored treasure. After seeing the sorry state the ogres were in, the party changed their mind and pledged to help the ogres to defeat the sea folks. In the end, they successfully slain the chief of the sea folks, but the prince's party member were all dead.

To show their gratitude towards the distraught prince, the ogres established a relationship with people of the Biheril Kingdom. After a hundred years of integration, they are currently coexisting peacefully with their fellow humans, so much that the humans would actually put up in arms to fight those who insult the ogres.

The Ogre God
Malta
 is the only named ogre character so far.

Beast Race

Various Beast Race rescued by Rudeus and Ruijerd in the Anime
Various Beast Race working as servants in the Anime
1/2

Beast Race
 (兽族,
Juuzoku
) are the original inhabitants of the Beast World. After the death of the First Beast God
Pudoria Dordia
 at the hands of the First Dragon God and the ensuing destruction of the Beast World, the surviving Beast Race were gathered by the Human God to live in the Human World and they settled in the place now known as the
Great Forest
. Their primary language is Beast God Tongue.

The Beast Race are similar to the Human Race in appearance, with the difference of having traits of other mammals on their body. Their lifespan is also similar to humans, while their physical capabilities are slightly superior. They are capable of using a unique magic called
Howling
, which allows them to infuse their voice with magic to perform echolocation or incapacitate their enemies. They also possess an enhanced sense of smell that could identify the faint scent of different people, or even the smell of arousal
. However, their enhanced sense of smell is also their weakness, making them prone to being disabled by strong scents or smokes
.

The Beast Race enter their mating season during autumn, in which they become restless and aroused. During the season, they would duel against members of the opposite sex in their favor, and the winner would become the dominant one in their relationship and subsequent marriage
.

Doldia Tribe

Ghislaine, a female Doldia Tribe Beast Race in the Anime
1/1

5,500 years ago
, humans declared war on all other races after enslaving the demon race. In response towards the human invasion, Beast God
Giger
 rallied the Beast Race to defend the Great Forest. Fighting on the front lines with might and wit, Giger successfully defended the Great Forest and earned his fame as the hero of the Beast Race. In extension, the Doldia tribe descended from Giger became the royalty equivalent of the Great Forest and the guardian of the Sacred Beast
.

Currently there are two branches of Doldia tribe: the Dedoldia tribe with feline traits, and the Adoldia tribe with canine traits.

Notable Doldia Tribe Members:

Gustav Dedoldia

Gyes Dedoldia

Ghislaine Dedoldia

Linia Dedoldia

Minitona Dedoldia

Pursena Adoldia

Tersena Adoldia

Heaven Race






Sylvaril, a Heaven Race member



Heaven Race
 (天族,
Tenzoku
) are the original inhabitants of the Sky World. They have the appearance of humans with a pair of wings and are capable of flight, while having lifespan of at least a few hundred years. Most of them are currently residing on the
Divine Continent
, and their towns are protected by magical barriers. They used to be hostile towards the Demon Race during the
Second Great Human-Demon War
, but they're currently indifferent. Since they didn't participate in the Laplace War, they don't have the taboo against Superds and have no problem in using spears. Their primary language is Sky God Tongue
.

The only named Heaven Race character so far is
Sylvaril
.

Ocean Race

Ocean Race
 (海族,
Kaizoku
) are the original inhabitants of the Ocean World. They rule the ocean, making sea travel across
Ringus Sea
 impossible. Their primary language is Sea God Tongue.

References

Randolph
========

Redirect to:
Randolph Marianne

Randolph Marianne
=================

Information

Story

Relationships

Appearance

Randolph Marianne
 is the current Death God after defeating the
previous Death God
.

Appearance

Has a Skull like face, in the sense that his face is so sickly that his skin warps tightly around his face. This appearance might be due to his mixed blood as he's not particularly sick.

Personality

Randolph used to be battle-thirsty but after countless battles, he's fed up. Now, he enjoys cooking (despite not being good at it) and walks around yawning without a care, even in time of turmoil. Generally a pacifist but Randolph does not mind killing anyone he's ordered to or in self-defense.

He is very loyal to
Pax Shirone
 and
Benedict Kingdragon
 because they were the only ones who enjoyed his cooking and understood him.

Background

After retiring he returned to his home country and started working as a chef and restaurant owner but soon the restaurant became bankrupt, leaving him with a huge debt. He then started working in Dragon King Kingdom as a Knight to pay off the debt.

Power and Abilities

Sword of Bewitching
 (
幻惑剣
,

Genwaku-ken
)
: It is a style of swordsmanship that tricks the opponent and creates opening in combat. It consists of two different sets of techniques known as the
Sword of Luring
 (
誘剣
,

Yū-ken
)
, a technique that entices an enemy into attacking when they should be defending, and the
Sword of Hesitation
 (
迷剣
,

Mei-ken
)
, a technique that entices an enemy into defending or retreating when they should be attacking.

North God Style
: Trained in the North God Style to at least Emperor rank. Was skilled enough to be a candidate for the North God rank.

Absolute Void Eyes
: This
Demon Eye
 let him create an impenetrable barrier around a location with minor loopholes.

Master of Stealth
: Randolph is capable of appearing behind a person without a sound or whatsoever with a saying "God of Death is always behind you".

Psychological warfare
: Randolph makes up for his lack of overwhelming power by making suggestions mid-battle, causing distress to his enemies and allowing him to turn the tables.

Equipment

Gauntlets created by and purchased from
Tallhand
, with the Mana Absorbing Stone planted inside. This allows Randolph to overwhelm magic users, though has limited use, as the Mana Absorbing Stones consume as much Mana as they cancel out, making them less effective against a magician with large amount of mana like Rudeus.

Achievements

Defeated his predecessor, the Death God
Laxus
.

Ranked #5 of the
Seven Great Powers
.

Overwhelmed
Rudeus Greyrat
,
Roxy Migurdia
 and
Zanoba Shirone
.

Trivia

Dead End
 were the last clients of his restaurant.

Badigadi
 told him about
Hitogami
, not to trust nor make enemy out of him, a long time ago.

In light of things,
Hitogami
 might have instructed
Gisu
 to sell Randolph the magic gauntlet in hope the Death God would take down
Rudeus
.

Despite being part immortal, Randolph has not shown to have omnipotent regeneration nor tremendous magical energy like his elders, probably due to him only having 1/8th of Atofe’s blood.

In the side story "Jobless Oblige", Sieghart succeeded Randolph as the next Death God, implying that he either defeated Randolph or accepted his offer to succeed his position somehow.

His grandmother was also called Death God Knight and her connection to
Laxus
 is unknown.

Randolph Marianne/Relationships
===============================

Information

Relationships

Appearance

Family

Others

This article
lacks information
 and requires expansion. Please
expand this page
 to include missing information to help improve the article.

Pax Shirone

Randolph liked Pax Shirone as a person, though he acknowledged Pax's shortcomings as a ruler.

After initially meeting Pax, they periodically dined together, Randolph offering Pax advice on swordsmanship and magic.

This unlikely friendship developed because Pax and his wife, Benedict, were the only people who genuinely complimented Randolph's cooking.

Pax's appreciation for Randolph's unique culinary talents, despite his fear of being poisoned, genuinely touched Randolph.

Randolph recognized that Pax was unloved by his people and had few allies, but he still respected Pax's determination to rule well and secure a future for Shirone.

He understood Pax's frustration with his subjects' rejection and his feelings of inadequacy as a king.

When Pax decided to commit suicide, Randolph was saddened but ultimately respected his decision, recognizing Pax's desire to die with dignity as a king.

He dutifully carried out Pax's final orders to protect Benedict and educate their unborn child, imparting his own skills and offering the child the praise that Pax never received.

Benedict Kingdragon

Randolph is fiercely loyal to Benedict and committed to protecting her. Pax entrusted Benedict's care to Randolph as a dying wish, and Randolph promised to fulfill that request, even at the cost of his own life. He safely escorted her out of Shirone Castle during the rebellion and planned to return her to the King Dragon Realm. He vowed to protect her until she gave birth and then raise her child, teaching them swordsmanship, culinary skills, and academics.

He respects her as Pax's wife and the future mother of his child. Although Benedict is described as quiet and inexpressive, even being considered a "half-wit" by some, Randolph treats her with respect and deference. He addresses her as "Her Majesty" and is mindful of her presence, refusing to discuss certain topics when she is around.

He seems to view her as a simple and somewhat naive person. He notes that she was likely mimicking others when she ate properly, having never received formal instruction on etiquette. He also comments that she will likely need his help in raising her child, as she probably won't be capable of giving them enough praise.

Hitogami

Randolph Marianne had never met Hitogami and had only learned of him through stories about a relative who had interacted with the Hitogami. While Randolph does not offer a direct opinion on Hitogami, his statements about his relative's relationship with Hitogami suggest that he views the Hitogami as a dangerous and manipulative being.

Randolph states that his relative, who he later identifies as the Demon King Badigadi, had "borrowed" Hitogami's power to defeat a powerful foe to protect his fiancée. This choice of words suggests that Randolph believes Hitogami did not give his power freely but rather exacted a price for his aid.

Randolph also notes that his relative had "a rough time of it" because of his association with Hitogami. This further suggests that he believes Hitogami's involvement in people's lives often leads to negative consequences.

He warns Rudeus to avoid interacting with Hitogami, saying that "it won’t end well for you either way". This suggests that Randolph believes Hitogami is a manipulative and dangerous being who uses people to achieve his own goals, regardless of their intentions.

Randolph Marianne/Story
=======================

Information

Story

Relationships

Appearance

Volume 5 - Juvenile Period - Reunion Chapter

Randolph Marianne ran a struggling restaurant that served Nanahoshi-style dragon meat. Due to Rudeus' harsh criticism, he decided to shutter the family kitchen business and accepted the recruitment of Shagall Garantis, a general of the King Dragon Realm.

Youth Period

Randolph was originally a Dragon King Kingdom's knight, but was ordered to escort
Pax
 in his coup d’état, where he easily overpowered the nation's imperial knights. He served as Pax's personal bodyguard since then. He was present during
Zanoba's
 return but had no interest in it.

When Zanoba and
Rudeus
 came back from the front line, he had a fight with them due to being mistaken for an apostle of
Hitogami
, which ended in a draw. It's revealed, however, that he only attempted to help Pax out of personal interest, for he and his queen were the only two people to praise his cooking. He was absolutely fine with letting his assailants go.

After Pax's suicide, Randolph carried Queen
Benedict
 out of the siege, resolving to teach
Pax's son
 skill in the swords and in cutlery.

Young Man Period

Rudeus would seek Randolph's help in the final battle but having to protect Pax's son, he can't leave. However, he tells Rudeus that if he can protect Pax Jr. from being targeted by the Shirone Kingdom Royalty he would would help in other ways, as to take down Hitogami and avenge Pax. He also gives Rudeus 『The Bone Ring of Laxus』in case he needs to ask
Kishirika
 a favor.

Ranoa Magic Academy
===================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

This article is about the Magic School in Sharia. For the Season 2 Episode 5 Anime , see
Ranoa University of Magic (Episode)
.

Ranoa Magic Academy in the Anime
Ranoa Magic Academy in the Manga
1/2

The
Ranoa Magic Academy
, also known as the
Ranoa University of Magic
 or simply
Magic University
, is the world's largest
magic
 school. It is sponsored by the Magic Guilds of the Magic Triumvirate and boasts one of the largest campus areas with over 10,000 enrolled students. The school is located in the Magic City of
Sharia
, Kingdom of Ranoa,
Central Continent
. People from all tribes, species, and social standings can be admitted.

Overview

The building of the Ranoa Magic Academy is made from magic-proof bricks which the Magic Guild has the monopoly on manufacturing and sales, but they're not strong enough to stand against
Rudeus
' magic. There are multiple magic circles around the school that have
healing
 power close to that of a Saint-level Healer, especially in the practice building's training hall.

The entrance fee and expenses until the graduation are about 3
Asura Gold Coins
.

Background





Ranoa Magic Academy Emblem in the Light Novel



Before the Ranoa Magic Academy was built, only the Magician Guild is present in the area, where it stood as a fortress protected by the Ranoa Kingdom. An alliance called the Magic Triumvirate or the Three Magic Nations is eventually established between the neighboring nations of Ranoa, Basherant and Neris. The Triumvirate poured tremendous amount of resources into magical research. The newly built Ranoa Magic Academy, the Magician Guild and Neris Magical Implement Workshop were established together in the Magic City of Sharia and became the center of the Magic Nations despite the overlapping borders. The Ranoa Magic Academy is located in the Student District at the eastern part of the city, whereas
Frau Claudia
, the 56th Generational Leader of the Magician Guild, became the first principal
.

Uniform

Rudeus wearing the male school uniform in the Anime
Ariel wearing the female school uniform in the Anime
Rudeus wearing the Ranoa Magic Academy Uniform in the Anime
Ranoa Magic Academy Uniforms in the Light Novel
1/4

Gentlemen are provided with a School Suit, Ladies are provided with a Blazer. They were designed and implemented by
Nanahoshi
 aka "Silent". They look like Japanese student uniforms.

The Gym uniform is a robe and the academy doesn't provide them nor do they specify any restriction or preferences on what to wear. So students can buy whatever they want and for the case of Rudeus, he uses the robe he had been using from the
Demon Continent
.

Academy Curriculum

The curriculum lasts 7 years, though it is possible to extend the duration of the study if it involves magical research backed by the Magic Guild. Normal student's curriculum consists of general studies for 3 years (typically Beginner-class in all four attack magic), after which they can choose to further develop a certain branch up to Advanced-class. Magic curriculum generally goes up to Advanced-class with the exception of Divine Strike (up to Beginner-class) and Barrier (up to Beginner-class) magic which are restricted by the
Milis Religion
.

Unlike other Magical Schools, the lessons in the school are not just limited to magic. There are also swordsmanship and horse-handling classes.

Books used though out the curriculum:

Fire Magic Theory and Practice

Water Magic Fundamentals

Earth Magic: Advanced Techniques

Wind Magic: Control and Mastery

Healing Magic: Principles and Applications

Teleportation: Theory and Fundamentals

The Teleportation Incident: Analysis and Impact

Summoning Magic: Techniques and Applications

Magical Theory: Foundations and Innovations

Illusion Magic: Principles and Techniques

Mana Management: Efficiency and Optimization

Magic Items: Crafting and Uses

Magic Circles: Theory and Design

Steps to Learning Summoning Magic: Analysis and Procedures

Special Student

The Special Student's Classroom in the Anime
The Tower where the Special Student's Classroom is located
Rudeus ascending the spiral stairway to the Special Student's classroom
1/3

Special students are those given special privilege from the school in exchange for the school to advertise how good they are after special students have been graduated. As such, the School also would send letters of invitation to renowned individuals to study in the Academy free admission to further boost their reputation.

The Special Student classroom is located at the third floor, rear room of the school building in the Light Novel
 while in the
Anime
, the classroom is located at the top floor of a tower with a spiral stairway to reach it and the interior is filled with various portraits.

Below is the list of privileges given to special students:

They are exempted from basic school expenses.

If they stay in the dormitory, they will be granted exclusive rooms for themselves, although they can share with other students if they want to.

The are exempted from classes under certain circumstances.

They can receive or join in any class curriculum aimed at the general students. The school encourages special students to mix in with other students if they attend.

Homeroom attendance is mandatory once a month.

They are free to do basically anything in the school (e.g. spend all day reading books in the library).

They may borrow one room in the research building for devoted research.

They may borrow one room in the training building for training time.

They are free to eat meals in the dining room.

They are exempted from duty of refilling water basins in toilets.

If they are active adventurers, they are free to continue being adventurers when they leave the campus.

They are free to publish their research findings if they visit the magic guild.

Anything done outside the campus is their own responsibilities (e.g. visiting the red-light district).

Since there are several types of special students, the aforementioned privilege may be varied.

Upon graduation, they would receive unconditional admittance to C-class membership from the Magic Guild if they produce their own theses, otherwise D-class membership is granted.

Areas

Dormitory

Ranoa Magic Academy Dormitories in the Anime
A Dormitory Room in the Anime
Ranoa Magic Academy Dormitories in the Manga
1/3

The Academy has several huge dormitory that is five stories tall with red roof, many windows with attached veranda and boarding is free. The dorm room is a 6-tatami length room, fitted with bunk beds with study chairs and tables, usually for 2 people but exception can be made for a Special Student. Students can also pay a bit more to move to a larger higher security room especially when it comes to aristocracies that fled their country. Boys and Girls' dormitory are separated and in the evening, boys are forbidden near the girl's dormitory.

The girl's dormitory is also the most secure location in the Student District. It is guarded by the
Rude Mercenary Company
 and the
Beast Race
 girls who have sensitive noses and the
Demon Race
 girls who have other ways to identify people like
Demon Eyes
. However,
Sieghart Saladin Greyrat
 who is trained in the
North God Style
 knows of a way to deceive their noses and knows how to deal with the demons by knowing their racial characteristics.

Reception Room





Ranoa Academy Reception Room in the Anime



The Reception is where the academy receives guests such as potential students of the academy that have a hard sofa and minimal furnishing.

School Yard






Ranoa Academy School Yard in the Anime



The School Yard is where students assemble for welcoming of new students or when announcements are made by the Principal or Student Council members at one side of the yard while students are seated around the room with tables and chairs like a banquet hall.

Training Hall






Magic Training Rooms in the Anime



The Training Hall contains several rooms with verandas for spectators while the center of the room has Saint Rank Healing
Magic Circles
 that automatically heals injuries instantly on anyone inside the circle so students can experiment and test magic or even do actual combat which is part of the fourth year curriculum. The outer area of the Magic Circles also has an Advanced Rank Barrier Magic that prevents magic from passing to prevent spectators from being harmed or incase of accidents.

Library

Rudeus and Norn studying at the Library
Ranoa Magic Academy Library in the Anime
1/2

The Library is in its own independent two-storey building that has a guard to ensure that students can enter. Magic is also forbidden in the library and due to previous students swapping out books to be sold, removing a book from the library is strictly forbidden unless given permission.

Infirmary

Rudeus, Zanoba and Julie watching over Nanahoshi in the Infirmary
Infirmary in the Anime
1/2

The infirmary is a spacious room that has a plaque by the entrance which says "Medical Room" and has 8 beds with 2 healers stationed to treat patients usually due to magic accidents that are brought in via stretchers.

Research Room

Nanahoshi's Research Room in the Anime
Zanoba's Research Room in the Anime
Cliff's Research Room in the Anime
1/3

Research Room are places where various research and experiments of Magic, that is mainly used by the Special Students where they are free to modify it as they please to meet the needs of their research. This also includes using it as their sleeping quarters.

Student Council Room

Student Council Room in another POV in the Anime
Student Council Room in the Anime
1/2

The Student Council Room is there the Student Council conducts their daily activities including summoning students for questioning and the like.

Rumors

Due to Rudeus being recognized as the strongest student in the academy, several rumors has began circulating about him, his friends, eventual family and even his
home
.

9 Rumors of the School:

Banchou
's arm flies."

"The Banchou's eyes shine."

"At the Banchou's single shout, a group of 30 people will assemble."

"A monster lives at the Banchou's house."

"The Banchou loves small children."

"The Bancho is a monster."

"The Bancho is great."

"The Bancho is rich."

"The Bancho is bald."

Ranoa University of Magic (Episode)
===================================

This article is about the Season 2 Episode 5 Anime. For the School article, see
Ranoa Magic Academy

Ranoa University of Magic
 (ラノア魔法大学
Ranoa Mahō Daigaku
) is the fifth episode of the
second season

Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on August 6, 2023.

Synopsis

After receiving a letter of invitation and Hitogami's advice, Rudeus decided to enter Ranoa Magic Academy accompanied by Elinalise where unique students called "
Special Students
" gather. When he arrives at the university, he faces a mock battle with one of the current students as an exam. His opponent is one of the Special Students named Fitts, who is a chantless magic user like Rudeus.

Plot

Rudeus
 arrives at the university, where his ability to silent cast is tested in a mock duel against another silent caster, Fitz, who Rudeus does not realize is
Sylphie
 in disguise. Rudeus easily defeats Fitz and is accepted as a student along with
Elinalise
.

After attending a speech by
Ariel
, who is the student council president, Rudeus attends his homeroom class. There, he reunites with
Zanoba,
 as well as meets his fellow classmates like Gyes' daughter
Linia Dedoldia
, beastgirl
Pursena
, and self-proclaimed magical genius
Cliff Grimoire
, who tells him he knows Rudues because of
Eris
, but hasn't seen her for a long time. He also learns Fitz is part of his class, but rarely attends.

After a brief encounter with Fitz, Rudeus meets
Luke
, who reveals he is also a Greyrat and Rudeus' cousin. Luke proceeds to tell him he's forgetful, indirectly mentioning that for not realizing Fitz's true identity as Sylphie, but Rudeus is oblivious to what he means by that.

Later, while Rudeus is on his way back to his dorm, Fitz accidentally drops Ariel's panties from a window, which Rudeus catches. The female students then confront Rudeus, accusing him of being a panty thief, and the dorm teacher attempts to punish him, but Fitz arrives to defend Rudeus, forcing the teacher and the mob to stand down by threatening them with violence and injury. She begrudgingly lets Rudeus go with a warning. Fitz apologizes for getting Rudeus into trouble, but Rudeus thanks Fitz for helping him, and Fitz decides to tease Rudeus by not telling him her true identity.

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Elinalise Dragonroad

Sylphiette

Cliff Grimoire

Ariel Anemoi Asura

Luke Notos Greyrat

Zanoba Shirone

Linia Dedoldia

Pursena Adoldia

Jinas Halfas

Locations

Ranoa Kingdom

Sharia

Ranoa Magic Academy

Rapan
=====

This article is about the City in Begaritt Continent. For the Chapter 100 Manga, see
Labyrinth City Rapan
.

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

"This city, wrapped in a whirlwind of chaos, is currently one of the largest and most prominent of the Begaritt Continent"

-Adventurer and Wandering the World Author
Bloody Kant





The Labyrinth City of Rapan in the Anime
Opening Theme 8



The Labyrinth City of Rapan
, also known as
Lapan
 is a city known for its numerous Labyrinth located at
Begaritt Continent
.

Geography

Rudeus and Elinalise arriving at Rapan in the Anime
The Labyrinth City of Rapan in the Manga
1/2

Rapan is a large earth-colored city sat in the midst of a vast desert, trapped in an enormous white cage that are actually made from bones of a
Behemoth
 where 12 of these bone pillars are enough to encase the entire city and has several oasis that makes the city unexpectedly verdant with life.

Background

When
Kalman II
 and his companions visited Begaritt, they battled a behemoth that was rampaging through the desert. After defeating it, they feasted on some of its meat and left the remains to rot and eventually become the bone pillars where Rapan is built that refuse to decay and a standing testament to the passage of time.

Ants and other
Monsters
 also feasted on the remains of the behemoth's flesh where if monsters devour other stronger monsters, they give birth to more powerful monsters. These mutant ants dug countless nests and the nests all mutated into labyrinths and the
Teleportation Labyrinth
 is among them.

As such, labyrinths make Rapan an alluring destination for countless
Adventurers
 from all over the
Human World
, looking to get rich quick that makes the city a stage where both happy endings and tragedies are acted out since then.

Economy

Various Rapan wares in the Anime
Various stalls in the sidewalks of Rapan
A merchant in typical bearded look and outfit of turban, flowing clothes
1/3

Rapan's economy is heavily dependent on Adventurers and the Merchants that buy or sell mainly
Magic Tools and Magic Items
 that are acquired from the labyrinths where they churn out in droves. Due to adventurers coming from all walks of
Races
 of the
Human World
, there is no standard currency used in Rapan and trading Magic Crystals is the most prominent means of trade where as long as your Magic Crystal stock is of certain quality, it is almost guaranteed it will sell at a high price that makes Rapan a land where merchants' dream come true.

Due to Rapan's remote location, the required knowledge of how to traverse and survive the desert and at least 6 months of travelling time come and go here, only a select few merchants make a habit of selling their merchandise to the
Central Continent
 for a more profitable and safer trade.

--To be added

Rudeus and Elinalise in front of Rapan Adventure Guild



The Adventure Guild of Rapan is located at the center of Rapan and is carved inside a huge boulder most likely with
Earth Magic
 but the complexity of its construction surpasses
Rudeus Greyrat
's abilities.

Rayfort
=======

Rayfort is the son of the elf village chief, Magnafort.

Appearance

Appeared to be about 15 years old by
Rudeus
' standards, with long elf ears hidden behind his golden-blond hair. He is devastatingly handsome, with
Ariel
-tier good looks. His face was so dazzling it was near impossible to gaze upon him directly.

Personality

he appeared to be really confident and arrogant becouse of his looks

Background

As he is the son of the elf village's chief, he has undergone special education towards becoming the next elven chief. His circle of friends as he was growing up included
Mi'nal
 and
Linia Dedoldia
, and he enrolled in
Ranoa Magic Academy
 as a special student after being chased out of his village after "some incidents".

Plot

We first met him during norn student council speech where he ranked norn B tier

Everyone said she was top-tier in this school, so I was hopeful, but... that's it, hm?... If that's all she amounts to, I bet her older brother, Rudeus, is nothing special, either"

Reality

Redirect to:
Reality (Dream)

Reality (Dream)
===============

Reality and Dream
 (
現実
,

Yume
)
 is the Twenty-second episode of the
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on December 12, 2021.

Synopsis

Rudeus and his friends have finally returned to the Fittoa territory. However, the village of Buena, his hometown, has become a wasteland, and the town of Roa, where the Boreas family used to live, has become a refugee camp for people caught up in the teleport incident. After reuniting with the butler Alphonse and Ghislaine, and learning about the current situation in the Fittoa territory and the Boreas family, Eris visit Rudeus after thinking alone.

Plot

Rudeus dreams of everyone he knows in a happy gathering. Then the dream turns nightmarish and he gets stabbed in his old form, in his old room. He wakes up with Eris beside him. Ruijerd asks him about "Human God" and Dragon God.

Rudeus reveals the nature of the "Human-God" to Ruijerd, and the fact that the Superd curse on him is gradually fading away.

The next day, Rudeus practices
Disturb Magic
 while traveling - in case he meets
Orsted
 again. Eris looks dejected after hearing this.

The party reaches the ruins of Rudeus' hometown, where he has flashbacks to his early life there. Ruijerd then announces that since Rudeus and Eris are strong enough that they do not require his protection anymore, he will take his leave. Ruijerd thanks Rudeus for helping him grow. They bid each other farewell.

Rudeus and Eris continues on to
Roa
, which is also in ruins. There, Eris reunites with
Ghislaine
 and her servant [Minor Characters#Alphonse|Alphonse]]. However, Alphonse reveals that Eris' parents were both killed as a result of the teleportation incident while her
grandfather
 was executed by the king. Alphonse also explains that another branch of the Greyrat family has offered to allow Eris to be married to
Pilemon Notos Greyrat
 as a concubine. Ghislaine has a heated argument with Alphonse. Eris asks them to leave her alone.

Rudeus noted his
mother
 is still missing and later finds confirmation that
Sylphiette
 was not found dead, but her location remains unknown to him.

That night, Eris enters Rudeus' tent and tells him she turned fifteen a few days ago. Rudeus don't want to take advantage of her current state, but she initiates sex with him.

The next morning, however, Rudeus wakes up to find that Eris had left with Ghislaine to an unknown location, which leaves him distraught and confused.

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Ruijerd Superdia

Ghislaine Dedoldia

Alphonse

Philip Boreas Greyrat
 (dream sequence)

Hilda Boreas Greyrat
 (dream sequence)

 (dream sequence)

 (dream sequence)

 (dream sequence)

 (dream sequence)

 (dream sequence)

 (dream sequence)

 (dream sequence, hand-only)

Locations

Central Continent

Asura Kingdom

Buena Village

Roa
 (Refuge camp)

Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 6

Chapter 11: Journey's End

Chapter 12: The Reality of the Calamity

Chapter 13: The Young Miss's Resolution

Differences with the light novel:

The anime adds a scene where Rudeus imagines a what if scenario with everyone together and shows his trauma to Orsted.

In the light novel they still use the carriage, meanwhile in the anime they now have a pair of horses.

Some thoughts of Rudeus after the encounter of Orsted was cut.

In the novel, the conversation with Rudeus and Eris was first and afterwards the conversation between Rudeus and Ruijerd.

The anime add a scene where Rudeus arrives to Buena Village, visit his house and remember his past.

In the light novel, Ruijerd departure was just before entering to the campament in Roa.

A conversation between Rudeus, Ghislaine and Alphonse was cut, some scenes where:

Rudeus talking about the past years

What happened with the servants

About Eris and her future

About Philemon, his relation with Darius and the current power struggle of Asura

A Eris PoV between the sex scene and when Rudeus wakes up was cut.

Recollection (light novel)
==========================

Mushoku Tensei ~ Isekai Ittara Honki Dasu ~ Recollection
 (無職転生 ～異世界行ったら本気だす～ リコレクション) is a digital-only anthology of short stories written by
Rifujin na Magonote
 featuring illustrations by
Shirotaka
 which was published on March 25, 2022 in Japan and May 30, 2024 in English. The book is a compilation of short stories which play out between Volume 1 - 10 of the
Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation
 light novel series, paired with an interview of the author
Rifujin na Magonote
.

Synopsis

DIGITAL EXCLUSIVE!

Experience the past adventures of the Jobless Reincarnation crew once again in this special collection! Enjoy more stories with some of your favorite characters during their early adventures—and tons more!

This Mushoku Tensei Recollection includes:

32 short stories set during the Light Novels 1-10.

A brand new short story exclusive to this collection.

Cover and color illustration gallery.

Character profiles.

Interview with author Rifujin na Magonote.

Illustrations

Clean Cover from Shirotaka's Twitter Account

References

Navigation

Redundancy
==========

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Information

Summary

Mushoku Tensei: Redundancy
 (無職転生 - 蛇足編 -
Jabashi-hen
) is a spinoff work of Mushoku Tensei that takes place between the end of the events in both
web novel
 and
light novel
. It is a collection of stories that focuses on more various characters than Rudeus Greyrat that the author was not able to focus on the main story.

Publication started on May 19, 2015, a month after the end of the main story. It has been divided into 8 parts with each exploring different characters. Originally conceived as nine stories in a whole volume, but the author removed the chapters regarding the main characters
Ars
 and
Aisha
 Greyrats after a re-evaluation of the controversial content. The story came to a conclusion on September 9, 2017.

Light novel

Span

Title

Publish Period

The Greyrat Children

May 24, 2024

3

Jobless Red Carpet

June 25, 2025

4

TBA

TBA

TBA

Author Notes

According to the
author
, he was not satisfied with the chapter after was violated in terms of use by the site but allowed himself to revise by scrapping the same chapter and possibly continue to keep their relationship and maintain of elopement in the future, especially the upcoming light novel.

Redundancy/Summary
==================

Information

Summary

Part 1

Part 2

Part 4

Let's Make an Automaton!

Part 5

Diary of Vacation in Millis

Part 6

The God That Dwells in the Holy Land of Sword

The Moment Aisha Greyrat Stopped Being a Maid

Aisha Greyrat
 is with
Ars
 in her room, reads a fairytale under the name "The Great Hero of Humanity Ars", the latter named after the main character. After that, she felt a strange kind of feeling when around him as he grew up, tracing his similarities of her half-brother
Rudeus
. Ars confessed to her and ended up having sex, only they were caught in sight by Rudeus. In shock, Rudeus rushed them to the bathroom and organize a family meeting, leaving the rest of the family, including
Lilia
, disgusted. When Ars declared he wanted to be with Aisha,
Eris
 got angry and beat him, but Aisha defended him in tears. As Rudeus and Lilia also got very angry, she suggested to Ars the idea of eloping. He agreed and they ran away from home.

Distressed after the elopement, Rudeus gathered his friends and family to search them everywhere of
Millis country
, but nowhere to be found. After months of searching desperately, Rudeus and his wives joined together in a quiet country outside Millis, where Aisha and Ars found in a handmade cottage. Eris encourages Ars to a sword fight, brutally chopped off his right hand by her sword as a result, but he swore to defend Aisha from his mother as his own will, while Rudeus founded Aisha, had got heavily pregnant, in her room. Rudeus, in distraught, wanted to end his half-sister with her unborn child mercifully, but only seeing Ars's resolve to protect Aisha and their genuine love despite being a relationship between family members is largely forbidden, he finally confessed at Aisha about his previous past. At the time of the confession between the siblings, Rudeus accepted Aisha and Ars' relationship. They were brought back home, and Lilia, however, attemptedly put an end of her pregnant daughter with a knife in front of them, but Rudeus calmed her down.

As a punishment, they removed Aisha's last name and Ars would step off separately from her to study while she is ready to leave her home to study in the Asura Royal Academy to learn more about the world and herself. At the time she gave birth to Ars' child, Leroy, would stay in the Greyrat Household; Aisha bids her goodbye to Ars and Leroy.

Four years later, Aisha is now married with Ars, bought a house from City of Magic Sharia and lives peacefully with the child.

Part 7

Nanahoshi Gourmet

Part 8

The Last One to Leave the Nest

Trivia

Leroy Greyrat
 is a first child and son of Ars and Aisha Greyrat. Born in the Millis country as an illegitimate offspring of the half-relatives, he has his father's sexual perversion and his mother's intelligence.

Leroy's character was later deleted in the web novel, but possibly reappear in the forthcoming light novel.

Reida Reia
==========

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Information

Story

Relationships

And yet, none of them had even tried to succeed Reida as the Water God. Calling themselves unworthy of the title, they'd left it in Reida's hands and content themselves with the rank of Water Emperor.

Reida Reia
 (
レイダ
・
リィア
)
, also known as
Reida Lia
 in the English Light Novel is the grandmother and master of
Isolde Cluel
 and
Water God
, one of the "strongest swordsman of the generation."

Appearance

Reida is an old woman with white hair and blue eyes who looked to be in her early sixties. Her looks are also stated to resemble Isolde's. She usually had a grumpy expression on her face and was normally the picture of a gentle, harmless old lady when casual. She also wore her sword at her hip.

In her early 50s, Reida had black neck-length hair that frames her with a single ahoge. She wore a uniform that gave a window view of her huge cleavage.

Personality

In her later years, Reida is a kind old woman with a fond disposition for children she knows, such as Nina. Even so, she can be sharp and scornful of others, such as when she rebuked Auber for failing in his duty and leaving her to clean up his mess. She seems to enjoy looking back to the past, with an air of nostalgia around her words and eyes whenever she spoke about the past. She also held a degree of pride in her title and used it to affirm the importance of her own position.

Reida was an attentive person who paid attention to her granddaughter Isolde's growth, whose confidence had grown excessive at one point, and decided that she stay in the Sword Sanctum to train further.

She stood calm and firm in her final moments against Orsted, sighing at the fact that she would have to fight such a powerful opponent before her death.

Background

Reida's real name is not revealed since it is the tradition of the
Water God Style
 since its establishment that those who become the Water God will change their name to Reida Reia for females.

In her early age, she had beaten up a noble, and in retribution she was knocked down by a crowd of nobles and about to get both hands cut off.
Darius Silva Ganius
 intervened and saved her. When she became Water King and got picked to be the royal sword instructor, she went to look for Darius to express her gratitude but by that point, he had already turned into a horrible human being. Later on, she had at least one son, whose children would later on become Water God style swordsmen themselves.

Reida also met
Paul Greyrat
 during her visit with her acquaintance
Augusta
's dojo and acknowledges Paul's talent in the sword but that he lacks desire in strength.

Legacy

In her final talk, Reida implied that Isolde will be her successor.

After Reida's death, Orsted immediately left the venue without naming himself and Isolde did not pursue him.

The nobles on the venue believes that Orsted is a subordinate of
Perugius Dola
 because of their similar hair color and eyes and gains faith on
Ariel Anemoi Asura
 becoming queen, who has the backing of the Armored Dragon King with a subordinate who can defeat the Water God with one blow.

Despite Reida claiming to be the sole perpetrator on the assassination attempt on Ariel, many nobles sympathized with her and Ariel did not want the Water God Style to become her enemy.

Power and Abilities

Reida Lia is a powerful swordsman who, by the time of current events, is an old woman past her peak physical years. Nevertheless, she still ranked as one of the strongest swordsman of the current generation. She had been a true prodigy in her youth, and her natural gifts were comparable to those of any Water God who'd gone before her.
 Even at an old age, a swordsman of particular skill could have seen that her relaxed bearing was only a facade and realize that their fastest attacks would fail to touch her.

She was shrewd enough to deduce that Gal Fallion wanted her to train Eris Greyrat in order to defeat another immensely powerful Water God style user, Orsted (though she initially assumed it was herself). She also immediately knew the three-way deadlock between Isolde, Nina, and Eris before they properly fought one another.

She is powerful enough that even in a direct confrontation between her and Armored (Mk. I) Rudeus, she would still have the advantage.
 She can also counter all of Armored Rudeus' magic from a distance; it would be impossible for even a powerful mage like him to kill her from a distance due to her
Battle Aura
.

『Water God Style』






Deprivation Sword Kingdom depicted in the Light Novel


As a former Water god, she was able to learn three of the five secret arts of the Water God Style, which is the bare minimum to be worthy of the title of Water God. She mastered the two
most difficult
 of the five secret arts, which led to the creation of a sixth technique that made others worthy of the title, content themselves with rank of Water Emperor, and left the title in Reida's hands for as long as she lived.

Blade of Deprivation/Deprivation Field
 - A Water God Style new/sixth technique, Reida combined the two most difficult secret arts of the Water God Style and managed to create this phantom art. The technique allows Reida to cut from any direction, be it up, down, left, right around her and even the slightest movement is instantly countered with a fatal blow. The move has quite a large range being able to hit anything within a room hosting a party for a large gathering of the most prominent Asura nobles. This secret art is so deadly that Orsted's only advice against it was "
to not let it happen
."

Equipment

Golden Short Sword

Reia's Sword in the Game
Reia's Sword in the Game
1/2

Quotes

Reida:
"Goodness... Orsted? The Dragon God? That's quite a grandiose attitude you're taking. Do you think she can do it?"

Gal:
"I think she can.
Eris
 does too."

Reida:
"I see That's fine then. Self-confidence is more important than anything."

Reida:
"Long time no see. Did you come to take this old lady to the afterlife?"

Orsted:
"Yes. You’re a disciple of the Man-God."

Reida:
“Disciple, huh… so you let me go the previous time because I wasn’t one then? My my, I'm gonna have to fight such an incredible opponent in my final moments..."

Trivia

She encountered Orsted once before the meeting that led to her death, but was allowed to live because was not a disciple of the
Man-God
 at that time.

Orsted has fought her multiple times in his previous loops, and thus is completely aware of her fighting style.

The name Reida is the feminine version of Reidar, a legendary swordsman of the Water God Style, and each new head of this style will inherit this name. It is tradition for Water Gods to change their name to Reida Lia for female or Reida Liadar for males.

Fujii Yukiyo is her voice actor for her younger version in the Mushoku Tensei Mobile game.

Reference

Reida Reia/Relationships
========================

SPOILER ALERT!

This page contains
spoilers!
  Read at your own risk.

Information

Story

Relationships

Isolde Cluel

Isolde Cluel is Reida's granddaughter and student in the Water God Style. Though she is strict with Isolde, Reida also holds Isolde in high regard as the next carrier of the Water God Style. Isolde calls her 'Master' and mutually holds her grandmother with sincere respect.

Reida brought Isolde to the
Holy Land of Swords
 after being invited by Gal Fallion to train his students. During the battle for
Asura Kingdom
, Reida wishes for Isolde to cut her down after her assassination job is complete, and excludes her from involvement in the attempt to kill Ariel and the others. Isolde lamented her death over the next few days but did not begrudge Ariel nor Rudeus and co. for it.

Auber Corvette

You think you're gonna hurt the North God Style's reputation or something? Too damn bad. I'm cleaning up your mess here, boy! Hurry up and grow a pair!

Reida and Auber are acquaintances. Reida does not view Auber positively after his repeated failure to eliminate Ariel Anemoi Asura and Rudeus Greyrat. She condescendingly calls him a coward and his ambushes half-assed, and is visibly annoyed at having to clean up his mess.

Darius Silva Ganius

The girl’s first love ended then and there… but I wouldn’t say it turned to hate, exactly. Her gratitude and disgust cancelled each other out.

Reida's first love. When Reida was young, she was saved by Darius from some nobles who wanted to cut her arms off. She meets him again years after she becoming a Water King and instructor, but by then he became a horrible human being and forgot all about her. Her gratitude and disgust cancelled each out, but she nevertheless still fell a debt towards him which the
Man-God
 takes advantage of.

Orsted

Reida has fought Orsted in the past, who left her alive for the simple fact that she was not a disciple of the Man-God at the time.

Reida Reia/Story
================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Information

Story

Relationships

Volume 13

Reida arrives to the Sword Sanctum with her pupil and granddaughter, Isolde Cluel, at the Sword God
Gal Fallion
's request letter to teach one of his students. Reida would normally tear such a letter but it piqued her interest since it was from Gal, who hates relying on others. She brings Isolde along because of how her student has grown conceited and is saddened that her skills have not grown at all. She is hoping that Isolde will be motivated to improve herself after fighting the Sword God's disciples.

Upon seeing
Nina Fallion
, she is nostalgically reminded of the past when Nina was a kid, but Nina doesn't remember her. However, Nina realizes immediately from presence alone that Reida is an extremely powerful swordsman. Reida tries to recruit Nina to Water God Style because of her humble and cool composure, to no avail.

Reida anticipated the deadlock formed between Sword Saint
Eris Greyrat
, Isolde, and Nina. She orders Isolde to stay at the Sword Sanctum to train with them for some time.

Volume 17





Reida using Blade of Deprivation as Orsted closes in on her.



Ariel Anemoi Asura
 reveals to the nobles of the
Asura Kingdom
 that she has the support of the Armored Dragon King
Perugius Dola
. After Ariel reveals Darius' crimes and is about to be arrested, Reida comes crashing down from the ceiling and unleashes her signature move, Blade of Deprivation. She instantaneously cuts in half two of Perugius' servants,
Almanfi
 and
Trophymus
, as they react to attack her, and nearly cuts
Rudeus Greyrat
's hand off for simply channeling mana into his ring to contact
Orsted
 (his magically-enhanced gauntlet broke while protecting him). Due to the auto-counter nature of her technique, this causes everyone near her to be incapable of moving a muscle (including Rudeus, Eris,
Ghyslaine
, Perugius, and his servants) and thus forcing them to a standstill.

After harshly berating North Emperor
Auber Corvette
 for his own failure to complete his mission, she orders him to kill Ariel, Perugius, and Rudeus while maintaining her technique. As everyone remains still, she creates a fake explanation for her actions: she was operating under pay from the King Dragon Realm and ordered to assassinate Asuran nobles. A horrified Isolde arrives to the scene, but Reida stops her in her tracks as well, adding in that a "novice knight" is to cut her down after the assassination job is finished. After sensing that Orsted is coming, she orders Auber to take Darius and escape but Ariel questions why. She then goes into monologue about how the
Man-God
 came to her in a dream and convinced her to repay her debt to Darius from long ago.

When Orsted arrives, Reida asks Orsted if he has come to kill her, and he replies in the affirmative. Orsted starts to move into her effective range, and she starts to counterattack. Her slashes grow much more powerful and faster but Orsted blocks all of her attacks using his bare hands and kills her with one blow to the heart.

Despite Reida claiming to be the sole perpetrator on the assassination attempt on Ariel, many nobles sympathized with her and Ariel did not want the Water God Style to become her enemy. Thus, the Water God Style training halls remained and Isolde's name was cleared too.

One day, Sylphiette break the news to Rudeus much to his deligh but 2 months later Rudeus receives a letter from
Geese Nukadia
.

Reunion
=======

Reunion
 (再会
Saikai
) is the seventeenth episode of the
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on November 7, 2021.

Synopsis

Although he is reunited with his father, Paul, Rudeus is heartbroken because Zenith, Lilia, Aisha, and Sylphy went missing in the transference incident, and because of the conflict with Paul. Paul, on the other hand, is admonished by Geese and realizes his own mistakes, such as the words he said to Rudeus, and tries to meet his son again to talk. Rudeus summons up his courage and confronts Paul. ......

Plot

TBA

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Paul Greyrat

Norn Greyrat

Ruijerd Superdia

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Geese Nukadia

Shierra

Vierra

Locations

Millis Continent

Millishion

Central Continent

Buena Village

Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 5

Chapter 2: Paul's Story.

Chapter 4: Reunited.

Chapter 5: Objectives Confirmed.

Chapter 6: One Week in Millishion.

Differences with the light novel:

All the
Chapter 2: Paul's Story
 was left implicit in the opening sequence, some scenes cut are:

A short scene where Paul remembers his time in the Dojo of Lilia's father.

His time in Milis and how Paul asked for help to the Family of Zenith and his approach to rescue the persons.

How with the time he start to found information of dead people that he know (one of them, Sylphie father).

A short scene where Norn says the he meets a bald guy (Ruijerd) before Paul fight Rudeus.

A short scene that explain how Rudeus miss the information of the letter in Zant port

The reason why Vierra use that outfit was cut.

The conversation between Paul and Rudeus after the reconciliation was longer, some information cut was:

Rudeus ask how was Sylphie, and discovering that she can use Chantless healing magic

Paul asking how was his relation with Eris.

Rudeus confirming that Paul dont have affair with his subordinates.

Rudeus thinking a way to transport Ruijerd to the Central continent

In the Light Novel the second reunion in Millishion is only Rudeus, Eris and Ruijerd, in the anime also have Paul.

In the light novel, they decide to stay a week in Millishion, meanwhile in the anime decides to departure in the next day.

Ruijerd show how he obtained a recommendation letter with a old acquaintance to travel.

All the
Chapter 6: One Week in Millishion
 was cut except the departure of Rudeus with Paul. some scenes cut are:

Rudeus visiting the HQ of the Fittoa Search and Rescue Squad and meeting Norn again.

Rudeus searching information in the adventurer guild and completing a quest.

Rudeus and Eris having a dinner with Paul and Norn.

In the end of the episode, Rudeus ride a horse, even thought is stated in further Light Novel volumes that he dont know how to use one.

Reunion Day
===========

Reunion Day
 (
再会の日
,

Saikai no Hi
)
 is the thirty-third chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Geese

Zenith Greyrat

Summary

Appearances

Characters

Geese

Zenith Greyrat
 (Flashback)

Rudeus Greyrat

Norn Greyrat

Rifujin na Magonote
===================

Rifujin na Magonote
 (
理不尽な孫の手
)
 is the pseudonym of a Japanese author best known for his original novel series -
Mushoku Tensei

and
Orc Eroica
.

Magonote rarely appears on-camera and likes to keep his privacy. When he does make an appearance, he wears a characteristic helmet to cover his face. This helmet is of the same model donned by
Orsted
 (a character in Mushoku Tensei) to keep his curse at bay.

Career

Magonote first started uploading his work on the user-generated novel publishing site,
Shosetsuka ni Naro
 in November of 2012. His first upload was the web novel "Mushoku Tensei".
The series quickly gained the support of readers, hitting number one on the site’s combined popularity ranking within 1 year of publication.
Within the next one-and-half years, Kadokawa licensed the Mushoku Tensei series under their MF Books imprint and started publishing the story as a light novel with illustrations by a Pixiv user -
Shirotaka
. The first volume was shipped on January 23 of 2014.

In 2019, he started a web novel titled "Orc Hero Tales" on Shosetsuka ni Naro, which in the subsequent year was also acquired by Kadokawa and started publishing the story in light novel format under their Fujimi Fantasia Bunko imprint. The illustrations were provided by ero-doujinshi artist -
Asanagi
. The first volume was shipped on July 17 of 2020.

List of Works

Media

Trivia

Magonote penned the story of "
The Conquest of the Dragon King
" (which was later published as an extension story of Mushoku Tensei) three years prior to starting the official main story. He scrapped the idea due to the story structure being too hard to understand.

He was inspired by works uploaded on Syosetsu. He loves fighting games and cream puffs

His favourite ramen is Chashu (braised pork-belly ramen)

Rifujin na Magonote's furigana is written as "Magonote Sodo (Sword)" (マゴノテ ソード)

Rikarisu City
=============

This article
lacks information
 and requires expansion. Please
expand this page
 to include missing information to help improve the article.





City of Rikarisu



The
City of Rikarisu
 (リカリスの町 -
Rikarisu no Machi
) is one of the three largest settlements on the
Demon Continent
, located in the Biegoya Region. Rikarisu sits in the middle of an enormous crater, the rim of which forms a single continuous wall around the city currently serves to protect the city against marauding
monsters
.

At the time of the
Great Human-Demon War
, it served as a home base for the forces of the Demon Empress
Kishirika Kishirisu
. Even now, it is sometimes referred to as Old Kishirisu Castle.

Description

There are only three entrances to the city, all of which are cracks in the rim of the crater. The walls of the crater are tall enough that one would not be able to make their way over them unless they could fly. Near the entrance to the town were the merchant related inns, related stables, and stores which are all connected.

The buildings are not as tall as the ones built in human settlements in the
Central Continent
 but there are just as many of them. The buildings are not built with architectural taste but rather as passable facility for living in, as a result a majority of the houses look homespun and similar. Most of the facilities near the entrance were stables and inns that clearly catered to traveling merchants and adventurers similar to the
Citadel of Roa
.

At the very heart of the city stand the ruins of Castle Kishirisu, half-destroyed during the events of
Laplace War
. Imposingly thick outer walls surround the broken black-and-gold castle itself, a sight that offer visitors a constant reminder of the Empress's faded glory and demonkind's violent, painful past.

Chronology

Story events regarding the City of Rikarisu.

Entry-Level Adventurers arc

Rudeus, Eris and Rujierd arrive at the city, and after declaring themselves as the adventurers party
Dead End
 they start to fulfill diferent request around the city. They are joined by a group of B class adventures who were previously pet thieves called
P Hunter
, where they would swap request, until Nekopara found out about the deal, too avoid being blackmailed by him Rujierd reveals his real identity as a Superdia forcing Rudeus and company to escape the city

Summoning arc

Rudeus, Elinalise, Cliff and Zanoba travel to the city in search of Kirishika. The city is now filled with guards from
Atoferatofe
 who now resides on the kirishu castle all of them with the objective of also finding Kirishika, upon finding Kirishika they are taken by the guards to Kirishu castle where they meet Atofe and
Moore
.  Atofe tries to reclute Rudeus and Zanova to her army upon rejecting her they are forcerd to run from her guards and escape the city yet again.

Organization arc

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Known Inhabitants

Vizquel

Ring's Sea
==========

Redirect to:
Ringus Sea

Ringus Sea
==========

Map of Ringus Sea
Full map of Mushoku Tensei with Ringus Sea on Center of Map
1/2

Ringus Sea
 (リングス海
Ringusu Umi
) is a sea surrounded by the five Continents.
Central Continent
 to the west,
Demon Continent
 to the east and northeast, the
Divine Continent
 to the north, and the
Millis Continent
 to the southeast.

This sea spawned when the former supercontinent was split into the Central and Demon Continent during the
Second Great Human-Demon War
.
[
Citation needed
]

Population

The sea is populated by the
Seafolk
. The language spoken is the Sea-God Tongue.

Notable Places

Devil's Cave
: A labyrinth that sits in the middle of the Ringus Sea. It is brutally difficult to even reach this labyrinth and due to its location, it is impossible to resupply once arrived. Given its depth and the fact that slow-paced exploration is almost impossible, it has earned the reputation as one of the toughest tests an adventurer can face.

Trivia

There are many pirates who rule these waters between the continents.

Roland Grimoire
===============

Roland Grimoire
 is the son of
Clive Grimoire
 and
Lucy Greyrat
.

Background

After his parents travelled happily and in love to the holy kingdom of Millis, they had him as their first and only child.

Trivia

He is the first descendant of
Rudeus
 who does not have the surname
Greyrat
.

Thanks to his elven lineage on both his mother's and father's side, it is possible that he could live up to 100-200 years.

Because he is descended from Rudeus, he is immune to the Curse of
Orsted
.

This could mean that he is one of Rudeus' descendants who help Orsted defeat
Hitogami
.

But it is also possible that he will become the Pope in the Kingdom of Millis, similar to his paternal ancestors.

He is the only known character who has 4 different races as ancestors.

Human, maternal and paternal,

Elve, paternal and maternal,

Hobbit, paternal

and beast race, maternal.

Rostelina
=========

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Rostelina
 is a female
Elf
 and companion of
Laplace
 during his time as the Second
Dragon God
 in the
Human World
.

Appearance

Rostelina has blond hair and long ears, a trait seen from elves.

Personality

Having no contact with anyone except Laplace and Saleyakt, has an innocent personality since she was a child.

Background

Rostelina: "I don't know anything about you at all, master!"
Laplace: "That's right, you simply followed me without asking anything."

Rostelina is born in an Elf Village but due to her unstable power causing her
Mana
 to go rampant that destroyed the village and killing its people repeatedly, she is considered a cursed child. Thus, Rostelina is cast out and abandonded to a large forest to be eaten by
Monsters
. This is where Laplace finds her and after uncovering the mystery of Rostelina's body and embedding a
Magic Circle
 that nullifies her overflowing magic. Since then, Rostelina is able to live a peaceful life and stays with Laplace at Dragonroar Mountain she tends to
Saleyakt
 and maintains the house.

History

After finishing her tasks for the day, Rostelina wants to know everything about Laplace who tells his story at the very beginning of his life in the Demon World and meeting the
First Dragon God
.

Route Selection
===============

Route Selection
 (ルート選択
Rūto Sentaku
) is the nineteenth episode of the
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on November 21, 2021.

Synopsis

After learning the whereabouts of Lilia and Aisha from The "Human God", Rudeus arrives to Latakia, the capital of the Kingdom of Shirone. Rudeus encounters Aisha, who has escaped from the soldiers in the city and rescued her and asks why she was being chased by the soldiers and where Lilia is. He decides to ask Roxy, who is also supposed to be working at the royal palace of Shirone, for help...

Plot

WIP

Rudeus engages in a talk with the "Human God"
He asks for the location of
Zenith
,
Lilia
, and
Aisha
.
He also asks for the location of
Sylphy
,
Ghislaine
,
Philip
, and
Sauros
.
"Human God" asks for Rudeus to trust him if his information turns out useful.
Rudeus says he'll consider it.
"Human God" shows a scene of Aisha Greyrat, but Rudeus must not reveal his real name.
"Human God's" next advice is to write a letter to someone Rudeus know in the palace of Shirone Kingdom. If he does so, he can rescue Lilia and Aisha from the palace.

Rudeus exits the dream world and finds himself seasick onboard a ship. Rudeus wonders at "Human God's" motive in getting him a
demon eye
.

<<
Dead End
>> disembarks onto the
Central Continent
. They travel by river. Eris tries to interest Rudeus in an
onigri
 - rice being a new food item to her. She seems puzzled at why Rudeus is not showing the same level of excitement.

The team enters the capital of Shirone Kingdom. Eris is visibly excited. Eris asks about Rudeus' master but he still seem distracted. Rudeus reveals that he learned that part of his family is held captive in the kingdom. Eris learns that he has a second sister that she was not aware of (She met
Norn
 in
Millishion
). Eris and Ruijerd agree to help.

Rudeus writes a letter to his master
Roxy
, and entrusts it to a employee of the inn. A young girl is partially shown to be gripping a letter hard as Rudeus walks away.

Rudeus wanders the market. He senses that he was being followed. A partially view of a female was shown to be running after him. He leads her into an alley. Armed men are also shown to be following the same direction. Rudeus runs around a corner and raised stone magically to seal the path behind him. There are sounds of a struggle, so he dispelled the stone wall, and sees a young girl in a tussle with two armed men - one of them holding a letter in his hands. They declare themselves soldiers from the palace. The young girl protested that they stole her letter. Rudeus sinks the two guards in
Quagmire
. The guards summon for help and Rudeus escapes with the girl with his magic.

Rudeus is aware that the young girl is his six year old Sister Aisha. He introduces himself as "Shadow Moon Knight". Aisha asks for his help in sending a letter to her father to let him know that her mother is being held in the palace. Rudeus makes vague suggestions on who can help her: a description of Roxy; a possible brother. Aisha says she has a un-dependable brother, which stings him. Her brother is a pervert. He reveals his alias to her - "Pet Owner of <<Dead End>>". He pledges to rescue her mother.

Rudeus asks his team to help with keeping his real name secret. Eris and Ruijerd end the talk by immediately embarking on an attack on the palace. Rudeus reins them back in lieu of Roxy's reply.

Morning came and someone called out to Rudeus. He quickly covers the sleeping forms of Aisha and Eris with a blanket, and answers the call. The  lady identifies herself as Ginger York, affiliated to the Guards of the
Seventh Prince
. She asks that he follows her to the palace. Supposedly Roxy wants to see him.

WIP
