Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 6

Chapter 1: Route Selection.

Chapter 2: Rice.

Chapter 3: The Shirone Kingdom.

Chapter 4: There Is No God.

Differences with the light novel:

The
Extra Chapter I: Dragon Meat, Nanahoshi Style
 from the Light Novel 5 that chronologically happens when they arrive to King Dragon Realm was cut.

A Short scene where Rudeus decides what route to take to continue his travel to Fittoa was cut.

In the LN, the scene about the vision of Hitogami about Aisha Happens in an Inn in the Dragon King Realm.

Almost all the events of
Chapter 2 Rice
 was cut and only shown in the OP sequence. some scenes where.

Almost all his exploration and information about the Dragon King Realm.

Rudeus making rice with egg and eating together that with Eris and Ruijerd.

All his traveling from the King Dragon Realm to Shirone kingdom.

The lore about Shirone kingdom was cut

A short scene where Rudeus decides that is a good idea everyone must use a fake name was cut.

In the Light novel, the letter of Aisha was confiscated and destroyed.

A short tough of Rudeus that never is going to launch himself again because he broke his legs was cut.

A short scene where Aisha peed herself because the escape was cut.

The conversation between Rudeus and Ginger to the road was a little longer

They pass near a slave auctions, that was moved because two mysterious persons (Ruijerd and Eris) attacked them the previous day.

How Roxy spend her time in the kingdom.

A Short scene  where Rudeus analyze all the situation after he was caught was cut.

Roxy
====

Redirect to:
Roxy Migurdia

Roxy's Homecoming
=================

Roxy's Homecoming
 (
ロキシーの帰還
,

Rokishī no Kikan
)
 is the twenty-second chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Roxy Migurdia

Summary

On a ship bound for the Demon Continent, Roxy gets seasick and is returned to her cabin by a crewman, where she dreams a memory. Leaving Shirone after the massive light in the sky, Roxy was immediately worried for Rudy and traveled East only to find paved flatlands where once stood villages. In despair over losing the Greyrat family, her extended family, she is advised by the coachman to head to the refugee center to learn more. There, she encounters a suicidal man and another Fittoan who returned after a long trek back, the latter sharing how the event was deemed to be a rare magical calamity that teleported everyone caught in the light around the world, many of which died where they landed.

Directed into the makeshift town to the temporary Adventurer's Guild, Roxy finds Rudeus, Zenith, Lilia and Aisha on the list of the Missing persons but not confirmed deceased. Remembering about Norn from Rudeus's letters, Roxy finds Paul's flyer addressed to Rudeus explaining that Norn was in his care while the other three were still missing, and that all information about them was to be forwarded to the Adventurer's Guild in Millis, leaving Rudeus alone knowing he can fend for himself. With the latter half of the message addressed to anyone reading to help find his family, Roxy's reads mention of the "Fangs of the Black Wolf" and realizes Paul was on the legendary S-Rank team. Once Roxy voices how she believes in searching the Demon or Begarid continents, she finds she reached the same conclusion as two other adventurers: Elinalise Dragonroad and Talhand.

Deducing Roxy in a Migurdian adventurer, they introduce themselves and since they were each planning to search the Demon continent, Roxy joins them due to her originating from there. Once their party is formed, they set sail, and Roxy is nudged awake by Elinalise once they reach port. Making landfall, Roxy ponders how Rudeus could be doing, knowing that he was a prodigy and he is most assuredly alive given his talent, thus Roxy swears to find Rudeus being that she is his master.

Appearances

Roxy Gets Serious Manga Chapter 001
===================================

Departure
 (
旅立ち
,

Tabidachi
)
 is the first chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei
 Roxy spin-off
manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Roxy Migurdia

Summary

Roxy Migurdia, now as Roxy M. Greyrat, who is now teaching in the Ranoa University of Magic, Roxy sees a book and remembers her story when he was young.

Roxy is a member of the Migurd race located in the Demon continent, and born without the special skill of the telepathy of their tribe. Her fathers, Rokari and Rowin learned the Demon tongue to teach her and they tried to prevent that Roxy discovered the lack of her skill, but one day, she left the house and found other children for the first time, but they dont speak and left her alone while they play, she returned to her house crying.

Some years later, Roxy in the roof of the house was thinking how suffocating was the mood of the village because she lacks Telepathy. Suddenly she finds that outside of the village was a traveler lying on the ground, when Roxy approaches the body, the person grabs her hand saying that was hungry. Inside Roxy house the traveler presents herself as Bloody Kant, and she is exploring the world to write a book about all the things that she discovers in the world. In the night, Roxy asks Bloody Kant about the worlds and she was fascinated about those places where they communicate with words, and asks if she is a good swordsman to travel in all those places, and she says that she is a magician and decides to show her skills.

In the next day Bloody Kant show her a the magic “Water ball”, and Roxy was fascinated, and ask her to teach her magic and Bloody Kant accept, for some days she teaches to Roxy the basic of magic until she was able to properly cast the magic Water ball, after that she gives to Roxy a wand, in the night, happy she wanted to ask something to her teacher in the next day. When she awakens, she finds that Bloody Kant already left the village leaving  behind a letter and an intermediate magic book to her, this makes Roxy sad because she wanted to travel with her. One year later, Roxy decides to leave her village.

Appearances

Characters

Roxy Migurdia

Rudeus Greyrat

Rowin Migurdia

Rokari Migurdia

Bloody Kant

Skills

Water ball

Regions

Demon Continent

Biegoya Region

Migurd Village

Trivia

The first magic that Bloody Kant showed to Roxy was Waterball, the same magic that Roxy showed to Rudeus in their first meeting.

In the Seven seas version in the first page, they change the name of Roxy M. Greyrat to only Roxy Migurdia.

Roxy Gets Serious Manga Chapter 002
===================================

The Town of Rikarisu
 (
リカリスの町
,

Rikarisu no machi
)
 is the second chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei
 Roxy spin-off
manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Roxy Migurdia

Summary

After leaving her village, Roxy decides to travel to the southwest to the Rikarisu Town, because for some words of her teacher, she knows that is one of the biggest town near the Migurd village, also have a adventurer guild and roxy heard some incredibles adventurers about them. After some days and without knowing if she takes the right path, she was attacked by a group of Pax coyotes, she was able to defeat some monster, but in the end she was saved by a group of adventurers and indicates to her the localization of the town, but this cost her all her money.

Roxy was able to arrive in the Town and register as adventurer, when she tried to pick a E- Rank quest to collect some flowers, but some adventurer tried to advise her to give up, because it was dangerous if she went alone but she ignored his advice and decided to take it anyway. When she arrived at the place of the flowers, Roxy was attacked by a group of gillray rats and was unable to defend herself because their attacks interrupted her chant. Suddenly the adventurer that wanted to stop her to take the quest and his party arrived and started to help Roxy, and she was able to chant Firewall and defeat the rats. After the battle, he presents himself as Dale and the party asks Roxy compensation because they saved her, but because she is penniless, they decide that she needs to work as a party member with them for some time. After returning to the town, Roxy's money for the quest went to the pool of the party and also for the first time since she left her home, she was able to eat a proper meal.

Appearances

Characters

Roxy Migurdia

Bloody Kant

Hawkendale

Nokopara

Blaze

Skills

Firewall

Regions

Demon Continent

Biegoya Region

Rikarisu Town

Trivia

TBA

Roxy Gets Serious Manga Volume 1
================================

This is the first volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 Roxy Spin off manga adaptation.

Synopsis

Roxy's life is a lonely one-out of all her tribe, she's the only one without the power of telepathy. Her days pass in silence, while people speak words she can never hear. But when she saves the life of a wandering witch, Roxy gets the chance of a lifetime: the opportunity to study as a magician's apprentice, and leave her strange home behind! Don't miss this brand-new tale in the Mushoku Tensei universe: the journey of Roxy, fated to be a star among magicians!

Chapters

Chapter 1:
Departure

Chapter 2:
The Town of Rikarisu

Chapter 3:
The Rikarisu Ruffians

Chapter 4:
Party Members

Short Novel: The Person Who Walks The World.

Navigation

Roxy Gets Serious Manga Volume 10
=================================

This is article for the tenth volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 Roxy Spin off
Manga
 adaptation.

Synopsis

Roxy heads to the labyrinth with Lene to make a new Staff. Roxy decides to make a suggestion to Lene, who is lacking in magic power for combat.

Chapters

Chapter 48: Personal weapon

Chapter 49: Curious Specimen

Chapter 50: Breakdown

Chapter 51: Graduation

Chapter 52: Drifting

Mushoku Tensei
 Roxy Spin off manga adaptation.

Synopsis

THE ADVENTURING LIFE

Roxy and the rest of her party set out from Rikarisu in search of their grandest adventure yet. Dale dreams of unearthing the secrets within an uncharted labyrinth, but in a life of sword and sorcery, things rarely go as planned. Instead, Roxy's path takes an unexpected turn...and soon, the Guild hires her for a secret, undercover mission!

MAGIC SCHOOL’S IN SESSION

With her old teacher’s letter of introduction in hand, Roxy enrolls at the legendary Ranoa University of Magic. It’s a whole lot of firsts: Her first time in school! Her first time in a dorm! All of it’s exciting, but there’s a small problem. Roxy doesn’t exactly have a lot of money left. Her roommate Lanletta seems all too willing to help by forking over heaps of cash, but Roxy can’t help but find this generosity just a little bit suspicious…

Roxy Gets Serious Manga Volume 6
================================

This is the Sixth volume of the
Mushoku Tensei
 Roxy Spin off manga adaptation.

Synopsis

Elementary, My Dear Roxy!

Now that she’s all settled in at the Ranoa University of Magic, Roxy dives head-first into her studies. When one of the library’s tomes goes missing, Roxy takes it upon herself to track down a replacement copy. Unfortunately, the replacement book winds up being stolen merchandise, and Roxy gets thrown into jail under suspicion of grand theft spell-tome! With a false accusation hanging over her head, can Roxy and friends clear her good name and track down the real book thief?

Roxy Gets Serious Volume 3
==========================

Redirect to:
Roxy Gets Serious Manga Volume 3

Roxy M. Greyrat
===============

Redirect to:
Roxy Migurdia

Roxy Migurdia
=============

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Information

Chronology

Powers and Abilities

Relationships

Gallery

Roxy M. Greyrat
, born
Roxy Migurdia
 (
ロキシー
・
ミグルディア
)
, is one of the deuteragonists in the
Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation
 series. She is a talented
Migurd
 mage, and a former
magic
 tutor. Because she can't use telepathy, she leaves her village due to feeling isolated from her peers. Unable to make a stable living as an adventurer, she becomes a travelling tutor and eventually becomes
Rudeus
' teacher. In the aftermath of the
Teleport Incident
, Roxy helps
Paul
 to search the world for survivors.

Appearance

Roxy is shown as a short statured adult woman in her physical teenage appearance between 15 or 16 years old. Her complexion is like sand but paler, and has long blue hair tied in 2 braids that reach below her waist. Her eyes match the color of her hair. Her hair color sometimes appears green in sunlight, which makes people distrustful or even afraid of her because of the similarity between her and the
Superd Tribe's
 green hair. She wears a long-sleeve white and gray button-down shirt with black edges, matching her short black skirt that shows off her beautiful, well-worked legs. On top of this stood out a large light brown layer, with the edges sinking into white and being outlined by black. A black hat rests on her head. In the center, a gold line rounded the circumference of the garment while 2 other wider white lines were painted on both sides.

The tip of her hat wilts lazily downwards while the flap stood erect in the air. Easily the most telling was the staff she carried around her, the blue gem at the tip of it glistening almost unnaturally in the sun.

As a
Migurd
, she has a rather child-like body, which causes several people to mistake her as a teenager rather than a normal sized adult.

Personality

Roxy is a calm and collected person with a wise outlook on life, yet always seeking to improve herself. She is very intelligent, able to piece together information and make rational deductions.

She was a rather headstrong person in the past, running from her tribe to roam the world as an adventurer.  She also openly defied her
teacher
 in the
Ranoa Magic Academy
 after learning his greatest magic. However, various incidents that happened afterwards and the encounter with
Rudeus
 greatly humbled her.

She has a bit of a clumsy side, making her prone to mistakes during unexpected and tense situations. She also has a complex with her petite figure, often laments her figure as unattractive and tends to get annoyed when someone mistakes her as a child. After seeing the family life of Paul and his family, Roxy begins to hold an idealistic outlook in romance and dreams of having a fateful encounter with the love of her life in a labyrinth and to start a family and become a teacher.

Background

Roxy is born to
Rowin Migurdia
 and
Rokari Migurdia
 of the
Migurd Tribe
, part of the
Race
 in the
Demon Continent
. However, she was born without her race's special ability to communicate telepathically, so her parents taught her how to talk normally. Throughout her childhood, she would often always feel annoyed and isolated with her race's silent conversation and ran away from her village after being impressed by a
Magician
 who visited her village one day.

Roxy becomes an
Adventurer
 to get some money in order to leave the Demon Continent where she joins the party
Rikarisu Gang
 with
Dale
,
Nokopara
 and
Blaze
 but the party eventually disbanded after the death of Dale. She stayed with
Bloody Kant
 for a time until when Kant gives her a letter of recommendation for
Ranoa Magic Academy
 and later heads to
Sharia
 to become a student in the Academy. Upon reaching Advanced Rank Water Magic, Roxy became a student of
Jinas Halfas
 and became a Water Saint. After graduating, Roxy left the Academy without saying a word to her teacher and went to
Asura Kingdom
 to look for work but is unable to find one even when she gradually moves toward the border and is at a loss. Roxy eventually found a job request for a
Magic
 Tutor and she hired by
Paul
 and
Zenith
 to teach
Rudeus
 about magic for two years.

Achievements

These are the current achievements that Roxy gained through her adventure, action, and training:

Chant Shortening

Water King Class Magician

Able to create Fire Saint Class scrolls

Teacher at the Ranoa Magic Academy

Shirone Kingdom Court Magician (Formerly)

Quotes

Roxy:
 "I, it was love at first sight."
Rudeus:
 "With whom?"
Roxy:
 "Eh?"
Rudeus:
 "It couldn't be dad?"
Roxy:
 "No, it's Rudy, when Rudy came into the Labyrinth to save me."

"Well. I thought after meeting Rudy, marrying Rudy, now having Rudy's child, how I'm the happiest girl in the world. But, because of that... if you die, then I will become the most unfortunate girl. Well, this is a little embarrassing to say, but... Please let me be happy."

Trivia

The hat Roxy wore as an adventurer was gifted by
Bloody Kant
, the author of "
Wandering The World
" and the one who taught her magic initially. It was replaced by a gift from
Rudeus
 and
Sylphy
, and finally gifted to
Lara
 when she left the household.

Roxy is the first Goddess that Rudeus worships in his exclusive religion, being the Goddess of Wisdom. Her holy panties are currently enshrined in the basement.

If Rudeus' previous life is taken into account, Roxy and Rudeus are of the same age.

Roxy does not like the taste of alcohol since she believes that it is dry until she visited
Kurasuma Town
 where there are sweet alcoholic drinks. Then, she would often be seen drinking in everyone at any chance.

Roxy likes sweets so much that she once sworn not to return to the
Demon Continent
 again, because the Demon Continent doesn't have any sweet food.

There are three things that Roxy had difficulty dealing with since childhood: green peppers, children, and
Superds
.

When she was a child, she was so scared of Superds that she would wet herself when she heard about them. The fear still lingers on when she becomes an adult.

A running gag in the
anime
 when Roxy is communicating with Rudeus via letters is
Pax Shirone
 grabs her chest and Roxy unfazed, retaliates with a Voiceless Fire Magic leaving Pax burnt but mostly unharmed.

In all previous loops where Rudeus doesn't exist, she became
Sylphy
's teacher and never married anyone.

Roxy's fantasy of meeting her fated lover in a labyrinth was fulfilled when Rudeus rescued her in the
Teleportation Labyrinth
.

According to Rudeus, in bed Roxy is the technical type, she looks to her teacher
Elinalise
 for advice and wisdom, Roxy offers alternatives to improve her performance(positions). She is always researching and improving.

Template:RikairsuNavbox

Roxy Migurdia/Chronology
========================

Information

Chronology

Powers and Abilities

Relationships

Gallery

Story

Volume 1 - Infancy Period

She taught
Rudeus
 magic and was astonished by his talent. She was known to be a very good teacher by Rudeus as she would constantly clarify his thoughts as long as they were relevant.

During her stay at the Village of Buina, she would often take it upon herself to help the villagers to forge better relationships with them. Although they were wary of her at first, they slowly accepted her.

She gave Rudeus his first magic weapon: A staff. A few days later, when he learned Water Saint Rank Magic after the first attempt, she left to train herself.

Volume 2 - Juvenile Period - Home Teacher Chapter

While not appearing in this volume personally, she however sent Rudeus a letter saying that she became a court magician of Shirone Kingdom and also a teacher of
Pax
, a Prince of Shirone. She also sent a book that taught him about the Demon God language, which she wrote herself, accompanied with some clumsy drawings. Rudeus was amazed with the detailed explanations stated in the book.

Volume 3 - Juvenile Period - Adventurer Chapter

Her birth place and identity of her parents is revealed. She was apparently known as a 'late-bloomer' and incapable of telepathy like most
Miguardias
 are able to. That had led her to leaving her hometown at a young age as she felt alienated, later becoming an adventurer. Her parents were relieved to hear that she was doing well.

Volume 4 - Juvenile Period - Voyage Chapter

Roxy,
Elinalise
, and
Tallhand
 reach Wind Port in search for
Paul's family
 but they heard about <<
Dead End
>> being in the same town, she manages to find
Ruijerd
 and
Eris
. But Roxy became scared when Ruijerd noticed her, and she then ran away back to the inn, not meeting Rudeus.

Volume 5 - Juvenile Period - Reunion Chapter

She returned to her hometown and reunited with her parents. Also, she learned the identity of
The Owner of Dead End
.

Volume 6 - Juvenile Period - Homecoming Chapter

She learned
Zenith
's location from
Kishirika
 and decided to reunite with
Paul
 to decide the course of action.

Volume 12 - Youth Period - Labyrinth Chapter

Roxy got trapped in a labyrinth for a month and instantly fell in love with Rudeus after he gallantly saved her life, despite him puking afterwards thinking that she had forgotten him. They then went to clear the Dungeon once more and save Zenith from the serpent that guards the labyrinth, freeing her from her crystal tomb.

Due to Rudeus suffering from the grief of losing his father, she "saved" him by having sex with him as it was known to be the best cure for it. At the end of the chapter, it was declared that she was to be his wife as he had to take responsibility for it.

Volume 13 - Young Man Period - Everyday Chapter

Roxy becomes a new Teacher at
Ranoa Magic Academy
. Roxy teaches Rudeus how to use Water King Class Magic. Rudeus has a threesome with Roxy and Sylphy.

Volume 14 - Young Man Period - Summoning Chapter

As Perugius doesn't allow demons to enter his castle Roxy is forced to stay behind while the rest of the group enters, after Rudeus returns and meets his future self, he tells him that roxy would have been destined to die by an infected rat, not only that but future Rudeus confirms that Roxy is pregnant with their first child, upon learning this Rudeus freezes the rat saving Roxy life.

Volume 22 - Young Man Period - Organization Chapter

Roxy tells Rudeus that she could be of assistance to help improve the Magic Armor, and he entrusts the task to her. It was revealed that she had also been studying magic circles for his sake.

Two months after
Atofe
's defeat, Roxy goes with Rudeus and
Lara
 to her hometown to visit her parents. Although at first Roxy wanted to make the decision to leave Lara at the Miguardia Village to hone her skills as an esper, she changes her mind after Rudeus decided against it and Lara did not want to leave her, even speaking up about her thoughts.

Equipment

Roxy’s Staff Information:
 It’s a unique and strong staff Roxy obtained thanks to her friends in the Ranoa Magic Academy.

The material of the wand is made from a rough and bony wood that comes from a tree called 『Elder Torrent』that grows in the large forest of the Eastern region of the Mills Continent.

Elder Treants are an advanced subspecies of the Lesser Treant, born from the nourishment of the fairy spring. They are capable of using water magic. Their arms could be used as material for high quality magical staves.

The tip of the staff is adorned with a magic stone in the shape of a small crystal that comes from a nameless slime monster in a labyrinth near the border of Ranoa.

Roxy’s staff increased her water magic almost twofold. While other magic element spells were marginally increased.

The opposed elements like fire are halved. Her staff was so incredible that her friends wrote research papers about the staff’s capabilities.

Roxy’s Staff Background:
 After entering the Ranoa University of Magic, Roxy realizes the limits of her mana capacity when attempted to cast Saint Rank Water Magic Spell Cumulonimbus and failed. Because she doesn’t have large enough mana pool.

So she commissions her classmate Louis who specializes in staff manufacturing to craft her a new staff. But the materials for the staff cost twenty gold coins and the magic stone itself cost fifty gold coins.

So she decided get magic stones by killing monsters in a labyrinth near the border of Ranoa. By applying for adventure quests.

She try get in a temporary adventurer party, but it is a double booking and they refused her for the voluptuous woman magician instead. Afterwards her Dedoldia tribe roommate Lene forced her to partner up in an underground fighting arena.

Roxy didn’t want to participate until Lene allowed her take all the prize money.

After they won the match, Roxy asked Lene’s help with killing monsters in a labyrinth and agreed to offer her strength so she can obtain a magic stone. Eventually after working together to kill a small slime monster inside the labyrinth.

Roxy was able to get the main magic stone that’s near its core. When she finally obtained the magic stone, Louis created Roxy’s new staff.

Roxy Migurdia/Relationships
===========================

Family

Rudeus Greyrat

Roxy and Rudeus sharing their first kiss in the Anime
Roxy comforting Rudeus after Paul's death
Roxy and Rudeus in the Teleportation Labyrinth
Roxy and Rudeus studying the book for the Teleportation Labyrinth
Rudeus embracing Roxy after saving her
Roxy giving Rudeus a Magic Wand
Roxy training Rudeus in Magic
1/7

Rudeus Greyrat is Roxy's disciple and later her husband. Roxy first met Rudeus in
Buena Village
 to become his home tutor. On Rudeus' 5th birthday, she gave him a magic wand. She was also able to help Rudeus overcome his fear of going outside, which led Rudeus to respect Roxy and treasure her "holy relic" (panties). The anime goes a step further, where she mentions how Rudy spied on her bathing. Roxy didn't admonish him for it, suggesting she was flattered he found her attractive.

After the
Teleport Incident
, they almost cross paths, but they wouldn't see each other. Years later they finally reunite when Rudeus decides to go the
Teleportation Labyrinth
 where he saves Roxy which made her fall in love with him that is seen afterwards where Roxy would make various attempts to be close to him or would always look at Rudeus. After the battle against the
Manatite Hydra
 that resulted in his Paul's death while saving Rudeus, he falls into depression but Roxy consoles him by sleeping with him. After that, they would eventually marry and Roxy would become his second wife. She later gives birth to Lara Greyrat and Lily Greyrat.

In an alternate timeline, Roxy dies due to
Magic Stone Disease
 under the manipulation of
Hitogami
, which causes the
Rudeus
 of that timeline to fall into depression and bent on revenge which also causes the death of the rest of his family. Realizing that he cannot reach Hitogami in his lifetime, Rudeus travels back in time to warn his younger self on what will happen and gives his diary to him before passing away.

Lara Greyrat





Roxy and Lara in the Light Novel



Lara is the first daughter between Rudeus and Roxy. Lara's mischievous personality tends to worry Roxy and will always tell her to apologize or reminds her of manners. This worry remained for years and before Roxy noticed, Lara has grown up to which Roxy believes that Lara will eventually calm down just like she did at her age. Roxy is also aware that Lara and her future role in the battle against Hitogami and would worry what will happen to her afterwards but later thought that worrying about it is pointless
 so Roxy would set her up in matchmaking sessions or even introduce jobs to her but these had no effect on Lara. When Lara decides to suddenly go on a journey, Roxy is the most worried of Lara that she repeatedly glances at the window that Lara might return.

Lily Greyrat

The Second daughter between Rudeus and Roxy. She's an airhead and has no interest in anything other than Magic tools and Magic Items. She would later join Zanoba's company and inherit the
Magic Armor
 research from her father, in addition to the production of an All-Purpose Magic Armor. Lily also has topographical disorientation, making her prone to getting lost even when walking back home. She later moves out of her parents' home and into her own place, but still resides in Ranoa.

Rokari Migurdia

Her mother. Roxy thought her mother saw her as a burden but when she visited her parents after the mana disaster, Roxy viewed her as someone who truly cares. Her parents would explain how difficult it was for them to learn to speak vocally. Yet, they did it because they did not want Roxy to feel alone. They didn't want her to leave the tribe, but was not against it when Roxy decided to explore the world as they themselves know she could never truly feel like she belongs in the tribe. When Roxy returns home and Rokari brought up Rudeus as a potential partner, Roxy blushes and dismisses the idea. When Roxy and Rudeus brought Lara to visit her grandparents and discovers that she retains the tribe's telepathy ability, Roxy suggest to leave Lara with her grandparents so she can has a sense of belonging.

Rowin Migurdia

Her father. Roxy thought her father saw her as a burden but when she visited after the mana disaster, Roxy viewed him as someone who loves her, albeit overprotective. Her parents would explain how difficult it was for them to learn to speak vocally. Yet, they did it because they did not want Roxy to feel alone. They didn't want her to leave the tribe, but was not against it when Roxy decided to explore the world as they themselves know she could never truly feel like she belongs in the tribe. Rowin is the reason for Roxy's fear of the Superd, as he would often scare her to do things (ex: don't leave the village or they will come eat you) with horrible tales of this demonic tribe eating children. It'd scare Roxy to the point of urination. Growing into adulthood, she still gets nervous while hearing the name Superd or facing Ruijerd. Rowin is shown to be very protective of his daughter; as upon their first meeting, Rudeus suggests Rowin to give Roxy's hand in marriage, the later flat-out refuses. When Roxy and Rudeus brought Lara to visit her grandparents and discovers that she retains the tribe's telepathy ability, Roxy suggest to leave Lara with her grandparents so she can has a sense of belonging.

Claire Latreia

Claire Latreia is Roxy's grandmother in law after being married to Rudeus. Roxy has heard about Claire and her stance towards
Demons
 since she is part of the
Demon Race Expulsion Faction
 and is prepared to be treated poorly when they go to visit the
Latreia Family
 at
Millishion
. However Claire advises her to be careful should their be abnormalities that appear on their children indirectly referring to Lara. But when Lara finds the golden locket Claire lost, she admits that she was mistaken and and tells her Lara is just fine. This caused Roxy to think that she can get along with Claire even though she hasn't known her for long and may never meet again after her meeting

Sylphiette Greyrat

Roxy and Sylphiette in the Anime
Sylphiette telling Roxy when her child will be born
Roxy and Sylphiette in the Light Novel
1/3

Sylphiette first heard of Roxy from Rudeus whom he regards with respect and praise that made Sylphiette jealous. When Rudeus informs her that he wants to make Roxy his second wife, Sylphiette is initially silent but after Roxy is about to leave, Sylphiette stops her and despite Roxy admitting she has ulterior motives for sleeping with Rudeus, Sylphiette accepts her to be Rudeus' second wife after admitting of being jealous of her but sees her as someone who loves Rudeus.

In the timeline where Rudeus does not exist, Roxy trains Sylphiette as her apprentice and like Sylphiette, she never marries.

Eris Greyrat

Roxy and Sylphiette welcoming Eris in the Light Novel
Roxy and Eris in the Light Novel
1/2

Roxy once applied to be the tutor of Eris but was declined and later recognizes who she is when Rudeus tells her and Sylphy of her plan to make Eris her third wife to which Roxy intends to respect.
 When meeting Eris for the first time, Roxy is shuddered by Eris' endowed figure like Sylphy and they later joined Eris into rescuing Rudeus who is
battling Orsted
 and after things settle down, she welcomes Eris to be part of their family.

Friends

Bloody Kant

A adventurer that she met in her village when she was young, she become her first master, training Roxy in the most basic magic and telling her stories about the world, after giving to Roxy her first wand, symbol of her graduation, she left the village. Roxy met her again in Asura kingdom, after helping her and before Roxy departs, Bloody Kant gave her old hat to her.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Elinalise Dragonroad

She met Elinalise when she started to searching Rudeus and his family, they became good friends. She would get embarrassed when Elinalise was so comfortable with "the deed" with random people in the places they stayed on their search for Zenith and the other Greyrats after the teleportation incident.

After becoming Rudeus's second wife, Roxy would seek Elinalise for advice on bedroom techniques.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Tallhand

Teleport Incident
 where they begin the search at the
Demon Continent
 since she knows the place. During their journey, Roxy would intervene on the fights between Tallhand and Elinalise that would eventually lead to his aversion towards groups to diminish

Others

Jinas Halfas

Jinas became Roxy's teacher when she was studying at
Ranoa Magic Academy
 after reaching Advanced Rank Water Magic and later progresses to become a Saint Rank Water Magician. Jinas and Roxy would also argue with each other and after Roxy graduated from the the academy, she left to travel without saying anything to Jinas.

Pax Shirone





Roxy punishing Pax in the Anime



He was her student when she worked in the kingdom of Shirone, after training Rudeus, she was disappointed by the growth of Pax. When she finds him again years later, she discovers that her attitude against him hurts him greatly. Pax had an obsession with Roxy when he was young.

Roxys Dream
===========

Roxys Dream
 is the 103rd chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Roxy Migurdia

Summary

Roxy wakes up from her dream of being teacher and going home to the man of his dreams and considers the dream to be bliss as she once again faces the reality of surviving the Teleport Labyrinth while recalling how she got separated from her party for accidentally stepping into a Teleportation Circle. Roxy continues to explore the Labyrinth as she fights her way through near endless Monsters but she eventually runs out of Mana and is cornered while still longing for her dream to come true of having a family like Paul and
Zenith
 until...

Rude Mercenary Company
======================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Rude Mercenary Company
 (
ルード傭兵団
,

Rūdo yōhei-dan
)
 is an organization in
Sharia
 established by
Aisha Greyrat
 and
Linia Dedoldia
.

Background

In
K427
, the Rude Mercenary Company was founded by Aisha and Linia in order to find a way for her to pay off Linia's debt to
Rudeus
 when he bought her from slave dealers. Since she was useless at house work, causing discord within the
Greyrat Family
, they needed to find another way for her to pay off her debt. Monopolizing on her charisma to attract people and using the start up money given to her by Rudeus, with Aisha managing her, the two were able to create a company.

The Rude Mercenary Company provides mercenary jobs such as hiring bodyguards, it is also a recruiting ground for able people to run
Zanoba
's doll stores, and the
ORSTED Corporation
.

Uniform

The Rude Mercenary Company Uniform is a gloomy black coat with a yellow rat embroidered on the back. It was designed and implemented by Aisha, after getting advice from
Nanahoshi Shizuka
, to help build solidarity within the group.

Employees





Aisha, Linia and Pursena in the Rude Mercenary Company



President:
Rudeus Greyrat

Advisor and Vice President:
Aisha Greyrat

Consultant:
Silent Sevenstar

Captain:
Linia Dedoldia

Vice Captain:
Pursena Adoldia

Company Employee: 50+ people

Subsidiary: Part of the
ORSTED Corporation

Sponsors

Nanahoshi Shizuka

Cliff Grimoire

Zanoba

Headquarters

Sharia
 (Main Headquarters)

Asura Kingdom
 Branch Office

Millishion
 Branch Office

King Dragon Kingdom Branch Office

Trivia

It was a company originally founded using Linia's charismatic ability to attract people and Aisha's ability for management.

Zanoba created the Portrait of Rudeus in the main headquarters, the Portrait is noted by Rudeus to be over-exaggerated in beauty to the point where Rudeus could not recognize the person in the portrait.

References

Rudeus
======

Redirect to:
Rudeus Greyrat

Rudeus Greyrat
==============

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Information

Chronology

Relationships

Powers and Abilities

Gallery

Future

It's no good to overestimate me. Victory is something that you grasp by always being modest, you know?

- Rudeus Greyrat

Rudeus Greyrat
 (
ルーデウス・グレイラット
,

Rūdeusu Gureiratto
)
 is the main protagonist of
Mushoku Tensei
. He was an overweight 34-year-old Japanese NEET who is reincarnated into another world after being hit by a truck whilst saving
some

kids
. Realizing he wasted away his previous life, he resolves to live this new one to its fullest and the series revolves around how he impacts his new world all whilst slowly growing out of his reclusive ways.

Appearance

Rudeus stands at around average height (175cm), has a muscular body despite being a magician, and his looks weren't that poor when his family members are asked. He was born with light brown hair and green eyes. However, he later has
Kishirika Kishirisu
 switch out both of his original eyes for
demon eyes
, causing them to be heterochromatic. Like his father,
Paul
, Rudeus also has a mole underneath his left eye and follows his ponytail hairstyle.

He is also always seen wearing gray robes but rarely covers his head during his time as an
adventurer
. At a young age, he is careless about the outfit he wears due to traveling the
Demon Continent
. He has worn the same gray robes when he entered
Ranoa Magic Academy
 which has many cuts and hems from his countless battles that makes him look like a delinquent. During his 20's, he begins to pay more attention to the clothes he wears that even
Perugius Dola
 mentions that he started to wear some decent clothes.

Following his second fight with
Orsted
 and later the final battle against
Hitogami's
 faction, Rudeus' hair temporarily lost its color from mana exhaustion. Fortunately, in both cases, the roots were unaffected, causing his hair to grow back to normal over time.

Personality

Because of his experience from his former life, Rudeus is careful not to get carried away and become arrogant. As a result, he is extremely self-aware and humble because he does not want to revert to his old self.
 After reincarnation he is more willing to be kind, helping his friends and protecting
his family
 whenever needed, where in the past he would have scoffed. Due to being considered a genius, who is capable in many fields at a young age, people have high expectations of him. Rudeus is also very polite to others, often making them uncomfortable especially to those who knows of his father's notorious reputation.

Having the morals of his past life, he hesitates with the thought of killing someone. He also has a calm personality who never lets go of his smile no matter how much abuse or violence he went through but he displays aggression and blood lust to anyone threatening his family. As a descendant of the Notos
Greyrat Family
 who likes pretty girls and big breasts, and also by influence from his previous secluded life, he is extremely perverted that he tends to touch his wives even in public, but he never makes a move on anyone other than his wives. He is also loyal to his friends that he always takes care of them to a great extent. As such, Rudeus is quite feared but is respected and loved by the people of
Sharia
 and to some extent even the most famous or powerful
beings
 of the Human World either fears or respect him.

Apart from carelessness in his outfit, Rudeus also loves cleanliness that he remodeled one of the rooms of his
house
 in Sharia to be a huge bathroom which is only made by the upper nobles of Human Kingdoms and he also bathes almost everyday.

Even with very high
magic
 capacity and high potential in battle, he often lacks the confidence to fight his enemy and his legs trembles when confronted in battle
 but manages to overcome this after surviving his
first battle
 against Orsted whose killing intent is significantly intense compared to what he encountered afterwards even when fighting against a
Red Dragon
.
 When facing a stronger opponent he knows he cannot defeat, he prefers to talk himself out of battles which also caused him to earn various titles related to this.

Rudeus also greatly values his family and friends that it affects him greatly when he is in bad terms with them like when he had a squabble with Paul
 and when Roxy forgotten him when they reunited at the
Teleportation Labyrinth
 that he threw up on both occasions.

Background

Rudeus was a 34-year-old NEET otaku in his previous life. As the fourth child of five children in a well-off family, he was praised as a bright student in elementary school considering his age. In junior high, he joined the computer club and and saved up his allowance to assemble his very own computer. However, he was so focused on tinkering his computer that he neglected his studies, causing him to fail the entrance exam of his preferred high school. As a result, the only school that would take him was a low-quality one, filled to the brim with delinquents.

Upon entering his new high school, he soon became a victim of severe bullying following an incident: he stood up to an upclassman who cut in front of him during lunch. However, this person then proceeded to beat him up, hang him up naked, nicknamed him "Pencil Dick", and took and distributed pictures of him in his state all whilst no one, not even the teachers, came to his aid. This event caused him to drop out of school and isolate himself at home, having developed a phobia toward the outside world as a whole. His family tried to encourage him to go back to school, but he brushed them off. There was at least one classmate whom he had a good relationship with who came by everyday to deliver homework. However, he pushed him away too when he also tried to get him to return to school. Now truly alone, he slipped futher into being a Hikikomori as time went on, taking an interest in some subjects on occassion only to quickly drop them once he saw that there was already someone better at it than him.

He continued being a shut-in, living off his family, for twenty years. However, this unhealthy lifestyle finally came to an end after both of his parents had passed away from old age and he refused to even attend their funeral. This ended up being the last straw for his siblings, prompting them to kick him out of the family home and disown him. Homeless and penniless, he wandered the streets aimlessly while reflecting on his life until he came across
three

high
-
schoolers
 arguing on a road. Seeing a truck heading toward them at high speed, he mustered all of his strength to run over and managed to push one of them away to safety. Unfortunately, this caused him to get hit instead, killing him. The next time he opened his eyes, he found himself reincarnated as the newborn Rudeus Greyrat in the
Human World
. Realizing he had been given a second chance, he declared he would live this new life to its fullest.

Achievements

These are the current achievements that Rudeus gained through his adventure, action, and training:

Capable of using unofficial God Class magic (Nuclear Explosion).

Water Emperor Class Magician.

Saint Class Magician in Fire, Earth, Wind,
Healing
, and
Detoxification Magic
.

Voiceless Incantation with attack magic

Conquerer of Legendary Labyrinth

Destroyed an Immortal Demon King

The Dragon God's Subordinate.

Hero (by defeating
Atofe
).

Seven Great Powers
 (Quagmire) by defeating
Kalman III
.

Trivia

Rudeus' name before reincarnation remains unknown. Even when mentioned by
Future Rudeus
, it is muted out.

Rudeus can speak multiple languages (Magic God Language, Beast God Language, Fighting God, Human Language) by the time he was 9. Which he learned when he tutored
Eris
. He wanted to learn Heaven God and Sea God languages but could not find any learning material. He managed to find a book from the sea race in volume 7.

Rudeus and his three wives have a strand of cowlick (ahoge) on top of their heads.

He named his right and left leg Tindalos and Baskerville. He also named his right arm Hulk and his left arm Hercules.

Currently, Rudeus is both founder and sole member of the religion he created which has 3 Goddesses.

Rudeus founded a fan club for his sister (
Norn
), he was eventually kicked out three days later due to him taking a bath together with her.

All of Rudeus' wives ""seem"" to get pregnant right before he goes on a journey to somewhere.

He has a tendency to always overestimate his opponent.

Incidentally, although he is Emperor Ranked in Water Magic, he has mostly used Earth Magic in combat.

After the incident where
Hitogami
 attempted to have
Roxy
 killed with an infected rat, rats are deemed top priority enemies in Rudeus' household. They must be killed on sight, corpse incinerated while wearing gloves and face masks, and have their ashes disposed outside of the city
.

Rudeus was given the title "Hero" for defeating Demon Kings.

Initially he refused to call himself a hero when
Badigadi
 mentioned it, but accepted the title later on after defeating
Atofe
.

Even though Rudeus is unable to wear
Battle Aura
, he has attained a Saint-class combat ability of a swordsman with his 『Magic Armor Mk II B 』 and God-class power with 『Magic Armor Mk I 』(The latter one was stated by Atofe).

A
Miko from the future
 who had the ability to control time revived Rudeus into his current reincarnated body.

He does not feel fear towards
Orsted
, and strangely, neither do his children.

Rudeus was born with the "
Laplace Factor
". This means that his development as a fetus was influenced for him to become a potential vessel for the Demon God
Laplace
 to be reincarnated in, resulting in his abnormally large
mana
 capacity. This is also why it was this body that he was reincarnated in, as it did not have a soul of its own and would have otherwise been
stillborn
.

His hair also turned white due to mana strain but his hair has a little bit of color left so he was able to restore his hair color than losing it like Sylphy (from the battle of Orstred)

Rudeus likes to joke he "has two wives and a husband and children," referring to
Eris
 as his "husband." He also jokes that instead of Eris being a part of his harem, he is part of hers, including
Pursena
 and
Linia
 as her "other wives".
