Seven Great Powers
==================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!


https://mushokutensei.fandom.com/wiki/File:MT-AN-S1-E15-WEBM-01.webm



Seven Great Powers motif in the
Anime



The
Seven Great Powers
 (
七大列強
,

Nana Dai-Rekkyō
)
 refers to the seven strongest warriors in the world, a selection of seven people that came to exist following the end of the
Second Human-Demon War
.

History

Establishment

When the Second Great Human-Demon War came to a conclusion, a person known as the
Technique God
 came up with the name. At that time, Technique God was considered to be one of the strongest people in the world. Technique God selected six more people and declared them to be the strongest in the world.

Post-Laplace War

The title of the Seven Great Powers was well known until the Laplace War. All original Seven Powers participated in the Laplace War, with the exception of Technique God. Among them, three were killed, one went missing, and another was sealed away. The Dragon God was the only one who came out of the War with a definite living-status. After hundred of years, with those at the bottom swapping spots and the top four having unknown status to the people, the title fell out of use.

Monuments





A Seven Great Powers monument in the Holy Sword Highway,
Millis Continent



In order to spread the name of the seven strongest across the world, stone monuments were scattered around the world in places where
mana
 concentration was high. The monument is of knee-height and a single character "7" is inscribed at the middle in the Fighting God language. The seven respective motifs of the Great Power surround the "7" character starting with the rank one motif being situated above the "7" character then sequentially going clockwise are the rest of the Great Power's motif. The stone automatically updates itself when a new Power enters the ranks with their respective motif.

The Seven Great Powers

Status

Trivia

It was believed the Technique God created this system so that he could find people capable of defeating him.

After the
Laplace War
, people began to doubt whether the Technique God even really existed at all.

Even though the Seven Power holders are said to be the absolute strongest of the world, there is further division within the group. The first four ranks (1-4) are referred as the "upper" ranks and the remaining three ranks (5-7) are referred to as the "lower" ranks. There is a very large difference in strength between the fourth (Demon God) and the fifth (Death God).

The ranking only changes when someone on the ranking is defeated or dead. As a result, the ranks are not directly correlated to their combat prowess.

The Technique God holds the #1 position despite
Orsted
 being stronger, because he is missing and not defeated.

Randolph Marianne
 is said to be weaker than the Sword God, Water God and North God due to staying out of combat for a significant amount of time
, yet he still holds a higher rank.

Prior to Demon Dragon King Laplace being split into two different beings, the Seven Great Powers ranking system had not yet been established. As such, Laplace as the Demon Dragon King is not part of the Seven Great Powers, yet takes two separate seats as two different beings after the creation of the ranking system.

Rudeus Greyrat is the only person who does not have the title of "God".

Notes

References

Seven Great World Powers

Seven Great Powers

Seven Knights of Asura
======================

The
Seven Knights of Asura
 (アスラ七騎士
Asura Nana Kishi
) are seven knights who have sworn absolute allegiance to Queen of
Asura Kingdom
 -
Ariel Anemoi Asura
 herself. Even among knights they possessed a special position and independent movement was permitted to some extent. Though they have pledged their loyalty to Ariel, most of them are unrelated to the Asura Kingdom, having been gathered from outside the Royal Capital or from foreign lands.
 The Seven Knights are scouted by the Queen Ariel and the Seven Knights' leader
Luke Notos Greyrat
 themselves. Social class is not an interference in entering this order, the members range from commoners and lower ranked nobles to high ranking officials.

Members

Leader

The
King's Dagger
,
Luke Notos Greyrat

The
Three Knights of the Left
 (左翼の三騎士
Sayoku no San-kishi
) are three knights who are charged with offense.

The
King’s Greatsword
,
Sándor von Grandeur

The
King’s Halberd
,
Oswald Eurus Greyrat

The
King’s Hound
,
Ghislaine Dedoldia

Three Knights of the Right

The
Three Knights of the Right
 (右翼の三騎士
Uyoku no San-kishi
) are three knights whose main job is to protect the King.

The
King's Gatekeeper
,
Doga

The
King’s Rampart
,
Sylvester Ifrit

The
King's Greatshield
,
Isolte Cruel

References

Sharia
======

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!





The Magic City of Sharia in the Anime



The Magic City of Sharia
 is a human city located at the Kingdom of Ranoa, the largest country of the northern region in the
Central Continent
 where Rudeus settles down along with his family after he became a student at the Ranoa Magic Academy.

Geography





The Magic City of Sharia during Spring



"Far to the north of
here
, is a country called Ranoa."

Roxy
 to
Rudeus

Sharia is located at the northern part of the Central Continent where it frequently snows throughout the year. It is also bordered by the Neris Kingdom in the northwest, Basherant Kingdom in the northeast which are part of the Magic Triumvirate together with the Kingdom of Ranoa. To the south is the
Asura Kingdom
 where it is separated by the Red Wyrm Upper Jaw mountain range and at the far west is the
Holy Land of Swords
.

Background

Aside from the Magician Guild Headquarters being located here, Sharia is mainly built for magical research where the Magic Triumvirate of Ranoa, Neris and Basherant poured tremendous amount of resources to build a grand city at the edge of Ranoa. Technically, Sharia is part of Ranoa but it is intentionally built at the border of Ranoa near the other 2 triumvirates where the Ranoa Magic Academy, Magicians Guild Headquarters and Neris Magical Implements Workshop are merged into the city which makes Sharia the center of the Magic Triumvirate Nations. While the Ranoa Kingdom alone wields the same kind of influence and power as the Shirone Kingdom in the south, the combined forces of the Magic Triumvirate is considered to be the hidden fourth power of the
Human World
.

Economy

Aside from the trading of magical goods between the 3 nations, the Magician Guild have monopoly on the sale and production of magic resistant bricks that are designed to repel mana and even withstand a large-scale magical attack. Due to the magical bricks to be very expensive, even for a wealthy nation like Asura only uses them for its capital and not even the Holy Kingdom of Milis nor Dragon King Realm uses them for their walls. As such, the process of their creation is a well guarded-secret.

Areas

When looking at a map, Sharia's design is based from the city of
Millishion
 in the Holy Country of Millis,
Millis Continent
. Technically, Sharia is part of Ranoa Kingdom but parts of the city are territories of the other nations of the Magic Triumvirate which was done intentionally since the main purpose of Magic Triumvirate alliance and building of Sharia is for research and magical advancement and everything about magic is stored in Sharia.

Student District

Ranoa Magic Academy, the centerpiece of the Student District
Sharia viewed from the
Greyrat House
 Gate in the Student District
1/2

Located at the east, the Student District is centered by the Ranoa Magic Academy and is surrounded its facilities and lodgings for students.

Workshop District

Located at the west, the Workshop District are full of artisan workshops and dwellings of its crafters with the Neris Magical Implements Workshop is at the district's center.

Lodging District

Located at the south, the Lodging District which welcomes those entering Sharia, including adventurers and has different kinds of inns to accommodate them depending on their rank.

Commerce District

Rudeus and Sylphiette at the Commerce District
A Commercial District Meat Store in the Anime
A Commercial District Fruit Store in the Anime
A Commercial District Furniture Store in the Anime
A Commercial District Kitchenware and Dining ware Store in the Anime
A Commercial District Clothing Store in the Anime
A restaurant in the Commerce District
A Slave Market in the Commerce District
The Commerce District during a festival
A restaurant in the Commerce District
1/10

Located at the north, the Commerce District where stores are lined up side by side separated by the large and winding main road with the Trader's Guild nestled in the middle.
 The Commerce District is also the location of various cafe and restaurants for nobility, reputable Slave Markets, stores for clothes and other necessities.

Points of Interest

Ranoa Magic Academy

Ranoa Magic Academy Emblem in the Manga
1/2

Ranoa Magic Academy is the largest magic university in the world that surpass even the professors of the Asura Royal Academy that occupies a vast tract of land in Sharia that was built for the purpose of magic research.

Magician Guild Headquarters

The Magician Guild Headquarters is located at the center of Sharia where all the magical research are kept such as production of
Magic Tools
 and Scrolls. One of the heads of the Magician Guild is also the principal Ranoa Magic Academy and because of this, graduates of the academy are granted membership and ranks in the Magician Guild depending on their contributions or research submitted while at the academy.

Rankings

Unlike the Adventure Guild's ranking system which progresses on the number of missions completed, the rankings granted by the Magician Guild is more focused on the recognitions and merits of a member's achievement or magical research accomplishments.

Adventure Guild

Like in most major cities, Sharia has an Adventure Guild branch located at the Lodging District. During times of emergency, such as an attack of a Demon Lord, the leaders of the Magic Nations also calls on Adventurers to respond to such emergencies to buy time while their main forces assemble to subjugate the threat.

Slave Market






A Sharia Slave Market in the Manga



Buying and selling slaves is an accepted practice in the
Human World
 although in the
Millis Continent
 and the southern Central Continent, it is a quiet affair but in the nations of the Northern Central Continent like Ranoa, it is legalized and key part of the economy. Sharia has 5 Slave Markets located at the Commerce District where slaves of most races are sold to be bodyguards or even cannon fodders during war.

Rude Mercenary Company Headquarters

The Rude Mercenary Company is a subsidiary of the
ORSTED Corporation
 where its main headquarters is located at the Third Street of the Lodging District and its members are known for their uniform of black coats with a yellow rat emblem which is their symbol of unity along with their manners. Due to Sharia being relatively peaceful,
Aisha
 established the company to be a bodyguard business that is contracted by the Knights of Ranoa, head of the Magician Guild and the Magic Tool Workshop after 14-15 from the start of business and serves as the neutral faction among them.

Magic

In terms of magic, Sharia has knowledge of most spells up to the King Rank in Attack Magic that are held by ranking members of the Magician Guild and taught in the Academy. But in terms of Divine Magic and Barrier Magic, the
Milis Religion
 owns the rights and forbids the teaching the magic until
K420
 where Sharia is granted permission to only teach the basics of Barrier Magic so instead the class is more focused on how to break through barriers.

While teachers of the academy can use and teach Intermediate Barrier Magic, it was illegal to do so and if they got caught, the
Order of the Temple
 would hunt them down and put them on trial.

Military






Unnamed Leader of Sharia's Knight Group(left)



Sharia is protected by a small unit of soldiers from the Magic Triumvirate stationed in the city to protect their magical assets but in times of emergencies that could result to incalculable damage, the rulers of the triumvirate dispatches their knight groups to intercept the threat that is lead by an unnamed captain for the knights stationed at the city.
 The Order of the Temple stands in direct opposition of the Ranoa Magic Academy and everything it represented but are not willing to start a war over it.

Diplomacy

In terms of relationships with other kingoms, Sharia aside from their agreement with barrier and detoxification magic, is neutral to their dealings with the Holy Kingdom of Milis despite the opposition of the Order of the Temple. Due to their focus on magical research, Sharia also values
Rudeus
 from an alternate future as long as he is useful to them even if it could lead to war against Asura Kingdom and Milis Kingdom.

References

Sharpen Your Fangs
==================

Sharpen Your Fangs
 is the 88th chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Summary

Eris finds a peninsula where she spends most of her day practice her swings everyday, eat when she's hungry and returns to the Sword God Style Main Dojo afterwards as memories of her battle against Orsted continue to linger. On her return to the main dojo, Eris encounters Auber which turned to a battle.

Shierra
=======

This article
lacks information
 and requires expansion. Please
expand this page
 to include missing information to help improve the article.

Shierra was one of the key members of Paul's search party. She was caught with her sister
Vierra
 in the mana calamity, And helps
Paul
 to find all the missing people.

Appearance

Shierra is a woman with short hair covering her eyes.

Personality

Shierra was a timid girl that had androphobia due to being enslaved and raped after being caught in the
teleportation incident
.

Background

She was caught in the teleport incident and was enslaved by some bandits with her sister until Paul and his group rescue them.

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Power and Abilities

She was never shown to fight in the series, but she was acting as the party's magician before
Rudeus
 replaced her in the Teleport Labyrinth. It's known that she was able to use intermediate level
detoxification magic
.

Shinohara Akihito
=================

Redirect to:
Shinohara Akito

Shinohara Akito
===============

SPOILER ALERT!

This page contains
spoilers!
  Read at your own risk.

Information

Story

Relationships

Appearance

Shinohara Akito
 (
篠原 秋人
,

Shinohara Akito
)
 is
Nanahoshi Shizuka
's friend and one of the people
Rudeus Greyrat
 attempted to save from being hit by a truck in his previous life. Despite never appearing in the main story, he is a pivotal character who is revealed in the final chapter to be partly responsible for Rudeus and Nanahoshi being transported to this world.

Appearance

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Personality

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Background

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Plot

Volume 22 - Young Man Period - Organization Chapter

He did not actually appear in the volume, but was mentioned by Nanahoshi. Nanahoshi created a hypothesis that he was also summoned to this world, but was summoned into the future where he saved a weak fated Miko that was destined to die. That Miko had the power to rewind an object's time and Akihito possibly saved that Miko and met with Orsted as Nanahoshi did to create a device that would amplify the Miko's power to change the past. If the future is changing the past, the future would take precedence and be the reason why Nanahoshi can't go back to her world since she may have been summoned by Akihito during the Metastasis event so that she can create the Multiverse teleportation device and go back to her world with him in the future. Since her future self that went back with Akihito can't exist if she went back to her world in the present, Akihito's influence interfered with the device when she was attempting to go back home.

In Rudeus's inner monologue, he summarized the details of the proposed future. Akihito collaborated with Orsted and was able to determine the reason why he would be unable to win against Hitogami. Akihito altered the past with the saved Miko's amplified power which may have been the reason Hitogami saw a vision of Rudeus's descendants with Orsted and an unknown man killing Hitogami and that the unknown man might be Akihito. Then in order to go back home, he caused the Metastasis event that summoned Nanahoshi so that she would create the device that would send them back to their world.

Epilogue: Prologue Zero

In the most recent life of the
Rebirth Miko
, he was summoned by magicians using a magic formation that tapped into the Miko's powers as a Hero to save the Kingdom from war. After being summoned, he was the only person in all of the Rebirth Miko's lives to have ever asked for her name. Since a Miko are only called Miko as their name and lose their actual names (Unless they are Royalty), the Rebirth Miko is a special case that has remembered her name to be Lilia. Since Lilia the Miko was the only one capable of understanding Akihito, she was assigned to be his interpreter and freed from her usual constraints as a Miko. He without knowing has made Lilia fall in love with him. During the battle with an enemy Kingdom, he was instantly beheaded and by the time the Lilia found him, 24 hours have already passed and it was too late for her to revive him. In her despair and wishing with all of her power, Lilia opened a rift in time and space in the past so that Akihito and her could not just live, but to live together. That rift created an opening for Rudeus's soul which happened to be near Akihito in the other world to be reincarnated. More of Lilia's power was exhausted to culminate in a rift that caused the Mana Calamity that summoned Nanahoshi to the world. As a result of Akihito meeting Lilia in a previous loop, he caused a change in the world that resulted in the events of what happened in Mushoku Tensei and the exhausting of Lilia's Rebirth Miko powers and Lilia's last life.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Power and Abilities

Like
Nanahoshi
, due to being from Earth, Shinohara is just an ordinary person who cannot use magic.

.

Rudeus Greyrat
 to be reincarnated into this world.

 to be transported to this world, causing the

 in the process.

Quotes

.

Etymology

Shinohara
 means "dwarf bamboo" (篠) (
shino
) and "field, plain" (原) (
hara
).

Akito
 means "autumn" (秋) (
aki
) and "person" (人) (
to
).

Trivia

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Shirotaka
=========

Shirotaka
 (シロタカ, lit. "White Hawk"), sometimes also spelled as
Sirotaka
, is a Japanese illustrator and character designer best known for their work on
Mushoku Tensei
 as the illustrator for the light novel.

Career

Shirotaka gained initial prominence through uploading illustrations on
Pixiv
 during a brief period in 2011. They made their major debut in January of 2014 as the illustrator for the light novel series
Mushoku Tensei: Isekai Ittara Honki Dasu
 (無職転生 - 異世界行ったら本気だす) written by
Rifujin na Magonote
. Other than Mushoku Tensei, they have also worked on the light novel
Netogehai Akuma no Negai Kanaemasu
 (ネトゲ廃悪魔の願い叶えます) written by Ubune Coma, which was also released in June of the same year.

In 2015, their career as an accomplished illustrator was followed by another light novel
Ore no Ibukuro wa Kanojo ni Nigirareteiru
 (俺の胃袋は彼女に握られている) written by Mochitsuki Nozomu. And in 2016, they worked on
Gyakuten Shoukan: Urasettei made Shiritsukushita Isekai ni Gakkou Goto Shoukan Sarete
 (逆転召喚～裏設定まで知り尽くした異世界に学校ごと召喚されて), a light novel series written by Mikawa Ghost.

They have also been credited as the base character designer for the
Manga
 adaptations of the Mushoku Tensei light novels, and for the drafts of the
Anime
.

List of Works

Title

Media

Position

Published

Mushoku Tensei: Isekai Ittara Honki Dasu

Light Novel

Sieghardt Saladin Greyrat
=========================

Redirect to:
Sieghart Saladin Greyrat

Sieghart Saladin Greyrat
========================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Information

Relationships

Sieghart Saladin Greyrat
 is the fourth child and second son of
Rudeus Greyrat
 and the second child he had with his first wife
Sylphiette Greyrat
. He is the younger brother of
Lucy Greyrat
 and the half-brother of
Lara Greyrat
,
Ars Greyrat
,
Lily Greyrat
 and
Christina Greyrat
. He is the main protagonist of Jobless Oblige.

Appearance

Sieghart has the same emerald-green hair color as
Sylphiette
 before the
Teleport Incident
 and also has a face similar to
Rudeus
.

By the time Sieg enters the
Asura Royal Academy
, he is confronted with soldiers until he cleared the misunderstanding that he is not a
Superd
. Due to his large physique and because of his green hair, he appears to be intimidating which causes some people to avoid contact with him.

In his middle age, Sieg's face has countless scars, even his armor and sword shafts bore numerous wounds, the physical representation of "Witness to a thousand battles".

Personality

Unlike his sister
Lara
 who is very stoic and hardly cries and his brother
Ars
 who cries whenever
Rudeus
 tries to hold him, Sieg is a very normal baby.

As he grew up, he admired the super heroes in the stories told by
his father
 and tried to become one himself. He has a strong sense of justice and moonlights at night in a disguise to perform heroic deeds. He is very much like his father and struggles with his own purpose in life during his adolescence as he is unemployed.

He has a habit of shouting out his name before fighting his enemies, something the
North God
, his master, also does.

Background

Sieghart is the second child of Rudeus Greyrat and Sylpiette. Before Sieg was born,
Perugius Dola
 tells Rudeus and Sylphy that should they have a son, bring him to Perugius to give him a name.

In order establish closer ties with the
Greyrat Family
, Queen
Ariel Anemoi Asura
 and Rudeus agrees to have an arranged marriage with their children, making
Ars Greyrat
 to be the first candidate until Ars marries
Aisha Greyrat
, which makes Sieg, the second son be the next candidate to be married to
Sariel Anemoi Asura
 even though they have never met until they enter the Asura Royal Academy.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Plot

Redundancy Let's Make an Automaton!

In the last chapter,
Kalman III
 takes Sieghart Greyrat as disciple.

Jobless Oblige

Sieghart meets
Pax Jr
. and
Sariel Anemoi Asura
 in Asura school, in the graduatasks, Pax Jr. asks him if he can help him build a kingdom, but he can't answer him because he thinks that
Rudeus
 needs him to marry
Sariel
 and strengthening his ties with Asura Kingdom, and in the end, he returns to Ranoa, being unemployed for a year, but in the night acts as a "Moonlight Knight", helping people and defeating criminals, one night Rudeus finds him, and after a talk, he decides to help Pax Jr., leaving Ranoa.

Decades later,
Pax Jr
. builds his kingdom and Sieg becomes the left hand of Pax Jr., as well as his strongest knight. He becomes the 5th «
Seven Great World Powers
», taking the place of Death God
Randolph Marianne
.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Power and Abilities

Even though when he was just a child, he was actually very strong. He could pick up really heavy boxes with much ease. He was also very intelligent as he has said that he is in the middle of the highest ranks in academics.

North God Sword Style

At a young age, he was taught the North God sword style by none other than the current North God,
Kalman III
. He has said that he may be the strongest student of his year in Ranoa Magic Academy, if not the strongest in the school.  Awarded rank of North King by Kalman III at age 15.

Aside from swordsmanship, Kalman III also teaches Sieg various techniques in hiding, sneak attacks, tracking targets despite these are from the different factions of the North God Style. Kalman III is versed to all these techniques being the North God that he used to hate these techniques outside his faction but after fighting Rudeus, he changed his mind and also teaches these techniques to Sieg

Otherworlder Bloodline

As a descendant of
Rudeus Greyrat
, a reincarnated person whose soul originates from another world, Sieghart is immune to the effects of the curse placed on
Orsted
 that induces hatred towards the Dragon God in all beings that originate from this world. He is also immune to
Hitogami's
 ability to cause people to have automatic trust towards him.

Swallow

"North God Style Mystery "Swallow"" is a counter technique that crushes an opponent's fist at the expense of the user's fingers. Sieghart uses this technique when he is facing an opponent he cannot win cleanly.

Moonlight Split

"North God Style Mystery!"

-Sieg preparing to use Moonlight Split

Sieg swings his Moon Glitter from the ground to an upward direction at high speed and overwhelmingly destructive manner that causes a massive shockwave causing anyone in the surrounding area to be swept away. The momentum then turns into a twin tornado that destroys even buildings on its path.

Magic Abilities

Sieg is an Advanced Rank in
Healing Magic
 but since this rank cannot restore severed limbs, Sieg also carries Scrolls of Healing with him.

Equipment

Moon Glitter

Unnamed Sword

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

Became the next Death God, the fifth rank of the
Seven Great World Powers
.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Quotes

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Trivia

Sylphiette
 had three dreams involving Sieghart being chased by a shadow. He was safe in two dreams but in the last dream, Sylphy was unable to save him.

His name was originally named Sieghart Greyrat, but
Perugius
 gave him the additional name of Saladin.

He is the first child that
Rudeus
 was anxious of because of his green hair and at the time of his birth,
Almanfi
 told him that
Perugius
 wants to meet him, leading him to think that he could be the reincarnation of
Laplace
. He even doubted
Orsted
, who told him that Sieg wasn't Laplace and brought him to
Perugius
.

The doctor, who helped
Sylphiette
 deliver him, had a stiff expression after seeing his hair.

Sieghart Saladin Greyrat/Relationships
======================================

Information

Relationships

Family

Rudeus Greyrat

Rudeus Greyrat is the main protagonist of
Mushoku Tensei
 and is Sieghart's father. As a child, Sieghart listened to his father's stories about 'Cheddarman' and being an ally of justice, values he will still bring way later into his older years. Like many of the kids in the Greyrat family, Sieghart deeply respects him but also believes that his father has no expectations of him. This is because Rudeus raises his children freely which the kids misinterpret as him having no expectation for his children when in truth it's actually the opposite. He is simply too lenient in raising his kids, but he still cares deeply for them especially Sieghart during his time being unemployed at home. Sieghart knows nothing of this and as a result, he tends to avoid his father and only talks to him sparingly. He tries his best to please his father by doing what he thinks his father wants and when he fails, he felt that he disappointed him. Sieghart only knew the truth about his father's intentions and feelings after he and his father had a heart to heart the night before Sieghart leaves Sharia to find Pax.

Sylphiette Greyrat

Slyphiette Greyrat is Sieghart's birth mother.

Lara Greyrat

His sister

Ruijerd Superdia

He calls him Uncle and sees him as a bit stubborn. Because they both have green hair, visiting Ruijerd and
Luicelia
 reassures him that he's normal.

Friends

Pax Jr.

Pax Jr. is the son of the late
King Pax Shirone
 and is Sieghart's best friend. Pax met Sieghart in the Royal Academy of the Asura Kingdom and Pax became his first friend there. They mostly lived their school life together in isolation. After they both graduated, Pax announces that he will return to Kingdom of the Dragon King, receiving some land and eventually developing it to be it's own independent kingdom. Pax asks Sieghart to join him and help him, but Sieghart silently refuses. They then parted ways. After some time, Sieghart decides to find Pax and assist him with his goals, and they reunite again.

Kalman III

Aleksander Ryback, the North God, took Sieghart in as a disciple since a young age. As his master, Sieghart respects him deeply and takes many lessons from him. Sieghart continues to train with him and eventually receives the title of North Emperor.

Sariel Anemoi Asura

Sariel Anemoi Asura is the daughter of Asura Kingdom's queen,
Ariel Anemoi Asura
. Sieghart meets her in the Royal Academy of the Asura Kingdom, and they became friends. Sariel was ordered by her mother to try and marry Sieghart in order to strengthen the ties between the Asuran royal family and the Greyrat family and because of that, Sariel often approaches Sieghart to become close. Sieghart knows about this too and felt that he should marry Sariel, but in the end Sieghart saw her as no more than a friend and didn't marry her.

Navigation

Six-Faced World
===============

The
Six-Faced World
(六面世界
Roku-men Sekai,
 lit. "Hexahedral World") is the setting where
Mushoku Tensei
 takes place. It is a world in hexahedral form where all beings live on its planes. It exists in a die-shaped structure with a total of six faces, each face is constituted of one world ruled by one God each, with another seventh world of nothingness inside the die-structure.

History

In the un-recordable times, before the Six-Faced World was created, there existed the powerful "maker of worlds" simply known as the
God of Creation
 (創造神 -
Sōzō-shin
). He felt he was slowly dying and would not last for much longer, so he tasked himself to create one last world before his time was up. However, he realized he did not have enough power left to build a stable world; the new world that he had created was severely deformed and unbalanced so he decided to create yet another world. It ended up as another distorted world, nonetheless he kept going until he finished making six worlds: the Dragon World, the Demon World, the Beast World, the Ocean World, the Sky World and the Human World, with a seventh Void World of nothingness at the center.

They were all distorted worlds which would soon collapse on its own, so The Creator stuck the six worlds together and was finally able to achieve stability. In this manner he established the Six-Faced World where each world supported the balance of the others. Still not content, The Creator decided to carefully manage the worlds until the inhabitants can settle and stabilize. With his remaining strength, he divided his body into six alter ego's and descended onto their respective worlds.

Soon after, as a result of their divine origins and diligent effort to make their world prosper, the ego's came to be respected as "Gods" by each world's inhabitants. In the Dragon World, it was called the Dragon God; in the Demon World, the Demon God; in the Beast World, the Beast God; in the Ocean World, the Ocean God; in the Sky World, the Sky God; in the Human World, the Human God. At the creation of his new six-sided world, The Creator ceased to exist and from him came the new Gods that came to be known throughout the Six-Faced World.

The Seven Worlds

Dragon World

The
Dragon World
 (龍の世界
Ryū no Sekai
) is the world of dragons ruled by the Dragon God, where the sky and the land are reversed. It was inhabited by a race with enormous power. The
Dragon Race
 were once primitive species who were not able to develop civilization due to their harsh environment and rogue dragons but that soon changed after Human God lent the knowledge of the humans to the Dragon God. The Dragon Race taught inhabitants of the other worlds how to manifest
Battle Aura
.

Demon World

The
Demon World
 (魔の世界
Ma no Sekai
) is the world of demons ruled by the Demon God, full of miasma and noxious mist. It was inhabited races with extraordinary physiques. Similar to the Dragon Race, the
Demon Race
 were once primitive due to their harsh environment where demonic beasts roamed and reliance on their extraordinary bodies, but the world soon changed into an orderly style after the Human God lent the knowledge of the humans to the Demon God. The Demon Race taught inhabitants of the other worlds how to reinforce a weak body in order to use Battle Aura efficiently.

Beast World

The
Beast World
 (獣の世界
Kemono no Sekai
) is the world of beasts ruled by the Beast God, with dense forests and mountains. It was inhabited by races with keen senses and powerful talons. The
Beast Race
 taught inhabitants of the other worlds how to capture and tame monsters and wild beasts.

Ocean World

The
Ocean World
 (海の世界
Umi no Sekai
) is a world of water ruled by the Ocean God. It was teeming with life, inhabited by races with gills, fins and scales. The
Ocean Race
 taught inhabitants of the other worlds how to purify water and methods of storing it.

Sky World

The
Sky World
 (天の世界
Ten no Sekai
) is a world of rocks floating in the sky ruled by the Sky God. It was inhabited by a winged race who flew freely in the sky. The
Sky Race
 taught inhabitants of the other worlds how to study and predict weather.

Human World

The
Human World
 (人の世界
Hito no Sekai
) is a world of flatlands and prairies ruled by the Human God. It is inhabited by a race with weak bodies but brilliant minds. The
Human Race
 taught inhabitants of the other worlds about the importance of reading, writing, communal living, social order et cetera and gave the light of civilization to the races. After the fall of the other five worlds, all the survivors fled to the Human World and settled in their suitable habitats. In this manner, the Human World is now filled with a variety of races.

Void World

The
Void World
 (無の世界
Mu no Sekai
) is a pure white world of nothingness formed when the God of Creation stuck together the six worlds in a die-structure. It later served as the connecting path for moving from one world to another as it is in contact with all the worlds. It is also the channel for summoning and teleport magic. This pocket of space is where
Hitogami
 exists.

Trivia

Earth lies outside the Six-Faced World.

References

Slow Life in the Doldia Village
===============================

Slow Life in the Doldia Village
 (ドルディア村のスローライフ
Dorudia Mura no Surōraifu
) is the fifteenth episode of the
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on October 24, 2021.

Synopsis

Rudeus, Eris, and Ruijerd are welcomed into the Doldia village. Eris is delighted to learn that this village is Ghislaine's hometown, but her brother, Gyes, insults her out as a disgrace to the family, and the two have a tiff. While Rudeus and the others are bewildered by the unpredictable situation, Eris is assigned to teach swordsmanship to Gyes's daughter, Minitona. ......

Plot

TBA

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Ruijerd Superdia

Gyes Dedoldia

Gustav Dedoldia

Minitona Dedoldia

Tersena Adoldia

Holy Beast

Geese Nukadia

Gallus Cleaner

Ghislaine Dedoldia
 (Flashback)

Gal Farion
 (Cameo)

Locations

Millis Continent

Great Forest

Doldia Village

TBA

Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 4

Chapter 9: Slow Life in the Doldia Village.

Chapter 10: The Holy Sword Highway.

Differences with the light novel:

A short scene explaining Ghislaine's ring was cut.

The anime cut the part where it was explained how Rudeus and the others spend their time in the village.

In the light novel, Geese was pardoned after helping the village during the raid and was released.

A short scene where Rudeus tried to learn voice magic was cut.

A short scene where the village was attacked by monsters was cut.

A short scene that explained the tribes of the great forest and how Gyes and Ruijerd developed their friendship relation was cut.

A short scene that explained how the holy beast lived in the sacred tree and that Rudeus was not the hero was cut.

A short scene between Rudeus and Minitona and Tersena before the reconciliation with Eris was cut..

A short scene that explain how Geese met Ruijerd in the past was cut.

The anime add some new scenes.

Gyes trying to leave the building with Minitona after finding out that Eris and the others knew Ghislaine.

The part where Eris tells Gyes about Ghislaine learning magic and other skills is cut, and Rudeus instead tells him later on.

Eris telling Minitona and Tersena about Ghislaine.

Eris training Minitona.

Gyes talking to Minitona after her fight with Eris.

A short scene that explain how a sword man that passed in the village taken care of Ghislaine when she was young.

A final sparring battle between Gyes and Eris before their departure.

Eris and Minitona's fight takes plane onscreen in the anime. Tersena calls Rudeus to stop the fight and Gyes breaks it up, while in the light novel Eris won the fight.

Eris and Minitona's reconciliation takes place offscreen in the light novel but is onscreen in the anime.

Trailer

TVアニメ『無職転生』次回予告⑮：10-24(日)放送第15話「ドルディア村のスローライフ」予告

Gallery

View Gallery

Click here to view the Gallery

Trivia

In the TV version, when Gyes explain to Minitona the past of Ghislaine, they show that both of the eyes of young Ghislaine are normal, even though it is stated that she was born with the magic eye and she didn't obtain it like Rudeus.

This was fixed in the Blu-ray version, with Ghislaine having her magic eye in that scene.

Soldat Heckler
==============

Information

Appearance

Soldat Heckler
 (
ゾルダート・ヘッケラー
,

Zorudāto Hekkerā
)
 is an S-ranked
adventurer
 and the leader of the party
Stepped Leader
.

Appearance

Soldat has blond hair, blue eyes and sharp features like many of the Northern people. He has a muscular build and is tall for an average person.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Personality

Soldat is arrogant, short-tempered, confrontational and tends to speak his mind towards people he interact with. He hates people who hide their true thoughts and put on a mask. However, he is a well-meaning and capable leader, willing to go great lengths to take care of people in distress.

Soldat's personality reminds Rudeus of his father and believes that
Paul
 is like Soldat when he was younger.

Background





Soldat Heckler during his childhood in the Manga



"Please Live! Sol..."

-Soldat's Mother

Soldat Heckler is born from a family of nobility but during his childhood they were attacked by unknown assailants and while the servants tells Soldat and his mother to flee, Soldat was the sole survivor when her mother throw her over the bridge and he gets washed away to a dump while waiting for her mother to return.

Soldat eventually becomes the leader of the
Stepped Leader
 that is also part of the "Thunderbolt" Clan

Plot

Soldat Heckler is first seen at the
Adventure Guild
 in Rosenburg, Basherant Kingdom bragging about going into a mission with his party mates.

Power and Abilities

Soldat battling with his sword in the Anime
Soldat evading Rudeus' Magic Spells in the Manga
1/2

He's filling a position of swordsmen with advanced-ranked
Sword God Style
 and intermediate-ranked
Water God Style
.

Soldat is also capable of battling against
Magicians
 and is able to close the distance despite Rudeus' attempt to stay away from his attack range.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Equipment

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Achievements

Advanced-ranked in the
Sword God Style
 and Intermediate-ranked in the
Water God Style

Leader of the S-ranked party Stepped Ladder

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Relationships

Rudeus Greyrat






Soldat introducing Rudeus to Stepped Leader in the Manga



"He has potential. So no matter what happens, his name will spread."

-Soldat on Rudeus

Soldat initially has a disdain for Rudeus' due to his depressed personality that he confronted Rudeus about it but also secretly instructs his party mates to ignore him. After coming to an understanding on why Rudeus behaves this way, Soldat helps out Rudeus after the rift between him and
Sara
 turns for the worse and even asks him to join him during their quests

Quotes

"You can’t waste time wondering what the reason is behind a woman’s every move. Women are like cats. We’re more like dogs. There’s no way dogs and cats can understand what the other’s thinking, right?”

Trivia

He was used by
Elinalise
 as a male prostitute before she married
Cliff
.

He tried to invite
Rudeus
 multiple times to be his team's permanent magician.

References

Soldat Heckler Arc
==================

Soldat Heckler Arc
 is the fifth side story chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Note: This is the chapter 64.5 in the
Manga volume 14
 if you want to see the chapter 64.5 of the magazine version
click here
.

Cover Characters

Soldat Heckler

Summary

In a tavern, Soldat was celebrating with his party after clearing a quest with a new member, one member says he's relieved to have a new mage, but Soldat says that she have a long way before she matches Quagmire, after asking information of him, Soldat decides to tell a story of him.

Rudeus was called Quagmire because his specialty was earth magic and Soldat in that time hated Rudeus dead eyes and his false smile with other people. One day Soldat find Rudeus drinking, so he decides to tease him a bit, but suddenly he received a punch from him, after seeing him crying, Soldat decides to hear his story.

Rudeus was drinking because he tried to have a intercourse with a member of the party that he was in that moment, but he couldn't get it up because a shock with another female that dumping him. Soldat tries to help Rudeus bringing him  to a high class brothel but that was futile, after drinking they leave but the woman member of the party find him and hit, after being dumped again Rudeus try to kill himself, but Soldat stops him, after that he invite Rudeus to his party.

After he end the story, the group talk about a reunion of his clan occurring nearby Sharia and thinking that is a good idea to visit Rudeus.

Appearances

Characters

Soldat Heckler

Tanya

Rudeus Greyrat

Sara

Suzanne

Skills

Regions

Others

Differences from Light Novel

Original chapter that summarizes the key events of
Light Novel Volume 7
 from the perspective of Soldat.

Trivia

This chapter was released between the chapter 64 and the chapter 65, but in the volume version was compiled between the chapter 68 and 69.

Navigation

Template:JuvenileP

Somar
=====

Somar is one of the three kids who bullied
Sylphiette
 in Mushoku Tensei: volume one and harassed Roxy in the “Roxy Gets Serious manga series.

Appearance

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Personality

Though it is unknown what he was like as an adult, he was a mean child and a bully.

Background

As a child, Somar lived in
Buena Village
. He is the son of Mr Eto and his wife,
Ada
.

Plot

Somar was one of the three children who bullied Sylphiette as a child. They pelted her with balls of mud and mocked her because of her hair color, telling her to return to the Demon Continent. Rudeus interferes and attacks him with his magic, after which they target him instead. This ends up being a fruitless endeavour as Rudeus easily evades their attacks.

He ends up in a few more confrontations with Rudeus, and every time is forced to go with his mother to Paul Greyrat where she complains about what his son did to Somal. Rudeus mentions that he seemed uncomfortable and later stops.

After the
Teleport Incident
, Somar ended up in
Millis Continent
. He was enslaved and forced to work as a male prostitute of some kind until Paul's companions kidnapped and rescued him, bringing him to their base in
Millishion
.

Trivia

• In the Roxy Gets Serious manga, Somar’s two friends who bullied Sylphiette as a child and discriminated Roxy for being demon. There names were revealed to be Teo and Arlo.

•  In the Roxy Gets Serious manga, Teo is the one with black hair and Arlo is the one with blonde hair.

• In the Mushoku Tensei English light novel and the Roxy Gets Serious English manga. His name is written as “Somal” and not “Somar.” Although the name could be translated differently, depending on the language.

Status Check
============

Status Check
 is the 101st chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Paul Greyrat

Summary

Rudeus is shocked that
Roxy Migurdia
 is missing and just as he thoughts of the worse, Geese tells him that Roxy is missing after stepping on a Teleportation
Magic Circle
 during their exploration and already has 5 attempts to search for her. Just as Rudeus calms down, Talhand and Vierra returns and they exchange greetings with Rudeus and Elinalise. After confirming that the Teleportation Labyrinth is where Roxy and
Zenith
 are being held, Rudeus shows them the «An Exploratory Account of the Teleportation Labyrinth» Book and they begin to read it.

Stepped Leader
==============

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!





Stepped Leader in the Manga



Stepped Leader
 (ステップトリーダー) is an S ranked
Adventurer
 party that affiliated with a larger clan known as "Thunder Bolt" which is active throughout the whole Basherant Dukedom,
Central Continent
.

Members

This party consist of 6 members with the composition of

2 Swordsmen,

1 Warrior,

2 Healers, and

1 Magician.

This party is lead by a swordsmen called
Soldat Heckler
 and
Rudeus
 used to join this party a few time to complete high difficulties missions.

Plot

Stepped Leader is seen at the
Adventure Guild
 in Rosenburg where Rudeus is also there and they are about to head out on a mission where they later comes into the rescue of
Counter Arrow
 who are battling numerous
Snow Drakes
 then Soldat punches
Timothy
 under the impression that they got doubled booked for the same quest of slaying the drakes.





Stepped Leader welcoming Rudeus in the Manga



After Rudeus parts way with Counter Arrow, Soldat brings Rudeus along and introduces him to the party who were initially surprised due to how Soldat seems to hate Rudeus but welcomes him nonetheless especially the female Magician who is interested in Rudeus' ability to
Silent Spell Casting

Reference

Stevio von King Dragon
======================

The 33rd Generation King of the Kingdom of the Dragon King. He become the king after
Orsted
 killed the previous king that was a apostle of Hitogami.

References

Story Arcs
==========

NOTE:
This article is under construction and revision.

Childhood Arc

The
Childhood Arc
 (幼年期
Yonen-ki
) is the first story arc which covers the
first volume
 of the light novel.

A 34-year-old NEET is kicked out of his home following the death of his parents. He comes upon a speeding truck heading towards a group of teenagers, and manages to pull one of them out of the way before dying. He then awakens in a baby's body and realizes he has been reincarnated in a world of sword and sorcery. While initially indulging in his perversion, he resolves to become successful in his new life, discarding his past identity aside for his new life as Rudeus Greyrat. At the age of three, Rudeus teaches himself magic arts and begins training to increase his mana capacity. Discovering his talent in magic, his parents hire a girl named Roxy Migurdia to be a live-in teacher. During his two years with Roxy, Rudeus learns more about the world and overcomes the trauma that was making him a recluse. After Roxy's departure, Rudeus befriends a bullied girl named Sylphy, whom he has mistaken for a boy. Rudeus teaches her everything he knows, allowing her to become proficient with magic. Realizing the co-dependence between Rudeus and Sylphie is limiting their potential, Rudeus' father, Paul Greyrat, sends Rudeus to his relatives to enlighten him about the world.

Home Tutor Arc

The
Home Tutor Arc
 (家庭教師編
Kateikyoshi-hen
), officialized is as the
Tutor Arc
, is the second story arc which cover the
second volume
 of the light novel.

Rudeus is bought into the Boreas branch of the Greyrat family and becomes a tutor to Eris Boreas Greyrat, an arrogant and violent girl. To become her tutor, Rudeus and the Boreas family arrange a fake kidnapping, which is turned into a real kidnapping when a butler betrays them. Regardless, Rudeus wins her favor and becomes her tutor for mathematics, languages, and magic. Over the years, Rudeus bonds with the Boreas family and teaches himself more about the world, learning several different languages on the side. On his tenth birthday, Eris and the Boreas family presents Rudeus with a magic staff. Shortly after, a magic beam hits the country, transporting people throughout the world. Roxy arrives at the city, and decides to join a search party led by Rudeus' father.

Entry-Level Adventurer Arc

The
Entry-Level Adventurer Arc
 (冒険者入門編
Boken-sha Nyumon-hen
) is the third story arc which covers the
third volume
 of the light novel.

Rudeus can pull Eris and himself to safety mid-teleportation and finds themselves on the magic continent, an area inhabited by demon citizens and powerful monsters. Cautiously heeding the words of a mysterious Human-God, Rudeus befriends Ruijerd Supardia who volunteers to escort them home. Passing through Roxy's hometown, they arrive in a city named Rikaris and sign up at an adventurer's guild to make money for the voyage. Coming upon a group of pet kidnappers, Rudeus destroys their operation and uses their rank to take higher level quests from the guild. Eventually, they are discovered and blackmailed, forcing them to leave town. Acknowledging his leadership was at fault, Rudeus changes the group dynamic to take Eris and Ruijerd's opinions into account.

Voyage Arc

The
Voyage Arc
 (渡航編
Toko-hen
) is the fourth story arc which covers the
fourth volume
 of the light novel.

The party arrives at a part that will take them to their next destination, the Milis continent. Following the Human-God's advice, Rudeus enters an alleyway and encounters the Demon Empress Kishirika Kishirisu, who gives him the power of foresight as a reward. Due to the Milis' discrimination against the Supard race, Rudeus pays an organized crime group to smuggle Ruijerd. Once there, Rudeus and Ruijerd betray the organization to save kidnapped children from the beast race. After freeing the Holy Beast, the beast race's deity, the beast race mistaken Rudeus to be part of the organization and is incarcerated. After clearing the misunderstanding, Rudeus, Ruijerd, and Eris spend a few months with the beast race as they wait for the seasonal rainstorm to pass. They then continue onwards and are accompanied by Geese, Rudeus' cellmate, who was imprisoned for gambling.

Reunion Arc

The
Reunion Arc
 (再会編
Saikai-hen
) is the fifth story arc which covers the
fifth volume
 of the light novel.

Arriving in Milis' capital, Milishion, the group and Geese go their separate ways. Rudeus comes upon a kidnapping and intervenes, learning that the kidnapping is actually a rescue orchestrated by Paul's search group. Paul chastises Rudeus for failing to search for teleportation victims on the magic continent, who is taunted by Rudeus in return, causing the two to fight. Rudeus realizes that aside from Norn, the rest of his family are still missing. After some self-reflection, Rudeus and Paul reconcile before continuing on their journey. Arriving at West Port to travel to the Asura continent, Ruijerd's connection and Rudeus' aunt (Therese Latreia), allows them to board a ship despite the ban against the Supard race.

Homecoming Arc

The
Homecoming Arc
 (帰郷編
Kikyo-hen
) is the sixth story arc which covers the
sixth volume
 of the light novel.

Arriving in the Dragon King Kingdom, the Human-God advises Rudeus to travel to Shirone Kingdom to save Lilia and Aisha. There, Rudeus meets Pax, the fourth prince of Shrione, who captured Lilia and Aisha to bait Rudeus and, in turn, Roxy, who he desires to court. Due to Pax's authoritarian rule, his soldiers rebel; at the same time Rudeus befriends the third Prince Zanoba, who helps free him from the prison. In the aftermath, Pax and Zanoba are sent out of the country, while Lilia and Aisha journey to reunite with Paul. On their journey, Rudeus and his companions meet the Dragon God Orsted, who attacks after hearing the Human-God's name. Utterly defeated, Rudeus is spared by Nanahoshi Shizuka, Orsted's companion. Continuing onwards, the party arrives at Eris' hometown. After saying their goodbyes to Ruijerd, Eris learns her entire family is dead. In response, Eris asks Rudeus to become her family, and sleeps with him. She then leaves to train her sword skills, in order to become a worthy woman by his side. Instead, Rudeus believes his sexual performance was lacking, leaving him heartbroken. Elsewhere, Roxy becomes acquainted with Kishirika who reveals the location of Rudeus' mother.

Mid-Level Adventurer Arc

The
Mid-Level Adventurer Arc
 (中堅冒険者編
Chuken Boken-sha-hen
) is the seventh story arc which covers the
seventh volume
 of the light novel.

University Arc

University Arc - Part 1

The
University Arc - Part 1
 (学園編 • 前
Gakuen-hen • Mae
), officialized as
The University Arc - Part 1: Special Student
, is the first half of the eight story arc which covers the
eighth volume
 of the light novel.

University Arc - Part 2

The
University Arc - Part 2
 (学園編 • 後
Gakuen-hen • Ato
), officialized as
The University Arc - Part 2: Sylphiette
, is the second half of the eight story arc which covers the
ninth volume
 of the light novel.

Newlyweds Arc

The
Newlyweds Arc
 (新婚編
Shinkon-hen
) is the ninth story arc which covers the
tenth volume
 of the light novel.

Sisters Arc

The
Sisters Arc
 (妹編
Imōto-hen
), officialized as
Greyrat Sisters Arc
, is the tenth story arc which covers the
eleventh volume
 of the light novel.

On Paul's behalf, Ruijerd escorts Norn and Aisha to Rudeus' home where they will be staying until Zenith is rescued. Aisha decides to become Rudeus' maid while Norn enrolls and dorms at Ronoa Magic University. However, being always compared to Rudeus and feeling completely alone, Norn secludes herself in her dorm. Rudeus sneaks into the dorms to see Norn, allowing her to sort out her negative feelings towards him. Months pass, and Sylphy becomes pregnant. Shortly after, Rudeus receives a letter from Paul's group, requesting for his assistance. The Human-God tells Rudeus to stay home, but is convinced to leave when Norn attempts to sneak out and go on the journey herself. Learning that Rudeus will need two years for his journey, Nanahoshi informs him about a hidden area containing a teleportation circle, which would shorten his overall journey to six months. Together with Elinalise, they are teleported to the Bengaritto Continent, where they traverse a desert of monsters and accompany a band of merchants. Arriving at their destination, they are reunited with Paul's group, and learn that Zenith is inside a legendary dungeon called the Teleport Labyrinth, and that Roxy is missing inside.

Labyrinth Arc

The
Labyrinth Arc
 (迷宮編
Meikyū-hen
) is the eleventh story arc which covers the
twelfth volume
 of the light novel.

Everyday-life Arc

The
Everyday-life Arc
 (日常編
Nichijo-hen
) is the twelfth story arc which covers the
thirteenth volume
 of the light novel.

Summoning Arc

The
Summoning Arc
 (召喚編
Shōkan-hen
) is the thirteenth story arc which covers the
fourteenth volume
 of the light novel.

Human God Arc

The
Human God Arc
 (人神編
Hito-gami-hen
) is the fourteenth story arc which covers the
fifteenth volume
 of the light novel.

Asura Kingdom Arc

Asura Kingdom Arc - Part 1

The
Asura Kingdom Arc - Part 1
 (アスラ王国編 • 前
Asura Okoku-hen • Mae
) is the first half of the fifteenth story arc which covers the
sixteenth volume
 of the light novel.

Asura Kingdom Arc - Part 2

Asura Kingdom Arc - Part 2
 (アスラ王国編 • 後
Asura Okoku-hen • Ato
) is the second half of the fifteenth story arc which covers the
seventeenth volume
 of the light novel.

Subordinates Arc

Subordinates Arc
 (配下編
Haika-hen
) is the sixteenth story arc which covers the
eighteenth volume
 of the light novel.

Zanoba Arc

The
Zanoba Arc
 (ザノバ編
Zanoba-hen
) is the seventeenth story arc which covers the
nineteenth volume
 of the light novel.

Cliff Arc

The
Cliff Arc
 (クリフ編
Kurifu-hen
) is the eighteenth story arc which covers the
twentieth volume
 of the light novel.

Zenith Arc

The
Zenith Arc
 (ゼニス編
Zenisu-hen
) is the nineteenth story arc, a direct continuation to the Cliff Arc, which covers the
twenty-first volume
 of the light novel.

Organization Arc

The
Organization Arc
 (組織編
Soshiki-hen
) is the twentieth story arc which covers the
twenty-second volume
 of the light novel.

Fourth Child Arc

twenty-third volume
 of the light novel.

The Final Battle Arc

Conclusion Arc

The
Conclusion Arc
 (完結編
Kanketsu-hen

twenty-sixth volume
 of the light novel.

Rudeus wonders if Zenith is even alive in her condition which angers Paul and grabs his coat to confront him on how he talk which causes the party to force them apart and they discuss their plan on how to defeat the guardian

Succession
==========

Succession
 (嗣ぐ)
Tsugu
) is the Twenty-fourth and final episode of the
second season
 (48th overall)
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on June 30, 2024 and also the fifth and final episode of the
Labyrinth Arc
 and Season 2 for the Anime.

Synopsis

After six months, Rudeus returns home to where Sylphy and the others are waiting for him. He talks about what happened in the
Teleportation Labyrinth
, Paul's death, Zenith's condition, and more. He also talks about Roxy... What will Norn, Aisha, and Sylphy's responses be...?

Plot

At Sharia, Rudeus, Roxy, Elinalise, Geese, Talhand, Zenith, Lilia, Shierra and Vierra are walking towards the Greyrat House where Rudeus suddenly starts running and Geese wonders if he really misses his wife that badly. While running, Rudeus realizes what Hitogami's
warning
 that he will regret going to
Begaritt Continent
 meant while concluding that
Paul
's death made him feel sad but not regret.

Rudeus enters the house and calls for Sylphy, but no one comes to greet him in the hall. He then checks the living room and the kitchen, calling their names, but no one is there. Rudeus is in disbelief about what is happening, but he hears footsteps and rushes toward them. He sees Aisha, who is surprised to see him. Rudeus asks Aisha if she is hurt; she answers him but is shocked and questions what happened to his left hand. Rudeus asks about Norn and Sylphy. Just as Aisha answers, Sylphy, who has just entered the house, calls for Rudeus. Sylphy assures Rudeus that everyone is alright, much to Rudeus' relief. As Sylphy welcomes Rudeus with an embrace, the rest of the party arrives outside the door, witnessing the scene as Roxy looks away.

Everyone is then seated at the dining table or the living room in silence until Aisha arrives with Norn from Ranoa Magic Academy who greets Rudeus upon arriving and is relieved to see Zenith. Rudeus begins to talk but Norn asks where Paul is so Rudeus tells him that he passed away while everyone is silent or looks away that leaves Norn in shock. Rudeus then places Paul's gauntlets,
Beloved Sword
,
Short Sword
 and the jar containing his ashes on the living room table. Norn questions how this has happened but Rudeus apologizes, causing Norn to further question him but stops upon seeing Rudeus lost his left hand and tries to contain herself as Aisha holds onto her shoulders. After Rudeus explains events of how
Paul died
 and Zenith has lost her memories, Norn confirms that Rudeus gave his all and begins to cry that no one could have saved Paul if Rudeus cannot as Aisha and Sylphy comforts her.

After Norn finishes crying, she asks if she can have Paul's Beloved Sword to which Rudeus agrees but tells her what it means to hold a sword like Paul told him when he gifted a sword to Rudeus on his
fifth birthday
 that surprises Lilia and Norn gratefully hold onto the sword. To everyone's surprise, Zenith suddenly pick up Paul's gauntlets and embraces it in her chest without saying a word and still having an expressionless face. Still not knowing if Zenith will recover, Rudeus tells everyone that Zenith will be staying with them and Lilia will look after her. Aisha then asks about dividing the chores of the house to which Lilia tells her that they will talk about it later then Norn tells Aisha not to hold back so she embraces Lilia in tears who also returns the gesture.

Outside the Greyrat House, Geese tells Rudeus that the rest of them will be looking for an inn but declines Rudeus' invitation to stay in the house for the night. Rudeus then thanks everyone for helping Paul all this time, to which Shierra wishes they could have been more useful, while Vierra tells him they will still be in town and to inform them where Paul's grave will be placed. Geese then cheers up Rudeus while Talhand tells him that it's Paul who should be the one thanking them, not Rudeus. Elinalise then says she plans to see Cliff but still blames herself for being unable to prevent Paul's death. Rudeus has no intention of blaming her. She then looks at Roxy, tells Sylphy that Rudeus loves her, and takes her leave with Geese, Talhand, Shierra, and Vierra. Rudeus then tells Sylphy he has something to tell her, and after glancing at Roxy, Sylphy accepts, and they go back inside.

Back at the living room, Lilia takes Zenith upstairs while everyone else stays behind. Rudeus then tells them that he wishes Roxy to be his second wife. Rudeus then explains how Roxy
saved
 him from grief after Paul's death. Rudeus then gets down to his knees, bows and apologizes to Sylphy for not keeping his promise. Norn approaches and berates Rudeus on how Sylphy is worried and misses him while he was away. Despite forgiving Rudeus on letting Paul die since he lost his left arm, Norn grabs Rudeus by his collar for his unfaithfulness. Rudeus defends Roxy's action, but Norn isn't having any of it, so Rudeus reminds him of what happened to her when she locked herself up in her
dorm room
. Although Norn is grateful for what Rudeus has done, she is a devout follower of the
Milis Religion
 that does not allow having two wives and points out how Roxy looks younger than her. Roxy tells her that she is a grown woman, but Norn continues to berate Roxy and accuses her of being shameless and taking advantage of Rudeus, causing him to get angry but manages to restrain himself. Roxy then faces Norn and agrees that she has been shameless, apologizes and begins to leave.

Rudeus tries to stop Roxy from leaving in her state, but Sylphy calls out to Roxy first and stops her. Roxy, in tears, turns to face Sylphy. Norn questions Sylphy's action and urges her to let her go, but Sylphy thanks her for worrying and states she can speak for herself. Sylphy then confirms that Roxy helped Rudeus, but Roxy admits she had ulterior motives. Sylphy acknowledges this and says she would not believe otherwise, adding that she would have done the same thing if their positions were reversed. Sylphy tells Roxy that she is aware Rudeus will eventually bring home another woman and has already realized this based on how Roxy looks at Rudeus. Roxy apologizes, but Sylphy brushes it off and tells her how Rudeus always talks about her with praise. This made Sylphy jealous, but after seeing Roxy, she sees her as another woman who loves Rudeus and welcomes her, saying that both of them will be supporting Rudeus from now on.

Outside the house, Rudeus and Norn are sparring with wooden swords. Norn still does not accept what has happened, as Rudeus tells her off for swinging too wildly. Sylphy reminds Norn that Rudeus is not a follower of Milis, and even Paul had two wives. She asks Norn if she would say the same thing to Lilia, who was Paul's second wife. Realizing this, Norn apologizes to Aisha, who had said nothing throughout the entire conversation, and because she offended her. This causes Aisha to mention how Norn does not think before speaking and runs off. Norn gets upset by that statement and chases after her, while Rudeus, Sylphy, and Roxy talk about how Norn feels while waiting for her family to return home. Sylphy then reveals that their child will be born in a month. Roxy tells her she will wait until her baby is born, then she will marry Rudeus.

A month later on a day with heavy snow, Sylphy gives birth where Lilia and Aisha handles the delivery and to her relief, the child does not have green hair, which is why she was bullied in her
childhood
 due to the animosity towards the
Superd Tribe
 who also have green hair. At Sylphy's request, Rudeus carries the baby and he sheds tears of joy after Sylphy tells him that she is their baby.

At the graveyard for nobles, Rudeus approaches Paul's gravestone and after cleaning the snow from it, he pours drinks on two glasses, tells Paul that his child is born and wishes that he could see it and after remembering how Paul protect him with his life, he tells him that their child's name is Lucy Greyrat and he married Master Roxy, like Paul he also have two wives and realizes this is what Paul was trying to tell him back in the Teleportation Labyrinth that Paul knows Rudeus loves Roxy, that Roxy also loves Rudeus and wanted to teach him how to prepare for that. Rudeus then wonders if Paul would think of marrying Elinalise or
Ghislaine Dedoldia
, but realizes that knowing Paul, he wouldn't give it much thought. After reflecting on his life so far in the
Human World
, he realizes that he is still a child with memories of his previous life and now that he has a child, he needs to grow up fast and still make mistakes on the way as he grows up and wonders if this is how Paul did it. After promising Paul he will work hard and finishing his drink, he takes his leave and promises to bring the whole family on his next visit.

As scenes of Rudeus' friends are shown, Rudeus is determined to fulfill his vow of living a life with no regrets.

Summoning Magic
===============

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!





Summoning Magic in the Manga



Summoning Magic
 is a category of Magic that allows its user to summon creatures and transport it to its caster.

Background

Six Faced World Era

Summoning Magic has long existed since the
Six-Faced World
 Era where smaller scales of
Teleport Incidents
 occur that causes
Monsters
 to appear in various worlds causing the
Gods
 of each world to blame and be suspicious of each other. To prevent this from escalating to a war, the
First Dragon God
 forbids the use of Summoning and Teleportation Magic because it might be abused and the
Dragon Tribe
 would take the blame since they are capable of anything without the regard of consequences.

But despite the restrictions, the First Dragon God also assigned
Magic
 Research to each of the Five Dragon Generals and Armored Dragon General
Dora
 is given the research of Summoning Magic. After
Crystal
's death, his research on Teleport Magic is also assigned to Dora where she continue his study on both Magic at a research facility in an unnamed mountain faraway from other cities in the Dragon World in the Dragon World to avoid collateral damage incase of an accident and the researchers working with Dora are the elderly of the Dragon Tribe who are aware that they are at the end of their lifespan and has accepted death should they disappear.

Laplace Wars

During the Laplace Wars,
Perugius Dola
, one of the Seven Heroes who battled Demon God
Laplace
 used Summoning Magic that brings the
Chaos Breaker
 into existence to the
Human World
 that he used as his Fortress in battle. Perugius also summons 11 Spirits to aid him in the war and Laplace was eventually sealed, making Perugius' accomplishments a legend throughout history where the new era is named in his honor, The Armored King Era.

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Perugius and Nanahoshi

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Details

Summoning Magic allows users to call forth creatures or elemental sprites with ease, requiring minimal magical control to learn. However, while it is accessible to most mages, it is difficult to wield effectively due to its reliance on the caster's mana. Summoned beings measure their master’s strength by their mana reserves, growing in power based on how much the caster can provide. These entities are also sustained by the caster's mana, meaning that mages with insufficient reserves risk quickly exhausting themselves or losing control. As a result, although Summoning Magic is easy to learn, it demands immense mana from the master.

**Summoning Magic** is divided into two types: **Fiend Summoning** and **Spirit Summoning**. Fiend Summoning involves calling forth highly intelligent monsters from other realms, offering them compensation such as mana, treasures, or services in exchange for their loyalty and labor. These fiends serve their summoner based on the terms agreed upon, and their power often reflects the summoner’s own mana capacity. On the other hand, Spirit Summoning uses raw mana to create beings called **Spirits**, which are entirely constructed from the summoner’s magical energy. Unlike fiends, spirits have no existence outside of the caster's mana and will, and their strength is directly tied to the caster’s magical reserves. Both types of summoning require minimal control to learn but place a heavy strain on mana, making them easy to access but difficult to fully master.

spirits are like programs which do what they where summoned for

Spells

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Methods to summoning

user must make a summoning circle and than the user must provide magic power to the circle while doing so must image what type and appearance of what they want to summon or the user can make a summoning paper which can summon a specific summon mostly used in battle or when a summoning circle is unavailable

References

Supard Tribe
============

Redirect to:
Superd Tribe

Superd
======

Redirect to:
Superd Tribe

Superd Tribe
============

The
Superd Tribe
 are a tribal race of infamous warriors from the
Demon Continent
. Due to the tales of their fearsome rampage without distinguishing ally from enemy in the war four hundred years ago, they are loathed and feared by all races.
 They now reside inside a forest in the Biheiril Kingdom, where they are know as "The Forest People" by a local village.

Background

The Superd were once an honorable warrior race and since the early stage had been subordinates of
Laplace
, a hero of who won the authority back from the
Human
 race and unified the
Demon
 Race. Due to the Superd warrior group's extremely high combat prowess, they became Laplace's elite force who specializes in suprise attacks and night raids which also causes them to be treated with both fear and respect.

During the middle period of the
Laplace Wars
 where the invasion of the
Central Continent
 began, Laplace gave the Superd Tribe spears, commonly referred to as "Devil Spears" which looks like the Superd's own spears but painted in ominous black. Some of the Superd rejected the spears as if they are forsaking their own soul but Ruijerd forces everyone to wield the spears as a sign of loyalty. But they were tricked by Laplace during the war. By using
Demon Spears
 instead of their own natural spears, they went berserk and killed everything in sight, as they could not differentiate between friend and foe.

Appearance

Their distinctive characteristics are their emerald green hair and a unique oval-shaped red gemstone embedded in their foreheads.

They are born with a tail, which eventually hardens and falls to become their spear as they grow up.

Abilities

Third Eye

Similar to the
Magic Power Eyes
, it detects
mana
, such as in living beings.

Spears

Superd are exceptional spearmen known throughout the world. The spears they use are unique in that they are actually their tails. Superd are born with tails which slowly harden as they age until they fall off. Because of this, Superd have a very personal relationship with their spears, considering them their souls.

Longevity

Superd are among the longest living races in the series, remaining in their prime even after over 500 years. It was known that some elders that fought the Second Great Human-Demon War were still alive when Laplace recruited the Superd warriors prior to the
Laplace War
.

Known Superd

Ruijerd Superdia

Luwelia Superdia

Ruiweld Superdia

Luicelia Superdia
 (Half-breed)

Village Chief

Rydelios Superdia

Trivia

Superd are so badly discriminated that the transport fee for them to cross the ocean is drastically higher than other races. It costs 200 Green Ore Coins (￥200,000 or US$2000) to travel from
Wind Port
 to
Zanto Port
, and 100 Royal Notes (￥5,000,000 or US$50,000) to travel from West Port to East Port.

Their culture is similar to the
Migurd
's.

Volume 1

Surprise
========

Surprise
 (
サプライズ
,

Sapuraizu
)
 is the fourteenth chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Ruijerd Superdia

Summary

In a far-off land, a Superd slays a creature while looking for someone in particular.

Back in Roa, Rudeus effectively masters the Beast language under Ghislaine's guidance, all for the day when he meets catgirls in the Great Forest; confirming to Ghislaine that he is indeed a Greyrat. Rudeus then confirms he master Battle-God and Demon-God languages, the latter of which was possible by his master Roxy, who sent him a personally crafted textbook for his understanding. While praising Roxy and mentioning the figurine he made of her, Rudeus's stomach grumbles and Ghislaine tries to keep him out of the kitchen while the staff finishes setting up the surprise by asking about his Water Saint magic. Rudeus brings up his strongest spell, Cumulonimbus, and how it would likely flood Roa, that to safely use it would require driving 2 hours out of town to use it. As Rudeus enjoys seeing Ghislaine gets flustered, a maid enters to announce everything is ready.

At the banquet hall, House Boreas greets Rudeus for his 10th birthday party, who fakes crying how happy he is for the celebration having eavesdropped on Eris a short while earlier. But because of how well he acted, he hug Eris in a move to try to calm her down while thanking her; this only makes her blush more. Sadly, Sauros bought his acting too well and declares war on House Notos with the aim to install Rudeus as head. Once Philip had his wife and a couple beast maids calm Sauros, he explains to Rudeus how Paul was disowned by the Notos family, the House Boreas family rival. If they were to learn of Rudeus being fostered in the Boreas house, it could be misinterpreted as them raising the next head of House Notos.

While wanting to avoid a misunderstanding, Philip still starts to becomes conspiratorial planning Rudeus's ascension, until Eris calls attention. Having readied Rudeus's gift, she asks him to guess and he incorrectly guesses his father to be the surprise. However, Paul had to fight a surge in monsters and Zenith had to tend to Norn with a fever, so his family couldn't make it. While Rudes puts on a brave face, internally not surprised circumstances prevented his family's arrival, the Boreas maids and Eris think he's only putting on a brave face. Surprising everyone in the room, Hilda comes up to "comfort" Rudeus feeling sad for his family not coming, and moves to have him wed Eris. Awkward and red, Eris tries to talk herself out of it until Philip simply commands Hilda to tend to Sauros. Philip praises Rudeus's ploy of gaining sympathy from his father and wife.

With that out of the way, Eris invites Rudeus to return to the festivities and the family enjoy hosting his birthday. As they enjoy, Rudeus remembers and cherishes the feeling of family he has around them. Later in the evening, filled from the feast, Rudeus returns to his bedroom, and is rather confused as he finds Eris in his bed dressed in evening wear.

Suzanne
=======

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Information

Story

Relationships

Appearance

Suzanne is the Vice leader of
Counter Arrow
, a party that help
Rudeus
 after he part ways with
Eris
.

Appearance

She has brown skin with braided hair tied to a bunch in a ponytail.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Personality

Suzanne is kind, caring and mature as she knew how to calm
Sara
 down when she got angry at
Rudeus
. During awkward moments, Suzanne tends to scratch her cheek while looking away. Suzanne is also willing to fight alone to give her team mates time to escape even if it puts her in danger.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Background






Suzanne and Timothy meeting Sara



Suzanne and
Timothy
 was part of another party when they rescued
Sara
 from a monster attack in the Milbots Region and survived along with
Mimir
 and
Patris
 and formed the new party
Counter Arrow
. She also took in Sara whose parents died at the attack and she becomes the party's archer.

Plot

Mushoku Tensei Volume7

"But here's the thing, kid... that look on your face is kind of a problem. You don't look like someone who's ready to take on the world alone. You look like a guy who doesn't even care if he lives or dies."

-Suzanne to Rudeus

Suzanne tried to talk to the depressed
Rudeus
 when they were on the carriage traveling to Rosenburg, and when Rudeus was taking on a A-ranked quest to kill Luster Grizzlies solo, she offered to invite him as a temporary member to do the quest together.

.

Lucy

Sylphy
 needed to go back to being
Ariel
's bodyguard.)
