Swindler
========

Swindler
 (
詐欺師
,

Petenshi
)
 is the eighteenth chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Roxy Migurdia

Rudeus Greyrat

Ruijerd Superdia

Summary

Recalling Roxy's old lessons of how the Superb were fearsome, yet is met by a good warrior with troubled eyes, Rudeus greets him kindly to start a conversation. Rudeus introduces himself and the warrior, Ruijurd Superdia, reciprocates, before asking why Rudeus isn't afraid of him. Moving to sit next to him, Ruijurd confirms he did save Rudeus and Eris, having seen them fall from the sky and killing predators coming at them. Rudeus affirms it would be rude to recoil in fear of his savior, and Ruijurd is surprisingly happy by that, grateful to meet such a strange kid.

As Eris wakes up, she goes into a full panic seeing Ruijurd and apologizes for whatever as she is afraid of being eaten given the stories she was told as a kid. While Ruijurd is unfazed by such a normal reaction, Rudeus feels that people wouldn't be so afraid if they simply talked to him. To get her to change her view, Rudeus plays to her pride to get her to greet Ruijurd, and she gets over her fear of him. As Ruijurd and Eris chat, Rudeus remembers his meeting Man-God in his astral projection. Having been following Rudeus for a while, Man-God wants to help Rudeus with advice and help him along. However, remember false friends form his first life, he refused to believe Man-God until he ultimately decides to go along with it with Ruijurd, but distrusts further involvement.

Around the camp fire, Rudeus updates Ruijurd on how he and Eris came to the demon continent, with Ruijurd noting Almanfi's involvement could mean Perugius's investment in the event. Ignorant to Pergius, Eris gleefully stands up to teach Rudeus, telling the history of humans at war with demon races who served the Demon-God, Laplace, as seven heroes united to face and seal Laplace; three of the heroes survived, Perugius among them. Ruijurd adds that Perugius is adept at summoning, so he likely sent Almanfi to stop whatever unpredictable event was going to happen. Recalling Perugius's name from a story book as a baby, Rudeus grows homesick and worried for his family, liking to believe they're doing OK.

Given the distance traveled, Rudeus and Ruijurd etch a map in the dirt to show Eris how far they travelled from Roa in the Fittoa region of Asura Kingdom; a distance Rudeus calculates to be equal between Las Vegas to Paris in his head. With it being nighttime, Ruijurd tosses them a blanket so they can sleep while he guards. With Eris worried for her parents and Ghislaine, Rudeus holds her close and swears to bring her home. In awe of Rudeus's dedication, Eris gleefully heads to bed leaving everything up to Rudeus. While Eris sleeps, Rudeus vows to bring her home safe, as Ruijurds looks over at him.

Sword God Style
===============

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

"A 『Sword God』 isn't something that you can become simply by memorizing a skill or something, you know? Even though someone special like me didn't get special treatment, why is there a need to treat Sword Saints that way?"

Sword God Gal Farion

Sword God Style
 (
剣神流
,

Kenshin-ryū
)
 is one of the three major schools of swordsmanship, and considered to be the strongest.

Characteristics

The motto of the Sword God Style is "Victory goes to he who moves first."
 This style of swordsmanship emphasizes speed and aggression, focusing on striking down the opponent first. As a result, many practitioners become short-tempered and belligerent. To react swiftly, practitioners are discouraged from wearing heavy armor and are encouraged to wear light clothing for maximum mobility.

Because the philosophy is to defeat the enemy with a single blow, this style usually leaves its users inept at defense with no counterattacks. Consequently, Sword God Style practitioners have difficulty fighting
Water God Style
 practitioners, who are adept at defense and counterattacks.
 Conversely, Sword God Style can overwhelm
North God Style
 because North God Style practitioners mostly rely on the environment to fight.

Known Techniques

Longsword of Light





Ghislaine using Longsword of Light in the Anime



Longsword of Light
 (
光の太刀
,

Hikari no Tachi
)
: The ultimate technique of the Sword God Style.
In this technique, the sword is held steady with both hands, and all the force of the sword is put into a single swing. This technique is extremely difficult to evade or defend against due to the speed of the slash, which can reach the speed of light when fully mastered, and the power to cut a heavy-armoured enemy in half.
The existence of this technique is the reason why Sword God Style is called the strongest of the three schools.

Used by
Eris Greyrat
,
Gal Farion
,
Nina Farion

,
Jino Britts

,
Ghislaine Dedoldia

,
Orsted



Light Reversal

Light Reversal
 (
光返し
,

Hikari-gaeshi
)
: The only known technical countermeasure against the Longsword of Light.
In this technique, it is a requirement for the user to have exceeding reaction speed; before the enemy's Longsword of Light reaches its maximum velocity, it is countered by the user's own Longsword of Light by cutting off the wrist of the enemy.

Used by
Eris Greyrat


Longsword of Silence

Eris using Longsword of Silence
Paul using Longsword of Silence in the Anime
1/2

Longsword of Silence
 (
無音の太刀
,

Muon no Tachi
, lit. "Longsword of Absolute Silence")
: An advanced technique of the Sword God Style.
This technique is a slower variant of the Longsword of Light where the blade is swung at a velocity beyond the speed of sound. A characteristic of this  technique is that leaves no sound behind.

Used by
Paul Greyrat

,
Eris Greyrat

Arm Chop

Rudeus using Arm Chop in the Anime
Rudeus using Arm Chop in the Manga
1/2

Arm Chop
 (
腕落とし
,

Ude Otoshi
)
, fully known as
Sword God Style - Initial Strike
, Arm Chop is one of the basic techniques of the Sword God Style. The user aims at their opponent's forearm to slice it off or if they are wearing armor will break the bones of their arm which in both cases loses their ability to use their weapon on that arm.

Ranks

There are seven ranks in the Sword God Style.

Sword God

The Sword God is the most powerful practitioner of the Sword God Style and leader of the school and as such he oversees training and operations of the school. Practitioners who are of Saintly level and above may call themselves a Saint, King, Emperor or God of the Sword God school. Similar to the system of
Water God Style
, there can be only one swordsman of the God rank while the there can be multiple practitioners who can assume the rank of Sword Emperor and below.

"You've gained the title Sword King, but I already have nothing to teach you. I'll give you the proof of mastery. Though it'd also be fine to jump you straight up to Sword Emperor but... you'd have to fight Ghislaine here. If you want to jump up to Sword God then you'll have to kill me."

Gal Farion to Eris

When a swordsman of the Sword God school defeats a Sword God, he can assume the title of Sword God - the strongest and the head of the school. If the Sword God dies for any other reason, the next strongest of the Sword God school will assume the title of Sword God. Therefore, a generational change of Sword God means a civil war in the Sword God school.

Sword Emperor

Sword Emperor rank is attained when two Sword Kings battle against each other with the Sword God as the witness and the winner is promoted to Sword Emperor.

Sword King

Practitioners with rank Kingly level are granted special titles by the Sword God and is given a Sword from his collection as proof of mastery.
 Judging from
Gal Farion
's sword collection, Ghislaine is the only Sword King before
Eris
,
Nina
 and
Jino
 ascended to the position
.

Sword Saint

A standard Sword Saint is being able to completely control their
Battle Aura
 and to be able to use the Longsword of Light but there are exceptions like Eris who attained this by defeating Jino and Nina despite being unable to use Longsword of Light but still granted the rank by Gal.
 When a Sword God Style practitioner reaches Saint Rank, they are given a dark leather jacket that has a white fur trim collar and a pair of white belts on each end of the sleeve similar to what Gal, Ghislaine and later Eris are wearing
.

Advanced


https://mushokutensei.fandom.com/wiki/File:MT-AN-S1-E02-WEBM-01.webm



Paul Greyrat
, An Advanced Sword God Style user consciously applying Battle Aura to a wooden sword



A standard Advanced Sword God Style Practitioner can self consciously use their Battle Aura. Until the the Advanced rank, the focus for lower rank is learning the foundations.

Intermediate

Intermediate Sword God Practitioners are those who advance the path of the sword after teaching them the foundation for at least 3 years and are able to sharply and swiftly cover their body with Battle Aura. An Intermediate Sword God Practitioner are able to contend with an average
Knight
.

Beginner

Beginner Sword God practitioners is the starting rank where its practitioners begins learning the foundations of the Sword God Style including children who cannot wear Battle Aura yet. A known training for this rank is the practice swings of the Arm Chop technique by hundreds of thousands.

Known Practitioners





Various Sword Saints, Sword Kings and Sword Emperors in the Sword God Style Dojo



Sword Gods:
Gal Farion
,
Jino Britts

Sword Emperors:
Timothy Britts
,
Nina Farion

Ars Greyrat
,
"Black Wolf" Ghislaine
,

,

Advanced:

,
Soldat Heckler
, Bigott Mercenal

Intermediate:
Rudeus Greyrat
,
Norn Greyrat
,
Luke Notos Greyrat

Unknown Rank:
Orsted
 (King or above, possibly God),
Defense of the Holy Sepulcher Knights
 including
Therese Latreia
 (at least Advanced Rank)

Trivia

Orsted
 is the only known person that could unleash the Longsword of Light technique with his bare hands
.

The headquarters of the Sword God school is located in the
Holy Land of Swords
 on the far north-west corner of the
Central Continent
.

The Holy Land of Sword was initially owned by Sword God but was claimed by Water God. The current Sword God reclaimed it back from the previous Water God.

Sword God Style is similar to
Jigen-ryū
 which originates from Satsuma Prefecture, 16th Century Japan where their teachings state that a second strike is not even to be considered
.

References

Sword Sanctuary
===============

Redirect to:
Holy Land of Swords

Sword Sanctum
=============

Redirect to:
Holy Land of Swords

Swordsman
=========

Redirect to:
Classes#Swordsmans and Warriors

Swordsmanship
=============

Due to the influence of the
Superd Tribe
, spears are said to be weapons of the devil and long-handled weapons are not favored, and bows with limited attack power cannot be used against strong people due to the existence of
Battle Aura
, so swordsmanship was emphasized and developed.

Three Major Schools

There are three schools of swordsmanship that are mainstream in the human world. Only those who have studied one of the Three Major Schools are called Swordsmen; in other schools, even if they use a sword, they are not called Swordsmen but Warriors.

All three schools have seven ranks:

Elementary Rank
 (
初級
,

Shokyū
)

Intermediate Rank
 (
中級
,

Chūkyū
)

Advanced Rank
 (
上級
,

Jōkyū
)

Holy Rank
 (
聖級
,

Sei-kyū
)

Royal Rank
 (
王級
,

Ō-kyū
)

Imperial Rank
 (
帝級
,

Tei-kyū
)

Divine Rank
 (
神級
,

Kami-kyū
)

At the
Intermediate Rank
, they have the power to compete with ordinary knights, at the
Holy Rank
, they are called geniuses, and at the
Royal Rank
 and above, they are considered to be among the most talented in the world.

Sylph
=====

Redirect to:
Sylphiette

Sylphiette
==========

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Information

Chronology

Powers and Abilities

Relationships

Gallery

Yes. To be able to stand in the same position as Rudy and fight together. On an equal footing, helping each other and protecting Rudy's back. I think I want that kind of relationship.

Sylphy, to
Rudeus

Sylphiette Greyrat
 (
シルフィエット
,

Shirufietto
)
 is
Rudeus
' childhood friend who is part human, elf, and beast race. Following the
Teleport Incident
,
 during which her hair turned white from
mana
 exhaustion, she became
Princess Ariel
's personal bodyguard under the alias
Fitts
.

Appearance

In her youth, she had short green hair and elfish ears. Her tomboyish appearance initially made Rudeus believe she was a boy.

After the
Teleport Incident
, her hair became white. Although she grew to have a more feminine body, her slender appearance combined with her apparel made her look more masculine. She also now wears white Gloves as her permanent accessory starting from Season 2.

Spoilers

After her marriage with Rudeus, she began to let her hair grow longer and wear more feminine clothing. Due to her elfen heritage, her body ages slower in comparison to humans.

Personality

Due to being constantly bullied, Sylphiette was very shy and meek when she was a child. She was very dependent on Rudeus and she break down crying when Rudeus tells her that he plans to leave to study. After Rudeus was forcefully sent away to act as
Eris
' home tutor, she resolved herself to learn and train in order to support Rudeus in the future.

When posing as Fitts, she put up a front as a cold knight in public, appearing silent, serious, and intimidating. She appears to be helpful, reliable and knowledgeable to Rudeus, which in turn made it easier for him to ask her for advice. However, deep down she was still very insecure, too afraid to confess her true identity to Rudeus.

After getting married, she is demure, supportive and accommodating towards Rudeus. As the story progresses, she gradually becomes more confident and assertive. She is deeply loyal towards her friends, but her utmost loyalty lies with Rudeus and the family. She is known as the 'housewife' in the Greyrat household.

Despite being gentle and accommodating towards Rudeus, she is very prone to jealousy towards other women that get close to him, even though she doesn't actively act on it. However, she would readily accept women that truly love and loved by Rudeus into the family.

Background

Childhood

Syphiette is the only child of
Laws
, a half-blood
Elf
 who works as a hunter and her mother who is part
Beast Race
 in
Buena Village
,
Fittoa Region
 in
Asura Kingdom
. When Syphiette was a child, she was always bullied for her being a hybrid and having emerald green hair that is the same hair as the
Superd Tribe
. Her parents tried to protect her such as her mother cutting her hair and making her a stitched pants for her to run away easier while her father petitioned the children's parents to stop targetting her daughter but to no avail.

Plot

Meeting Rudeus






Syphiette successfully learning Voiceless Incantation from Rudeus in the Anime



The bullies would throw mud balls or rocks at her sometimes and kick her too, causing Sylphiette to be resigned to her fate until
Rudeus
 saved her from the bullies and they became friends with Rudeus calling her Sylph. During their time together, Rudeus teaches Sylphy about math, how to read and write and most importantly the use of
magic
, voiceless incantation and everything she wanted to know. Meeting Rudeus is an upheaval of her everyday life causing the bullying to eventually stop and they would play and practice magic together. During their magic practice, it is revealed that her Fire Magic is weaker than her Wind and Water magic because she is afraid of fire unconsciously  because she accidentally burned her hands when she was 3 years old.

When Sylphy sees Rudeus unconscious and tied up by
Paul Greyrat
, she uses a voiceless intermediate ranked magic at Paul who easily avoids it but the speed, power and being a voiceless incantation surprises Paul of what Rudeus has taught Sylphy. Laws tells her the situation and she accepts that they will be apart and continues practicing her spells and training her body as Rudeus did everyday.
 Sylphy tries to get information on where Rudeus went from
Zenith Greyrat
 who refuses to tell her but teaches her
Healing Magic
 and discovers she is able to use voiceless incantation with healing and it is her strong point as well. Sylphiette then approaches
Lilia Greyrat
 to know where Rudeus was taken but like Zenith, she did not tell her anything but taught her etiquette and manners of the nobility. During Rudeus' 10th birthday, Sylphy carves a pendant made from wood to serve as a good luck charm similar to what her father wears to be delivered to Rudeus then the
Teleport Incident
 occurred.

Silent Fitz

Syphiette defeating a Terminate Boar in the Anime
Sylphiette falling from the sky
1/2

Sylphy is teleported on the sky above the Silver Palace and struggles to break her fall with magic and somehow survives with bruises and fractured legs only to immediately battle a
Terminate Boar
 that is about to attack Princess Ariel. Sylphy seeing the boar immediately uses her strongest magic to kill the boar then uses voiceless healing magic on her fractured legs and finally collapses in exhaustion due to expending her mana. Sylphy wakes up and realizes her hair has turned white then is questioned on where she came from and who taught her magic. Despite Syphy's unbelievable story that she is from
Buena Village
 in the
Fittoa Region
 and she learned magic from Rudeus, Ariel insists on Sylphy becoming her new guardian to take the place of
Derrick Redbat
 who died protecting Ariel from the terminate boar and be always by her side to which Sylphy accepts on the condition that she pardon her crime of entering the Silver Palace without permission and help her find her family and friends. As news of the Teleport Incident spread, Sylphy's story becomes more believable and she is clearly not a noble as she only learned some etiquette of the nobility from
Lilia Greyrat
 while trying to find out where Rudeus was taken.

Fitts battling Nights Eye Crow in the Anime
Fitts battling Nights Eye Crow in the Manga
1/2

In addition, rumors of the
granddaughter
 of
Sauros Boreas Greyrat
, Lord of Fittoa has changed so much because a boy who tutored her have been circulating, which leads to speculations that  because they are the same age that they were the same person, but also gives doubt on her becoming Ariel's guardian since the Boreas Family supports Prince
Grabell Zafin Asura
's faction. But this doubt comes to an end after Sylphy defeats
Nights Eye Crow
, an assassin known to have slain many nobles for the past decade who attacks Ariel.  After this, her nightmares of falling from the sky after the Teleport Incident also stop. Since she rarely spoke and could use voiceless incantation, eventually Sylphy became known as "Silent Fitts" as he continues to protect Ariel from numerous assassination attempts, eventually leaving the
Asura Kingdom
 with Ariel to study at the
Ranoa Magic Academy
.

On their journey to
Sharia
, Fitts accompanies Ariel with 15 nobles that gets assassinated when one is isolated due to multiple ambushes on the way. The final ambush comprising of around 10 swordsmen, 1 magician and 1 healer at the Red Dragon's Upper Jaw was crushed by Fitts thanks to the chantless magic combat techniques that Rudeus taught her and the ambushes stop after crossing the border. By the time they reach Sharia, Ranoa Kingdom's capital, five of them remained: Fitts, Ariel,
Luke
, and the servants
Elmore Bluewolf
 and
Kleene Elrond
.






Sylphiette confirming that Rudeus is her childhood friend



After entering
Ranoa Magic Academy
, Sylphiette defeats
Linia Dedoldia
 and
Pursena Adoldia
 then along with Ariel and Luke becomes part of the Student Council where they plan to recruit allies in helping Ariel's bid for the throne of Asura Kingdom. Years later, rumors about Quagmire Rudeus begin circulating and Sylphiette confirms that Rudeus is indeed her childhood friend from Buena Village so Ariel leaks the information to Vice Principal
Jinas Halfas
 who sends a letter of invitation for Rudeus to Ranoa Magic Academy.

Achievements

These are current achievements that Sylphiette gained through her adventure, action, and training:

Voiceless Incantation.

Water Saint Class Magician.

Princess Ariel's Personal Guard (Formerly).

Quotes

Sylphiette
: "I will follow Rudi. I do not know what the result will be. We may fall into some serious problems, and may end up being killed by
Orsted
... But even at that time, I'm going to support Rudi. That way we will remain married for life."
 Sylphiette to
Luke Notos Greyrat

Sylphiette
:
"Well I think, I wanted to be like
Eris
."

Rudeus
:
"Eris?"

Sylphiette
:
"Yes. To be able to stand in the same position as Rudy and fight together. On an equal footing, helping each other and protecting Rudy's back. I think I want that kind of relationship."

Rudeus
:
"......"

Sylphiette
:
"But Eris, and also Rudy are so far away that I can never hope to reach it. I've realized this. So, I gave up on this goal and will protect Rudy's back in another way."

Rudeus:
 "What is it Sylphy, my lovely wife?"

Sylphy:
 "Don't stare at Ariel-sama too much or I'll pull your ear."

Sylphy:
 "I know that! But Rudy is moving with the thought of protecting us! For us, to not hold our head down and appreciate his efforts is like exposing our ugly side! I do what I must do, rather than saying anything that would annoy him or cause any misdirection, I take his side because I will support him from behind!"

Luke:
 "If you want to help Ariel-sama, then kill Rudeus. If I said that, what would you do?"

Sylphy:
 "I choose Rudi. I know it's a bad choice for Ariel-sama, but if I'm forced to choose, I cannot turn my back against my husband or my child."

Trivia

Sylphiette's green hair is a result of her having the
Laplace Factor
 in her, which grants her aptitude towards all forms of magic and a large amount of magic power.

Sylphiette's originally green hair
turned white due to the stress
 caused by the Mana Calamity as well as using all of her magic power.

Sylphiette is one of the three Goddesses that Rudeus worships. The blood-stained piece of the sheets from the time when Sylphy gave her virginity to Rudeus to cure him of his ED is kept in a box and enshrined in the basement of the mansion. She is the Goddess of Love in Rudeus' religion.

Sylphy's journey after the teleportation incident greatly differs in each adaptations:

In the
Web Novel
, a long and detailed debate among nobles of Ariel's faction happened before deciding to make Sylphy pose as a male guard magician, and her bond with Ariel began to deepen after Ariel's failed sexual assault.

In the
Light Novel
, Sylphy is quickly made into a guard magician with identity concealed, in order to act as a deterrent.

In the
Manga
, Sylphy lost her memory after crash-landing into the palace, and only regained them when she fought off the assassin Nights Eye Crow.

In the original timeline where Rudeus doesn't exist, she became
Roxy
's disciple and was still discriminated due to her green hair. She became an adventurer and eventually managed to conquer several labyrinths, becoming a world-class Labyrinth Explorer.

Her nickname, Luffy: It's just a nickname using the 3 kana after the first kana in her name (シ
ルフィ
エット/shi-
ru
-
fi
-et-to). Rudy interprets it as "
Luffy
" and connects it to
One Piece
 in his head.

According to Rudeus, Sylphy is submissive in bed, she accepts everything unconditionally, even if it is something very shameful, she will do it.

Her type of Blood is A and her height is approximately 110 cm in volume 1
.

Sylphy ages slower than regular humans due to her 1/4 elven blood. At 74 years old, she looks about 40 years old.

Sylphy has very low tolerance in alcohol, and gets very clingy with Rudeus when she is drunk
.

The origin of her name as the guardian of Ariel "Fitts" (Fitz in Seven Seas version) is from the
Fitts' law
, because it was the first name that the author found when he was searching names starting with "Fi" (フィ).

Sylphiette/Chronology
=====================

Information

Chronology

Powers and Abilities

Relationships

Gallery

Mushoku Tensei Novel Volume 1 - Infancy Period

Sylphiette is first seen being bullied for her emerald green hair and getting chased and getting hit by mud balls thrown at her by the village children,
Rudeus
 saw the event and decided to step in to stop the bullies. After chasing them away he then proceeded to wash the mud off her with warm water he made using magic. She was particularly attached to Rudeus and could not bear to be apart from him.

Mushoku Tensei Novel Volume 7 - Youth Period - School Entry Chapter

She is reunited with Rudeus at the
Ranoa Magic Academy
, however he did not recognize her because she was disguised as a boy and her hair had turned white as a result of overusing her magic during the
Mana Calamity
. Then, she was disguised as Fitts-senpai and the bodyguard of
Ariel Anemoi Asura
.

She is known as the [Mystery], the one who was feared between Ariel,
Luke
 and herself. It was said that she had once single-handedly managed a handful of delinquents that posed a threat against Ariel, which caused people to stay away from her.

In the volume, she had been the one to test Rudeus to see if he was truly eligible as a [Special Student] of the
Ranoa Magic Academy
. She had later been shocked by how strong and potent he had become, even though he had only displayed the skill [Rock Bullet].

She is often seen in the library and had many meet-ups with Rudeus there. At the Magic Academy, like Rudeus, she had made use of it to find the reasons behind the
Metastasis Event
, even aiding Rudeus to find out the cause of it. In fact, she even remembers the titles of the books that she has read, showing her intellectual side.

For the most part of the chapter, she is seen trying to make Rudeus remember who she was, as she still held a liking for him. In the end, she helps Rudeus cure his impotency and she becomes his wife.

Before the happenings of the entry into the Magic Academy, she had been teleported to the
Asura Kingdom
 and found herself falling from the sky. In a desperate attempt to soften the blow she cast magic one after another which caused a mana strain, causing her hair to go white. She then coincidentally lands into the place where Ariel was nearly assassinated by a rampaging magical creature and saves her by throwing out a spell.

The incident earns her recognition and she is later promoted to become Ariel's guard, escorting and protecting Ariel until the end of the
Asura Kingdom Arc
 and
Ghyslaine Dedorudia
 takes over her role.

Mushoku Tensei Novel Volume 20.5 - Intermission Chapter

Sylphy is pregnant with her
second child
.

Volume 22 - Young Man Period - Organization Chapter

Sylphiette/Powers and Abilities
===============================

Information

Chronology

Relationships

Powers and Abilities

Gallery

Abilities

『Voiceless Incantation』





Sylphiette learning Voiceless Incantation from Rudeus



Rudeus taught her how to use Voiceless Incantation but unlike Rudeus, she is able to use it even with healing and detoxification magic. She is, however, unable to use voiceless incantation for melded magic.

『Disturb Magic』





Syphiette practicing Disturb Magic with Rudeus



Disturb Magic, cancels other magic. Sylphiette first sees Rudeus use Disturb Magic at the
Ranoa Magic Academy
 and asked
Rudeus
 on how he canceled her magic during the entrance exam
 and later asked him to teach it to her.

Magic

Sylphy using Sonic Blast on a Terminate Boar
Sylphy using Sonic Boom against Nights Eye Crow in the Anime
1/2

『Fire Magic』

Intermediate Rank

『Water Magic』

King Rank

『Earth Magic』

Advanced Rank

『Wind Magic』

Advanced Rank

『Healing Magic』

Fitz using Healing Magic on Rudeus
Fitz using Healing Magic on Juliette
1/2

Advanced Rank - Sylphy learns Healing Magic from
Zenith Greyrat
 when she begins helping in the
Buena Village
 Clinic to try to know where Rudeus was taken and realizes that Healing Magic is one of her strong points. Aside from
Orsted
, Sylphy is the only known person in the series that could cast healing magic without incantation.

『Detoxification Magic』

Advanced Rank - Sylphy is able to use a voiceless Detoxification magic that she uses to neutralize a poison used by Nights Eye Crow, an assassin targeting Ariel that she narrowly survives.
. She is the only known person in the series that could cast it without incantation.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Equipment

Ariel gives Sylphy Magic Items and Magic tools as an overhaul of her appearance to fulfill her new duty as the Second Princess' Guardian.

Magic Wand





Sylphiette using her Magic Wand to confront Luke in the Light Novel



A magic wand given to Sylphiette by Rudeus, whom the latter had received from
Roxy
. After the
Teleport Incident
, Sylphiette uses this to kill the terminate boar that attacked Ariel and desperately did not want to part with it as it is her sole property from Rudeus.

Cloak of Perpetual Warmth

Cloak that regulated the body temperature, preventing sudden illness. Previously owned by
Derrick Redbat
.

Gale Boots

Shoes that greatly increase the user's speed. Previously owned by Derrick Redbat.

Overwhelming Gloves

Pair of gloves that halves all impact damage received near the palm. Previously owned by Derrick Redbat.

Bustier of the Steel-threaded Silkworm

A special undergarment was newly ordered for Sylphy. It is made with fibers that resist most blades, however it cannot withstand an attack by someone using skills of the
Sword God Style
, rather it's more for preventing wounds from the level of a thrown dagger.

Sunglasses of the Rescuer

A sunglasses allowing the face to remain hidden, it allows perception of the crisis state of the princess instantaneously. Despite the wearing of sunglasses being frowned upon by the nobility, the king gave special permission to allow Sylphy to wear them after the recent terminate boar attack.

Illusionary Ring

Allows user to change appearances into the wearer of the ring's other pair. Does not change eye color or voice.

Reference

Sylphiette/Relationships
========================

This article
lacks information
 and requires expansion. Please
expand this page
 to include missing information to help improve the article.

Information

Chronology

Relationships

Powers and Abilities

Gallery

Family

Rudeus Greyrat

Rudeus teaching Sylphiette Voiceless Incantation in the Anime
Sylphiette forgiving Rudeus
Rudeus tutoring Sylphy in the Anime
Sylphiette not wanting to separate from Rudeus
Rudeus meeting Fitz in the Anime
Rudeus learning Fitz is Sylphy in the Anime
Rudeus showing Sylphy their new house
Rudeus and Sylphy's wedding reception
1/8

Her childhood friend and husband. They first met when Rudeus saw Sylphy getting bullied, and became fast friends. Rudeus would teach Sylphy magic to defend herself from bullies. Rudeus assumed that Sylphy was a boy until the bathroom incident where they were in the bathroom on a rainy day to take a bath but Rudeus forcefully stripped her and figures out that Sylphy is a girl. Sylphy would eventually develop a crush on Rudy. After 8 years, they finally reunited at the Ranoa Magic Academy, but Rudy wasn't able to recognize her because she was Fitz at that time. With the help of Ariel, Sylphy was able to recreate a childhood event, Rudeus was finally able to realize that Fitz was actually Sylphy. This lead to Rudy accepting her love; fully expressing his own affection, unknown to her, due to his trauma with Eris making him believe Sylphy would leave him too if he wasn't clear.

Sylphy was worried that her flat and un-curvy body wasn't attractive enough for Rudy; only to be surprised that he found her figure "divine". After giving her virginity to Rudy, Sylphy was surprised to hear him indirectly propose to her; after the princess asked how Rudy would take responsibility and not abandon the one he loves. Shortly afterwards, they get married and buy a home, graduating school and Sylphy becomes pregnant.

She becomes pregnant with Lucy Greyrat and Sieghart Saladin Greyrat.

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Laws





Sylphy and Laws in the Manga



Laws:"Does Sylphy want to keep being only protected by him forever?"
Sylphy:"I understand. I will become strong to help Rudy...!!"

Laws is Sylphiette's father who loves his child despite having green hair which makes people afraid of her which is accepted by adults but the children of
Buena Village
 would bully her and Laws talked to the parents of children but the bullying has not stopped until Rudeus protects her. But when Paul tells Laws of his plan to separate Rudeus and Sylphy, he agrees seeing how Sylphy has become too dependent of Rudeus and through his encouragement, Sylphy decides to train on his own while apart from Rudeus.

Elinalise Dragonroad





Sylphy and Elinalise in the Anime



Elinalise Dragonroad is Sylphy's grandmother. Like most of her children, Elinalise raised Laws until he became independent and severed ties with them due to her curse. But Laws told Sylphy who Elinalise really is and she is also part of the
Fangs of the Black Wolf
 Party with Paul. During Sylphy's wedding reception with Rudeus, Elinalise congratulates them and tries to stop her tears, leading Sylphy to ask if she really is her grandmother. After talking things out, Sylphy and Elinalise consider each other as family again.

Lucy Greyrat





Sylphy after giving birth to Lucy in the Anime



The first daughter between Rudeus and Sylphiette.

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Sieghart Saladin Greyrat

The second son between Rudeus and Sylphiette.

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Paul Greyrat






Sylphy, Rudues and Paul in the Anime



"Even though I easily avoided them, the magic has speed and power besides the voiceless incantation. If it was anyone else, they probably would have died. What the heck did this Rudy teach?"

Paul Greyrat after avoiding Sylphy's Spell

Paul is Sylphy's father-in-law and although their interactions are not shown much, Paul helps Rudeus on how to talk to Sylphy after the awkward incident.
 When Paul realizes that Rudeus is getting too attached to Sylphy that is hindering both of their growth, Paul decides to separate them. Before Paul sends off Rudeus to the
Citadel of Roa
, Sylphy sees Rudeus who is tied up and attacks Paul with an intermediate ranked spell that he avoids. Paul then sees Laws talking to Sylphy is glad that his son is being loved.

Princess Ariel Faction

Ariel Anemoi Asura

Sylphy saving Ariel from a Terminate Boar in the Anime
Fitz protecting Ariel in the Anime
Sylphiette and Ariel in the Light Novel
1/3

Ariel: "Powerless as I am, I cannot help you. So, I will no burden you anymore than I already have. From this day forth, you are-"
Fitz: "No. You called me your friend, Your Highness. You are my friend, too. When my friends are in trouble, I want to help them. When they are in danger, I save them. That is no burden. This time, I want to go with you of my own free will."

When the
Teleport Incident
 transported Sylphy to the Silver Palace's  royal gardens in Asura Kingdom, she meets Ariel after protecting her from a
Terminate Boar
 and was nursed and cared for by Ariel until she recovers. After this event, Ariel's faction wants to dispose of Sylphiette but Ariel insists that she became her Magic Guardian after
Derrick Redbat
 where Sylphiette is known as Silent Fitts. Sylphiette joins Ariel on her journey to
Sharia
 and battle off numerous assassination attempts by the First Prince's faction and later become close friends.

Because Ariel's harsh childhood of being targeted by assassins, Ariel developed a sadistic personality and when she tries to attack Sylphiette in her bed, Sylphiette who knows of the inner workings of the Silver Palace from Lilia retaliates with her magic causing severe injuries to Ariel and also became a masochist. Despite Ariel's personality Sylphiette develops a bond with Ariel and they become friends that Sylphy decides to join her to Sharia and continue her duties as Ariel's
Magic Guardian
.
 At Sharia, Sylphy confirms that the rumored
Quagmire
 Rudeus is her childhood friend and with Ariel's help, they reunite and eventually marry.

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Luke Notos Greyrat






Sylphiette and Luke in the Light Novel



Luke:"IF you want to help Ariel-sama, then kill Rudeus. If I said that, what would you do? If you had to choose between them, who will you choose?"
Sylphiette:"I choose Rudi."

Luke is Sylphiette's partner in her work as a
Guardian Magician
 while Luke is a
Guardian Knight
. Like Ariel, Luke was also saved by Sylphiette when the Terminate Boar appears in the Silver Palace's Garden which would have killed Luke and Ariel. Initially, Luke dislikes Sylphiette for being a commoner who has no place to be with the nobility but he opposed their faction's proposal to dispose of him since Sylphiette is a girl. As Sylphiette struggles to adjust to her new life as Ariel's guardian, Luke would occasionally help out Sylphiette and gives advice on how to improve which they eventually became close friends after they survived the journey to Sharia.
  After Sylphiette marries Rudeus, Luke challenges Rudeus to a duel in which Rudeus thinks that Luke also loves Sylphiette.

When Luke tries to stop his
father
's execution by taking Ariel hostage, Sylphiette choose Rudeus over Ariel but her words causes Luke to release Ariel and is later forgiven.
 After Ariel becomes queen, Luke offers to welcome Sylphiette anytime in his home but Sylphiette tells him she won't break up with Rudeus.

Sylvaril
========

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

This article
lacks information
 and requires expansion. Please
expand this page
 to include missing information to help improve the article.

Sylvaril
 (
シルヴァリル
)
 or
Sylvaril of the Void
 (
空虚
の
シルヴァリル
)
 is one of the 12 servants of
Perugius
, the Armored Dragon King. A member of the Heaven Race. She is the only servant of
Perugius
 who isn't a summoned spirit.

Appearance

Sylvaril has near-white, golden hair draping down her shoulders. She wears a white mask of a bird and a gown-like white robe, while holding an expensive-looking magic staff that carries a magic stone that is opaque and dark. From her back grows a pair of jet black wings.

Personality

Sylvaril is normally uptight and proper, exuding an atmosphere of elegance. She is extremely loyal to
Perugius
, favoring those who praise her master and shows obvious hostility towards anyone who disrespects him by her accord.

Background

She was the first familiar of
Perugius
, and the only one who isn't a summoned spirit. Apparently this stems from 400 years ago when
Perugius
 was on a Laplace Campaign, he saved Sylvaril and from then, she has served him since.

Plot

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Power and Abilities

She is the only servant who can draw teleportation magic circle like Perugius.

Achievements

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Quotes

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Trivia

She hates
Rudeus
 due to him accidentally summoning
Almanfi
 as his summoned magic guardian and for him being a subordinate of Orsted.

In the light novel,
Ruijerd
 states that she is a very skilled fighter and was still fighting
Laplace
 alongside
Urupen
, while
Kalman
 was knocked out and
Perugius
 was on his knees.

Perugius Faction

Leader

Perugius Dola

Members

Sylvaril

Dotbath

Szilard
=======

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Szilard
 is from the Saint Dragon Tribe and the leader of the Five Dragon Generals who oversees the protection of the Dragon World and its capital city Kayos.

Appearance

At a glance, Szilard can be seen as a leader of his people but not in the apex like the
First Dragon God
 and his most outstanding features is his ephemeral golden eyes, seen in most of the Dragon Tribe but instead of any softness, it shows a strong will laid back on them.
 Apart from being slightly bigger than the rest of the Dragon Tribe, he gives off a different aura and his scales are emerald-silver giving a calm impression.

Personality

Szilard is always calm, decisive and of good judgement even when his opinions are opposed by other Dragon Generals.

Background

The First Dragon God teaches the Dragon Tribe how to use
Dragon Battle Aura
 that allowed them to battle against the dragons that rule over Dragon World and eventually conquer it. Although the First Dragon God is powerful, he is not omnipotent and there are places out of reach as well. Thus, from the Dragon Tribe, he chose the 5 most powerful individuals to be the Dragon Generals whom he entrusts with protecting the Dragon World and Szilard is one of them who are loyal to the First Dragon God.

Szilard is the leader of the
Five Dragon Generals
 and is responsible for the entire Dragon Tribe but most of his duties is in the capital city of Kayos and is in charge of the Dragon Warriors. In a sense making him the Second-in-Command in the Dragon World when the Dragon God is away and during meetings, its usually Szilard who summarizes of the opinion of the Five Dragon Generals and offer his best judgment.
 Like the rest of the Dragon Generals, Szilard also has a unique emblem that resembles the Dragon God's emblem with some alterations.(see photo above)

Plot

Szilard greets the First Dragon God who just returned from the Demon World and brings Laplace with him. Although he is wary of
Laplace
, he didn't question the Dragon God's decision to raise him. On the meeting regarding
Crystal
's death, Szilard concludes that a gold dragon could not kill a Dragon General and considers the possibility that someone with the power of the Eight Demon Kings could possibly kill him. Despite volunteering himself to find Crystal's killer, Szilard did not oppose the idea of Laplace volunteering as well.
 Szilard greets Laplace who has just returned to Kayos after capturing
Necrolia Nacrolia
 and commends him for his work along with the Dragon Warriors and takes over the custody of Nacrolia for interrogation since he can understand Demon God language.

"Dragon God-sama, we are of one will, let's invade Demon World immediately and let them receive the just reward fro what the Five Dragon Generals have suffered."

-Szilard

Szilard attends another meeting with the rest of the Dragon Generals at the Dragon God's mansion and after Laplace conludes his report, Szilard confirms that Necrolia indeed killed Crystal under orders from the
Demon God
 to stop the Teleportation Research for the Dragon Tribe and confirms that Necrolia is already executed. After the rest of the Dragon Generals voices their opinions, Szilard summarizes their recommendation to invade the Demon World but the Dragon God chooses to negotiate with them. Like the rest of the Dragon Generals, Szilard is reluctant with the Dragon God's decision but still asks that Laplace be rewarded for his efforts on capturing Crystal's killer to which the Dragon God names him to be Crystal's successor as Dragon General. Although shocked by the Dragon God's word, Szilard acknowledges Laplace's loyalty to the Dragon God and praises him for accomplishing his mission.

When the Dragon God's child is born, Szilard announced that a parade will be held at Dragon Roar Mountain which is a grand celebration that lasted for decades and like the rest of the Dragon Generals, Szilard is also impressed by the child and left with a solemn expression.

You are more gracious to Lunaria than anyone else. Everyone acknowledges your loyalty to the Dragon God. You cannot cause that tragedy."

Szilard to Laplace

A few days after Lunaria's death, Szilard and the rest of the Dragon Generals holds a meeting where Szilard reports his list of suspects that are from the other worlds like
Pudoria Dordia
 and
Kirisis Calisis
. Szilard notices that Laplace has gone pale after giving his report then assures him that none them believe that Laplace could have done this much to his relief.

Szilard and the rest of the Dragon Generals accompanies the First Dragon God as he battles and defeats the Gods of the Beast World, Ocean World and Sky World one after another and resulting to the destruction of each world just by the power of the First Dragon God and the Five Dragon Generals.
 But for the Demon World, which is comparable in fighting strength with the Dragon Tribe and in addition, the Eight Great Demon Kings matched strengths with the Five Dragon Generals so the full force of the Dragon World's Dragon Warriors is brought to wage war on the Demon World. The war between the Dragon World and Demon World lasted for decades where one world manages to defend their world and launch a counter offensive on the other's world but are forced to withdraw after faltering.

The stale mate lasted until the Eight Demon Kings were defeated by isolating them one after another and causing the Demon God to finally appear in battle. After the First Dragon God defeats the Demon God, the Dragon Generals brings him back to the Dragon World as the Demon World's destruction begins.

Talhand
=======

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Information

Relationships

Tallhand
 (
タルハンド
,

Taruhando
)
 also known as
Talhand The Clifftop
 (
厳しき大峰のタルハンド
,

Ikameshiki Taihō no Taruhando
)
 is a short rugged
dwarf
 magician used to be in
Paul Greyrat
's party before
Rudeus
 was born.

Appearance

Like all dwarfs, Talhand is short compared to other races. He also has a long orange beard that reaches below his waist that are split in two by dark bracers.

He is always seen clad in dark armor, gauntlets and helmet with a white robe underneath his armor.

Personality

While Talhand shares similarity with all dwarves that likes rock and iron, alcohol and admiration for blacksmiths and builders, he is considered a maverick among dwarves due to his unconventional thinking and stubbornness. He learned water and wind magic that are frowned upon by dwarves, and refused to conform to the traditional dwarven mindset of blacksmithing and crafting but he is very devoted towards people he trusts and admire especially towards his younger brother
Godbard
. But when Godbard also ostracized him, he leaves the village and finds it hard to trust other people. Furthermore, his attraction to men more than women made him struggle to join any
Adventurer
 party.

Background

Talhand is the 37th of 51 siblings born in the Dwarf Village which has a culture that all children of the same generations are grouped together like a school.

Talhand is close to his 38th sibling, Godbard and to support him, Talhand offers to focus his studies on Water and Wind Magic to become his right hand man when he becomes the next Ore God. Godbard agrees and also thinks that the adult dwarves are too hard headed on their tradition that dwarves to practice Earth Magic for generations. Talhand delightfully advance his studies on water and wind magic at the scorn of his other siblings. When the day for Godbard to become Ore God has come, he did not select Talhand. Talhand argues with Godbard that he studied learning wind and water magic to support him but Godbard rebukes him after losing to a blacksmithing competition so Talhand leaves the village next day on the succession ceremony of the new Ore God.

Talhand began his travels as an
Adventurer
 and is always alone. Due to his incident with Godbard, he could no longer bring himself to trust other people, cladding himself in armor and resigning to the role of a Magic Knight, believing that adventuring wouldn't be too hard. When Talhand reaches Rank B Adventurer, he is approached by
Elinalise Dragonroad
 and they begin to occasionally work together because of Elinalise's abilities being a fast warrior and heavily armored mage. Talhand and Elinalise meshed well together despite finding her irritating because of her advances. Neither of them talked about forming an official party until
Paul Greyrat
 brings them together with
Ghislaine Dedoldia
 and
Geese Nukadia
, and so Talhand becomes one of the members of the
Fang of the Black Wolf
, a party of outcasts from their own town.

Plot






Talhand battling a Manatite Hydra in the Anime



A dwarf that was member of the Party "Fang of the Black Wolf". He, along with
Elinalise
 and
Roxy
, decides to help Paul to find his family.

He later joins Paul to search for Zenith in the
Teleportation Labyrinth
 and takes part in battling the
Manatite Hydra
 where he tanks the Hydra attacks and is partnered with Roxy

Redundancy

Talhand opens a shop in
Millishion
 after forging weapons and armor for the
Rude Mercenary Company
 which becomes his sponsor. Talhand then visits the Dwarf Village to arrange a meeting with Rudeus and the Ore God after settling an old grudge.

Powers and Abilities

Physical Abilities






Talhand tanking a Manatite Hydra attack while protecting Roxy



Being a Magical Knight, Talhand is skilled in combat and is able to survive being a solo Rank B adventurer.
 Talhand is also an effective
Tank
 being able to stop an attack of a
Manatite Hydra
.

Blacksmithing

After leaving the Dwarf Village, Talhand's blacksmithing skills are base level for a dwarf and during his time as an adventurer, he also took up smithing jobs to improve his skills. After taking a break from his travels and staying in
Millishion
, he decides to improve his blacksmithing skills and begin utilizing wind, earth, fire and water magic at his disposal to start creating swords, shields, helmets and armor based on his knowledge as an adventurer about what kind of equipment outperform others and his skills rapidly increased and his wares sold well.

With his reputation as a blacksmith known in Millishion and being acquainted with Rudeus, the
Rude Mercenary Company
 became his sponsor where Talhand is able to setup his own shop.

Magic Abilities






Talhand using Earth Pillar in the Anime



Due to his
Dwarf
 Heritage, Talhand has a natural affinity for Earth and Fire Magic but in order to be the right hand man of Godbard, Talhand studied Water and Wind Magic that is frowned upon by dwarven tradition.

Immune to the charms of a Succubus

Intermediate Rank Earth Magic

Elementary Rank Fire, Water, Wind Magic

Equipment

Axe

Talhand uses an axe-like wand that can presumably be used both as a wand and an axe.

Armor

Due to Talhand's agility being zero, Talhand clad himself in dark colored armor and has survived being a solo adventurer as a Warrior and Magician.

Achievements

Created a sword using a black ore made by Rudeus that the Ore God took great interest of the black ore to the point that he agreed to be part of the
ORSTED Corporation
 for a large amount of the black ore.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Quotes

Elinalise
: "Rudeus, I'd be carefull if I were you, this dwarf drinks up men too"

Rudeus
: "Ehh"

Talhand
: "Don't say things in such a way that will cause misunderstandings..."

Talhand
: "I take men only"

Trivia

His first love was
Godbard
, the current Ore God.

Tears of Regret
===============

Tears of Regret
 (
後悔の涙
,

Kōkai no Namida
)
 is the twenty-sixth chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Rudeus Greyrat

Gablin

Bachirou

Kurt

Ruijerd Superdia

Summary

In the Forest to slay a monster, Rudeus's pause to help fellow Adventurers results in one of them dying, compelling Ruijurd and Eris to jump in and slay the monsters attacking them. After Rudeus slays the Executioner as Ruijurd and Eris slay the Anaconda, Kurt is thankful for the rescue. Ruijurd demands Rudeus's reason for waiting so long when the could have saved Gablin, but knowing he waited to try and garner more glory builds on the guilt in his heart as his focus on profit allowed Gablin to die. However, Kurt intercedes siding with Rudeus as his team were the adventurers on mission, thus Gablin's death sits on Kurt's shoulders being the party leader. Hearing Kurt, Ruijurd apologizes and acknowledges them as warriors, stating his view on the ideal of honor as he apologizes to Rudeus in the misunderstanding that he was protecting their honor as adventurers. Despite Ruijurd's kind words, Rudeus's guilt still lingers inside, thinking only of profit and advancement while viewing the situation as a game.

Thinking how his past self would be fine getting away with the "good ending", Rudeus cannot help but quietly hate himself for allowing someone to die. After parting ways with the other adventurers, Team Dead End ventured further into the forest and found the remains of another adventurer team they met earlier. The culprit was revealed to be a Red Hood Cobra, an A-Rank creature that made the forest its home. Despite the cobra's evasiveness, Dead End succeeded in killing it and claimed materials from the remains before heading back to the guild. Tired from the events of the day, Rudeus just wants rest but is met by Nokopara, who found out that Rudeus traded jobs with the Peahunter team, forcing a confession from Jalil when he took Vizquel hostage. Nokopara demands a monthly fee for his silence, as quest trading is grounds for revoking their license. But in a plan to sacrifice their licenses to escape, Rudeus orders Ruijurd to carry him and Eris out once he floods the city.

After failing and quitting all his past life, Rudeus just wants to live his second life to the best he can, but Ruijurd splashes his head to reveal his green hair. Not wanting Rudeus to dirty his hands, Ruijurd exposes himself as a real Superd, causing immediate panic in the city. As Jalil and Vizquel disavow them, citizens scream in fear, and Kurt is afraid despite being saved earlier in the forest, Rudeus doubts he'll ever be able to mend their reputation. Once Ruijurd threatens to kill Nokopara if their adventurer licenses are revoked, he flees leaving Rudeus and Eris, who chase after him; Kurt realizing that they knew Ruijurd was a Superd. With Ruijurd scapegoating himself to allow Rudeus not to shoulder more blame, Rudeus breaks down crying as the city continues to panic.

Appearances

Characters

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Rudeus Greyrat

Gablin

Bachirou

Kurt

Ruijerd Superdia

Nokopara

Jalil

Vizquel

Navigation

Teleport Incident
=================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Lilia and Aisha during the Teleport Incident
Teleport Incident manifesting above Roa
Ghislaine caught in the Teleport Incident
1/3

The
Teleport Incident
, also known as
Metastasis Event
 is a
Mana
 calamity that occurred in the
Fittoa Region
,
Asura Kingdom
 in
K417
 which resulted to its citizens to be teleported to random locations on the world.  The incident caused an innumerable amount of casualties and the first turning point in
Rudeus Greyrat
's life in the series.

Prelude

"I'm not sure. That's discovered three years ago but its not something bad... It's better to think that way."

-Sauros to Rudeus





Red Orb appearing above the Boreas Estate



Since the era of the
Six-Faced World
, numerous teleportation incidents has already occurred but in a smaller scale which is also one of the reasons why there is animosity between the worlds because of suspicions of one world might be invading the other for the disappearance of their people or appearance of monsters. But according to the
Dragon Tribe
 researchers' hypothesis: a power possessed by every living creature permeates the Six Worlds which is called
Dragon Battle Aura
 by the Dragon Tribe while the Demons call it
Mana
 or Magic Power that is said to maintain a natural equilibrium within the Six Worlds. However, the power of the Six Worlds suddenly declined, creating significant imbalances. If the power diminishes significantly in one world, it'll absorb power from another world to compensate which results to the teleport incident, causing not only trees and animals but also people to disappear.

Although Teleportation Magic is forbidden by the First Dragon God because it may trigger a war, research is still conducted by all beings of the Six Worlds. For Dragon Tribe, this research is assigned to
Crystal
 and later inherited by
Dora
. The research is conducted by the older members of the Dragon Tribe since they are near the end of their life in a facility faraway from the rest of the denizens of the Dragon World so other cities will be unaffected incase of accidents. The First Dragon God plans to share the research to the other worlds to prevent anymore teleport incidents but this did not happen because of the war that lead to the destruction of the other worlds except the
Human World
.

In K412, a red orb appears floating above the Boreas Estate in
Roa
 and there is no known history recorded of such occurrence in the past. In a conversation with Rudeus,
Sauros
 tells him that it's not a bad thing and that it is better to be left at that. Five years since its appearance, Rudeus notices that the orb seems to be getting bigger but overall the daily life and activities of Roa's citizens goes on.

Cause

The cause of the Teleportation accident was actually the result of events taking place roughly 80 years in the future. At this time, a certain nation was embroiled in a war and used the power of an individual known as the "
Playback Miko
" to summon
a boy from another world
, who was prophesied to be their savior. The Miko would grow close to the summoned hero and eventually develop feelings for him. Unfortunately, the boy was actually just an ordinary human and he ended up dying when the country forced him onto the battlefield. Overcome with grief, the Miko burnt out her power, to bend time and space, to alter the world to one where she and the boy might live happily together.

To successfully alter history, the Playback Miko reached out with her power and found an individual with similar feelings for the boy as herself:
his girlfriend
 from his original world. She then attempted to summon her to her current location, the Fittoa Region, roughly 80 years in the past. The Miko's hope was that this would allow her to set things up so that the boy would not have to die. Unfortunately, the world itself fought back against the Miko's attempt to alter fate, and thus nothing happened initially. However, the Miko's attempt to summon someone from another world opened up a rift in space from which the soul of
a recently deceased individual
 emerged and was reincarnated into the world.

Due to the reincarnated individual not being from this world, the world's resistance to the Miko's power began to wane as he grew and began to influence the fates of those around him. As a result, the void eventually became visible to the naked eye in the form of a floating red orb. Eventually, the world could no longer hold it back and the rift fulfilled its purpose by successfully summoning the boy's girlfriend into the world, causing the Teleport Incident in the process.

Manifestation

The orb gathering mana that looks like a storm
Kishirika using her Clairvoyant Eye to view the Mana Orb
1/2

In K417, huge amounts of mana gather around the orb and looking like a storm with eight eyes.
Orsted
 and
Kishirika Kishirisu
 senses the gathering of mana and mobilizes to find the source.
Perugius Dola
 aboard his Sky Castle notices the mana resembles the light of summoning and considers the possibility that someone could be seeking to undo the seal on
Laplace
. Perugius then commands
Almanfi
 to investigate the source of the mana and kill any suspicious persons on sight. At this time, Rudeus,
Eris
 and Ghislaine are outside of Roa to test out his new staff,
Aqua Heartia
 that Rudeus received on his tenth birthday from Eris the day before. Almanfi attacks them but Ghislaine fights him briefly and assures him that they have nothing to do with the incident. As the magic activates, Almanfi teleports out of the area then a pillar of light lands and expands at high speed, enveloping anyone it touches and teleports them randomly all over the world.

Casualties

List of Missing and Casualties in the Adventurer Guild in the Anime
List of Missing and Casualties in the Adventurer Guild in the Manga
1/2

Due to the Teleport Incident massively affecting the Fittoa Region, the definite number of casualties and missing are nearly impossible to account for. The Refugee Camp of the Fittoa Region has a list of missing and dead while adventurers and former adventurers alike search for the missing and coordinating with adventurer's guilds in the continent.

Known Casualties:

Philip Boreas Greyrat
 and
Hilda Boreas Greyrat
 are teleported to a
Strife Zone
 with
Ghislaine
. By the time Ghislaine reaches them, they are both already slain.

Laws
 and his wife are reported to have died and it took a heavy toll on Sylphiette who is in Sharia after joining Ariel.

Aftermath

"This much is certain. Originally I suspected Laplace or someone associated with him, however... Summoning her over is impossible even for me. In that case, it shouldn't be possible for anyone of this world... I suspect it's not man-made. It just happened by chance."

Perugius to Sylphiette

Rudeus and Eris meeting Ruijerd
Roxy, Tallhand and Elianise heading to the Demon Continent
Nanahoshi in the Asura Kingdom
Paul and Norn returning to where Buena Village used to be located
Rudeus seeing what remains of the
Greyrat Family
's Home in Buena Village
Roa now in ruins where its survivors builds a Refugee Camp
1/6

Buena Village
 and
Roa
 disappears from the face of the continent and all that remains are the ruins and rubble of where its buildings stood.

Hitogami begins appearing in Rudeus' dreams

Rudeus and Eris are teleported to the
Demon Continent
 and is saved by
Ruijerd Superdia
 who accompanies them on their journey back to Roa and joins the
Adventure Guild
.

Sylphiette
 is teleported to the Asura Kingdom where she becomes
Ariel Anemoi Asura
's bodyguard as Fitts and accompanies her to
Ranoa Magic Academy
 after she left the kingdom.

A
Knight
 who is barely outside the zone of area affected by the teleportation, reports what happened to the nearest town, and the report was spread throughout the Asura.

The King of Asura also hears of the news and assigns the Asura Magic Division to investigate which also clears Sylphiette from suspicion that she is a spy.

Roxy Migurdia
 joins
Elinalise
 and
Tallhand
 to search for Rudeus in the Demon Continent.

Paul Greyrat
 and
Norn Greyrat
 are teleported to the Southern Regions of the Asura Kingdom. Alphonse, Butler of the Boreas Greyrat Estate recruits him and he joins the search group for his family and other missing citizens of Fittoa.

Paul and Norn eventually goes to
Millishion
, Holy Kingdom of Milis and asks support in the search effort from Countess
Claire Latreia
 who immediately agrees after learning Zenith is among the missing. With no news of his families' whereabout, Paul sinks into depression and spends his days drinking until he reunites with Rudeus at Millishion.

Zenith Greyrat
 is teleported to the
Teleport Labyrinth
 where Rudeus, Roxy and members of the
Fangs of the Black Wolf
 would eventually rescue her but she has become unresponsive.

Lilia Greyrat
 and
Aisha Greyrat
 are teleported to the Shirone Kingdom and are imprisoned
Pax Shirone
. Rudeus, Eris and Ruijerd rescues them with aid from
Zanoba Shirone
 after learning that Rudeus is the creator of the Roxy figurine he likes.

Nanahoshi
 is summoned to the Asura Kingdom grasslands and was saved by Orsted, eventually travelling together since she is unaffected by the curse on Orsted.

Nobles who has a grudge on Sauros like Pilemon and the Second Prince's faction schemes on eliminating Sauros

Sauros Boreas Greyrat is blamed for the calamity and is executed.  He is succeeded by James Boreas Greyrat

Alphonse
 takes charge on managing Roa, now converted to Fittoa refugee camp and its refugees rescued from the teleportation. He proposes that Eris becomes
Pilemon Notos Greyrat
's concubine.

Ghislaine returns from the Strife Zone and works on the Fittoa refugee camp. She proposes Eris should be with Rudeus or run away together.

Rudeus, Syphiette and Nanahoshi begins research to uncover the truth of the incident as this has never happened before according to Orsted.

Sylphiette asks Perugius who is behind the Teleport incident but he responds that its not man-made and just happened by chance.

Nanahoshi theorizes that
Hitogami
 is involved with the red orb's appearance when Rudeus was 5 years old during the time he grew closer to Roxy and Sylphiette and the incident itself happening a day before Rudeus is about to sleep with Eris.

Nanahoshi also theorizes that her being summoned and Rudeus' existence is to set in motion the events for the future where Rudeus' descendants will ally with Orsted to kill Hitogami and suggests that Rudeus consult with Orsted.

Despite being protected by a strong fate, the situation of the people affecting Ariel on becoming the
Asura Kingdom
's queen has been altered from Orsted's knowledge of the original history such as:
:

Derrick Redbat
 who is supposed to persuade Perugius on backing Ariel to become queen, dies while protecting Ariel from a terminate boar and is succeeded by Syphiette.

Luke Notos Greyrat
 marrying Eris and both becoming Ariel's bodyguards who will protect her from numerous assassination attempts and eventually becoming queen does not occur.

With Eris being Ariel's bodyguard, Sauros and Philip are suppose to join Ariel's faction but this does not occur due to their deaths.

After being saved by Ariel,
Tristina Purplehorse
 is supposed to testify as a live witness against
Darius Silva Ganius
 on being kidnapped then forced to become his sex slave and causing his downfall goes missing.

Rudeus and Zanoba borrowed a section of land in Fittoa from the Boreas Family where they build a research lab that has a teleportation circle to Zanoba's Workshop since it is unlikely anyone can discover the lab and there, they created
Anne
, the first automaton of the SS Anne Series that resembles Nanahoshi.

To prepare for the upcoming return of Laplace and war he will start, Ariel issues a decree that removes Teleportation magic from being a "Forbidden Technique" and uses her influence and charisma to sway the opposition and eventually became law regardless.

Rudeus informs Cliff and the Miko of Memory that he plans to build Teleportation Circles but they are extremely troubled since the Milis Religion designates Teleportation Magic to be the ultimate forbidden technique.

Rudeus creates a large teleportation grid all over Asura Kingdom despite strong opposition of the citizens of Asura Kingdom

At the minimum, The Holy Kingdom of Millis did not allow Rudeus' plan to have teleportation magic in the country;
Cliff Grimoire
 and the
Miko of Memory
 protected him from trouble with the
Milis Religion

Although Nanahoshi did the research of the teleportation that is sponsored by Rudeus, Only Rudeus is blamed by the nobles, merchants and the priests of the Milis Religion and he become known as <The Person who broke the Taboo>.

Bell
 who lives in the Fittoa Region's countryside obtains exceedingly good results at a newly built school in Fittoa and is recommended to study at the
Asura Royal Academy
 where her village organized a fund raising campaign for her travel expenses and plans to serve under the Feudal Lord of Fittoa further the development of her village. Bell would eventually become the best friend of
Christina Greyrat
 in the academy and graduate becoming a civil official under the Feudal Lord.

Trivia

Despite the random nature of the teleportation; Rudeus and Eris, Paul and Norn, Lilia and Aisha were teleported to the same place together because they are in physical contact with each other before they are teleported.

References

Teleport Labyrinth
==================

Redirect to:
Teleportation Labyrinth

Teleportation Labyrinth
=======================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

Monsters of the Teleportation Labyrinth using the Teleportation circles to replenish their numbers
Teleport Labyrinth in the Anime
1/2

The
Teleportation Labyrinth
 (転移の迷宮) is an S-ranked labyrinth located beneath the desert of the
Begaritt Continent
 that is accessed by a cave of a cliff north of the city of
Rapan
.

Background

"There is a theory that the
ancient demons
 gave birth to these Labyrinths and their creatures in a quest to create a paradise for themselves."

-
Perugius Dola
 to Rudeus





A group of Tarantula Deathlords guarding the Teleportation Circles



Like all Labyrinths near Rapan, the Teleportation Labyrinth is formed by ants that ate the remains of a gigantic
Behemoth
, previously slain by
North God

Kalman II
 and his group. The mutant descendants of these ants dig tunnels beneath the Behemoth's remains that eventually became Labyrinths where monsters became attracted to it because of their concentration of
Mana
 and due to the labyrinth having numerous Teleportation Circles, it became known as the Teleportation Labyrinth.

As with all Labyrinths, the Teleportation Labyrinth has its Magic Crystal located at the Seventh Floor where its monsters tend to kill or take intruders captive into the Magic Crystal where they become the "heart" of the Labyrinth that distribute Mana to all its inhabitants and allowing it to function. The mana that flows through these captives trapped in the Magic Crystal causes them to lose their memories, but their body is also infused with a mysterious power which turns them into a
Miko
 or
Cursed Ones
.

Geography





The Teleportation Labyrinth, located north of Rapan



The Teleportation Labyrinth is located north of the Rapan that takes 1 day or half day depending on how fast to travel there
 where the entrance looks nothing more than a cave on the outside and makes it look like a hole in the side of a cliff. But seeing it in person gives the sense that there is a labyrinth within it because of the unsettling air to it.






Rudeus' party preparing to enter the cave of the Teleportation Labyrinth



As such, a large clan consisting of several Adventurer
Parties
 tend to divide their group into 2 roles: The main group that explores the Labyrinth, while the second group, sometimes referred to as the support group set up camp and wait outside for emergencies or supplies. But for the case of the Teleportation Labyrinth, the support team returns to Rapan due to its closeness and prepares the supplies from there.

Book

"Yeah, it's amazing Paul. If the things written in this are real, then clearing up to the sixth floor is already easy."

Geese to Paul

Geese studying the contents of the Book for the Teleport Labyrinth
«An Exploratory Account of the Teleportation Labyrinth» Book in the Anime
Roxy reading the Book for the Teleport Labyrinth
1/3

To assist in the exploration of the Labyrinth, Rudeus borrowed a book from the
Ranoa Magic Academy
 Library titled: «An Exploratory Account of the Teleportation Labyrinth» which records the previous attempts of
adventurers
 on exploring the Labyrinth. Rudeus previously used this book to also investigate the magic circles which could give further information on the
Teleport Incident
 but due to Teleportation Magic being considered taboo, he left out details about the teleport magic circles and even consider this to be fiction or that it could be another labyrinth.
 The book contains detailed information about the Monsters on each floor including their sketch and a diagram of each Teleportation Circle and their functions whether its a one way or two way teleportation that would take days of exploring each floor with out the book otherwise.

Overview






Rudeus' party using a Teleportation Circle to transfer to the Second Floor



The Teleportation Labyrinth is a seven floor labyrinth where each floor is connected by a teleportation magic circle. The labyrinth is full of teleportation traps.

The architecture of the first three floors is similar to an ant nest, with curving tunnels, complicated passages and dead ends that is also written in the «An Exploratory Account of the Teleportation Labyrinth» but is confirmed by
Adventurers
 who previously explored the first 3 floors through trial and error. Starting from the fourth floor, the architecture is similar to the ruins of the
Dragon Tribe
.

In
K423
, The labyrinth was cleared by
Paul
,
Rudeus
,
Roxy
,
Geese
,
Elinalise
 and
Talhand
.

Floor 1

Rudeus' party exploring the First Floor
Paul Greyrat battling the Tarantula Deathlords in the First Floor
Elinalise Dragonroad battling the Tarantula Deathlords in the First Floor
1/3

The nest of the Tarantula Deathlords but there are also various smaller arachnids here that is the primary prey of the Tarantula Deathlords. The walls and ceiling have white threads stretched all around them.

Floor 2






Rudeus' party taking a break to clean their gear in the Second Floor



The place with a large quantity of Iron Crawler and Tarantula Deathlord.

Floor 3






Roxy battling a formation of Monsters in the Third Floor



Mad Skulls can be found commanding groups of Iron Crawler and Tarantula Deathlord.

Floor 4

Elinalise defeating an Armored Warrior with her Gladius
Geese charting a map for the fourth floor and notating it in the Anime
1/2

Iron Crawler and Tarantula Deathlord disappear leaving only Mad Skulls and Armored Warriors.

Floor 5

Geese burning a talfro root to repel the Devouring Devils in the Anime
1/1

And then, after you get to the fifth floor the Mad Skulls disappear leaving only Armored Warriors and Devouring Devils.

Floor 6

Geese searching for a hidden room in the Sixth Floor
Geese scouting a Teleportation Magic Circle Room in the Sixth Floor
Rudeus using Stone Cannon to uncover the hidden room
The Magic Teleportation Circle to the Seventh Floor glowing deep blood red
1/4

This floor is the nesting ground of Devouring Devils. The final room of the floor has 3 teleportation magic circles, these circles are traps, and the real magic circles that connects to the final floor can be found below a hidden stairs.

Floor 7

The Guardian of the Labyrinth laying dormant before the Magic Crystal
Floor 7 with the Teleportation Magic Circle Entrance/Exit
Rudeus' Party engaging the Manatite Hydra
Roxy and Talhand running at the sides of Floor 7
Rudeus' party battling the Hydra
Elinalise protecting Rudeus from the Hydra while Paul decapitate it
Magic Crystal shattering upon the death of the Hydra
Rudeus' party burning the remains of Paul before the corpse of the hydra
1/8

Floor 7 is the final room and the den of the Guardian of the Labyrinth, the
Manatite Hydra
 who guards the magic crystal and is believed to be the center of the Teleportation Labyrinth. The room has a rectangular shape, similar to a giant temple hall where the edge of the room is as big as a baseball field and the sides are perimetered by thick pillars with braziers on front and stairs in between them, making it a 2 platform room with the higher platform at the sides.

Zenith
 was trapped inside a magic crystal in this room which shatters after the Manatite Hydra is killed.

Monsters

The labyrinth is filled with powerful and intelligent monsters. They are familiar with the labyrinth's layout, and are capable of setting up structured ambushes using the teleportation circles in the labyrinth and setting up defensive formations to prevent their enemies from escaping.
.

See
List of Monsters in the Teleportation Labyrinth

Plot

--To be added

Trivia

Roxy
 survived for an entire month in the third floor by herself. She survived by eating the monster flesh and using water and detoxification magic.

Terminology

Tersena Adoldia
===============

Tersena Adoldia
 is the Adoldia tribal leader’s middle daughter and
Pursena Adoldia
's  little sister.

Appearance

Tersena has short gray hair and brown eyes, with a pair of floppy dog ears on top of her head and a fluffy tail behind, indicating her Adoldia heritage. She has a slim hourglass figure and a well-developed chest. She's very well endowed, even by animal breed standards, more so than Minitona.

Personality

Tersena is shy and often hides behind Minitona. She is often forced to resound out Minitona when she loses her temper, and like Minitona, Tersena has become friends with Eris and Rudus.

Background

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Plot

She was one of the beast folk that Rudeus and Ruijerd rescued from the smugglers.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Power and Abilities

Superior agility, physical strength, and the characteristics special to her race.

Voice Magic

A unique magic of the Dedoldia race, that can manipulate the sound of her voice.

Can be used to find enemies with a far-reaching howl or to stun them.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.
