The Adventurer's Guild
======================

The Adventurer's Guild
 (
昌険者ギルド
,

Masashi Ken-sha Girudo
)
 is the twentieth chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Ruijerd Superdia

Summary

While Rokari hopes Rudeus and company stay a little longer, they bid farewell to continue their journey, and Rowin gifts them funds and a sword for Eris as thanks for telling them of Roxy's well being. Curious, Rudeus asks and learns Roxy left the village 20 years ago as she was born without the Migurdian telepathy, shocking Rudeus to realize Roxy is his (mental) age of 44. After Rokari wished them well, Rowin angrily tells Rudeus to not call him father. Eatting by a campfire later on, Rudeus is thankful for the hospitality but shifts focus to how he's just standing behind his capable fighter friends Eris and Ruijurd.

As the approach the crater city of Rikarisu, Rudeus uses erath magic to give Ruijurd a stone helmet to get past the guards, on the look out for "Dead End" who Rudeus learns is actually Ruijurd. To hide his identity, Rudeus dyes Ruijurd's hair earthy red as they register at the Adventure's Guild, with the membership inside laughing at their declaration that he's the infamous Dead End. Now with his identity concealed as a Migurdian in attempt to link "Dead End" to a heroic party name, they register their team name and Eris is overjoyed to be an adventurer. As newcomers, they are slated at F-Rank at the bottom, and exit the tavern having finalized their registration. Looking at request, senior member Nokopara jokingly suggests a lost pet job for the newbies since Superds have radar vision.

Not wanting to do too much in one day, Rudeus instead has his team take their leave. However, as Ruijurd is about to get in a fight with a crass senior member, Nokopara tells his contemporary to let them be. Outside, Ruijurd is reassured by Rudeus everything is working to his plan, and Eris also reassures as Rudeus is amazing in her eyes. Confident, Ruijurd apologizes for his doubts and agrees to follow Rudeus's lead. Rudeus hugs the two in affirmation, thinking how he cannot betray their trust and devoted to finding a solution to get home. Meanwhile, Nokopara sees them from afar with a scheming smirk across his horse face.

Appearances

Characters

Rokari Migurdia

Rudeus Greyrat

Rowin Migurdia

Rosh

Ruijerd Superdia

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Nokopara

Perutoko

Skills

The Birth of My Little Sister, the Maid
=======================================

The Birth of My Little Sister, the Maid
 (妹侍女の生まれた日
Imōto Machi Onna no Umareta Hi
) is the twentieth episode of the
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on November 28, 2021.

Synopsis

The third prince of Shirone and Pax's brother, Zanoba, appears in front of Rudeus, who has been caught by Pax and confined in a room as bait to lure Roxy. Zanoba takes out an object and asks Rudeus a question. The situation takes an unexpected turn... On the other hand, Eris and Ruijerd hear that Rudeus has been captured and head to the rescue.

Plot

While waiting in his cell, Rudeus is met by Shirone's third prince, Zanoba, who idolizes him for making such lifelike sculptures of Roxy and Ruijerd and seeks to become his apprentice. When Rudeus explains that only Pax can undo the seal on his cell, Zanoba promises to resolve the situation. Meanwhile, Pax's guards smuggle Ruijerd, Eris, and Aisha into the palace in return for rescuing their families, who are being held hostage by Pax. Zanoba then captures Pax, with Aisha revealing Zanoba is a Blessed Child who was born with superhuman strength and is known as the Decapitator Prince. Zanoba coerces Pax into freeing Rudeus while Pax's guards refuse to help the moment they hear their families are safe. Afterwards, Lilia and Aisha are arranged to be sent home, and Lilia returns Roxy's panties to Rudeus and gives him a necklace Sylphiette made for his tenth birthday. Rudeus then gifts his forehead protector to Aisha as a keepsake. As she leaves, Aisha apologizes to Rudeus for calling him a pervert, revealing she knew his true identity all along. Meanwhile, Pax and Zanoba are exiled from the Shirone Kingdom due to the scandal under the guise of studying abroad.

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Ruijerd Superdia

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Aisha Greyrat

Lilia Greyrat

Pax Shirone

Zanoba Shirone

Ginger

Paul Greyrat
 (Flashback)

Zenith Greyrat
 (Flashback)

Sylphiette
 (Flashback)

Locations

Central Continent

Asura Kingdom

Buena Village

Shirone Kingdom

Latakia

Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 6

Chapter 5: The Third Prince.

Chapter 6: A Speedy Resolution.

Chapter 7: The Birth of My Little Sister, The Maid.

Differences with the light novel:

In the light novel, Lilia and Aisha were teleported inside the Royal palace of the Shirone kingdom and treated as a spy.

A short scene where Zanoba shows the box of Lilia and its content was cut.

In the light novel, the scene where the shirone kingdom guards ask Ruijerd and Eris for help to rescue their families was off screen.

In the light novel, The description of Zanoba as a blessed child and his past was an inner monologue of Rudeus.

More detailed info of Zanoba's past and an explanation of how the Royal system of shirone work was cut.

In the light novel, when he brought Pax to Rudeus, Zanoba killed some guards in his way and also appeared two princes of Shirone following him.

Ginger family was already rescued by Ruijerd and Eris previous rampage in the slave market in the previous day.

This detail was already cut in the previous episode

A detail that Pax was sent to King Dragon Realm was cut.

A short scene where Rudeus meets the king of the Shirone Kingdom was cut.

A scene where Lilia, Aisha and Rudeus group spend a night in a inn was cut.

Instead, some of those events happen just before the departure of Lilia and Aisha.

In the light novel, Lilia doesn't say that the pendant that was in the box was made by Sylphiette.

Trailer

TVアニメ『無職転生』次回予告⑳：11-28(日)放送第20話「妹侍女の生まれた日」予告

The Boreas Family Greetings
===========================

The Boreas Family Greetings
 (
ボレアス流挨拶
,

Boreasu-ryū aisatsu
)
 is the ninth chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Ghislaine Dedoldia

Summary

Easily deducing Thomas to be responsible, Philip had him arrested for his attempt top sell Eris to a lecherous noble, and has had him replaced with Alphonse. However, seeing Philip's face covered in bandages, Sauros arrived with praise for Rudeus and Alphonse informed him of Sauros's beating up Philip in an overly emotional state. Calmly, Sauros asks Rudeus to teach Eris, but stops himself from accepting as he realizing Sauros has spoiled Eris by doing things for her. Thus if Rudeus does accept, then Eris wouldn't really be learning from him if all she has to do is ask her grandfather. To ensure Eris focuses on learning, Rudeus requests that Eris directly ask for his mentorship. Although angry at Rudeus's refusal, Sauros can't argue with the logic and calls Eris down, with enough strength to nearly deafen his beastkin maids. Once she has arrived, Sauros orders Eris to ask Rudeus herself to teach her, so she stands like a cute catgirl to ask Rudeus to teach her.

Rudeus blacks out for a second thinking that didn't just happen, but finds it really did and is terrified by an otherwise cute pose as Eris's face is otherwise raging. Looking to Sauros for help, the grandfather instead fawns over his granddaughter as Philip directs her to stick out her hips more. Exasperated, Rudeus looks at the beast maids and realizes the men have an affinity for them- compared to Paul who loves large breasted women. Sauros then asks Rudeus if he accepts, since Eris took a pose of humility to ask, with Rudeus still screaming no at him. During combat training, Ghislaine voices her being impressed at Rudeus telling Sauros no and making him stop doing that to Eris.

Over the next month, Rudeus tutors Ghislaine and Eris in magic and math, while he also improves in minor margins in combat training under Ghislaine's teachings. The only progress on that front is Eris showing an aptitude in combat and beating him up. When walking by her room and hearing Eris practice her magic, Rudeus remembers his first attempt with water magic and finds Eris setting her room ablaze. Eris shows an ability for magic and combat, but struggles with mathematics and reading. When Eris voices frustration, Ghislaine talks about her old adventurer days and after the team broke up when Paul and Zenith got married, she struggled with trying to be on her own. With additional details, she summarizes that she needs to learn math and reading to not repeat her mistakes, impressing Eris to be invested and improves on her studies. As Eris improves, Rudeus can't help but think of how Roxy and Sylphy are doing. When grading Eris's improving scores, Rudeus finds she is increasingly upset, then checking the calendar does he find he has been a failure of a teacher.

Appearances

Characters

Ghislaine Dedoldia

Rudeus Greyrat

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Philip Boreas Greyrat

Alphonse

Sauros Boreas Greyrat

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Sylphiette

Lilia Greyrat

Roxy Migurdia

Skills

Regions

Others

Differences from Light Novel

Trivia

Ghislaine is ranked as Sword-King, the 4th highest rank in the Sword God Combat Style.

The Fiancé of Despair
=====================

The Fiancé of Despair
 (絶望の婚約者
Zetsubō no Konyakusha
) is the eight episode of the
second season
 (32nd overall)
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on August 27, 2023.

Synopsis

The season of love has arrived...!? Rudeus is asked by a special student Cliff to introduce him to a certain woman. On the other hand, duels for courtships is prevalent during the
Beast Race
 mating season in the autumn, so Linia and Pursena, princesses of the Doldia tribe, shut themselves away in the dormitory to avoid duels. However, for some reason, someone appears who challenges Rudeus to a duel...!?

Plot

Cliff
 approaches
Rudeus
 one day and asks him to introduce him to
Elinalise
, who he has developed a crush on. Rudeus goes through with the introduction, but Elinalise privately reminds him the
curse
 that forces her to sleep with men won't fulfilled if she's dedicated to a single partner. Rudeus advises her to just turn down Cliff's feelings, but the next day, he is shocked to see that both she and Cliff are in a genuine relationship, with Cliff promising to find a way to lift the curse. Later, the beastmen of the school begin challenging Rudeus for the right to marry
Linia
 and
Pursena
, having been misled by the girls that he is their pack leader. However, the beastmen are all defeated by the Demon King
Badigadi
, the fiancé of
Kishirika
, who challenges Rudeus to a duel after hearing of Kishirika's praise of him. Rudeus manages to win the duel by wounding Badigadi with his first attack, convincing the demon king to concede. When winter arrives, Rudeus and his classmates are surprised when they find out that Badigadi has enrolled in the university and joined their class.

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Sylphiette

Zanoba Shirone

Julie

Elinalise Dragonroad

Linia Dedoldia

Pursena Adoldia

Cliff Grimoire

Badigadi

Nina Farion

Locations

Central Continent

Ranoa Kingdom

Sharia

Ranoa Magic Academy

Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 9

Chapter 1: The Prodigy's Secret (Part 1)

Chapter 2: The Prodigy's Secret (Part 2)

Chapter 3: The Impervious Fiance (Part 1)

Chapter 4: The Impervious Fiance (Part 2)

Differences with the Light Novel:

The event where Badigadi's movement across the country causes the armies of the Magic Triumvrate to mobilize.

The event where Rudeus discusses his impotency with the rest of the Special Students is cut.

After the duel of Rudeus and Badigadi, Rudeus is struck by 3 of Badigadi's fists which knocks him out while in the Anime, he has a bump in his face.

The event where
Jinas
 talks to Rudeus for defeating Badigadi is cut.

Trailer

『無職転生Ⅱ ～異世界行ったら本気だす～』第8話「絶望の婚約者」次回予告／ナレーション：前世の男(CV.杉田智和)

The Forest in the Dead of Night
===============================

The Forest in the Dead of Night
 (真夜中の森
Mayonaka no Mori
) is the second episode of the
second season

Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on July 16, 2023.

Synopsis

In order to search for his mother,
Zenith
, Rudeus spreads his name under the nickname of "
Quagmire
" due to his achievements as an adventurer and his proficiency for the spell. One day, he joins
Counter Arrow
 on their mission in Gargau ruins, but a large number of
Snow Drakes
 attacks them.The party is saved by
Stepped Leader
 party lead by
Soldat Heckler
 who were also in the area but after the battle, Soldat angrily approaches Rudeus and his party...

Plot

Several months pass as Rudeus builds his fame and reputation in the Basherant Kingdom, hoping that word of his exploits will reach Zenith or that someone will know her whereabouts. After completing a snow gathering mission, He decides to accompany Counter Arrow on another quest to collect
Snow Drake
 scales, but end up being ambushed by the Snow drakes and accidentally running into another party,
Stepped Leader
, who are out to hunt the snow drakes. Despite this setback, Counter Arrow successfully complete the quest and return to Rosenburg, where Sara convinces Rudeus to join their victory celebration. However, during the celebration, the leader of Stepped Leader, Soldat, goes on a drunken rant over how he is put off over Rudeus because he can tell he's holding back his true power.

The next day, Rudeus learns that Mimir was killed and Sara had gone missing during a quest, with the rest of Counter Arrow being forced to retreat due to a blizzard. He heads to Trier Forest, kills the
Snow Buffaloes
, recovers Mimir's remains, and manages to rescue Sara from a
Icefall Treant
 whom he thought is also dead after finding her
earring
. After being thanked by Sara and Counter Arrow, Rudeus feels like he is the one saved and forgiven, as he looks forward to a good sleep in a long time.

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Suzanne

Sara

Timothy

Patris

Mimir

Soldat Heckler

Locations

Central Continent

Basherant Kingdom

Rosenburg City

Round Shield Inn

Adventure Guild
 Headquarters

Gargau Ruins

Trier Forest

Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 7

Chapter 3: Quagmire Rudeus

Chapter 4: The Forest at Night

Differences with the Light Novel:

The event where Rudeus completes a snow gathering mission occurs first before the gathering of Snow Drake Scales mission

Sara's monologue after the Soldat confrontation is cut

Mimir's remains were burned together with the rest of the Snow Buffalo's victims in the Anime while in the Light Novel he brings it with him which Sara carries back to Rosenburg after being rescued

Trailer

『無職転生Ⅱ ～異世界行ったら本気だす～』次回予告③ 7-16(日)放送第二話予告／ナレーション：前世の男(CV.杉田智和)

The Greyrat Household Maid
==========================

The Greyrat Household Maid
 (
グレイラット家のメイドさん
,

Gureiratto-ka no Meido-san
)
 is the first side story chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Lilia Greyrat

Rudeus Greyrat

Summary

Back in Buena Village, Lilia serves Rudeus his afternoon tea while both see Paul fail to get on Zenith's good side. Lilia brings up her past with Paul learning sword arts and how he surpassed her, but he would goof off to have fun or chase girls. Surprising Rudeus, Lilia admits how her first time was when Paul snuck into her room and took her virginity, leading to his being expelled. The two did not see each other until she was hired as the family maid when Zenith was pregnant with Rudeus. After Rudeus apologizes for his father, Lilia apologizes for not being comfortable around Rudeus as a baby, and figured his "unusual" behavior was due to his gifted intelligence. But after getting pregnant seducing Paul, her opinion of Rudeus changed after he got Zenith to keep her in the family. With gratitude, Lilia plans to have her child also be in service to Rudeus in the years to come. Serving him more tea, Lilia is happy to be the maid and a member of the family.

Appearances

Characters

Lilia Greyrat

Rudeus Greyrat

Zenith Greyrat

Paul Greyrat

Skills

Regions

Others

Differences from Light Novel

The Kidnapping and Confinement of Beast Girls
=============================================

The Kidnapping and Confinement of Beast Girls
 (獣族令嬢拉致監禁事件
Kemonozoku Reijō Rachikankin Jiken
) is the seventh episode of the
second season
 (31st overall)
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on August 20, 2023.

Synopsis

While Zanoba and Julie are progressing in their doll making, Rudeus remembered the Roxy doll that he once made and now in Zanoba's possession. He asked Zanoba where it is, but the doll was in pieces. Zanoba explains that it was destroyed in a duel between the
Beast Race
 Princesses Rinia and Pursena which causes Rudeus to tremble with anger.

Plot

As Sylphie gets used to school life with Rudeus back in her life, she begins to realize that she may have romantic feelings for him. One month after Zanoba's purchase of Julie, Rudeus has been able to teach her basic magic as well as how to cast without incantations. However, when Zanoba shows Julie Rudeus' sculpture of Rujierd, Rudeus asks about the sculpture of Roxy that he had also made. Zanoba is forced to admit that in his first year, he lost a duel to Linia and Pursena, who destroyed the sculpture. Angered at this slight against Roxy, Rudeus defeats Linia and Pursena in a fight and confines them in his room, but leaves them tied up for so long that they wet themselves, forcing him to clean them up. He then consults with Fitz on the best way to punish them without creating a grudge, and Fitz comes up with the idea to prank the beastgirls by forcing them to wear embarrassing face markings for one day. Linia and Pursena leave with a grudging respect for Rudeus after learning he trained under Ghislaine, and Rudeus spends some time alone with Fitz. Fitz considers removing her sunglasses to show Rudeus her face, but decides against it.

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Sylphiette

Ariel Anemoi Asura

Luke Notos Greyrat

Zanoba Shirone

Julie

Linia Dedoldia

Pursena Adoldia

Locations

Central Continent

Ranoa Kingdom

Sharia

Ranoa Magic Academy

Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 8

Side Story: Sylphiette (Part 1)

Chapter 7: The Kidnapping and Confinement of Beast Girls (Part 1)

Chapter 8: The Kidnapping and Confinement of Beast Girls (Part 2)

Differences with the Light Novel:

The Lady Of The Greyrat Household
=================================

The Lady Of The Greyrat Household
 (
グレイラット家のお嬢様
,

Gureiratto-ka no ojōsama
)
  is the second side story chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Zenith Greyrat

Aisha Greyrat

Norn Greyrat

Summary

Back in Buena village, Zenith calls to babies Norn and Aisha to crawl to her. While Aisha gets to Zenith first, Norn starts a tantrum over it until Zenith encourages her daughter to keep going, and both babies are finally held; Zenith thinks to herself how she's come to see both as hers even if Aisha is Lilia's. When Lilia tries talking with Aisha, a sleepy Norn has them go to nap time, and Zenith looks at Paul angrily, remembering how he got Lilia pregnant despite her own pregnancy. As Aisha naps with Lilia and Norn with Zenith, Zenith recalls her following the teachings of Millis, such as monogamy. Even though the two weren't believers themselves, Zenith felt a massive betrayal when they had Aisha, she came to forgive them because of Rudeus's fear of losing his family, even though Rudi won't see them for five years. Hearing Paul's childish pleas, Zenith relents when Paul brings up Rudeus and how they should have a tight family for when he returns. When the two hug, Norn starts crying just as Paul is romancing a kiss with Zenith and she invites Paul to help change Norn's diaper, enjoying their family bonding.

Appearances

Characters

Norn Greyrat

Aisha Greyrat

 (Flashback)

The Leader and His Companions
=============================

The Leader and His Companions
 is the 91st chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Aisha Greyrat

Summary

Aisha sleeps with Rudeus when Sylphiette is on Magician Guardian duty for the night to which Rudeus does not mind, after realizing the situation of the two sisters while in Millishion. One month has already passed and Norn still stays at the Greyrat House every 10 days but their relationship as siblings are not yet that close. At the Ranoa Magic Academy, even Linia and Pursenia notices Rudeus is feeling down and after a conversation, they give Rudeus a bag but also tells him to open the bag when nobody is watching.

The Reason For Respect
======================

The Reason For Respect
 (
尊敬の理由
,

Sonkei no Riyū
)
 is the third chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Roxy Migurdia

Rudeus Greyrat

Summary

Rudeus still remembers how he was in his previous life, and is afraid of leaving the house for fear that his new life will be revealed a dream. However, when Roxy takes him and they both mount Paul's Horse, Caravaggio, Rudeus finally overcomes his fear of the outside world. His social fears and insecurities melt away as passersby greet Roxy and he questions why he never left before. When Rudeus and Roxy arrive to a desolated area, Roxy tells him the chant of the Saint Level Magic, Cumulonimbus, and tells him that he must maintain the magic for an hour. Using his knowledge of climate from his previous life, Rudeus was able to easily self-sustain the magic so he need not keep his arms up. After Roxy sees this, she decides that Rudeus passed the test, causing Rudeus to feel he has finally accomplished something the first time in both lives. Upon returning home, Roxy decides that it was her time to leave to polish her magic skills. She gifts her Migurdian pendant to Rudeus that it may help him someday should he be in trouble with a demon. Roxy tells him that if he really wants to improve his magical aptitude, that he should go to Ranoa university of magic. After she left, Rudeus felt the most utmost respect for her for her getting out of the house. Ironically, he also silently apologized in his mind for still having the panties that he stole from her.

Appearances

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Zenith Greyrat

Paul Greyrat

Roxy Migurdia

Skills

Cumulonimbus

Regions

Buena Village

Fittoa Region

Others

Differences from Light Novel

The manga cut when Roxy use The Saint Level Magic Cumulonimbus before Rudeus and hit with a thunder Paul Horse .

Trivia

To Be Added.

Template:JuvenileP

The Redhead's Hood
==================

The Redhead's Hood
 (
赤毛のフード
,

Akage no Fūdo
)
 is the twenty-first chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Summary

As the group stays at the Wolf Claw Inn, Eris bathes while recalling a talk she had with Ghislaine in Roa before the mana calamity. After a session in sword training, and Eris talking about developing a figure like her mother, she inquired of Ghislaine of her being strong, with the Sword King noting how Eris and Rudeus are a good team pairing. When Eris wanted Ghislaine to join her and Rudeus on adventures, Ghislaine reminded Eris that she wouldn't be around forever and imparted onto the young lady that she'd have to be strong to protect Rudeus, confident in Eris's progressing abilities.

Back in the present, wonders on Ghislaine's survival after the calamity, and worries of her adequacy in protecting Rudeus. Meeting the two outside, another Adventurer team approaches Eris with a recruitment offer she refuses (as she cannot speak Demon). When the adventurer pulls her coat, Eris brutalizes him for damaging the clothes Rudeus gave her and is about to kill one of them before Rudeus intervenes- unable to enjoy grabbing her by a breast given the situation. Once Rudeus warns the three away, Eris smacks him off and voices her frustrations from being unable to understand Rudeus conversing in Demon to not being noticed and not having Ghislaine around. After she rushes to her bed, Rudeus realizes how worried she was and goes to promise her that he'll be more mindful of her going forward so she won't feel insecure, promising to get them home to Asura safely.

Rudeus then meets Man-God again while he is asleep, poking fun at him for getting close to a young girl while also noting how Rudeus should be glad he took his advice and got a trusted partner in Ruijurd. However, Man-God came to Rudeus due to his current predicament: money. As their current finance from Rowin being used for the Inn and food, Rudeus calculates less than two weeks of funds to support the trio; finding it ironically funny that a former NEET is worrying about money. Irritated he's still with Man-God, Rudeus asks for his advice and is told to simply accept the lost pet quest. Waking up, Rudeus aims to do so for his party's sake.

But while the intent was noble, the outcome proved foreboding with Eris bloodied and Rudeus keeled to the floor as Ruijurd was engulfed in a dark aura of bloodlust.

Appearances

Characters

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Ghislaine Dedoldia
 (Flashback)

Hilda Boreas Greyrat
 (Flashback)

Philip Boreas Greyrat
 (Flashback)

Sauros Boreas Greyrat
 (Flashback)

Rudeus Greyrat

Ruijerd Superdia

Kurt

Bachirou

Gablin

Hitogami

Rowin Migurdia
 (Flashback)

Nokopara
 (Flashback)

The Teleportation Labyrinth Guardian
====================================

The Teleportation Labyrinth Guardian
 is the 107th chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Paul Greyrat

Zenith Greyrat

Summary

Paul sees Zenith encased in a huge magic crystal and charges in despite the rest of the group yelling at him not to rush in but to no avail. As such, the rest of the party engages the Manatite Hydra but any
Magic Spells
 used against it is nullified, forcing the party to stop Paul from re-engaging and to retreat.

The Value of a Life and the First Job
=====================================

The Value of a Life and the First Job
 (人の命と初仕事
Hito no Inochi to Hatsu Shigoto
) is the tenth episode of the
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on March 14, 2021.

Synopsis

Rudeus, Eris, and Ruijerd make it to a city. They need to earn money for their journey, and decide to register as adventurers, but Superd like Ruijerd aren't allowed inside. Rudeus has a plan, but how well will it hold up in practice?

Plot

Rudeus, Eris and Ruijerd arrive at the city of Rikarisu. To have Ruijerd enter the city without trouble, Rudeus dyes his hair and has him pretend to be a member of the Migurdia tribe. The three brazenly call their team
Dead End
, after Ruijerd's nickname. Everyone laughs and the disguise works. However, their novice status prevent them from taking more challenging quests.
Nokopara
 is one of those who mocks them.

At the inn, a young demon walks in with friends and tries to befriend them, but due to a misunderstanding, gets beaten by Eris. Rudeus heals them and they introduce themselves as
Bachirou
,
Gablin
, and
Kurt
, as
Tokurabu Village Gang
. While on bed, Rudeus worries about expenses with the inability to accept higher quests. In a dream sequence with Human-God, he gets the advice to accept the lost kitten quest. He wakes up and found Eris awake, who is worried for
Ghislaine
 and
her grandfather
.

The next morning, they accepted the lost kitten quest, which leads them to another group of adventurers who kidnap pets to get the bounty for finding them. After the kidnappers are defeated, Rudeus attempts to interrogate them, but is hit by
one of them
, which leads Ruijerd to kill him instantly. Rudeus reprimands Ruijerd for it and forbids him from killing unless in self-defense.

Taking advantage of the kidnappers' higher rank, Rudeus and co. get the chance of taking more rewarding jobs, while improving their own party's reputation. Nokopara walks into the meeting of two parties and mocks them.

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Ruijerd Superdia

Blaze
 (unnamed)

Nokopara
 (unnamed)

Bachirou

Gablin

Kurt

Hitogami

Jalil

Vizquel

Roman

Locations

Biegoya Region:
Rikarisu City
;
Demon Continent

Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 3

Chapter 5: Three Days to the Nearest Town.

Chapter 6: Infiltration and Impersonation.

Chapter 7: The Adventurers’ Guild.

Chapter 8: The Adventurers’ Inn.

Chapter 9: The First Job: The Value of a Life.

Chapter 10: The First Job Completed.

Chapter 11: A Smooth Start.

Differences with the light novel:

How Rudeus asks Ruijerd if he can teach him how to survive was cut.

The explication of the origin and characteristic of the Superd spear was cut.

The description of Rikarisu City was cut

In the light novel, to enter to the city, Rudeus creates a stone helmet to cover Ruijerd face, after that he buys the blue dye to disguise him as a Migurd.

The rules of the adventure guild, and how the guild cards works and the rules of a party was cut.

The explication of how works those lights that illuminate the city in the night was cut.

How Rudeus asks to the client the characteristic of the missing pet was cut.

In the light novel, Rudeus caught the kidnapper party off screen.

The reason why Rudeus was afraid of Ruijerd after he killed the kidnapper was cut.

The interrogation and the swap jobs deal with Jalil and Vizquel is longer in the LN.

The reason why Jalil and Vizquel where working as pet kidnapper was cut

How Rudeus returns the pet to her owner and how they report the quest to the guild was cut.

The White Mask
==============

This article is about the Season 2 Episode 9 Anime. For the Manga Chapters, see
White Mask (Part I)
 and
White Mask (Part II)
.

The White Mask
 (白い仮面
Shiroi Kamen
) is the ninth episode of the
second season
 (33rd overall)
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on September 3, 2023.

Synopsis

Rudeus and Fits investigates the
Fittoa Region

Teleport Incident
. Since their research indicates that teleportation and summoning are similar, Rudeus consults with Silent Seven Star another Special Student, who specializes in summoning magic at Ranoa Magic Academy, in order to gain knowledge about summoning magic. What is the identity of that person?

Plot

Fitz
 remains conflicted over revealing her true identity to
Rudeus
 as she's afraid that he's forgotten about her. Ariel encourages her to tell him the truth with her approval. Meanwhile, Rudeus continues to study teleportation and sees many similarities to summoning magic. Fitz suggests he consult with a summoning specialist, Silent Sevenstar, but Rudeus is shocked to discover it is
Nanahoshi
 and faints after reliving the
trauma of his death
 at
Orsted
's hands.

Fitz revives Rudeus and Nanahoshi shows Rudeus two Japanese names, Shinohara Akito and Kuroki Satoshi, and asks if either of those names belong to him. Rudeus doesn't recognize the names and comes to the realization that Nanahoshi is a person from his own world. Nanahoshi removes her mask and formally introduces herself as Nanahoshi Shizuka, and Rudeus notes she resembles the high school girl he died attempting to save. However, Nanahoshi wants to find a way back to their world while Rudeus has no intentions to go back and wants to stay in this world.

She explains that unlike Rudeus who was reincarnated as a child, she was summoned to the fantasy world as she is now five years ago though she hasn't aged since. Orsted found her and took her under his care, and she has been studying summoning magic ever since, though she lacks mana capacity and cannot cast magic herself. She makes a deal with Rudeus where he will use his mana to assist her in her experiments in return for her knowledge about teleportation.

She further explains that the mass teleportation disaster was possibly a side effect of the spell that summoned her to the fantasy world. Upon hearing this, Flitz snaps and attacks Nanahoshi, screaming about all the lives lost because of the incident, including those of her own parents. When Rudeus tries to stop Flitz, she becomes confused and asks him why he's defending Nanahoshi since she knows he also suffered during the years following the incident, but Rudeus clarifies that Nanahoshi was as much of a victim as they are since she wasn't summoned willingly. Flitz calms down and apologizes.

On the way back, Fitz is glad to hear Rudeus has no romantic feelings for Nanahoshi, but still can't decide whether or not to reveal the truth to him.

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Sylphiette

Ariel Anemoi Asura

Luke Notos Greyrat

Nanahoshi Shizuka

Pursena Adoldia

Locations

Central Continent

Ranoa Kingdom

Sharia

Ranoa Magic Academy

Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 8

Side Story: Sylphiette (Part 2)

Light Novel Volume 9

Chapter 5: The White Mask (Part 1)

Chapter 6: The White Mask (Part 2)

Differences with the Light Novel:

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

The Woman with the Demon Eyes
=============================

The Woman with the Demon Eyes
 (魔眼を持つ女
Magan o Motsu Onna
) is the twelfth episode of the
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on October 3, 2021.

Synopsis

Rudeus and his friends arrive at Wind port, the southernmost port town of the Demon Continent. The three of them attempt to travel to the continent of Millis by boat, but they are charged a tremendous amount of money for the trip because of the presence of the Superd tribe. That night, Hitogami appears in Rudeus' dreams, that was troubled by the lack of funds, and leaves him with some advice. The next day, while Rudeus is strolling through the town, he meets a mysterious girl who is hungry.

Plot

Roxy's party disembark at the city, while Rudeus and Eris learn that due to Ruijerd being a Superd, his boat fee to travel the ocean is too high for them to pay. While looking for a solution, Rudeus is once again contacted by Human-God, who instructs him to buy some food in a specific place, where he stumbles on a hungry peddler and feeds her. The peddler reveals herself as the Demon Emperor Kishirika Kishirisu, who rewards him with a new power that allows him to see a few seconds in the future, and Rudeus uses this power to save a man from harm. After getting used to his new ability, Rudeus decides to sell his staff to get enough money for Ruijerd's ticket, but Ruijerd himself dissuades him from doing so, when Gallus Cleaner, the same man whom Rudeus saved approaches them.

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Ruijerd Superdia

Kishirika Kishirisu

Roxy Migurdia

Elinalise Dragonroad

Talhand

Hitogami

Gallus Cleaner

Locations

Wind Port

Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 4

Chapter 1: Wind Port

Chapter 2: Missed Connections, the Prequel

Chapter 3: Missed Connections, the Sequel

Side Story: Missed Connections, Extra Story

Differences with the light novel:

In the light novel, Eris speaks in the Demon Tongue language when they arrive at the sea in Wind port.

A short scene where Rudeus' party arrives at the adventurer guild of Wind port was cut.

In the Adventurer Guild, Rudeus hears the nicknames of the Dead End Party.

In the light novel, Rudeus incapacitated a suspicious person that tries to give food to Kishirika.

In the light novel, Kishirika explains to Rudeus six types of demon eyes that she can give to him before Rudeus picks the Eye of Foresight.

The sparring fight between Rudeus and Eris was different.

The sparring fight between Rudeus and Ruijerd and the explanation why the eye of Foresight doesn't work against Ruijerd was cut.

Trailer

TVアニメ『無職転生』次回予告⑫：10-3(日)放送第12話「魔眼を持つ女」予告
Released on September 26

The Young Lady's Decision
=========================

The Young Lady's Decision
 is the 51st chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Summary

Appearances

Therese Latreia
===============

This article
lacks information
 and requires expansion. Please
expand this page
 to include missing information to help improve the article.

Information

Story

Relationships

Appearance

Therese Latreia
 (
テレーズ
・
ラトレイア
)
 is the sister of
Zenith Greyrat
 and the aunt of
Rudeus Greyrat
 and
Norn Greyrat
. She is the third daughter of
Claire Latreia
 and
Carlyte Latreia
.

Appearance

Therese has a striking resemblance to her sister
Zenith
, to the point where
Rudeus
 got her confused with his mother on their first meeting but notices that Therese's hair and the position of her mole is different from Zenith.

Personality

She is a devout believer of the
Milis Religion
 and is a knight of the
Order of the Temple
. Although she is part of the
Cardinal Faction
, she does not hate the Demon Race and is relatively tolerant to them.

She is relatively easygoing and cheerful, often playing the role of a doting aunt towards
Rudeus
. She had unwavering loyalty towards Milis, not even hesitating to strike against her own family as long as the order was given.

She is strong willed and holds her own beliefs, not afraid to speak up or take a stand against those that say otherwise.

Background

She was raised under the strict upbringing by
Claire Latreia
 who was very disappointed that Zenith ran away, often expected to excel at various places. To meet her mother's expectation towards her, she had excelled in both academics and etiquette. Despite her mother's strong opposition, she went on to being a Temple Knight although her mother thought women were unfit for such roles.

Plot

She first appeared when
Eris
 go to hunt goblins in Milis Kingdom. She was saved by
Eris
 from the
Pope Faction's
 assassins.
 Later, she helped
Rudeus
,
Eris
, and
Ruijerd
 to pass the West Port.

In
Volume 21 - Young Man Period - Cliff Chapter
, she make a comeback and often advises and helps
Rudeus
 in the course of retrieving
his mother
,
Zenith Greyrat
.

She had even tried to persuade
her mother
,
Claire Latreia
 to free
Zenith Greyrat
, even to the extent of calling her brother and father to help with the matter.

During that timeframe, she was a guard to the
Miko of Memory
 and had taken part in the trial where
Rudeus
 was framed for wanting to kidnap the Miko. She had faced
Rudeus
 in a short battle with the [Defence of the Holy Sepulcher (Anastasia)] although she had showed signs of being unwilling.

She was later exiled to another place for failing to protect the Miko from the kidnapping and demoted from her rank as a Miko's guard to a sub-captain of another division. However,
Rudeus
 signs a petition formed by the rest of the Miko's guard in order to lighten her punishment. As a result she is still demoted but is allowed to continue guarding the Miko while under a new superior. This is shown when, after being requested by
Rudeus
,
Eris
 finally reunites with the Miko she saved years ago.

Power and Abilities

『Magic』

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Equipment





Therese wearing the Order of the Temple Armor in the Anime



Order of the Temple Armor

When on duty as an Order of the Temple Knight, Therese wears a blue plate armor and helm, with a white cape and uses a double edge sword.

Horse






An Order of the Temple Horse in the Anime



The Order of the Temple also provides a horse covered by a blue caparison that has their emblem engraved on it. The horse is also trained to immediately go to Therese when she whistles.

Achievements

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Quotes

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Trivia

She is not married and is very sensitive about it.

She has the same Japanese voice actor with her sister
Zenith Greyrat
.

Reference

Therese Latreia/Relationships
=============================

Eris Boreas Greyrat





Therese and Eris' first meeting in the Anime



Therese first meets Eris while she was protecting the
Miko of Memory
 from assassins and is grateful for her assistance and agrees to guide them out of the forest.
 Therese meets with Eris who was together with
Rudeus
 and
Ruijerd
 at
West Port
, where she assists them by convincing Customs Office Director
Bakshiel von Wieser
 to waive their fare to the
Central Continent
, and also provides medicine for Eris' seasickness and provisions for their journey.

Rudeus Greyrat





Therese and Rudeus in the Light Novel



Rudeus:"...Mother?"
Therese:"I am a single woman. I don't have any children, let alone one as old as you."
Rudeus:"I'm sorry. My mother's missing and you look a great deal like her."

Rudeus is Therese's nephew who she initially knows of from Zenith's letters and when they first met who Rudeus thought she is
Zenith Greyrat
 for their resemblance. Upon learning who Rudeus is, she immediately took them into custody and convinces
Duke Bakshiel von Wieser
 to waive the fare for Rudeus' group to sail to Central Continent and she stayed with them until their departure.

Miko of Memory

Claire Latreia

Reference

These Feelings
==============

These Feelings
 (この気持ち
Kono Kimochi
) is the tenth episode of the
second season
 (34th overall)
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on September 10, 2023.

Synopsis

Rudeus contiues his research on Teleport and
Summoning Magic
 and begins to cooperate with Nanahoshi, who came from the same world as him, even though she was not reincarnated. Fitz feels a strange bond between them, even though he does not know why and begins to feel depressed. However, Rudeus also begins to have feelings for Fitz, even though he is a man.

Plot

Fitz
 continues to feel jealous how
Rudeus
 is spending most of his time assisting in
Nanahoshi
's experiments now, but remains too afraid to reveal her identity to him. One year after enrolling in the university, Rudeus notices that the other students are in awe of him thanks to the reputation he had built up defeating Fitz,
Linia
,
Pursena
, and
Badigadi
, but turns down suggestions to take a leadership role.

Later, he receives an invitation from
Soldat
 to attend a clan reunion. After the reunion, he parts with
Elinalise
 and
Cliff
, who plan to do some adventuring to give Cliff experience. After meeting Fitz again in town and in the library, Rudeus realizes that he has romantic feelings for Fitz, and begins to have doubts that Fitz is male.

During another meeting in the library, Fitz accidentally falls on top of Rudeus, and he is able to confirm that she is in fact female. Fitz denies this and flees in embarrassment. Rudeus realizes that for a brief moment, he felt an erection. Now knowing Fitz's true sex and that she holds the key to curing his impotence, Rudeus decides to start a relationship with her.

Characters

Elinalise Dragonroad

Cliff Grimoire

Sylphiette

Ariel Anemoi Asura

Rudeus Greyrat

Nanahoshi

Badigadi

Goliade

Linia Dedoldia

Pursena Adoldia

Zanoba Shirone

Julie

Soldat Heckler

Conrad

Luke Notos Greyrat

Jinas Halfas

Locations

Central Continent

Ranoa Kingdom

Sharia

Ranoa Magic Academy

Adaptation Notes

This episode adapts the following material:

Light Novel Volume 9

Side Story: Sylphiette (Part 4)

Chapter 7: A Day at the University of Magic

Chapter 8: Clueless, but Perceptive

Differences with the Light Novel:

The event where Fitz also joins Rudeus and Nanahoshi on their research is cut.

The event where Badigadi and Rudeus talks about
Battle Aura
 and
Laplace
 is cut.

The event that Goliade is terrified of Rudeus is changed to Goliade simply avoiding him.

Trailer

Things to Prepare Before Marriage
=================================

Things to Prepare Before Marriage
 is the 79th chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Sylphiette

Cliff Grimoire

Zanoba Shirone

Summary

Rudeus, Cliff and Zanoba take turns on watch duty as night approaches in the "Haunted" House. Cliff hears movement of someone in the house and wakes up Rudeus and Zanoba to engage the "Ghost" but to Zanoba stops them from attacking the Ghost after grabbing with his arms. The 3 bring their findings back to Ranoa Magic Academy and Zanoba volunteers to conduct research.

Three Heads Are Better Than One
===============================

Three Heads Are Better Than One
 is the 85th chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Nanahoshi Shizuka

Summary

Rudeus has been taking care of Nanahoshi at his home ever since her collapse where she has given up on going back home. Rudeus brings Nanahoshi's
Magic Circle
 to Zanoba and Cliff to see if they can help with fixing the magic circle.

Eris Seriously Sharpen her Fangs

Volume 1

Three Swords of the North God
=============================

Three Swords of the North God
.

Members

Auber Corvette

Wii Taa

Nuckelgard

Achievements

Plot

Were hired by
Darius Silva Ganius
 to assassinate
Ariel Anemoi Asura
 before she was able to become queen of the
Asura Kingdom
. Wii Taa and Auber took part in the first attempt, along with dozens of knights serving under
Pilemon Notos Greyrat
, but were ultimately thwarted and fled as
Eris Boreas Greyrat
 and
Sylphiette
 were easily able to defeat the mob of knights,
Ghislaine Dedoldia
 was able to overwhelm Wii Taa in their duel after
Rudeus Greyrat
 disabled Wii Taa's ability to prevent Ghislaine from fighting by blinding her using reflected sunlight, and Rudeus himself was able to react just in time to prevent Auber's sneak attack on him.

All three members were present in the second attempt, where Ghislaine once again engaged in a duel with Wii Taa, where he was nearly killed but was able to attempt to flee, and was finished off by
Orsted
, Eris defeated Nuckelgard in their duel where she suffered a major injury to her shoulder, and Auber was once again able to get away after narrowly escaping a fully powered
Stone Cannon
 from Rudeus after he figured out where Auber was hiding.

Finally, during the party Ariel hosted where she defeated Darius by exposing his crimes, and had
Perugius Dola
 show up to prove his support for her,
Reida Reia
 instructed Auber to flee with Ganius and save him, but he was chased down by Ghislaine, Eris, and Rudeus where he engaged in combat against all three of them at once and was ultimately slain, leading to all three of the party members being killed.

Trivia

All three were killed in part or whole by
Eris Boreas Greyrat
,
Ghislaine Dedoldia
, and
Rudeus Greyrat
.

Navigation

Timeline
========

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!







This article is for the
Timeline
 of the
Mushoku Tensei: Jobless Reincarnation
 Series, that includes the storyline of the Original
Light Novel
,
Web Novel
, Redundancy and Old Dragon Tales.

Antiquity

More than 100,000 years ago

The age of the gods of ancient times. According to legend.

20,000 - 10,000 years ago

The God Wars

The God Wars (not the offical name) began when the first Dragon God declared war on 4 of the 6 worlds in order to search for the murderers of his wife Lunaria. Evidence pointed to a conspiracy of these four worlds that resulted in Lunaria's murder, and so the Dragon God and his five Dragon Generals began their massacre on the Beast world, followed by the Ocean World, the Heaven World and finally the Demon world. Each time, the Dragon God faced off and killed one of the Gods while his Dragon Generals committed genocide on the world populations. The Human God then opened a rift to allow the survivors of those worlds to escape into the human world.

The five Dragon Generals betray the Dragon God when he announced invading the Human World, and their battle ends in mutual defeat. The Dragon God is killed by Hitogami.

The dying Dragon God sends his son Orsted into the future to defeat Hitogami. Demon Dragon King Laplace (one of the five Dragon Generals) is given a mission by the Dragon God, “Gather knowledge on all known techniques and magic.  Archive them for my son when arrives in 10,000 years.”

Laplace escapes the collapsing Dragon World, and begins to wander the Human World as the second generation Dragon God.

The legend states that all worlds but the Human World were destroyed, but at least the Void World still exists.

10,000 - 8,000 years ago

The age of chaos. The different races in the Human World are mixed together and struggle. Eventually, each race starts to live in different parts of the world. Only the humans and demons continue to quarrel.

Laplace begins studying techniques and spells for the sake of defeating Hitogami, with the goal of one day teaching them to Orsted.

7,000 years ago

Start of the First Great Human-Demon War.

6,000 years ago

The First Great Human-Demon War is ended when the hero Ars leads his six comrades to defeat the five Demon Lords and Demon World Emperor
Kishirika Kishirisu
.
 The hero Ars then established the Asura Kingdom, the capital of which is named after him.

5,500 years ago

Humans wage war on other races and each other for a period of about 500 years.

5,000 years ago

Kishirika revives. Start of the Second Great Human-Demon War, began by Kishirika. The demons ally with the beast race and sea race, and corner the humans.

4,200 years ago

Badigadi manages to dominate the humans, becoming a key player in the war, after taking advice from Hitogami who appears in his dreams. This left the humans trapped and almost defeated.

The Golden Knight Aldebaran, with his Fighting God Armour, appears and singlehandedly turns the tide of the war in favour of the humans. At the very end, his attack punches a huge hole in the Great Continent, forming a sea and splitting it into the
Central Continent
 and
Demon Continent
.
 Falsely according to legend, this happens when Aldebaran fights Kishirika.

In actuality, the Human Hero Aldebaran had abandoned his armour and had died before this point. Advised by Hitogami, Badigadi locates the armour and becomes the Fighting God. Possessed by the armour, Badigadi kills Kishirika and then engages in a final battle against Laplace. Using the ingrained techniques of the armour, Badigadi is able to defeat Laplace, resulting in his soul to split in half. Laplace loses his memories and is split into two individuals: the Technique God Laplace who seeks to defeat a god and the Demon God Laplace who hates humans. At the same time, the Fighting God Armour was broken and fell to the bottom of the ocean, which was just created by the separating of the two continents.

Whilst both Aldebaran and Badigadi were Fighting Gods, history mistakes them for the same person. Badigadi was the one who split the continents using the power of the Fighting God Armour fighting against Laplace, and not by Aldebaran fighting Kishirika.

The Second Great Human-Demon War ends with the splitting of the continents.

4,200 - 1,000 years ago

A time of peace. Humans gradually segregate demons onto the Demon Continent and blockade it. The demons struggle for resources, and their population drops.
   Kishirika revives again at some point during this period.

1,000 years ago

Demon God Laplace is reborn. He unites the demons and subjugates the Demon Continent.
  There are some demons, such as Badigadi and Kishirika, who do not join Laplace. They become a faction known as the Moderate Faction.

500 years ago

Start of the Laplace War, fuelled by the Demon God's hatred for humans. Laplace persuades the sea race and beast race, and attacks the Central Continent. Quickly gains control of the north and south part, and invades the west from both directions.
  Some time after this, before the end of the war, Laplace gives spears to the Superd Warriors, which some accept. Crazed by the cursed spears, the Superd start attacking family, friends and foe alike, resulting in the deaths of the majority of Superd and Kishirika (again). This villainises the Superd, who go down in history as traitorous monsters, though people are generally unaware of the curse that afflicted them.

About 400 years ago (K0)

The Seven Heroes persuade the sea race to lift the blockade of the sea, and ally with the beast race by holding hostage the children of their heads of families. The last remaining human country, the Asura Kingdom, put all their efforts into a final assault. The Seven Heroes led the Millis Holy Order of knights and the beast race in an attack on Laplace's stronghold. In the final battle, four of the Seven Heroes die, leaving Dragon God Urupen, the first generation North God
Kalman I
, and the Armoured Dragon King
Perugius
. Laplace's close allies are annihilated and Laplace is sealed.
Ruijerd Superdia
 also aids the Heroes during the final battle. The war ends. According to legend (Citation Required).  Ruijerd's role was mentioned by himself and Perugius.

Armoured King Years

The end of the Laplace war marked the start of the Armoured Dragon Calendar (甲龍歴). Years are
K[year]
, the K for Kou (Armoured).

K100

The
Dragon King Kingdom
 Rises to power in the south of the Central Content after driving out the King Dragons which resided in the mountains. The nation is named after the aforementioned monsters.

K200

The
Shirone Kingdom
 allies with the
Dragon King Kingdom
 as its vassal state.

K330

in the Winter, Start of Orsted's time loop. He appears in a nameless forest in the northern part of the Central Continent.

mana

Rudeus meets Roxy and begins to get taught magic by her. He also begins to get taught swordsmanship by Paul.

Rudeus is led out of the house by Roxy. He becomes a Water Saint-class magician. Roxy goes off on her own. He meets Sylphiette.

A red orb appears in mid-air inside the Boreas estate.

K413

Rudeus notices Sylphiette is a girl (starts to call her Sylphy).

Lilia

Aqua Heartia

The next day, the
Teleportation Incident
 occurs in the Fittoa region, originating from the red orb.

Rudeus and Eris teleport to the
Demon Continent
.

Ariel

eye of foresight

Kishirika Kishirisu

He saves captured beast race children and the Holy Beast.


Sauros Boreas Greyrat

He meets
Geese

Zanoba

Luke

K420

Rudeus returns to Fittoa
, and has his first time with Eris. She parts ways with him the next morning to train at the Holy Land of the Sword.

Roxy meets Kishirika in the demon continent and thanks to her, finds the localization of Zenith Greyrat in a labyrinth in the Bergarit Continent. Elinalise Dragonroad travels with the demon King
Badigadi
 to give the news of Rudeus Greyrat, Meanwhile Roxy and Tallhand travel to Millis to give the news to Paul.

After the departure of Eris, Rudeus decides to travel to the northern part of the central continent. to find his mother Zenith, on the way he meets the party
Counter Arrow
.

Rudeus and Counter Arrow stop at Rosenburg.

The day after, Counter Arrow propose to Rudeus to do a quest with them.

The next day, they set off to Lake Cucuru.

After three days of travel, they arrive at night and Rudeus saves the party by killing the Grizzly Bears.

After another three days of travel, they come back to Rosenburg.

For three months, Rudeus does exercises to maintain his physique and joins numerous parties in order to make his name well-known.

One day he sets off with Counter Arrow to the Gaulgau ruins.

After three days of travel they arrive. Counter Arrow saves Rudeus. Short confrontation between Stepped Leader and the party.

After three days of travel, they return to Rosenburg.

After three months, it's been 6 months since Rudeus had gone there, he heals a child during work. He sees Counter Arrow who announce the death of Mimir and disappearance of Sara. Rudeus arrives at the place of disappearance at night, fights the Buffalo, then the Treant, that has Sara, and saves Sara.

Sara and Rudeus arrive the next day in the morning

K421

Six months after that, it's been a year since Rudeus arrive at Rosenberg and he becomes famous as "Quagmire" in the northern part of the Central continent.

One day he talks with Sara after a mission, who asks him to accompany her to buy weapon, in other words, a date.

The next day, they go on a date. Rudeus discovers he is impotent. Sara runs away, claiming she was returning his favor for saving her, Rudeus drinks for the first time, meets
Soldat
 who brings him to a brothel.

The next morning, Sara slaps Rudeus, after bad-mouthing her while drunk, who decides to go with Stepped Leader leaves Rosenburg for dungeons. Sara tries but fails to find Rudeus in order to make apologize for her over-reaction.

Rudeus and Stepped Leader go to the third biggest city of Neris, Gyuranza and Caelrion at the edge of the Ranoa Kingdom.

K422

Rudeus, Stepped Leader, Rod Knight, Iron Cluster Corps, The Drunkard's Nonsense travel to kills a Red Wyrm. Rudeus does it alone.

Rudeus becomes even more famous thanks to this and there is a theatre play about it.

Elinalise Dragonroad
 finds
Rudeus
 and tells him the news about his mother.

One week later, he receives an invitation to become a special student from the Ranoa Magic University's Vice Principal
Jinas
, Hitogami advises him to go.

Three months later, he heads for the university after waiting for the snow to thaw and says goodbye to Stepped Leader.

One month later he enrolls in the Ranoa Magic University. During his first day he meets with
Silent Fitts
, not recognizing her. He meets
Linia Dedoldia
,
Pursena Adoldia
, and
Cliff Grimoire
 during homeroom. He reunites with
Zanoba

One month later, Silent Fitts asks him to join his research on teleportation.

The day after, Zanoba starts his figure-making training, but doesn't have the precision needed.

A month later,
Zanoba
 and Rudeus buy
Julie
.

The month after, Rudeus, with the help of Zanoba, kidnaps Linia and Pursena in order to punish them for breaking Zanoba's Roxy figurine.

He frees them the next day, and they start calling him "boss".

 and

Rudeus ignores Hitogami's advice and goes to the
Begaritt Continent

Lucy

K425

Founding of the "Norn Greyrat Public Fan Club". Linia and Pursena graduate. Rudeus becomes a fourth year student. Nanahoshi summons a seedless watermelon from Earth.

Rudeus goes to the Sky Fortress to ask Armored Dragon King Perugius about treating Zenith. He goes to the Demon Continent to ask Kishirika about how to treat Nanahoshi's Drine disease. He fights the immortal Demon Lord
Atofe
. He learns of Hitogami's plans after meeting future Rudeus, and disposes of the mouse with magic stone disease. He is coerced into battling Orsted by Hitogami and with the help of Zanoba and Cliff creates the magic armor. He reunites with Eris. Orsted defeats him and he becomes Orsted's subordinate.

He marries Eris. He summons the Holy Beast from the Great Forest, and named him Leo. Orsted orders him to guard Princess Ariel, who ascends to the throne of Asura. He begins training to protect himself and his family.   Volume 14-18       -

References

Timothy
=======

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

"It's a pleasure to meet you. I'm Timothy, a magician. My specialty is offensive magic and I fight on the backline. Technically, I'm also the leader of this party."

Timothy to Rudeus

Timothy
 is the Leader of the
Adventurer
 party
Counter Arrow
 but mostly lets his wife,
Suzanne
 to be in charge of commanding the party.

Appearance

Timothy has long shoulder-length hair, wears a gray scarf and brownish-red robes. He also has a surprisingly sized "magic wand".

Personality

Timothy has a kind and soft spoken personality and is always seen with a smile on his face. He would try to get along with people around him, and would face hostile people with a smile if he deemed necessary.

Being an experienced
Adventurer
, he has a habit of throwing a free booze party to earn the favor of locals upon completing a big quest in a new place, so that they could prevent themselves being targeted by jealous adventurers
.

Background






Timothy and Suzanne meeting Sara



Timothy is born in a nameless village and moves to
Sharia
 where he studies at the
Ranoa Magic Academy
 and became a
Magician
. Timothy eventually becomes an Adventurer where she meets
Suzanne
 after moving to
Asura Kingdom
.

Timothy and Suzanne was part of another party when they rescued
Sara
 from a monster attack in the Milbots Region and brought her into the party along with
Mimir
 and
Patris
 who survived the monster attack and the five formed the new party
Counter Arrow
.

By the time they achieved B-rank, there was hardly any work left around the center of the
Asura Kingdom
 and they decide to move to a more challenging location to go north or south. They decide to go north which was also Timothy's birthplace and he knew the land.

Plot

Timothy and his party are travelling to the northern region of
Central Continent
 where they first meet
Rudeus Greyrat
 who is apparently depressed. Their party eventually assists him to complete a Rank A mission after being convinced by Suzanne.

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

Power and Abilities

Timothy casting Flame Thrower in the Anime
Timothy using Ex-Flame
1/2

Timothy is a magician who specializes in offensive magic and mainly uses Fire
 and Earth magic
.

Equipment

''Note: This section is under construction and revision''.

name
.

Timothy Britts
==============

SPOILER ALERT!

This page contains
spoilers!
  Read at your own risk.

 Timothy Britts
 is the disciple of the current Sword God,
Gal Farion
. He is also the father of
Jino Britts
.

Appearance

Nothing is known about the appearance of Timothy Britts currently. Only that he looks cute in the eyes of his master; Sword God
Gal Farion
.

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Personality

Background

He is one of the two current Sword Emperors in the Sword God Style. Although he is strong enough to become a Sword Emperor, Sword God
Gal Farion
 has not given him the proof of mastery, nor does he expect him to be able to rise up to have Sword God capabilities.

.

Tipsy Roxy
==========

Tipsy Roxy
 (

,

Horoyoi Rokishī
)
 is the forty-second chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Roxy Migurdia

Trivia

Navigation

To You
======

To You
 (あなたへ
Anata e
) is the eleventh episode of the
second season
 (35th overall)
Mushoku Tensei
 anime series originally broadcasted on September 18, 2023.

Synopsis

Rudeus discovers that Fitz is actually a woman. There are also signs that by touching her body that Rudeus would be cured of her impotence. Rudeus finds hope in Fitz's presence, but since she pretends to be a man, he worries that she might become distant. Then Luke comes to visit... Meanwhile, Fitz is told something by Ariel.

Plot

Luke
 confront
Rudeus
 about what he has done to Flitz, but he acts ignorance and has no intention of revealing Flitz's true identity to anyone else.
Ariel
 confronts Flitz about everything that has happened to her, how Rudeus approached her and Luke at the super market, that she intentionally told him that she was male and Rudeus knows she's actually a female from what Luke told her.

She tells her she was patience with Flitz taking her time, but grows tired of her indecisive and pressures her to reveal her identity to Rudeus and she shouldn't hold back because she still owes Ariel for saving her life She tells Flitz she is her friend, not her servant, and once again asks what Flitz really wants. She tells him she wants to be together with Rudeus. However, Fitz is still uncertain if Rudeus remembers her as Sylphie, so Ariel and Luke come up with a plan to help jog Rudeus' memory.

When Ariel asks if there are any strong memories she has with Rudeus, Sylphie mentions that he thought she was a boy when they were kids, and that when they bathed together and Rudeus undressed her, he found out she was actually a girl. When asked what kind of relationship she seeks with Rudeus, Fltiz tells her she’s fine having lots and lots of kids with him. With that information, Ariel supports Flitz's choice, but warns her if she fails to tell Rudeus her identity, she will use her authority as the second princess of Asura to forbid her having further contact with Rudeus.

Later, Fitz invites Rudeus to accompany her to gather a rare flower deep in the Forest of Hail despite it being the middle of winter. When he asks to bring someone with them, Flitz is against it, stating it would cause Ariel some trouble and that they should do it with just the two of them. Rudeus agrees and the pair travel into the forest. Fitz then secretly uses her ring which suddenly causes it to rain, soaking both her and Rudeus before they can reach shelter inside a cave.

Rudeus strips off his wet clothes to avoid hypothermia and advises Fitz to do the same, but Fitz insists that Rudeus strip her instead. Rudeus complies and recognizes her as Sylphie, his childhood friend from
Buena Village
, much to her relief. Now properly reunited with Rudeus, Sylphie admits that for a long time, she has loved him and wants to stay with him forever.

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Sylphiette

Ariel Anemoi Asura

Luke Notos Greyrat

Zanoba Shirone

Julie

Badigadi

Locations

Central Continent

Ranoa Kingdom

Sharia

Ranoa Magic Academy

Forest of Hail

Adaptation Notes

Light Novel Volume 9

Chapter 9: Rain in the Forest (Part 1)

Chapter 10: Rain in the Forest (Part 2)

Differences with the Light Novel:

Conversations between Rudeus and Fitts such as Rudeus explaining his magic melting snow is cut.

The details about magicians hired by Ariel to cause the rain is cut as well as the part of Sylphiette's monologue on cancelling out Rudeus' attempt to stop it.

After Rudeus removes Fitts' gloves, the event where it shows a burnt scar on her right hand is cut which is otherwise one of the memories that Rudeus remembers about Sylphiette having the same scar.

Tokurabu Village Gang
=====================

Tokurabu Village Toughs
.

Tokurabu Village Toughs
=======================

Tokurabu Village Toughs
 was a party formed by three young friends on the
Demon Continent
.

History

An Adventurers' Guild party based in
Rikarisu City
 created by a group of three young demons. They had big aspirations to become big shot adventurers, but had their dreams cut short when one of their members died in the Petrified Forest while fighting a group of Almond Anacondas and an Executioner, but before being completely wiped out they were saved by
Dead End
. Before Dead End left Rikarisu the two parties stayed in the same inn, and had a brief run in with Eris, where they tried to recruit her mistakenly thinking she was a mage, leading to Eris beating all three of them up since they ripped her cat-eared hood that Rudeus bought for her earlier that day.

Members

Kurt

Bachirou

Former Members

Gablin

Abilities

Trivia

When they first met Rudeus they were rank E, but before Rudeus left Rikarisu they achieved rank D.

References

Towards Begaritt
================

Towards Begaritt
 is the 99th chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Sylphiette

Norn Greyrat

Aisha Greyrat

Summary

Rudeus informs Sylphiette, Norn and Aisha that he plans to go to the Begaritt that saddens Sylphiette but accepts Rudeus' decision. Rudeus also tells them that he will be back in 6 months since
Nanahoshi Shizuka
 provided a means of travel through Teleportation Circles that she previously uses with
Orsted
 which Rudeus assures them that it is safe. After talking to Norn and Aisha, Rudeus plans to give their
unborn child
 a name but changes his mind when the three girls looks visibly distubed by it.

Days later, Rudeus and Elinalise gave their goodbye to his family and rides Matsukaze to hire an
Adventurer
 to accompany them to Lumen Forest and tasks the Adventurer on returning Matsukaze to the Greyrat House. After seeing the monument with the Dragon God emblem, Rudeus recites a chant provided by Nanahoshi and they enter the ruins that materialized and takes the Teleportation Circle that transports them to the Begaritt Continent.

Tristina Purplehorse
====================

This article contains information about spoilers describe in the novels, anime-only watchers and manga-only readers should please proceed with caution!

"Regardless, we'll be able to remove High Minister Darius so long as we have Tristina. With him gone, we won't have any trouble with the rest of the opposition."

Orsted
 to
Rudeus Greyrat
,
Light Novel Volume 16
, Chapter 1

Tristina Purplehorse
 (
トリスティーナ

・
パープルホース

)
 is a daughter of the Purplehorse House, a noble family in the
Asura Kingdom
 and was sold to Darius as a slave when she was a child. Eventually she was sold to the bandits and became the leader's mistress under the alias Triss.

Appearance

Tristina is blond woman with short hair and light blue eyes. She is very well endowed, rivaling Eris in the chest department.

Personality

Even though Tristina was born as a noble, she became aggressive and vulgar like her fellow bandits, while having an indifferent attitude towards the events that happened in her life. However, she didn't forget her relationship with Ariel and kneels down before her on their reunion. She was also capable of performing in refined noble etiquette when necessary.

Background

Tristina is the daughter of the Purplehorse house. She first met then Princess
Ariel Anemoi Asura
 on her five year old birthday party. When she was 8 years old she was secretly sold to the Minister of Asura
Darius Silva Ganius
 and forced to become his sex slave, while the public was told she was kidnapped.

However, after
Teleport Incident
, Darius sold most of his slaves, including Tristina, who was sold to the thieves group. She later managed to obtain her freedom, but remained a thief known as Tina Triss.





Tristina Purplehorse meeting Ariel, Rudeus, and the others for the first time.



Plot

Orsted gives Rudeus his first mission to make Ariel the next Asura Kingdom queen. On their plan, Tristina is needed to ensure the mission can be completed. Rudeus establishes contact with the thieves group, successfully requests a smuggling job from them through the communication password provided by Orsted and establishes contact with Tristina with her code name "Striped Pattern Acorn".

Ariel recognize her as the daughter of the Purplehorse house. Tristina then reveals her past after she was missing from becoming Darius' sex slaves to being sold to a gang of bandits in the border. In tears, Ariel swears that she will bring down Darius and asks her to testify. After giving it thought, Tristina decides to help her to expose Darius for his crimes, and help the group in his travel towards Asura Capital thus becoming Ariel's companion. In the Venue of Ariel, she appeared as the daughter of the Purplehorse house, where his father recognize her and testify that Darius kidnapped her.

After Ariel becomes queen, Tristina returns to the nobility and one of Ariel's attendants but still maintains her contact with the thieves group in case of Ariel's need to broker deals from behind the scenes or equivalent back door jobs.

Power and Abilities

Thief

Tristina is trained as a thief during her time with the bandits group thus making it her business of knowing the names and appearance of dangerous people. During their journey to the Asura Kingdom's capital, Tristina also gathers information on the the location of Darius's private army and movements of
Auber Corvette
 at Ariel's request.

The bandits group handles jobs that include information gathering, smuggling, search requests, slave trades and assassination requests. To make a job request with the thieves group, one must enter their territory in a forest in the border of the Asura Kingdom and communicate with passwords for the corresponding request otherwise they operate as highwaymen on those trespassing their territory.

Smuggler

Tristina is also trained as a smuggler. As such, she has knowledge of uncharted roads throughout the Asura Kingdom without the need to pass checkpoints and has contacts with all the hideouts to house their goods being slaves or otherwise.

Equipment

Purplehorse Ring

A ring with a beautiful amethyst gem. On the amethyst, there is an engraved horse and is used for someone from the Purplehorse House to prove kinship.

Achievements

Note: This section is under construction and revision
.

Quotes

Tristina: “When you're in this business, information is everything. Knowing the name and appearance of a dangerous person."

Rudeus: "I'm not as dangerous as it sounds."

Tristina: "Oh, that much is clear. We understand. Though the name Rudeus isn't that famous, 『Quagmire』 on the other hand is well known on the street. The woman over there is also known as 『
Mad Sword King
』. The Beast woman over there, isn't she 『
Black Wolf
』. Is that right?"

Tristina: "W-why is Ariel-sama ... At a place like this...?"

Ariel: "I came back in response to the information that father was sick, but... apparently my brother didn't welcome my return very much."

Tristina: "Oh, I see. ... So in an attempt to cross the border safely, you're making contact with us."

Trivia

In Orsted's previous loops, he notes that Tristina is the third person needed for Ariel to become queen and is the key person in bringing down Darius, one of
Grabell Zafin Asura
's main backer.

In Future Rudeus's Timeline, Rudeus met the thief Triss and she helped smuggle Rudeus while he was a fugitive.

References:

True Feelings
=============

True Feelings
 is the 64th chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Cliff Grimoire

Elinalise Dragonroad

Summary

A week passed since Rudeus introduced Elinalise to Cliff and its time for the Monthly homeroom, only hoping that Cliff don't end traumatic like in his case. When he enters the classroom, he finds them flirting and receives the news that they are now dating. Cliff even knowing the circumstance of Elinalise and her curse, he proposes to her and promises to find a cure for her. Rinia after seeing them proposes to Rudeus to start to going out, but he disclosed to the classroom that he is impotent. Rinia ask if he spent his first night with a terrible woman, but he angrily defends Eris and still thinks that is his fault that she left him.

Searching for information in the library, Rudeus still hopes to finds a cure for his heart and impotence, Fitz arrive and tells him all the information that she was able to find, Rudeus tells him with a smile that he enjoys the time that they spend together, Fitz finds that had a chance to disclose her identity but is unable to do it.

After departing from Rudeus, Ariel and Luke finds her, in a conversation in the dormitories, Ariel is irritated that Rudeus  don't remember her, but Sylphy tells them that she still hasn't disclosed her identity because she was afraid of his answer. Ariel tells her that she can continue to approach him at her own pace. Now resting in her Room, Sylphy thinks about her love for Rudeus, and she doesn't want other women near him, but that Rudeus' smile was aimed for Fitz, and if she stopped being Fitz, she won't able to help her friends.

Summer arrives in Sharia, Rudeus is still searching for information about the metastasis event with Fitz, but the information is sparse and feels that he has arrived at a dead end, he asked himself if he is going to able to find a cure for his sickness. Meanwhile in the middle of the mating season of the beast Race, Nina Farion arrives at the Magic university of Ranoa and Badigadi is running to full speed, both wanting to meet Rudeus.

Tsubasa
=======

Redirect to:
Ending Theme 7

Turning Point
=============

Turning Point
 (
ターニングポイント
,

Tāningu Pointo
)
 is the sixteenth chapter of the
Mushoku Tensei

manga adaptation
.

Cover Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Ghislaine Dedoldia

Eris Boreas Greyrat

Summary

At the start of a new day, Rudeus meets with Ghislaine and Eris as he promised to show them his Water Saint level magic. After an awkward hello with Eris, Rudeus inquires about a red orb that floats over Roa, as Ghislaine had been curious also. As it appeared five years earlier and nothing has occurred, Sauros and Ghislaine deemed it to be harmless and let it be, so the trio board the carriage. As townsfolk greet Rudeus riding by, Ghislaine reminisces on how Rudeus has grown in three years, as well as Eris having grown since his arrival. Even after teaching Ghislaine reading, writing and math, the people in Roa have come to accept Rudeus on their own, as Rudeus have become a respectable teacher. Whilst Eris agrees, Rudeus thinks how he has changed since reincarnating and wonders how his teacher, Roxy, is doing. In Shirone Kingdom, Roxy's "student" Prince Pax finds her letters from Rudeus and, thinking he's her lover, threatens to assassinate him if she doesn't become his woman; unfazed, Roxy corrects his misconception and welcomes him to try. When comparing the pathetic Pax to the prodigious Rudeus in her mind, Roxy sees the mana pooling over Fittoa and worries of Rudeus's safety.

Far from Roa, Rudeus displays his magic skills with his new staff, finding it magnifies his spells 2-5 times with the standard mana input, and thanks Eris for the gift. As Rudeus starts the chant for Cumulonimbus, he stops as he notices the sky change. As Ghislaine can see the mana pooling over the city, her plan to get the children away is interrupted by the arrival of Almanfi, servant to Perugius. Initially believing Rudeus to be the cause of the mana anomaly, he seizes attempts to kill him hearing Ghislaine's sworn title of Sword King. When Rudeus attempts to ask for more information, the red orb swirls with mana as an unknown person inside awakens. The resulting energies are sent to ground and everyone, from House Boreas to Rudeus's family in Buena Village, are caught in a mana disaster with the epicenter in Roa. As Almanfi escapes and Ghislaine is engulfed, Rudeus holds onto a frightened Eris as the region is wiped off the map. Arriving in an unknown space, Rudeus finds himself in his original form and falls in a depression begging any who can hear him to not let it be so. In the physical world, Rudeus's body is found by a Superd man.

Appearances

Characters

Rudeus Greyrat

Ghislaine Dedoldia

Pax Shirone

Almanfi

Sauros Boreas Greyrat

Hilda Boreas Greyrat

Philip Boreas Greyrat

Aisha Greyrat
